Uf9QS5T26POHcQPzfkiQ1A.text: Went with my brother for this Birthday. It's rather odd to be eating in this kind of restaurant in a mall, but the faint mall music didn't affect the food.   We started with the Ahi Tuna Tartare then moved on to (rare) bone in rib-eye and Kansas City stip. My brother went surf and turf and added the prawn, which was basically the largest shrimp I've ever seen. We rounded out with sides of lobster mash potatoes and creamed spinach.   My only complaint was my moscow mule, which didn't appear to have any ginger beer and was essentially vodka and lemon juice. Overall, the food was cooked perfectly and the service was attentive without being annoying (this is a fine line). It was a great experience and I'm sure it made my brother's day.

rF0UFPkzDZM5z8QGdEPWmg.text: Wow. Everything about this place was fantastic. The service was great. We arrived earlier than our reservations and were seated promptly. As soon as we arrived, our waiter approached us and greeted us. He went over the menu and brought us complimentary bread and drinks. Checked on us several times and had some great recommendations. The service size was huge. I had the Cajun Alaskan Halibut - Yum! So fantastic! Others had steaks, too big but way too delicious. We were celebrating a birthday -- and we got huge complimentary dessert -- oh and the dessert came with like even bigger portion of whipped cream! lol We were too full for the dessert but appreciated the gesture. I would love to go back and visit or at least wish we had this restaurant where we live! Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A worth while meal! Yum!

6u-qLqNL3K5ic32cY_1A-g.text: Drinks: Lemon Drop, Mastro's Mojito, Basil Mary Appetizer: Chilled Alaskan King Crab Legs Entrees: Bone-In 12oz Filet, Chilean Sea Bass Sides: Lobster Mashed Potatoes, Sauteed Spinach Dessert: Warm Butter Cake  Everything here was top-notch. Service was attentive, food was perfect. The quality pairs appropriately with the price.  The crab legs come with three sauces: horseradish, cocktail, and a third that I've forgotten (we preferred the others). The mashed potatoes have a generous helping of lobster and the flavors are pronounced. The sea bass is larger than you'd ever expect; I actually took half home!   We were much too full for dessert, but we still ordered it to go! Mastro's packed a lovely box for us.

xh09YpIKzl6W7DfNqKroYg.text: On my third trip to Vegas, my main priority was not to get sht-face wasted and it was not to shop until I dropped, but rather it was to eat in a treehouse. And that I did! I was sooo excited to try Mastro's (Mah-stro's or May-stro's?) after hearing ridiculously good things about this place. I made reservations online, and called ahead to request a seat in the treehouse.   Service is impeccable here! Everyone was super nice and friendly. We started with the lemon drop dry ice martini and it was possibly the coolest (pun intended) alcoholic drink I've ever had! The dry ice fizzles over the top and there is a mini tornado in your martini glass!! It tasted great as well! Perfect blend of sweet and tart - with, of course, a kick of alcohol!  To eat, I ordered the filet mignon and we split truffle gnocchi, lobster mashed potatoes and sugar snap peas as sides. My steak was perfectly cooked, silky and tender. The gnocchi and mashed potatoes took it over the top to glutton overload. Those dishes are soooo richhhh and decadent and creammmyyy. Yum. I definitely think I gained 10 pounds that night.   Bad for your waistline, bad for your wallet, but great for your taste buds!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle gnocchi and lobster mashed potatoes
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet mignon
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon drop martini with dry ice

-ZP0hv__r8SB9TGdme9Abg.text: Two vegetarians walk into a steakhouse and walk out thinking, "That was the best meal I've had in Vegas!!" So what happened?  After spending the day hiking in Utah and then driving 4 hours back to Vegas, we were tired, disheveled, and hungry. It was our last night in Vegas. My dad had raved about Mastro's mac n' cheese for years. So we decided to have some for dinner!   I admit, I was a little worried that we wouldn't be treated well, being that we were not ordering high priced steaks or seafood. That was definitely NOT the case. We had extremely attentive, first class service the entire time. We decided to eat in the bar so we wouldn't take a table away from steak lovers, and since we were more casual. There was live music, which was loud but not impossible to talk over.   Our waitress was just awesome. She explained to us that the portions of the sides were huge and we definitely could share. We appreciated this since we didn't need leftover food. We ordered mac n' cheese, asparagus, and drinks. I had the paloma, a grapefruity drink. It was good! Not overly sweet. My friend loved her berry lemonade. Bread was brought out and was very fancy! There were different kinds of rolls, crackers, breadsticks, and pretzel sticks. Very yummy!   Our meals came out and WOW... the sides were huge! Our waitress served us everything... and whenever we finished, she came to refill our plates. Very classy! We ordered pomegranate martinis on the way through our meal and again... WOW. They were amazing! Order one! They come in a shaker, and are poured table side. There is enough for more than one. The waitress came over and refilled our glasses as needed too.   We finished every single bite of the mac n' cheese and asparagus. And were full. Too full for dessert. The meal was $100! I can only imagine what it would be with steaks. But it was $100 worth it.   This would be the first place I'd come back to eat at in Vegas!

7t0SvjSrVNgez0FZynKiNA.text: Located in the Crystals at City Center, you can't miss this place as part of it sits in something that's supposed to be a sculpture called "the tree".  The sculpture itself is lost on most.  At any rate, my girl and I were in to celebrate a special occasion and Mastro's just happened to fit the bill for what we were looking for.  We started with Oysters on the half shell along with a Lobster Bisque.  The oysters were a good size, not too briny and of the east coast variety.  The Lobster Bisque was excellent.  Chunks of lobster and the soup itself was neither watery nor too thick but with proper consistency and the temperature just perfect.  Main courses consisted of Chilean Sea Bass for her and the Scottish Salmon Filet.  I put my trust in the chef and opted to be surprised in the preparation of my salmon, and I was not disappointed as everything was prepared exactly as requested.  Sides to accompany the entrees were the Lobster Mashed Potatoes and some sauteed Asparagus.  Drinks to accompany the meal was a nice Sauvignon Blanc (the name escapes me) which went with everything as per recommended by our server.  Service-wise:  very attentive.  Our server ran through all of the specials for the night and answered any questions we may have had including selecting the wine to go with our entire meal start to finish on top of being entertaining.  If a course was complete, someone was present to take the item away.  Our glasses were never empty and staff (including the manager) made it a point to be sure that our needs were met and that everything was fine.  Bonus points for giving us a table right along the edge inside of the "tree" sculpture.    Word of warning:  portions are quite generous so either be prepared to share or come hungry.    In short:  Top-notch service, good food, quality that pairs equally with the price.  You will not be disappointed.

8vYcqJrena6cv4VUWIfLDw.text: Food is awesome but very pricey. This time I had the ribeye, so good and we all shared sides but what one this that was memorable is the Butter Cake, I'm not much into sweets but this is orgasmic...lol, if you have room, it's a must have. The comb of the salty, sweet, cold and hot...

aQf2ZAILbKFgrNtv9D5ldg.text: MY ALL TIME FAVORITE RESTAURANT ON THE STRIP!  I bring my parents every year for their birthday & I go on my birthday as well!  The food is PHENOMENAL  & the service is even better!  The dungeness Crab Cocktail is AMAZING!  Oh & their Chilean Sea Bass is literally the BEST I've EVER had....if you get it pan seared, it literally just MELTS in your mouth!  Oh & their warm butter cake....simply to DIE for!

3P9f_hZ_E4QN9Eo8ZKWRlw.text: Was there for a casual dinner, it was good but not great. The service at times was annoying, especially when they fill your water glass up every 10 seconds. The food was adequate but not spectacular. If you want a spectacular Mastros experience I would suggest going to the Mastro's in Beverly Hills, CA. It is above and beyond anything you'll experience in Las Vegas. I would go back to the Las Vegas location but only after some serious thought and consideration of some of the other steak houses in Vegas.

bxOHRAwKKAzwWOzdXmJPNg.text: The food is absolutely wonderful. The sides are huge so don't order more than two per couple. The service is wonderful as well.

gTnRJSmhL21t1ceqI3w6wQ.text: Gosh this structure sure is beautiful in the middle of the mall at ARIA.  I was in Las Vegas on a double date with my neighbor and his girlfriend for my partner's birthday.  At the tail end of our trip we had reservations for Mastro's Ocean Club.  It was pretty grand, let me tell you.  The service is simply superior.  You're not going to get a higher class feeling, especially for being inside a mall.  We had the lobster mashed potatoes and onion rings for the table (the onion rings were AMAZING), and we each ordered a different drink (personally, I ordered Dragon Fire, which was tequila with all sorts of sweets and a jalapeno topping).    Our main meals were all impressive in their own ways.  I ordered the lamb, which was simple and delicious.  My boyfriend ordered the filet mignon, which was cooked to his perfection and would've rated this place 5 starts.  My neighbor ordered the ribeye, and was displeased with the outcome.  My neighbor ordered medium rare for his ribeye, and my partner ordered medium-well for his filet mignon (because he will NEVER eat bloody meat), and my neighbor's ribeye was much more well cooked than the filet mignon.  My neighbor's experience was lackluster, but TRUST ME, had my neighbor said something to the server immediately it would've been fixed ASAP.  My neighbor didn't want to make a big deal, so he just said something at the end of the meal that it was okay, and he ate it, but he wasn't happy with it because of how well it was done.  The server was very apologetic and took the ribeye off our bill.  His girlfriend had the mussels, and she thought they were good but wasn't floored by the textxure.  Mastro's was great, but this is definitely one of the restaurants I go to once because I don't want to have another meal while watching ostentatious women picking out what they want at Balenciaga across the way with a perfect view.  It was annoying.

JZCe4xv8qDTEp7DKQx88aA.text: hey this place aint too shabby.   Yea its located inside city center aka the shopping mall.  Yea the noise outside the restaurant can get loud what do you expect from a restaurant literally located in the center of the mall?  anywho heres the review----  highlight of the night has to be the awesome lounge singer.  He did a standout job as we were waiting for our table to be seated.  Kindly took our request for Rick Astley "Never Gonna Give You Up"  AKA 'Rick Roll'd'   Did a fantastic job.  For that the restaurant gets the full 5 star it deserves.  Oh the food?  it was good I had a rack of lamb that was outstanding!  Besides that the lounge singer stole the show! BOoooo yah!

EibEJyzOKHg-xZZIolOvvQ.text: I ate here during my trip to Vegas in December. It was a great experience.  Service from beginning to end was excellent. Waiter was very nice and even scooped some food into my plate when the plate was getting emtpy lol. There was also a guy playing the piano and singing so that was nice too.  I ordered the filet mignon steak and I have to admit, it was one of the best steaks I have ever had. I'm from New Orleans and I have tried all the top steakhouses here like Mortons and Dickie Brennan's but Mastro's tops them both. Meat was tender and was full of flavor.   Pricewise, it is pretty expensive but that is to be expected. Steak was about 55 bucks, sides were about 15 for me. G/f ordered a mixed drink that turned out to be 17 bucks. Total bill for 2 people was around 140.  I highly recommend this place if you want a classy place to eat in Vegas

TP31aPNJ9nJLnmQGRF-IBw.text: We made reservations for 7:30 pm for a return visit for our annual visit Vegas.  Last year our service was so over the top, the food so good, and the unique ambiance made it a great meal.   It was still a great, er good meal. We arrived at 7:20 for our party of seven reservations. Both cabs got lost.   We were seated at 8:30. The management seemed unable to deal with people camping at the table. We suggested they offer to buy them a drink at the bar l get them off their butts and get out!!  Once we were seated, we had the wonderful seafood tower. Our wait staff was good, not great (like last year). Examples is very pedestrian descriptions of the specials or main dishes. Our waiter went through the list rote. Our meals were deliverd together, but several times we had to ask for water, the bus staff made comments and interrupted conversations with their removal of plates. I think bus boys should not participate in table conversation, unless asked.   My bone-in strip steak, ordered charred medium rare was neither, and NOBODY askede if I was satisfied with the steak, which surprised me.  My steak wasn't charred and it was rare.  I know, some people say medium rare and really want medium. I know the difference. I like 120 to 130 degrees max. My steak was rare or actually cool and uncooked in the middle. I'm in the food business and actually run a meat wholesaler. My steak was just so-so, it had some tough parts and the undercooked aspect make me leave at least 30% of the meat on the plate.   The gnocchi and the lobster potatoes are worth the trip.   I'm not sure how to avoid the hour wait for a table, but it was frustrating.   Last year it was a 5 star meal, but due to average service, the long wait, my steak being undercooked and average quality, it was a 3 star night, and it was over $1,000.  Ouch.

hYdctoqAsN9cMJYN2Fp3_A.text: We ate here before seeing a show in Vegas.  We were looking for good steak, and couldn't get reservations at our top pick, so tried this place instead.  The weird thing about this restaurant is that it's in a mall -- it's a very nice mall, but it's still a mall.  Setting that aside, the food is very good.  We all got filets and they were delicious.  The sides are HUGE, so no need to go overboard on them.  If you can, ask to sit in the "treehouse" -- it's a part of the restaurant that juts out over the second floor of the mall, and gives you a "view" of the "mall" (I know that sounds silly, but it's pretty cool).

UzWKq1zFLt20fQdvKvEAyw.text: My friend treated me to dinner here for my birthday, and it was fabulous.   I would've rated it as five stars, but I had a couple things that bothered me. First, we had a reservation, and came about 15 minutes early so we could grab a drink at the bar first. We checked in, but were not seated until about 20 minutes past our reservation. Not a big fan of having to wait that long past the reservation time. Second, I'm not a big fan of the dress code. It's supposed to be fine dining, and it is a beautiful restaurant. But, the fact that you see customers simply wearing t-shirts and jeans kind of ruins the whole thing.   Other than that - all was dandy. Service was impeccable, but I would hope so considering the amount you pay to eat there.   Food wise - we got oysters as appetizers. They were very fresh and tasted great. The clam chowder we ordered was decent, but nothing to rave about. I've had plenty of other clam chowders that easily beat the one at Mastro's. The steaks we ordered were cooked to perfection, and were complimented well by the sauteed mushrooms.   Since it was my birthday - they did give us free chocolate cake, which was nice. Very light, fluffy, & moist. BUT, we did also order the warm butter cake, which I think most would agree is a must. Man, the chocolate cake was nothing in comparison.   Overall, great place. Would definitely go back again, when I have the money to spare.   And on a completely random note - they do serve Chilean Sea Bass at this establishment, which surprised me. This fish is known to be highly over fished and is on Seafood Watch's list of fish to avoid. Just thought I'd let you know.

voca_S3TPnnn0CstczmMhw.text: The best steakhouse dining experience we've ever had.  Attentive server and perfect food.

BcKG4Tyas-EhIIiyBa90kg.text: We came here for our mothers day celebration. My wife liked it the last time we came to lv so we made a reservation to come back.  We are big fans of Maestros in west LA.  We ordered lobster bisque and caesar salad to share for starters.  The lobster bisque was the star of the whole dinner and the ONLY reason for the 3rd star.  It was really really good and to find real lobster in it was great.  The caesar salad was good and the fact that they portioned it out for us was a nice touch. We  two ribeye steaks for mains together with mac and cheese and creamed spinach.  We ordered our two steaks med rare and medium.  The steaks came out med and almost well done.  I had to give half of my steak to my wife since it was her day and she forbade me from complaining to the staff so I'm writing this review.  The creamed spinach was really good and the portions were generous.  The mac and cheese on the other hand was a huge disappointment - completely tasteless and gummy.  Service was good and they really did treat us well.

M1lQZ1DccQEsxm1jY3WiSA.text: Actually 4.5, but not a choice here.  So good! They know steak. The ahi tuna plate was delicious as well. Mac and cheese was sinful. I also had the Ceasar salad, mushrooms, garlic mashed potatoes and butter cake for dessert. Everything was great, but the steak, ahi and mac and cheese were phenomenal.   The place is cool. We sat in the tree dome looking section. It's also nice to have Tiffany's and Louis V. right next door.  Our table was up against another seating booth which I didn't like. I don't like strangers so close to me, especially when I'm eating. Don't want to listen to them and I'm sure they don't want to listen to me. Service was decent, but they were busy.

HR70fmZ7CkEbFUEZJ0Yfbg.text: Who wouldn't love a restaurant that's positioned right next to Tiffany's??  Seriously.......  I went for a company dinner so cannot attest to the price (although based on other Yelpers, the cost is quite steep!)  Started with a lovely bread basket with a wide variety of different breads, including "pretzel bread" which is quite similar to Joe's Stone Crab bread.  The bruschetta appetizer came next which was VERY oniony, but it's a good thing I'm a big fan of onions because I absolutely loved it.  Caesar salad was just so-so.  Then the main course....I got the mahi mahi in this fancy butter sauce which was excellent, but not as good as my husband's salmon (I almost stole his plate it WAS THAT GOOD).  The fish portions were very large and filling.  Sides for the table included creamy mashed potatoes and creamed spinach.  The spinach was a little salty for my taste, but not grainy at all.  Dessert was cheesecake with whipped cream and berries which was creamy and decadent...A+ even though I was completely full I ate the whole thing.  Would I return to Mastros?  Absolutely.  Wonderful ambience and GREAT salmon.....after all it is an "ocean club" so the fish has to be good right?  Cheers!

kbLLfpcheb8la7h-S02I0w.text: The food, the service and the atmosphere were incredible. I've been coming to Mastro's since they opened and have never been disappointed. Their drinks are beyond incredible, and although they are expensive they come out in a shaker so you get a drink and a half or two drinks out of each order.   Everything I've ever ordered has been fantastic, starting with the breadbasket that is brought out. Make sure you leave room for dessert because their butter cake is the most amazing dessert I've ever had!  I wish I can give them more than five stars!

veNp9wSjMWyJr2suKTrfDw.text: Great service, good food. Place stays busy so set reservations and enjoy.

_ydrj4RfiuyAWQMqp5kJQg.text: Whenever we dine here, my tummy and my brain thank me..After a disappointing dinner at the RM Seafood last sunday../for my hubby s B-day/, we decided to visit our friend..Mastro at Crystals ...I called to make a reservation and was greeted by Sarah which was super nice and helpful.My husband and i were wearing shorts and that was not a problem for the restaurant's attire. We started with a bottle of Pinot Noir and of course the bread basket. For appetizer we ordered the shrimp cocktail /all clean,deveined properly/ and the steamed mussels..let me tell ya..the shrimps are super jumbo..i took 4bites out of one shrimp..the mussels are delicious with that tasty wine reduction ..actually just that by itself is an entree . For entree we shared the seared scallops and a steak with a side of fries.. The portions are perfect ..but we got full after the steamed mussels so had to take the rest 'to go' ... Also, if u have a special occasion, make sure u tell them ahead as they will get u a super nice piece of cake for u.. ON THE HOUSE. All this deliciousness didn't cost more than $180 .. Thank u for another pleasant experience Mastro's ..see you soon!

TTKwgtFZ3AhOoypgEpQ90Q.text: Great steaks cooked perfectly to temp and the seasoning was spot on.  Bone In Rib Eye - see above King Crab leg - fresh , can't really screw this up if it's fresh Oysters - same review as the crab legs Gnochi with King Crab & Truffle - delicious side dish  Great wine selection and atmosphere.  I would give a more in depth review but a little too hungover, my palate was not firing on all cylinders.  But I do remember it tasted really good.

M-bizcYlxF8BeflgmvsosA.text: Great Filet Mignon. Asked medium rare but received it medium but still very juicy and tender.  Double baked loaded baked potato was huge and amazing.  Great for dates but was actually there with a bachelor party of 10 men and worked out great.  Very pricey but when in Rome..

7Sjq4b95vOvvLOuE-2B-WA.text: 12 ounce fillet. Bring your appetite little spend well worth it, defiantly get what you pay for. Sorry no photo phone was tripping out. Sweet potato mash is a must, don't think for a minute they are healthy.

ZYm4oVcloVnogknGEvMybw.text: Came here for my wedding anniversary 6/14/2018 for the first time and the food was amazing as well as the service, best steak , lobster bisque and lobster mashed potatoes i ever had !!!! I'll definitely will be back !!! 10 stars (didn't get a picture of the food) but the cake melted in my mouth omg

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BLsCNwrdaCsVeD0YnV4E5w.text: What can I say about Mastro. Easily the best dinner I had on my last Vegas trip, and I know that's not a statement that can be thrown out easily given the steep competition in the area.  We made a reservation for two and was seated in the 'treehouse' area, which was great for people-watching, as many tourists come filtering through the mall, stopping to gawk and try and make sense of this structure that we're dining in. We had the ahi tuna and bone marrow appetizers and both were extremely delicious, the ahi tuna notable for its thick and generous cuts. The fish entrees we had (Arctic Cod and Bronzino) were made to perfection, but left us so stuffed that we had no room to try dessert, unfortunately. Special kudos to their complimentary bread bowl which is undoubtedly the most diverse, delicious, and high-quality 'free bread' I have had in a long time at any restaurant in this price range.  The service was attentive. The drinks were divine. For the fruity girly drinkers like me who still want a kick in their drink, try Tiki Time, which was just FANTASTIC.  Next time I fly back to LV, I'm getting into an Uber and going directly to Mastro's.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yoink
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SIfNbvPpRFuEpwnEzW7frA.text: The steak was good; we have only visited seldomly since they changed owners a few years ago since we noticed undesirable changes (such as charging for each bottle of coke). Also the service was not as wonderful as it was in years past. But the most notable part of our experience? The slippery floors! The floors are slippery with grease- absolutely disgusting and especially unsafe for any woman in heels. Someone could very easily slip. And the worst part- the same tile extends   from the entrance of the restaurant all the way into the treehouse. Once you are near the elevators and entrance heading out the door, it is no longer slippery- so it's not an issue of the floor material. It must be grease coming from the shoes of waitstaff in and out of the kitchen. Please do something to clean your floors! Sheesh

8mcuGmvXgoUy6ldQa1-yVQ.text: Best spot ever!!  Seafood towers and the butter cream cake was to DIE!   U must order for dinner (u can share).  Suggest making reservations for the tree house

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aV24V16mcBJoAfMQH5PQLg.text: Definitely start with the seafood tower everything was fresh and chilled. The escargot was okay but not what I'd hoped for. However service was top notch and I would recommend it.

aardCRqmmzcHS6XxBg3fdw.text: This has to be one of my favorite restaurants ever! I have been to the one in Arizona 3 times and just found this one in Vegas.  We always order too much but I cannot get enough of the Alaska king crab legs. They serve generous portions, especially of the martinis. I am hard to please when it comes to a dirty vodka martini with blue cheese olives and they do it perfect! The appetizers and sides are all fantastic. Maybe someday I will try a steak here but you cannot go wrong with the seafood. Also location is right across from stores like Gucci and Louis Vuitton so you can have some fun with drunk shopping afterwards. We are already coming back in April again. I wish I would have taken pictures but was too busy stuffing my face!

IDh_GLeQl33YKu40RbM-0w.text: Let me start by saying we love Mastros.  We live in Thousand Oaks and dine there regularly. But this particular location didn't make us feel welcomed at all.  My family and I had reservations on Thanksgiving Day for dinner. Our reservations were made for 8:45. So we had already passed the rush hour. My family and I get there and they go to seat us. That's where i get pretty disappointed. They wanted to seat us to what looked like a make shift area. It was away from everyone else dining and we were at a busy traffic area for the employees to go in and out of the kitchen. I asked the hostess who was seating us to please move us to another table. Her smile disappeared and seemed annoyed by it. We walk back up front and she tells the other hostess about my request to be moved , and she looked pretty annoyed as well. I'm sorry but i was not about to be seated in a dark corner secluded from the main dining area as if we didn't belong there. They had many other tables available but they said they didn't have servers for those tables. So to make a long story short, it truly ruined my appetite due to the looks and snarls of the hostesses including the manger that happened to be at the check in table as well. We enjoyed our server , but you could tell that word had gotten around that Missy (me) had requested another table. It felt really uncomfortable the whole evening.

YHJJXsRKXtO42_yS0IXoBA.text: What a wonderful birthday dinner! A delicious butter cake and marvelous food! Tim the server was extraordinare in his knowledge and efficiency! I am extremely pleased and look forward to returning soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Halibut with lemon caper butter.....just dreamy!

jYFeoIoIFA1ZGWq6qcZobg.text: Mastros never disappoints. Was in celebrating the opening of a new job and the experience was extremely pleasurable. No reservation, 8pm on a Friday and was seated immediately at a table in the bar area. Steak was excellent, cocktails were excellent. The sommelier that came over had a warm demeanor and was very personable. We weren't even drinking wine, scotch flights in fact but he was still knowledgeable into making suggestions with whiskey as well.

Mp9BUssmJsFZ7yA5omsHig.text: Friday night team dinner with my coworkers at Mastro's. We'd been planning for a while but schedules kept getting in the way. I'm glad we finally made reservations and went because wow. Just wow.   Made our reservation for 5 on OpenTable and when we arrived, we were instantly seated. Our server got us waters while we waited for the rest of our group to arrive, then he went through menu and drinks with us. We ordered drinks and appetizers. While waiting for appetizers, they brought out baskets of bread (the pretzel bread was yummy!). We ordered Shrimp Cocktail and Seared Ahi Tuna for appetizers. I ate some of the tuna, which was amazing.  For main course, we each ordered a meat then a bunch of sides to share. I got the filet mignon. For sides, we got Mac & cheese, black truffle gnocchi, broccoli, asparagus, and mashed potatoes. I couldn't eat the gnocchi, but everything else was flavorful and delicious. Even the veggies had a unique flavor to them! We had leftovers, which we split up (somehow I ended up with a coworker's lamb, which I ate the next day and OH MY GOD I should have ordered lamb...). They bagged everything up for us and then we ordered desserts to share. We got the butter cake, flourless chocolate cake, and one other dessert (I forget!). The butter cake was good, but not my favorite. I loved the chocolate cake, though it was super rich. So yummy.  As far as service, our server was fantastic and attentive. When we first were seated and only ordered waters to start, I think he was a little "eh" that we might not be big spenders (and therefore big tippers...), but as we ordered more and more he seemed to friendly up a bit. He also had an assistant who helped quite a bit and constantly refilled our waters and cleared plates as needed.   The ambiance is nice, but it is in a mall (though a pretty nice mall). The main seating areas kind of overlook the mall, so it's a bit "meh" but don't let that take away from your experience. The food was great, the service was great... the price was definitely expensive. I'm sure you can eat here without it being as pricey as we made it, but we ordered a LOT of food and drinks.   Really enjoyed Mastro's. Definitely recommend it!!

yawTy-WNHA2ZQX6CSr4Vog.text: Dined at this location for my anniversary with the Mrs. Guy next to our table clearly had too much booze and yacked all over his food/table. Disgusting. Brandon the restaurant manager made things right by us and was very accommodating. Mastros will always be my favorite steakhouse and I guess for the guy who yacked..."what happens in Vegas stays in Vegas"

-T87k2ay1pfdDmeT1iP3uw.text: Food and service exceptional! We had oysters on the half shell... shrimp cocktail steak and dessert! Shrimp was huge! So yummy! Steak grilled to perfection. Oh we had the creamed corn server suggested we add jalapenos and bacon omgeeee! And the butter cake was sooooo good! It came with ice cream and fresh fruit and a side of whipped cream!!!

d716X1AodfDSofrWxxRkFA.text: Incredible experience! We split the wagyu tomahawk, gorgonzola Mac n cheese, black truffle gnocchi.

B0ITgqJnx0h4h9mwThX6aQ.text: Went to mastros for a celebration and had the tomahawk steak. It was amazing. Crab cakes and lobster mash was excellent as well as always.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomahawk steak! Amazing

yiZA09tFoAGDX5gski-RvQ.text: My husband and I go to Las Vegas several times a year mostly for the food, and we have a strict rule that we will never repeat a place that we have eaten at. This place makes us want to make an exception to that rule. The service was amazing, we were celebrating our anniversary and they made it really a special night! Best steak ever by the way!

fQrIXInjDTi_EZNX5SH2OA.text: We made a reservation via OpenTable and though we showed up almost 25 minutes late, they seated us quickly and at a great table in The Treehouse.  The bread basket was fantastic (as is most). There is Epi Baguette, Sourdough, Pretzel, and Cheese Crisp Crostini. The baguette had that wonderful chewy, moist interior, crusty exterior, and a great distinctive flavor.  We started with Fried Calamari ($15) and it's served a little differently now. They drizzle the spicy garlic aioli over the calamari and it's served with a sweet chili dipping sauce along with the usual fresh lemon. I thought it would be too much with the aioli and the chili sauce, but they really complemented each other (though you do need acidity from the fresh lemon juice to cut through the creaminess and sweetness). I would prefer the calamari to not be pre-sauced, but it was still tasty.  The 22 oz. Bone-in Ribeye ($59) was decent; it was cooked a tad over our request of medium rare and though it had nice strips of fat around the edges, the cut lacked a lot of marbling. It was still tender and mostly flavorful, so we enjoyed it.  I really liked the cut and size of their Chilean Sea Bass ($51) and it was good, but it didn't have that super buttery texture that I've come to associate with this fish. It was a little disappointing and I'm not sure what attributed to its non-characteristic texture; perhaps overcooked?  As it as been said many times, the Lobster Mashed Potatoes ($38) is absolutely divine! The super creamy potatoes are combined with large pieces of fresh Maine Lobster and finished with a pool of butter. It actually looks more like a buttery lobster broth, but I guess it's just lots and lots of butter! Either way, it's obviously delicious.  Not something we would normally order, I was pleased with the Alaskan King Crab Black Truffle Gnocchi ($34). The chewy, pillowy gnocchi is tossed in a asiago alfredo sauce and finished with black truffle and King Crab. All of these flavors worked together nicely and nothing was particularly overwhelming or too heavy.  Lastly, we ordered Sauteed Broccoli ($13). I was surprised how little it was sauteed, however, it was crunchy and a perfect accompaniment to the rich potato dishes and steak.  Since we were here for my birthday, they brought out a complimentary slice of their Triple Chocolate Layer Cake (I believe it's half). Not typically a chocolate cake fan, I loved it! The cake was really moist, wonderful mousse, and I loved the crunchy chocolate shavings and fresh raspberries. It's also served with a mountain of their wonderful fresh whipped cream (there was so much, we thought it was ice cream!).  From the moment we stepped into the restaurant to the very end, service was phenomenal! We were tended to by so many individuals and everyone was on top of their game. Everyone helped each other and we never had a moment of need.  The prices are mid- to high, but the portions are very generous! I assume most people leave with bags (we walked out with a large one as our food would've been enough for 3-4 people). Overall, we had a really wonderful experience and the food was good (above average).

IfS1n5UV_-HwLjeMrHFsLA.text: I have visited several Mastro's and this was not my favorite dining experience. Don't get me wrong service was great but at other locations the service has been phenomenal. The food we ordered was great with the exception of the green beans and butter cake!!!!!!!the green beans were bland and taste like rubber. The butter cake seemed to be smaller than normal. In addition, it was dry and almost brittle. I mean the butter cake alone is what keeps me going back!!

sMQXA0oaINPyrGwJ0Ey_5Q.text: Excellent service. Peter was our server and he treated us wonderfully. Ribeye steak and twin lobster tails on point.  Excellent cappachino as well. Great location at The Crystal Shoppes. Very elegant! P.S. my husband loves the bread !

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Don&#39;t take my bread!!!!!! Mastro&#39;s bread rules

W1WVogeXq1kbzY2tV47c5w.text: Been to this restaurant many times and it NEVER disappoints me   The steak is always cooked to perfection I always get medium rare and it's always on point    I ALWAYS get oysters I'm a huge oyster fan have been for years   Also ordered the shrimp cocktail seems weird when they bring them out it's only 3 but they r really big :)   Also order the Alaskan king claws very big and lots of meat   Also ordered the salmon which was cooked blacked very good as well  This place is always on point never been disappointed if you go here and u don't like it there's just something wrong with u

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

A9-BmPVi064p9wnh9kz3Yw.text: Sherri was an awesome bartender! She introduced us to some fantastic whiskey in one of the coolest looking places on the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It&#39;s the battle of the old fashioneds!

HKKqq294GgGkMtADpqmk1g.text: I came here for our office Xmas dinner and as an office full of foodies, we get around to a lot of nice restaurants. Mastro's Ocean Club was hands down the best place we've gone. The ambiance was very classy and the staff is knowledgeable and attentive. Half of the restaurant is a traditional dine-in interior, but you also have the option to sit in a large wooden structure that resembles a nest. It's a little wild, but it gives you something to talk and post pictures about. The food is top notch. Like seriously top notch. The fish is cooked perfectly and most dishes can be prepared in several ways. My sea bass was baked with a herb rub and a parmesan crust, so the bite was crispy on the outside but firm and juicy on the inside; all the bases were covered. The sides are served family style and are a great way to experience the whole menu; my personal favorites were the brussel sprouts and the lobster Mac and cheese. I'm really glad I got a chance to stop in and look forward my my next visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A decadent and delicious butter cake topped with vanilla ice cream and a side of whipped cream.
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilean Sea Bass with sides of lobster macaroni and gnocchi.

_Tdu8h5etRRY86HP21nTHA.text: Dining in the tree house is such a beautiful experience. The atmosphere has truly gone above and beyond the usual restaurants on the strip.  The food is a delicate experience in which you must savor every moment. From appetizers such as thier incredible sea food tower, to desserts like the buttercake, or everything in between like thier incredible sides that compliment every entree. Mastro's is a must try.  From romantic dinners to corporate outings there is a seat for everyone at Mastro's Ocean Club.

ExRZ8fjdFdDxvJEe7etMZw.text: Went to dinner with friends while in Vegas a couple of weeks ago. This was a wonderful evening.... Starting with the best Martini ! My steak was perfect..... This location is my fav of all the Masrtro restaurants I've eaten at. The ambience is also very inviting and cozy. Love this place.

GJZiSPCqdzeQ_4e-pYPcGg.text: I brought clients here on a Thursday evening for dinner around 800 pm. I recommend reservations since  the place gets busy. My clients who arrived from Denver around a year ago and never experienced Mastro's previously so I knew they were in for a treat.  We started off with drinks at the table  once we were  seated and were brought the awesome bread basket -  I indulged in the pretzel bread yum! We ordered a few appetizers - scallops, crab cakes and ordered our starter salads. I opted for just the 1/2 salad of the iceberg wedge - it's plenty large and so yummy. For my main entree I went for he rack of lamb and we shared several twice cooked potatoes and cream spinach. Everything was spectacular and the service was stellar! My lamb was cooked to perfection and  my clients were impressed as I expected. The only con was nobody had room for buttercake!  I received a telephone call from Mastrro's the following day thanking me for my business which again is so out of the box. I'm happy to see even with the change of ownership that nothing has changed here!

Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Butter cake
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 22 oz bone in ribeye, lobster mashed, Mac &amp; cheese and mushrooms

1ZzhQE1mSkQy_M39MUlI1Q.text: So painful to give Mastro's a 3 star rating. I live in AZ and we have three separate mastros that are all great - eat there all the time.   We were in town for the weekend and we came here with a party of 4. I always get my filet medium at mastros and it usually comes out at about medium rare to medium because of the plate being hotter than the oven. I got my 8oz filet and about 1/3 was a little too cooked. The meat was great but unfortunately a little over cooked.   Now is the time for BUTTERCAKE. If you look back at my reviews of all the Mastros around the country, I highlight the buttercake every time. Greatest dessert ever. Our other guests never had it, so of course I was hyping it up big time. Our first buttercake was very burnt - inside was completely hard and 2/3s was not edible at all. So we waved down our waiter and he runs back to get another. Second one comes out and unfortunately its the same burntness. By that time, we were over it and just said take it back and take it off our bill. Very disappointed in this - first time ever this has ever happened.

EmYK9x3tjNVI4g3csXn_mA.text: I've been a big protagonist of Mastro's since I first visited their Beverly Hills location almost four years ago. That visit was hands down my greatest overall dining experience with the service and all things considered. Since that visit, I've been here to the Ocean Club twice... both times were special occasions made very unspecial with the experiences here.  I'm not sure if the Beverly Hills location is just so far ahead of everyone else, or perhaps Mastro's being bought out not too long ago was the cause for a dip in overall quality, but I just don't feel the same about this place.   There's nothing imaginative or cutting edge about the menu here. It's typical steakhouse fare... beautiful cuts of prime beef, lobster mashed potatoes, king crab gnocchi, louie salads, seafood towers, butter cake and overpriced cocktails. Among your big hitting steakhouses, execution of the chef and service is what will set you apart.   To my disappointment, Ocean Club LV just doesn't stand out. Both times I've been, the last visit being last month, the service didn't stand out like my first visit to Mastro's.   When I came for my best friend's bachelor party weekend, three... THREE of our 5 steaks were severely undercooked. We got black and blue ribeyes, and they just re cooked the same steaks we had already cut into and gave them back to us. Pretty laughable for any establishment, let alone one that is supposedly of the highest quality.  Came with my fiancee the second time and the service was SO slow. Our waiter was not at all attentive and very difficult to track down the entire night.

9hc98oFvMoR_OE298BKEMA.text: Our party of six family chose Mastro's to celebrate my mother's 85th birthday.  It was a stunning experience from start to finish!  The room is just beautiful, with the careful engineering that dampers the sound so that even when the restaurant is full and bustling you can hold an intimate conversation at your own table.  The ages in our party ranged from a somewhat shy 16-year-old boy to my elderly mother - the servers were attentive, patient, respectful and engaging with all, and put everyone at ease.  The "high-drama" cocktails (some containing dry ice for an amazing display) were brought to the table with flair, as was the food which was delicious.  At every juncture we were made to feel that the staff was grateful that we were there - and the phone call the next day thanking us for having dined with them was an elegant and much appreciated touch.

Ii9b21ITdOlzCNdfSEppnw.text: This is my new favorite restaurant and I've been to most of the nicer spots in Vegas.  Great atmosphere (in Crystals shopping) and the food is simply amazing.  I had the sea bass and my husband had a filet -- both were beyond exceptional.  But the piece de resistance was their dessert.  We had their signature butter cake and it was literally the best thing I have ever tasted!  They are always busy so make sure to make a reservation!

RT81DHVvPGH3fw_ZirtB5A.text: Great service. Food was very good.  Blackened salmon and the Big Eye Tuna were terrific. Brussels sprouts were too large and undercooked. Mac and cheese was very good. Chopped salad as just average.   Looking for a big Pinot Noir?  Belle Glos from the Clark & Telephone vineyard will rock your world!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big Eye Tuna
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blackened Salmon
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pinot Noir!

-235cJT9FsWK0rBLjKdgag.text: Came here for dessert--ambience was great. Bartenders friendly and attentive. Butter cake was recommended as their signature dessert so we ordered it. --omg so rich! Warm butter cake with vanilla ice cream and a large helping of fresh whipped cream. The ice cream wasn't very good...expected better but the warm butter cake with the fresh whipped.cream was so good. Definitely a must share order. Even the two of us couldn't fully finish it.

0S-G8BZkSx5ZjKXxdeUiFA.text: The food is great and the service was excellent. We complained the lobster pasta didn't hve enough lobster and they immediately changed it and it was AMAZING

6BbtqraZE1PTxWqlw2gdvg.text: I went here for a work dinner hoping to find a good seafood restaurant In Las Vegas but left very upset with both the dining experience and the quality of the food.   The food: we started out with some alacarte cold seafood. I had the oysters which to my surprise was only served with a cocktail sauce -  not vinegar. A shame for otherwise good oysters. My colleague had the burrata with the heirloom tomatoes, but the cheese was more like mozzarella and the tomatoes un-ripe and hard.  For our mains we went with the seafood - I had the sea-bass (blackened) and to my surprise it  was drenched in butter and tasted more of butter than the fish I was expecting. My colleague had the swordfish - which was overcooked, and cold by the time it came out.  The service: the service was non-attentive and several times the staff walked by not noticing our empty glasses or asking if we would like another drink.   When we got both our apps and our mains the staff served us the wrong courses- we all got each-others dishes.  Lastly - Once dessert rolled around (we had ordered two deserts to share) -we only got two plates which was very inconvenient. After once again waiting for the staff to come around and not noticing we had not started eating, we managed to get some plates brought out - albeit - the plates were hot and miserably watched the ice cream melt as it hit the sizzling plates.  Overall we left Maestros pretty upset with the experience and the food - especially considering we brought our client here for a fun evening.  Follow up: the following day I received a follow up call asking how we found the experience - I told the caller about the experience and I had a manager try to reach out to me after. I will post an update here after I get in touch with them again.

nPMIUPZrqCYGN55qLZSJrA.text: So as we walk into this place I was very skeptical to think that they would produce good food because on the outside all you see if the tree house and you kind of don't understand how to get in here but then we walked in and it finally made sense.we were celebrating our cousins birthday so there was four of us. So let's start with appetizers we had the crab cakes which here they were your typical crab cakes nothing special but still tasted petty good. Bone marrow!! I'm telling you it's the business here! They were served with mini toasted bagettes buttered on the grill and the little salad they had on the side was an awesome pairing.I would definitely order it again yummy! So the waiter recommended that we try the 33oz wagyu tomahawk ribeye and I'm glad we ordered this steak. And for 88 bucks I expected another mediocre steak but boy was I wrong. I asked the waiter when the steak came out if I needed any sauces for this steak and I was thrown off on how he immediately said no trust me eat it as is.. the most awesome steak I've had in my life so far..I was so satisfied from first bite to finish and now look to have this steak on a regular.my wife also agreed and sister and cousin felt that was a phenomenal steak! Thank you so much for the experience Our cousin and sister had the rack of lamb and for me I'm not too much of a lamb guy but they insisted that I try it and I was amazed because normally when I eat lamb it's too gamy for me but this was an awesome prepared lamb chop so thank you for that because it totally changed my perspective on lamb. As for the sides that we enjoyed with our meal we had lobster mashed potatoes and asparagus and cream corn.they went with our meal and I will say my favorite thing was the cream corn and the recommended lobster mash felt like it was just your simple mash potatoes and gravy with lobster on top..still it was delicious Since we were celebrating a birthday or waiter gave us the also recommended butter cake on the house which was very nice and I think the dessert is not as good as they say. but we all enjoyed it overall the steak is what I will come back for it was such a great meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The non bone in side of the tomahawk ribeye that my wife had! Bomb
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone marrow! Ahh so good
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab cakes

PRzcO-q6NTKVZtqikwuvZQ.text: I visit Mastros often and would like to update. We had our corporate Christmas dinner here and Brandon could not have been better. They just know customer service and their food is incredible. Christina served us at the bar area. She was outstanding. Knew the menu and wine list. I didn't have to ask anyone else about my favorite Pinot Noir. She made us feel at home. Best things: lobster roll, filler mignon, Brussels sprouts and mashed potatoes. Of course, the butter cake. Loved it.

eMOT_81PYesda7UcZcq5_w.text: Really disappointed, we arrived for early dinner, and were immediately sat , beautiful building , after that it was all downhill. Server should have worked at norms, he was in a hurry , no specials introduced very little interaction , sat for awhile finally received some bread,drinks were pretty good, wedge salad was swimming in egg, mayonnaise and bacon bits, taste was flat, when wife's petit filet arrived and my 22 oz bone in porterhouse they were over cooked , the greens were sizzling in the pan and went soft in 10 minutes , my steak was uneatable, , wife got 1/2 of hers down , when I requested the check waiter brought it to me and thanked me as he turned to service another customer , weak customer presentation . We usually dine at the restaurant in Newport Beach and everything there first class, Lots of wonderful restaurants to try in Las Vegas , hopefully your visit here won't match ours, maybe they should enforce a dress code as well , baseball hats , shorts on men and pool wraps on women should be discouraged

UIHAz0dlqelRpNFl9bm0xw.text: My favorite spot in Vegas :) I come to Mastro's every year for my b-day. Food is amazing, lamb is my favorite. The best part is the butter cake, it's the best thing ever Best people, food, service and atmosphere.

Tn9LG2N2WJf97Rj9UmILfQ.text: This is such an amazing spot I've probably been here 5 times. The food had always been good every time and the staff is just so nice and friendly it's definitely a spot you don't wanna miss. The restaurant is so uniquely built and fun the price is not bad either.

AHjIZp4itJKyeAFBebSn3Q.text: World class service! Amazing staff!  impeccable attention to detail was breathtaking...I recommend Mastro's to everyone! The ambiance is amazing and the food we ordered is on the top of our list! The steak was juicy and perfect our drinks were made to perfection and the dessert was to die for! Come to Mastro's and have the same amazing experience we had!

uTEYpnsSGi84mouOdIwbUw.text: This is by far the best restaurant I have ate at in a long time. Everything we mouth watering. The service was great. The dessert was AMAZING!!! You have to get the butter cake.... mind blowing. My husband didn't barely eat his chocolate layered cake because he got a taste of my butter cake and couldn't stop eating it! Lol So make sure you get two!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2BupasyT8AI1bh6WlJl3cA.text: I searched, for the perfect Vegas restaurant, for our anniversary dinner, by checking the internet, asking friends, and tallying #YELP, Open Table, and Trip Advisor scored. I started with a long list and ended up, with Mastro's. And, it was the perfect setting, to celebrate our anniversary.  We travelled all morning. Checked in our hotel and walked all over the strip, during the day. So, we were a little tired, by dinner, but were up, for celebrating, with delicious food and wine.   We had a table, in the "treehouse". We ordered a bottle of The Prisoner wine, because we were splurging. It was delicious, and went well with our meal. The bread basket they brought out was this bread lovers dream; huge, wide assortment of yummy goodness, with butter.  We had the crab cake appetizer. The crab cakes were very large, and scrumptious, with not much filling, just lots of crabmeat.  The Lobster Bisque was very nice.  We shared Blackened Scotch Salmon, which was delicious, but thankfully, not huge, cut in half. The lobster Mac 'n Cheese side is sinful.  They brought us a complimentary dessert, for our anniversary. We were able to squeeze in a few bites.  The service was as you would expect, in a higher end, very nice restaurant. Our waiter and all the staff were courteous and helpful.  Without the $100 bottle of wine, the meal was still pricey, but it was worth it. This is a great place to celebrate something/anything!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert lit up
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary Dessert
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Mac &#39;n Cheese side, with a shared portion, of Blackened Scotch Salmon

BC9XxoR-GSuKX667BqODaQ.text: Ok,it's not cheap! With that out of the way,the place is amazing! Visually stunning! A piano player. Pretzel bread and bread  basket the best. Spicy Mambo Salad,unique and flavorful, Highest quality steaks and seafood. Can't go wrong with the Fillet Mignon or Sea Bass. Warm Butter Cake for Dessert,a must!! Put it on the credit card and enjoy.

uLACFsR1KuR-DG38WfQZ8A.text: One of the worst steakhouse I've ever ate at.. Dirty dishes and knives to begin with. Had 3 of my friends order medium rare and it came out brown.. Told the manager, he had the chef to start a new order, and it came out again well done.. I was speechless. How do you mess up the order twice??? For a steakhouse this is pathetic. If your cooks can't cook steaks .. Please consider a new profession..

8rA2NcEjYWacKVqYeLs83g.text: Very high priced for what you get. Service was good and attentive. The food was just not worth the high price. Sweet potato fries on menu come out in what tastes like fish batter. They were not labeled as anything but "sweet potato fries" but when they delivered them to our table it looked like 2 pounds of battered fries that were not good. Then they called them tempura style. They took them off the bill and were very professional. They even surprised us with an excellent butter cake for a birthday in our party. I would score them higher if it were not for the value for the money.

mjemWO712Fjjc9GK2JqICw.text: Has 7:45 reservations, arrived at 7:30 and was sat promptly. Our server Dalin was great and made sure we had everything we wanted. The rack of lamb was excellent and the lobster mash was delicious. We started with the calimari which was lightly breaded and very juicy rings. Save room for the buttercake desert. Enough for 2 and tastes great with the fresh whipped cream they serve with it. Overall, great place to eat dinner for steak and seafood. Great atmosphere and service.

GubnVSYglpoqWelZxm2pPg.text: I am going to make this review short and to the point.  You should come here.  The food and drinks are superb, the wait staff are very friendly and attentive and the restaurant is amazing.  Worth the money for sure. Get on it people.

vtTVvBhhW2RRDCZcR_y1Mw.text: Ok. I have walked by this place a dozen times in the Crystal Shoppes and always just thought it was a mall restaurant. Surprises in Vegas keep on coming. I checked on Yelp and it was rated pretty high at 4.5 with 589 reviews. The final selling point was that it is open until 1 am which makes sense in Vegas. It is a pain to make it to a show and have dinner finished by 10 pm. A lot of the supposed higher end restaurants could do a lot better job on their hours in Vegas. Mastros does and so it got our reservation. We had a great dinner, the sea food tower was stacked and very well done. Everyone enjoyed their meals, the steaks and fish meals were great and not a complaint was raised at the table. The wine was recommended and reasonable. Not to mention very well paired to the meal. Thanks to Dion (our waiter), for a really enjoyable evening. He made the night work for everyone, even though it started off a little shaky. A bit more attention by the host staff when dropping people in the bar to wait on their table would have earned 5 stars.   However, we would go back in a heartbeat.

OfXD0Xg9arCWrvdAR14Fvw.text: I am usually a four star reviewer.  If the food is good and the server is attentive, that is good enough for me.  5 Stars are for the rare occasions both the food and server are over the top good.  Mastro was both.  First Mastro is in the middle of the almost new City Center construction project and mausoleum for the lost profits of Dubai and the MGM Group.  It is a really nice place filled with shops people can no longer afford.  Mastro from the outside looks like a brown tree house in this glitzy cloud.  It is a really beautiful build out with a long and a two dining areas, one in the tree house and one outside said house.  It is a traditional steakhouse with tons of cuts of cow cooked to your liking and ubiquitous sides:  4 different types of spuds, veggies, etc.  I do not eat steak, but most of these places will have one chicken dish and really decent seafood.  I ordered the salad, scallops and split the sweet potato fries.  The salad was huge and could have/should have been the meal, especially after the  box of 6 kinds of different breads.  The scallops really excelled with a Parmesan flavoring, but the hit was my friends Arctic Char, which was perfect....and I mean perfect  Where is there fish that good in a desert?  The waiter was excellent and goaded us into dessert.  We asked him about the Praline Vs House Special Batter Cake.  He said try one as they were his favorite.  He would let us try the other.  Both were phenomenal....  As is this place....Really great food and total culinary experience

utIpkbWlVtyDJAP4s_uPZg.text: Celebrated my father's 70th birthday dinner here along with my wife and mother.  The food was excellent and the sides are HUGE.  The four of us ordered 3 sides and it was way, way, too much food.  We all had fish dishes on their menu and all were superb.   Be sure you order their signature dessert.  Can't remember it's name but it is heavenly.   Also, ask to be seated in The Nest and be sure you make reservations...the place will be packed.    Finally, only one complaint - Their Hostess's need to LOSE the attitude!  Try looking up and making eye contact when someone walks in to check in.

NHVvfF0HT2v-gPGOxMp37A.text: Yeah yeah, this place is great (ribeye, lobster mashed potatoes, truffle crab gnocchi, butter cake).   Comparing CRAFTSTEAK??  Service: Waaaaaaay better at Mastro's. Craftsteak reminds me of being on a Caribbean cruise, and that's NOT a good thing.  Food: Larger portions and better execution at Mastro's. Craftsteak seemed oversalted on its steaks and lacking on everything else.  Ambiance: *see Service comments :)

76Lq9RSBWRYqZwDGMyq6eQ.text: Best Steakhouse hands down! Lobster Bisque and the Lobster mashed potatoes are a few to name the best ever! Filets to die for! Always a treat! Love you Mastros!

C1F7mmPns0k6_-GMVv6vzw.text: We were celebrating my wife's's bday, service was outstanding, we were in a bit of a rush to catch a show, and they were very accommodating. The scallops were out of this world and the ribeye was worth every penny. Only regret is not having more time to enjoy the moment.

Thv7zZFfcGasqWUoxyYuRw.text: Five stars! Amazing food. The customer service is awesome. Our waiter was very helpful explaining the menu and helping us make our choices. Portions are large and perfect for sharing. You can also order half orders of pretty much everything.

nNqroFpEop2OBEyd5QxnDw.text: I spend the majority of the month in Vegas. There are some good spots to dine at, but none compare to Mastro's. It's beautiful decor, great staff, timeless menu, and perfect good keep me coming back. The sea food tower not only has a wonderful presentation, but it is some of the freshest seafood I have found in the west. The steaks are superb and will not disappoint. The bar is beautiful and the drinks are outstanding. I would definitely start with a fresh sea food tower and end with the butter cake.

2EYUo-ds5VOHj-1nhwXpaQ.text: It was either a off night, or they were training a new steak cook.  I ordered my bone in rib eye medium and at best it was medium well.  My buddy's filet tasted like liver, that really strong iron taste.  Should have ordered the fish at a place called "Ocean Club".  Or next time I will stick to Wolfgang's Cut.  So disappointing.  Service was good.  Should have sent back my steak, but I hate wasting food.

YtCkIPGJ13tlUrxVy5RHyw.text: Delicious food, a special occasion restaurant for sure!

OoTf3s2yD5NwZFhfYWrNcw.text: Good food but pricey. Great service by the staff.

xRlp-vDAl17ToGkYHZDpoA.text: This was a very unpleasant experience. We made reservation for the treehouse, when we got there, they said the treehouse was not available. So they tried to put us at a table, that was so close to the other table, that the people eating would have to get up so would be able to sit. I had taken the day off from work, this was my birthday dinner, that I never got to have. We left do to the fact we didn't want to interrupt the other people from eating. The bottom line is that if you want a great meal and great service, go to the Wynn. I usually go there, but I thought I would try something new, big mistake.

QvrzXdhIJfG2U8YzwaZwfw.text: Mastros wins on all aspects FOOD, Atmosphere and incredible service. The best place to sit is in the tree house that extends in the center of the mall, never seen anything like it.  The shellfish towers are awesome, you get to pick what you want on it...ie...alacart shellfish. If you go through all meal courses it will cost you a few bucks but worth the expense.

ROXOH0rkUQjdAT4CJHjNZg.text: Insane collection of meat and seafood. I guess you can find stuff to nibble on here, but why? Epic portions of well prepared seafood and meat. A wagyu bone-in rib-eye doesn't come by very often. Holy jeez what a fantastic steak! I actually could not stop eating it. With the surf accompaniment of a grilled lobster tail - I was like in food Valhalla! And although they claim the restaurant in in a tree-house in the middle of a money mall, the caliber of the food let me overlook the pretentious vibe for the most part! Not for the penny-pincher!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Surf &amp; turf flintstones style
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. After dinner.

GPKoa8oc-UYOg5MpiJVEmQ.text: I've been to the Beverly HIlls location and it is my favorite steak joint. The service was awesome here but the food was very disappointing. Portions were way smaller and the quality was not the same. Very disappointing when I was hyping it up to my family. I will not be back.

yBUyJrDIgEWebCzvztcTjA.text: the steak i had was terrific.  but the best part was seeing mike tyson there.  i sent him a chocolate cake with the help of my waitress who was super friendly and accommodating.   there was a live piano player playing great tunes the whole time.

QGe2h3n7m2hhn6kPhW80nA.text: Make no mistake, This place is AWESOME.  The service was excellent, the menu has lots of unique offerings (The lobster mashed potatoes are unreal).  Everything was flavorful and prepared perfectly.  I had a bone-in Ribeye.  It was seasoned well and cooked to perfection.  It was not the best steak I have ever eaten, but it was up there.  The drinks are aggressively poured (for what they cost, they certainly should be). Dessert was equally impressive and the attentiveness of the wait staff was some of the best I have ever seen.  The dining experience as a whole was in my top 5.  I very strongly recommend this place if you are seeking a top notch dinner in las vegas.  That said, be forewarned that it is also in the top 3 most expensive dinners I have ever had.  The entrees are not really that exorbitant, but when you tie in a side like lobster mashed potatoes for $40 and multiple alcoholic beverages, it gets expensive in a hurry.  Although expensive, the entire experience makes it worth every penny.

3WtBiyvJssRCoRq6Dq9cIg.text: Little late on this review, but didn't want to miss out on saying how wonderful this beautiful new restaurant is. Service was impeccable. Seafood tower was delicious and our steaks were perfectly prepared. Not a sea bass eater, but was told it was one of the tastiest. A don't miss Vegas experience.

SEbVEQHG1RhS9_6b9yY9aQ.text: This was by far the best meal and dining experience we had in Las Vegas. Daniel our waiter and the rest of the staff were very helpful, attentive, accommodating and professional. I highly recommend Mastro's  to anyone looking for an excellent meal and dining experience.

5QLbuw7e7n2_k9UwNGVjGg.text: Went to Mastro's before a show. Scott was our server and was excellent. Had a full dozen oyster's on the half shell which were just out of the ocean fresh and delicious! I ordered Sea Bass blackened and it was melt in your mouth perfect! The lobster mashed were delish as was the house dessert, Warm Butter Cake, served with loads of fresh homemade whipped cream! Servings are large and we all had leftovers. Loved sitting in the treehouse. We do have a few suggestions: The entrance is so boring and the piano is shoved way back in a back corner that you would never notice it. How about putting the piano up front somewhere? Such a wonderful restaurant needs a a better first impression. Also, we had called and asked for a 7:30 reservation and were told it was not available but 8:30 was. That was too late for us to make our show, so reservationist suggested 7. We arrived and were seated at 7 and the restaurant was no more than half full until past 8 pm!! So why couldn't we have come at 7:30 as we first asked? I mentioned this to a manager who approached our table mid-meal  and he said, "Well, sometimes things change." HUH??? Terrible response. Nevertheless, we loved our dinner and the service was fabulous. We can't wait to go back. We're already saving up!

hOHsRAii9bmfu4XkjngmmA.text: As a party planner, I do not gratuitously provide 5-Star Ratings. However, I believe Mastro's Ocean Club to be the perfect location for an intimate dinner party in Las Vegas. We booked the private rooms upstairs for a reception and sit-down dinner for a party of 40 on Saturday, September 15, 2012 and our discerning guests who came from all around the country could not have been more pleased with the entire experience.  We were expertly guided from start to finish by Carly Smith, Director of Events. Carly was assessable, professional, flexible and an essential resource regarding local vendors to compliment the comprehensive services offered by Mastro's.  The ambiance was charming and elegant... photos of the gorgeous chandeliers, golden leather seats and flat screens which are viewable on their website, do not do this venue any justice.  We were in full view of the delightfully lit Tree House and even the restrooms which came with very courteous attendants, were a pleasant surprise. Their technology is also top of the line. All we needed to do was bring our slide show on a flash drive and our iPad playlist and our music soared through the rooms and our slideshow displayed brilliantly on two flat screens. Mastro's provided all of the equipment and cords and made it easy for us to make our party truly surround sound fun!  No event is a success without delicious food and this is where Mastro's clearly shines brightly. We started with an extraordinary Seafood Tower and Brochetta during the reception. Guests could not get enough of the Colossal Shrimp and Split/Chilled Alaskan King Crab Legs and the wait staff kept everyone's wine glass full which added to the fun and excitement during the reception. As we moved into dinner, the asparagus tempura seemed to disappear from the tables as guests ordered their choice of salads and entrees. And, talk about entrees...the generous portions of prepared-to-order salmon, chicken, steak or sword fish provided additional shock and awe. Even the side dishes, sauteed mushrooms, sauteed broccoli and garlic mashed potatoes were absolutely delicious. In addition to Carly Smith, we also have the highest praise Sherie Ritzler, General Manager, Brandon S., Banquet Captain, as well as, L.R, Alex and all of the wait staff and hostesses.

DXjOOWzfb29ABujqob4tnA.text: Went to Ocean club for dinner on our last nite in Las Vegas-had been there before and loved it. Well, this time it was even better than we remembered!  Almost as soon as you sit down, the waiter brings an amazing bread basket with the prize being the hot pretzel bread.  We split the bacon wedge blue cheese salad and my wife had the big eye tuna rare. It was a huge portion of incredible, slightly seared sashimi. I ordered the New York medium and it was perfect medium with no grizzle or fat.  It comes on a plate that is 400 degrees with clarified butter on the bottom. I can honestly say it was one of the best steaks I've ever eaten. Sure its $50 bucks, but I've had lots of crappy 50 dollar steaks in my life and this was worth every penny.  We ordered the side dish that the waiter suggested.-home made gnocchi with either lobster or crap meat and gorgonzola cheese. Maybe the best 29 dollars I've ever spent!  We had a great bottle of merlot and unfortunately, couldn't finish all of  the food so we passed on the amazing selection of desserts but will leave room for one next time. And no, I'm not related to the owners!  Just had a fabulous meal and want to share our experience!!

2ywfpxujqGED4nfoPMkiOQ.text: Wonderful food, don't miss the pretzel rolls & not that expensive for lunch.

pbzYSlkPM_JJbBoZnOKl3A.text: my wife and i came for dinner at mastros ocean club last week. great menu and  great food. service was the best, i had not seen in vegas for long time. sonny took very good care of us. he took us to restroom upstairs and waited for us then showed us the dinning area upstairs. super friendly and very caring. next time we come in to mastros, we will love to see sonny again.

o-3ehL8sCLXsnZwfZDe60A.text: We went with a group of six and sat in the "treehouse". Our service team took very good care of us. We started with generous martinis. The generous side dishes are perfect for sharing. I really enjoyed my seared ahi tuna. The butter cake was a great way for the group to share dessert. The prices were lower than we expected and it was a good evening for our group.

At7rR_-7tBaeWgFtUL1K4Q.text: Great atmosphere, food was excellent.  My only issue is there isn't one person of color on the waitstaff.

bQ8w7pEXjufHiIt9wWRsFA.text: I really like Mastro's.    The service is excellent! They are attentive without being snobby and cold.  And you don't get pressured to order more food and bottle of wine.  (I personally think that Cut has the cold, snobby vibe that I'm referring to)  Highly recommend the whole dining experience, but I also love going to grab a glass of wine at the bar.  The bar has an open feeling that is very comfortable, but with an intimate vibe.  Food is good.  Nicely prepared and cooked to perfection.  Nothing crazy on the menu or super unique so its an easy crowd pleaser.    Price is on target as well for their quality of food. They don't push you to buy bottles of wine or spend a ton of money.  The servers are just there to give you what you ask for.  I never felt pressured to get more food and spend a ton.   By the way, if you're local they have a free dessert!  They're so generous with the portion size and its so delicious.  This definitely helps when I'm deciding where to go.  We love our restaurants that support their locals!

uTQr91OJGIvQySYwKsm1qA.text: Pros:  -Great food (excellent steak, excellent seafood. The Iceberg Wedge salad has a smoked bacon that is really great. The tuna tar tar is also terrific and beautifully presented. And the Macaroni and Cheese side dish: fantastically flavorful, rich, creamy, delicious pot of cholesterol. Worth it!!)  -Good drinks poured generously -Very good service   Cons: -absolutely earsplitting music- so LOUD it's impossible to hold a conversation. In an attempt to create a high energy environment, they have eliminated any opportunity for enjoyable conversation, and drive out a lot of sophisticated people. Bad, bad, bad decision!! PLEASE just play some classy jazz at a reasonable volume or anything except that loud rock and roll. Really a detraction from the establishment's fine qualities, and honestly it ruined our meal. If the music doesn't get turned down, we'll never be back.

wWJsU4067B8wgNTPsWD-iw.text: Very good food but I have to be hard on a place like this. You're paying top dollar for everything from environment to world class service and thus you'd expect the food to be equally top echelon, but I could nit pick my steak and the food's temperature. Sitting at the bar was not top echelon service attentiveness, just good. The chef and owner need to pay more attention to detail if they want to be seen as Las Vegas' best restaurant, which they very well could be.

QLCZxJwaPKIprXuARegUJA.text: Extreme Rude people who work here. Had a reservation and still waited 45 mins  my steak was over cooked and they didn't have lobster..

KU-2Wq-15Fayr36a3lk_7Q.text: This was our first time visiting Mastro's. We've visited other steakhouses like Flemings, Mortons, Ruth Chris, etc,  and this place ranks at the top. The servers are on point the entire meal, making sure that every detail of your meal is correct.  I ordered the 19 oz bone in filet and my wife ordered the petite filet. Both steaks were cooked exactly to our liking and did NOT need any seasoning at the table. They were flavorful as they were served. We ordered mac and cheese, mushrooms, and asparagus as our side dishes. The side dishes are large enough to share with your entire table so be aware.  We ordered the seared ahi tuna as a starter and it was delicious. Every bit of it was finished.  We ordered a few drinks with dinner and the drinks were excellent. The lemon drop I ordered was served on dry ice so the drink was smoking, entertaining presentation.  The location of this restaurant is a little odd, smack dab in the middle of a shopping mall in what appears to be a large wooden bong (not sure how else to explain it).  We also received a call the next morning thanking us for dining with them. It was expensive, but excellent and we didn't mind since we were celebrating our marriage.

erCKRh7Ftf6yr43ai9t9dg.text: A very classy restaurant, expensive but worth every single penny... The service is one of the highest First night my waiter was Nick and second was Tim very nice and attentive... Highly recommended this restaurant The food the drinks the dessert the service I don't have anything negative to say my birthday dinner was totally successful.... The cocktail DREAM BERRY is the best and sweet the creme brulee.. Thank you Mastro's keep up the good work!!!!
