nudO1x9riyWLp6HbiRyBWA.text: There is nothing bad I can say about this place and my experience there. I could complain that it was too expensive, but I knew that going in. The steak was fantastic and the sides as well.   The service was great. The waiter gave us great recommendations and shared a few jokes that I am sure he uses all the time. He also provide us with a good wine pairing. I was lucky enough to have someone else pay for the bill so all the better.  One thing I would say is that if you want a romantic dinner, this may not be the spot. The restaurant is in the Crystal Mall in City Center, and this place is pretty dead. I guess it will depend on the vibe you are after. I went for a buddy's impromptu wedding, so it was just 4 of us. Definitely one of the best steakhouses in Vegas.

-PbPc1Qo01YRd5HPWeJvKQ.text: I was back to Vegas with my work team. First time at Mastro's Ocean Club, a restaurant in the middle of Crystal Mall. We booked dinner reservation for 9:45 pm for 6 on Sunday May/18/14 after the Show. I arrived 7 mins early, but our table was not ready and we were seated 10:10 pm (empty table needs to set up for 6). Our waiter was very tentative and recommend us the seafood platter. The Alaskan Red King Crab Claws & the Jumbo Shrimp Cocktails were awesome.  My Rack of Lamb was cooked medium rare as I requested on a super Hot Plate. Perfect!. The rest of the food and side dishes were great. The only less desirable thing was by the time we got our main course it was 11:40 pm at night.  For sure it was a bit pricey, our bill came to $1200 USD for 6 of us. Overall, it was a good experience. Maybe we will try again an earlier dinner time when we have a chance again.

4Cxbd7xnOs7r2RZKDtf0Ww.text: It has been a bit since I have been here. After the steak we had I question why- except I know the answer. Bone in rib eye- wow. The lobster appetizer was a lil skinny on the lobster- to be expected in a steakhouse- its not the main order, right? Sides and service, great. Mmm u are still in a high end mall. This has nothing to do with food or service, but its like, really? Patrons , please understand that a t- shirt or a jean jacket is acceptable for evening attire. I get it is Vegas, lunch-ok. Dinner? Puh-leez

MGf2jsp4vfODDvMGfuFDYQ.text: Had dinner here with my cousins in early August and I totally forgot to write a review. The best service in all of Vegas along with the best steak. Among the three of us we shared the New York strip, asparagus, Mac n cheese, and mashed potatoes. Also had the lemon drop martini. For dessert, the butter cake just melted in my mouth. Let's just say I was half asleep during Cirque De Solei's Zarkana show because food coma!

w9mqmjMt7Jq2sfSPMO8APA.text: Excellent service, food was delicious. We were in a hurry to get to a concert and they were very accommodating.

ijQbOvDeUMtGlvkm3m8PKQ.text: Our most recent dining experience at Mastros was 3/29/15. We were a party of 4. We were seated promptly upon arrival under "the cage". That is an open covering cavelike to soften the views of the Mall as it is located in the Crystal Mall in City Center. Crazy. Most of us ordered steaks and Calamari for an appetizer. The appetizer took FOREVER to appear! Ok, forgiven because it was excellent. Moving on. The steaks, for the most part, were fine except for one which needed less raw. Yes, I said raw! All side dishes are a la carte, so sharing is a must. The dinners are served on near bare plates with no presentation at all, so whatever.  All in all, not bad, but for the price a little bit more effort is in order. I will say our server did her best to cover up the mis-steps and I appreciate that effort. Unfortunately, she should not have to.

4fdRm297Ow3zthx2aV7m3g.text: This place is always pretty good! This location in particular is a bit odd, though. You're literally eating in the mall much like a food court (with a large bill). But hey, at least you're surrounded by designer names..ha!)   The seafood tower is the way to go. The bone-in filet is NOT the best thing on the menu despite what the masses say. It's a bit chewy. My girlfriend had a regular filet and it was much better and cooked perfectly.  The butter cake is terribly overrated. I always find that it's a bit dry and for lack-of-a-better thought....NOT worth the calories.

gK3s83iupGE5G7Mvzm3IDw.text: Ahhh the seafood tower appetizer is more then a meal in itself.  So delicious and so much fun with friends.  Great to enjoy good food here.

DLxoD8BLHM0WUxJ3f_ikEQ.text: Excellent food,service and ambiance. The original Masteros in AZ is a go to favorite. The Vegas version doesn't disappoint.   In the landscape of Vegas dining where return visits are rare to the scale and innovation of dining venues. Masteros will get additional visits from myself, family and corporation.

dP4kuJ8HoiSWb-4Qzi0J7A.text: I will preface this review with the fact that family was in town and this dinner was free!  We had reservations for Saturday Night  at 8:30 pm for a group of 7. I am always leery of a restaurant that is in the middle of a mall. I don't care how fancy the mall is, I think mall food every time I dine at one. Mastro's my friends is no Mall Food Place.  The Service was top notch, we had a waiter and 2 bussers, while I'm sure they had different tables, they were always there when we needed them. It was like they were our dedicated staff.  The meal was top notch, starting with the amazing bread basket, continuing through the entrees, the family style sides, and ending up with an amazing dessert (which they comped to the table).  The Bread basket was a good start, it had Pretzel Bread, olive bread, a Parmesan crisp, and few other breads. The sides were amazing, they are served family style in surprisingly large portions. We had Creamed Corn (some of the best I've ever had), Creamed Spinach, Lobster Mashed Potatoes, King Crab Gnocchi, and Mushrooms. We also had a few salads to pass around the table, 2 Caesars (one regular and one spicy), Tomato and Onion, and Tomato and Mozzarella. A seafood tower and crab cakes were also ordered, I'm not much of a seafood guy but everyone else loved it.   They entrees were pretty stellar as well, I was splitting the 33oz Wagyu Tomahawk cut with my uncle, but since he was too full from the salads and sides, I had to man up and eat the whole thing myself (the things I have to do). This was one of the best pieces of Cow I've had in my life (and I've had A LOT of cow). It was cooked just a touch under medium rare (perfect IMO), the marbling in the meat was insane, and it came out on a scorching hot plate. I don't know how they cooked it but it was perfect.   Table mates also got the Seabass, A Filet, and a few other meats, I was very impressed with the size of their portions, most places would serve about 4oz of fish, but their filets were about 12oz servings.  After dinner, they brought out a Warm Butter Cake with Vanilla Ice Cream for the table, it was a great end to the meal, and comping it was a nice touch!  I have no clue what the meal ran, but it was amazing. My only complaint is that their bar area isn't the best, if they're going to make you wait 10-20 mins for your table they need more room in the bar. They did however have a great piano player and singer who played a variety from christmas carols to current hits which only added to the amazing meal.  Will I be back, hopefully, especially if someone else is picking up the tab!

FQc1zHTzaB48NSait9DzEg.text: So disappointed. I did not enjoy the experience at all. Sea salt fries were burnt, chocolate cake was super dry, and my filet was pretty mediocre. the steaks are so much more flavorful and better prepared at The Capital Grille. The cocktail was the best part of my night. Not to mention the waiter spilled the wine on the table while attempting to serve. Maybe the one in BH or Malibu is better. Idk...

48XhhcchaAfxkdgCfSdKqg.text: Great food!!  Love their lobster mashed potatoes. Great service and very friendly. Unfortunately, our check took forevaaaa to come! LOL. Other than that, def would recommend.    Can be a quite busy so make sure to plan for your reservation.

Q0RuFiZDZ7o2Fo7ynFkiUg.text: I've been to two out in LA/Orange County area.  This one doesn't quite meet the same standard as set in California.  Still good, don't get me wrong.  Had the bone in filet.  It was cooked correctly, it just lacked flavor (as I'd expect from a bone in steak!).  The lobster gnocchi is always great.  Really enjoyed their wasabi salad (sorry- can't remember what it's called).  The restaurant itself is in a bit of a strange location- it's in middle of the mall. So atmosphere is very bright and you can see the stores while dining.  Didn't really like this setting for eating good steak.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

58Bu0PU-PvAE3ksaTzkoeg.text: I was blessed with a surprise dinner to this restaurant from my SO for Valentine's day and could not have asked for a better night. This is surely not an everyday restaurant for us but it felt so nice to go somewhere fancy for the night. The portions are shareable which was nice since everything was a la carte and a bit pricey, which was to be expected. Our waiter was super friendly and gave some great recommendations since I was so indecisive on the lobster tail or salmon; so instead he convinced me to splurge a bit and get both (which I did). The salmon was delicious and fresh, the lobster tail was a generous size, the mash potatoes were soft and the asparagus was seasoned perfectly. The bartenders have a heavy hand which was nice but I am a slight light weight so I could not hang after that margarita. The food and drinks made for a great night and made our Valentine's day dinner very nice, I highly recommend this restaurant for a special night out or a good treat for that special someone.

EvAQGl_JSPR5us562X8Ctw.text: Top notch service! We went to Mastro's for my mother's birthday and had a wonderful time. The staff, ambiance, and food all made for a memorable evening. Getting dressed up to fine dine is one of my favorite things to do and Mastro's didn't disappoint. Our server even added a special touch by bringing my mom a birthday dessert to celebrate. Well done!

uRf8VMtCIWeUUUWXKuFloA.text: Best scallops ever.  Amazing calamari  Amazing 12oz filet  Amazing service  Amazing lobster mashed potatoes   Even the bread basket was perfect.  With higher prices than normal you would expect excellence and perfection and they delivered.  I will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak. Mashed potatoes. Mac and cheese. Corn. It was dark lighting so it&#39;s not the best photo ever. But the food was amazing

FRFtOX5ob2mZWgjZxHs0hg.text: Amazing service, and surprisingly large portions of great food. This was out of our comfort zone restaurant wise and our waiter was patient and so knowledgeable so we were sure to get the best of the best. Definitely a new celebratory staple in Vegas when we go

bnhu6ZiZdJZ8qUZRWPUx6w.text: This my favorite Mastros in the country. What a gorgeous restaurant situated in the center of the Crystal Center.   Food is consistent with all other locations, but there is just something so wonderful about sitting at the bar in this particular location and not feeling so enclosed by walls - it is open and airy with great views to people watch as you indulge.

8XR5lOzO0fvpqsJBRcLr4Q.text: I've been here a few times over the years and I've never been particularly impressed. All the dishes I've had have been almost too salty to eat. The portions are huge but when the dish is oversalted you can't even begin to eat the whole thing. My martini at Mastro's yesterday was $23 which is high even by Vegas standards. But the open space and the "treehouse" is nice, so perhaps the food isn't the main point here.

qqNavmsdivUOvlnX98oWRg.text: Great special occasion spot. Have come here for the wife's birthday last 2 years now and we love it. This time instead of getting a meal we got some appetizers and sushi. For starters we ordered the fried calamari and a special smoked steak bacon. The calamari was delicious and lightly battered and cooked perfectly. The bacon was out of this world, smoked and served with a bourbon maple glaze, I could have ate 5 lbs of it. We got 2 large pieces and we devoured it. Next we had the sushi tower. The presentation is excellent with glass plates on the tower. We had the clear lobster roll, hamachi with crispy onions and the jalapeno tuna sashimi and all were to die for. The lobster roll had nice chunks of lobster in it and is wrapped in soy paper instead of seaweed. The hamachi was my wife's favorite, thin slices of hamachi with a light sauce and crispy onions. The tuna sashimi was as advertise, thin slices of time with a jalapeno on each piece, really good and all the sushi was really fresh. We followed that up with a wedge salad( all the salads here are large enough for 2 but they will do a half if you ask) and we each had a bowl of the lobster bisque. Wedge salad was covered in bacon and yummy. Bisque was brilliant with lots of lobster. Since it was her birthday they threw in a slice of their warm better cake, it's their house special and my wife loves it. Had it last year and I think that the main reason she wanted to go back.  I had the chocolate covered strawberries served with a pile of whipped cream. They were fresh and so very good. Service is always great and professional. Atmosphere is elegant and we love sitting in the tree house. Will definitely be going back next year!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fJ1OLVSTc7_2Gzo8bQv5Fw.text: Amazing as always. I had the 12 oz filet and the sweet potato  fries. I love the location in the mall next to my favorite store Gucci!! Steak was nice and tender customer service was top notch. And it's always good to running into friends while at dinner.

VsOA-YYmfcLjLdG402JDiw.text: Outstanding service!!! Even on a pack Friday evening! Left me speachless. Thank you so much for a delicious , great experience with my wife on our anniversary. Special thanks to our waiter "Edgar" for help making it a wonderful night for me.

v2k1EITSVdDwNW--hBcuIA.text: Unbelievable experience, food, flare, and fun. If you've never been to a Mastro's, you need to try it at least one time. Save it for a special occasion, big promotion at work, or any other time you either (1) want to treat yourself or (2) want to show off to someone else.   Regardless of which Mastro's you visit, come prepared to spend a few bucks. It's well worth it for the food and normal for a high end steakhouse, but for those unfamiliar with the brand, I didn't want you to be caught off guard. Rough prices: Drinks $20, Appetizers $25, Salads $20, and Steaks $50. They do have items cheaper than what I've highlighted, but also have specials that are much higher. For example, my steak was $144. For my wife and I, dinner was about $350 plus tip (I had a few drinks).   Ladies, be sure to order the Lemondrop. It's not on the menu, but will be made upon request. It's a sweet vodka based drink with chunks of dry ice at the bottom. When served, the drink literally steams over. Attention getting and for the lady in your life, something special.   Lastly, there are a lot of steakhouses in Vegas. If you're reading this, your probably doing what I did. Poking around yelp to compare and see which one was right for me. We ultimately picked Mastro's because they are a chain - and they can't afford to taint their reputation (they are generally in extremely wealthy areas). I've been to several steakhouses in Vegas, and this one seems the most consistent.   Good luck and enjoy!  PS - this is in the Crystals Mall, adjacent to the Aria. It's inside of that wooden treehouse that goes up to the ceiling.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DeyWAR5AQpOACarSzSOt0w.text: Top notch service and excellent drink selection on the menu. Great stop if you are looking for some relief from the heat out on the strip. Located at the shops at crystals on second floor. We were here in the summer just walking around in shorts and sandals. I needed a cold drink. My wife recommended going in but I thought there was no way in hell they would let me in with my Golden girls shirt and faded shorts. It wasn't a big deal, they let me right in. Sat at bar and ordered a few drinks. Drinks are a bit pricey but you probably know that already. Dining at the bar is offered. I wish I hadn't stuffed my face earlier. I wanted a steak but settled for cocktails.   The bartenders were very courteous and made sure to check on us regularly. The highlight for me was meeting my all time favorite NBA player, Magic Johnson of the Los Angeles Lakers. I made sure to go over and say hello. He was very kind. I even named my tortoise after him that's how much I love magic. The summer league was going on and a bunch of NBA management and players were hanging around. I saw a bunch.   Very dark inside the restaurant. Interesting how it opens up into the mall. Next time we will grab some steaks. Great place to hang out and people watch. Happy drinking!

rLv0nlaBGJxbr3vInKq9kQ.text: Amazing meal, best steak I've ever had. All the food was cooking perfectly. The warm butter cake was out of this world. Fine dining at its finest. The wait staff really makes you feel taken care of and there to serve you. I feel everyone should dine at this caliber restaurant at least once a year. Great experience at Mastros, I highly encourage everyone to try.

Fv6y43M9QJaGPe1gyeCtYQ.text: Coming from Seattle I'm always skeptical of seafood restaurants that aren't on the coasts. I had the halibut, it was fresh, not over cooked and the blackened preparation was very tasty. We all split several side dishes with our main courses. All were cooked to near perfection and were generous portions. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone seeking a great meal, good service and fine wine.

f4Cc4gC_xmJdnG24GIBYFA.text: This is one of my 2 favorite restaurants in Vegas. Always have a great meal and a good time here. I enjoy this location more than the southern ca locations. Tonight the meal started off with oysters Rockefeller and jumbo shrimp cocktail then onto a bone in ribeye cooked perfectly, creamed Corn and the butter cake for dessert. - excellent.!

L_JG_yYRHwcPC9qyImkzGQ.text: Overall I'd have to say this was a disappointment. Have always wanted to try this place and finally pulled the trigger. Wish we'd have just left it as a fantasy place. Server was very good, had great knowledge of the menu and made suggestions. Starters were all great. Lobster Bisque was outstanding as was the foie gras and the mussels. My wife had a sushi roll as her entree and it was really sad. Bland, unappealing... Just boring all around. I opted for swordfish and it was ridiculously dry, I mentioned it, only ate half of it but got to pay for it just the same. Gnocchi with lobster and black truffle was pretty outstanding, too. Beware, it's easily enough for 4 people. Drinks are very good but the prices are pretty out of line. Overall, I'd go back for apps and cocktails but would pass on a dinner.

YQ06e5J7jT9cjT9ApD6TUw.text: So this was my first experience at Mastro's and I was very pleased. I thought the atmosphere would be more dressy but it was pretty casual so its pretty much up to you if you want to dress up or dress down (both welcome). Our waiter was very nice and I like how he checked up on us often. Now let get to the food, I loved how the steak came out on a sizzling hot plate to keep the food hot but my steak was a bit over cooked for ordering medium. So make sure to be specific on how you want it. The sides were amazing I recommend the garlic mushrooms. Definitely will be back.

WBY40ErQW_C3JrUFPRjdmQ.text: Went here for our anniversary after many many recommendations from friends and it didn't disappoint. We had the wedge salad,  lobster bisque, filet mignon, mashed potatoes and butter cake. The dessert they brought out as a complimentary to celebrate our special day...service was top notch, drinks were amazing and the food was so so good. It definitely wasn't cheap but man o man was it worth it! Thank you for everything and I look forward to our next visit!

G2WjBQnSOCpU3iASPfEYhQ.text: Ummmm... sorry, Joe's. I think I may have found my new favorite seafood restaurant in Vegas.   Felt like taking the boyfie on a date so we decided on Mastro's with no reservations around 9:30pm. Thankfully, they close at 11pm and had a table available inside the spaceship looking thing. We were both super excited about that :) We were greeted immediately and was given the best bread basket on planet earth. I couldn't stop eating the cheese one!  Ordered: x Seafood Tower w/ Lobster cocktail, Crab cocktail, and oysters - The lobster "cocktail" and crab "cocktail" are GREAT and worth the price because it comes with a whole lobster in the shell and with tons of crab claws. The cocktail sauce is served on the side so it's a bit DIY. I prefer this SO much more over regular seafood cocktails. The oysters were small and delicious. Super fresh! x Caviar - AMAZING!! For $150, we got an ounce of some super delicious caviar serviced traditionally. Worth the $$$ if you want to splurge on how caviar should be consumed. x Seabass - This dish is served 4 different ways so it's pretty cool that we got to choose :) I wanted the panco-ish breading so we opted for that. The seabass was INCREDIBLE! Cooked to perfection and so tender!! LOVEEEE. x Brussels sprouts - Our favorite vegetables. Pretty large serving so enough to share between 3-4 people, in my opinion. Savory goodness.   We also ordered two gin drinks which were SOOOOOO strong. So worth the money :)   Everything was honestly just so great. It was fun to people watch shoppers in the Crystals. Beautiful space and fabulous food. Can't believe Mastro's is a chain! Don't let that scare you away. 10/10 would come again. Can't wait to try the other dishes!!

9Fld7z5_ov7FLqqsdb-nhg.text: Everything I ordered here was great. Everything is A La Carte so I got the filet mignon, sweet potato smash and broccoli. The caviar that night was going for $500 so that was a firm no for us.   The decor is nice and open plus the staff is nice.   Good eats.

3UxCLLVQi2RFlnZT_wDy5A.text: I've been to the Mastro's in Costa Mesa several times so I was pretty excited to try this Mastro's. Plus, I've always wanted to dine in the treehouse that they have here! I suggest making a reservation and requesting the treehouse. I guess it's not anything too special, but it is nice being in a different setting that you can't really get anywhere else on the strip.   The service here was excellent. Janene was our server and provided excellent customer service. She constantly checked up on us, refilling our wines and making sure our meals were to perfection.   // FOOD & WINE // Wine- The Prisoner: This wine is a blend of Zinfandel, Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah, Petite Sirah and Charbono. This wine had so many flavor profiles going on. It also went really well with all of the meat that we ordered. The wine was very smooth with plenty of fruity flavors to it.   Sauteed spinach: Your basic sauteed spinach with garlic. I would rather suggest ordering the sauteed mushrooms.  Scalloped potatoes: It was good, but it wasn't excellent. I would have liked more cheese added to my scalloped potatoes. Also, the potatoes seemed to be slightly undercooked and hard.   Bone-in ribeye: A great piece of meat with excellent meat to fat ratio and amazing flavor. I would definitely order this again.   18 oz bone-in filet mignon: Ordered rare plus, this meat was so tender. Unfortunately it wasn't seasoned that well so I had to add salt and pepper to each bite.   Overall, I enjoyed dining at this Mastro's location, but if I had to choose between this location and the location in Costa Mesa, I would have to choose the Costa Mesa location. The service at both locations were excellent, but I would have to say that I slightly enjoyed the food more at the Costa Mesa location.

hGdLvtTt_nlpAuiUJ_dijQ.text: Fine Dinning at it's best! Wow! If there was an option to give this place 6 Stars I would!   Ordered the stemmed mussels to share and I ordered the new york strip steak, medium-well. Mashed potatoes, roasted jalapenos and roasted Brussel sprouts were and excellent choice.   The steak was probably one of the best steaks (if not the beat) i've ever tasted. Cooked to perfection, tender and juicy and very flavorful.   jalapenos gave just the right amount of heat.   The staff and management went above and beyond in order to accommodate our party.   Overall probably the beat fine dining experience I've ever had although I can't say that I'm a regular at fine dinning places, much the contrary.   The decor of the restaurant , the ambiance, the food, the staff, the management were all absolutely amazing.   HIGHLY HIGHLY recommend next time your'e in Vegas.

Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Staff was very knowledge and amazingly good at what they do. This os a pic of the front entrance.

OfEoQWPrBfpt26hQglcdJQ.text: Always have had great food here which it better be for the price point. We always ask for Samantha now as she is always attentive unlike some others.

Kgk1zEaNHPo3nju-uLYxuw.text: Good seafood restaurant here at crystal mall Las Vegas. And I really love drink here they're call Mastro's Lemon Drop and Dream Berry serve with dry-ice that so cool.

0lZfr4GZhWyq7JsLCspfXA.text: UH-MAY-ZING!!! We will never go anywhere else for the best filet and seafood. The lobster mash is a MUST!

q2Xb3tjwzXugNdvXt3Ndjg.text: Dinner in a treehouse!   It was my first time visiting Mastro's located in the shops at Crystals.  This beautiful and elegant dining can be seen while walking through.  The 'treehouse' as they call it sits directly in the center so it's very hard to miss.  The wooden structure will catch your eye in a heartbeat.    We made reservations for our group and were seated early.  I would like to give a tremendous thank you to Paul our waiter.  I don't think I've ever been so entertained while receiving the best service anyone could ask for.  He went above and beyond to make our evening memorable.   The table is brought a bread basket which has 3 options. I will say their pretzel bread called my name.  I asked for more in which Paul graciously brought an entire basket of just those.  Fantastic!   I started with the wedge salad.  Perfect and delicious.  The crumbled bacon had a great flavor combined with the creamy blue cheese.  For my entree I chose the Chilean Sea Bass accompanied by creamed spinach, Gorgonzola mac and cheese and Alaskan king crab black truffle gnocchi.  Of course all of the sides are huge and were shared between all of our group.  The sea bass was so light, fresh and baked perfectly.  The gnocchi was a disappointment.  I don't think there were any crab pieces in this. But the other two sides definitely made up for it.  They were so creamy.  Anything with Gorgonzola will make me happy. Simply delicious!  If the appetizer, bread basket or main meal didn't fill you up, they have a great dessert list.  On top of that list is their signature butter cake.  It's topped with vanilla bean ice cream with strawberry drizzled around the cake.  It's calorie free and fat free... In my dreams! It's moist and delectable.  After the huge meal, I would suggest splitting this huge cake.    Mastro's delivered an impeccable meal with first class service.  It was surely a memorable evening!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Butter cake
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apple martini on dry ice
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wedge salad

9vB8GELVTyyeHvx1I8QhUg.text: Mastros always has a special place in my heart, I can't come to Vegas without making a stop here for dinner one night.   The service is always great along with the food. I always get the following:  Burrata salad Bone in filet Grilled asparagus  Scalloped potatoes Moscow mule  I've also tried the Truffle gnocchi (on the salty side just FYI)  You can't leave here without having their amazing buttercake! It's the great ending to the meal.

drcMkn0IxVttMK3rMBOJAA.text: I was able to go to Mastro's for the first time ever and I'm glad my first experience was the tree house seating at the Las Vegas location with my best friend and spouse. We made reservations for our Best- Friendaversary :-) and we all were looking forward to going. Our expectations were all exceeded. I've never tasted flavors like those served at Mastro's.   So, we ordered the smoked salmon appetizer for starters, blackened chilien seabass, a 12oz medium bone in filet, herb roasted chicken, garlic mash, creamed spinach and the Gorgonzola mac n cheese. OMG! Everything was delicious. We all ate off of each other's plates so we sort of had the whole surf and turf combo going since we all order different main dishes.   Of course we couldn't without saving some room for the delicious warm butter cake which is like no other cake I've ever had. Served with best wishes to me and my best friend by Lionel. He was great and I won't forget him. He made my first dining experience at Mastro's very well worth it and I hope every time I go the environment and culture is the same.  BtW the Lemon Drops we amazing!!!

2t9hQmJpm4QBRVrH_0ZFPA.text: I was a fan of Mastro's in Orange County and decided to try the Vegas location and didn't feel the same.  The food and service was fine but the server doubled all the items for the seafood tower which we didn't realize until towards the end and they didn't clean the crumbs on the table like other locations do.  Also, I made a mistake of only tipping 10% tip for 6 people and I was going back to give them the cash for the rest but I was too far away by that time but I saw that they changed it to 18% and charged to my card.  I wouldn't go back to this location since I found the better place the next day called "The Palm Las Vegas" in Caesars Palace Hotel the next day.

miCfh-hIfkLE_XylYeY51A.text: Always a favorite stop for us when we're in town. I'm never disappointed, never leave hungry and never leave wanting more...  A feast for the eyes. Satisfying for the stomach. Yes!  We started off with crab cakes. Yes, pedestrian. But I was starving and wanted to keep it simple with my G&T.   We dove straight into the giant grand seafood platter. It was delicious and amazing. But I was slightly disappointed. The Dungeness crab was a bit salty. (I mentioned it to our server, he admitted they boil it in salted water. I felt they should dial it back. Dungeness is briny on its own. I suppose it's okay to put it in a lightly salted water for preparation. But maybe it was a bit much?)  Then for the final blow: Kobe beef with foie gras and lobster mashed potatoes. Yeah. Stick a fork in me. I was sick with regret a half an hour later. But I did enjoy it! The steak was perfectly medium rare and so tender I nearly didn't need a knife. Truly amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood platter.

qqQl-Ewji4QXmwNbCXn0uQ.text: Food was excellent, the service does not match the ambience and food. There was a guy walking around with a suit on, he was friendly. Our server was not friendly.   The petite filet and lobster mashed potatoes were excellent. The roasted Brussel sprouts were good also. I had the elderflower martini without the sugar rim, nice but pricey (along with most martinis in Vegas). We sat in the treehouse, which was a wonderful experience. Overall, this was an excellent experience, however, I have been to several restaurants that offer the total package.

YnR8yzAHFsW8nv4eMtHcMA.text: My husband and I went here our first night in Vegas. We didn't have a reservation we just showed up. They seated us right away. This restaurant is stunning, low dimming lights to set the mood. This has to be the best food I've had in Vegas yet. It is expensive tho. The steak was so tender and juicy and the mushrooms were delicious. We shared the dessert. The waitress recommended the house special and it lived up to everything she said it would. The staff was friendly and seemed like they enjoyed being there. This restaurant is definitely one I'd like to return.

D3hIK3HQIzGZ1H1ljfPojQ.text: Finally made it to Mastro's Ocean Club in Vegas, as I always go the my Newport Coast location..  Consistently delicious Mastro's quality and posh interior decor. Stellar service, bomb seafood tower, A5 wagyu was LICK!!!  The chic architectural design of the spiral dome nest inside The Crystals mall makes this an uniquely edgy location. I luv that it's next to Van Cleef & Arpels, Christian Louboutin, & Fendi. Eat, then shop to the 9s to work it off...  By the time the ice cream butter cake & choclate cake circulated, I was FBR (full beyond recognition).  Our group was sooo stuffed, we shut down the restaurant and literally popped out of our dresses.  Thanks goodness I wasn't wearing one of my Herve Leger dresses, hahaha LOL.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The schnauzers at Mastro&#39;s..
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster, king crab, jumbo shrimp, or oysters... anyone?
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Two (2) giant seafood towers (lobster, crab, jumbo shrimp, oysters) - luv the juicy jumbo shrimp cocktails (my fav)!!!

UorKUjZxwvNZQddSJRGezw.text: This is top notch dining. Located in Crystals at Aria on the 2nd level. Five of us came to celebrate a birthday last night and we requested the "tree house". This is a wooden structure which almost floats in the air, very unique for sure.   We were seated in the center and were lucky enough to get Paul as our waiter. Paul is everything in a waiter you could ever ask for. Knowledgeable, very attentive, funny and yet professional giving us excellent service during our meal.   He was helpful when selecting wines as well as explaining the menu. I ordered the dungeness crab cocktail and the 22 oz bone-in ribeye. I love seafood and was planning on the seabass but couldnt resist the ribeye. Our table split sides of gorgonzola mac & cheese, creamed spincach and Gnocci with alaskan king crab.   The crab cocktail was excellent. Served in a dish with 2 sauces and dry ice it comes out smoking. It was about 10 large pieces of crab ($28). The ribeye was also very good ($58), although a tad to fatty for me. It had good marbling like a ribeye should but parts were a bit too fatty. 3 of us ordered our steaks medium rare and they all came out rare. Beware they do tend to undercook  a bit, but we all finished them as the meat was so good.   The gorgonzola mac and creamed spinach ($14) were both really good. We were a little disappointed with the gnocci however ($33). I found very little king crab in the dish but the flavor was there. For dessert we ordered 3 of Mastro's famous butter cakes which come with vanilla ice cream.   Paul was nice enough to personalize one of the plates with a "happy birthday" written in chocolate. The butter cakes were awesome (and quite large). They can easily be split  between two or three people.   Mastro's provided us an excellent meal with outstanding service. The steaks could have been cooked a little longer but with that being about the only flaw the 5 stars are well deserved.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The famous butter cake. Ohhhh soooooo good!
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 22 Oz bone in ribeye. A little fatty but still excellent
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dungeness crab cocktail

lHEVMBuSyr3v-2rEla2Mtw.text: First off let'a start out with the fact that we sat in the tree house!!!!! Great atmosphere and impeccable service not a second went by that our table was not being tended to refreshed or checked on to make sure everything was to our standards. From the Siberian caviar, west coast, and east coat oysters to the lobster and plentiful sides. Each bite was flavorful and delectable. The mouth watering lobster hardly needed anything added not even melted butter due to it melting already on your mouth from tenderness. The creamed spinach was packed full of flavor all the way down to the shuttle hint of garlic and don't forget the creamed corn. And you can't end your night without having the butter cake. Let's just say I died and went to heaven with each bite. Mouth watering melting you mouth warm butter cake topped with vanilla iced cream and fresh berries!! Need I even say more. Hands down fully impressed and satisfied.

u-a0Aq1rCntYWjXrdpnKCA.text: Do yourself a favor and dine here. I've dined here a total of 3 times and have been wow'd each time. Aaron, is literally an angel in disguise. He will make sure you are taken care of. The food is always amazing and the atmosphere is great! One of my favorite dining spots on the Las Vegas Strip.

oWGCYk_NjcFH8IQDJLxoJQ.text: I came here for my Birthday. The food was very impressive and so damn good!!! The pretzel bread they serve is the best!! Our Appetizers were crab cakes and ahi tostadas(these were just okay I've had better :/) I ordered the Sea bass lots of flavor juicy on the inside and a great crunchy crust on the out. My BF had the Lobster, juicy and buttery. Sides were mashed potatoes and green beans all yummy!! And they brought me out a birthday cake that I inhaled!!!  You definitely get what you pay for..

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy birthday to me :D

YB7DGlxI9Xtg2u-a2cSpNw.text: I love Mastro's! I have been to the one in Cali, Vegas, AZ, and IL. All are them are the same, exceptional service with exceptional food.  My husband and I have had dinner in the middle of the treetop last year at this location, this year we just stopped in for a little snack.  We had the shrimp cocktail at the bar and it was outstanding. I loved their Moscow mule and my husband was very happy with his vodka martini chilled with caper berries. When we sat in the treetop, we had an amazing dining experience as well.   You can't go wrong with seafood or steak when dining at a Mastro's. They are always worth a quick stop if you are looking to spoil yourself with the best.

O_YE4mHBUJpuadKwxhqr5w.text: Don't be thrown off that it's located inside a high end mall, Crystal Shops. Fantastic all around. Food. Service. Atmosphere. Worth the $$$$. We will definitely be back the next time we are in Vegas.

0-eJSKrx5HRLPMu5wLXNZw.text: My wife and I went to Mastro's for our 30th wedding anniversary.  The service and food were excellent.  We went to see a show after dinner and let them know we would be back for dessert later.  They setup another reservation and gave us an excellent dessert on the house.  My steak was cooked perfectly.  My wife's swordfish was really good.  I can't say enough about the service.  The place isn't cheap but you know that already.

8SPxRTjEYLMIo8TXv86TEA.text: We have been going to this Mastros location for the last 4 years and never had any complaints, it has always been our favorite steakhouse. Now, we went for my boyfriends birthday last night with 8 of our friends and we did not experience the same taste that we were used to. Our server, i wish i remembered his name, was very nice. The dreamberry cocktail was outstanding. Most of us ordered steak of course which usually comes out pipping hot but this time it was luke warm at most. Although we did not voice our complaint none of us were happy with our steaks. The sides were good, creamed spinach and macaroni and cheese. I'm saddened to say I dont think we will be coming back any time soon. I believe we will continue with Stripsteak at the Mandalay Bay which is Excellent.

u8TCdw0v8MiG6Tii6nUDXw.text: WOW. Best meal of my life.    For being located in a mall this place very nice.  We had a very good bottle of red wine that paired well with the bone-in ribeye and lamb of rack.  Speaking of the ribeye was humongous and melted like butter.  The rack of lamb is actually 2 racks which the waiter kindly had the chef slice for me so I didn't have to feel like I was performing surgery in the middle of my date. This had to be the best lamb I've ever had.  The food was soo good that we made a special trip back to the aria before seeing Ka at the MGM.  (PS my feet paid the price)

Dh9DF12T81drbG-KhwWyOw.text: Coming to Vegas? You have to try this place, from great mixed drinks, entree's you will not forget, to butter cake for dessert...you will not be disappointed!

8G--lRqze1OntfURRDrl0w.text: Omg. Warm butter cake = better than most anything I can think of, yes including THAT thing! One serving feeds 3-4 easily. The steak was perfect as was the salmon. The twice baked potato was very good. Service like no other. Even an oops was handled with grace and gentle self-deprecating humor that made it charming instead of annoying. I had heard "it's in the middle of a mall" which is technically True, but I found the atmosphere lovely and private, so I would disagree with that criticism. Worth every penny of the splurge.

Y4Uluf-TgyIzaI3YCICl0g.text: Yay - I've always wanted to eat in the Tree restaurant inside City Center! :D  Unfortunately, we were not actually seated inside the tree, but tis okay! Our group of 5 (3 other girls were too drunk to make it, but anyhows), was seated near the door. Hint - if you are seated along the wall, make sure you sit in the booth with the white plush walls. Awesome to lean your head against!  Our waitstaff was superb, although I was a bit sad when they didn't offer any comp things for our meals taking so long! Womp. Also, our table was super dim, we could barely see each other.  As a party of 5 girls (and our first and only meal of the day), we had:  * Seafood tower w/ oysters, claws, jumbo shrimp, crab. Uhhmaaayyyzing. Get this. Pick whatever you want. I'd go without the oysters as they clocked in about $5/each and were not mind blowing. DEFINITELY get the jumbo shrimp - they were huge and already peeled! There are few things better than that in the world.  * Alaskan king crab black truffle gnocci. UMMMM I am OBSESSED w. this dish. So buttery, so creamy, so YUMMY! I could not stop gobbling this ish up.   * Lobster Mashed Potatoes - nomnomnom! Had huge chunks of fresh luscious lobster nestled within the creamy mashed potatoes. Fan!   * The special 32oz kobe steak, cooked medium rare. This was perfection. $98 worth of absolute perfection. The steak was a perfect pink and melted in my mouth. The leftovers even tasted amazing.   * Chilean Sea Bass, blackened per our waiter's recco. Unfortunately, I didn't love this dish....so i don't really have much to say about it. I think it had more to do with the way it was prepared (I generally don't have my fish blackened) than the fish itself - but not impressed.  Two girls split a bottle of red vino for just $33 - surprisingly priced at such a nice resto.  At the end, our bill came out to just about $100 pp. Pricey - definitely, but I think it's worth it! Make sure to request a tree house table!  Oh - at the end of the meal, our waiter gave us to-go sippy cups for the rest of our vino! He also jokingly asked if my drunkie friend would also like a cup of agua to go ;) puuahaha

Sckvwz-t7-oMXh_JNzxg_Q.text: My husband brought me here for an early valentine's dinner.  Reservations were at 7:30 pm and we were seated immediately. We were seated in the half booth half tables that are right next to the bar. You know, the ones that are right on top of each other. I was annoyed, because I would think they would save these seats for walk-ins. I was determined to not let that upset me and I'm so happy I didn't. Our waiter was awesome as was our food. They bring this beautiful bread basket with a variety of wonderful fresh bread, served with butter of course.  We started with the colossal Dungeness crab which came out with dry ice so it was smoking. It was pretty neat. The crab was very fresh.  I drank water, but my ordered a double shot crown and coke. There was so much crown when the waiter brought the drink that he couldn't put but a splash of coke in it (sodas come in little aluminum bottles). I ordered the Chilean Sea Bass and my husband ordered the 12oz filet. We shared the garlic mashed potatoes and mushrooms. My sea bass was cooked to perfection and it was huge, I couldn't even finish it.  My husband's filet was cooked perfectly and had a lot of flavor.  The mashed potatoes had a soft garlic flavor. They were my husband's favorite. The mushrooms were sauteed with rosemary. I've never had mushrooms with rosemary. It was a new flavor for me and I liked it. Our waiter brought us the butter cake for dessert complimentary for dining with them. This was my favorite. It came with a ginormous side of homemade whipped cream. It was the greatest, most delicious thing I've had. I've been dreaming about it ever since! I love this restaurant and have told all my friends and family about it. Definitely going back!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Butter cake with homemade whipped
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilean Sea Bass with mushrooms and garlic mash

nyIbmu-TxO3BK3UUM-7LAA.text: After living in Vegas for about a year, this is easily the most disappointing high end meal I've had.  I'd give the food a 4/5 but the service was probably a 1/5.  Service The first disappointment was waiting.  We had a reservation and even so I can understand waiting by the bar for a few minutes.  However, we wanted far more than a few minutes.  Our "leader" went up to the front to inquire and they said on someone will be by shortly to seat you.  That didn't happen so we had to check back again and someone gave us the apology of "oh, I'm sorry I thought they came and got you."  Maybe a miscommunication, but certainly something that could be excused.  However, things didn't get better from there.  It seems like about 10 minutes from when we seated until we even got drink menus, then another 10-15 before the drinks arrive.  Easily 15 minutes before bread arrived at the table.  It just felt like everything was so slow.  After the first round of drinks came our waitress or waitresses seemingly disappeared.  I mean when you have a table of 10 people ordering rounds of $15 cocktails or better you'd figure service would be fast.  I think they easily missed out on  at least 1 extra round due to the slow service.  If you look at the prices at Mastro's and compare it to other places across town, you would expect to have a waiter or waitress that knows the menu back and forth and can describe all of the stars.  We got none of that.  I would say our service was at the level of an average chain restaurant.  You aren't adding any value when you ask about menu items and the waitress just lists 3 things that are "good".  We asked how the steaks come and the reply was something like "what do you mean"?  I mean are they seasoned, sauced, dry aged?  There is no explanation on the menu or listing of sauces or accompaniments for the steaks...."oh yeah, they are seasoned and broiled"....thanks.  This was followed up with no description or explanation of any sides.  During the meal we couldn't even locate the waitresses and people were still anxious to get more drinks.  I will say that the food was good.  The steak was unique in the regard it was so warm when it came out.  Usually food has somewhat cooled but their steak still had a sizzle and was warm for the first few bites, pretty good.  The asparagus was nothing special.  The lobster mashed potatoes were good but at $40 can be steep for a side dish.  Crab gnocchi was good, but I'm not crazy about gnocchi so I'm not an expert.  The problem in Vegas is that you can find a place equal to Mastro's food wise with probably lower prices so suffering through bad service can be a deal breaker.  Needless to say, nobody ordered dessert or drinks after dinner.  With so many other options in town for steak I probably wouldn't come back for that.  I will say I tried the ahi tuna sashimi which seemed great for under $40.  I didn't try it but the swordfish looked the same.  I would come back if I was in the mood for seafood but would be nervous about the service, maybe with a smaller party and a better table things would be better.

36HUr1s6BTOUcmpxEgq5MQ.text: This restaurant needs 10 stars in service, ambiance and of course the food. This was my favorite dinner while in LV,  and Trista our waitress made the night even better! We had the hamachi with truffles, the bone marrow. For dinner we had the Chilean sea bass blackened. Now, the Item of the night for me was the lobster mashed potatoes!!! I would have a bowl of that daily if I could! The dessert was a representation of the perfect creme brulee, seriously delicious! Overall, it was our best dinner in Vegas!
