Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blackened sea bass, lobster mashed potatoes and sautéed asparagus
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The hamachi with truffles and crispy onions!

rWMSKICPwflTBhP2_rkjEw.text: A-maze-ing!! Everything was wonderful - even my slightly undercooked steak (which they very quickly rectified for me). Heard about the great seafood - so tried it for appetizer (husband) also had for dinner but I was looking for a steak. The food was great - service was wonderful and I know have to wait way too long for my next serving of their warm butter cake!    Thanks for wonderful evening.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab appetizer
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Suggested drink - very yummy lemon something
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Warm butter cake - whooped cream and. Nice drink - need I say more

dz35rA4at5GxZJcOBJ9xvg.text: Despite my earlier dissatisfaction, we returned in early February.  Okay, the chef's a ******, but since we've always had excellent service and food, why not? This time, bad service.  Something triggered my wife's food allergies (one reason we'd been frequent diners here was that it had always been "safe".)  As soon as she began to feel ill, I called to our server, explained the problem and asked for the check so we could get her to the room and get her a shot of her medication.  TWENTY MINUTES LATER he comes sauntering over and casually drops it off as if he hadn't a care in the world.  He didn't. My wife did.  I tipped shallow, and now regret having tipped at all.  Lots of other choices in Vegas...

DBl7UV807s3DMCKPpg5b9g.text: This past weekend was my second time at Mastro's and this time I was in charge of planning for 16 hungry guys in a bachelor party.  The original number we 12, and I called 3 days before and had no problems getting a table.  By Saturday night, the number had ballooned to 16.  I was nervous about calling to change the reservation, but Mastro's called first and offered a private room which made it even easier to up the number to 16.  Many thanks to the Hostesses at Mastro's for being so easy to work with.  The service is here is friendly and confident, they know what they are doing.  The food continues to carry that confident theme.  Big, bold, and flavorful, the steaks here are serious...no sides to cover them up.  They are served to you "naked" with nothing else on the plate.  Sides can be ordered for the table and the sides pretty much all delicious.  Back to the steaks...Charred and flavorful on the outside, juicy and savory on the inside.  My mouth waters just thinking about it.

WC8tb4bz4BQZx8A6ntI-qQ.text: Was really underwhelmed with the cocktails, food and service. Steak was over cooked, we had to send some of the sides back. Things came out staggered and not together so by the time the sides came out the steak had been sitting on the table for 5 minutes or more. Manager removed the bad sides from the bill, but didn't seem to care about the horrible service when we spoke with him. No apology or anything... Was really disappointed

G-Ol7mY6CrjX0JGD6yiSdA.text: As always, Mastro's does not disappoint! Their food tasted just as I remembered it, AMAZING. The service we received was great! I love how attentive they are with everything!   We got the Chef's special - Ribeye with Maine Lobster and let me tell you, the food was so delicious.  They also comped their famous Butter Cake since it was our Anniversary.   Being that we've dined at their Beverly Hills location, this place seemed a bit more casual and less romantic since it's inside a mall.

F-lzBL0neZ4-JpXm1WXrKg.text: Cannot say enough great things.  From the 400 degree plate that keeps your steak warm for the entire meal...to the impeccable service staff...A+ all around.  Seafood tower was divine.  Worth the splurge.

e7vjTgFhHR0vZo5w2NNy5g.text: Party of 8 on a Tuesday night. Interesting set up - there is a part of the restaurant that looks like a large wooden hornet's nest.  Not sure what that's all about.    Service was impeccable from the hostess to the main server to his assistants.  Everything was prompt, polite and timed well.  We were not rushed out even though we were one of the last parties to leave.   Food: I ordered the Gorgonzola Mac and Cheese $12 and the Rack of Lamb $48.  The mac and cheese was a little disappointing - very little flavor and it was dry,  very dry.  I had read that this was a great side dish so I was sad when it wasn't very palatable.  The portion is huge - consider sharing it if you do.  It easily fed our entire table.  I asked for the Rack of Lamb medium rare and it came out closer to medium.  Regardless, the flavor was very smooth, not gamey.  The outside was a little too charred, but the rest of it was quite good.  It came with mint jelly, which was very tasty.  We also had a Heirloom Tomato and Burrata salad $12 which was a very generous portion - the tomatoes were sweet and juicy.  The table got the Seafood Tower (have no idea how much that was but it was worth it).  This was friggin amazing.  Honestly.  There were Kumamoto oysters, fresh dungeness crab, snow crab legs, humongous shrimp, great big lobster claws.  All fresh and tender meat.  It didn't require sauce.  None of it was briny or sandy.  So delicious and whatever we paid, I don't care.  It was unbelievable. Other people in our party got the Arctic Char "oreganato" style, bone-in filet, seared scallops and halibut.  Every dish was served with mushrooms, asparagus, green beans and creamed corn (this had to have crack in it b/c creamed corn never tasted so good.)  NO ONE had a single complaint and EVERYONE finished what they ordered.  By this time, we're all about to pass out from food coma, but we insisted on the BUTTER CAKE.  If you come here, no matter what you order, you MUST save room for this signature dessert.  I can't even describe it but it is amazing.  It comes out warm, w/ freshly made whipped cream and vanilla ice cream.   MUST.  MUST.  MUST have.    Overall, great experience.  Cost us a total of $1400 for 7 people.  You do the math.

P727u80QHBR9kjeOuAQiIA.text: BEST FOOD ON THE STRIP! Holy crap. This is one of the best meals I've ever eaten in my life! Portions are big but two of us shared 2 entrees and 3 small sides because we couldn't decide what to get! Mac n cheese, mashed potatoes and the crab gnocchi. All of them were so amazing and unlike anything I've ever eaten! And don't forget to save room for the butter cake!!

HI07xHrjaaH3nodA9Ymduw.text: We called for reservations a few hours prior to our requested time & were delightfully accommodated. There were 4 of us & we ordered the following to sharekids:  Appetizer:  Seafood tower (amazing) Escargot (I can't comment because I don't eat it, but the others agreed that it went well with the puff pastry it was served with)  Main Courses: Tomahawk Wagyu Steak, Scallops & Lobster (all very delicious)  We were so stuffed, we couldn't even look at the dessert menu.   Service: could've been better. Our waiter seemed to be occupied with a larger party & when he would walk by our table, I noticed he didn't look our way to check on whether or not we needed anything. We nearly had to flag him down every time as he passed us quickly. Large table, small table, which ever it may be...needs equal amount if attention. Especially if you don't want your tip to start decreasing.   The minus 1 star is for their lack of service & their water selection (still or sparkling). Some are OK with tap & it wasn't at least offered.

a6EpH46j7mg9E18GBkCh6Q.text: It was my first time at a Mastro's establishment. However, I have been to other upscale steakhouses (Larsen's, Ruth Chris, Morton's..)   The restaurant is beautiful, we dined at the tree house and it was a great experience. It's located in the center of shopping center connected to the Aria.   The service was impeccable, the waited was very attentive. The waiter was constantly checking up and cleaning the area. All the employes around the restaurant are on their toes, checking everything is running smoothly.   The food did take a whole to be brought  out. My steak was cooked fine, but my friends was left too rare. We had the lobster mash, sauteed spinach, and the green beans. Overall, I wasn't blown away with the food. Maybe my expectations were set really high because I've heard so much hype around the restaurant.   My favorite food item was the tuna tartar we got as an appetizer, I really recommend it.   I would say come here for the experience, I wasn't blown away from the food.

AuylcgPD33AmT_-XiC29rQ.text: Fun to sit in a tree house and have amazing food, drinks and great service.  A little to much food so make sure you pace yourself and their cocktails are pretty great.

z6mBqIt3N7aD9-vD7-atDw.text: we came here for my fiances birthday bc he loves the mastros back at home in Beverly Hills. I'll have to say it's not comparable. the service was excellent. as always. however their steaks we're just not up to par. I ordered the filet mignon, medium, and it came out well done. I wanted to say something to our waiter but I didn't want to ruin the vibe celebrating my fiances birthday. everyone else in my party thought their steaks were just okay as well. they had the bone in rib eye.   we also ordered the cream of corn and fries. the cream of corn just... didn't taste good so I don't recommend getting that. the fries were typical and not so bad.  I don't think I'll be coming here anymore when I come to Vegas. I'll just stick to buffets.

eX82wC7ndCF2kHQOIAaOZQ.text: The boyfriend decided to make a dinner reservation here for my birthday. He had to keep adding people to our reservation but they were accommodating and allowed our changes.  The place is located in the middle of Crystals, the shopping center at City Center. We arrived on time for our reservation but they did not have our table ready so we grabbed some drinks at the bar. There was live piano playing and singing so it was a pleasant wait.  Dinner was good and the service was good.  I got the bone-in rib-eye and it was good. It was tender, juicy and flavorful.  Sides: Creamed Corn Creamed Spinach Garlic Mashed Potatoes Sauteed Mushrooms  All the sides were delicious. It's family style so the servers will initially go around and ask if you want a serving and will serve you.  It was an amazing birthday dinner and I would come back here if I ever get the chance.

E6gi-dFERrABdlZwD1T0NA.text: This review is for drinks only. Expresso martini and bananas fosters was amazing. You get one drink in your glass and the shaker with one more drink inside. Simply fabulous. Waitress and bartender were very nice and welcoming. I will be back next time.

NMqjGOUw49Ewsy5NDXeMMw.text: Another great dinner there last night.  Filet great as usual.  My wife had the Tuna which was delicious.  Maybe our favorite place in town.

0VGzluRDYBV-nkFYvjIefQ.text: I usually go to the one in beverly hills food was just as good but the restaurant itself was in a mall and didn't feel as elegant. Service and food was great.

lDlGfj3tYrXMzpD9lFqotA.text: Mastros is my favorite fine dining restaurant in Las Vegas!!!! There ribeye steak is grilled to perfection and is so tender and juicy and the lobster mash is a must as well! I've been celebrating my birthday here for the last couple of years now but this year I was a little disappointed because they didnt serve the warm butter cake as my birthday desert

wHv-4CVYfHSlwf82ejWPDA.text: This was just an amazing meal.  Wish we could have been seated in the large wood sculpture portion, but a great meal none the less.    Thanks!  Oh and thanks for the call the next day.  That was a 4 star to 5 star conversion

DInbUwZEOAXCgHJCJFNtSw.text: So I am a huge fan of Mastro's and frequent their Costa Mesa and Newport locations. I gotta say that this was pretty close to the CA locations, minus a few minor details. From the pretzel bread to the seafood tower appetizer, I was pleasantly reminded of home sweet home (OC). The atomic horseradish is the perfect paring with your chilled seafood, and that is the perfect way to kick off you meal at Mastro's. I ordered my usual bone-in ribeye and sides of lobster mashed potatoes, creamed corn, grilled asparagus and creamed spinach - all were pretty good. The finale AKA warm butter cake, is where they finally dropped the ball. They brought it out and it was cold. Now this is a dessert that you absolutely must eat piping hot, and considering I had just ordered a dinner for 9 people and 2 bottle of Caymus, was not too thrilled at the anticlimactic ending to my meal. The service was great and I would definitely eat here again. Maybe was just a minor miss on the dessert? Anyways, Mastro's remains my favorite steakhouse and I will definitely give it another shot next time I am in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Warm butter cake that came out cold. Usually a hit, it was a minor miss for the evening.
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caymus. Best wine ever.
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood tower. You get to pick how you want it created.

dKZTMY-my1sn8DG11aweZA.text: Let's begin with, this location is in the middle of a mall.. which alot of other reviewers have brought up i know - but it's the main reason for 4 stars instead of 5. It does get a bit loud and the view is of a shopping mall.. a high-end shopping mall, but still. Not my ideal view for a such an awesome spot. It is what it is though!  The room itself is very nice, lots of seating, lively atmosphere, great looking staff. I have been a couple of times now and the service is always great when I have gone and the food spectacular.   I have ben to Ocean Club a couple of times, but this most recent visit was a dinner of 'Dungeoness Crab Cocktail', 'Ribeye' and '10 oz Ahi Sashimi' . We shared everything with a side of sauteed spinach .. and a few martinis. :) I loved was the personal style serving from the individual pans that the food items were seemingly prepared in. The service staff has always been very pleasant and makes the experience very comfortable.   The Ahi was fantastic with a really beautiful presentation laid out on a long plate with a finish of a really tasty sauce. The ribeye was prepared expertly, perfect medium rare with still  a beautiful grill flavor. The spinach was .. spinach, sauteed.. but was excellent nonetheless! haha.. I was having such a great time and enjoying the vibe of the place overall.   There was a piano player in the corner of the room playing standards and old-school vegas tunes.. Sinatra and the like. It gave a beautiful feel to an elegant style dinner. My friends and I aren't the most refined diners, but we know how to have a good time, and Maestro's made us feel welcome within that setting.  Now don't get me wrong... this ain't your downtown steakhouse with a $4.99 steak special.. you WILL drop a pretty penny to have some seriously tasty grub.. but I do believe it's worth it.  At over $150 a head when we dined there last, it was worth the money but definitely be ready for a big bill. It's nearly unavoidable.   Have a great time, and happy eating!

g-QkPE1th0qWGgKqn0MK_w.text: Awsome!!!! Food is excellent! I had bone marrow, steak and lobster mash potatoes. If there are two of you just get one side the portions are large. A must is the butter cake. Don't even think about any other desert get the butter cake and a cup of coffee you will need it. You will need to walk around because the meal is so good and rich. Great place and great staff.

ptsZYpDap3Jhro-74U92-A.text: I've been a huge fan of the Ocean Club since it opened, and I always make an effort to dine here when I'm on the Strip.   Top notch in every way: service, decor, ambiance, wine list, and happily- the FOOD!   Highly recommended

vNCZPelRNvGWKHBYdK-fDA.text: Very nice steak and seafood restaurant with impeccable service. Our waitress Sam was wonderful and did a great job selecting a wine for us.  I had a bone-in ribeye and my wife had  a baked sole dish. We shared lobster mashed potatoes, (awesome) and green beans (meh) with the couple with us and it was plenty for all of us.   Had one of the best desserts I have ever had, butter cake... freaking awesome. Yellow cake based with butter and cream cheese and god knows what else. I promise it is better than it sounds. Comes with a big scoop of ice cream and fruit. Way more than one person could (or certainly SHOULD) eat, so share!  Great upscale dining experience in a beautiful, unique architectural setting.

ww2M_oBwUwJnXpuLF5vovA.text: After trying many of the best steals in Vegas, I have found the very best!  Service was excellent.  Steak was awesome and the desert was also great.  Generous drinks pours also helped.  Easiest 5 start review ever!

RyrlkzWBzx_zZhZYs8JjAw.text: Nice ambiance but the rib eye was overly seasoned. The brussel sprouts where not oven roasted but burnt. The lobster bisque was excellent but the mac n cheese was dry and not saucy. The only good thing was the two bottles of wine we drank.

QfUbXRaFswWUzM07rTCboA.text: Always the best! Great service, perfectly prepared food and the best butter cake on the planet!

GbCSnIDTD3tmE1mdj8FZLA.text: What is not to like about this fine dining establishment located in Crystals found at the heart of the City Center.  Supurb steaks...... Lobster mashed potatoes........ Super sushi rolls... Excellent seafod..... An extensive wine list  Buttercake with real whipped cream for dessert ...... oh yeahhhhhh  The location is very unique, in that you can sit out on a terrace in an art deco treehouse and under some beautiful chandeliers. The service is very good, the wait staff is very knowledgeable and friendly. We had an enjoyable evening topped off by a table visit from Lucianna, the manager.  We were recommended to enjoy "Earthquake" an excellent Cabernet Sauvignon from the Lodi vineyards, California. I would pass that recommendation on to you - if you are enjoying the fine steaks.......  It is an absolutely supurb wine selection.  At first I was sceptical of the Lobster mashed potatoes, but the  dish is a real treat....  and the portion is so huge that it can be shared by all at the table. A totally unique sidedish... containing an amazing amount of lobster   Don't miss dining here.... I think this is one of the finest dining experiences you can enjoy while in Las Vegas.  I can not wait to return.

5JjmRwvViNQw5Z7wZjUKVQ.text: First of all the calamari was as good as the stuff we get in Mexico and the butter cake was amazing. BUT, the ambiance wasn't that great. Too much crammed into one space in the middle of, what feels like, a mall. I wouldn't pay the prices again for the food quality. It was good and had good flavor and service was good. But it was not anything amazing. We had the crab legs, the KC ribeye, creamed spinach, and scalloped potatoes. It was good food, like I said, but I would never pay the high prices for it again.

LLPTlCx918Jm7x6xDgCoCA.text: The bad - made reservations at 9, didn't get seated until 10, paying $15 for a drink, it better be a damn good drink. Far from it. We are in Vegas there are plenty of options at here, so for not being in a club, i didn't want to pay $15 for a bad drink  I split the special - waygu steak bone in, it was a huge piece of meat, but for a $100 i truly didn't see why this was such an expensive piece of meat   The good - the manger did come over due to us waiting an hour before we got seated and she brought over some Beef Carpaccio which was some of the best i have ever had.  The Ok - Lobster Mashed Potatoes, sounded better then they tasted.  I wouldn't recommend this place and i will not be coming back.

akLDh1fU63T7LpcxbBklZQ.text: We celebrated our anniversary here and hands down from the time we arrived until we left everything was phenomenal the server Jonathan is very knowledgeable he told us about the menu items in detail and his suggestions were great we enjoyed every minute of our time the dessert was the bomb must have the butter cake with  vanilla ice cream!

wUeLIAamO3BHFRqgnbhNsA.text: Outstanding! Probably the best seafood restaurant I have ever visited.

JRGG-L1_HLZvSDUAwMOKAA.text: What a disappointment!! Started with the escargot they came out dry and burnt.  ordered the New York steak, the ribeye, the Gorgonzola Mac & cheese and the sauteed mushrooms the steaks were comparable to Ruth Chris. The side dishes were bland the Gorgonzola Mac and cheese had no Gorgonzola it tasted like something that came out of a box! The mushrooms had no flavor I don't get the hype.

47LVjDbjhnWr6YsTftAAnQ.text: Wow! Great food great atmosphere and amazing service. Everything was prepared perfectly and was piping hot. The Chilean Sea bass was light and buttery while the twice baked potato was so savory my mouth is still watering two days later. Wine list was sophisticated and the lobster roll is a must get. Would recommend for anyone who has $100 a person to spend on dinner.

1xH4_7oXpwptjiGr13ma_Q.text: Visited this superb restaurant on Sunday.  Hostess & Wait staff were terrific.  The menu is a little bit overwhelming, but my friend highly recommended the bone in Filet.  SO I think more than half or our party of 10 did just that.  Also, the sides are served family style.  We had several different sides & all were delicious.  Just to let you know about the service.  I ordered the bone in filet medium and when I received it, it was bordering on well done.  When the waiter came back to the table (within a couple of minutes), he noticed that I was not eating and asked if there was a problem. I informed him that the filet was overcooked for my taste and he immediately picked it up and said he would bring out a 18 ounce (I had a 12 oz).  I told him that he did not need to do that, but he insisted.    It did not take long for me to get my filet brought back out and this time it was perfect.  He apologized again.  I didn't think I could eat all of it, but after the first taste, I realized that I was not going to let this go to waste.    If you go here, I would for sure get a reservation.  Also, be prepared to spend about $60 - $80 per person.    Side note, one of our friends in the group had a birthday, and he was treated with this delicious chocolate moist cake.  I mean it was terrific.  It came with a big bowl of whipped fresh cream.    If you are in Vegas, you need to try this place out.  I have eaten many steaks in Vegas, but this one has been the only one that has satisfied me.    Dress code is business casual, but I am sure if you wanted to walk in with shorts and a t-shirt they will take your money.

OVDZpwNZG0-Fpu_eDBt2qw.text: Thanks to a coworker's recommendation and fellow Yelpers, we had a wonderful Christmas dinner here. We requested the Tree House area and it's where you want to sit. We had a drink at the bar while waiting to be seated and Randy served up an awesome Lemon Drop martini for me and a Key Lime Pie martini for my wife. We had the grilled salmon and ahi tuna sashimi, so good. And as many before me have said here, the signature butter cake dessert is phenomenal. Finally, a comment about service. Kudos to the entire staff and management are due. We walked up to the hostesses and we were welcomed by big smiles. Then off to the table, from the bar, and the hostess carried the drinks for us. Robert, our waiter, and a host of other men with bread and water and what ever we needed made this one special dinner experience. Thank you and see you again soon.

DjJOvnILYWiZk-LyzekI8w.text: Mastro's in OC is one of my most favorite steak places ever. The Vegas one was good but I prefer the ambiance at the OC one more. The steaks were cooked well as I expected from Mastros. Lobster mashed potatoes...always yummy! Great martinis and great service here.

HgJy5y8_GPIi8lgW3wRGAw.text: I'm a fan of the Mastro's steakhouse in Costa Mesa, but this was my first visit to an Ocean Club location.  My expectations where pretty high, although I must admit I was not particularly thrilled with the location deep inside Crystals.  However, from start to finish, this was really a first-rate experience.  Service and food were top-notch.  I even had a follow-up call from the GM the next morning to make sure everything was to our satisfaction (which it most certainly was).  I was particularly impressed when, after ordering a bottle of wine which they initially indicated was out-of-stock, the sommelier was able to hunt a bottle down for us. It was this type of service and their overall attention to detail that really impressed me.    Normally, I stay at Wynncore, so if I had not been staying at Aria on this particular trip, I am not sure I would have made the trip up here.  Now that I've experience the Ocean Club first-hand, I won't hesitate to book a return visit.

HeTG1ebAJt25C_ZSDNBb0w.text: Actually, this place isn't bad if you're into terrible service and over priced steaks, or should I say, SALT with meat. This location is a horrible disappointment compared to the Mateo's steak house in Chicago. Seriously folks, there are way better steaks at so many other restaurants.

SNUNYVqISRjeHOyWZgUqFQ.text: First time at Mastro's and loved it!  One appetizer, One bottle of Wine, Two Steaks, Two Sides, Dessert, and Tip =  $300.   We got the most expensive appetizer and one side was the most expensive, so you can make your adjustments. But look to spend $250 for two people.   Loved our waiter and they treated us very well.

ciVgOymgsa-M18uX7E7VzQ.text: Outstanding service, quality of food with only one drawback.  It was very noisy the night that we were there and was told a holiday party was going on close to restaurant.

bSozxYbrOMb_L1lfY5rUew.text: Mastro's Ocean Club is one of the high end dining places that has opened up in the last year or so at Crystals which is part of City Place.  Technically speaking Mastro's is a chain, though it doesn't carry the chain vibe.  The locations of the handful of Mastro's that exist live in high end cities like Scottsdale, AZ, Beverly Hills, CA and Chicago, IL.  This location in Las Vegas was tagged with the words "Ocean Club" to show off the fact that not only do they have steak but a large selection of seafood too.  Steak is what Mastro's have built themselves up as and if you are thinking about dining here I would suggest the steak.  They are famous for firing their meats in an oven that burns hotter than 1100 degrees F.  I ordered the bone in ribeye that I split with my friend.  We did the usual recommendation of medium rare and in my opinion it came out perfect, though it was too bloody for her and she sent hers back to be cooked more.    Of course Mastro's is a la carte and buyer beware the sides are HUGE.  One side order can be spit by 3 people.  We ordered the grilled brussel sprouts and they brought them out piping hot still in the skillet and put the skillet on the table.    Wine selection is wonderful.  Though the food is pricey the wine prices are affordable with decent bottles for only $27 though they go way up in price.  Dessert was a chef's creation at this Mastro's in Vegas (executive chef Wayne Schumaker) which is the signature warm butter cake.  This is a large piece of butter cake that has a sugar crust that is baked hot along with a scoop of vanilla ice cream and a pile of homemade whipped cream.  OMG ridiculous good but again could be shared with like, 5 people.    The only major downside to Mastro's is the music.  They have a live piano bar that you think would play soft, classy music like jazz or piano but instead you get very loud, karaoke type performances by an older man and woman (ages 60+) who use an iPad connected to the piano to sing modern and past day pop music such as Pink, Katy Perry, and even Foster the People's "Pumped Up Kicks".  If Mastro's would lose the cheesy, loud, awful music they would go to 5 stars.    Bring headphones and enjoy a nice dinner.

XOIgt2Gb_z2bEwL6jg1Zjw.text: Thank you so much for an unbelievable dinner. This place really stands out in terms of food service. You guys rock thank you!   Had dinner at del friscos the night before and it sucked.

1GXTC1splX52QPGASZf_Hg.text: Everyone there made me feel welcome and part of the family. None of the smiles were fake which is important. Mario Lopez was the ultimate in gracious and professional services! The filet was cooked to flawless perfection, and now no other steak will make the cut. Thank you all for the complimentary butter cake! You made our honeymoon an incredible treat!

4m8WN9GrIZ9f8WoVX2ZwWw.text: My friend wanted to have a steak and we decided to try Mastro. This was one of the best steaks I've ever had. Their fried calamari had a perfect touch of spices and was amazing. You do not even need a dip for it.

TFT_XLPU6KB3Gjc9TaJNjQ.text: Was brought here on my birthday and I was blown away. From decor, to food, to service... Everything was top notch. I had the blackened salmon, which was perfect. All my guests also enjoyed their meals, and we had a great time. Will definately be back.

E3JYLGXX4TabTo4twgOPuw.text: I went for dinner in 2/15 for anniversary.  Wow this has been the best dinner I have ever had.  Expensive yes.  It's a lot even for Vegas.   It's worth it though for special occasions.  My wife (the boss) still talks about are dinner.

ngjM6cHQn2P7zycwSE-U4A.text: This place is amazing!! It offers a wonderful dining atmosphere and the service was professional and polite. I ordered the lobster mashed potatoes, sauteed asparagus, raw oysters, and sea bass, and will definitely be returning.

sa5neio_HZ3yM1RheZ37TA.text: Well we kept hearing about the lobster mash  potatoes so we had to see for ourselves and it was amaze balls the steak was pretty good not as good as Ruth's Chris but good but the dessert was really good the whip creme I could eat all day

KW7e8CRSjY4i0DXowfNzYg.text: Just had dinner at Mastro's Ocean Club. We're not near the ocean in Las Vegas, but there are Mastro's on the water in SoCal. Had the bone in ribeye, absolutely mouth watering. Had Lobster Mashed Potatoes, which was a meal to itself. Giant sauteed mushrooms and I was in heaven. Outstanding service to boot. Great experience. It's not cheap, but it is a top of the line Strip restaurant.

8J4VGm4M4gGhx4nqyvK7bw.text: We had dinner one night at Mastro's, and what a great choice!  I can honestly say everyone on staff made our dining experience a complete delight.  For dinner I got the chopped salad, gulf red snapper, and the twice baked potato.  In addition, our server also brought some warm, fresh bread out to the table.  Everything was SO GOOD.  Truly, the fish was so fresh I would not be surprised if it had been caught that very same day.  The seasoning on all the food was perfect, and I didn't have to add salt, pepper or anything.  Truly tantalizing.  The portions were also large.  The potato was definitely big enough to split with at least one other person.  To top off my experience, someone from the restaurant actually called me the next day to ask how our experience was!  That was a first for me, and I was majorly impressed.  The next time I go back to Vegas, we will definitely be stopping in at Mastro's again.

BtqOdTz4TZUTJh7ecFrlWw.text: Everything here was spectacular from beginning to end. I went here for dinner on a Friday evening. The restaurant itself is located inside of Crystals in an open area of the shopping center. Despite the open area, the atmosphere was still very nice and the live music really added to it.  My Experience: Starters -The bread was pretty good -The Shrimp Cocktail was delicious and the horseradish was spicy!  Main Course & Sides -I ordered the Filet, and having dined at another steakhouse earlier in the week, I must say, the filet here was incredible. This was probably one of the best filets I have ever had! -The sides were just as amazing. We had the mac and cheese, green beans with almonds, mashed potatoes, and creamed corn. I would recommend all of them as there wasn't one I did not like.  Dessert -I'm not a huge sweets guy, but I was told that I HAD to try the Butter Cake even though we were already stuffed. It definitely lived up to the hype as a MUST TRY dessert!  Overall, I had a great dining experience here. Our waiter was awesome and we never felt rushed. I would HIGHLY recommend trying this place next time you are in Vegas!

IsI6j8HAz3mcPowZ4iO4Bw.text: Manager Dan was kind enough to ensure my second experience here was memorable. Everything was great. From the service (Our server was Tim) , to the food, there is not one thing I can say that was not excellent. We ordered the scallops again, which were as good, if not better than the first time. The clam chowder and chop salad were tasty. The biggest difference was how the steaks were prepared. My bone in ribeye was perfect. Each bite was tender and juicy, make sure to order the Mac n cheese side dish.  I would definitely recommend this place. Thanks, Dan!

Gdwle-Ow5S1Mf6NiSvTdgw.text: Best Mastro's experience ever! Peter was our server and he was phenomenal. He went over the menu with us, as well as wine and cocktails. He helped with pairing the best wines with our entrees. I was so impressed! To top it off, the managers Aaron and Daniel came to make sure everything was perfect. Our entrees were spot on perfect! I will come here every time I come to Vegas. Best steak I've ever had!!! Best service I've ever had! Love it!

QoTU6-MxCeoNqp6j_mGKsw.text: We wanted to try a fancy steakhouse on our trip to vegas and Mastro's did not disappoint.  the rodeo was in town that weekend and we saw lots of happy looking cowboy types (i assume they know good beef).   i had the smallest filet and it was perfectly cooked! the meat was delicious. the rub on the outside i felt was the tiniest bit too salty but i can live with that.   the mac n cheese was so rich. i got the half sized portion but ended up taking half of it home. it was still delicious days later.  we also had a healthy side of broccoli was steamed nicely. can't complain about that.   the one thing that did sort of bother me was that the cokes were served in tiny 8 oz bottles. at 4 bucks a pop the refills can add up. if i had known this i would have gotten an iced tea instead. so i'll dock a star for that.  this place is pricey and i'd return but only if i was ok with spending special occasion amounts of money.

gsgwMgvO9otCdD5e43lo0w.text: Five stars all the way :)  My boyfriend and I came here for our one month anniversary, and it was an incredible dining experience. He ordered the Filet, and I ordered to Chilean sea bass. Both were cooked to perfection. We got the gorgonzola mac and cheese, and the salt and vinegar fries. The mac and cheese was EXTREMELY cheesy, so order it only if you love cheese. Our server was fantastic, and gave us a FREE buttercake topped with ice cream for our anniversary!   TIPS - Get the lemon drop! It was delicious, and so worth it because there is enough for two full glasses.  - If with a small party, ask the server if he can make the sides half sizes. i had no idea they could do that, but our server did it for us. (And we still had leftovers!)  - Sit in the reehouse

7TOcr7CYUj7h7fPzHSBpMw.text: Our first time at this Mastros.  We've been to others so expectations were high and they lived up to it!  Sat in the Treehouse which is very cool.  Others complained about feeling like you are in the middle of the mall, but it didn't bother us.  Our server Leonel was attentive and very personable.  Outstanding service and he had a sense of humor!  We started with the shrimp cocktail which was fantastic. Sometimes the really jumbo shrimp are chewy but these were tender and tasty.    Hubby's filet was cooked perfectly and the Mac n cheese is to die for.  I was craving some crab so I had 2 king crab claws of the appetizer menu.  Wow!  Of course you can't go to Mastros without having Butter Cake.  OMG!  It's like no other.  Great meal for a great date night!

7TucTlqroMpnFKlfjGqD1Q.text: Before heading out for a night of partying at XS, my buddy and I found ourselves wandering around the Cosmopolitan looking for a good restaurant to try.  While the rest of our friends were grabbing dinner at the literal hole-in-the-wall pizza counter upstairs, we wanted to take advantage of the opportunity of trying something a little more unique.  Well, that is, assuming we could find somewhere that didn't have a crowd; each of our first few tries were met with wait times of 45 mins or longer.  Hoping for better luck at the mall at City Center next door, we eventually worked our way over to Mastro's Ocean Club to check things out there.  Greeted by a friendly hostess and the opportunity for immediate seating, our search came to an end.  Score for table seating by the bar!  For a while now, I've heard a number of good things about Mastro's from friends in LA.  From the service to the food, they've all mentioned how great their experiences were.  At the end of my meal, I could certainly see what they mean.  After perusing through the menu of seafood and steaks, I ended up going with the grilled Chilean Sea Bass with a side order of the Garlic Mashed Potatoes for my friend and I to split (rather, I wanted it for myself, but needed to "share" it to justify getting it).  Now, I know...ordering a fish dish on my first ever trip to Mastro's is pretty counter-intuitive considering their reputation as a steakhouse.  However, given that it's one of their two Ocean Club spots, I figured that maybe I should give the seafood a shot since I don't know if it'll be as readily offered at their pure steakhouse spots.  When our orders were brought to our table, I have to admit that it wasn't stunning at first glance.  Although the cut was larger than I had anticipated (which is never a bad thing), there wasn't much in terms of frills and dressing.  Since everything is a la carte, you literally get just the fish on the plate, with half a lemon on the side of seasoning.  Despite how lonely it may have looked though, there's no questioning the quality.  Although Chilean sea bass is generally more forgiving when it comes to cooking because of its fatty nature, this one was done perfectly regardless.  The meat was soft and tender, and it was moist throughout.  Flavor-wise, you couldn't ask for much more - modest seasoning to it, with a great buttery and velvety sort of flavor from the fish.  Excellent.  As for our sides, the Garlic Mashed was pretty good.  I liked the consistency (thick, but not gloppy or too thin), and the flavor wasn't too potent.  While I would generally prefer a stronger punch to it, it worked well to not overpower the sea bass.  In addition, my friend also slipped in an order of the skinny fries, and let me tell you - a "basket" of fries here really is a basket of fries.  The order was this huge mound of fried potato goodness, and even after chipping away at it throughout our meal, there was still plenty left for our other friend to snack on when he joined us.  Oh, and I can't forget to mention their bread basket either - all served hot and soft with salted butter.  All of the ones I tried were good, but my favorite was the toast-like bread with cheese...so good.  As for the rest of the experience, everything else was spot on.  Our server Sarah was awesome - really attentive, friendly, and pretty damn cute.  Now, I'm sure that last part MIGHT have had something to do with it, but seriously, really cute.  While it's kind of odd that it's located in a mall, I really liked the vibe of the place.  The main dining area is on a sort of a semi-open balcony (check out the pictures...quite a distinctive look), while they have a piano and singer by the bar.  While the music can make conversations a little tough, it's no worse than if you were sitting with a large group.   While I do somewhat regret not having ordered beef instead of fish, I have no complaints about what I had either (plus, was still under that damn zero/reduced beef pledge).  That said, I know I'll be back to try more of their menu anyways (saw several tables with the seafood tower), as well as to get a table in their "tree house" section.  Great ambiance for a date as well, and while not a cheap meal, it's certainly worth the price.  But then, that could just be my waitress-induced bias doing the talking too..

Y8iuJ-oZubdaz4rgYcarfQ.text: I think I am in the twilight zone after reading the other reviews.  just dropped 4 bills here on my silver anneversay dinner for 4 - no wine either.   Service and atmosphere were great.  however this did not make up for the food.  I would give it 2.5 stars.  appetizers we had were calimari and Boston clam chowder.  the sauce that came with the calimari was not good.  The calamari was above average.  the soup seemed to lack a good seafood stock so flavor was absent although it had a good amont of clams.  we ordered two sides with dinner.   lobster mash potatoes was a good size serving but the lobster chunks were swimming in a puddle of butter.  could get the texture of th lobster meat but not too much on the flavor side.  string been were better bu similar.   I had the artic char.  seemed to lack flavor likely more than a day old.  sauce was tasty but I love the flavors of really fresh fish.  My wife had Chilean sea bass.   I had a bite at the end.  it was fishy like an old fish.   I have this dish often and this was the worst I have had.  I couldn't eat desert after this.   My kids had a new York steak and rack of lamb.  both were not cooked well and we're tough.  I am pretty sure I could have kicked as on the chef for these dishes.   the rack of lamb did have a good serving portion.  I was hoping I could be more positive and considered that my palate could be off because of something I ate earlier.  however the Chilean sea bass had some good flavors but was overpowered by bad fishy flavors.

Z4ylx6YT0OOaUUp9X4QQ9w.text: Mastro's Ocean Club located in Crystals at CityCenter is absolutely the best place restaurant with the best service on the latest Vegas business trip. In fact, I was more impressed with the non-swanky mall location than its Orange County siblings.  The Mall is incredibly quiet and the piano acoustics are phenomenal, making dinner at the bar or at a quiet table a very nice experience. Victor is a great bartender and the service is wonderful. As with all Mastro's, the wine list is incredible and goes on and on. Tonight was a Darioush Cabernet starter night as I pondered this wonderful menu, trying to stay light and healthy, amongst some decadent alternatives.   Eventually, I decided on a starter of Jalapeno Tuna Sashimi which is ahi tuna sliced sashimi style, topped with fresh squeezed key lime juice, thinly sliced jalapenos, and ponzu chili sauce. This is light despite looking like a lot of chili sauce.   Next, a salad of beefsteak tomato and onion with balsamic was a refreshing without being super oldtime steakhouse heavy!   For an entree, I ordered another small plate: The lobster cocktail which is 1.25 pounds (including shells). Now after eating all of this, I have slowed down and am just enjoying my wine when a couple of friends show up and we decide to end the evening with the crab claws which are excellent.  What an incredible meal, great services, great music and very relaxing.

Knkjtea3RKmIZ48pArwFww.text: Came here 4th time, I didn't realized first two times, but third was very impressive so I came back again and was same experience.  Food? yes it was very good.  Service? amaging! best service I ever experience in same class of restaurant.

vNHH5Pc-S_VSXzBYeR5Itw.text: I have been here 2 times in the last year  the staff is freely and very attentive. This time we got to sit in the Bird house which is really cool.    The first time was great had the Herb Roasted Chicken*24oz, Lobster Bisque Soup & Heirloom Tomato & Burrata, Creamed Spinach, Creamed Corn, Grilled Asparagus but the best part was the dessert that Mastro's Signature Warm Butter Cake is by far the best dessert you will every taste.    So on our second visit we wanted to see if they could repeat it.  Again we got the Herb Roasted Chicken*24oz - it really is very good and enough for two to share.  We got the Blue Cheese wedge and the  for the sides this time we stuck to the same creamed spinach, creamed corn but added the onion rings )which are fantastic) and the grilled Brussels Sprouts(i have to admit these were not bitter at all.)  then came the end that Mastro's Signature Warm Butter Cake was even better then I remembered its so gooey it melts in your mouth, you have to have it warm because we have stopped by just got the cake to go and it was server cold s not the same.    I recommend to anyone weather you live in Vegas or visiting try this place you will not be disappointed.

PXETUod0g7mpQEU1flrSow.text: Decided to have a nice dinner with my husband and everyone recommended to come here.  We were both really excited and wanted to a enjoy a nice dinner even knowing that it would be pricey.  The server was very nice and a great salesman.  He knew exactly to recommend the most expensive items on the menu.  The bread basket is amazing!!! I think the drinks are WAY too expensive especially with the Vodka that they offer, $18 for a martini with SKY vodka is ridiculous!  Ordered: 18 oz Bone in Filet Mignon - Medium Lobster mashed potatoes Mushrooms and Truffle Fries Note - side orders are really big and are family style.  Results: Our steak even with the bone did not look 18 oz (not even close) our steak came rare, we sent parts of it back to cook just for a couple of more seconds and got it back totally well done and gross.  The Lobster mashed potatoes were ok and NOT worth $39 as you barely tasted the lobster and all you tasted were massive amounts of butter.  I would have been happy with garlic mash.  The mushrooms were amazing and probably the tastiest item we ordered.  The really expensive fries were soggy and didn't have much flavor at all.  The manager was nice enough to not charge us for the overly cooked steak but it was quite disappointing to go to specialty restaurant where they don't know how to cook their meat the right way.   Even after they took off the meat the bill came out to $140 and it was totally not worth it.  Very disappointed in our experience here.

42KoDy5hBve86YDMqYHRbA.text: Great food, great service just a little pricey for a date night. I would suggest this as a great place for a customer dinner. Plenty of food options that would satisfy anyone's needs. The sides were great too and large enough to share. I recommend the sea bass with sauteed mushrooms and the creamed corn.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chiliean sea bass with Mac and cheese, spinach, mushrooms, mashed potatoes and creamed corn
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood sampler

WRJlmq992SPtyU0ifkGrig.text: Probably one of the top 40 meals of my life, and I've eaten at some good places. The staff was attentive to every detail. The food was perfectly prepared.

85pMGEeF0HfiXcgr1_wLCw.text: First time here. We had a private dining room for large group. Dinner overall was great. Seafood towers ordered & very fresh. Ordered swordfish but it was a bit salty and was not able to eat it all (didn't care to send it back, it was very tender though) Lobster mash & other vegetable side dishes were good, didn't care for the lobster mac n cheese.  My husbands steak was good, others ordered the salmon which looked delicious, will order the salmon or steak next time around. I've never had ahi tuna which was also ordered by some in the group & they were very happy with their choice (it did look good). . The waiters hustled, but at the end of our meal I requested a coffee & never got it while others did. We managed to get dessert the warm butter cake. Yum!!!  It just felt like they were overwhelmed.  I'd rather come to visit just the hubby & I for our 2nd visit.

9_LED8XEm_nOPXoB7jtIFQ.text: I wanted to try Mastro's for two reasons: (1) If possible, I would gorge myself to death on seafood; and (2) I wanted to eat in the weird looking treehouse in Crystals.  I got both (except for death...unless....).  The ambiance of this place is weird, to say the least.  A few tables are enclosed in a traditional restaurant space with, you know, walls.  The rest are inside the "treehouse," a very cool, wood-slated structure dangling in the middle of Crystals.  Although very cool looking, it's VERY LOUD.  In between the awwfffulll live music (really, they need to stop that) and the echo of everyone's conversations (no walls = no muffling of noise), it's almost difficult to have a conversation.  I would say this is not a romantic spot to eat.    There were also lots of middle-aged dudes in jeans.  Like, packs of them.  Very weird.  FOOD  As we were in a "small plate" mood, we went crazy on the appetizers as follows:  Sauteed Sea Scallops ($22)- Three medium-sized scallops, three slices of parmesan toast, diced tomatoes and cream sauce.  Unfortunately, the scallops were a tad overcooked and chewy. I'd probably pass on scallops next time.  Beef Bone Marrow (around $18) - two huge bones and baguette toast.   Delicious, decadent and full of flavor.  We gobbled it all up.  Seared Ahi Tuna encrusted in sesame seeds and served with julienned carrots ($22).  Overall, it lacked flavor although perfectly cooked.   Wedge salad - ($12) Big portion and very good.  I liked that they didn't cover the iceberg in dressing and instead left it on the bottom of the plate, surrounding the salad.  This allowed the diner to control how much dressing on each bite.  The dressing was a tad watery, the way I like it. Well executed.  But, it's a salad, so......  Then we got a half and half side of the following (they give you a half portion of each to let you try everything ($38):  King Crab Black Truffle Gnocci - Salty, rich and so delicious.  Lots of king crab chunks. My favorite thing I tried.  Lobster Cheese Mashed Potatoes -Although rich, it wasn't that flavorful. Mostly salty, not complex. I did love the enormous pieces of lobster, though.   I have to add they were really generous with the wine pour ($12 for a glass of Shiraz).  Overall, good service and big portions.  It's a bit pricey but they serve up some tasty food.    Definitely come here if you're 40 and have a penchant for denim.  This is your mecca.

Kh98QCpkIyC0Y7hUjzehjg.text: Came in here for dinner and all i can say is WoW. First, the service is outstanding. Second the Petite Filet was so well prepared you did not even need a knife. The flavor was amazing, as were the sides we order. You definitely get what you pay for here..worth every penny

m7EjrfrO_PPSy-O3xna2uQ.text: Came here as a finale to a Girls/Moms weekend in Vegas for Mother's Day. Our anticipation was high since we had enjoyed Mastros NYC in Sept 16 for our birthdays. I was extremely disappointed with the dinner service and attention; it was extremely slow and absolutely no comparison to the fabulous, high energy and attentive service we received in NYC. Our server did not cover any specials or explain the different steak and cut options. He was more concerned with putting away the menus than attending to us. Our drinks at the bar were great plus plentiful and the bartender was attentive and fabulous. Our meal was good, however we really came for the experience and the service. This location does not compare in service to NYC. The location is nice and open in the Crystals Mall but we expected much more. We spoke to the Manager after and he was concerned and said he would address it. We were so disappointed that we skipped the butter cake and high tailed it out of there. There are lots of options in Vegas so we will skip this one next time in town.

I4sMOMy3m583qsfADdm4BA.text: Typical high-end steak place format. The location in City Center is unique, in the wooden "treehouse". Highlights were potatoes gratin, creamed corn, and grilled asparagus.  The bananas foster cocktail is like a rum desert. Of course the service is upscale as expected.  I have been to Mastro's locations in Orange County and here, both were consistently good.

J8qn8x9EvzQFV5AWA8-3CQ.text: Mastro's, you never cease to wow me!  I first fell in love with you in Newport Beach at both the Ocean Club and Costa Mesa locations. I think this is the best steak I've ever had.  Everything is cooked to perfection. We had the spicy mambo salad which was a twist on a traditional caesar with wasabi and sriracha dressing (order with croutons added back on).  We also had the shrimp cocktail which was coincidentally one of the best shrimp cocktails I've ever had too.  The dry ice makes it that much more fun.  I think Mastro's has one of the best bread baskets in town as well, particularly the pretzel bread.  It makes it so you almost don't even need sides -- however, if you are getting sides, you must try the lobster mashed potatoes at least once in your life!  Thanks Mastro's for a fantastic evening!

YD79a7v_R-ImVfCLlLq39Q.text: Love maestros. When family was here we had two adult only dinners during the week and of all the places in town we chose maestros. Great food, service and atmosphere and they stay open late which we like. Shellfish app is always a must. From there you can't go wrong with lobster tails or steak or surf n turf for entree. But for dessert the butter cake is a must yummm!

uHUsAlTai3D2qmqwIkAumw.text: This is the second time I've eaten here and the dining experience was amazing!! My friend Daniel E used to be a waiter here but now is a manger and so I was sad I wouldn't see him but we had Dion and his service was remarkable!!! Casual and fluid yet professional and on point. The timing of all the dishes were excellent and I had a great time in the tree house!

EP9h7izMDrc5zjNVp-Zr7g.text: Had a 4.5 star meal, but not quite 5 star, at Mastro's on a Friday night.  It was very crowded, as in full, but we were seated promptly at our reservation time of 8:00.  We were seated in a high top kind of half-booth type table.  I'd not sat in something like this before, but it was comfortable.  The place was humming, but since it's open to the mall, it wasn't so loud that you couldn't carry on a conversation.    Our server immediately approached us to take our water and drink orders.  She also provided a wine list, which was above average but pricey, which was expected given that Mastro's is located in Crystals on the Strip.  I didn't think it was out of line with other lists at similar places on the Strip.    To start, I went with the lobster bisque.  This was one of the best versions of this dish I've had.  It was velveety smooth with a lot of chunks of lobster.  The sherry came through, and it was seasoned very well.  Just a creamy lobstery soup.  You may get some sticker shock given that it's soup, but I think it was worth it (I can't recall the exact price, I believe it was either $16 or $18).  Additionally, a friend and I shared the ahi tuna tostada.  These come 3 to an order, but I could have easily eaten another dozen.  The tuna serving is substantial, and all of the accompaniments (avocado, onion salsa, and chili sauce) are fantastic.  Crispy, flavorful, but not too heavy.  Loved it.  We split steaks among the table, opting for the traditional bone in ribeye and the wagyu bone in ribeye from Australia.  It was $110, but well worth it.  It was noticeably better than the other steak.  Not that the "regular" ribeye wasn't good.  It was.  But, the depth of flavor with the wagyu was significantly better.  Absolutely re-order if they have it available.  Plus, since we were sharing they offered to cut it for us in the back of the house, which we appreciated.  On the side, we had the peppercorn steak sauce.  It's good, but I don't know that it's worthy of its reputation.  I didn't think the steaks needed it, so I only had a couple of bites with it.  The lobster mashed potatoes are incredibly decadent, nearly swimming in lobster and butter.  The twice baked potato is good, but it's typical for this type of dish.  For dessert, we went with the famous butter cake.  It easily lives up to its reputation.  Warm, a little crispy on the outside, but impossibly moist and buttery.  Served with berries, ice cream, and plenty of whipped cream, it was an excellent end to a great meal.    Service was fantastic the entire time.  Our server was there when we needed her but not overbearing.  Our food came out quickly, but we never felt rushed, despite knowing how busy they were that evening.  All in all, a great experience.  I can see why Mastro's has its reputation, I would absolutely return.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Another angle of the butter cake.
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The (justifiably) famous butter cake.
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye with peppercorn sauce.

BmZYWtxFslaM9smtWtpSMg.text: I have ate at Michelin Star Restaurants and very high end Steakhouses.  Mastro's Ocean Club is the best!  The ribeye plate was so hot that I could hear it sizzling.  I assumed it's just the plate.  The minute I put a piece of steak in my mouth OMG it's like heaven!  This is the way all steak should come out "HOT" like it was cooked and immediately bought out to your table.  I also have two seafood plates too.  It was also hot too! Most restaurant do not know how to get that part right. When you have multiple orders, and how to cook it where all the plates are delivered Hot.  The drinks are amazing.  The service is absolutely the best!  My must go place in Vegas from now on.  Just hope it will be consistent.  You got my Michelin 5 Star.

Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. cream of corn

hq5KxvwVlgGVhG47yl_L0w.text: You know, some close friends of mine introduced me to this place a few years ago. I've yet to find it's equal.   I highly recommend the Flour de blu (stoli elit), butter cake, Chilean sea bass, and anything else you can wrap your paws around. Truly epic.

qR3Ic48Uh-wqOIOv34dfTg.text: A huge thanks to Brandon (manager) and Marc (server) for making my bf's birthday a night to remember!!! The service was amazing and the food was delicious. We enjoyed the oysters Rockefeller, halibut and the filet, along with the peas, and a few drinks. I loved the berry cocktail and the after dinner chocolate cocktail!! Marc ended our special celebratory evening with a slice of chocolate cake (which is my bf's favorite!) and a birthday candle. Everything about the restaurant is top notch!! Look forward to going back on our next visit to Vegas. Thanks again to the entire staff that made the night so special. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters Rockefeller, filet with peas, berry cocktail, chocolate dessert cocktail, and chocolate birthday cake. Such a special night!

wYN_uMBV3Off-iJlNTwUqQ.text: Ate here 9.18.18 Super bummed wish the food matched the service. Mike our waiter was amazing and catered to us greatly and can tell he is super passionate about job.  We were here for a work dinner and wanted to splurge on some great food for the price... only our main course was way delayed from our appetizers and once our steaks were received they were not cooked to order and had to be sent back. After waiting for order to come back the steak was again not cooked correctly and wasn't worth the effort to say anything at this point nor did we have much of an appetite sitting and waiting over 3 hours from start to finish. Therefore I will be hesitant to visit again.     Again our server Mike was fantastic.

5T6S2SDFHvvdkXk3MjcvGw.text: Exceptional service. Open past 10pm for late dinner. I was in Las Vegas for my birthday weekend and my friend and I were looking for a nice dinner at 10pm. It is hard to find a steakhouse open past 10pm but we found Mastro's and I am so thankful.   We started with the lobster cocktail and it is huge. The lobster claws went past my expectations. And mashed potatoes and brussel sprouts with our 22 oz ribeye.   The only bad thing is the location, it is right in the mall which I am not a fan of, but it is conveniently located on the strip. And the architecture is beautiful and modern.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. lobster cocktail

3GofqXmmfjrpBrKKa6MPEw.text: We had a wonderful dinner on Saturday evening with a friend that was visiting.  We started with the Caviar which was delightful, it was beautifully presented and tasted delicious.   The Caesar salad was good but not exceptional. The 3 of us shares a bone in filet.  It was tender and exceptionally tasty. We ordered the steak medium rare. The steak came out closer to rare but it was still delicious. A must have is the truffle crab gnocchi!!  The service was great too!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wine and Caviar
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious wine and Caviar!

bkRXyRie6AzaOXzj-YoOBg.text: Hands down best steak I've ever had. Came here for my fiance's birthday. Everything was just so delicious and service was prompt and caring. I thank them for my experience here. We went ahead and ordered the bone in rib eye steak that was done on medium well. Tender to perfection, greatly seasoned. I didn't want the steak to end so I was taking my time eating it. The rosemary garlic mushrooms were really tasty and nutritious. The rosemary and mushrooms created a lovley aroma and cream of corn was nutritious and creamy delightful every bite was worth it. Oh but the desserts were chocolatey and sweet to perfection. My taste buds were extremely happy and satisfied. I'll definitely be back to try more great entrees!

DSXKFuT5iWVavoYsiIb-xQ.text: My top two favorite restaurant in Vegas. The seafood tower is a must - everything is always fresh and delicious. The steak just cooked beautiful, every time I've been there. The sides... yummm!! And the dessert.. always save room for dessert when eating at Mastros.

w_Q1aRZJCt3ftU2S9m3nDQ.text: I'll start off by saying - the food, drinks and service are very good. However, this place has extremely loud background noise and their website stresses the importance of a formal/business wear yet when we got there, there were people in shorts and t-shirts and converse shoes. It was a bit disappointing as we were taking out a very important partner and we made sure we all dressed appropriately, as required per their website. After everything was said and done, and after paying hefty bill...the night turned out well.

tJyUfHrceP_l-KAVLAmUaw.text: Food and service is always good! Portions are big but can be on the pricier side. Will be back again!

3cD6OmldkoLwVvBITiG9jw.text: this place was suggested by the Aria concierge and it was horrible. food was cold and service was bad. when your waiter helps you to your side dish and a veggie falls on the table, it should not be picked up by your waiter and put on your plate. just bad, real bad

3ig56H9MfTRcz09rDTK_GA.text: My boyfriend and I came here to have a celebratory dinner. There was a bit of a mix up with our reservations (I used open table) but they were still able to accomodate us.  Mastro's is located inside the Shops at Crystals on the second floor. My boyfriend loved his Hennessy sidecar cocktail and always talks about going back just for drinks and to try their dessert.  We decided to skip appetizers and just go straight into the main course. We got the 22 ounce bone-in ribeye, the ahi tuna sashimi, lobster mashed potatoes, and sauteed broccoli. Since we were sharing, they offered to plate and serve everything for us. We ordered with the intention that the tuna would be for me, and the steak would be for him but by the end of the meal, I enjoyed the steak so much I ended up eating most of it. I'm a fan of ribeye steaks because i find them to be more flavorful than filets - and the steak here had a nice sear on the outside and perfectly tendor on the inside. The lobster mashed potatoes were yummy but a little bit salty to me (although my boyfriend said it was fine and he loved it). The amount that we ordered was more than enough for two people, we didn't get to dessert because we were so stuffed.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster mashed potatoes, rib eye, ahi tuna, and sautéed broccoli

Y25zqLi3L7qbaoeEg4-AAg.text: The food is here is unbelievably amazing. the service is awesome and very 5-star elite. the location is always busy, and I always recommend this place even if it is a franchise. it is one of those restaurants that you do remember for the taste of the food, more than the presentation. it is always a treat for me bringing my friends and families here, and truly--i never get tired. the crystal's location adds to the star, because i am happy it is located inside the crystals mall instead of a casino or stand alone.  Your must-tries:  * any steak cuts  * bone marrow  * wild caught fish selections  They also will accommodate to your share-plates if you need it

AR0jDgSq7z0oN2tb5CVNOw.text: Had dinner there last night.  We started with a chopped salad.   Wife had Chilean sea bass.  I did the filet.  Sides were Mac and cheese with Gorgonzola and fried Brussels sprouts.   Staff was professional and attentive.  We'll definitely be back.

pRqJKrJxDq9_RLulCb97lg.text: Would give it 10 stars if I could! Always a must when we come to Las Vegas, and this time didn't disappoint. Service is 5 stars, and the food is always amazing. Found it on a whim 6 years ago, and so glad we tried it. Mastro's Ocean Club is phenomenal.

PkrQxjxVoUV5O2lDEj57Kw.text: Sad this place had so much going for it good food and entertainment and it's really gone down hill . I use to enjoy sitting at the bar and listening to the piano player and now all I hear is the sounds of the canned music and the mall while I drink my over priced drink

_6dOu-qZHhQvF5Yhfkr23Q.text: Great food and great service at a fair price. Our waiter Greata was very professional and personable - we can not wait to go back in May 2019.

4iRnVkdvHHeva3A489jw4g.text: Stellar experience.  Hideously expensive but expected on the strip.  Huge selection of wines Amazing food.     - good bread    - first rate seafood    - delicious steaks    - fabulous sides    - decadent desserts First class service.   As long as I am not footing the bill, I would return here anytime.   Las Vegas Strip signature restaurants are known as much for the huge price tag as well as quality food/service.

YX2mSfis8TsY1wZqxKUamA.text: We heard the food was amazing and we wanted to check out the tree house location.   The food and service met and exceeded our expectations. All the decadent extras enjoyed with a great meal, my personal favorite, truffle butter on petite filet. Plenty of specialty items, bone marrow, a seafood tower and a long list of specialty drinks-check out my picture of the top shelf at the bar.  The signature dessert is a must, a giant personal butter cake topped with ice cream, strawberries and served with a giant side of stiff whipped cream.  Service was impeccable, including the personal attendant in the restroom.  Our only disappointment was the location. The tree house is in the center of a shopping mall, so the atmosphere was a little less than expected.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4xgkFCW7PImyoHqwWqVNVQ.text: Mastro's was amazing! We are locals and decided to splurge on dinner before going to see Hootie and the Blowfish! Our dear daughter was kind enough to gift us with the tickets so we made a whole night of it. We rarely venture down to the strip other than for work, and SO HAPPY we decided on Mastro's!  Our Server was Renee. She did an awesome job taking care of us. She was so attentive and kind. We decided to share everything since we couldn't take any leftovers with us and she happily split our portions into two! This is a fancy restaurant. Service and food presentation is on an elevated level! I even saw the manager inspecting a table set up with a FLASHLIGHT to make sure there were no spots on the silverware or glasses, and no crumbs left under the table! Wow!  They even bring you your food on a very heated plate. All the food was super hot! I LOVE that as one of my pet peeves in most restaurants is the food isn't hot enough.   You could make a meal on the bread basket alone. We had a Caesar salad to start, and then we split the 16 ounce New York strip steak, Scalloped potatoes, and sauteed shrimp. Also order a bottle of wine. Everything was PERFECT with the food, timing of dinner, & service.  DO NOT miss the ButterCake! It is heavenly and they serve it with a HUGE plate of whipped cream.   It was our first visit to Mastro's but it won't be our last! I have a feeling this place is going to become our go to for special occasions! Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scalloped Potatoes
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mastro &#39;s Signature Warm Butter Cake
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side of whipped cream - Yum!

8uHfV5aTa3MI0ffgJQfWpA.text: Ambiance was very nice. Sea bass was delicious. The 22 oz ribeye was not flavorful. But the desert, butter cake was well worth it all!! It's huge so you can share it with 3 or 4 people!!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Entrance to Mastros in the Shops at Crystals

w4IB0fzhg-y27_2rDLEVDg.text: Took my gf here for her birthday and we both loved it. The atmosphere was great andwe felt like our dollar mattered. We spent 300 dollars on  2 lobster bisque soups 2 New York strip steaks 2 Mojitos The truffle gnocchi enough for 3-4 people    My gf got the chocolate cake and I got the butter cake.   Everything was delicious! We could not finish not one thing we ordered though lol great serving size   We will be back!

y84NqRokOs8_xxyHUbZJLA.text: Had dinner at mastros for my birthday this past Saturday, out waiters name was Raymond and he was AMAZING.. I actually was fighting a cold but decided to go anyways because it was my birthday. After ordering our food I realized I really wasn't feeling well and asked for hot water with lemon and honey, he quickly brought it out to me knowing I wasn't feeling well, I also asked him to give me the food to go and he also quickly brought that out as well, he ended up giving me to go cups of hot water with lemon and honey to drink in my hotel room and let me Box the complimentary birthday desert as I was just feeling so sick. He was absolutely on top of it and made the whole situation much better. I will absolutely come Here again next time I visit in hopes to get Raymond as my waiter!

dL2aTCFV304pfHwVPpi-Ig.text: I'm just not very impressed with Mastro's here or in Vegas. The menu is typical steakhouse fare and the service is just okay. I like the Mastro's salad but could not decide what to eat for a main. I just got the crab cakes and they were just ok. My husband enjoyed the steak and potatoes. While we love the Aria Hotel, there are many better restaurants to eat at than this.

lcfRoyZOQpQgsiKeDH2VuQ.text: May 10, 2019 Ate here for the first time with family (for my Bday)and I must admit I was very impressed.  I had the halibut, Brussel sprout, lobster mashed potatoes, butter cake, and Hennessey Carside to drink; All made perfectly. Wished I could remember our waitress because she was great! Very, friendly, personal, and attentive.

gIK6xFkNGm2p85ysFuH42g.text: Probably the best Birthday dinner I ever had! Order a lemon drop! They fizz! I enjoyed the halibut oscar and the butter cake! So yummy! Service was on point too!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HTDf-kKPFL1ddVSC0XCOxQ.text: We had a great meal, 4 of us were there, our waitress Sam and crew were great, she was helpful with the menu. She was also flawlessly smooth bringing and removing stuff from our table, without interrupting our conversation. The desert was great, their signature butter cake, can"t wait till our next visit.

Feb59GFLSrFwIbMtkevy7A.text: Mastro's Ocean Club is a fine dining experience that must be seen to be believed - so long as you're willing to pay the price that accompanies that experience or know someone who will.  Mastro's steals the show at The Shops at Crystals (or chews the scenery, depending on your point of view) with its distinctive "pod" hanging over a major walkway. You'll either find it breathtaking or tacky - I tend towards the former - but either way, it doesn't come cheap.  Their food makes just as much of an impression as the "pod" their restaurant lives inside, with a seafood selection so exhaustive and delicious you almost forget you're eating at a nautical restaurant with "Ocean Club" in its name in the heart of the desert. Their lobster tail is quite delicious, and I say this as someone who doesn't consider lobster one of their favorite foods.  In total, Mastro's Ocean Club makes for a lovely night out. It's certainly a place to impress your date or, more likely, colleagues when the expense account is in your hands. Your taste buds will thank you and the top-notch service will make you feel like an old friend who's in on all the jokes. I just don't know if it's enough to justify the price tag in a saturated restaurant market replete with competing options.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vanilla-battered lobster tail

5pnEHcqsZgm_TWWMjokTqw.text: Lobster mash potatoes and the warm butter cake were my favorites. Scallops and the crab cake were okay. Sushi was good, but I have had better. Steak had too much fat. The atmosphere is great and awesome customer service. Just have to order the right things here. I still recommend this place

0fawEUR1vV8UKbpTP_D4Pg.text: The ONLY reason they got 3 stars, is because my very first experience was amazing and the food was great. However, my second visit was terrible; even with them knowing I'm a resident at the adjacent high rise. My food was not even processed into an order, until I came inside and paid. The first time I came, my food was out in 5 mins; I always place a pick I'm order. The shrimp was greasy, the lemon and garnishes were thrown about and halfway properly set. The ice cream was put in some cheap styrofoam cup, versus the tub it typically comes in. The first time I went, I was greeted at the entrance and as soon as I got to the bar. This last time, nobody greeted me; I had to tell them I needed to pick up an order and actually flag down the girl standing directly in front of me drying cups. My first order I got my complimentary bread basket, this order; NONE. I was then given an attitude when I asked about it, and explained my first experience. I even went as far as to show them photos of my first time there, and the manager couldn't say anything. He immediately canceled the order.

2rN0YNiagwk5ooILJeBSJA.text: This was a very expensive, but pleasing night. Our waiter was very timely and extremely knowledgeable of the wines and menu items. His recommendations were pricey, but spot on. It's is NOT hard to drop $200/person on dinner with even a lower tier bottle of wine.   We got the seafood tower to start with a side dish of oysters. The tower was all on ice and had 3 of each item (3 People). You are able to build your own tower, which can be good and bad (gets expensive and all the items sound good). The Ribeye was cooked to perfection - I would also recommend a side of bearnaise sauce to taste.   Topped off with a side of grilled Brussel Sprouts and a $70 bottle of wine, this meal was PERFECT. Thank you Mastro's for a great night!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Quality
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sea Food Tower
