HiKm8DWdgJug7dI1EWRSHQ.text: This was a first time experience at this establishment. I'm always excited for a great dining experience. After looking on line and reading the menu I was hoping for great things to come. We had a large party so plans were set up in advance for a private room. As we arrived we were led to one of the private dining rooms, they appeared a little too small for my comfort or maybe it was the fact they place multiple round tables in a triangle shaped room. Made it very hard to Socialize. They have a very impressive wine list to which I ordered wine by the glass 26.00 to be exact but not everyone was interested in drinking wine or the type I desired. The crab cakes were very good they were served on platters and also served with a Caesar Salad which was passed. Being we had a larger party with us gave us a chance to try many of the food at one sitting. I shared a 22oz Rib eye and an order of twin lobster tails. I ordered the stake Charred rare. I do enjoy my meat in a very rare manor however this stake was beyond rare there was no charring and the stake appeared to be like maybe being applied to heat for 2 minutes per side then done. The Twin tails were actually a disappointment as well.  One tail was not even cooked the other was fine. I had my partner take the good tail as they took away the raw tail to recook. I did get a taste of the Lemon sole and will say it was very good. On out table we had Lobster mashed potatoes, very good Gorgonzola mac and cheese, (mac and cheese) Sweet potatoes fries which were good and Brussels sprouts which were tasty. About the time I ordered another glass of wine and ate about 3 bites of my extra rare steak, I was done as I had tasted many of the sides several pieces of bread my lobster tail arrived. When he brought it to the table I advised just box it up. A little disappointing. Now as everyone is sitting around full and content was time for desert. Coffee was being served and we ordered the following deserts Warm butter cake which does live up to its name, and the cherry crisp & cheese cake. Deserts all were very well prepared.  It was a nice experience but I was a little set back on the main course. I also wish the room we were in was better set up as I was sitting with my back towards many of our guests. One last thing about the main course even though it was virtually raw when it arrived at my table the flavor of the meat was very good.

y5TXNfxC1p1G-29rOIofNw.text: So fresh and tasty. Amazing mushroom medley sushi grade Big eye tuna steak and delicate Halibut with butter and capers. Mmm

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate layer cake with raspberries birthday perks

7JdV3FXgCu-g2RthQEVZEQ.text: This is quite the snazzy place that would impress any date! With a price tag to match, you certainly get  an atmosphere that'll make you feel catered to. The service is spectacular and you'll undoubtedly feel catered to. I honestly felt the entrees were overpriced, but the sides are certainly tremendous in portions, and I was a large fan of the fries and the creamed corn.  My honest favorite part of the meal has to be the dessert - omg that butter cake, though!!! Words cannot replicate how good this cake is, and top it off with home made whipped cream - just mouth watering deliciousness!

DqA_V0lVpy1Vr2nTckscvg.text: This is one of my favorite go-to restaurants in Vegas! Outstanding food, cocktails, and wine list. Definitely try their shrimp cocktail and save room for the decadent butter cake dessert!  The setting in Crystals is spectacular and the service is knowledgeable, friendly, professional, and top-notch.

9aArcfEUAVwsuAHUAY7M-w.text: Delicious lobster and sushi. Very nice ambiance. I love the location. It sits inside then shopping center but it didn't feel like it. Everyone in my party loved their food. Tender asparagus. A nice place for a romantic dinner or other special occasion.

Bbn2tS0aDn5Jw_rb6LQZ-Q.text: The fact that I've been to so many different Mastro's,I can appreciate the consistency in all locations and the quality of the food.Usually when you go to places like this when you're in such Groups, there's always that one person is not satisfied with their Entree.Nevertheless, that was the case with us. Our waiter was excellent he did really well at connecting with his customers. He seem more than happy to help and assistance with anything that we needed. Thank you Mastro's for the excellent customer experience and keep up the good work.

ORiQbQAGQs3xqIAS5pIw-Q.text: We had a very negative experience with their banquet staff for a group event we held here about a year ago. We had a group of about 50 people in a private room with wine and everything, so we spent a significant sum (I think it was around $5,000).   Later in the evening, after the dessert course, we had asked the waitstaff to come speak to us to inform us as to the status of the bill and if we were under the minimum spend required or over it. No one came to inform us later in the evening as to the status of the minimum. In fact, the waiters were nowhere to be found later in the evening. Then, to our surprise, a waiter came up with the check and presented it to us and we were under by a significant sum - about $1200. We told him that if he had come to us earlier, then we would have ordered more food or wine.   The banquet contact person had left for the evening so the waiter suggested that they would just add onto our bill about 40 bottles of wine as a "placeholder" and that we could resolve it later. We emailed the banquet person the next morning but never heard back and we had to leave Las Vegas for our flight home.   Later, we talked to our contact person with banquets and they insisted that we come pick up the wine. We said we weren't local so we couldn't come. And the restaurant wouldn't ship it to us because of wine regulations for shipping wine out of state. We asked for a credit or gift cards but they refused, even though it was their staff who suggested putting the wine bottles on the bill.   Finally, a few weeks later they said they no longer had the wine (we don't know what happened to it; but I'm sure they just re-sold it at a profit in their dining room) so we couldn't have it. But they refused to give us credit for the wine that THEY profited from.   Now it has been a year and they are still holding our wine "hostage," telling us that there's a corporate policy against storing wine so they were justified in getting rid of the wine. What corporate policy involves reselling wine at a profit and then refusing to pay the fair amount owed to those customers? We PAID $1200 for this wine and then they profited off of it - that's unjust enrichment.   I would not recommend doing a special event with their banquets facility.

L_UAgPGEHic7k6C2BP_fJA.text: My favorite restaurant for seafood and some amazing appetizers every time when I'm in Vegas! Love the seafood tower, lobster mash, king crab truffle gonocci and cream corn the best!

z9ya6PYHidV90RUB2c0QSQ.text: Highly recommend Mastro's... Service: 5+ stars  Exceptional service from Katie. Katie did an amazing job recommending the food, specialty drinks, and wine. She was very knowledgable on the entire menu. Katie's  attention to detail was on point!   Food:  Halibut/blackened: amazing. Very tasty and nice texture Bone In Filet: amazing: thickness and quality was great Sides: Very large portions.... Loaded baked potato: very tasty. Creamed Spinach: best ever had Dessert: cheesecake. Comped for birthday...very good homemade new york style cheesecake.   Drinks: great value for drink. Oversized portions pf wine and double liquor on martinis, plus an amazing selection of both.   Overall: best dinner/drinks/service in Vegas. Will definitely be going back....especially to try the butter cake Katie recommended!

ElHm2-dibWcG3R1SFggFLQ.text: Service was great hence the 2 stars but I don't understand what the hype was all about. Our steak was part dry part medium rare in some area, our Seabass was super salty. We also ordered cream of spinach they made it extra creamy but that's my fault, it's expected.

iRTWVO4NKIgwBo957h2Zrw.text: Mastro's where to begin. Located in the Crystals mall just outside the main entrance to Aria, sister restaurant to Scottsdale & Beverly hills' location. we embarked on night one in Vegas.  So let's start with the drinks at the Piano bar a very nice opening where a piano man and gorgeous singer belt out a few tunes prior to dinner where we were seated in the Tree house so to speak.  Bright open and airy we were treated service wise very nicely.  8 Tonight and waiters and staff were brisk and efficient.  The standard push for bottled water well you get the drill. A High end steak house and fish place that needs no preamble.  Great Start bread basket with Pretzel breads and such excellent!   I'll run it down.  Shrimp cocktail is a highlight with the dry ice making the fog come off the shrimp it's an eye catcher.  Asked for horseradish on the side oh boy the hottest dam thing I've ever consumed. one drop in the sauce made my dry stuffed nose wince and my head was cleared like a nitrate ammonia pack from my football days. Yea baby it was good! A lobster cocktail was also equally outstanding.  Multiple salads were also ordered and shared from a Chopped house salad, a Cesar salad and beefsteak tomatoes & Mozzerella.  Skip the last one.   Entrees: 7 Steaks one piece of fish. Every single steak was absolutely delicious From the bone in filet to the strip to the bone in KC Strip there were outstanding. One was cooked or shall I say undercooked and the handled it not only by fixing the dish but removing it from the bill.  The Hawaiian big eyed Tuna was horrible only way to describe it. Sorry but another get this out of here moments.   Sides: All very generous in size and easily splittable among the group 4 sides way too much for 8 people. Lobster Mashed potatoes a die for moment outstanding Sauteed mushrooms yummy Gorgonzola Mac & cheese another to die for moment  Creamed spinach excellent.  All and all a fine dining experience with the drawback of a couple of 1 undercooked steak and one bad entree both removed from Bill make this a nice experience.

SP0_7kfSFSa5-vXjMhQu_Q.text: Wonderful experience. Restaurant is beautiful and service top notch! It is on a pricey side so be prepared. But I defiantly recommend the experience. Lobster bisque was amazing and butter cake out of this world! It is big enough to share and is served with a large amount of whip cream!

r_SMRkRGhKR65HCHvnFgtg.text: I love this place!   My boyfriend and I came here to celebrate our 6 months semi-anniversary and we certainly had a great time! The only down side is it burnt a hole in our wallet. But it is a special occasion and we both think it is worth it.   I made a reservation on line at open table and I mentioned our occasion. When we were at the hostess stand, we were greeted by our last name which really surprised me. We waited for about 2 min before we got seated in the tree house, just like how I requested in my reservation. Our server came right away to take our drink orders and also gave us some recommendations.   We decided to go with the Surf and Turf they have which comes with a 3 pound Maine Lobster and steak of our choice. One thing about the meal here is that it does not come with any sides. You only get what you order. If you want to have mashed potatos or onion rings, you do have to order them seperately which again raises the cost.   The food came fairly fast after we ordered and the busser divided the meal for us right by the table. The lobster tasted great so did the steak! The server was telling us that they have a live fishtank in the back and all the lobsters they have came in daily directly from Maine! You can't get anything fresher than that in Vegas! The steak is flavorful and juicy. My boyfriend said it could be more tender. As for the side, we ordered Scalloped potatoes and Corossal Onion Rings. We both like the potatoes it was yummy but not too impressed by the Onion Rings, for some reason it tastes a bit soft.   Upon we were finishing up our meal, so stuffed at that point, our server actually surprised us with a complimentary desert for our celebration! What a nice gesture! So definitely put in the occasion if you are celebrating anything at Mastro's!   The environment is elegant and classy with live performance. It is expensive but you definitely get what you pay for. We return on our next special occasion.

RSsoI3-wWWoFrrHHJLx_8w.text: Always excellent.  Steaks and seafood. Wife had the king crab legs and loved them.  Remember to have butter cake.

JXFpfPMvkzm2xhcQNn_GbQ.text: So I am sitting here at the table right now and we have had the most AMAZING experience. We came here in Saturday 10-14-17 to celebrate my mom's birthday (from Chicago) and decided to come back today 10-16-17 for a few drinks and dessert. The manager, Brandon, remembered us immediately and wished my mom a happy birthday and offered us a free dessert. We were shocked that not only did he recognize us, but he also remembered it was my mom's birthday. A few minutes later another manager, Aaron, comes up and brings my mom a free martini! It was such a shock and wonderful experience. We also had a super great waitress, Katie. Truly amazing customer service, better than I have experienced in a long time. Would definitely recommend this place to anyone thinking of coming! The food was also amazing! Great steaks and sides (best French fries I have ever had) and the most amazing butter cake. If I could give more than 5 stars I would!

VPhaTdzujchRQFUahRok1A.text: I want to say that I'm a frequent diner at the Mastro's in costa mesa as well as beverly hills.   The service there trumps the vegas experience. Disappointing. At one point the server dropped some of the gnocchi on my lap as he was serving it onto my plate. He knew because I reacted unfavorably since I had some pretty nice pants on. Not a single apology.   meh.   I don't hold it against you Mastro's... you're still my 2nd favorite place to eat in orange county :D

njHmZ_jAFsdQn2U3lBbvyQ.text: Everything is always done perfect at Maestro's. The food, wine selection and a dessert with its own twitter site. The only weird thing about this one is it's in the middle of a mall with very expensive stores. Steak place in the mall....hmmmm Other than that, they are always spot-on with the best food and service. If you never have been to one, you can't truly say you are a foodie.  Warm butter cake!!!

YwUZDAQBzVG3QvlH-jPTpQ.text: This is my current pick for the #1 best place for a business dinner in town (assuming cost is no object). There's a nice variety of steaks and seafood, and the ambiance is quiet and fantastic. It's not too trendy or loud, and the food is classic and well prepared. The tree house area is especially nice.   We tried a bit of everything, and all of it was fantastic. The cold seafood tower appetizer was fantastic (the stone crab claws were the stand out!). For our entrees most of us got seafood and were all pleased! I loved my arctic char, although it was HUGE - stupid HUGE. Honestly it seemed like 16-20 ounces of freaking fish on my plate. With all the other yummy food floating around I could barely polish off a quarter of my fish. If I was dining with my husband, this is definitely a dish we could share. The best side with the crab and black truffle gnocchi... OMG.. best gnocchi of my life ! The lobster mashed potatoes were pretty incredible as well.   So the butter cake did live up to the hype! Moist, rich, delicious. Four of us split this and felt like there was more than enough to go around. Even if you don't think you have room for dessert - this cake is good enough to warrant making yourself sick !  I can't say I tried any meat, but for seafood I really loved this place. Great service, and great food.

V0fkci85CTwYb_6H6N0U_w.text: I enjoyed my experience at mastros.  Their cocktails are delicioussss. I had the cosmopolitan, which featured a dry ice presentation. Beautiful. It was pricey but you get the mixer and the extra contents, which is pretty much 2 cocktails for the price of one. The food was nothing short of spectacular. I ordered the ribeye and it was cooked perfectly, seasoned well and simply amazing. Their sea bass is so tender and melts in your mouth like butter! Ah! Yum! ** The really nice thing about the place is their hefty portions, so at least you leave full and like you got your monies worth.  It a MUST to try the Warm Butter Cake Dessert! It's worth the $16 to spend, it's a warm yellow buttery cake that's crispy on the outside, with sugar coating and warm and gooey on the inside. There's a large scoop of vanilla ice cream on top and the whole thing is finished with raspberry drizzle. It also comes with a large side of house whipped cream!   The first time I dined at the restaurant, I received stellar service; this second time around I saw my server 3 times during our meal and I wasn't impressed with his serving qualities.   All in all, it is definitely an experience to dine at mastros. The food speaks for itself.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Warm Butter Cake!
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye!
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blackened Sea Bass!

icYnTMhpOPEXXmiin8-u3Q.text: My friend and I were looking for a simple sushi restaurant near our hotel, Aria but the one inside the hotel was booked.  So we walked over to the next building and finally decided on Mastro's since I loved the one in Beverly Hills.    It didn't disappoint..the service was A+..our waitress kept a close eye on us to refill any drinks and was very knowledgable about the menu.  The Maine lobster was exquisite and the asparagus crisp and seasoned.  My poor friend ordered sushi which she didn't like because there was chocolate in the sauce.  Chocolate?!?  The lemon drop martini was awesome.  It came to the table smoking and kept on smoking for awhile. . We shared a delicious dessert.  $250 dinner for two..well worth it.  Ambiance was superb in the treehouse.. Service was respectful, reliable and solid.. Food was delish..

D-TIM9VVveoL_xCmGh7-wQ.text: Wow...where do I begin?! We came here as a family just for the great Mastro's experience, and boy were we amazed. To start off, my two older sons shared the Boston clam and chowder, I shared the lobster bisque with my youngest(soup portions are big enough to share), and my husband ordered the escargot. All of it was the bomb .com.     For the main course we shared the sides of corn in creme, mashed potatoes w/ lobster, and the best mac in cheese this world has ever seen. My oldest son got the bone in fillet, the best dish of the night.. (yes I said dish). I got the scallops as well as my middle one, perfectly cooked,and the sauce was heaven with the bread. My husband got the New York strip, which was cooked perfectly and very delicious!!!! My little one had a little of each of our plates ;).     The dessert was really good especially their signature butter cake. Service was amazing, and our waiter George was awesome.    Thank you Mastro's Ocean Club for the dining experience that I will never forget.

HvAmYIkkKj804cYD7qpgzw.text: Honestly - one of the best new York strips I've had... just amazing.  Martinis are easily 3 drinks and well worth the $19 price tag.  The best meal I've ever had in Vegas.

hTK1mOuKIfSKaMtkio0W_w.text: This is now my 4th trip there and I wouldn't be doing the place justice If I didn't write a review. Steaks: huge, cooked right, and delicious. Seafood- fresh fresh fresh.  On the late fall the stone crab claws are the largest I've ever seen.   Prices: on par w the rest of SIN CITY for a high end place  The real difference is the service. We literally had 7 people taking care of a table of 4. They are on top of everything.  If you want a high end meal or want to impress business clients, this is a no brainer.

5LIGcb0kbEsndI9-2emi9w.text: If I could give this place 100 stars I would.    Found this steakhouse on Yelp and 4  1/2 stars rarely disappoints so I made reservations via Open Table.  I found a few websites suggesting other steakhouses but I found them all to be owned by famous people and didn't want to dine at place based on being known by their owners.  I'm so glad I went with Mastro's.  So first off, yes, it is in a mall but I had no issues with that.  We sat in the 'treehouse' which faced all the high-end stores but never did I think it was awkward.  I mean....high-end steakhouse in a high-end mall, surrounded by high-end retail stores.  Nothing wrong with that.  What really counts is the FOOD and ambiance.  For a little less than $200, my husband and I each ordered an appetizer, salad, drink, an entree, and shared a side dish.  We had a late lunch so didn't order many sides.  We got the Brussel sprouts which were more than enough for two people.  A third would've been ok too.  The steak was DELSIH!  I have to say prob the best steak I've EVER had and I've had some of the best.  The steak literally MELTS in your mouth and before I even moved my knife to cut it, the tip of the knife t split the top of the steak open, that's how tender their steak is.  At first I was like whoa, $17 for a drink?  Well, you get them for free at the casino for a reason....it's prob watered down and not the best quality alcohol.  $17 actually gets you what appears to be more like two drinks as they leave the shaker on your table and that serves another glass.  By the way, the drinks were all delish as well.  The other highlight of the night, as if it wasn't the food itself wasn't enough, was the staff.  Our waiter Daniel Ellery was awesome.  Not only was he super nice and very courteous, but he was very knowledgeable about the menu.  My pet peeve is when you ask about certain dishes and how they are prepared and the waiter say, "Oh, I don't know.  Let me get back to you."  Anyhow, I really enjoyed our dinner and the ambiance.  Everything was perfect for my birthday weekend, which by the way, they brought out a very lovely chocolate cake.  I'm not usually a sweets person but this cake was sooooo good.  Not too sweet and creamy.  It was delish!  Will definitely be back in the future.

W0OUulDoe7RwAcAWALbz7w.text: Nothing but greatness to be expected from Mastros and once again they lived up to their reputation. This was the first Mastros Ocean Club I have visited and i was very much impressed. DISCLAIMER: They do tend to undercook their steaks but they did take it back and fix my New York strip. And of course we had to try the seafood tower. I love that you can build it yourself! Our waiter was so pleasant and attentive. Seriously he just made the night. Wish I could remember his name but all I remember was thay he was Canadian lol Only because I am a die hard Michael Buble fan lol

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our first Mastros Ocean Club
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our seafood tower...enough to feed 2
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I forgot to mention the complimentary dessert....amazing!!

fmDEcH-Wle0Ivj0v6h4RCw.text: Great food as always.  Our server Elizabeth was perfect.  She was very attentive and literally went the extra mile to make sure we had everything we needed or if we wanted anything else.  The steaks are by far always the best!  The setting in the Mall there I found to be quite loud and not the typical high end feeling you get at their other places.  What drew us there was the food and they definitely were spot on there!  5 stars for the food.

yxJf3-hrXYg9WAYA2eC4Bw.text: When my husband and I visited Vegas this weekend, we both had a craving for delicious seafood.  Unfortunately for us, many of the restaurants that served seafood were primarily steakhouses.  We read a few yelp reviews for Mastro's among others and eventually made a reservation here for dinner that same night.  When we arrived, we were seated inside the "tree house" that's suspended in the center of the shops.  We ordered a bottle of Shiraz, the halibut and the sea bass encrusted with their special seasoning, and macaroni and cheese.  Our water was never more than half empty at any given time throughout our entire meal.    The food and wine turned out to be amazing!  Our waiter (I wish I remembered his name) was kind enough to ask if we wanted the rest, including the wine, boxed up since I had been feeling sick to finish it.    A few tips if you visit, the sides are quite large, probably enough to split with up to 4 people.  Trust your waiter/waitress.  Ours suggested the preparation we had on our fish and we were not disappointed.  And the price is a bit high but well worth it in the end.  I would definitely go back here again.

tM3ElhE0WrSydrcM7v9LhA.text: The restaurant is located in a mall which doesn't usually scream fine dinning. However the food and service are excellent. I would suggest the seafood tower! You pick from a large selection of fresh seafood. Comes out smoking with dry ice.

o3yWWWU3LD2yDOaczPIiBg.text: Delicious from beginning to end. The appetizers, the steak, the fish, the sides - all made to perfection. And the dessert, the warm butter cake, absolutely incredible. Too bad we were too full to finish it all. It's enough for 4 to 6 people, so leave some room for dessert. But don't leave without trying it. The service was wonderful too. Oh, I forgot to mention the bread! Fabulous. Just incredible all around.

K5oBpl1AKM12Aen9Fq_cCQ.text: Great service, amazing food, and awesome live jazz band. It's a great restaurant. Love the architecture of this place. I had the Burrata salad, Ocean Club Crab Cakes, Chopped Salad, Chilean Sea Bass, and Filet Steak. My favorites were tomato & mozzarella and the chilean sea bass. Very good quality.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab Cakes
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salad
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burrata Salad

v6jnBpQI0cZtNBIepXXijQ.text: We stopped by at Mastro's for our Valentines Day Dinner last night.  When we arrived we were sat inside their Treehouse.....a fairly unique dining experience.  The Treehouse is their main dining area which is shaped like a Treehouse that overlooks the center of the Crystals' Mall.  For starters, we ordered their stone crabs abd lobser bisque.....both were very average.   The bisque was watery....not very thick and rich.  For our entrees, we had the sea bass and rack of lamb....both very flavorful and super tasty.  For sides, we had their creamed corn and lobster truffled gnocci....both were extremely, extremely rich (too much cream and truffled cheese).....but very flavorful.  For desert, we had their famous butter pound cake with ice cream and chocolate starwberrries......the cake was very average......I can get more flavorful pound cake at Safeway...the chocolate strawberries were good, but nothing spectacular.  The service was average at best.   Overall, the food was good, not great. One extra star for the cool treehouse dining experience.

5Q22MmT_VdapL4y3J-pGnA.text: The $100 up charge on the credit card was resolved through the diligent work of AMEX and it looks like the manager is the one who padded the bill after we finished dinner. So apologies go out to deon because the vitriol should be directed to the manager. Aside from that, this was one of the most perfect dinner experiences that I've had in a while in Vegas. I received an email from someone in corporate but have had no follow up after that. A gift certificate or something would have been nice because they certainly f***ed up.

2CmhSS5JtCgR-JncsCorWQ.text: My wife planned a birthday surprise dinner for me last night. We have dined at the Beverly Hills Mastro's and were always happy with the food and service. Well we were more than happy with her choice. Our waiter Troy was great. He made us feel welcome and assured us that there was no rush. He decanted a special bottle of wine that we brought with us from the Aventura Winery in Paso Robles. This is a "big" red wine so we both chose the filet mignon with baked potato and sauteed brussel sprouts. The filet was best I have had in many years anywhere-hands down. Cooked to perfection and melted in mouth.  At the end of the meal Troy brought out their signature dessert, a warm vanilla pound cake served with real whipped cream topped with a candle. This is not your grandma's pound cake. It was just decadent and there was more than enough to share. I rarely give 5 Star reviews to any restaurant but this was a 5 Star experience in every sense. If you are in Vegas don't hesitate to book a table here you won't be disappointed.   PS the ambience was enhanced by a excellent piano player who had just the right mix of songs to accompany a leisurely dinner.

QRXSby3QIfbklydyO9eSLg.text: Since I had a good experience at the Mastro's Steakhouse in OC, I decided to try this Mastro's Ocean Club in Las Vegas and let me tell you, I had an even better experience.  It's probably due to the fact that I LOVE SEAFOOD!!!  I was tempted to get an appetizer tower but there were other things on the  menu that I wanted to try that were actually served hot so we opted out of the tower.  Instead we ordered the following:  *Seared Ahi Tuna - (just as good as the first time I had it in OC) *Sauteed Sea Scallops - 3 pieces of jumbo scallops with three pieces of bread, in a rich creamy sauce.  AMAZING!!!  I just found out I'm moderately allergic to scallops but I love jumbo scallops so it doesn't stop me from trying them anyways. SOO YUMMY. * Chilled Alaskan King Crab Claws - came out served is a cool bowl with dry ice.  Loved it.  Way A lot more tasty than shrimp cocktail or lobster option.    This was definitely more than filling but it didn't stop me from ordering a Chilean Sea Bass for my entree since my favorite fish are chilean sea bass or cod anything.  I'm use to ordering these type of fishes miso style but since it wasn't an option, I decided to order it pan seared.  It came out nice fluffy and buttery.  I ordered it cooked medium.  I really liked the consistency of the fish and how it was cooked but wouldn't have minded some type of sauce to give that extra umph.  To be honest, I couldn't enjoy it as much because I was so stuffed!  I really wanted to try the infamous warm butter cake but I guess I'm just going to have to wait it out until the next time.  I will definitely come back :)

uThZkP_rcgPxYCtpdKo2EA.text: One of the best places with top notch service, atmosphere, fine dining in  Vegas.   I always get the 18 oz bone in filet with lobster mash.   They have an extensive wine list aswell.   Great place for a business meeting.

TR4UsJSxE6IrSmdZJnRKzA.text: Decor was very nice, cool tree house in the mall.     Service lacked as it was very slow and took a long time to get the bill...  Portions were HUGE,  wish we knew that before ordering because no one finished their meal and what a waste since we were out of town.  I hope the bus boy ate my wifes left over chicken.  It was a whole chicken it looked like!!  But it was sure good...  My wife did not like the live music nor the singer, she looked good, but really did not sound good.  Plus they ruined a classic REM song.   Overall ok and a bit over the top, would I go back?  no...

itBJOEqRwA_EdzxeO09nRA.text: Oh yeah...awesome restaurant....delicious food, excellent service. Add this to the Vegas must visit restaurants. Btw, we had the fresh Arctic Char...enough for three people, along with the Mac n cheese side. I had the King Crab legs. Just delicious. Enjoy!

LMzEEPO2NJnvKCrxbyL4IQ.text: This restaurant in a tree house was an all around great experience. The service from start to finish was top notch, our food was so good, table side prep and presentation was perfect. A True fine dining experience. Most important thing was the home made whipped cream! If it's winter time have a hot chocolate with this whip cream on it if it's summer put it on anything and everything. We ate it by itself!!!!

g1neJGHEYcE0p7LuFPKRZg.text: Prettiest bar ever. 100 bottles of each brand lined up. Waitress made a teeny mistake with our oyster order.

Jq3VuH36k-jrY9n6GTS9-w.text: Great restaurant! I've never been to an Ocean Club, and everyone in my party loved this one. Something different, their martini's are actually 2 martini's in one order for around $19, you keep your shaker which gives you the second. My staple is dirty with Chopin and blue cheese olives. Theirs was excellent! All of the food was good, but much much bigger portions then expected - strange to me for this type of restaurant. Didn't get desert, but the drinks and food was great. Everyone got something different and everyone love their dish. Great place!

njwFV5Q3HrhKh8vkIdSFvw.text: A snobby Canadian boy took me to the Mastro's Ocean Club. The conversation didn't go that well and he was as full of himself as he could be. Luckily, the delicious food and wine made up for the sour date.  We started with the oysters (Blue Points I think). They were fresh and delicious. We then shared the seared scallops and bone-in fillet mignon as our main dishes. The scallops were cooked perfectly. They were a bit creamy for my taste but overall a solid dish. The bone-in fillet mignon, omg, was soooo good, probably the best steak I've had in the US. The meat was tender yet full of flavor. I was in heaven and couldn't care much less about whatever Mr. Snobby was barking about.   Oh and we shared crab gnocchi as the side dish (with a price tag of $30, a bit steep for a side dish.) I also had a glass of Pinot Noir (ZD '09) to go with the steak - the wine didn't have enough body, but it went very well with the meat.   I knocked off one star because they served the scallops and the steak at the same time in the same plate, which I really didn't like. I would prefer having them separately. The scallops should have come first and then the steak as two individual courses. This way I could have really taken my time to taste each dish.   Overall, I really liked this restaurant. As for my date, I found out he wasn't all that annoying anyways. He was kinda cute and was quite thoughtful when I wasn't feeling well at the end of the meal. I may come back to the Mastro's next time I am in Vegas. Will I go out with Mr. Snobby again? I think so.

L7E27NBiT0u-NWSU-z7MbQ.text: Perfect first experience at Mastro's! Went there to celebrate our anniversary and they really did make it feel like a special occasion. We were seated in the treehouse - beautiful and romantic, great date spot.  Really unique cocktail list -definitely not the usual boring drinks. I tried the blueberry martini, didn't really care for the taste since I prefer sweet drinks, but it was strong and something different. Cocktails were a little pricey at about $18 each, but you pay for the ambiance.  Started w escargot, I've never had it served in the shell before. Very pretty and delish - served w clarified butter and garlic. Great selection of yummy breads too.  We shared the 18oz bone in Kansas city strip w twin lobster tails (1 butter poached, 1 vanilla tempura fried). Sides - twice baked potato and brussel sprouts w bacon. Steak was cooked perfectly medium, tender, juicy and flavorful. They knew we were sharing so everything was split for us. Poached lobster was good, cooked perfectly. The tempura lobster... mmm I'm not a huge fan. It was good, but a LOT of batter and I didn't really get even a hint of vanilla. Glad we decided to try it both ways.  Twice baked potato was good, but I've had better. They didn't bring it out till about 10min after the rest of the food because the chef didn't like how the first one looked, so he made a new one. They took it off the bill w out us asking. Nice that the chef has attn to detail vs just cranking out the orders. Brussel sprouts used to be fried w pancetta but they recently changed the menu, so no more pancetta. They did accommodate by doing it w bacon instead, but not really the same - thin sliced bacon just can't compare to chunks of pancetta. We got the butter cake comp since it was an anniversary. Super cute of them to do a candle. The cake is enough for 3 or 4 to share, served w vanilla ice cream and a huge bowl of fresh whipped cream. So bad, but soooo good!  Service was excellent, our server Mike was friendly and knowledgeable. The rest of the wait staff were great too. I checked out our neighbors food, I'm looking forward to trying the seabass, seared tuna, or crab salad next time.  In the end there's not a huge difference w steak joints - they generally serve the same cuts, appetizers and sides. But Mastro's stands apart with its service and intimate classy ambiance.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mastro&#39;s treehouse
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Escargot
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Butter cake

p2KmR_ReCnL3iumtQzXnlg.text: I love love love the Chilean Sea Bass at Mastro's! Delicious! Mastro's maes my top 5 favorite restaurants list for sure!  Service was excellent. Entertainment (guy on the keyboard & a singer) at the bar was a nice touch, but we were right next to them, and it was a bit too loud. Sittng further away woulda been better, but it was okay.  Complimentary bread & butter: yummy! Boyfriend loved the pretzel bread.  Crab CakeS: yes, they give you 2 crab cakes. Lol! Hate when resataurants only give you 1 and charge you an arm and a leg. This is not the case here. They were big, chunky and delicious! Great for sharing with 4 people.  CHILEAN SEA BASS: really...need I say more? Like butter!  Petite Fillet: melt in your mouth good!  Warm butter cake served with ice cream and whipped cream: another must.

teqdidibY2RDT6tSPd7NfA.text: Not loving this steak house.  Their seafood tower has very small pieces.  The steak is good, but the sides are small, too.  They do serve a large drink, which I love.  I don't appreciate the bartenders whispering about the guests and trying to not make it obvious.

WZ0XGc0Z3TQ5H15nCc0gnQ.text: There are three steakhouses in the country that are in a class by themselves.  The III Forks chain, Jean George (Aria/Vegas), and the Mastro's chain. The warm pretzel rolls, gigantic but perfectly ripe salads, perfect meat, and amazing desserts make this an absolute can't lose.

S20Di41p0bDfH151rL2PLQ.text: Mastro's Beverly Hills is my favorite steakhouse in LA, so I was eager to check out the Vegas branch. While there are obviously similarities, here are the differences:  1. There's a separate room inside what's called the Treehouse, but it looks more like a giant wooden stomach. Which is appropriate. I'd strongly recommend getting seated there and not because of the view (The "breathtaking" scenery consists of every high-end luxury goods store on this planet. Then again, I know people who enjoy staring at $5000 handbags from a distance.). It's because the other half of the restaurant looked packed as hell. I wouldn't be surprised if the diners were eating their neighbors steaks by accident.   2. There's more fish on the menu - hence the name - although there was no noticeable difference shellfish selection-wise. Sadly, Billy Ocean wasn't singing at the piano. Mastro's, you screwed up on a golden opportunity here.  3. The bar's wall o' liquor is an impressive monument to chronic liver failure. Then again, this is a city where it's legal to walk down the street slurping Everclear out of a foot-long Eiffel Tower.   4. Steak's great. But not comparable to the Beverly Hills branch.

Wls4q5-R1szZYr3b0A-UzA.text: Completely disappointed by Maestro's restaurant in Las Vegas.  I read such wonderful reviews on yelp and was really looking forward to it. My husband and I went there for our 1 year wedding anniversary dinner. I made reservations a month before the big day and requested to have a bottle of champagne upon our arrival.    We ordered the beef Carpaccio to start.  It took about 20 minutes for them to take that initial order and another 20-30 minutes for them to bring it out.  The beef Carpaccio was SO salty and came with a weird Caesar salad combination on top as aside. The dressing of the salad ruined the flavor of the meat if the salt didn't already to it.   As our main entrees we ordered a petite filet and lamp chops. DRY, DRY, DRY! I'm sorry but if we are paying over +$50 a plate we expect mouth watering tender meat.  That wasn't the case at all. So disappointed.   To end the evening we were so disappointed by the slow service, the bad appetizer and unsatisfactory entree we didn't even want dessert. As the waiter brings the +$200 check he just says Happy Anniversary and walks away.  No complimentary dessert or glass of champagne as most places would have done. Oh well...I will go back to SAGE inside Aria which is the BEST steak house I have ever been too.

bGMZCTkrzd0i2gKFrf7snw.text: Amazing food.fabulous service.I had king crab legs and lobster mashed potatoes.friends had filet min and ribeyes cooked perfectly. Do go treat yourself

5UOTJq0WsnPDkWteZJcRSg.text: The experience was not unique and the ambiance where we were seated for reservation was awkward for a fine dining experience.  Not what you look for when you visit Las Vegas.  My lobster roll was ok as best and my wife's fish was just ok as well.  Drinks were good.

ygA0K8wrtKtBWvMnFmoTjw.text: Obviously, this is a steakhouse, so it goes without saying that this place isn't built for vegetarians.  However, I enjoyed what I had - broccoli, green beans, and some mac and cheese.  The service was excellent, as was the wine, the bread provided, and the birthday cake they made for my boyfriend.  The look of the place is the coolest part, though, especially from the outside looking in.  It's located inside a mall, and words can't quite describe the architecture of the structure the restaurant is in, but it's neat and adds to the experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eZ0sEqzZuygoLStcBIKA9Q.text: We decided to treat ourselves for the Christmas holiday, and we were not disappointed!! We live in Las Vegas and have gone to several of the $$$$ restaurants on the strip, this is by far the best!! The service is impeccable, the food is delicious and the ambiance is perfect! I had the filet cooked to perfection, my husband had the baked sea bass and was over the moon about it! You must save room for the warm butter cake-it's out of this world and can feed 2+ people!

ug8BpSu3pmm0wru_xWskMg.text: Nom nom nommy noms. We were in Vegas for an anniversary trip and needed a place to indulge and Mastro's was a great choice. We made reservations a few days before and got a phone call to confirm. It's located in Crystal Shops at City Center which is connected to Aria.  We were a bit early but were still seated as soon as we arrived. The restaurant from outside err inside the mall looks so cool and it's even nicer from inside. Very nice ambience which calls for a relaxing meal. Now for the food: The bread basket had only one bread i liked. Basic french bread...typical. Then we started with drinks. I knew I would be having wine as opposed to my typical cocktail while DH unusually ordered beer so we were living wild! I needed help with finding the right wine to pair with my meal and the waiter was very helpful.  After tasting two wines, i settled for the Remy Pannier Chenin Blanc which was excellent with my Alaskan King Crab Legs. DH had the Alaskan Amber which was great with his meat haaaaaa. For sides, we went with Asparagus and Scalloped Potatoes. Both sides complimented the filet and crab legs and the meal was very tasty AND filling. To finish, we had the Creme Brulee and ice cream which were decadent.  This was one of my favorite experiences in Vegas. To top it off, we received a call the next day thanking us for choosing them and asking how our experience was. I would love to stop by again our next visit to the Sin City!

J4oHQOzZfo3IbbZ5Ogg0Bw.text: It was the top steak I ever tasted.... perfectly cooked as requested. All the food tasted great. It was even a better experience for me than their branch at Newport Beach Service was excellent... our server was friendly and very helpful  Would definitely come back for my next visit in Vegas

Sgf20zm-bl-XiHKmRo59xQ.text: I am going to be 100% and not waste anyone's time.  Butter cake. Best I have ever had. So sweet buttery, that homemade whip cream adds a nice sugary surprise. That is all I get when I go here and totally worth it.  THE VERDICT: Butter Cake. See YA!

PacURkO8l9mTkITwrHiA3A.text: Delicious food, friendly and attentive staff, and an all around good atmosphere. The seafood was excellent, the filet was cooked properly, and the wine selection is good. The dining area is visually striking and the booth seating is quite comfortable. Prices are a bit on the high end, but not outrageous by any means.

FKZsCIfEpkFp2q1ml7tulw.text: Hands down one of the best restaurants on the strip! The steaks come out on a 400 degree sizzling plate and the sides are to die for! I'm a regular here and come every week. The staff is amazing, the management is outstanding and my favorite bartender is Randy!!! Although a little pricey it is worth every single dollar! I don't know what i would do without this amazing restaurant. Keep up the amazing work!.

1yUzk6859ada92dorPEktA.text: Amazing service!!! The food was awesome and the service was simply amazing. We had a group of 8 and we honestly felt like we were the only people in the building. Our cups were never empty and our bellies were full. Huge portions of food as well. Definitely a must visit when in Vegas.

8jQBR7L6dDZ_udb2MFlbzQ.text: The decor in this restaurant is pretty amazing even though it's in a high profile mall.  Who would've known!  The service, food, and drinks were all delicious.  They our large party of all ladies at the high tables with the high stools.  It probably would've been easier if we were seated at the regular tables as it was also very dim in that section of high tables.   The steak and the fish were all very delicious and large portions.  So ladies it's ok to share!

5lB9w3L7aRTWhC_6CYGN5w.text: The food and service was on point here at Mastro's.   I always heard great things about it and I am so glad I finally tried it.   To start, I had the steamed mussels. Although the mussels were small the sauce and cheeses croutons were incredible. I took advantage of all the various breads they had in the basket just to dip in the sauce and Indulge more.   For dinner I had the Hawaiian tuna served sashimi style. It was seared with Asian inspired flavors and didn't make you feel so heavy. I will say that it is a quite a portion and initially seeing it can be overwhelming.  They warn about the size of the side portions so please think it through or else you will have way too much. I had a table of 4 and we battled to eat everything cause it was yummy but man I came out of there a fatty wack. I LOVED the Cream corn and Alaskan Crab truffle gnocchi. Done deal with those two! I had the lobster mash and yes it had big chunks of lobsters and it was good but not as great as it's hype was. We also had sauteed broccoli and honestly it looked steamed. They serve you the sides which I thought was a great service.   They gave us their signature butter cake. Topped with ice cream and fresh fruit with a side of whipped cream. If you even last this long to have dessert then order it. Warning-the portion is again good for 3-4 person so think it through before you order.   I would highly recommended this place. It's ambiance is okay because it still does feel like you are still in the shopping area even though you can't see it too much. Great service and great food. You really can't go wrong.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna served sashimi style. Large portions!

Ne7ju1uZtfJaxJS0txVmrw.text: Great attention and great food. I had the bone in filet, oysters, scalloped potatoes and truffle fries. The steak was tender and extraordinary, highly recommended. The oysters were fresh and the scalloped mashed potatoes were nice and buttery. I can't find a single negative at this fine dining establishment.   I was too full to eat the infamous butter cake there so I took it home. This is an absolute must. I could have not chosen a better steakhouse.

o-7Pll1liX7TTC76klB5Ew.text: The food was bomb. Especially the shrimp and scalloped potatoes. However this review is for Stephen who was amazing. Excellent server.

VUBeBuW-6ZXlkAAxQu6kdw.text: I had major food coma and forgot what i was going to write. I'll update this when i do wake up. Service is def top notch.

Z4Nq7uy4KsmxDsaA_Ndk9Q.text: Very good experience staff was very attentive food was delicious.  I will highly recommend this to anyone wanting a good mill in Vegas

cMnpWJ8SmHAIqcr4KuYpbA.text: This Vegas Mastros location is my absolute favorite compared to the Bev Hills and Malibu one.  I guess i just like the more airy, modern vibe there. The BH location is kind of old and stuffy, while the Malibu one is cramped and the vibe is weird. The energy felt so much more free flowing and airy at this vegas location. I'm assuming because it's much newer. But I love it. The other ones seemed to cramp the tables too close together. As far as the food...amazing. The foie gras was delicious and the portions were generous , seafood platter...yum! The steak was perfect. Thank you Mastros for another yummy experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yhblPECSZBurvUiZPbjNQA.text: Delicious restaurant overall. Had crab cakes as appetizer, 16 oz ny strip which was absolutely delicious, and as mentioned the butter cake dessert is a must. Overall great restaurant.

z_GPXcvgDB3uvHq2esq1Tw.text: This is the epitome of fine dining! The restaurant is located inside what looks like a mall on the strip, and is in what looks like a cage. I came here for my girlfriends birthday. The service was excellent. We arrived at 5:30 pm, on a Saturday because we knew it would fill up for dinner time. They also only opened half hour before that. They provided us with delicious bread, one tasted like a pretzel. We each had a mixed drink. Mine was good, but my girls drink was excellent. It was a strawberry mixed drink. It tasted perfect! I ordered the largest steak; a 22oz. ribeye. It may have been the best steak I have ever tried in my life. Even the fat parts disintegrated in my mouth. My girl had the filet mignon. It was also delicious.   For her birthday they brought her out a slice of cake that said 'Happy Birthday!' along with a fresh batch of whipped cream. All in all it was a memorable and splendid experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 22 oz. Ribeye
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry mixed drink

B4Ykl80sD-_554bt9nwiAQ.text: Maestros Ocean Club for dinner with clients. Its actually in the mall upstairs in the back so took a little while to find it. Good wine list, excellent service and the seafood tower was a hit with clients. Overall very solid dinner

mr2SStnds8jpYNi0HQN39A.text: Went there with some coworkers. Outstanding service and food. The steaks are amazing.

mQVM5SvRMK1Uu5hXZ_mssg.text: Wow!  We had live Maine lobster and a New York steak which were absolutely perfect but the highlight might have been the Blue Point oysters which were sweet, tender and delicious. Wait a minute, that wasn't the highlight!  The highlight was the service which was attentive, friendly and helpful. Our waitress was so genuine that I thought I had been transported to somewhere in the Midwest. This place is a must go!

ZvbsKp3twYimpbV4H9YdVQ.text: One of the best meals that I have had in a long time.  Looking forward to repeating.  $300 for 2 for dinner.

tgQeZpadkFjFwq0O8MMfyA.text: Mediocre steak (for this level place). Great lobster. Unimpressive decor overlooking mall. Very good Mac & Cheese (though not best). Extra large dessert, with great whipped cream.

FIxKnrRARO0nocYCft_Iug.text: Every single time we go to Las Vegas, we make sure to make reservation with Mastro's right after hotel reservation... I love to eat at bird cage... Service is EXCELLENT!!!  They do everything possible to make me feel welcome all the time.

fxvWxuFmZYuyTejoZyF02A.text: Looong overDO review for fab restaurant! Hubby & I have eaten here several  times! Every time the food & service has been simply FLAWLESS!! Steaks are mouthwatering, sea bass is cooked to perfection, mac n cheese is to die for, lobster mashed potatoes are sinful & cream corn is sensational also generous size side portions!! TROY is the BEST server! Overall this restaurant is Simply PERFECT!

fXMZG0OsAlBbzPby8amEfw.text: Pretzel bread was amazing. Must try their seafood tower! Even the lemons were on point with the freshness! Their food is family style and the waiters come around and serve the food to everyone at the table . Mac and cheese was delicious !! Great date spot and the treehouse was a great atmosphere . Will go back

Ds_O1kWz5a2Adi38uj0qXA.text: Outstanding! We had planned to eat at Sage at Aria, but ran too late so  Mastros was a happy last minute accident. Even though our waitress was in training, the service was great, the food and ambience was excellent. Had lamb chops and twin lobster tails, brussel sprouts & scalloped potatoes....all cooked and seasoned perfectly. The piano bar singers were very good and not C+  cheesy like most Vegas entertainment. Dinner was very expensive, but excellent.

ZoPSyixPmuJp73LZWZ4pOg.text: The usual great live entertainment in a brightly lit mall setting. Bone in ribeye is perfectly seasoned. Appetizers and sides are great for sharing among 2 to 3 people. I recommend the Mambo Salad, sugar snap peas, and the lobster mash! Eating in a mall just doesn't feel as nice although we did see Tyson Chandler from the Mavs. Dessert is also a huge portion...enough to feed 3-4!

plhq8g0mcXunNJKDyB6WtA.text: My husband ordered the New York steak. The steak was excellent. We really enjoyed the dinner and will be back.

8pZ10aSRsmj4AY15Ks3BaA.text: I wanted this to knock my socks off, but it fell short.  Mostly due to the service, partly due to the strange atmosphere and the fact that they were 40 minutes late seating us when we had reservations and arrived early for them.  First, the bar.  There is a beautiful bar, great drink list, nice bartenders, piano and lounge singer... all setting up for a relaxing setting, right?  Nope, the lounge singer, with piano accompaniment, sang songs by Katy Perry and Rhianna, and songs like "Call Me Maybe".  WTF?  It was just so weird!   We had 8:30 reservations, arrived around 8:20, and didn't get a table around 9:10.  That's just bad planning on their part, I believe.  Now, the service was the worst part of our meal. The menu is very simple, with no explanations of any of the items.  You would rely on your server to elaborate on preparations, etc, when the menu contains none.  This was where the meal went off the tracks.  There was just a list of all the available entrees (lots of different fish, etc), and our server showed up and said, "are you guys ready?".  I said something like, "we're unsure of the preparations available for each fish"... and he said something like, "oh, we can do blackened... you know... whatever......".  SERIOUSLY?  That's it?  So guess what I ordered... Blackened halibut!  I didn't know how else to order!  Even the salads, the one we ordered was the spicy mambo salad, had no explanation.  What the hell is a spicy mambo salad?  I don't know, so thank god we liked it.  It was like a spicy caesar salad and was very good.  My halibut was delicious, my husband's tuna was great.  Portions are RIDICULOUSLY HUGE.  I wouldn't suggest 2 side dishes for 2 people, just choose one and share it.  We had so much food left over, it was depressing to leave it all to be thrown away, but it's Vegas!  We're not gonna pack leftovers around all night!  After we ordered, the server at the table next to us went through the available preparations with his table, and after hearing them, I would have definitely liked to try several of them.  I was very disappointed by our server.  All in all, the food is delicious, but good food is not hard to find in Vegas.  The service is a big part of making a great meal, and this was lackluster.  Not sure I would return or recommend this restaurant, with all the great options in this town.

OKIc2O-PRAn4EbTGH1rDWw.text: Great service! I love their complimentary bread basket. It has about 4 or 5 kinds of bread in it and all of them are so good. Especially their pretzel! Their steak? Awesome. Thick, juicy and tender. Escargot....hmm not my plate.  Scallop is good.  Lamb chop. Best one I've ever had!!!!!! it's a must have.  They also gave us a slice of chocolate cake for my sisters birthday, which was awesome.   We paid around/0ver $350 for 3 people. So it is very pricey! but it's worth the great food and experience.  I would totally come back!!!

wXhuR1Cyuq9gkeCmhMJd0Q.text: Huge portions and great service. You can also bring your own wine.  Pricey but worth it! I had two additional meals due to the leftovers and cake;)

1fFHr32uCc-eDakPExt9Mw.text: Well, since we were in LV we visited our usual place for a Sat night dinner. Glad we did as it is always top notch.  The Con's: * The bathrooms are up stairs. A real bummer when your all cocktailed up and have to navigate carpeted stairs. There is an elevator, but you kind of feel odd waiting for an elevator to go up one floor.  The Pro's:  * Staff is always top notch, from the hostess, to the bus guys, all are great and seem to have been trained very well. Anyone can help you with anything. Never do you hear "I will tell your waiter". They just get things done and do it well.  * Food I always top notch. Never had a better steak on the strip.   * Great vibe and crowd. Upscale and nice looking crowd. No torn jeans and camo here. It's nice seeing folks get cleaned up and dressed for dinner.  I will keep this review short as I have already reviewed them several times and don't want to repeat comments. If you have not tried this place, you should. Top notch for sure.

5SbZSPXabyxJHNGEYPUWpw.text: Have to say one of the top 5 meals I have every had. The service was great, sides were great, the Wagyu beef special was incredible. I would go back and highly recommend this restaurant!

1ySDh19ZrkN6UL00Bs4UgA.text: Mastro's Ocean Club Las Vegas - I think we just had a bad night!  I didn't think it was all that... Good but not oh my gosh good. What really made it bad was our waiter.  When you spend a lot of money at a restaurant you expect great service and our waiter stood around talking and laughing with other waiters and barely paid any attention to us.  Our drinks were empty multiple times for long periods of time.  Took him forever to take our order and acted like he worked at a dinner instead of an upscale restaurant.  I'm sure if we had a different server I would feel better about spending hundreds of dollars on our meal but we got what we got and unfortunately I have to base my experience on that.

HA5mkj7nlfdDhvRwdd8yDQ.text: service was great, food was excellent and plentiful. Bring your appetite. mushrooms and of course their signature lobster mash was amazing

vsIHgpIiLqG5oSDKry6xaA.text: Truly debated rather to cancel or not our reservation.  Prices were kind of high and after all, you eat in a "mall" if a luxury one. Glad we didn't.  We had a wonderful evening.  The food is plentiful so don't even think of not sharing side dishes.  As for the desert, we took their specialty, which is the butter cake.  It's ENORMOUS and plenty for two, maybe for three.  And it comes with a huge bowl of delicious whip cream. The wine list was a nice surprise too and we ordered a Pinot Noir Chateau St Jean.  Very nice and under $30. The atmosphere is another good surprise.  Feels much nicer being in the "nest" than seeing it from the outside. The choices in Las Vegas are plenty, but this one is definitely a win.

wo3U5DVJEKbew9mfIW10cQ.text: We've eaten at the Mastro's in Chicago before and we were looking forward to a great steak. The low down for the Mastro's in Vegas is below:  A) Service: Superb. Our waiter was fantastic. Best overall service in a restaurant we've had in a long time.  B)  Atmosphere:  OK. We sat "outside" so that we had a view of the mall. The atmosphere here is really not conducive to a great experience. You feel like you are eating in a mall food court. They should really try to find a better location with better ambiance.   C) Food. Really good ( almost) There were 4 of us and we all ordered some variation of a fillet. Mine came out perfect, but my wife ordered hers medium rare and it came out close to well done. We were having such a good time with our friends that she didn't want to spoil the scene and return the steak. Otherwise everything was great including the shaker that they bring to your table with your cocktail, so that you actually can 2 glasses of booze for $18 rather than one.   Overall, another great steakhouse in Vegas. Probably won't come back. Not because it was poor, but just because there are so many other places to explore in this restaurant town.

p85jxzNEVTd5TBQ5VC13Ug.text: Horrible food! We go to Mastros in Scottsdale arizona very frequent and this location in Las Vegas was nothing but disappointment. Sent my steak back because it came out over done and then it came back cold. Their scalloped potatoes are my favorite, except at this location they were pure salt. Total disappointment. Don't waste your money here!

xsJliXa0CPbv63nnsij0rg.text: I don't want to repeat what everyone else has said. It really is a fantastic meal. Especially if you're out celebrating something special or romantic. The artistic treehouse canopy is lovely to sit under. The service is phenomenal and thoughtful (when I said I was already getting full after my appetizer, the waiter offered to make my scallops entree an appetizer portion). The gorgonzola mac n cheese is out of this world. The brussel sprouts are excellent. The scallops amazing. The oysters rockefeller were the best I've ever tasted. The Chilean Sea bass also was the best I've ever tasted (my bf had that... I tasted it). Then the warm butter cake... Cuh-ray-zee!!! So unbelievably good. My eyes went all googly and I nearly floated away. And the portions are generous so unless you're like us and were just curious to try many different things, don't order too much. It will be enough.

-ycQhRseVRv-V33JwBQKxA.text: Mastro's is one of my favorite restaurants in town. The menu is wonderful and this is a restaurant where every single dish is perfection. The foie gras is an orgasm in your mouth - yes, that's a thing. Rarely happens, but when it does.... The filet is one of my favorite steaks in this city. I judge a restaurant harshly on their bread service. If you're 5 stars you had better have amazing bread & butter, Mastro's does :). A restaurant should pay attention to every detail! Plus, the restaurant is in a treehouse, which makes for such a fun but elegant setting. Decor & service on point. They're making me a fort for my next visit - a promise is a promise.  Yup. Acing the dining experience Mastro's. I rarely give 5 stars because to me it equals perfection in every way.

t1k5OKXbaLFsTLySv46scA.text: Amazing food:) They treated me like a princess. The architecture of the restaurant was so pretty.

QcSNC4RLEX9IoccXa6r5QQ.text: Awesome service. Meals was phenomenal. View was great. Very open environment other than other Mastro's locations.

6Suss3Cz-UwmHEHzrrcSog.text: While the hostess staff was actually rude and discourteous to us ignoring us for a good two minutes while we stood at the hostess stand and watched them talk badly about a previous guest before even saying hello or looking in our direction our experience in the restaurant was still really good.   We went here for our anniversary and were blown away. We shared the tomahawk steak and shared it with macaroni & cheese and Brussels sprouts. We shared an amazing bottle of wine that the server suggested. He was extremely knowledgeable and helpful. We had the most romantic dinner and the butter cake for dessert was life changing! If you don't get the butter cake did you even go to Maestros?!   They even wrapped up the bone so we could take it home to our pup!! $350 well spent, this was our 3rd time there and we will most definitely be back!!

kJSnoh-uPIg0L4otH5-Slw.text: Our food tour brought us to the restaurant and we had vanilla ice cream with cheesecake it was perfect match when the ice cream was cold and the cheesecake was warm and I usually don't like sweet but it was perfect it wasn't so much loaded sugar

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our food tour bought us here and I love the cheese cake vanilla ice cream , I didn&#39;t usually like too sweet desert but this is perfect

yzyOvEV3qY5tUQB6-4fbTA.text: I really love steakhouses and good ones but I was not quite satisfied with the dish , I went to Mastro's in dc and it was phenomenal like I loved it. It was my best friend bday and they gave us the buttercake on the house which was very nice . I'm not a fan of extra sweet dessert . The cake was saturated in butter and sugar . We didn't eat it, maybe two bites. We were kinda full. My steak came and it was warm, I understand medium rare but it should be hot as well and I had it with the foie gras butter , good choice by the server. The tuna tartare app was very disappointing, just wasn't a good choice at all.

Bc_doK4nC053yGAAn3d6cA.text: If you haven't enjoyed Mastros ocean club yet then you haven't truly treated yourself to a night out. YES you will love the food. YES you will feel pampered. YES you will enjoy the drinks. And YES you will pay through the nose. Is it worth the price??? YES IT IS! I've been many times and when I leave there I feel as happy as can be... then a few days later I feel the low of the expense. Then I do it all over again and the cycle continues. My favorite is the seared scallops. What I like to do to cut the cost is order a seafood tower, maybe split a truffle gnocchi side and a veggie then order the seared scallops appetizer for entree. Trust me it's plenty of food. You'll get 3 scallops instead of 5 but pay a fraction of the cost.

_CDbc8Bjbk8PY3FDG2s6mA.text: Fantastic service, fantastic food, cool venue.  Portion sizes great, wine list extensive, cocktail list large. Nothing negative to say about Mastro's.  Make a reservation and ask for a table overlooking the balcony of the bird's nest.    We tried a little bit of everything.  To begin, the bread is fantastic.  baguette and pretzel rolls were the standouts, but I love a restaurant the begins with an assortment of complimentary.  The tuna tartare was heavy on the avocado, but surprisingly each bite mixed well with the tuna.  The mambo caesar salad was one of the best salads I've had with a kick of wasabi flavoring in the dressing to clear the sinuses.  For entrees, the table had the sea bass, tartare, lobster, steak, and big eye tuna.  We also shared sauteed spinach and the crab gnocchi.  Everything had a unique spice or rub that made sharing ideal.  The lobster was some of the thickest and freshest I've had.  The tuna was very good and had an Asian flare of black sesame seed rub, but this dish is also presented as an appetizer if you want a half portion.  The sea bass was fantastic fish but a little bland in all.  Steak - just a well-prepared steak nothing more nothing less.  The spinach was fine as a green but the gnocchi, with chunks of crab, was a nice accompaniment to the fish as its creaminess was a nice dipping alternative to change the flavor palette of the meal.  Finally, the butter cake.  Top 3 dessert of all time.  Don't know how they make it and don't wanna know.  I just want to enjoy it again and again . Fantastic.  All items come a la carte so be sure to feast on the sides.  Also inquire about half orders as this restaurant is surprisingly accommodating to changes to how the fish is cooked, changes to ingredients in orders, or sizing.  Mastro's is one of the best.

C4V9rSfBRprN37QX8rcaRw.text: This food was fabulous. I ordered the petite filet. It was cooked to perfection. However, the gorgonzola mac and cheese stole the show. It was delicious. We couldn't stop eating it, but had too because our stomach's would allow us to. By far the best mac and cheese I've ever had in my life! Then our dinner was topped off by signature warm butter cake - which I can see why it's their main attraction. It's crumbly, warm and topped with cold ice cream. The perfect way to end the night. My only suggestion for anyone who comes to this restaurant is to come on an empty stomach.

X61KQPzyWu_mOefksZFY7Q.text: Loved the drinks and atmosphere the sides were great my steak was good on the ends but dry on the inside other than that loved the waiter she was awesome

0kt6CKopIkwppX-5NOk5ZA.text: We really enjoy dropping in to Mastro's Ocean Club for a drink or a nice meal at the bar. Charelle is great. She will take care of you guys for sure. Mastro's is located inside Crystals mall in the City Center. We were there on a Sunday night and just had the most pleasant time.   We had just an appetizer with our drinks. We got the calamari. It was good. It was all calamari rings in a seasoned breading. Delicious... You can never go wrong with calamari and theirs is one of the better ones. We also had the famous signature warm butter cake. DAMN... That really is a delicious dessert. It is like the most perfect butter pound cake topped with a tasty vanilla ice cream, surrounded with strawberry & baby orange slices and drizzled with strawberry sauce. It's so good. It's so rich but worth it if you share it. The bottom of the butter cake has a caramelized crust so when you get to that bite, you're in for a flavor kick. So good. You have to get it... I'm glad we finally tried it.   Service at the bar was exceptional. Charelle, the bartender, made a perfect dirty ketel martini and was such a pleasant person to conversate with. Mastro's is lucky to have her. We enjoyed our time at the bar with her and appreciated her suggestions & customer service. Make sure you look for her. Thank you Mastro's Ocean Club and Charelle! We'll  be back soon... In a few weeks, in fact!

Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

D2ikor6aRfkAQBIK55sHPA.text: Everything was absolutely delicious. My dinner date and I opted to split the Chilean Sea Bass and topped it Bruno Style (two scallops).  Our side dish was Creamed Spinach and Truffle Butter Mushrooms. Dessert was Butter Cake with Vanilla Ice Cream that was dense but not overall sweet. I had ordered a Lemon Drop Martini and the presentation on with the Smokey dry ice was pretty cool.  This a MUST visit place, when in Vegas.

epj2d2bfXiDiVG4eMaIzZA.text: What is there not to love about Mastro's? Perfectly cooked and delicately tender steak is a given, as it should be for any high calibre steakhouse.  The accompanying dishes, wine pairings and cocktails were really what dining at Mastros to a higher level of excellence.   The buttery lobster mashed potato was divinity on a plate.  Smooth, rich and very generously apportioned with large portions of lobster.  The shrimp cocktail was adorned with plump and juicy prawns (what we call them in Oz) and the accompanying horseradish really packs a strong punch.   The only time I eat bread and butter is while dining at restaurants.  I certainly wasn't disappointed by the carefully arranged basket of bread and the purest of butter goodness at Mastros.  A rum based cocktail marked the start of our eating festivities and a good South Australian Shiraz ensured the gleeful fine dining momentum continued throughout.

Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster mashed potato.  The lobster probably died drowning in the glorious butter.
