ppfAUckRvIs6XKn1EpgTNA.text: Great place to celebrate our 15 year anniversary. The food and service was amazing. This is our second time here and will be back again. Thank you for making our celebration super special

pKYWfzPnB3AutXxjSSUpdQ.text: Mastro's is a classic favorite of ours that never fails. We ordered the classic Caesar salad, lobster bisque, two petite filets (medium) with truffle sauce, and the macaroni and cheese. The only down side to the meal was that everything seemed to be VERY salty.  Service and atmosphere was impeccable as always.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A classic favorite!!!
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A little salty but good nonetheless!
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8CRhQGX6bz08i9Wfzb24Sw.text: Good service and high quality food.   Fairly standard steakhouse experience with the addition of a fairly extensive seafood selection. They even have about a dozen sushi options if that is what you enjoy.   Desert was also quite good. We got a butter cake with ice cream and it was superb.

TS4syZAkzNYfCH_qk5_sTA.text: A great bet for a solid meal and good service in Vegas. Our meal was delicious and our server was very friendly and attentive. Eating in the "nest" was neat although it is kinda funny it's the middle of a mall. Would recommend for a good dinner in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ffgCHNs5U2h8mK6OuT5Yqg.text: I'm giving 4.5 stars.  The bone-in rib eye was not as impressive as I had expected. There wasn't as much marbling, and it didn't seem seasoned enough.   The truffle gnocchi = out of this world. This is a def must-try. The lobster mashed potatoes- SUPER legit. But I think my cholesterol level shot up double points from the butter. It was swimming in yellow soup-ey juice, and when I asked the waiter, "Excuse me, is that butter." He responded, "Most people think it's a sauce. But yes, that is butter."  I like how he didn't give me a straight answer first. It sure looked like some sauce!  Bread basket- LOVE.  Seafood appetizer- much more filling than expected.   Interesting layout and concept of being in a mall. It's a place worth trying out for a nice occasion.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread basket
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone-in rib eye

XCCQZ8eUxXH5VkSzMVnTZA.text: Famous for their seafood, famous for their seafood. Between the salmon, swordfish, steak and chicken I tried last night, the seafood won. Steak was decent, but for the price you can get better elsewhere.  The sides: mashed potatoes, creamed spinach, green beans. All great, but really nothing that stood out.  Mastro's is the weird treehouse looking restaurant inside City Center. They have free valet service if you're dining here. Just make sure you park at the right place- NOT Aria, NOT Vdara parking.

RQQnSnJYjjk8sieGg1ovAg.text: Staff and service were good. My steak came out twice the wrong temperature. I ended up just eating the sides which were good. Return visit...probably not.

XyIuLALYBdSAC3Bmyw4_Sw.text: This place has there best seafood in Las Vegas! If you can afford it I highly recoment it

7ClTN0aiYj4R7oXi42dzew.text: Whoa... Don't waste your time or money. There are far too many fantastic choices in Vegas to come here. Shockingly horrible food experience we had for our pre Christmas dinner last Sunday. I do NOT recommend coming here. I can't believe we paid $270 for a mediocre meal... what a disappointment. Fail Mastro's Vegas! Again, I highly, suggest spending your money somewhere else. The one star that I gave them was for, Dalan, our awesome server.   Now, I have been to Mastro's in OC about a dozen times and it has never failed me but in Las Vegas it was a major let down. What happened?! If anything, I expected more out of the Las Vegas location. We ordered:  1. Shrimp cocktail 2. Wagu 8oz. Steak $98 3. Gorgonzola mac and cheese 4. Creamed spinach 4. Creamed corn  5. Key lime pie  The shrimp cocktail was the best thing my boyfriend had, served with their house cocktail sauce. The Wagu steak was cooked medium but was the texture of a pork chop. Unlike the buttery, melt-in-your-mouth goodness they boast of. The Mastro's in OC  Wagu steak was cooked to perfection so I have something to compare it to. Fail Mastro's Las Vegas. The Gorgonzola Mac and cheese was missing salt, it was rather bland. The creamed corn was a bit watery, unlike its usual creamy consistency. The corn was also mushy, probably over cooked. That is always a favorite but they seamed to mess that one up too. The creamed spinach was rich but tolerable. Aside from the shrimp cocktail and key lime pie, the dinner was meh.  Update: 5/24/15  Mastro's reached out to me shortly after our visit but I somehow missed their attempt. After four months of not seeing their message, I immediately called back and spoke to the manager last Saturday. He apologized for our experience and told me that the GM would give me back a call on Sunday... Well, a week later and I hear crickets. No missed calls or messages. Nothing. Wow, this is an even bigger let down. The second fail requires that I update my review... Mastro's kitchen, staff (ie. Management) clean up your act.  I'd take away that one star if I could.

ud_-sQcqyFhql3a-qXkKeg.text: Second time eating at this location in Las Vegas. Really enjoyed our meal and service was outstanding. While Mastros is an expensive restaurant, I genuinely feel there is great value all around here. Food is very high quality and well prepared. Drinks are generously poured and professionally mixed. The Hawaiian ahi and butter cake were the standout menu choices from this meal at Mastros.

teevBD532p_jiytXuXEgZA.text: Went for a special dinning experience last night at their Las Vegas location . We typically dine at the Crystal Cove location in Orange County, CA. Very consitstant at what they do. Here, the experience was very different.   We sat next to the bar in one of tgeir high tables. Started with an Escargot appetizer. However, the appetizer did not come with the Escargot schells which defeated the purpose of the experience of working your way through this delicatessen in anticipation of savoring your find. We have been dining at Matro's for 15 years and always order Escargot on schells. That is how is served!  All along the waiter kept pressuring us to order something else to drink besides water! The next appetizer was seared ahi tuna, which was overly spiced and was no presented well..  Some how the waiter probably felt we were not worthy of her service, so we caught her drinking beer with other customers at the next table over.  We decided not to order anything else and asked for the check which came 20 minutes later. As far as we were concerned this venue does NOT maintain its reputation and status consistantly across other locations.  Very disappointed, to say the least.

o-Aiws3JPCMxmVDr-wuHnA.text: Dined here while in town for the SEMA show. Now I do have an Ocean Club by my house in Scottsdale which I love, however Las Vegas location took it a step further. I mean the food was excellent and very similar you must try the Chilean sea bass with the crust/ lobster mash/ & butter cake by the way, but the service we experienced in Las Vegas was out of this world! Everyone from the hostess to server and manager really made our experience wonderful. Keep up the good work I will be back.

ArGhE7wEdDKXy_OI5sOFCw.text: Like a nightmare written by Edgar Allan Poe.  The food was rich in flavor, decadent in appearance.  Yet the service was atrocious.  For absolutely no reason, the staff had a bad attitude.  Maybe their manager treated them badly so they took it out on us all.  My cheerful nature was no match for the bleakness they threw at our table, like a shadow cast across the pristine.  When we received the bill, something we never ordered was on it.  No kidding!  We paid the beggars and left.  Luckily there are a hundred better places less than a 5 minute walk from this unpleasant experience.

DrjMnTEdHaP9pXHDZj8X2w.text: This pace by far was amazing!  Was only here for dessert, but oh what dessert and service.  Had the butter cake with a side of their whip cream and ice cream it it was a MUST have while at Aria!  Just thinking about it makes me want to go back for more !   Also tried the cheesecake which was very good , but back to the butter cake!  Accompanied by an espresso martini which just made Dessert that much more memorable.  This place gets busy so get their early or come in late for a nice generous and delicious portion that is sure to satisfy your sweat tooth! Great way to end a night!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing Butter Cake and Cheesecake along with an Espresso Martini

t4Gzm7kbBE7XvasPb-5woQ.text: One of my all-time favorite restaurants! If you have never tried the lobster mashed potatoes, you are missing out! Other items I would recommend are the shrimp cocktail, ahi tuna, and the cosmopolitan which is served with dry ice giving it an appealing presentation. The service here is the best and the food is amazing! I wish we had one of these in the 405, but until then, I will hit them up whenever I'm in Vegas or DC. If you visit the Vegas location, it is located in the Crystal Mall in its very own treehouse, which is very unique. There's no other place like it!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big Hawaiian Tuna
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp cocktail

Xw5lYRNWdISU-IUaTB-0Ew.text: We dined at the tree house for an early dinner (5pm), it wasn't packed as it usually is for later hours. our server was really charming and helpful. He recommended us a good bottle of vino and it went perfect with our steaks! We had both the Japanese wagyu and the bone in fillet steak. Creamed spinach and potatoes were a perfect combo to the Japanese wagyu that melts in the mouth! They do give generous servings that what we had were good enough to share. We had sauteed shrimps for appetizer that was really filling.  Get the butternut cake -if you are into something savory than sweet. It's huge, great for sharing as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Butternut cake so savory, great for sharing
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfect wine pairing; japanese wagyu melts in your mouth x

29KS4RMxqtOpjNF3LE8M6Q.text: After reading the reviews and seeing the menu and price of the food, I expected it to be above average and amazing. The service was good, but the food was just average in my opinion. The tuna tar tar lacked salt and the scallops were in a nice sauce but undercooked in my opinion. The bread basket was the best part of the meal in my opinion.

f0unTUA5u3d4sMXK25opkg.text: Eh. This place could have been better. The service was freaking SLOW, I was starting to get impatient.  What made this place great was the guy who played piano and sang live while we had dinner.  He was really good, my friends requested to sing 2 songs for us.  The bread were hard and our steaks were not that special, I've had better.  Really disappointed.  All in all, i expected better from this restaurant...

0tMXD_wOaamCl-qrEYcfTw.text: The food was delicious.  The low rating is for the service.  Our waiter, Craig, was not friendly and seemed completely irritated that we were seated in his section.  This was the worst dining experience of our trip.  We will not be going back.

4bLpZt3C7ozzXIz4OIcNOA.text: I have been to Mastros in Newport Beach and Costa Mesa, this location did not disappoint. My only complaint is we were with 7 people and they offered my husbands and my sides to everybody else. We were going to share the mash potatoes and broccoli, there really was nothing left after they served them to everybody else. I felt weird and did not want to say those are mine. I barely got my side because they gave them to everybody else. Other then that everything was amazing, food was delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love their Martinis
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Butter Cake. Fantastic!

P4cHW4u72vx6jEbIuNY99A.text: Quite an exquisite appearance; I'm impressed!   I came here on a short weekend trip with my hubby and was told that their steak is delicious from hearsay. So of course being the steak lovers that we are, we had to try this place out! We ordered two crab cakes, a steak entree for myself, fish fillet for the hubby & lobster mashed potatoes for our side entree to share. The crab cake appetizer was packed with ample crab meat; though I did feel that it lacked a bit in flavor. There was a side of greens topped with avocado which I didn't think complimented the crab cakes very well. The 22oz steak was DELICIOUS and yep, you bet I finished all 22oz of it! NOT! This hunk of meat was humongous and of course I shared it with my hubby! It was cooked to perfection at medium rare; nice and tender! Served sizzling hot on a scorching plate; I devoured every bite of my steak! My hubby's halibut was very good; soft and tender with a nice creamy sauce mixture. The lobster mashed potatoes was good. It was also super creamy with a hint of garlic. They weren't too generous with the lobster meat but  I wasn't expecting much beforehand.  Service here was definitely not up to par. Considering I had made reservations at 8:30pm TWO WEEKS prior to our arrival, I was hoping that we'd at least have to wait for ehh, maybe a good 10 minutes. NOPE. We were running a bit late that night and I called the restaurant at 8:15 to inform them that we were on our way and the lady confirmed that our table will be waiting. We get there around 5 minutes pass our reservation time (not as late as we thought after all!) and the lady tells us that it's actually going to be another 50 minute wait!? WHAT?! Though she did apologize that they were behind schedule, apart of me was just a wee bit frustrated. She should have at least have the decency to let us know ahead of time when I phoned in so we didn't have to rush over! Well nonetheless, we went to the sushi restaurant next door and surpassed time at the bar.   The treehouse architecture of this restaurant is out of the ordinary and quite astounding! Built inside the Crystal mall - it has a unique structure to it. Entrance is accessible through the second floor; the restaurant is built from the 1st ground floor up.    All in all, my hubby and I had a very scrumptious and fulfilling dinner together! I would highly recommend for all steak-lovers to be sure to check this place out if they're ever in Vegas! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 22 ounce rib eye steak.
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab cakes.

lmobAvs52IZXIVs7XcvYpA.text: My friend made reservations for Christmas Day dinner 2 weeks prior to Christmas. When we arrived we were told 40 minute wait for the "treehouse" which she requested. She was furious. We were seated 5 minutes later, I'm really not sure what the deal was, but we didn't have to wait. Drinks were good as was the service, however the food was not great. The mac and cheese was lacking the cheese. I ordered lamb chops and they were cooked ok, medium rare, but lacked flavor. Totally not impressed. I ate half my lamb, and we got a go bag for everything else. When I got home my lamb never made it to the go bag. Really? $48 for 1/2 an order of lamb. This place is pathetic. Go to Del Frisco's if you truly want to be impressed. Epic fail here!

35qSI2sEXFU6qKdMFNsWrQ.text: I've debated about how many stars I should rate Mastro's Ocean Club, technically it deserves one less due to what happened during my dinning experience here but the customer service made up for a lot of the mistakes.  I was in Vegas with my girlfriend who had been there for a company conference, it so happened to also be my birthday weekend and I wanted an amazing meal on my Birthday before we headed back to LA. Mastro's had always been well recommended by friends and family so i was excited to have a birthday meal there. We have a few locations in the Los Angeles area but never had a opportunity to dine at one.   We arrived a few minutes after opening and were seated promptly, our server (I forget his name :( so sorry) was amazing! Was very informative and accommodating. My girlfriend ordered the chilean sea bass and one prawn. I had the bone in rib eye steak and we shared a side of green beans and asparagus. My girlfriend ordered a delicious drink and while I couldn't decide on what to have myself our waiter brought out a amazing whiskey drink for me.   Once the food arrived it all looked so yummy, and here is when the problems began. I had ordered my steak medium rare, when I cut into the steak it was more medium / medium well. I thought maybe it was just the surrounding edges that were overcooked because that tends to happen with rib eye steaks. Once I cut closer to the bone it was evident it was overcooked. I called over the waiter and quickly had my steak sent back and a new one was on its way out. My girlfriends sea bass was amazing but the prawn she ordered was overcooked. While I waited for my replacement steak to arrive the manager came to our table to offer their apologies which was much appreciated. My replacement steak took quite some time enough time for my girlfriend to finish her meal while I sat there waiting for my food.   Once my new steak arrived I was eager to eat, the manager had them bring out fresh new sides which was unexpected but very appreciated. Manager had me cut into the steak to see if it was cooked properly and sadly it was also overcooked. I was disappointed and as I cut further in to check the center of the steak it was evident this steak was overcooked as well as chewy. The manager acknowledged it was overcooked and offered a replacement but at this point I just wanted to eat! I told him it was ok and that I would finish my steak and be on our way, needless to say my steak was comped. A few minutes into my second steak the manager let me know that they had another steak for me and I should slow down on finishing this one. I advised him I had no desire for a third steak and that there was no way I could finish it but he insisted.  My third steak was brought out and my second was taken away, again the manager asked me to check the cook on this third steak. Upon cutting into the steak it was raw, very raw...almost a blue steak. I was really disappointed at this point and the manager just walked away. Our server came to our table and asked me "Do you like your steak like that?" acknowledging how undercooked it was. At this point I was so upset that I just wanted to eat but could only finish a few extra bites. The manager brought out a free dessert with Happy Birthday written on the dish which was freaking delicious. The customer service is is really fantastic I can't stress that enough. Drinks are fantastic and the wait staff is top notch! And the steak was fantastic the next day when I had to for lunch and was reheated to a proper temp ;)   I'll definitely return here for a second meal regardless of all the problems I experienced as I truly believe they deserve a second chance and I'll update my review accordingly. Thanks again to the staff at Mastro's Ocean Club for great service and attention. Special thanks to our waiter who was fantastic and to the manager who went above and beyond.

dnqON9NgaDTlvwOm11WZ2w.text: What an amazing dinner last night. Our server Tim was awestruck me from start to finish. He acknowledged our honeymoon right away and even gave us an amazing dessert at the end. Being the night prior somewhere else being so bad he turned our trip around. The filet was amazing. Scallops as well! Even the host was awesome, giving us a great seat. Thank you!

luco1W_d3dL9Tl13sQ3nGQ.text: Growing up in Beverly Hills I have attended the Mastro's on Canon close to 100 times. They have the best steak in the game, I don't care what anyone try's to say. Last night me and my friend Paul had the night off in Vegas so we decided to check out the Mastro's here in Las Vegas at City Center. It not the traditional Mastro's setting but the food was still remarkable! Our waiter Deion was the man he helped my friend choose the perfect wine to accompany his bone-in filet topped with foie gras! Which just melted in ur mouth! (Pause) I myself took down the 22oz Bone-in Ribeye cooked medium rare plus like a beast and enjoyed every single bite! Once again Mastro's was an A+! Pictured below was the Bone-in Ribeye.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 22oz Bone-In Ribeye

W19iQvN5ulrsWQabSPNI7w.text: The drinks and food were fantastic. I had a nice verity and was happy with each dishes.  I highly suggest the Lab chop

9QwDtq4E4mz9us_pWr-udw.text: We came here with our friend's who were visiting from Australia. I love coming here because it is always consistent. Many of us ordered wine and cocktails. You always feel special when you get your own shaker for your martini. We shared the tomahawk steak, which is amazing. We ordered brussel sprouts (amazing), gorgonzola mac and cheese ( just so so, I like my pasta softer), sweet potato fries (no flavor, not sure I like the tempura batter), and scalloped potatoes (yum!). Service is always amazing. Thank you Mastros!

iOBTc4zzAG7Wnz1g58nXAg.text: This is a follow up and it's long overdue. We did eventually hear back from the restaurant and the manager offered us a gift card so we can go back and try them again. I was extra careful on food choices at the 2nd visit: steak and chocolate cocktail (no seafood, no fresh veggies or fruit), and yes it was a great decision, no upset stomach this time! 5 star service, 4.5 food. Combined with my negative experience from 1st visit, solid 4 stars as a final.

dm_-s2xAWnkIXfLCgUnm8w.text: Great experience. The service the food...wow . I can go on and on but you must experience it yourself. The steak, the Gouda mac and cheese, lobster mash....

P3WHnNXzTIwHVM3iwbX0MA.text: I had a great meal here last night . I sat in the bar area with a buddy. I highly recommend the bar . It's casual but still has the level of service you expect from a restaurant of this caliber. Angie our server and provided us with the best service. Thanks Angie! When I come back to  Vegas I'll be back for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

v35YrbHz5HXJoKwYKZG6LA.text: Really great food. Went on a Sunday and was not crowded. Food & service were both very good.

Qc4wOg4kVz-6W5ZFq4cfwA.text: This place is a tree house.. no really, it is!  Their main dining area is called the tree house; quite cute actually.  But regarding the experience:  Food:4 stars Service: 1 star Price:2 start Average:2.5 star.. but I rounded up because my meal was courtesy of MGM... thanks casino host!  I was seated by the hostess.. then I waited.. and waited... and waited.. for menus.  After making continuous eye contact with the wait staff, displaying my need for service, I was ignored.  Then maybe after 10 mins, I received a menu, but still had to ask for water.  Shocking, as this is supposed to be a nicer restaurant.. You would think with these prices, would come service.  Also, during our dinner, I had numerous times where I was looking an empty champagne glass.. and no I'm not a fast drinker... If you are going to place the bottle in a ice bucket stand on the other side of the table, please be mindful of when to fill my glass... I know this may sound snobby, but i have no problem pouring my own glass.. however, I believe they should keep a close eye, especially since there was plenty of staff just standing around.  The mussels were probably one of the best I've had! This was a nice surprise, as most steamed mussels are quite standard with white wine, garlic and parsley.  But this had some sort of light and creamy sun-dried tomato sauce! it was thin enough to compliment these under the sea delights, but hearty enough to dip with bread!  The crab cake was also divine!  Definitely no fillers here.. instead, a cake-shaped form of literally pure crab!  The Chilean sea bass was prepared really great, especially for a white fish!  Overall, I would definitely check this place out, ESPECIALLY if you have a food/bev comp through MGM hotels.  However, I still prefer Sage over this place.  The service really stood out to me, and it was HORRIBLE!  Dear waitstaff.- please be kind to your customers, especially in the city of where splurge-worthy tips are common!  And to the tall, 60 year old server with some salt and pepper action going on ontop of that head.. stop winking at ladies.. you're creeping people out!!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. chilean sea bass
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seared sea scallops
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mussels and crab cakes for apps!

dgc_S3B5nBwgTBGMsv_xvg.text: My friend & I started with a bottle of Marquis de la Tour non-vintage Champagne. We ordered the Mastro's Signature Seafood Tower of shrimps, lobster, Alaskan King crab legs, Alaskan Red King crab claws, and Kusshi oysters. The shrimps were plump & juicy, as was the lobster. The crab was sweet & succulent. The oyster were very fresh. On the side were cocktail sauce, mustard, and our favourite, atomic horseradish, where a little goes a long way! In addition to the seafood tower, we had the Alaskan King crab black truffle gnocchi. As it approached our table, the smell of the black truffles was very evident. Atop the gnocchi was a parmesan & bread crumb topping, which was baked until golden brown. We added a few lemon drop martinis, which were pour table side. It steamed as the liquid touched the ice.   The service was amazing. The waiter was super friendly, and the water boys were attentive. I never saw the bottom of my glass. The ambiance was very delightful. It just made the meal even better. We loved every element of this meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood Tower of shrimps, lobster, Alaskan King crab legs, Alaskan Red King crab claws &amp; Kusshi oysters, + lemon drop martinis

EZMiUk4JLmPgmmul4ezcIg.text: To say this was the worst meal I've ever had in Vegas is an unbelievable understatement. I ordered the lobster tails and was rewarded for my choice with food poisoning.  Secondly, a table with 6 people ordering steaks shouldn't have all six returned multiple times for being undercooked. They even served the salads warm.   I have dined at this restaurant more than a dozen times and have recommended it even more than that. I now regret having sent anyone there. In addition to ruining the meals of my entire travel party, the food poisoning had me confined to my room for the entire trip.   If you're thinking about going to this restaurant, dine at your own risk. IT WAS THE WORST MEAL I HAVE EVER EATEN!!

2Rai8WdM94axjw5AVJIuug.text: I love this place. I went here with my mother in 2010 for my 21st birthday dinner. We had chilled dungeness crab, king crab, and shrimp. The waitstaff was incredibly attentive and made my birthday all that much more special. I cannot wait to bring my husband here for his birthday week in Las Vegas!

MYJwI9faatxWlydJg6-3vg.text: Service:  Seemed hectic(?) although there didn't seem to be much going on for a Wednesday evening. I didn't feel like I was at a $$$$ restaurant. The waiter took awhile to come over once seated and the pacing of the meal was very odd. The bone marrow took 20 minutes to come out which was fine, (we were warned of this) but the lobster bisque soup took another 20 minutes after that, and we sat around for 20 minutes with nothing to eat between soup and dinner.   Location:  Looks wonderful. We sat in the cool wooden treehouse thing. The problem is, there is no climate control. It was HOT. I sweated throughout the meal. Shame. I didn't really get a good feel of being "in the air" or a good view. I think it looks cooler from the outside.  Drinks: The lemon drop was delicious and fun with the smoking dry ice. The tiki-time was fine although forgettable.  Food: The bread basket was interesting. It wasn't warm? Some of the pieces were tough to eat and made a real crumb mess...  Bone marrow appetizer was good. Although I think we both preferred the side salad with capers and cheese to the actual bone marrow.  Lobster bisque was fine. There were some interesting complex flavors, but my partners portion had a shell in it. (not ok for fine dining...)  I had the recommended 12oz bone-in filet for dinner. It was seasoned well. I ordered medium-rare. Maybe 1-2 bites near the bone were medium rare. The rest was brown all the way through. The meat was incredibly tender and well seasoned but the temperature was all over the place. They do serve it on a 400 degree plate (why?) that made all of the side dishes on my plate scalding hot...  Partner had the halibut filet with panko cheese crust. The crust was slightly burnt. The fish was incredibly overcooked, dry and tasteless. The waiter noticed our dis-interest and had it removed from the bill...  The lobster mashed potatoes were fine, although certainly nothing fabulous. The sauteed asparagus was also adequate.   Would not recommend.

jg5867X5nM9bimYxXzP8oA.text: Food was delicious. I ordered a kansas city steak (bone in) rib eye. Ordered lobster mac &cheese, scallop mash potatoes, creamed spinach for sides.  For a group of 6, one side dish only feeds a lot of people.  The service is superb, server always checked on us, got dessert complimentary since it was all of our first time there. We got lucky that night.  I would definitely return. I've visited the Mastros in Beverly hills, California location and it is also good food, service in vegas was even better though.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GOpbETODuKAgM8dJJGtMdA.text: I have never been to a fancy steakhouse before, and I have learned that they are incredibly awesome!  We booked a reservation ahead of time, so getting seats were very convenient and we were seated right away. Our server for the evening was Craig and he was a very personable man, who was very helpful throughout the entire evening. He had an answer for any question I threw his way and he explained things that they were offering off the menu very well as well.   Our appetizer came out first, which were their ahi tuna tostadas. They were very delicious. The tostada portion was very crunchy and had the perfect texture. The avocado and tuna that they served on the tostada were so soft and had a buttery texture, which was heaven in my mouth. Our entrees then came out with our sides. I ordered the bone in ribeye with an 8oz prawn, while by brother ordered the Kansas City strip. Both of our steaks were cooked to perfection. I ordered mine medium and my brother ordered medium-well, and it came out exactly as expected. For our sides, we ordered the lobster mashed potatoes along with creamed spinach. The lobster mashed potatoes were supposedly their most popular side, and I can see why. They had a good amount of lobster in that dish and it added a nice change to plain mashed potatoes. The creamed spinach was very creamy and rich. I personally could only handle so much, but they did prepare it very well. Since we went there for my birthday, they provided a complimentary slice of cake for me to eat, and it was a 5 layered chocolate cake. Their cake is some of the best cake I have ever had. I have no way to describe the taste besides "clean." It stayed together very well, the flavor wasn't too strong, and the texture was perfect.   To say the least, the service and food was some of the best I have ever had all in all. I definitely could not eat here on a regular basis, but for special occasions, this will definitely be on the list.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye with a prawn on the side
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ahi tuna tostadas

CdWnkMzsoHYp3yztEOjOiQ.text: We had our New Year's Eve dinner here. I requested a seat with a view inside the treehouse/nest and they complied! I was pleasantly surprised. Our server was great and attentive, and we had to stop ourselves from eating all the fresh bread.  We weren't overly hungry so we shared a larger filet mignon. It was decent, but it wasn't as tender as others I've had before. The stone crab was delicious and I'd want to try their sea bass on a future visit. My bf has a sweet tooth, so we ordered sorbet for dessert. We got three of the largest scoops we've ever seen in our life! I joked for that size they should've given us one of each flavor instead of making us pick one. We only finished one scoop.

jueGeihlvOsyWMl7Lifs0A.text: What can I say.  Head and shoulders above the other restaurants on the Vegas strip in both food quality and service.

XDFBMbJx0mZQ3IbWpXOksg.text: Took my love here for an early birthday celebration. Our waiter, Johnny, was the best, so funny and attentive.  We started out with the lobster bisque and it was heaven! I had the petit filet with scallops, my bf had the Kobe steak with sauteed shrimps, we had the lobster mashed potatoes and Brussels sprouts for sides.  The filet, steak and shrimps was delicious! My scallops was a little salty and slightly overlooked but still yum! The brussel sprouts was also salty and could use some shaved almonds and cranberries but overall good.  Would definitely come back despite the whole meal cost me an arm, a leg and probably my first born.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary birthday dessert
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sautéed shrimps

Fp8LiQahur7Cu0Dnr9F0Cw.text: We only stopped in for an appetizer and drinks, but I have to say I will be back very soon!  The lemon drop was an experience that was the perfect start to our girls' night out.  I won't ruin the surprise, but you have to get one.  We also had the shrimp cocktail  which was perfect, containing large, firm shrimp served extra cold with the spiciest horseradish I have ever had (Yum).  But the best part was the staff.  Daniel, Jacob, Brandon, and Claira treated us like we were royalty (Ok, I was there with a regular), but they welcomed me into the "family."  I now live in the area so I will definitely be bringing my many visitors back here.  I hear I need to try the sea bass and the butter cake.  Looking forward to next time!

Y06dXeoAVIx9CABIfST7jg.text: The meal I had was pretty good but it definitely wasn't mind blowing. I had the Pacific Swordfish cook perfectly but the taste wasn't making my tastebuds swoon.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pacific swordfish

m0MUPXbE8gXcRFJrf_37KQ.text: My fiance and I went here to celebrate our engagement. His parents had gotten us a very generous gift card to use for exactly that purpose since they live far away and couldn't be here to celebrate with us.  Based on all the great reviews, we decided to spend it here.  I wouldn't go so far as to say it was the best steakhouse we've ever been to, but it was pretty damn good. We ordered Blue Point oysters, which were fresh and delicious. The sauteed scallops were absolutely to die for. It comes with bread to dip in the buttery sauce and it was so amazing.  Then we ordered a filet, the sea bass, lobster mashed potatoes and Gorgonzola mac n cheese. While still very tasty, each item had some issues.  The lobster in the mashed potatoes were a bit overcooked and slightly chewy.  The mac n cheese had no hint of Gorgonzola at all and as soon as it slightly cooled while sitting at our table, the thick top layer of cheese became hard and rubbery.  The filet was good and perfectly cooked, but I've had much better steak elsewhere.  And last, the sea bass wasn't the melt in your mouth buttery bite of heaven as I expected.   The service is great. Everyone said congratulations since we had put that we were celebrating our engagement in the reservation details. Our server was super busy but she checked on us often. The ambiance is definitely strange as you're in a mall. It's really loud and not intimate at all. You're very close to other tables. Ours was right on the back of a booth, and the guys in that booth kept accidentally knocking over our table lamp.   Overall, I'm really glad we tried it out, but will stick to our favorite next time we want to splurge on a dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QF9rxm8CM1rMa0UQCpUOKQ.text: OMG! Where do I start. The Customer service  is great. I came here for my 5th Year Anniversary.  The atmosphere was beautiful. They made a lovely Anniversary menu for us. The food was Delicious. I  had Roasted chicken & garlic mash, Brussels sprouts Mmmm, so good my Husband had a Ribeye steak  mouth watering he said. Just perfect. The end of  our dinner they presented us with a cake how sweet was that. Thanks for making our special day  memorable.

r4uw9_yYEhcmKN-PL79fDA.text: Second time at this location. As always solid from the taste and preparation of the steaks.   This review is really for a more bizarre experience. Ordered a Manhattan which they pour table side into a martini glass. About 5 minutes into my drink the base of the glass literally explodes, splitting into several pieces. Luckily the drink landed on its stem and so none of the drink spilled.   I immediately alerted the waiter to the bizarre situation. The handling of this was appropriate, but not great. First the waiter understandably seemed perplexed. After assessing the glassware myself I came to the conclusion it occurred because they had apparently chilled the martini glass; and as it came back quickly to room temperature it shattered. In any case, the waiter asked me if the drink was okay. Ha. Yes, the drink is fine. No glass made it into the drink. By the way I am fine too, no need worry there is little bits of glass in front of me. The waiter took away my glass to pour it into a new one which was again acceptable. Later on in the meal though I actually cut myself on a random tiny piece of glass that was left on the table cloth. Just my luck (no pun intended Vegas), but again its not the restaurant's fault. The cut was small and did not have to amputate so decided not to ruin the mood and make a big deal about the glass. However, ones expectations eating at an establishment like Mastros is high and the entire experience did not meet that expectation.   Next time maybe my luck will be better. Until then beware of exploding glassware. Suggestion to Mastro's: do not freeze stemware.

rXATa9Frhe97E-1C0g9qzg.text: I have been to this restaurant 3 times, and each time gets worse and worse.   1: Was seated, and unattended to for 5 minutes. No menus, water, nothing. This would be understandable if the restaurant was busy, but 7-8 servers were just standing around talking on the opposite side.   2: I ordered a glass of wine and the proper way to serve it would be to have me try it first before pouring the glass. It was brought out like a coctail.   3: I was given 2 choices for water- flat and sparkling. I said flat and was charged $17 for 3 glasses of water filled twice.   On to the food....  I have long given up on the entrees at Mastros. I have never received an entree that lived up to standards.   We ordered the following:  Clam chowder- pretty good  Lobster bisque- delicious Crab coctail- amazing Crab cakes- way too fishy Lobster mashed potatoes- amazing Gorgonzola Mac n cheese- too rich for my taste. Could only have one bite  Brussel sprouts- perfect Bone marrow- burnt to a crisp and could not scrape any marrow out  Butter cake- the one thing that saved the entire meal   In the future , I will have dinner elsewhere and come to Mastro's for coffee and dessert only.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab coctail- so good!
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gorgonzola mac n cheese- pass
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burnt bone marrow

xCVJaz4E6Dbnj2Hc7hec5w.text: Mastro's Ocean Club is a gem that you cannot miss next time you're on the Strip.  Located in the newly designed City Center, just look for the beautifully designed "tree house", which hangs high above the ultra chic boutiques in Crystals that only the richest of the rich can actually shop in.  Be sure to request a table inside the tree house...it's where all the cool kids sit.   Mastro's is not cheap, but then again, nothing in Vegas is.  In any case, it's worth every penny because the food is outstanding.  I started off with a very rich and tasty New England Clam Chowder.  For my entree, I went with the porcini mushroom crusted sea bass with fried spinach.  It was light but delicious!! Perfect for lunch.  For the side dish, what else but the lobster mashed potatoes! I'm not talking about lobster flavored mashed potatoes.  No, no, not at Mastro's.  I'm talking about over a pound of lobster mixed in the mashed potatoes.  It was soooo good and was big enough that all four of us could enjoy it with plenty to spare.  Although we were happily stuffed, our waiter brought out their signature butter cake with fresh whipped cream on the side for dessert; with his compliments (a very nice touch, which only further highlighted the tremendous service that we had during our entire meal). I highly recommend getting this dessert no matter how full you are. We all loved it.  I should note that the cocktails were also great.  Make sure you get one of their signature martinis, which comes with dry ice on the bottom of the glass that makes the drink bubble and emit smoke.  Pretty cool.   Although I was able to get a table for four for lunch on a Saturday with ease through OpenTable, that won't last long because the restaurant only opened up 2 weeks ago and the buzz is still building.  Soon, Mastro's will one of the hottest tables in Vegas so get in while you can.

cG_RiXhLEEOcCEvP5rRi7Q.text: Absolutely incredible restaurant!!!  You must have the warm butter cake for dessert!!!!!

KZ5M378RIebPRNHHm3Wi6Q.text: This place is a little expensive, but worth it.  Nice ambience with live music.  I enjoyed the scallops - locals recommend this place for seafood - and the asparagus.  They are the best scallops I have ever eaten!  The service is also great with attractive waitresses as a bonus ;-)

_zKyEiBv6jO7beak_OHN7g.text: We (my family and best friends) had the pleasure of experiencing Mastro's exceptional ambiance and cuisine on August 12, 2011. Sat in the incredible "Tree".  Mike R was our amazing server. His expertise was supported by and flanked throughout our experience by several other servers thus we never went lacking for anything at anytime. We feasted on crab, shrimp, oysters, and escargot appetizers followed by various soup and salad presentations. All were a "cut above" the normal "starter" course anywhere on the strip. From there it just kept getting better & better as the ribeye, scallops, new york strip, more oysters, fillet represented the breadth of our entree courses. The accompanying sides: crab gnocchi, asparagus, sugar snap peas could not have been better anywhere!   Now, we had been tipped off about Mastro's Signature Warm Butter Cake which defies human description. One just has to believe that it is literally to die for!   All-in-all, this experience represented the absolute best, bringing together our great friends & family with fantastic food & amazing ambiance!   Thanks Mike R. Thanks Mastro's. We will be back!

lNvXTA01KRusfb6PZJgw5A.text: Fav steakhouse chain. Lobster mash a must. Any steak with bone-in a must. Top notch service. Located inside mall. Less stuffy then other locations.

KGgKdEVAFss7ag13rxZv7A.text: been a few times and the vanilla crusted twin lobster tails are still amazing also some of the best seared ahi I have ever had great location inside crystals in the city center look for the giant wood shaped tree house hovering in the air....thats it!!!

RrKp0Oriwo0nfRX6RFKaWQ.text: Great ambiance and amazing service!  Not to mention the food is just fabulous.  We started with tuna tartare which was good but nothing spectacular.  But then for the main entree I got the bone-in filet with a side of Mastro's mashed potatoes.  The meat was perfectly cooked to medium rare and the flavor was melt-in-your-mouth delicioso.  Even the simple mashed potatoes was creamy and savory.  It sure is a splurge but I highly recommend it if you are in Vegas and want to pamper your tastebuds.

Z-QbgcVdcXTakNio5gdHcw.text: Just great. Love their seafood tower the most. Petit stake is super too. Big and spacious place. All excellent

k8EvmRhFJbXi9JxGCyNaJg.text: I love Mastro's!  We went for our first anniversary dinner after having gone on our honeymoon last year. The food was so amazing we had to come back.  We were greeted at our table with 2 glasses of champagne to celebrate. We spilt the most delicious wedge salad and it was good. Last year we had apps and the lobster mashed potatoes as a side. Those were so good they'll make you wanna slap your momma!  We were so full I am embarrassed to say we didn't even finish our steaks. This year we switched to Gorgonzola Mac & Cheese...epic!  I had the bone-in ribeye and my wife ordered the 12oz filet mignon.  Both were the finest steaks we've ever had. You will never appreciate any other steak after that. Mastros ruined steak for me, talk about melt in your mouth. Our server Mark was phenomenal and super attentive. A really nice guy. For desert they brought out the warm butter cake...wonderful!  Mastros is the only place I would eat in my life if I had the choice. Thank you  for a wonderful first anniversary dinner. GO THERE!!!!

O7HA0JlDNRYJgtbT2TzafA.text: My husband & I chose this spot to celebrate our 40th wedding anniversary and we are still reeling from the experience!!  Absolutely one of our best dining experiences EVER!! For starters, we requested Mike R as our server due to the many good things we read here and he didn't disappoint. Made our dinner and all round experience very memorable.  Everyone made us feel so special from the hostess to the busboys.  Oh, the food!!  We knew the portions were reportedly large and Mike encouraged us to order half portions. We had half Spicy Mambo Salad - Caesars salad with horseradish and wasabi - really yummy with a nice kick to it and lots of chunks of Parmesan. We loved it! My husband had the 12 oz filet and I had the 12 oz bone-in filet. Both were done to perfection and very flavorful.  Mike suggested ordering only one side to split. My husband can't resist fresh fries, especially with steak, so we got the salt & vinegar fries. They were so good and so addictive, we couldn't stop eating them even though we were stuffed.  Then came dessert!  Special occasions get comp dessert here, but Mike went over and above for us as he said he had never served anyone celebrating a 40th wedding anniversary before. We not only got the warm butter cake with ice cream and a hugh side dish of fresh made whipped cream (and yes it is every bit as good as reported), he added 4 hugh chocolate covered strawberries and 2 glasses of an amazing appertif- Michele Chiarlo Nivole.  A truly awesome evening we will never forget!  Oh, and they called us the next day to thank us for coming! We can't wait to return.

q7Vq6InuXg38h4VJTJ0-OA.text: Let me start from the beginning here. I was searching for a good date spot for me and my gf. I have dined at most of the finer restaurants in Vegas. But I wanted to try something new and by far, this was the best reviewed spot. Only thing that turned me off was that it was in the middle of a mall. NOT AN ISSUE. I requested the 'Tree House' and that is where we were sat. Once in there I completely forgot I was in a mall...it was romantic and beautiful. Our server greeted us and asked if we've ever diner here before....we both responded "NO". We were then treated to a 5 minute explanation of their entire menu. Based on other reviews...we started with the shrimp cocktail and I suggest you do the same. Very unique and brilliant presentation. My gf had the Fillet of Arctic Char "Oreganata"..we both LOVED it. I had the Bone In Rib-Eye. Cooked perfectly. Delicious. For sides we chose the mac-n-cheese(not bad, but kinda bland to what I've had at comparable restaurants) and the brussel sprouts...fantastic. We had no room for dessert. Cocktails were good....coming from a guy in that business. As we left, EVERYONE thanked us for coming...from busser to manager. That was impressive. I even woke up the next morning to a voicemail from them thanking me for me business and hoping that me and my 'beautiful' gf had a great time; and that they hope to see us again. ONLY complaint..and this is being picky: when our bread was dropped off(with multiple choices), it was just thrown down with no explanation as to what was what. But this is a must go!

8BlK6RDhPZCK49cHnDumHA.text: My girlfriend and I fell in love with this place for several reasons.  The staff, the atmosphere, and the food combined to bring us back the next night as well  We were able to make reservations through Yelp and OpenTable but we arrived early each night and sat in the first come, first serve bar area.  The piano entertainment was first class. Our server, Racqel, was always timely, willing to meet our every request, and helpful in navigating the menu to ensure we got the most of the food choices we desired with the least amount of waste.  Her name escapes me now but there was a corporate employee there the second night who recognized us from the night before.  She not only bought our first round of drinks but when we were leaving insisted we try their "Butter Cake" so much so that she ended up giving it to us.  Very good stuff. I can't imagine anyone not feeling good upon receipt of this restaurant "regular" type of treatment on a 3 day, 2 night trip.  Sheri and I can't wait to return to town and visit the place again!  I highly recommend any of the filets, shriimp cocktail, king crab, lobster mashed potatoes, lobster bisque, gorgonzola mac and cheese, and the red snapper.  They will split any plate they have, upon request.

HYC6u2wZPQdPThCL4Or2HQ.text: YUM! The crab legs are always perfect, the filet always like butter, the pretzel bread always hot and the service impeccable! Amazing.

Dx9q7YqzLUbYV2tFwZcQTQ.text: Pricey but very good, we had fish, I would go back to try the steaks.

JAinnhFDiElZUT0zuITcOA.text: Went there with the girlfriend before Ka. Got the clam chowder to share, she got the maine lobster (mkt price) and I got the round eye steak. We each got a martini.  Clam chowder was ok, we had better at the Fisherman's Wharf in San Francisco.  Maine lobster was a bit overpriced but very fresh. 5 waiters came to take out the shell! Girlfriend was amazed Round eye steak was very  generous. Well cooked, and the outside was pretty crispy despite asking for medium rare. Inside was soft and moist as expected. Got the cream spinach on the side. Martinis were very strong and plentiful. Water melon martini was very good. We definitely started to speak more loudly and laughing for no reason after a few full glasses.  Atmosphere overall feels very open, live music is excellent. Waiters were attentive and professional without feeling overwhelmingly present. Girlfriend had a great time so it deserves the 4 stars. Overall, a great experience though a tad pricey, especially the lobster.

LjRJjXqUOWmHx85hdlxEaA.text: What an amazing experience!! I was there with 2 of my girlfriends for dinner, it was our first time there.  Mario, our waiter, was AMAZING! Even though it was our first time there, he made us feel like regulars. They even bought us dessert! The ambiance was great! The food was beyond amazing! We had ribeye cooked to perfection, and the mushrooms were incredible! Overall of of the best restaurant experiences I have had!

bZjEm5MK8yW7Kh4eVqnI3g.text: i felt like someone importanttttttttttt their service is amazing and the food... melts in your mouth like butter.

51s4L-OCyNBuMcL3NpzzAg.text: From the friendliest hosts at the front desk to the Amazing food, service & live music. WOW!!! OUTSTANDING!

UWut3N--U4JYSQYjjFPKKQ.text: The hottie and I headed to Mastro's Ocean Club on a weekend trip to Vegas.  A friend of mine has been pumping up Mastro's to me for years.  I ordered the bone in rib eye.... my favorite!  I would say that its not as good as Del Frisco's but still very good.  The hottie got the sea bass which was excellent.  We started off with fried calamari which was nothing special.  For sides we got creamed spinach which was pretty good and gorgonzola mac n cheese which was not good.  I'm not a big fan of gorgonzola from the start so it wasn't a surprise that I did not like it that much.  But the hottie is a big fan of gorgonzola and even she said it wasn't good.  We loved the tree house look and its a first class place.  We even saw Pete Rose there with a...... ahem companion.  Overall thumbs up!

GQWTGuS0Sc4bH0Y4SwsKZA.text: The name Mastro's is known to a lot of people for their steaks already.  We happened to be in Vegas for our anniversary, so we decided to have dinner there as our celebration.  Because this place is located at the City Center right in the middle of the mall, so it doesn't carry the same kind of "exclusiveness" as the one in Costa Mesa or B Hill.  Dress code is also easier, only required hotel casual, so shorts and tees are welcome.  Just as mentioned by most, the staff are extremely polite and friendly, that was a great start already.  We got seated fairly quickly and our waiter brought us the wine / cocktail list quickly.  I asked for the Mastro's Mojito cocktail, which is rum with lime and mint.  It's not very strong and I like it a lot.  We were aware of the portion at Mastro's, and since my wife is pregnant she can't eat too much.  So I asked the waiter if it's OK for us to split the steak and allow us to try more other dishes.  They were very understanding and said absolutely no problem at all.  For appetizer, we went ahead and ordered the sauteed scallops.  We were both very very impressed with the dish.  Three gigantic scallops, all prepared and seared to perfection, and the sauce was awesome together with the bread.  It was very rich and good.  We also ordered the lobster bisque, and they went ahead and split the soup between two bowls for us, that was very nice.  The waiter also came and helped us split the scallop appetizer on our dish, that's great service.  We also tried the pretzel bread together with the soup, they all paired together very well!!!!!!  My wife particularly loved the lobster bisque.  She commented that a lot of times the lobster bisque she has is way too salty, but the one we had was just right.  Very smooth and rich in lobster flavor, but it doesn't get overpowered by the saltiness.  For steak, we ordered the bone-in 18oz filet and we asked them to split a small portion for my wife (medium well).  Mine was cooked medium rare.  It was simply fabulous.  Meat was very tender and juicy, and even my wife's portion, though cooked medium well, was still very tender.    And I have to say one of the most important thing they did right was resting the steak well before serving.  Most of the time when I eat steak, by the end it was juice all over the dish.  But not this time, all the juice was retained inside, that was awesome.  We also got the lobster mashed potato as side dish.  It's good, a lot of lobster as stated by others, though I agree with my wife, while it's good, for $36 bucks, it's basically lobster mixed with mashed potato.  It doesn't have that "specialness" in some sense.  Since it was our anniversary, they gave us a big chocolate cake.  It was BIG, and it tasted really good too!  At the end of the day, we were impressed with the dinner.  It's not cheap by any means, but for special occasions, the quality and quantity of food?  I think it's worth it.  Although part of me still wonder how the experience would differ if we were to go to the one at Costa Mesa.

9hjDDwEkgXCo7lni52awAA.text: Wow.  Our server Robert, wow.  AMAZING experience.  We got there late at 6:15pm and had a show starting at 7:30pm.  That essentially leaves an hour.  Despite the busy night, despite me being all over the place in hurry to get in and out, he did an exceptional job!    Best steak ever!!  Prepared perfectly, on the warmest (okay, hottest) plate for an additional temp if needed.  The Lobster Mashers are totally worth the $39!  But the Butter Cake, I could live off that!    Great experience!  You must ask to be sat in the "treehouse", but don't beg like me... Hahah.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. That&#39;s right, a huge piece of Butter Cake!!  It&#39;s a must try!!  Mastro&#39;s is delicious!
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Exterior of Mastro&#39;s in Vegas is awesome!  I really wish I had my own Treehouse!!

FjqacqVqDmldTZ3_XT_0BQ.text: This is definitely one of my favorite Steakhouses! Took my mom there for her birthday last week and it was amazing! Started off with a berry martini....delish!  For a starter i had the wedge salad you can never go wrong with the wedge :). As my main course i had the filet mignon which i absolutely love!!!!! Its so tender it melts in your mouth and the flavor is beyond amazing! Most restaurants don't know how to season their meats :/ Not Mastros. My mom was even amazed with the flavor of the filet. FYI my mom is a picky eater :/ actually so am I haha. We ordered three sides to share (the portions are pretty big just to throw out there). There was 4 of us In our party and we had lots of left overs. We had the Mac n cheese (a must have) creamed spinach and sauteed mushrooms. Dessert time we had the butter cake. I swear this has to be the best dessert I've ever had... No joke! Once you start eating it you can't stop....its addicting!

DnVI_SPc9MNdVr4QQmB2zQ.text: Had our wedding anniversary dinner here. Altogether, I was satisfied. The place was creative--eating in a fancy tree house! The food was decent but you're really just paying for the ambiance. We ordered the scallops, lobster mashed potatoes, clam chowder, and two fish entrees (mine was the special from New Zealand and forgot what hubs ordered). I thought the lobster mash was good but way too buttery. The rest of our meal was okay. We couldn't order dessert because we had to leave but the server was kind enough to give us a complimentary anniversary chocolate cake. He was a great server btw...wish I remembered his name!

zZ6RYv_7XY3glhZSswbNRg.text: Great filet.  Wonderful service.  Big portions.  My lobster was overcooked, but other than that, it was good.

JwxfL_fsiKq8N1JO89GmJw.text: Came here for a friend's Birthday.   The service was superb, a big thank you to Peter our waiter for dealing with such an unruly large party!  I had the Kansas City Strip Steak...was amazing. They use a great rub or some other seasoning.   We started with a couple dozen Oysters which were fantastic, and not too expensive. All the sides were great, including the potatoes and spinach.   Great wine selection, and its only 2X for certain bottles of wine. We had 3 bottles each around $100 but top vintages of some great wineries in Napa.   I believe the birthday boy got a free desert of some kind, but at that point in the meal I was having to much fun to notice.   This is a clean, fun, and delicious higher-end place to eat with friends. I will definitely be back

PRMDmxwoIBGTXBVGnvlH9g.text: I had high hopes for this location - I've gone to the Malibu and Beverly Hills locations before and wanted to try the one in Vegas for my husbands birthday. It pains me to say that the food unfortunately was not good this time. Upon arrival, they seated us pretty promptly, in around 5 minutes or so. By the time the waiter came by, 20 minutes had passed - I get it, a restaurant gets busy, so I didn't think much of it. We ordered the entire meal at once -  crab, iceberg wedge, and the Ahi tuna tartare as our appetizers - these were the best part of our meal. Our main dishes took an hour to come out and the waiter didn't come by to check on us, etc. My husband ordered the bone-in ribeye and I ordered the filet. Both steaks were to be cooked medium, but they were cooked well and seasoned so heavily with pepper and salt that I could barely taste the meat. It made the meat so dry. We also ordered green beans, mashed potatoes and mushrooms for the sides...the green beans lacked flavor; they tasted like nothing. The mashed potatoes and mushrooms were okay.  In any case, I was disappointed at this place - some things were good, but others were subpar, given it is Mastro's.

khGmVHi0SzipixHbuFWr6A.text: this was my first time trying mastro's and I'm glad it was in vegas.  and let me tell you, everything here was expensive.  I probably won't be coming back but I'm glad I finally got to try it.  lobster mashed potatoes - it was actually pretty good!  the lobster taste and the mashed potatoes really mixed in well together.  I've heard that this dish wasn't as good in the costa mesa one  bone-in-filet - very tender and very good!  bone-in-kc strip - i loved it  i loved everything that was bone in.  I didn't get to try the bone-in-ribeye because it was too big  we also got a side of asparagus which is like $10 (not worth it).  although it was good, it tasted like I can cook this at home for so much cheaper, and it would taste the same.  nothing special at all

0j5Iii248hP1uZ6PuaxNPg.text: Recently dined here to celebrate a friend's birthday - what a great choice! Mastro's is centrally located on the Las Vegas Strip at the Crystals Shops. Part of the restaurant has this cool area called the 'Treehouse' which overlooks the shops below. Mastro's has a pretty even ratio of steaks/chops and seafood items. Once you're seated they bring a nice assortment of breads in a basket (my guest liked the pretzel rolls especially). There's a good amount of appetizers and even sushi and about 8 salad options. As we both recently had steak - we decided to order seafood - I ordered the Grouper and my guest had the Fillet of Arctic Char (very similar to salmon but not as 'fishy' IMO) and we shared sauteed asparagus, twice baked potato and steamed broccoli - it was A LOT of food and we ended up taking stuff home. Both fish were very nice and flavorful and prepared just right and the side dishes are served family style so one side dish is at least good for 2 - 3 people (if you have a group order different ones to share). Make sure to save room for desert for the 'famous' warm butter cake with vanilla ice cream and fresh whipped cream. OMG!! This will take cae of any sweet tooth! LOL They put a candle and wrote 'Happy Birthday' in chocolate on the plate and my friend absolutely loved it and so will you! I recommend making reservations as it gets busy. Bring your appetite and enjoy!

zHZtA_-9BRsd4F55oy_vVg.text: Okay the food here is AMAZING! For starters I recommend the crab cake or the ahi tuna. The bone in filet mignon is to die for and the butter cake is the only dessert you should ever order.   Now, that being said I have given this place two tries and if you're going to eat here you better have plenty of time and no plans for the rest of the night. The first time was with my husband for my birthday and it took about an hour to get our appetizers and the restaurant was far from occupied. Not only did it take an hour but then the appetizers were burnt and had to be made again. We ended up being so late that we had to get our food to go. The second time we didn't make any plans but the service was very mediocre. The bussers kept bumping into my chair, the server disappeared for a while, the food took a long time (as expected) and when it came time for dessert they brought us out a cake for our anniversary and left before I could order a butter cake for dessert. I would have gladly paid for it but the next time we saw the waiter he dropped the check and left again.   The food really is amazing. There isn't much ambiance and maybe my expectations are always too high for the service.

JNGUIjDLhz0akj2y6AkuVg.text: if Jesus dined out, he would dine here and even HE would have to count calories. The food is AMAZING!! It was my husband's birthday, so we brought our appetites and we should've brought the deed to our house as well... more about that later. We had reservations and were seated promptly. Our server was Michael, a lovely gentleman and self -proclaimed foodie like us. We started with foie gras, Dungeness crab cocktail a dream berry and lemon drop. We ended with butter cake and key lime pie, in between was a New York strip Oscar style which was tender and flavorful in every bite. Halibut, more dream berry, and neat shots of glenlivet 15 year chased with pelligrino. No complaints whatsoever, but everything is a la carte and very rich, like maybe they should offer complementary heart surgery instead of after dinner mints rich. Not cheap, we left $717 lighter, tip not included but it was worth it to indulge and celebrate life.... while shortening it considerably. Eat up!

9V-XEEKhIS1uhWwHBGJdxw.text: The overall design is impressive.  It was busy on a Friday night, and the staff was very attentive.  They are busting their ass all night long.  We had the seafood tower which was good.  The horseradish sauce that came with it was tasty.  I had the pan seared Chilean sea bass which was divine.  Every bite melted in my mouth like butter.  The seasoning was perfect.  The lobster mash was good, but the lobster was over cooked and a bit rubbery.  Overall It was good.

OGNFVM7L3OQPMIMrt9Uw9A.text: My favorite place to dine in Las Vegas!  (1) Service - I forgot his name but awesome, awesome server! Best service ever. He was hot too! Drools! 5 stars for amazing service and seating me with a hot server.  (2) Seafood Tower - massive shrimp, king crab, lobster, three types of oysters, and massive mouth jizzy.   (3) Bone-In Ribeye - mouth jizz... must get! 5 stars  (4) Lobster Mash Potato - one of my favorite dishes. Drenched in BUTTER... yum! 5 stars  (5) Asparagus - well cooked! 5 stars!  (6) Bone Marrow - 5 stars!  (7) Alaskan King Crab Black Truffle Gnocchi - 5 stars  (8) Birthday Chocolate Cake - I got this for free... so sweet of them... but it wasn't my birthday... I think they gave it to the wrong person.  (9) Coffee - a little weak... I wanted a strong one... so I can get ready for the clubbb... yeahhhhh... woots!  OVERALL** Yup! That was all for 2 people... haha! I eat a lot! Massive bill... but worth every of my penny!

n8OCtQ7t2n56UJHFOqla9A.text: The meal may have taken 3+ hours (we had a large group and were in no rush, but still) but man, was it fantastic.  The group started with the smoked salmon, fried calamari, and some shrimp dish (i'm allergic so I don't remember what it was exactly). The smoked salmon was delicious. Not anything special necessarily, but it sure was delicious. The fried calamari was cooked perfectly and came with such a delicious sauce, a superb aioli as opposed to the more traditional tomato sauce.  One thing the group really appreciated was that Mastro's agreed to specially make a burger for one individual who didn't want to eat steak. Of course, the individual got sick, but we were so appreciative of their willingness to accommodate us that we asked to have the burger brought out and we all shared it - cut it up into sliders. They were melt-in-your-mouth incredible. For a classy steakhouse, Mastro's sure makes an incredible burger.  I had the Chilean Sea Bass for my entree, most everyone else had steaks. Boy am I glad I went with the Sea Bass though, I was already feeling a bit full from the appetizers and then the sides on top sure was a lot of food. The fish was cooked perfectly, seasoned excellently. Flaky and fairly light actually, it was a good sized helping as well. Would definitely get again.  For sides the table all raved about the Lobster Mashed Potatoes, but I'm allergic, so I couldn't eat it. Which was fine by me because the Gorgonzola Mac & Cheese was heavenly. And the portion of the side was enormous. Honestly, I could've had the mac and cheese side as my entire meal and gone home happy.  Food was great, service was as good as expected, just a wonderful meal overall. Would go back again in a heart beat.

kWC9LbEBNlNjptrXsmcLEA.text: You can do a lot of interesting things in Vegas.  I had no idea fine dining in a funky abstract treehouse was one of them.  Mastro's is quite the experience -- from the structure itself, to the wondrous items and their presentations, to the exceptional and classy staff.  You salivate as you picture-perfect dishes being carried by.    The seafood tower is a spectacle - double tiered dish with dry ice smoke surrounding it.  I have no idea how the waitstaff can carry that giant concoction.  It came to the table and shocked us at first sight.  The shrimp were the size of my fist, the crab legs were monstrous, and everything was overwhelming.  If you can eat after that appetizer, then hats off to you!    As luck would have it, I was crazy hungry, so I went for the 22 oz Bone-in Ribeye.  It came out on a plate sizzling at 400 degrees.  Perfection!  Medium rare to the T.  That was the second best Ribeye I've ever had (first being V&A).  I wanted to pick up the bone and start gnawing.    Someone else got the Halibut cheek which also looked very unique and delicious.  I really wanted to order it.  Alas, as a Texan, Ribeyes speak to my heart (on so many levels?)    This is definitely one of classiest places that I've been to.  What an upscale Vegas experience.

vR-08R2kOQnMJecsg2-fsw.text: Hands down one of the best steakhouses in town and believe me we have tried a lot of them in Vegas on an off the strip.  Tony and Peter are the best servers you can get and will treat you like royalty!  From the minute we walk in the door the staff is beyond exceptional and THAT is what continues to bring us back every time.  The food is delicious, the martinis are the best and that butter cake is the bomb!

iDbN7SnFdO8U0hMXazE1Qw.text: Best food I have ever had in my life. Very pricey but that is expected in a high end mall on the strip. Love this so much and can't wait to go back!

DC3cjSz4eTCV-LMctpjCjQ.text: In a city full of excellent restaurants Mastro's Ocean Club is too-shelf. Great selection of beef and fish served by an attentive wait staff. We've also gone to group dinners there and they did a wonderful job for 40 guests.

by4tMytCwMAOoWTO4GYzDw.text: A mediocre experience. Awesome, awesome service (probably best of the weekend) let down by seriously overlooked fish and an 1hr15 wait for food. After being met by the friendliest server in a city of friendly servers, we were about to eat our own arms as food arrived. The sides were great - but the halibut was so rubbery and dry. We sent it back and by the time 2x new ones arrived - we had eaten enough sides we were full and didn't really get to enjoy it.    I was going to give 3* then remembered the worst part. When the bill arrived, the server smiled and said I hope that's ok - I thought great, she'll have taken off the overcooked entrees. Opened it up and last item was -$xx for 2x entrees. Perfect. But then the total felt too big still - so checking back up the menu, they had ADDED the 2nd lot of recooked fish then removed it again at the bottom so it looked just removed - most people after a couple of drinks no way would've noticed that. SUPER sneaky. Kinda took the edge off the whole experience really - doubt we'll be back

ocE-b8Ysp_anqQrzxi1Arg.text: **This review is for the bar area only**  I've heard many great things about this restaurant, and after reading other Yelp reviews I decided what better time to try this place out than my birthday? And what better way than sitting at the bar, and partaking of some artistically created adult beverages?  For starters this place is located smack in the middle of the Crystals Mall, you can't miss it. It's the big wooden orb shaped thing that seams to be floating in the center of all the action. It's pretty neat, but as other reviews mentioned, I'm not sure I'd want to spend $200+ on a dinner with a mall atmosphere. None the less it's quite a unique experience and they did a great job (at least in the bar area) of making sure their music drowned out most of the mall sounds.  I knew the drinks here would be pricey so I was prepared for it, but for others it may be a shocker. They have an extensive list of specialty drinks starting at $16, but most are $18. I was told their in-house specialty was a lemon drop which came over dry ice, I didn't actually try it though. I did try the Chocolate Martini ($18)- which won me over because of the giant chocolate covered strawberry on the side of the glass. It truly was dessert in a martini glass! Other views were correct, when you order a martini they give you the shaker along with your drink so you can refill your glass, it's almost like 2 drinks in 1. I also tried the Banana Foster ($18), it was delicious but not what I expected. It has whipped cream, I expected it on top but it was shaken inside and gave the drink a bit of a lumpy texture.  The bf tried the Mastro's Mojito (also $18) and it honestly was not very good, it  came served in a tall glass so there was no shaker on the side. I wouldn't recommend ordering this one. His mom tried the Dragon Fire ($18), which as very tasty, but yes it was hot/spicy - not something to quench your thirst. She rounded off her evening with the Flur de Blu ($18), one I was considering as well. She liked it, but after I tried it I was glad I went with the dessert-style drinks instead.  The service was good. The bar wasn't busy so we had as much attention as we wanted. We were able to watch them make our drinks and that was a fun part of the experience. We saw all kinds of great food coming out of the kitchen so we asked for a food menu, we elected not to order anything since we'd already been there a while and run up a tab of $100. However one bar tender offered to bring us a bread basket. The bread was great and the basket came with several different types of bread, and super soft butter. Note to self for next time: ask for the bread basket when you arrive, it's free.  I think I'll drop in some time again, when I'm in the mood for a dessert martini and can afford the $18 drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from Crystals mall, the bar &amp; a Mastro&#39;s Mojito $18
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate Martini, Dragon Fire, Banana Foster, Fleur de Blu - each $18

QNQG-eFYZSbmvHOA4yledA.text: Simply bad service from the waitress Christina. Ignored and didnt offer a second drink to us thus loosing value to the owners. Second time meeting her and not a fan. Local resident at Crystals.

UMPVWWI3JgtUqMjefGmGgQ.text: This place was wonderful!!! Our waiter was the nicest man, the food was delicious I recommend the Alaskan crab legs and the gnocchi. You have to try this place

bM5b5tPKa_2Z55m1NXR_YQ.text: Such a cool place for a fine dinner.  I was served the best espresso martini one can find on the strip, by a cute little waitress called Sooner.  I found great entertainment in watching her bounce around all evening. We enjoyed one of her recommendations which was a sea scallop dish with a light tomato sauce.  Sooner made us feel spoiled all evening.  Great value for $$

uuhwhKrDp7W8bKK-fS8vGw.text: I heard so many good things about this restaurant. I finally treid it, expecting too much.. I was a bit dissapointed. Service was horrible.. You would think for a nice place it would be pristine. They served my mash potatoes on my plate like it was PRISON FOOD and served the rest of my party the same way. The food was ok not that amazing. I had the Salmon with mash and maccaroni, kinda pricey for the service you get. The food quantity was alot i must admit but it did not WOW me as much. I woudlnt reccomend this place, but if you like to try new restaurants like myself i would check it off my list.

JpYAuexbMsdEcM6jXtKVaw.text: I regret not going back to Jean George's Prime restaurant.   I wouldn't  go back to Mastro's if you paid me. To be fair it wasn't because the service was bad because it was very good. Props to our waiter Troy.  If you're a steak-snob you're going to weep for the cow who gave his life to the second rate chef who doesn't know how to season a cut of meat. I ordered the 18oz bone-in filet which is a glorious piece of meat. It was the first time in my life I didn't finish a steak.  If you're like most people you'll have ONE, maybe TWO, nights to eat out in Vegas. If you're  considering going to Mastro's, that means you're likely considering other high-end restaurants like Prime, Cut, Craftsteak etc. Regardless where you go, you're going to spend $90-$150 a person so wouldn't you be disappointed if you weren't blown away?!  Go to Prime.

3CSFdTqDMN7biNO0IRy5kQ.text: Ordered the australian ragu, lobster mashed potatoes, mac and cheese, creamy spinach, brussel sprouts, and vanilla baked lobster. All extremely delicious and great service. The australian ragout is 33 oz, I shared with a friend and it was more than enough. Another friend got the new york ragout which is also delicious but very, and i mean VERY fatty but just as tender and juicy. Depending on your taste, I preferred the australian ragout.

jAAMXNO4WjUR987xWq5ADw.text: I really wanted to enjoy my experience but despite very good service, Mastro's disappointed. Outrageously overpriced for subpar quality chilled shellfish. Embellished preparations took away from the quality of the fish dishes. Many better expense account options in Vegas.

H7Hl4axP9Ggl0mVxlDkjTA.text: If you're a fan of beef or as I like to call it "MEAF" (meat + beef) then you need to go to Mastro's.  This is the second time I've eaten at Mastro's; the other was in Orange County, CA.  This is a place where you want to burn your money and empty your wallet.  Why not waste it on fine food instead of strippers and gambling.  This venue in the new Crystals City Center is a little small, but the atmosphere and location is excellent as it sits over the ledge with a great view.  A sexy live singer and a pianist playing the tunes of some 60's through 90's music.    I ordered a medium rare 22 oz Bone in Ribeye for dinner and a side of Sauteed Asparagus.  The main entree does not come with any free side orders.  Side orders are priced separately.  I didn't have to wait too long for my Ribeye as the service was excellent.
