The beef was perfectly prepared and no need to add any additional seasoning.  However, I always like my food spicy so I asked for some Tabascco.  The Asparagus was ok as it complimented with my meal.  The food is exceptional for the price.  But don't buy too many drinks there as it does get expensive.  Great place to hang out and enjoy the atmosphere.

Oh7rpIOAWWVNuyBS0dFz3A.text: I had the crabcakes, ahi tuna, seared scallops, gnocci with truffles, spinach, chilean sea bass (I like this fish for future reference), and creme brulee with homemade whipped cream (best whipped cream ever).  WOW.  It sounds like so much food now - no wonder i was hurting!!!!  Don't worry though - the pain is gone.

KTgLL35_gsMYG2FX2X3Z5w.text: Solid American, good steaks, but really, this place shines for dessert. Namely the Butter Cake.  It weighs seemingly 8 lbs. Two people would be hard pressed to finish it, especially if you just ate a huge steak.  Pricey dinner, but large portions and good food.  Great service, fantastic location if you sit in the "tree house".  Live music often and usually very crowded.

3KSkDPr8CsCwTCsG5dSaOw.text: I'm not feeling up for a lengthy review so I'll keep it brief. For two of us, without wine and dessert (the later was comp'd by our Mandarin Oriental Concierge) our tab was $230 + tip. I can say without hesitation having dined all over the world, and eaten at the best steak houses in NYC, Chicago, Palm Springs and LA, this was NOT a $230 meal. At best it was worth $120.   Food= Our seafood appetizers were delicious - oysters and shrimp. For dinner we ate fillets, lobster, au gratin potatoes, and creamed spinach. The meat was good, lobster decent, and sides very disappointing. Usually this is what makes a Steak house memorable -not here.  The warm "pretzel bread" and butter cake dessert were by far the most memorable portions of the meal.  Atmosphere = you're eating in a mall - albeit a beautifully designed mall with every luxury brand in the book, it's still a mall. Within the tree house where we dined, you watch mall walkers beneath you. Ouch.  Service= Very good, attentive, but not $230 good.   Overall 3 stars. For all of us Zagat's goons, I'd go with Food=21, Decor=23, Service=23.

9CVDjbL720YdKbTVlnyrUg.text: One of the best dining experiences I've had in Vegas in a long time. Located in Crystals shopping center in Aria, great views from the restaurant if your seated in the right place. Decided to try this restaurant for my husband's bday after a friend's recommendation. I ordered the sea bass and my husband ordered the 20 oz rib eye! The BEST steak and sea bass we've ever had at any restaurant in Vegas.  The waiter was excellent! He knew we were sharing and decided to split both items for us ahead of time. He made an excellent recommendation on how the sea bass should be prepared (blackened) and plated our sides when our food came so we barely lifted finger :P And since they knew we were celebrating my husband's birthday he got a free chocolate birthday cake :) Will definitely be coming back here again! Excellent food, excellent service!

aufWJ2wEtEfc0pCey-Yjew.text: Lobster mashed potatoes, seafood tower, bone-in filet, 5 star service, presentation, be sure to get a spot in the "treehouse" section. Take a good look at menu prices beforehand though;)

y1Gt61yGrScQCzxb23A-Ig.text: 4 stars: Yay! I'm a fan.  When I called to make reservations a few weeks in advance, I had asked to be seated inside the "tree house" and they were able to accomodate this request.   Mastro's is a steakhouse chain that is better than most. If your school of thought is that Ruth's Chris is the pinnacle of chain steak in America, then you will be pleasantly surprised to have broadened your horizons.    What I like about Mastro's is that the dining experience is very consistent regardless of the location you choose to frequent.  This particular Mastro's is inside a shopping mall. A very nice shopping mall, but still a shopping mall. It's slightly off-putting, but does not affect the food or the service. If you wish to eat at a "proper" steakhouse, with burnished leather, dark wood furnishings, and Laguioles then perhaps Mastro's is not the spot for you.  If you're not too snobbish about your surroundings, I think this is a solid steakhouse in Vegas that doesn't require you to traipse through a casino to get to it.  The food is consistent with any other Mastro's so I won't dwell too much on it.   Stick with what you know.   The lobster mash, the crab and truffle gnocchi, biggest ribeye you can split with someone, or porterhouse if they insist on a tenderloin or filet.    The butter cake is worth every last calorie, so please be sure to save room for it at the conclusion of your meal.

m2ipr7hEHp4QiyvjRNbx-g.text: By far the best steakhouse in LV. Our server was Tony and he really took the time to explain everything! Cannot wait to come back!!!

eQZcw12Mi23BRFt85Ex1Mw.text: A type of restaurant for very special occasions and/or company expensed dinners. A 5-star experience from the service, attention & of course, the bone-in rib eye.

kPknZkDAT0y0EFh4C9-fvA.text: I LOVE Mastros in So CA and Scottsdale and was very excited when this place opened, however, the location and ambiance (treehouse in the mall?) of the new LV Mastros is a little strange and does not compare to other locations.  I will not return because of this. Seafood tower, pretzel bread, gorgonzola mac n cheese and bone in rib eye are all wonderful choices.

NOPAwrGdnC55o_oqdcxk0w.text: 1.) The wait staff was inattentive.  2.) Sommelier (via waitress) brought out the wrong bottle of wine. 3.) Lamb was medium well when asked for medium rare. 4.) Swordfish was raw and under seasoned.  Front and back of the house need help.

HOgH8GaMFJUgLAkLnG-PpQ.text: I came here for my friend's 30th birthday dinner. It was delicious. Seafood was obviously delicious, but what really surprised me was that their sides were also great. This restaurant served me the best gnocchi I have ever eaten. Just for that wonderful surprise, I give this place 5 stars.

OzVxXUSZcZ5KSAMbhWNXQA.text: We've wanted to have dinner here for a while, the structure of this restaurant is really cool.  We got to sit in the treehouse, which was really cool.  However i found the music to be a bit loud, but that may be because they had a full house, and therefore  the music had to be loud to overcome the conversations?    Our waiter was awesome, i cannot remember his name...he told us about the 32oz Australian Waygu tomahawk chop, and he had us hooked.  Thank you fellow yelpers for telling me that the portions here were huge.  So we decided to skip appetizers and go straight to the beef.  Oh boy was there a lot of beef.  The sides were also awesome, mac and cheese and mushrooms, they split our tomahawk and everything so that we didn't have to do it.    Our waiter recommended the butter cake, oh my goodness...it is a whole lot of cake, and it was so yummy...so glad we skipped the appetizers or we never would have finished this dessert.    We will definitely be back the next time we are in Vegas!

bWYtmriAV0cjw6r-6wHrwg.text: I'll just get right to it:  I love their steak. They serve some of the best steak I've ever had. Not exactly my favorite, but it's up there! The sides are just as good. We had creamed corn and garlic mashed potatoes. For appetizer we had oysters. Service was great! No reservation needed and no waiting.   Oh, and get the warm butter cake!

a07kdME8WaafVOgDOXJU3Q.text: Came here and we sat at the bar. Even at the bar the tree house is so cool to look at! If your going to eat dinner definitely have to make reservations to sit in the tree house! I got the pomegranate martini and was so delish! We also got the butter cake! Which is a must try here. Literally melts in your mouth of sweetness!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pomegranate martini and Mastro &#39;s Signature Warm Butter Cake

LX93Uohtw5qrXarvUeV0OQ.text: When I open the menu, I was thrilled with the prices, for sure 4 $ signs on Yelp. We picked thick bacon & lobster cocktail as starters, pan seared Chilean Seabass & sashimi Bigeye Tuna as entree. Have to say all good picks. Seabass is juicy, tender & fresh, tuna sashimi is Chinese mixed Japanese style, flavorful. Lobster is fresh. 2 cocktails pick are good, too. We are here to pre-celebrate Anniversary. They have sweet surprise too. Last but not least, we are seated in tree room, love the decor & design.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

X1Prt0GifNz8qG8MZkhSXA.text: Mastro's is such a treat, we went two days in a row over this past weekend. They really made by birthday a truly great experience and I could not have been happier. I am a huge onion ring snob, and Mastro's were the best I have ever had...think onion donuts more. Also, the sweet potato fries have to be at least 5 pounds! Dungeonous crab is an amazing starter...the service here by the waiters, hosts, and bartenders is all second to none and very impressive. Atmosphere is amazing and you will definitely not be disappointed. Very reasonable prices for the quality of food, that doesn't mean inexpensive though so definitely bring your wallet. Please do not skip on their ever so famous butter cake...it probably is one of the best desserts I have ever had.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mastro&#39;s famous Butter Cake...Amazing

2kqMmM7X1be3kuMSmfaa5Q.text: Still great food and service, but I'm taking it down a star since they have done away with their entertainment.  This is Vegas... no one wants a stale dining experience!  Basically, you only have so many times to make it a great night in Vegas, and there simply are too many other great steakhouses in town that offer a better overall fun experience like STK, Bazaar Meat, and S.W. to go back here.   I've been to many Mastros locations across the country, and this is the only one I would not recommend. Bring back the fun, and I'll come back too.

1bGzrBRG-vTPpr08mcR85w.text: 12/31/18: Considering that Mastro's had always been my favorite Vegas restaurant... I made reservations to ring in the New Year and have this be our last meal in 2018. I have never been more disappointed by any other restaurant! My absolute favorite drink is a dirty martini with extra blue cheese stuffed olives... The waiter was kind enough to fill my martini glass with plenty of olives, however, the cocktail itself was the worst I'd ever had. The martini was hardly dirty, but I decided not to complain since he was so generous with the olives. For our appetizers, we ordered the Dungeness crab cocktail as well as Alaskan red king crab claws. Dungeness crab has always been my favorite and I remember ordering this dish the last time we dined at Mastro's. The Alaskan claws were so dry and it was nearly impossibly to remove the crab meat from the shell. We had to use our napkins to do our best to break into the claws! The main meal consisted of Chilean sea bass, Alaskan King Crab legs, and scalloped potatoes. I was disappointed with every dish! The sea bass was undercooked, the scalloped potatoes were saturated with grease, and the King crab legs were by far the worst I'd ever had! The crab legs were very thin and the meat was over cooked and completely dried out! I was shocked that they had the nerve to serve such a low quality dish at such a high price. The only reason I didn't complain about the entire meal was because my boyfriend politely asked me not to. The service itself was fine and our waiter was polite and attentive. However, the quality of the food was not up to par with our previous experience. My disappointment was exasperated by the fact that New Years Eve is always a very special night, and Mastro's did not rise to the occasion.   Previous Review:  One of the best dinners we've had in Vegas! We had early reservations and the restaurant quickly filled after we arrived. The "treehouse" atmosphere was adorable yet elegant! The entire staff has very friendly and attentive. We ordered the Dungeness crab cocktail, Boston clam chowder, and Chilean sea bass with Ahi tune and mushrooms for our entrees. We both agreed that the Chilean sea bass was by far the best fish entree we've ever had! The sea bass was prepared perfectly (we opted for the fish to be grilled). My favorite type of crab is Dungeness... and it was super flavorful, tender and moist. Not one complaint with the entire experience. I even received a follow up phone call from the restaurant to ensure that we enjoyed our visit. We are both looking forward to returning to Mastros for another wonderful experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grease filled scalloped potatoes... disgusting!
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thin, over cooked, dried out Alaskan King Crab legs. Worst crab legs I&#39;ve ever had.. especially for the price!

BAPNtpv0Xw8gssBAPXpcIw.text: I am seriously so impressed and so in love with this place. My bf and I came here for our 3 year anniversary dinner. I made my reservation with a request to sit in the bird nest which was completely followed. The ambiance is trendy and still somewhat romantic. It's located in the middle of the Crystals shopping center, but you honestly don't feel like you're in a shopping center at all once you're there.   Food wise we started with some oysters as a appetizer. They were super fresh & tasty. I preferred the west coast over east, but still both were very good. (4/5) We also were provided with complementary bread and butter. I only had a small piece since I didn't want to fill up too much. For a main entree I had the Chilean Sea Bass. It was cooked so perfectly and the texture was like butter. It wasn't over powered at all with seasoning and the fresh lemon along with it was perfection. (5/5). As a side we shared the Lobster Mashed Potatoes. It was a huge portion and the pieces of lobster were very generous. It was seriously to die for! THIS IS A MUST ORDER! (5/5) To top off our meal they provide us with a complementary anniversary dessert. It was very good, but I was just too full to eat more than a few bites.  Overall I was very impressed with the food, service, and decor of the restaurant. I will certainly be back again in the future & definitely recommend this place to others.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Aspen Ridge Steak
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mastro &#39;s Signature Warm Butter Cake
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilean Sea Bass

rm0uO-cjhv4fnlop4Ba5tw.text: I typically don't do chain restaurants but this one is consistently good no matter where you are. Took my daughter for her 16th birthday and they were so nice. The waiter had the bartender make various Virgin mixed drinks for my daughters. They loved it. We ordered so much food, you had to roll us out. The butter cake never disappoints and they brought it out with a birthday candle. Very thoughtful and great wait staff. I'd come here again! Loved it:

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YURXtKm8ooaZEyT2MDgg6Q.text: I dined in this evening with a group of girls, we are visiting Vegas for a bachelorette party. Brandon & Anabelle were very patient when we called over the phone by giving us directions & telling us exactly where to go. We felt welcomed & the atmosphere is very elegant & relaxed. We had the pleasure of having Tim as our waiter. He went above & beyond for us. He knew the menu like the back of his hand. He made great conversation & was very VERY attentive. I have never had a waiter like Tim & I'm so incredibly thankful I had him tonight. Antonio was just as amazing, he had such a wonderful smile every time he approached the table. Kept up on our refills & was so polite. He removed all of our dirty plates & also put away my leftovers. I appreciate a good crew when I see one. I ordered the steamed mussels, king crab & the gnocchi. SO MUCH FLAVOR IN EVERY BITE. Black mussels had just right chewy texture with a squeeze of lemon and croutons. King crab legs were perfection with melted butter. The gnocchi was a great portion for two.  Overall if I could I would give this place a 10/10. Thank you so much to everyone!

Zk667oNZVTXIsCh-am8A_A.text: The design of this space is pretty cool.  Even though it's in s mall,  you don't notice it as you dine.   The service is on par with other Mastro's locations.  A couple of mis-steps on entrees were quickly rectified by management.  Overall, we enjoyed the dining experience.  I would recommend the convenient valet parking for the mall.  Other than walking, and who wants to do that  before/after dining, valet park.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A glimpse of the menu.

cMxxkslzmJQLqP6b9zOukg.text: Enjoyed our meal. Our servers were super attentive. Service was a 5 out of 5!  Entrees were 3.5 out of 5. We had some hits and some misses. I had halibut and it was a tad dry. My husband had filet and he thought it was a little over cooked. The tuna tartare was my least favorite very mushy and tasteless. Our two favorites of meal were the shrimp cocktail and the butter cake!

w4R7awnUSgD7-jXasW7pNA.text: I will start with YES it is a chain but it is always consistent and never seems to disappoint. This location is partially located in a giant treehouse in the center of an atrium. I was never in a treehouse as a child so as an adult I can appreciate it over a Chopin martini. The crab cakes were fantastic not mushy at all and you can see and taste the fresh crab meat. Calamari was good nothing crazy at least it wasn't overly greasy or chewy. Shrimp cocktail extremely fresh. Ribeye was spot on, prepared perfectly on a sizzling plate. The service as always was spot on. The best part of any Mastro's meal is by far the butter cake! So sinfully rich and decadent.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab cake
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Butter cake A+

czlErMBVU5dB_dar3fZeUQ.text: This place is garbage. Im so sorry to say, & i am not one to write bad reviews but when a high end restaurant fails time after time, something is terribly wrong. I live at the adjacent high rise next to Crystals, & ive ordered from here over & over thinking its just been bad luck every time i get my food.. but this time ive had it. When i called in to place my order i specifically asked them to make sure i get ginger & soy sauce w/ my sushi (which should be an obvious given) but because they seem to always forget, i figured this time i would triple ask so it doesnt happen... of course i get home & what do i see? Sushi w/ NO SOY SAUCE OR GINGER. Not to mention the sushi tastes awful, old & fishy. I also ordered the sauteed shrimp which came w/ NO SAUCE!!!!!! What in the world ?!? This place is a hot mess & if the kitchen is this absent when preparing food that says a lot about management & the restaurant as a whole. Never going back nor will any of my high roller friends.

XBInpHi3sZ6uaZRfTMC8QA.text: This place was absolutely amazing.  The restaurant was clean, the restrooms were clean, the staff amazing / professional and the food was amazing as well. The restaurant is very pricey, but worth it. My party spent approximately $450 (4 of us), but the quality was top notch. If you want to spend money on quality food......come here. We will definitely come back!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari (one of the best I have ever tasted).

8L6_wrIoHJQ2ddg9YXNrgQ.text: We had dinner the other night and the service was excellent.  We started with tuna tartare, which was outstanding, and escargot, which was very good, and loved the puff pastry.  I had the Halibut which was very good and my wife had the Artic Char, which was kind of dry and tasteless. Our waiter asked how our dinners were and my wife mentioned about the Artic Char and they offered to replace it or give her something else which she declined. The General Manager came over but my wife declined to get anything else.  I had the Key Lime Pie with their home made, absolutely wonderful, whipped cream.  All in all, the meal was very good and when we got our bill, they had taken the Artic Char off the bill.  We felt that this was outstanding Customer Service and would highly recommend this restaurant.

O_syBUGh5rYR7JrMEndWDw.text: Take 3!!! Came here for my birthday celebration and knowing they have the best steaks in town.  Although, I have tried Mastros steakhouse and the Ocean Club, this was by far the best from customer service to the food.  If you have not been here before, Mastros Ocean Club is located in the Crystal Shops in the Aria. Since some of the other hotels charge for parking, choose to park your car in valet, as it is free. However, do not forget to tip the people.   My fiancee and I got there a little bit early, but we also had a reservation. They even sat us down early, which added more brownie points for this review. Prior to deciding if you want to go here, also make sure to let them know if you are celebrating a birthday, anniversary,  or promotion as you will be receiving a special treat at the end. Also, they can get extremely busy on other occasions. So book in advance.  The menu: they have appetizers, seafood, steaks and chops, salad, veggies and potatoes (not included in meal, considered sides) desserts, a massive wine list, cocktails, and beers. Since we were hungry and did not want to put food to waste, we ordered medium well 22 oz. Rib eye steak, cream of corn, lobster mashed potatoes, and rosemary mushrooms.   The food: they do take their time perfecting how all their steaks and chops taste. The steak, was evenly seasoned, juicy, and tender. I did not even have to use A1 steak like I normally do at other places. Makes you want to keep eating more and keep your mouth drooling for more. The cream of corn, awesome! Creamy and complimented the steak by adding some ohhh so sweet taste. The lobster mash, oh my, you thought that lobster could not get any better. This is also what they are known for. Fresh, buttery, fluffiness. Must order, and I am pretty sure you will never want regular mashed potatoes after eating this. Last, I got a complimentary chocolate cake for my birthday w/in house made whipped cream. By the end of eating, I literally could not eat the rest of my cake. We also added the chocolate pudding cake, which also was taken home.   Overall, the service was on point! Thank you to all who made this one for the books. Will be back soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thanks mastros!!!
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happppy birthday, to die for cake!
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Take 2

0shZng3X8P9Ppm9_MfjJvw.text: We are used to the same old go to steakhouses. The experience at Mastro's was at or better than most in the same class including old standbys like Ruth's Chris, Oceanairre, and The Capital Grille. The portions and flavor at Mastro's were excellent and the drink menu matched. In a city with a lot of great food options, Mastro's holds its own.   Without a doubt, come hungry and be prepared to leave stuffed.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uspS7ji-EFaCFJparsgI5A.text: I have been to the Mastro's in California and I loved it so much, I simply assumed this one would be just as great, boy was I wrong! The service is okay, not 5 star worthy but just okay.   Let's talk about the experience of the food. My husband and I brought his parents here for Thanksgiving dinner and we were very excited to be able to treat them to a "great" meal. We all ordered steak and lobster, the waitress mentioned that the plates were 400 degrees and to be careful not to touch them. I wish that was True but she lied...  When they brought my plate of steak and lobster my steak was freezing cold to the touch. I told the waitress and she took 45 minutes to have her manager come out and ask me if I wanted to have them re-heat the food. At that point everyone at our table was nearly done eating. So I respectfully declined and wanted them to take it off the check. The manager then came over and was like what else can we do aside from taking it off the bill? I told him that I didn't think it was necessary because my party was done eating and we had a show to be at and I was honestly not in the mood to eat a re-heated steak. He rolled his eyes and just grabbed the plate off the table in such a horribly rude manner. Needless to say, I will never return to this location.

a2yjJz3iHKbJU3ERgVocsQ.text: Food decent.   Service not so good for this level of restaurant.   Dirty plates on table for extended period.  Never asked if I wanted cocktail or glass of wine.  Server doesn't have a good understanding of menu.  Honestly haven't seen sever in a awhile.  Grouper was terrible.    Might as well have ate My belt.

tcB0Sm_7s4QqgsUbMw-fvg.text: Review Notes  We celebrated a milestone birthday, and I wanted to splurge for the best seafood I can find in Las Vegas. I might have found it! I'm not kidding about splurging. This place is the most expensive restaurant I've ever been to, but to be fair I knew that before I made reservations. This was a Tuesday evening, and the restaurant was packed, so I highly recommend making reservations. I use Open Table. Mastros Ocean Club is located at City Center on the Strip adjacent to the Aria. The unique building structure looks like a gigantic whistle or modern tree house. Honestly, I'm not sure what the shape is suppose to represent, but you can't miss it when you get to City Center. We were seated inside the tree house overlooking the mall. We started with Fried Calamari which was amazing. Entree's were Pan Seared Alaskan Halibut and Chilean Sea Bass that melts in your mouth. Rosemary Garlic Sauteed Button Mushrooms and Garlic Mashed Potatoes completed the sides.  For desert we had their famous Butter Pound Cake topped with Vanilla Ice Cream. Don't even look at the dessert menu. Just get this cake. It's that good. Overall Mastros Ocean Club is a top notch restaurant that serves up a 5 Star menu, a quiet ambiance and a professional attentative staff to ensure you have a memorable dining experience. We'll be back.

xMu0PQ8DcSWv-0nF1el9hw.text: Now we've eaten at Mastros in Newport Beach and to be honest, I was not a fan. However our experience at the Ocean Club in Vegas was great!   We had a large party for my husbands 40th bday last weekend we were visiting and the food and service was great!   We started with seafood towers, calamari, bone marrow and crab cakes. Everyone seemed to love it all.   Most got steak, however I got the scallops and they were delicious. I appreciated that the waiter was diligent in letting us know what others had ordered as sides so we didn't double up, which gave us an opportunity to order a different side for us to share. Of course that was split down the middle. One half of the table were able to share sides while the other half had their own. We had plenty of food.   From what I heard, the drinks were fantastic! Unfortunately being pregnant I wasn't able to partake but they were a hit at our table, which is where dessert came in for me. Wow I was surprised at how many strawberries came in the order but I was able to share and everyone enjoyed it as well.   Thank you for making my husbands birthday dinner a hit!

GT5G5JHKUauAsORm3w8KMA.text: Best Filet Mignon and butter cake in town. I have eaten at many different steak houses and this one is my favorite. Superb service. Make reservations in advance as this place is always busy. Also try the lobster mash. You won't be disappointed.

BfogQxMFjkZ6dtPvC82cFw.text: Amazing food and service. We went for the first time for our last pre-baby date night. I took the Yelp tips & requested we seat in the wooden "tree house". It is very open but intimate at the same time. We started out with the shrimp cocktail. The shrimp were the size of lobster tails. They were huge. Next we ordered crab cakes which we all crab & very little binding & fillers. I took another yelpers review & we split a steak and sides so we had room for the famous butter cake. It seriously is amazing & life changing. It is expensive so this will definitely be a celebration restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jumbo shrimp cocktail. Mid bite &amp; 9 months pregnant. Craving satisfied.

tuzpmVeB9eqM99DubFVf_w.text: We are HUGE fans of Mastros  and go to the Newport Coast , Palm Desert and Scottsdale restaurants whenever we are in those neighborhoods. We were in Vegas this week and had never been to this one until now.   Well I must say I will never go back there! Terrible service first of all.  We didn't see a waiter for first 10 min!   Drinks were great as usual.  Seafood tower- always a hit- however we said we wanted lots of shrimp and a few dunguness crab.  Got a few shrimp and tons of ( there were 4 people) crab and it was not smelling good to us! I told the waiter but he pretty much ignored me and of course charged us for all of it.  Steaks- warned about extreme hot plates(we knew about those) --ya not hot.  My son asked for a new hotter one and it was the same.  The steaks were not hot and not up to standard as we usually are used usually used to !!! I had the chopped salad 3 weeks ago in Scottsdale and it was fantastic. This time it was bitter tasting and I could barely eat it. The waiter asked if I didn't like it and I said no  .... no response from him and of course was charged.  Overall we were not happy and very disappointed with our experience and won't go back

OmGig1KuMtrRZx0rMmSwXQ.text: I Love to try new restaurants whenever I visit Vegas.  Our party had a craving for High Quality Steaks and we luckily found Mastro's though Yelp.  We scheduled a reservation last minute and they were able to find a table for us.  Food and drinks here was delicious and the service was great!   The next day I noticed a discrepancy with the charges on my credit card.  I called and spoke to the manager.  He was very attentive and responded to my concern in a very timely manner.  The experience here was wonderful.  If you're in the mood for a luxurious dining experience in LV, definitely try Mastro's Ocean Club!!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7GgCXp99m-WnLXq3cKXubw.text: Absolute perfection.  Shrimp cocktail that makes a grown man weep. (Really, the horseradish sauce does in fact make you weep...take caution).  Ordered two tomahawk steaks cooked medium, with truffle butter...definitely worth the additional $15 scoop of butter... Two grilled lobster tails...and the Gorgonzola mac n cheese was absolutely delicious. Definitely fills you up after a few bites, but most definitely worth it. Butter cake to top it all off, and you got yourself a party in your mouth. Your taste buds will thank you.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomohawk perfection
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gorgonzola mac!!
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Butter cake

LWfC6cueiu85skyKqAxluA.text: Mastro's takes the cake as far as a next-level steak and seafood experiences and has set the bar very high for all other like-contenders. Their Bone-In Ribeye (charred, medium-rare plus) will forever be the compared-to factor against all other steaks I come across in my lifetime.  The Ocean Club was an excellent dining experience among many in the city of Las Vegas. The great ambiance of the tree house accompanied by stellar five-star service sets a standard of elevated heights and their menu features some of the best food items in town.  Without saying anything more, I have zero complaints on my first encounter and eagerly looking forward to my next.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tree House view: Bone-in Ribeye, Lobster Mashed Potatoes, glass of Darioush

qPYZFW5ETQYCV7B9Fih2XA.text: We finally tried Mastro's for valentines 2018.  We've been eyeing those lobster mashed potatoes for a long while but with a 35 dollar price point we just never ate there.  So finally we went.  The lobster mashed are worth it!  Easy reorder next trip.  Fish was excellent. Those were the standouts.  We would return for the fish and the mashed.  Some of the other items we tried were ok but not a reorder for us.  Service was great, room and atmosphere was great for Valentines.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8s661OH9sqsVKVxv0JAgSA.text: This is probably a 4.5 star review, but there really wasn't anything to gripe about, so let's ring in the New Year with 5 stars!   I've been interested in visiting Maestro's Ocean Club for quite some time. I'm a seafood lover, and a lover of fine dining, so it is right up my alley.  Located in Crystals, the layout is interesting. You simultaneously have the feeling of being in the mall, yet separated from it. There is a dome of sorts as the ceiling, so shoppers cannot see inside and gawk at the diners, but the diners can somewhat see out into the mall. Tables are a smidge close for comfort, but that's just a personal preference.  Service, as expected, was wonderful. Our server was friendly, personable, knowledgeable and professional without being overbearing. There is an extensive cocktail list, and I enjoyed my cocktail- "Strawberry Dream", which is very sweet, but I like sweet drinks.  For an appetizer, we split the lobster cocktail, which ended up being more meat than originally expected based on the presentation. Although the server warned us about the heat/kick of the "atomic horseradish", it actually was quite bearable, and complimented the lobster well.  I opted for the crab cakes as my entree, and they were also quite good. Perhaps not the best crab cakes I've ever had, but certainly a fine showing. They perhaps could have used a bit more seasoning, or some of the horseradish, but they were full of meat, and the little filler held things together well. We got a side of the Gorgonzola Mac and cheese, and wow!! Huge portion, and holy cheese, batman! Super cheesy!! Really good, very mild though.   For dessert,  we split the butter cake, and it was melt in your mouth good. Seriously. The homemade whipped cream along with the ice cream may have been overkill, but if you're going to do dessert, might as well go all out!   Of course, Maestro's is on the expensive side of things, but if you want a solid seafood fine dining experience, I wouldn't shy away from it.

SSRCyDDHvPw6mUyZDXkmAg.text: We came here by chance just walking. Luckily there was a table at the bar so we didn't have to wait. Our waitress was very sweet but what gives this 5 stars is the managers. While the food was being delivered, moving the bread I spilt my drink on my steak and lap. The manager brought me a new steak, plate and drink all while apologizing for something that was an accident. They also where constantly checking tables and on the move. It was a great dinner with great customer service. They can teach the one in Newport Beach a thing or two.

zLWPIPu2hOcdojfRA97bzw.text: This was our second experience at Mastro's and it was better than the first. I am a fan and would highly recommend. Samantha was our server and she hit all the high points. Her attention to detail and insightful explanations make this restaurant a GoTo place in Las Vegas. Thank you

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy Birthday &#34;Butta Cake&#34; .... WOW

Wo6327CaOPdepkoKI690Mg.text: Great food. Great staff. Dessert was amazing. Outstanding atmosphere. Ordering one side is more than enough for two people.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FmUypXyhY2OgHVWcMO4p9Q.text: Extremely disappointed. Been to several locations in California so we were expecting nothing but the best. Turns out we received the complete opposite. For starters, my wife's filet was cold and my ribeye was rare (ordered med). This after taking almost an hour to get our food. Our Rockefeller oysters were at best average. I would say that the highlight of our dinner was the complimentary surprise deserts in celebration of our anniversary. That was a nice touch. Also, our host was nice enough to comp one of the steaks. Still, the poor experience put a damper on our afternoon. All in all, not what we anticipated for our anniversary. Sadly disappointed.

ll_y63WTCoVNnKDNp_9NBw.text: Can't go wrong here! This is one of the hot spots in LV. It's right in the middle of an upscale mall and has a nice buzz  to their energy level. The food is really on point but know ahead of time, everything is a la carte. I ordered the filet mignon which was prepared medium-rare. It was pink in the center, tender, tasty and really filling. Our group ordered an individual plate and then we shared the sides we ordered. No quality was spared by the chefs and we indulged like kings!   It's on the higher end of the price range but it will make your trip to Las Vegas memorable and delightful.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side view of my beautiful medium-rate filet mignon!

5qX6X4OuP0s1jwVG_3fjew.text: Went to Mastro's to celebrate hubby's birthday and it did not disappoint.  This was our first time eating at Mastro's but we will definitely be coming back.  The lobster tail was huge and my petite steak was so soft.

NgJFrcoWgp_pD0fXcLuc8Q.text: The food was excellent and the ambiance was lovely. The service here was incredible; our server was attentive and knowledgable. I appreciate that they cleared the table (and even our crumbs) immediately after the dish was finished!  We had the Chilean Sea Bass and it was cooked to perfection. We also had the Seared Scallops, which I feel are very underrated in terms of recommendations. The scallops were also perfectly cooked, and the sauce they were served in was delicious. The lobster baked potatoes were loaded with lobster!   They also gave us a complimentary slice of chocolate cake for my boyfriend's birthday. It was one of the best chocolate cakes I have had: moist, not overly sweet, and absolutely delicious.  This place is on the pricey side, but you definitely get what you pay for. Excellent food, wonderful service. I can't wait to go back!

YPVIMcR4KA2hLIUXPQfnlw.text: This review is a little late, but I had a different experience compared to all the other yelpers.   We came in for Thanksgiving Dinner, luckily we got a table right a way. The hostess was very sweet. The ambiance of the restaurant was great, and it's located right inside the mall.   Service was great from our waiter and he was very attentive and helpful. My only issue was that when our server was busy and we tried to call someone over but even though other waiters were around and saw our flag down we were totally ignored.   Our food came timely, the spinach and scallop was delish! My only issue was that there was a hair in my lobster mash. I let the waiter know and he kindly took the mash away and asked to replace it. The replacement was delicious but I was already turned off with that hair.  That's why I took one star away. I felt that if I'm paying $300+ for a thanksgiving meal, it should come with high quality food, good service at all times, and that doesn't include hair in my food. I requested my steak to be medium well but it was definitely very rare. The meat was under cooked for my taste, and they were nice to recook it but it just took two times for them to make it right. & I'm reallly not a picky eater. It just sucks that the time they spent recooking in sitting there watching my party enjoy their meals.   All in all, I was dying to try this restaurant and had high hopes for it.. but I would not come back because of the high price tag and the service/food was not worth the $$

k9jgm-AOyDzm-5_MljFkNg.text: This is one of the few Mastros that offer the vanilla battered fried lobster tail mmmm. Not all do

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vanilla Battered Lobster Tail. Was to thick batter this time .Like I said usually on point when I come must be a different chef .
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna Ahi Tuna Tartare, been here many times the tuna usually better texture and fresher and brighter
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters Rockefeller

9_axPy1ADabVsRXG4BbKPg.text: I've been to the mastros and Costa Mesa, but this one in Vegas probably has better customer service.  The food quality is the same, and tastes the same. They offer most of the same food items but for some reason Vegas is a little cheaper.   For the appetizer I got the lobster bisque and the mastros Cobb salad? I suggest ordering the salad as a half size the portion was huge even split between two people. The lobster bisque was soooooo good! I didn't want to share, but I did. I'd definitely pick that over the salad any day.  We ordered a bottle of red wine...forgot the name but it was pretty reasonable for $45.  For the main course I got the bone in ribeye, snap peas, mashed potatoes, sauteed mushrooms. All were really good! I was super full from drinking and our appitizers we had to make most of it back to our hotel. But the leftovers were still amazing as a late night snack.  I suggest sitting in the "tree house" it seems a little more intimate than in the other section. Lastly thy brought us out the better cake and oh my gosh! They did not have this option at the Costa Mesa one. This seriously was so good!
