Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jFJX8dot3MY_x8FJy4G9yA.text: Great restaurant, great food, great service. In addition to steaks they have a huge variety of Seafood. My wife and I had sea bass cooked to perfection and our friends from Taiwan had steak that they said was the best steak ever.

LhjxWl_hetd_bzUVfE72qg.text: Amazing. Just amazing. Came here for my birthday and the staff was really sweet. We started off with some bubbly and then wanted to do a shot so we asked the waiter to bring us a mixed shot. Our shot comes with pineapple juice and it was so warm as if the bartender didn't shake the cocktail. That was the only part of the night that was okay.  Other then that the food was amazing. Had lobster bisque and their chilean sea bass both were so beautiful and fresh. They even brought out their famous butter cake that said happy birthday!  Really cute location and a very romantic vibe there.

QpSThu_fpJqBuMaztFaBlA.text: Amazing shrimp cocktail and oysters. Crisp perfect sea bass. If you are looking for somewhere to blow your winnings, this is it.

4I4vsPs3YACN2QykvFxkgA.text: Came here on a Saturday night, and although they were absolutely packed, the service was excellent. I ordered the Ribeye, and the first time around this particular slab was tough and stringy. I started to tell our server and he grabbed the steak no questions asked without even letting me finish my sentence..Could it have been that I tried my brother's Kobe beef steak prior to trying the ribeye, which set up unrealistic expectations? Possibly....but they brought out another ribeye fresh off the grill, which was nice, tender, and perfect. For desert, we had the warm buttercake, which was phenomenal. Also add some drinks into the equation, and for three of us, our bill was $385. I think it was worth it, though.

3iWX5PeEieP4IqGlOpnxow.text: Went with a group of friends and the food was just ok. The service was ok and the price was high. I must say I thought the decor was nice and cozy, considering its in the center of the busy mall.

hSkCGQrlhGmKZ9u0NRxT1A.text: No surprise here.  MASTRO'S always does a great job.  The martinis,  the food and the service were all superb. We had to split the check for 4 of us 8 ways due to no alcohol is allowed to be on an expensable reciept. This was NO PROBLEM which is not usually the answer. The dungeness crab app was to die for. Everything was perfect .

4qwWDQVAa51NAjSpnAlJKg.text: Forget about reservation, still waiting after 40 mins past my reserved time. Very rude hostess kept lying about our table will be ready soon, manager was nice enough to offer free drinks for waiting.  Then after almost 1 hour of waiting we were finally seated, but now more waiting for our waiter to help us and after that 1 hour of waiting for food.  My friend ordered medium and the steak came out well done, again the manager offers free dessert for their mistake.  Our reservation was 7:30 and we were there until almost 11, the whole time I felt like one of my ex girlfriend (always bitching).  Horrible experience even with the free drinks and dessert.

X06oWnYMWk0S1y4IoD_m6w.text: Came here for a friend's birthday celebration and the prices justified as much.  We gave our buddy a lot of crap for not being specific about tap water and we ended up with a fee of $20 for flat water.  Oh well.  I'll take the story any day.  This is definitely a white table cloth establishment.  It's not super stuffy, but this isn't the place to roll in wearing shorts and a t-shirt.  The restaurant is beautifully designed and if you can, try to sit in the "pod" where you get a view of the mall interior and everyone walking around.  Food was excellent.  We shared the shrimp cocktail and the vanilla battered shrimp for appetizers, and to this day, I still remember that vanilla battered shrimp.  Probably one of the best appetizers I have had.  My main course was the chilean sea bass.  The serving size was enormous and it brought off into perfect flakes during consumption.  For the side dishes we had the asparagus and scalloped potatoes.  Highly recommend either but their selection has a lot to offer.  Service was attentive as expected and best of all got to use a little bit of Polish.

0Y1AKenulNvfls1gznLF7Q.text: We splurged (again) to enjoy mastro's great food and service.  This last visit was our second visit and we weren't disappointed at all.  TIP: to guarantee your spot, always make a reservation.  Las Vegas ocean club has the beautiful tree house and I even asked to sit in there.  They brought us to the bar while we waited for our table.    I was pleasantly surprised that the drinks we ordered were actually strong; usually other restaurants are stingy with their alcohol.  Maybe it was due to being in Las Vegas, but those drinks were tasty and strong.  A few minutes later we were seated inside the tree house.  The staff were very attentive to us.  We ordered ahi tuna and a filet to share. A couple of side orders of veggies, salad, crab cakes and some bread completed our meal.  I really thought that we would not have enough food but I couldn't finish it all!  We promised ourselves that we would come back just for dessert- and we did return the next day! - just for the chocolate pudding cake and their cheesecake.  I LOVE their pudding cake and I am not a chocolate person!  Again, their service was outstanding. Crazy busy on a Friday or Saturday night or slow like a Sunday dinner, the staff never forgot about you.  If you ever want to experience great service and food - consistently, mastro's ocean club in Las Vegas is a sure bet.

oQ0GxnaQpXvVlVtC0yeesw.text: I'm no stranger to Mastro's.  I have spent many a special occasion at the one in Costa Mesa.  This is now my local Mastro's for the time being, so my boyfriend and I decided to have a nice Valentine's Day dinner at Crystals.  All-in-all, as with the other Mastro's, the food and service are top-notch.  Our waiter was attentive, friendly, and patient; other waiters provided the same level of attention to us even though they weren't assigned to our table.  Like always, we shared a 22oz ribeye, and a side order of Alaskan king crab gnocchi with black truffle.  We grabbed a second order to-go because we love that dish that much.  For Valentine's Day, we also got a complimentary order of Mastro's signature warm butter cake, which is incredibly sweet and rich.  Love it.  My only complaint is the atmosphere of this location.  The main dining room is located in an open-air treehouse structure inside the Crystals mall.  Although for Valentine's Day we were seated in one of the private dining rooms upstairs, I would imagine the atmosphere between the two is similar.  I dig the dimly lit, quiet, romantic ambience of the Costa Mesa steakhouse.  Since this location is in a mall and (mostly) open-air, you get ... a mall atmosphere.  Which is okay, but not optimal.  There also seemed to be a lot of very loud, drunk people at the restaurant, but I figure they're everywhere on the strip on a Friday night.

TL5EhNkjmIlvjxoUkaOSHA.text: 22oz Ribeye is outstanding! Warm butter cake is the perfect desert!

vnA4FraUaP1hwHKcb3UiVw.text: My hubby and I celebrated our 20th wedding anniversary here with my daughter and parents. We started off with Mastro's Seafood Tower. You can create your own seafood tower to your liking and size. Our seafood tower had shrimp, snow crab claws and oysters. We all enjoyed especially my daughter; the cool dry ice effect and seafood tower presentation. The seafood was fresh and the oysters tasted amazing. My hubby had the lemon sole, my mom had the Chilean sea bass, my Dad had the herb roasted chicken, I had sauteed sea scallops and my daughter got to sample a little bit of everything. We shared two sides family style of their signature lobster mashed potatoes (love this combo) and the other side dish of roasted brussels sprouts. The seafood and chicken entrees and sides were served hot, fresh and perfectly seasoned. At the end, they complimentary served us their yummy signature warm butter cake dessert with vanilla ice cream and added Happy Anniversary wish which was a nice added personal touch. We had a wonderful time and food experience on our first visit here, and the service was friendly and excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 20th Wedding Anniversary dinner at Mastro&#39;s Ocean Club.

4sKybhu70oxnQwO1cxmpbA.text: Food is awesome.  We split a shrimp cocktail (4) and two Alaskan claws to start and they were served over dry ice, excellent!  Bone in ribeyes with spinach was excellent but maybe too much.  Could have split the steak leaving room for the butter cake dessert.  Also the bread is incredible.   For wine add the Stags petite syrah.  And they were generous with the wine.  Only downside was tables for two are limited and we were a twosome.  The guys big head in the both next to us was the center piece for us.  Good place for 4 to 6.  Great food and service.

C6l9IC5hXmpTcGKYTMpD1A.text: We sat in the tree house; very cool atmosphere although the mall brought it down a bit. Food was very good as was the service. A notch below the SW steakhouse.

QdGz1xZnZOWOEqiQJWuuYA.text: I've been to BV and Newport Beach locations many times, but still the LV location is my favorite.  Oysters are always fresh.  Filet mignon is always cooked to perfection - rare+.   Just a wonderful dinning experience.  Enjoy...

UQWd9oeSdjqEJp1M87-TBQ.text: This restaurant has become one of my all-time favorites! I've eaten here multiple times over the past 3 years, and that's says a great deal because the Strip has so many fine dining options. I've actually had the same waiter, Mike, a couple of times. His knowledge of the menu, and service to our table couldn't have been better.   My favorite entree is the Fillet of Arctic Char Oreganata style. This is a flavorful fish like sockeye salmon or snapper, not bland or mild like grouper or cod. The portions are large at Mastro's, both the entrees and the sides, and this dish is no exception. They serve 2 fillets of fish. There must be 12 to 14oz of fish on the plate. I've ordered steak here once as well, an 8oz petite filet. Is was excellent, cooked perfectly, as one would expect at a high-end restaurant.   For desert, I recommend sharing the Mastro's Signature Warm Butter Cake. It has an amazing smooth and warm buttery taste that intensifies as you near the cake's center.   Lastly, with regard to the dining experience, the restaurant is located in the Crystals Mall, however, there is no "mall-feel" to the experience whatsoever. The wooden "tree house" dining area is an impressive sight to see, and a truly unique and beautiful open-air room to dine in.

WoANH146_B3CYnE6i0mwKw.text: GREAT steak! Had the bone-in ribeye... delicious.  Minimal sides as the Vegas "eating tour" had me full, but definitely couldn't miss the dessert (chocolate cake, crumb cake and whipped cream).  A must-do next time you are in Las Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NJbmIpHLiuVnkdwfQul-mg.text: Food and service always great. The Manager Daniel is always friendly and goes above and beyond.

QkdbY7AJkhCzrMY7gdE7xA.text: Comfy bar tables, and almost every entree was excellent...The Filet was perfect, one of the best pieces of meat I have ever had, 5*+ but the NY Strip was average at best. All the sides were excellent and service was great too. Overall a great experience and I will be back for sure.

SPlN2rKeExIqAxkLLdoHLw.text: In a place where restaurant service is generally lacking (Las Vegas), Mastro's hits the ball out of the park!  This is top notch service (white & black napkin service, hot hand towel service between courses, sides served onto your dish at the table, crumbing, etc.).  Notables not to miss: the crab cocktail - TRUST ME.  OMG...already shelled WHOLE pieces of crab - and so many!!!  The cocktails are awesome - do not be scared by the $15-20 prices each, you get about 2.5 martini glasses full, since they leave the cocktail shaker with (a lot) more in there.    We also had the escargot, which was a little (too) salty, even for this dish but still good and they made for a unique appetizer.  We had 3 different types of oysters, which were also good, but that is not really a refection on this restaurant since a raw oyster is a raw oyster...but they were very cold and served on a platter with dry ice, and accompanied by three different sauces, which was neat.  We shared the bone-in prime ribeye as an entree.  It was good, but Flemings is better, in our opinion.  Maybe we got a weird cut?  The dessert they brought out (complimentary) for my husband's birthday was the butter cake with ice cream.  It was excellent - my husband took that home and ate it in bed, like a heathen!  He even woke up and had some more the next day!!!  For a side, we had the lobster mashed potatoes... they were good and we are both glad we got them, but they were not worth $36, nor was there 1.5 pounds of lobster, as advertised.  That was a bit of a bummer, but we are still glad we got them once - still a tasty treat!    Nothing was bad or even just OK - it was all good and points were extremely excellent - The real stand outs were the crab cocktail, the service, and the alcoholic cocktails - these were far and above other nice restaurants!    We are so thrilled to have found this place (via a birthday gift for my husband from a friend) and are very much looking forward to coming back and trying some of the other yummy options on the menu!  Tips: ask to sit in the bird's nest.  You can share a steak and a few appetizers and have PLENTY.  we took our whole dessert and some of our steak home and we are both big eaters.  ORDER THE CRAB COCKTAIL!

j1bG0LFvoll9zNmHjbmX0A.text: I have to say the best dinner we had in the week we stayed in Vegas. THe food and service were the best Have to get a cosmo they service with dry ice, it is an experience. Waiter Paul was the best could not do enough for us  have to try the Lobster mash potatoes

_3pmzESccFCUBKmAn7VQpg.text: Sat at bar two nights in a row.  Food excellent except maybe a bit of minus for chopped up wedge salad but seafood is best in lv.  Very service oriented, pleasant and attractive bartenders.  Never rushed or pressured to drink or eat more than I wanted.   Would definitely return.

XjOdT7zDohhcTO5IKxJKSA.text: OMG delish! Gorgeous atmosphere, incredible service and from the shellfish platter to spicy Caesar salad to perfection steak we were very pleased with the whole experience! Happy Anniversary to us!

TR7sTffunFO3WSh5KI6WYA.text: They are good at taking a reservation but not honoring it. 8pm reservation on a random Wed and we waited over an hour. Ultimately the manager made it right so we will be back and give them another try.

XOjxGp6N0Xxq3r2oNwOprw.text: Worth every penny! Everything bite was beyond delicious. Best lobster bisque I've ever had. The filet with truffle butter was perfectly cooked and tender. We added creamed spinach, lobster mashed potatoes, and asparagus all were very good, especially the lobster mash potatoes. Nothing but good things with the warm butter cake. Even if you don't have room for dessert, you have to have the warm butter cake!!!

4asvShrmwPKhr_C5BdPyew.text: Girlfriend and I celebrated our 3 year anniversary we each got a filet mignon steak which was great along with the lobster mashed potatoes, but bad thing was there were some lobster shells that I bit into.  Waiter was quite nice to comp us with a free butter cake desert which was delicious!

9nYmmZm288RxIYQkydodqA.text: Got to freeload a meal at Mastro's last week. Been to all the Mastro's restaurants except the thousand oaks location so i'm very familiar with their food.   a little surprised by the bar area - kinda small felt a little claustrophobic . Asked for a michelob ultra - sorry , we ran out ...on a tuesday ?!?!?   the restaurant is cool looking but i don't need our waiter to babble on about who designed it, how much was spent, blah blah blah   Let's focus on the food.   Started with the seafood tower - solid . Of course, the pretzel bread - still my fav pretzel bread though CUT gives Mastro's a run for the $$$.   I went for the meat - Bone in rib eye, some creamed spinach and asparagus. Of course, my fav, the blue cheese/oil oil and garlic sauce for the steak ( pic ) ...decent but not to the level of the mastro's in B. Hills and Costa Mesa . The rib eye was also average - the talk about the plate being 400 degrees when it's brought to you - i think they needed to add the 400 degrees to the broiler - i ordered medium but it was rare. more bothersome, it didn't have that nice outer sear bordering on crunch - it was too soft ! flavor was decent.   Some nice pinot noir wines - even though the host gave me the wine list to order, i showed restraint - a Laetitia from Paso Robles and a forgotten Oregon - both under $90 each

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. where&#39;s the butta !
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. hungry ?

4wGNLXU56TZbywtOgzBNQg.text: I come here everytime I visit Vegas. I usually share the Porterhouse, which is amazing - Tender and a top quality cut cooked to perfection.  Top it off with the Alaskan King Crab Black Truffle Gnocchi and Lobster mashed potatoes, it's definitely worth the visit.   Yes it is pricey, but it's as good as it gets!  Book ahead and ask to be seated in the Treehouse!

sP2XYPv_MyY2cyffP6sGng.text: First off, location, location, location.  While it has the name, with this spot inside a shopping mall, you know something else make up for it.  Unfortunately with the rather loud "Billy Joel wannabe" pianist playing all night, and the shoppers strolling by looking at your dining selection, this place does not rate as well as it should.    While the service was outstanding, the quality was mediocre when comparing it to other similar, better located, places in Vegas.  Price hurts a little too...guess the uberMall rents are high so the costs need to be passed along to the diners.  Since service is one half of a successful dining experience, this is what saved it from garnering a single star.  If you are looking for convenience and staying at Aria or Vdara, you could try this place....or you could walk a little further to other higher end dining experiences.

uyrwMG5U4TCrdP2QB152eQ.text: Food was most excelente!!! Got the blackened salmon and rack of lamb... Best Bloody Mary ever had ask for Brandon best waiter on section..

L7_SaByUpR0KaG41IIvWmw.text: If I could, I would give it 3.5 stars. The food varied from excellent to average and while our server was very friendly a salad was forgotten, dishes were not promptly removed, drinks were not refilled promptly, and when alcoholic drinks were completed we were not asked if we would like another. It seems on the night we went the server just did not have the support he needed for this to truly be a fine dining experience nor did the food measure up to a True fine dining experience. We enjoyed the unique design of the restaurant and the atmosphere but will not be putting it on our short list of places to visit.

1BMX7ottg6PJYtmPxDvhDA.text: Best restaurant in Las Vegas. Everything on the menu is top of the line. Great service and great atmosphere

9wKKhnxjGKuGU45QOdNOng.text: Awesome food! Awesome service. Came back here twice on our Vegas visit! Will be visiting again!

BVaAkVZQRR5CYnOOFC-vSQ.text: I followed Peter H.'s advice and was so happy I did.  The seafood tower was amazing.  The tower can be any thing from the raw bar you'd like to create.  I let the waiter create it for us.  It included, Alaskan king crab legs, lobster, oyster, carved crab meat, jumbo shrimps....  They were all very fresh and cooked,except the oyster.    I had the lobsters bisque which was excellent.  The wedge salad was good but nothing special.  For the entree, I ordered rib eye steak, medium, with lobster mashed potatoes.  The rib eye was sooooo tender with great flavor.  The lobster mashed potatoes was unique and best tasting mashed potatoes I've had.  There was a good amount of lobster meat inside.  I tried to taste my friend's prime rib, which was not as good as my rib eye.  I did not have a chance to taste the dessert since we were all so full.  I thought the setting in the terrace was a bit informal not compatible with the price charged for the dinner.  I'd definitely recommend sitting in the tree house.  The seafood tower cost more than  $200 by itself.  The rib eye steak was $52.  The mashed potatoes was $38, but a good amount was given.  If you plan on going, you should plan for $75 to $100 per person.  The service was a bit slow but very good attitude.  Oh, be prepared to pay to $2 tip to the restroom attendant each time you use it.

8F5F-zkNMSeFAhBK-zSzcg.text: We went there for my cousins birthday. It was everything I was expecting it to be. The food was amazing, the service was great, they even brought out her favorite cake for desert all decorated!!!!

-Jc7fseVJnHSutBxZQ5Y4A.text: I've reviewed other locations, so I'll keep it simple.  Bone in Filet  Mastro mash  Start with seafood tower of Claws, legs,tail and shrimp  Malbec to wash down with  Hit the strip

OI0ZpXI65-atfzor7pU9sA.text: A mall restaurant by any other name is a mall restaurant.  Beautiful mall by the way. This restaurant is very very very expensive.  My personal recommendation is don't order rack of lamb well done.  It comes out inedible as punishment for liking well done.  I have made and ate well done rack of lamb all over the world. Never has a restaurant cooked it in such a way that a knife could not cut it AT ALL.  Service was great though. My husbands steak just ok.  Butter cake was wonderful though.  We would not return.  Much much better restaurants in Vegas.

J5t6xiakrM6DKk0lAfi5Aw.text: Definitely one of the best meals I have had in a long time.  Everything at Mastro's is great-- from the service to the ambiance to the food, the whole evening was really enjoyable.    I don't even usually like shrimp cocktail, but it is really exceptional at Mastro's.  The jumbo shrimp is delicious and the over the top "smoking" presentation is pretty amazing.    The steak is obviously great, but I could have eaten just sides all night.  The creamed spinach, mashed potatoes, and roasted Brussels sprouts were all delicious.  Since I was there with a big group we also sampled several desserts.  I know a steak meal can be filling, but try to save room.  Highlights included the chocolate pudding cake and the key lime pie.  A great restaurant for a special occasion.

1ICaVx3zNoCxiJKPr4vKxA.text: A good friend of ours suggested Mastro's when we asked for a recommendation for a seafood on the Strip. So I made a reservation online for that night at 7pm on the Mastro's website. What I didn't know was that I had somehow clicked on the Chicago location. Luckily I was walking around the Crystals shopping center that afternoon and went to check out the venue and was chatting with one of the hostesses who offered to check on our reservation to confirm it .. good thing she did and we fixed my error. They were pretty booked that night but were able to squeeze us in. :)   The service was pretty much top-notch from start to finish, hostesses, servers, and bussers,  all were very attentive and knowledgeable as well as being friendly and personable. Loved that they dish out our sides for us .. that's a really nice touch.   The food, we had a variety of items which were all delicious but at the top of our favorites were the Alaskan King Crab Black Truffle Gnocchi and the Signature Lobster Mashed Potatoes. Both are must haves to accompany any steak or seafood dish. We had the bone-in Filet which was melt-in-your-mouth delicious as well as the pan seared Chilean Sea Bass which my dining companions said was spectacularly prepared and seasoned.   Dessert was over the top .. we had three .. Mastro's Signature Warm Butter Cake,  the Cherry Crisp, and the Profiteroles. The first two were topped with Vanilla Bean Gelato. Both were to die for. I had read lots about the Warm Butter Cake and it was everything I had expected and more :) .. and surprisingly I also loved the Cherry Crisp .. I am not huge on Cherry anything but the flavor had just the right amount of sweetness and was not overpowering and the Crisp part is a crumbly granola like topping which is an nice balance with the Gelato and fruitiness of the dish. It's something I would definitely order again!   My only complaint is that the server didn't warn us about the size of the Beef Carpaccio appetizer. Mom and I each ordered our own, and when they came out .. they were absolutely gigantic and even though we had a party of 5 we were unable to finish both. Being in the service industry myself, I would have definitely warned my guests about the size of the Carpaccio dish and suggested something else to order with it.   All in all it was a fabulous dinner, the restaurant, even though it is in a busy mall .. has a nice ambiance, and we will absolutely be back.

4DTFlIUkcHzJqmXidakJog.text: I was eating there on Sunday June 7 with my family. The atmosphere of the restaurant was really relaxing. Very classy. The waiters were very careful when serving. I ordered the 12 Oz filet. It was AMAZING, the best steak I have every had. I also had the lobster mash potatoes, that was also a very delicious choice. I couldn't finish it all, but shared it. I was very satisfied when I left. They also provided us with a vanilla yellow cake with cream cheese, topped with vanilla ice cream,  strawberries and oranges with homemade whip cream. I loved it! I am definitely going back again!

_HakRCRPrk094KR7Q6HL4g.text: Top shelf restaurant.  The BEST  Burt is  a regular at the Chicago Mastro's.  Burt loves it.  The Vegas version is an Ocean Club.  Everything here is top quality. Bone in Ribeye,  Bone in Filet,  brussel sprouts, Scalloped Potatoes.  Butter cake dessert.  The usual Mastro's fantastic food.  PLUS seafood.     Burt ordered the twin lobster tails.  Cooked to perfection!  Not an easy thing to do.  Lobster usually is a little tough or well done.  This came out perfectly and cooked very slowly on the hot plate but never got over cooked.  Excellent service as usual.    Mastro's Ocean Club is located in the center of a mall.  That sounds horrible doesn't it?  But its not.  First off its a high end mall.  Burt requested to sit  in the Tree House, which is a modern type open style room that hangs out over the mall.  It was very comfortable.  A live band was playing in the lounge so being in the Birdhouse was a nice distance to hear the music and feel the energy but still be able to conversate(sic) with the people at your table.    Bottom Line-  Burt Loves This Place!!!!!!

GSubAiVMRGCkjUaCyLlynQ.text: Mastro's is the best steakhouse I've ever been to. I've been to a lot of locations (Newport Beach, Malibu, Beverly Hills, Palm Desert, Las Vegas, All 3 AZ locations) and it's NEVER been anything but the best. The service, the food, the entire experience from start to finish puts all other restaurants to shame. In fact, I find myself often saying in regards to other restaurants "It was good, but it wasn't Mastro's"   :)

kbEK_-Id7J7L6ioAGZ0dCg.text: Went here for my wedding dinner 4/6/2012. We were early so we sat at the bar. Had some really cool drinks thanks to bartender Amy. Very accommodating restaurant. Food delicious. Especially the dessert which we were too full to eat. But we did anyway! Delicious. Make it a point to go there, you won't regret it.

wlxGobTrDtaeDekPFfIILQ.text: Our group of 12 had dinner at Maestro's and it was fantastic.  Jamie and her team provided us with excellent customer service and the food was exceptional.  Don't miss this one.

SCxkKMP2YoQYuZrtB8oC_A.text: Absolutely recommend Mastro's Ocean Club.  We had a wonderful experience in the tree house.  We started with an apple martini and a berry martini.  The apple martini comes out smoking, we also saw a Cosmo come out the same way.  A really cool touch!  We order an appetizer of shrimp cocktail, it come with three but since there were two of us Lionel ( our server) suggested we get four, so we did.  They were huge and very tastie.  The cocktail sauce was delicious along with some very hot horseradish, perfect balance.  We also ordered ahi tuna as an appetizer, this was amazing too.  Ordered salmon prepared blackened style and my husband order tuna Asian style with a side of asparagus.  We ordered way to much food as the portions are very generous.  We then had raspberries sorbet, which was to die for.   So, I mentioned large portions..we took home tuna, salmon and asparagus to our hotel room and ate a wonderful lunch in the room the next day.  They also boxed up the bread, which is a variety of sourdough, pretzel roll and something like a baguette.  Our lunch was just as good as our dinner.  I mentioned Lionel earlier in my post.  Well, you must request him as your server, he is personable and very professional at the same time.  Be sure to sit in the tree house.  It is expensive, but well worth the splurge!

os0t28tRFxerv3DCoRIeNA.text: I always make sure to stop by when I am in Las Vegas I come here pretty frequently the service is excellent the restaurant is very classy the waiter went out of his way to get the chef to make us a special pasta dish that they do not serve on the menu I will never forget that and am happy that I discovered this restaurant in the crystals mall I usually eat the one in Beverly Hills and this one put to shame try the lobster mashed potatoes and a bone in filet mignon they have a pretty good lemon drop martini as well

nL9dbvEfEFRJzzenZDj27Q.text: Oysters Rockefeller, Escargot, Ahi Tuna tar tar... and lobster mashed potatoes with CHILEAN SEA BASS (oh, how I loved you!). This is a perfect menu. The place is beautiful, food is amazing, service is impeccable - this is Mastro's. GO.

jQGlv5ZgxeP31Oyo-L-UVA.text: This place is still a 4 to 4 1/2.  Pricey but great food and service.  The steaks, lobster tail, and sea bass were all worthwhile.  They have a nice bar that you can grab a drink at before dinner and the music they play live is nice.  Typically, standards.  Leave room for dessert.

RAZxu9SoThqnoHUuAbaW8A.text: This was out second trip to a Mastros steakhouse and it would be hard to top the experience in Scottsdale. The food was excellent and the service was attentive and friendly. The waiter had just a little trouble pouring the wine, but other than that he did an outstanding job and was very efficient. I prefer a darker feel to a steakhouse and with the Ocean club being in the mall that was hard to achieve. Overall I would definitely go again. Bone in rib eye was a little undercooked but excellent. And the butter cake dessert off the hook good.

NDF9yp_cwi-jLqMYOERh5w.text: Loved the dungeness crab appetizer, crab and truffle gnocchi, and lobster mashed potatoes. The steaks were good but not better than other high end steakhouses but the sides and appetizers were amazing.

PmSrXSZYbpJFtjb4vWQrhA.text: Hands down one of the best steaks I've ever had.  I was thoroughly impressed with the quality of the food and how good the waitstaff was.  They even comped us some deserts and a portion of our meal due to a couple of the guys being former military.  If you're looking for a good steak, this place is for you.

5uGr9U5RhYZHxLs5eT8X0w.text: Wow, what a huge disappointment!  I have always heard good things about this chain, including this location in Vegas.  This is a high-end (very pricey) steak joint, so you expect (a) a REALLY good steak and (b) prompt efficient service.  Ocean Club failed on both counts during our recent dinner.  Had we not been pressed for time, I definitely would have had a candid (blunt) discussion with the manager regarding our disappointment.  Our party of 12 was promptly seated and we had two waiters to handle the large party.   Failure #1 - drink orders were taken from the ladies and those came out quickly (within 5-10 minutes); they didn't take drink orders from the guys for another 5-10 minutes and we waited a good 15 minutes before they came out.  They messed up on two of the drink orders (stuff that shouldn't have been a mistake). Failure #2 - they screwed up on one of the steak orders (ordered rib-eye - I was sitting right next to him, so I knew that is what he ordered), they apologized profusely and said they would expedite the correct steak.  10 minutes later guess what comes out?  The WRONG steak again!  Fortunately most of the guys got larger steaks, so we shared so that our friend wouldn't be left eating alone. Failure #3 - I had ordered my steak medium rare, but it came out much closer to medium-well.  For a high-end steakhouse, this should never happen - steaks should come out consistent / match what the customer ordered.  The only positive note was the side dishes were all very good.  Other reviews are consistent on the rave reviews of the sides.  Given how much we spent on dinner, it was a massive disappointment.    8/31 Update - after posting my review, I did get a personal call from the GM of the restaurant.  He was very apologetic and I believe he was sincere in soliciting my feedback to ensure the risk of this happening to other patrons is minimized.  As a gesture of good faith, he did offer a gift card for use at any Mastro's location.  To be honest, had this call not happened, I would have never set foot in this restaurant chain again.  But, because of this gesture, we did go to the Beverly Hills location and had an AMAZING meal (I'll post a separate review for that location).

8h8OVxkFXDIzyNCiueUC7w.text: Great Spot! Been to the one in AZ and this was just as good. Great service, great food! The bar area has a great look and the light entertainment was enjoyable. Will consider going back next time in Vegas!

UUi0GUa36qgalMCxB0kt9w.text: Phenomenal Atlantic char served orreganato (sp?) lobster mashed potatoes are killer and it's a great place for a date! Very expensive, but the offer an option to order half of anything on the menu, making the prices more affordable

Beny9YuLl3TYox7IS3AF9Q.text: Loses a star because there were 15 empty tables when we walked in at 9:25 for our 9:15 reservation, and they made us wait at the bar for 15 minutes.   Otherwise, basically a great meal. Slightly poor ambiance because it's in a mall, albeit an ultra fancy mall. The piano guy was pretty good.   The food was fantastic. Had really good oysters, ask for the grassy ones if they have them. Some sort of california oyster that had a really strong flavor that the waitress recommended.   The crab cakes and ahi tuna apps were also very good.  For main we got the seabass and the swordfish. The seabass was very good, but not in that cliched and too common sweet glazed seabass/ black cod.   Swordfish I foolishly ordered a little underdone but was still good. They allow you to choose how to cook the meat, if you don't know much about cooking and different fish, ask the server, he/she seems very likely to know the best way to order each fish.   For dessert, we got their signature "butter cake" which was obviously ridiculously rich and good. Served with an ENORMOUS tray of whipped cream. Everything at this restaurant appears to be made from scratch, and it tastes that way too. Every dish is enormously portioned as well.

e0YMq1iDDwWLvVA21SgCBw.text: I absolutely loved the atmosphere and the night entertainment.  The pianist and the red-headed lady were just awesome.  It was very high in energy and the crowd was sophisticated but casual.  The food was great, I had the 22oz bone-in rib eye, only finished about 7oz of it.  I highly recommend the creamed corn and the lobster mashed potatoes for sides.  Order the Old Earth Cab to compliment the steak and it was just delicious, not dry at all.  To finish dinner off, I shared the creme brulee and it was delicious!  Service was pretty good, except when our water cup was left unfilled towards the end of dinner, so I had to knock off a star for that.  All-in-all, I will definitely be back to enjoy the food and entertainment.

bAxHIOap5GMaH9rrcbmSLw.text: Just Great!  Mastro's Ocean Club is a must STEAK HOUSE (we weren't there for the Ocean fare), inside this shopping venue.

Bbyt-Ou-cv7bqvD0seiySg.text: Went to celebrate our anniversary.  Although pricey, the terrific food and service are worth the extra bucks.  Shared a large filet, 2 orders of lobster tails, and sides among four people.  Everything was delicious.  Portions are large, so it's easy to do something like this (which also cut the cost a bit).  When in Vegas, this is definitely a must-go for a great eating experience.  Joe, our server, was great fun and very attentive.  Everyone at the restaurant has a friendly NOT snooty attitude that is delightful to find in such an outstanding restaurant.

BLORNc1_7KXY_dJJRe4PRQ.text: I love Mastro's. My groomsmen took me here for a part of my bachelors party. Had the New York Strip steak medium rare. It was cooked for perfection. No need for A1 steaksauce because you only put that on a crappy steak. This place does not have a crappy steak at all. The steak cut real nice, it was juicy, tender and flavorful. The sides were awesome too. The cream corn was very delicious. It was creamy and the corn did not taste like something out of a can. Also had the shoe string onion strips and they went well with the steak and sides. If you have to splurge on a steak, this is a place to do it at!!!

bmd1DDk3IWsRb7dAl6TEUQ.text: Sorry, you just don't have it.  CRAFTSTEAK is much better.  Hands down.  First, you've got fifteen zillion workers just standing around.  Then when you all flip into action setting a table it is hysterical - too much commotion for other diners.  It was like Cirque de Soleil.  Shining flashlights on the glasses - meanwhile, i'm served my steak and NO ONE comes to ask if it is cooked correctly - it was not - it was mooing at me.  Anyway. won't be back and you'll be closed in a year.

x2T-R2k-sdZknnLXfOGemQ.text: Great place to eat. Great live music. Great food. There twice baked potato was amazing. Little bit pricey but well worth it. If you are not a steak person like me they have other substatutions for seafood chicken and salad. I had the chicken breast something and it was very juicy and tender and spiced seasoning. Was well worth it. Great for anniversary dinners or birthdays. They had a huge selection of desserts at the end of you meal but I would order for 2 the portions on some of the menu can feed about 2-3 people. The service was great as well.

6znCmb3LkmVqW0KoFRCUIA.text: DELICIOUS!! The bread basket was warm and fresh out of the oven. I'm not a huge steak person so I ordered the Chilean Sea Bass. It was cooked perfectly. I'm a sucker for sweet potato fries. The mac & cheese was good and the lobster mashed potato was amazing!!! Not only was the food good but the location and being in a treehouse was fun. Service was top notch and I'll definitely come back for more.

hMOOURUy4sFFOv9pW5BnPg.text: Review for Restaurant Week Fall 2012 menu only:  I went to Mastros tonight for the first time and I convinced my wife to try Restaurant Week, too!  We were very pleased with the meal.  We got a nice bread basket with several types of bread.  I really liked the pretzel rolls with salt.  There were five choices in the basket.  Course 1:  We each got a salad--my wife's was a Caesar and mine was their spicy mambo salad.  They were both the same greens but my dressing was made with some wasabi, hence the spicy.  Both salads had a good amount of freshly grated cheese on them and they were very tasty.  Course 2:  I ordered the Scottish salmon and Andrea got the 8 ounce filet cooked medium.  I had several preparations from which to choose for the salmon and I chose the blackened option.  The salmon was delicious.  The filet was very good, too.    With their Restaurant Week menu, diners can choose two sides.  We each ordered garlic mashed potatoes.  My wife ordered the creamed spinach and I got the creamed corn.  The sides were huge.  Since we each ordered the mashed potatoes, we got a regular portion which is their standard size for sides.  The corn and spinach were smaller versions.  All three were very good.  I needed salt, but then anything needs salt.  Samantha started us out by giving each of us some of the sides so we each could try everything.  Course 3:  For dessert, Andrea got the chocolate layer cake and I got the Key lime pie.  ALong with the desserts, we were brought a large bowl of freshly made whopped cream--lightly sweetened.  The chocolate cake was huge.  My Key lime pie was more a normal size.  Both were outstanding!!  We ate in the Tree House overlooking the shops at Crystals.  Service was superb!  Our server, Samantha, was excellent.  The staff cleared tables promptly, cleaned the table cloth between (not that I'm a slob or anything), our iced teas were refilled often, and the pace of the meal was perfect!    I am so glad Mastros participated in Restaurant Week.  It gave me a chance to try it and I will be back.  What a fantastic start to RW Fall 2012.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate layer cake.
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bowl of fresh whipped cream brought with dessert.
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Key lime pie.

kCt6oEpXGJipeDtAZp0NQg.text: Food was amazing. The discount on this review is based on the hostess service upon check in.   I wanted to have dinner with my dad for his 73rd birthday. I made a reservation for 5pm for a party of two. I showed up early at 4:20pm and hostess said she could not seat us however we can sit by the bar and have drinks and appetizers. The two hostesses asked for my name multiple times for the reservation. We sat by the bar and the bartender says only non cooked items are available for appetizers. I wish the hostess mentioned this before offering the bar side option. 5pm passes by and I see the hostess seating other parties to the tables. I went back to the reception and the same hostess asked for my name twice. She points at another host and I assume to follow her. She doesn't acknowledge or provide a greeting. I realize she is the one supposed to seat is. Maybe the host station wasn't organized or wasn't ready for the evening but I didn't appreciate the confusion and cold reception upon check in. I understand names are complicated but I must have said my generic name seven times to two different people, "Cheryl Garcia". To add additional confusion, I received an email saying I did a 'no show' for my reservation on Open Table. I'm not certain how that happened even when I checked in on Yelp as well.   The server provided better service and made excellent recommendations. I have an issue with over ordering but that's because I want to taste everything. For a party of two, I ended up ordering the chowder, calamari, sides of roasted brussels sprouts, sauted asparagus, twice baked potato, sea salt & vinegar fries, and twelve oz bone in filet. The bread service was warm with an assorted selection. I enjoyed all the sides except the twice baked potato- I thought it was too salty & the chowder was slightly watered down and boring. The calamari was flavorful and crispy. The bone in filet was served sizzling on a ceramic platter and was super tender cooked to perfection.   The server brought out a complimentary butter cake for my Dad's birthday. The cake was warm and rich topped with a vanilla bean ice cream and strawberries. This was very special and made the overall experience much better.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My date&#39;s birthday dinner. My Dad turned 73. Dinner service was excellent.
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Warm butter cake, super rich, and slightly salty.

ZSC3p-hWCYFU11VABH7Cfw.text: I have literally nothing bad to say from the hostess stand to the wait staff to the supporting crew... our server Elizabeth was so awesome ...the food was superb

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ciroc red berry martini and the vanilla bartered shrimp mmmmm
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pw85tg_nrRreUr-5JUeeBQ.text: We are Loyal Mastro's customers and visit the SoCal locations often, so we were pretty devastated after tonight's experience. Never have we felt so terrible paying the bill.   He ordered the bone-in ribeye and I ordered the "Chilean sea bass," which our waitress said was their most popular fish dish. The ribeye was great, flavorful, and juicy. Pretty in line with the quality of steak we've had in the past.   The sea bass, however, was an entirely different story. I am 99% sure we were served the wrong dish. I've had Chilean sea bass countless times, and my fish tasted nothing like it. The shape was long and narrow. The texture was extremely dry and almost chalky. I ordered it with the parm crust and literally the only thing that gave it flavor was the lemon I squeezed on it. The fish was extremely bland and it was actually hard to eat. I should have sent it back but didn't want to be that person. I'm not a picky eater, so this was particularly bad.  Even the bread didn't taste as piping hot and magical as the bread we're used to.   The service was fine though.   Absolutely the saddest dining experience during our Vegas trip ever.

xyn7rBs38pATcA9Y80jH_g.text: The food is great (especially the lobster bisque) but for the price I wasn't really feeling the location of the restaurant.

-Q85YMi_ORoLnw1hUzHe4A.text: The food was good, but the service was subpar. The long wait times wasted me and my family's time.

ftZeTpvw2IBkpnodR8Tf5w.text: Mastro's had the blessing and the curse of being my second "fine dining" experience.  I appreciated the tap water so much more since I had been charged for a super-bougie bottle at Gordon Ramsay Steak.  The attentiveness of our waitress was exceptional. During the dinner rush, our meals got lost in the shuffle and when she realized we were still not served (bout an hour in), she made sure we wouldn't wait much longer. Our food was out  of the kitchen quite quick.  I started with the lobster bisque and it was incredible. Best lobster bisque I've ever had, hands down.  The steaks were very good. I'd say that they are much better than 95% of the steaks I've ever had.  I was divided on the sides. The sauteed broccoli was nothing special. It did a very good job of tasting like broccoli. However, the gnocchi was incredible. I could eat it all day, every day.  My sugar loving girlfriend was in love with the butter cake. It really was delicious, and that comes from someone who isn't into really into desserts.  Overall, not a bad experience. I'll definitely be up for a return.

Va17Pl1Rw9v70yqXRGuUxA.text: We were in Vegas for a bachelorette party for one of my besties and decided on this place for our fancy dinner night. We had 11 girls and people ordered a variety of things from the sea bass to the bone-in steaks. This is one of those fancy places where you order just the protein and then sides are extra. Here's the breakdown:  Bread basket - GOOD. Normally, I'm not a fan of loading up on carbs, but we were getting bottle service the night and I was already starving, so I had to put something in the stomach. I was pleasantly surprised at the freshness of the bread! So soft and slightly warmed.  Lobster bisque - giant serving (probably enough for 2!). Rich and creamy with actual chunks of lobster!  Seabass - good and buttery. It was a big serving size and I only finished probably half of it.  Bone-in ribeye - good, but slightly under cooked according to my friend's order.  Lobster mashed potatoes - I'm not really a fan of mashed potatoes and these were okay. Small pieces of lobster mixed in.  Sea Salt & Vinegar Fries - pretty good! Nice little break between bites of our main courses.  Creamed corn - pretty good! Nice side dish without being overpowering.  The food was pretty good, but for a place of this caliber, I expected a lot more. They either under cooked or over cooked several steak orders, which had me thinking: What kind of steak house is this?!  The service was top notch at least and our bride-to-be got a special warm butter cake delivered to our table.  Would I return? Probably not.

Mv9pIjA3O2sMWV-ILhFydw.text: You will over order. It's all just too good. Great service - wonderful food. Enjoyed my hubbies 50th birthday here!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wonderful! They went the extra mile to make my husbands birthday wonderful

m2VewMzFkxi9yQwun1B9Uw.text: I am a huge fan of Mastros Ocean Club. The food is nothing less than superb. I have been to the Costa Mesa, Newport, and now the Vegas location. This is by far my favorite restaurant/steak house. The mats are perfectly seasoned. The appetizers are all delicious. The desserts, we'll all I will say is Butter Cake!  The ambiance is very elegant, and the staff Is on top of everything. I highly recommend this fine restaurant. I do highly advise the bill will not be cheap, but you pay for what you get. They offer a military discount, which is 30% off the bill. Another great way the restaurant takes care of their customers.

Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate Cake
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Butter Cake

wcKdKMiUIsD1-w6i7vTddA.text: Incredible place. Came here for a birthday party, 7 of us. The bread basket is to die for - pretzel buns and the sourdough are the best! I had the rack of lamb - very yummy, tender, not overcooked. Others had the petite filet, New York steak, regular filet, lemon sole, scallops, and roast chicken. The side dishes are huge, and can easily serve 4-6 people. (We had lobster mashed potatoes, regular mashed potatoes, steamed broccoli, and 2 types of mushrooms.) The butter cake was so recommended, we had to get it. Hell yeah, as good as advertised! And the chocolate cake (can't remember what it was called - it's the more traditional one) was delicious as well. But one of my absolute favorites was the whipped cream that came with dessert. It could've been dessert in and of itself. Thick and rich. Was like eating sweet butter! We were eating it by the spoonful, it was so good. (I took some of the cake home, and ate it the next morning - the whipped cream was STILL fresh - not flattened! Now that's good whipped cream!). Great service and atmosphere.

l8X9n1jBnuM2hi4_idCNbw.text: So I have to say starting out I am a Mastro's Ocean Club fanatic! I decided to spend Valentine's day dinner here because oddly enough I live in Las Vegas and never been to one of my favorite hotel chains? What better else day to try it out right? Booked my reservation through opentable.com and actually because of the level of high priority reservations, I had to put down a credit card just to hold my spot. Reservation was for 9PM and once we arrived we were seated immediately which was great because I was starving! Things started off a bit rough for the experience but they made things right and THAT's the part that counts. I know what the quality of food should look and taste like because I dine at the one in Beverly Hills all the time. So for our order we went with the Tomhawk for 2 which was running for $115 and added on a lobster tail ($36) to go with it. The steak is obviously sharing size but the cool part is that they can cook it to the temperature of what each person would like. I am more of the medium and my partner is medium well. So when the steak came out it was incorrect and we asked to have blue cheese crust added which didn't get added and the mac n cheese came out sub par as well, very dry with just no taste! Not sure what the chef was thinking last night but anyways. The fact that I was able to pull the manager aside and address my concerns with the presentation of my meal left me satisfied because he actually cared and fixed it. I commend the him and the staff for going above and beyond to make things right. My Valentines Day meal will now be memorable! Shot Out To Dan! Thanks again!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing! Surf N Turf

2EW8oTApOB35sE3CpuAoRA.text: I'm a strawberry shortcake fan so my sister took me here as a belated birthday/ girls night out to try their dessert. All I can say is I was in heaven!!! Butter cake was one of the most delicious desserts I've ever had, and is plenty for 4+ people to share. Wonderful service from Elizabeth and perfect ambience. Can't wait to return.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheers
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Butter cake and prosecco

6nB9ixXqk38ukI_NoTjSuw.text: Went here for a meeting. Located in Crystals- here's a tip - go park in Crystals Valet and not Cosmopolitan. Save yourself $10!! Food is very expensive, but very good. I had salmon , the sides are family style . Of course big on pushing wine... I got a Diet Coke in a glass bottle. It was a nice experience, but not somewhere I would pay. I'd rather go to Texas Roadhouse.. which we don't have.

V9yo89VjPYhcXpxuMj58pA.text: I don't really know what to say about this review. It almost became a 2 star review but our server was knowledgeable, personable and friendly, it didn't seem fair.  Food is highly unimaginative. With this sort of price tag, you would think there'd be something special about the food.  There isn't.  The quality of the meats itself, was wonderful. Definitely have a good supplier and though, I didn't care for the flavors of the food, the fish, scallops and crab was fresh and didn't have a terrible ocean taste.  The execution is mediocre. Flavors were not complementary, almost overpowering. With fresh seafood, you should let it shine but I felt like an amateur who didn't understand the lightness of the seafood made our dishes.  We did receive a complimentary cheesecake because it was my bff's birthday.  With how much we paid and the overall taste and quality. Don't even bother coming here, there are too many good restaurants on the strip to settle for Mastro's.  You've been warned!

94XAZEupV9rG_XOMwBgGEw.text: Great ambience. Great service. Petit filet with lobster mashed potatoes was perfect. They offer half orders of sides which is a great option to try a few different things. The butter cake was awesome -- 3 people can share or 2 dessert lovers. No complaints. Great time.

AfgTgniG3IU6OkGXvPqjIw.text: Steak....great!  Seared Ahi Tuna.....great!  Ahi tosatas......great!  Brussels Sprouts....meh!  Butter Cake.....had to change my pants!!!!  Service was phenomenal!!!!!!!!!  Pants.....ruined.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2ReuYQz6peIanFZ_KvXnqw.text: I had dinner with my girlfriend and her friend for her friends birthday. The oysters were amazing but the rest of the crab and lobster was NOT. it tasted very fishy and not fresh. Every time I have gone here before I have had an incredible experience and tonight I was very disappointed with the food. The steak was not prepared well. I will not be returning to Mastro's again and I am honestly very disappointed .

DzJG6DgzMMH6pgnw7U8jmw.text: We ate at Mastro's at their Los Angeles location earlier this year. The steaks that we had were the best that we had ever had. We were in Las Vegas during part of the Labor Day Weekend and had long decided to eat at the Vegas location in a shopping mall leading into Aria Hotel/Casino and in a tree house. We were staying at The Cosmopolitan Hotel it was a breeze to get to the restaurant. We were seated immediately to our table as per our reservation. The server was very attentive and informative. I had a bone-in filet for dinner with garlic mashed potatoes and a dessert in the end. All of the above with a forever flowing bottle of red wine. The steaks at Mastro's Ocean Club (Whether in Los Angeles or in Las Vegas) are dry-aged and prepared to perfection. The texture is so soft and buttery with the flavors bold and bountiful. I have to tell you that the term, "Melts in your mouth", can literally be used at this establishment and it would not be over stated. We paid a pretty penny for this meal as well however it was well worth all of it and then some.

Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet Mignon
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brussels Sprouts

6cZ0rR7ujfrsyIn54KRiNg.text: How can anyone not love this place? Amidst Yelp's Spring Break festivities and other dining excursions we had in Vegas, the dining experience at MOC was one of the most memorable. From the amazing "eighth wonder of the world" tree house we were sitting in, to a generous martini offering, to excellent overall service....it was beyond a five star experience. And I haven't even scratched the surface yet. With all the eating going on in Vegas, I could have been very content with just their fresh pretzel rolls and a fantastic Campagna Burrata salad. But I couldn't resist and... ...order more pretzel rolls. They were just too addicting. ...try their Brussel Sprouts. Lightly salted to perfection. ...taste the Lobster Mashed Potatoes. One order can feed an army. ...sample their Petite Filet. Medium rare truly melted in my mouth. ...and savor the Seared Sea Scallops. Cooked just right with an orgasmic garlic butter sauce. (yelp.com/biz_photos/GI-C...) Just when I thought it was over, I was reminded of their infamous Warm Butter Cake for dessert. So I had to be a teamplayer and try a little. It was heavenly. No matter how full we were, dinner was not complete without indulging in this popular dessert...and the accompanying gigantic bowl of whip cream. I discovered that 10 spoonfuls is "just a little taste" when it comes to this cake topped with vanilla ice cream and sliced strawberries. Ay! Their mysterious live piano artist kept us entertained and added a nice touch to the ambiance of not only the restaurant, but around all of Crystals mall. This will not be the last time I dine here, that's for sure. Even though we were running late to a Yelp event, it was well worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing architecture
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Warm butter cake!!!
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallops

yGq2BIzfdo0JJPhYyQ7ptw.text: We searched so many fine steak houses. Most were four stars and just a few were 4.5.   Starting with the bar it was a great experience. Huge selection and fat pours.  Our bartender knew her sprits well and we did some taste testing.. And learned some things too.  The service was great. Everything we asked for was prompt and accurate.   Food was delish. Bone marrow apps.. Yum.  My steak was perfectly aged and well marbled.  Everyone at our table was praising me about my selection of this place!  The bill was reasonable. The extra bonus of course was that we were not treated like rubes the way Gordon Ramsay Steak does. It was so nice not hearing about the "Hell's Kitchen special" five time before you cane get a word in.

27pzL0y8sdP3O0Q-aT6dGw.text: Yelpers enticed us here--and we are glad we came.  We started with the Dungeness Crab Cocktail. It was great, too tantalizing to wait and take a photo; we only could do so once we took a break. Delicious morsels of crab stacked in a bowl over dry-ice. The red cocktail sauce has some horseradish-but if you like it hot, ask for some on the side.  We planned to order one of the healthy vegetable side dishes but our waiter Jonathan ("Johnny") gave such a wonderful description of the lobster mashed potatoes that we couldn't resist.  Unless you're big eaters, the way to go is to split a steak. At the next table over it looked as though their steak was cut in half before cooking. But Jonathan suggested that he cut our bone-in Kansas City Strip into slices after cooking, served on a plate "in the middle."  This was perfect.  Highly recommended. We couldn't even finish our halves of this delicious, well-cooked "medium" steak.  The mashed potatoes were just as described. Great. A big splurge, but this dish added to our memorable meal.  Too bad no "desert pocket" left for the longed for Butter cake.  Next time.  If you're looking for a place for one of those meals you savor not only at the time but also in your memory for a long time, excellent food served by a pro, Mastro's is your place and Jonathan, who's been here since they opened, is the waiter you want.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kansas City Strip, partially gone!
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yes, this the famous Lobster Mashed Potatoes, &#34;with one whole lobster.&#34;
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pretzel roll

RIzTNSVefdfri-mkh17xFg.text: Second time there. Service very good. The steaks are amazing and lobster mash. My fish came didn't come out hot but it was fine. It left more room in my stomach for the BUTTER CAKE which insane!!!!

NqG-9oj4f2am5WZJYaSR5Q.text: Brought my parents here to celebrate both of their 80th birthdays this year. Made reservations online indicating our celebration and when we arrived reception greeted my folks with a cheery "happy birthday!"   We ordered a bottle of Cabernet and a bottle of pelligrino to go along with our warm bread basket. Started with shared Caesar salad and ocean club salad which the kitchen split for us, that's always a nice gesture when a restaurant does this. I enjoyed the ocean club salad, fresh, with shrimp, chopped tomato, egg, and bacon. Salads were dressed just right. We ordered steaks all around except for my mom who ordered the Chilean sea bass along with fresh asparagus, sauteed mushrooms and scalloped potatoes. Entrees were cooked perfectly and delicious, I had a piece of mom's sea bass and it was to die for! Sides were good with the exception of the scalloped potatoes which were way too salty (maybe I shouldn't have said yes to add Gruyere cheese). The finale was Mastro's warm butter cake with vanilla ice cream with piping around the plate "happy 80th birthday" and coffees. Wow, cake was sumptuous and so very good!  Really a wonderful, leisurely evening bonding and reminiscing. Glad we chose Mastro's to celebrate a special event! A special thanks to our server, Tim who was so friendly and patient with us. He even walked with dad to show him where the men's room was. He's the best!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Warm butter cake, vanilla ice cream... drool!
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone in rib eye, mushrooms
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet mignon, asparagus, scalloped potatoes

xprbQoXcbCtQmsATBTEAMA.text: Came here to eat dinner with a couple of out of town friends.  We were greeted nicely and led to our table.    Given menus and told about the menu options and some of the favorites.  We were also told about the side items (made in large portions meant to be family style) And about the salads (also large and meant for 2 people).  our salads came quickly and cleared as soon as we finished and the entrees and side came soon after.  The service and knowledge is top notch, the food is good and the fish is flown in daily.  Good food good service pricing not bad, will come back!

6lsQi__ukQpDlNgzkmc8tQ.text: My husband has been spoiling me rotten for the last days of my 30s. We had the pleasure of coming here Monday night. We were greeted my the beautiful Jasmine who told me she had the same exact birthday as me ( only she was 1993 and I was 1973) but we were so giddy about it. Once we were seated our server Allen was one of the most attentive servers I've ever had. He was so polite and knowledgable, he knew every detail about the menu and made sure the food was to our liking. I got the lobster bisque, and the scallops. My husband got the fresh oysters, and seared tuna. Everything was perfect! Then they came with my chocolate cake with fresh cream. I cried, it was magical! I hope I don't have to wait another ten years to come back. What an experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate cake and fresh cream,happy cake day to me!
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JFc4FWT6JK5so058tpdwFw.text: Pretty much everything positive has been said about this Mastro's location in Las Vegas. Sit in the "Tree house" if you can. It's a cool atmosphere.  Great service, excellent quality, and well-mixed drinks.   Just be sure to try the brussel sprouts. Wow.

zQcX0dK8lYdP9CylMKdIYA.text: Had a beautiful dining experience here. Came in about 9pm with no rez. No problem! Seated us in 4 minutes and away we went into carb heaven. The restaurant itself is interestingly designed and larger than it looks. Lemon drop martini is a must, AND I MEAN MUST, try. The best I've ever had.... In my entire life. You're in Vegas so splurge on a nice seafood dinner. Get the Spinach side and the Mac and cheese. It's better than winning at slots!

ueOQmWdoFw1Fj8LpFw_JHg.text: We were there for my mother's birthday 6 of us.  We enjoyed it until the food came.  My moms $80 lobster was extremely chewy, not buttery soft. Two of the steaks were medium rare until you got further in then they were blue.  My scallops were perfect.  Sorry we picked this place, needless to say will not be back.

eiuwLg9ZNdHrEmqLozUqxw.text: Mastro's never disappoints.  But their Ocean Club locations, in my opinion is the better than their "Steak House" locations, because the ambiance is quieter and more enjoyable.   This is our second time visiting this location, and both times we have left extremely happy and full.  The first visit we didn't make reservations, but they were able to accommodate since it was a Monday, this visit we made reservations, but it was on a Monday as well, so they weren't busy anyway.  The staff was very helpful and provided excellent service; never had to ask for our water to be refilled and were always attentive asking if we were doing okay.   Food: We started the meal off with escargot and bone marrow. Both items were very delicious. Mastro's is honestly the only restaurant where their marrow is enjoyable because it is cooked to the point where there is zero blood, I don't know if that is the correct way to cook marrow, but that's my personal preference. My boyfriend loves their escargot. It is cooked, buttered, and seasoned perfectly. As for our entree we shared their Colorado rack of lamb as well as their sauteed spinach. Both items were cooked excellent as well. To end the night we ordered their famous warm butter cake. In all honesty, their butter cake is the main reason we love Mastro's. There isn't anything like it. The warm, sweet, soft cake paired with the vanilla ice cream just go so well together.   Overall, we love Mastro's and anytime there is a location we are staying at, we make it a goal to check that location off the list. So far we have been to the Newport Beach and Beverly Hills location here in SoCal, and the location in Chicago. It is so good, how can you not!

dDmGwtRbgtBcu_XGnQ_9vg.text: I've been here a few times to celebrate special occasions and loved it. From the Main lobster tail that's always so juicy to the steaks, I've tried a few but recently my husband got the tomahawk steak, they cut like butter and is always cooked to perfection. The lobster mash potatoes are phenomenal not to mention the world famous butter cake. This location is a little bit brighter and more of an open space. I've been to one other location that had more of an dark intimate feel.

JOYK_m5LaaqJ3mRFZFHHjQ.text: I have to say, the staff was absolutely fabulous! We came to mastro's at the last minute after having a terrible experience elsewhere. We had to salvage our anniversary dinner somehow and mastro's was able to squeeze us in on a busy vegas night. Not only did they listen to our story(which is another review entirely) but made up for it tenfold.   Our waitress was knowledgeable about the menu and the wine list, and helped us select the perfect dinner choices. I must say the gnocchi w snow crab and truffles was exceptional, literally the best I have ever tasted. We also ordered a pair of lobster tails that were also excellent. To our surprise they comped us their signature desert w a happy anniversary message written in chocolate across the plate. Everything we tasted was outstanding.  Again I have to thank the staff for a truly memorable experience. Every person from the busboys to the manager were very professional and treated us like regulars. I would give Mastro's my highest recommendation and encourage anyone to give them a try.

XPkqdxmbWdP7f949wkV8og.text: Pricey but so good! Even the escargot was amazing, and their signature butter cake is the best!!

-931UmAk8xXqD4fka7wRsQ.text: 5 star class all the way. Not only was the food amazing and the design of the restaurant but service was superb too. All portions were very big. My lamb was to die for. Ambiance out of this world. I normally do not eat bread but I just had to here.
