WD5W06LCxK3m82MdOOpdIQ.text: My wife and I celebrated her recent birthday here on Monday evening 10/25/10 and enjoyed and amazing dinner that far exceeded our highest expectations. This new outpost of Mastros is romantic and elegant with all of the True hallmarks of five star dining.  We have previously been to Mastros in Beverly Hills and I much preferred this location as food and service were flawless as we've come to expect with the added touch of refinement and class that Mastro Beverly Hills seems to lack with the Nightclub atmosphere and Hollywood infused scene.   The Food:  Appetizer:  Seared Sea Scallops -  Perfectly seared and prepared in a Garlic cream sauce. Accompanied by 2 Garlic Toasted Bread Crisps. Delicous.  Entrees:  Petite Filet (Medium) - Hers - Simple but perfect. Mastro's signature entree and they do it to perfection  Rack Of Lamb (Medium Rare) - Mine -  I love Lamb above all other meats and this is one of the best I can ever remember having. Bold but not gamey it flavor. (Jiraffe in Santa Monica is a close 2nd.)  Sides:  Sauteed Mushrooms w/ Onions  - Sweet & earthy. The perfect compliment to tender Filet & Lamb when combined with Mastro's Fries.   Sea Salt Shoestring Fries (No Vinegar) - Crisp and salty which just the right amount of texture.  Dessert -   Chocolate Birthday Cake - Brought out complimetary. Nothing special but a nice birthday gesture.   Warm Butter Cake Ala Mode - You simply HAVE to get this!  No meal at Mastro's would be complete without it. My wife talked about this for days before our meal and reminisced about it for days after. It's simply the best enormous warm, buttery sugar cookie you've ever had paired with the smoothest vanilla bean ice cream you can imagine.   I have to say we left very impressed with our Mastro's Las Vegas experience. It definitely raises Mastro's to our favorite special occasion restaurant from now on (Just not the Beverly Hills location.)With food, service and atmosphere this wonderful you just can't go wrong.   Next up for us is Mastros in Thousand Oaks.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Warm Butter Cake Ala Mode
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sea Salt &amp; Vinegar Fries
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 8oz. Petite Filet

Gxq1KijX0nf9hreyQPmH8w.text: Oh boy, where do I start?  I made reservations for my fiance here last Saturday night :) It was his birthday, and so I wanted to take him out. We were in Vegas celebrating, and seeing that this place had high ratings, I took him here to try it out. The restaurant itself is inside a mall, and though we didn't get seated in the treehouse looking part, it was still a pleasant visit. It was our first time dining at ANY Mastro's restaurant, and definitely won't be our last! We got a waiter named Tim (Timothy), and he has got to be one of the best waiters we've ever had. He was very informative and was extremely nice. He showed us the different menus and helped us choose. I decided on the chilean sea bass. It was sooo good! The flavor was on point, and it was a perfect portion size. My fiance ordered the filet for himself, and his was overcooked, but they knew right away after he received it. Dan asked him if he wanted to switch it for a new one, but he said it was fine, and ate it anyways. He liked the flavor and was genuinely fine with it and didn't think it was really a big deal. We also ordered calamari as an appetizer, and a side of sweet potato fries. (Which was family sized, for sharing.. but we didn't know!) The calamari was awesome. We ended up only being able to eat about 10 fries out of that giant pile.. lol. We were too full! A different waiter served us sprite and ended up spilling it all over my fiance's shoulder.. yikes. They did help him clean it up though. In the end, my fiance got a warm butter cake as his birthday gift :D yay! It was so delicious, we ate it all.. despite the fact that we were super full! We were also given complementary wine for the steak being overcooked and for the sprite spill. Now THAT's excellent customer service, and if Vegas wasn't so far, I'd come back more often. I'll miss this place :( Hope the one in Newport is just as professional! But I know if we were in Vegas visiting, this spot will be one of the first places I'd go to eat at. Thanks for the wonderful experience Mastro's! :) Stay gold.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. warm butter cake. everyone was right, this is a must try! so yummy, we ate it all despite how full we were.
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilean sea bass. looks simple, but tastes so good.
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. sweet potato fries. we barely ate like 10 fries.. it was too big and we had too much food!

gdwdxgb3Mm_ZMz9EsSkn_A.text: I was recently in Vegas for a week for work and unfortunately, the people I was with did not like fine dining.  I couldn't convince anyone to go to Cut nor Craftsteak, so we ended up at Mastro's.  This Mastro's is located in the City Center's shopping mall called Crystals.  Just look for the unique treehouse design.  We were lucky to get a table inside the treehouse.    I enjoy eating course meals and family style, so here's how we ordered:  appetizers: Escargot Colossal shrimp cocktail 2nd course: Seared Ahi tuna 2 Lobster bisques Main course: Bone-in ribeye Garlic mashed potatoes Creamed corn  We enjoyed most of our dishes except for the escargot and the seared ahi tuna.  Those two we wouldn't ever order again.  The lobster bisque and bone-in ribeye were the stars of the night.  There were 4 of us eating together and that was plenty of food.  We were so stuffed that we skipped the butter cake.  Service was friendly and our server staggered our meal perfectly.  Another excellent meal!

MQ5Gf2F6FP26QwQ4u8XjLA.text: Kind of a weird location in the atrium of an upscale mall, the food was terrific and service top notch. Best swordfish I've EVER had...in the middle of the desert, no less!  You won't get out of here cheap, but don't let the location deter you.

Y7mOQT8qHBhwdIhG5dyRpQ.text: Need to blow off that easy money you just took from the casinos and treat yourself to a neat dinner in a unique spot which calls out for attention the moment you walk into Aria?  Enter Mastro's, the ever popular chain of steaks that knows just how to let you indulge and live it large on a nice meal.  And as for pricing, it's actually pretty fair as you get a ton of great service, and most importantly, great food.    The steak would be the only thing I get to be a snob about.  For instance, the meat was a little tough and although they've caramelized it, I can't but imagine thinking of how similar it tastes to Ruth's Cris.  But luckily, the other sides gave it supreme justice.  I got the bone in rib eye, at medium rare, so it should have been tender, but somehow wasn't.  The flavor was just buttery and I just wish there was more.   Just to make things interesting, I turf'd it up with combination of jumbo shrimp scampi.  The amazing garlic sweltering sauce which had a parmesean bread crisp  reside next to made all the difference in the meal as the big shrimps were engulfed with flavor from the buttery garlic sauce.    For sides, we shared the following: -Roasted Brussel Sprouts - pretty basic, but satisfying -Cream of Spinach - so damn heavy and big its a good thing we only limited ourselves to 2 sides only on top of our surfs.  Overall, I enjoyed my meal, but would I come back?  Probably not, or to any of the other locations for that matter at the time being.

WvUHPqrk-BKjLhJ7r85i0Q.text: What's not to love? We dined here for Valentines Day and it was lovely. Wonderful service, extensive wine list and stiff drinks as my husband put it. I had the Chilean sea bass and my husband the ribeye. What I love is they offer 4 ways to prepare your fish which gives you more options when choosing a lighter dish. We spilt the enormous sides and didn't have any room left for desert (next time). We'll definitely be back.

yy0I_lKqmaHOZIMjHONdMg.text: Absolutely nothing to say except the service and food was great! My first time there and it's not going to be the last.

SJmCRWqU6o1yfcr5AULQ4g.text: If you are a seafood lover, be sure to make a pit stop here.  Absolutely gorgeous design, impeccably-trained staff, delicious food and excellent booze selection make this establishment a winner.  Only issues are the mall location. Also, I made a reservation yet I was made to wait in the bar for 30 minutes, yet I noticed tourists in shorts with their Forever 21 bags sitting there eating dinner, they were obvious walk-ins so I wasn't pleased about waiting.  Bathroom is a hassle, requiring an elevator or flight of stairs.  But one of the best restaurants in Vegas.  Oh if you are expecting to eat cheap here, forget about it, you're looking at about 75 per person, without drinks.

LXqamYcVDtpveA-_7X9yTQ.text: Amazing food and service. Bone marrow was amazing. Be careful, your eyes maybe bigger than your stomach

w7V1iUfCvdWg1cXw7fZR6w.text: The food here is sooooooooo GOOD! All I have to say is go here! I had the sea bass and my boyfriend has the halibut and the were both amazing. We also had the tower with crab, lobster oysters and shrimp and everything was great! Highly recommended!

qEwj2lhd8uPm0jIatS-G-g.text: This time I had a plan: share a martini and save room for the warm butter cake!  Since our server, Leonard, kindly allowed me to split a martini with my friend, I actually remember my second visit to Mastro's in its entirety: from the amazingly addictive pretzel rolls, to the heirloom tomato and Campagna burrata salad, to the filet mignon (served with Bearnaise sauce, upon request), to the lobster mashed potatoes--and, finally, the famed warm butter cake.  This cake, alone, is worth 5 stars! The warm butter cake portion was more than enough for the three of us, served with a drizzle of berry coulis, sliced strawberries, a scoop of vanilla ice cream melting on top, and, in a separate bowl, enough whipped cream to frost a double-layer cake.  My first spoonful filled my mouth with warm brown sugar-sweet goodness, with the cake texture somewhere between a Genoise and a pound cake. The cake was wonderful on its own but we couldn't help but top our tastes with the whipped cream. We were so full from our meals (most likely due to that extra order of pretzel rolls) that, sadly, we couldn't quite finish the warm butter cake.  I plan to return for an all-carb meal next time: pretzel rolls and warm butter cake!

IG_8BDaf2iDNJXrXUXLoAw.text: Must visit if you're in Vegas. Great atmosphere, great service & awesome food. Definitely will go back.

FgDO7ZNyHfm2WQ1tkng2Fw.text: I'm kind of surprised right now. So if you read my other reviews you pretty much know that it's hard to get 5 stars, but pretty easy to get 4 stars. If you get 3 stars then there must've been something wrong.  First of all I was really into going to eat here. I thought it was really nice on the inside. I had a very positive attitude without super high expectations. That's the ideal right?  Well, I was here for my wife's birthday, and my sister in laws belated birthday dinner. I ordered bone in rib eye. My wife ordered bone in filet w lobster tail on the side and my sister in law ordered lamb chops. I ordered mine medium rare. It came out just under well done. My wife ordered hers medium and it came out well done. My sister ordered hers medium and it came out rare. The manager happened to come by and ask how everything was. I really want to avoid complaining at a restaurant, but my wife said his is too done, and my sisters is not done enough. I said hey it's alright we can handle it, but the manager said oh no please let me take care of this. Ok I said no problem thank you so much. So they started another steak for me and started to cook my sisters more. Ok so they brought mine back. It looked right on the outside...nice looking. Alright so it was practically raw. My sisters comes back and it looks like they threw it in the microwave. All the while it's my wife's birthday and her steak is brown. Wtf.  So I cook a little around the house. Some say my steak is better than most restaurants. I usually say it's ok. Well, in this case I can say I can get the temp on the money 90% of the time without timing it. I really was kind of shocked. I won't go into the meat anymore because it really was a train wreck.  The appetizers were good. Dungeness crab cocktail, and oysters on a half shell. Drinks were great. We all enjoyed. But the dinner was really one of the worst I have ever had. I am really bummed about that. I can't really rate it a 1 star because the manager was good, appetizers were good, drinks were good, but the dinner...well, never again. I almost want to bump up the 2 stars that I have given on other reviews because this review is really 1 and a half.

Ub7VDzrn2J-JCUppdQkAzA.text: warm butter cake!  it is warm and full of butter and oh so sweet.  what more can i say?  thank you to the hostess for seating us without a reservation.  if you are just coming for the dessert let the hostess know so that they don't turn you away

6OLlukXWDhr2A_6iJP5bHg.text: I am usually a regular at The Old Homestead in Ceasers, but this place had a high rating and the date I was with, who was looking awesome dressed in a miniskirt and hooker heels, convinced me with the innuendo of sexual favors to try something new, so as a sexually charged male, I obliged. Mario, our server, was awesome. He hooked us up with a great wine and had some menu suggestions that would make anyones heart flutter. The bread basket was phenomenal and the staff we could see was very professional and classy. However, the staff we couldn't see undermined all forward progress made by the men in white suits. The steaks were overcooked, the scalloped potatoes were sour and cold, and the timing of the food was as coordinated as the Dallas Cowboys 2015 offensive line, or any play by the detroit lions since 1976. Its worth a try, but I would have rather gone somewhere else.

e4uK0UhkCpaGg7PVtcEp5g.text: I came here for Thanksgiving day dinner and I was really surprised.  I've always been a fan of Mastro's, especially the Beverly Hills location but I hadn't been to their Ocean Club before.  I decided to go with seafood since that seemed to be their specialty and I was really impressed.  The blue point oysters were extremely fresh and for the main course I ordered the scallops which were huge and cooked to perfection. For dessert I ordered Mastro's signature butter cake which is always good. Our waiter was very entertaining and the service was beyond exceptional.  The washroom attendant was very cheerful despite having to be in there on Thanksgiving day.  Thanks for the wonderful meal I will be returning very soon!

nBuWUS3wNYoJXwAwwStzsA.text: I have had the chance to visit Mastro's Ocean Club twice and both times were equally wonderful. Everything from the wait staff, ambiance and the food are all beyond amazing.   Their service is probably as good as it gets. The hostesses are all very friendly in their greetings when you arrive. The wait staff is very attentive. I felt like I never had to flag someone down, there was always someone readily available.   The energy in the restaurant is very nice. There was live music being played on a piano which helped to set the tone. The restaurant itself is set up in a modern tree house space located inside of the Crystal's shopping center. There is nice colorful lighting that helps set off the dark woods of the tree house and white table cloths of Mastro's.  The food though is the real star of the show. I had the 12oz filet and it was phenomenal. It was cooked exactly the way I like it. Perfectly seasoned. The other member of my party had the bone in rib eye which was just massive. The sides we ordered were more than enough to share. The side portions are a meal in themselves. Their mac & cheese is a must have! So are their sea salt & vinegar fries. If possible, save room for dessert. Their signature butter cake is by far one of the best desserts that I have ever had on the Las Vegas strip. I was lucky enough to receive a complimentary cake from the manager, so if I could, they would get an extra bonus star just for that.  All in all, Mastro's is a definite must visit. It's great for special occasions or even business dinners. It will become one of your new standards for what you expect in a restaurant.

-NzLb4pEH56N4xEpZRI8Zg.text: This was a 5 star anniversary dinner for us!  Amazing!  Location:  You cannot beat dining in a "tree house" in the Crystals Mall.  Very cool!  I loved the live music that I could hear from the lower levels of the mall.  Service:  Mike R was our server.  He was completely patient and totally helpful.  He gave us a taste of two different wines when we were trying to decide on a bottle.  He was great with any questions we had.  Great guy and a huge asset to the restaurant.  Food:  The bread basket was amazing and beautifully presented.  Wish I could have tried everything without filling up before dinner!   Beef carpaccio, bone in filet, ribeye (bone in), au gratin potaotes, and compliementary butter cake (for our anniversary!).  I loved every bite of our meal.  The food was superb.  Drink:  As mentioned, Mike R let us sample the wines, and we selected the Earthquake, which he stated was from a boutique winery.  Huge thumbs up!!!!!  Next visit will include one of the cool looking cocktails!  This was a great, great meal!  Mastos hit everything on the mark, and have two satisfied customers who can't wait to return!

p8p-cqWMV05t55At7cP3fQ.text: Mastro's is absolutely by far the best fine dining you will find in the US. I have been to all locations except for Chicago. (Yes, I will get there someday.) It is expensive but worth every penny. The crab cakes are crazy delicious. Lobster mashed potatoes. Yeah, you read that correctly. The filet melts in my mouth. The chocolate covered strawberries are amazing even when ordered in the dead of winter! I'm heading there in a few weeks for my 40th birthday followed by Thunder from Down Under. Ahhh, what a fabulous evening that shall be.

ISDZlRfnFPeKMbbGTwBdfw.text: LOVE Mastros!  Dinner was perfect - atmosphere even better!  The tree house is so fun and innovative!  The piano bar was a great way to start our dinner.  The singer was perfect!  Our cocktail waitress was too cute for words and made the night even better!  The food at Mastros speaks for itself!  Among our favorites: *Filet - I like the petite my husband the bone in *Creamed Corn - a MUST *Potatoes - all of them are good - if I could I would do one of each :)  All in all - GREAT doesn't even begin to say how much we love Mastros!  A must for everyone!

BtV0k_PYzzVRD-_LUtkYzw.text: We walked by the place early last week while shopping and exploring the City Center.  Love the ambiance, menu looked great, have heard great things about other locations so we decided to make this our last nights meal in Vegas.  Glad we did because aside from Mix, and JR's this has now become one of our favorite places in Vegas. I would not hesitate to recommend.   Seated in the main dining area right in the middle of the coolest structure for a restaurant you will ever see. Warm dining room, very welcoming as were the staff. Ours were a attractive redhead young lady and a younger guy.  Piano playing jazzy christmas tunes, nice touch.  Immediate introduction by the servers, it looked as if there were two for every table. We started with the house special martinis, served chilled and shaken at the table and blended perfectly. Really, perfectly.  Scanned the menu,  server came back by to check on the drinks and announced the specials. Decided on the following:  Sauteed Sea Scallops Warm Spinach Salad Chilean Sea Bass NY Strip w/o bone Lobster Mashed   Scallops arrived, great presentation. Now I love scallops, being in the PNW we have lots of choices on seafood and some of the best scallops I have ever had are at the barking frog near the Woodinville winery and home of the famous Herbfarm. These were excellent, large but not too, perfectly seasoned and prepared. All sitting on tip of the most wonderful cheese bread cracker in a wonderful sauce. Yum!   Salad arrived, again great presentation, just made, plate warmed just enough you could smell all the ingredients. Now this was key. Onion, egg, bacon and greens all perfectly aligned to emit this wonderful fragrance that just made your mouth water.  None of the heat or tartness you sometimes get with places putting too much red vinegar on the greens.  And the taste, I shit you not this was the best salad I have ever tasted. The senses alive with the fragrance and the taste perfectly aligned.   Steak and bass arrived, simple but elegant in preso.  Bowl of steaming potatoes with over a pound of lobster and a beautiful sauce. Steak done to perfection, one of the best cuts and flavors I have had. And I am a steak house freak.  Steak was severed still sizzling on the plate, little bit of butter on top on a simple white plate.  Wife's Sea bass was served equally as elegant. Simply in presentation, nice cut of fish perfect flavor.    Service was just right, friendly, genuine there when needed. Asked the server to choose a wine for me to pair with the steak. Perfect choice came back again.  I don't work for this place, wish I owned stock or had ownership though. This was by far one of the best dining experiences we have had all year. We will be back.   Thanks to the wonderful staff and happy holidays!

_DtwyqCVib_6QdvWmNnmsA.text: ***UPDATE*** After posting the following review, I was contacted via Yelp by a person calling herself "Kate G.". Kate stated, "I would like to get your phone number so that our corporate side can look into this and discuss." I asked Kate G. who she was & she stated she was Landry's Social Media Coordinator. Why didn't you tell me that in your first e-mail? Ummm, I don't hand out my phone number to random internet contacts! Why on earth would I give my phone number to Kate? Does she think I want to be bothered my her or Corporate? I can't be bought off with a gift certificate from Landry's. I will never eat there again. I filed a complaint with the Southern Nevada Health District!!! So, listen up Kate G., you can NOT have any of my personal information. May I suggest you introduce yourself before asking for someone's phone number. BTW, I still have nightmares over what happened to me!   I got so ill after eating here I thought I would die. Never again! I had a steak, loaded potato, green beans & one glass of wine. I'll have PTSD whenever I think of that night.

4zHXXwhzqD29gKnn_Pmweg.text: Ate here for a work event.  One of the better meals I've had on the strip.  Especially impressive because it was a set-menu event for 20+ people. That scenario usually doesn't enable a restaurant to truly shine as they have to fire so many plates simultaneously.  I'd recommend it.

gFjv0oU3bbPd7L8vj8pwgQ.text: We live in LV, and eat all the time at the high end strip restaurants.  This is probably the easiest 5 star rating I have ever given.  Everything was fantastic, and I went in with very high expectations.  A friend recommended, and said it was one of the best steaks in LV.  I was not disappointed. Steak had terrific flavor, and melted in your mouth.  Drinks, appetizers, main courses, sides, and desserts - all were simply fantastic.  We also loved the atmosphere, and our waiter was excellent.  We will certainly return.

f3G0vf6lPgVeeuOmbTSIbg.text: I live in Chicago and have been to many fine dining restaurants. The Mastros in Chicago is my absolute favorite place to eat. I went to Las Vegas and noticed they also had a Mastros so I naturally made sure I go. There is no way I could actually like Mastros any more than I already do right? Wrong! Mastros Ocean Club was even better than the high bar that the Chicago location set. Aside from world class food, Tanya and Juan, who waited on me, were the absolute best servers I have ever had. They know the restaurant food very well and its almost amazing how they know almost every ingredient used in every dish. They also gave me great recommendations for the rest of my time in Vegas and were just overall great servers. Not only does Mastros have some of the best quality food around, and the ambiance is second to none, but Tanya and Juan made it such a great time that I can not wait to see them again this upcoming February! No matter what you will love Mastros but if they are working, make sure you sit with Juan and Tanya for a truly exceptional dining experience!!!

KBkMgl9m2Y0Jjm1Fasvhcg.text: Overall, I really enjoyed my meal but be prepared for a different ambiance! The restaurant is literally in the middle of the mall, with the tables pretty much out in the open. Not a huge deal, but definitely not ideal.   I had the mambo salad (spicy caesar salad with no croutons), 8 oz. Petite filet and cheese cake for dessert. The filet was perfectly prepared, served on a burning hot plate that sizzled and continued to cook the sides of creamed corn, spinach and garlic mashed potatoes. Our table also shared the steamed mussels appetizer, which was excellent! Highly recommended!

G6-x7WSpI9tULAfGrCZL2Q.text: Mastro's is amazing. I had the best steak here (even though this restaurant heavily features seafood). We had an early reservation because we had an 8:30 show to go to. We were seated immediately and i think they gave us white or black napkins, which they placed across our laps for us, based on what color we were wearing. And that was just a hint of the level of service to come. We had a very attentive server, but someone in a suit, his supervisor (?) was also constantly checking on us. My water glass was never empty, a standard I use to base a restaurant's level of service. I had gotten up once to use the restroom and accidentally dropped my napkin. As I was leaning over to pick it up, our server appeared out of nowhere and immediately insisted that he would do it. When i came back a fresh napkin was folded at my seat. When the sides came, someone immediately offered to serve them to us. I was surprised no one offered to cut my steak...lol. The restaurant quickly filled up, but from the time that we were seated until we left, never once did the superb service lapse.  Ok onto the food: There were a few different types of bread and i think I like most of them. They refilled our bread basket, but I wish they didn't lol because I ate way too much bread. I ordered a berry flavored cocktail and it came in a martini glass, but they also set down a shaker cup by my glass, and to my delight, there was enough to fill my glass a second time! =D We ordered the steamed mussels appetizer and they were delicious, so fresh, not fishy at all. Just delicious. I could have inhaled an entire order myself. Everyone ordered the ribeye and it was perfect. So, so good. We were trying to be kinda healthy so we got sauteed mushrooms and spinach and creamed corn as sides. But afterwards I wish we had gotten the mac & cheese and the truffle gnocchi. Everything was so delicious and the portions were pretty big. I ate about a third of my ribeye and we didn't even finish all of the sides. Luckily our hotel room had a fridge so we could take the leftovers.   It was definitely pricey, but for the amazing service and food, I think it was well worth it. I would definitely go back or at least go to one of the SoCal locations. Mastro's is the standard by which I compare all steakhouses and other fine dining establishments to.

Gy_1uFvBOuqUsfq94jthAg.text: I am a fan for sure.  The service and food is top notch, but my main problem with Mastos in Las Vegas is location.  The location (which is a huge factor with fine dining) is in the center of a high end indoor mall and it's loud.  Mastros can not control ambiance and echoing noise from the mall including the 80s hair band music that was playing throughout the mall.  I have been to Mastros in New Port and I should say the mood is very different there because they can control it.  So all in all.  Food Great...Service Great....Location Not Great.

psoyUrI419YgbUBVvG7iQQ.text: Mastros over delivers every time! There are plenty of solid restaurants in Vegas, but no one provides the level of service Mastros does. The hamachi appetizer was amazing! Colossal size stone crab claws were lights out! Steaks are always cooked spot on and seasoned perfectly! Worth every penny you spend.

NuvfNEhvd2X3fMeScO9alA.text: Was a bit dissapointed on the quality of the steak and sides... Seafood was good though. Specialty cocktails sounded better than it tasted. Butter cake was pretty good but not something that will bring me back here again.

3-ytHzoLS4JbNSNWSjI8ZQ.text: We dined at Mastro's at the suggestion of my client.  It's an interesting location in the Crystal shopping center right off the strip.  The food was very good as was the service.  But it's spendy!  $18 glass of Glenlivet 12, $14 for Soli and Tonic.  And a word of advise, don't open the wine menu if you are faint of heart.  With that said, if you just crushed it at the tables and you got some money to spend - have fun!

7ehnBknF496zEkstZKoEqQ.text: Cool location inside a wooden sculpture... that is inside a high-end boutique mall.... in the middle of City Center.... on the Las Vegas Strip.... in the middle of the desert...  Should I continue? Anyway, the truffle gnocchi was tops in my book with shavings of truffle visible in the sauce. Our server was super friendly and we enjoyed the pretzel bread... Its VERY new trendy classy fancy Vegas.

-fFd82efWwJRY0m3YV2Pig.text: There's a reason why Mastro's has such high reviews.  Good service and incredible food.  My experience was no different.  From the outside, the restaurant is housed in a cool modern treehouse.  On the inside, it's what you would expect from your typical fine-dining establishment.  The service here is attentive and accommodating.   They pay attention to detail by offering a black or white napkin depending on your attire.   The food?  Perhaps some of the best I've had in Las Vegas.  Let's start with the bread basket.  It was mixed with a variety of carb-loaded treats.  Olive focaccia, soft pretzel, etc.    We ordered the Spicy Mambo Salad and the Ocean Club House Salad for the table.  Both portions were very generous and each is enough for an individual meal.  Both were delicious but have their own individual personalities.  The Spicy Mambo Salad has no protein and is reminiscent of a caesar salad with hints of wasabi.  The Ocean Club House Salad had bits of lobster and shrimp and were well balanced.  We also order a side of macaroni and cheese for the table.  The "side" was huge and plenty for a table.  In fact, we had some left over for a party of seven.  Again, delicious.  For my entree, I had the 12 oz. filet.  I ordered it medium rare as I normally do.  It was cooked perfectly and was tender to the point that I could have peel off pieces with only my fork.  It's arguably the best steak I've ever had.  A friend order the sea bass, and unlike other fine-dining restaurants I've been to... the portion was huge.  The sea bass had a lightly seasoned crust and super white in color throughout.  It was flaky, yet melted in your mouth.  This was by far the best sea bass I've ever had.   The reasons I didn't give Mastro's five-stars?  Three reasons.  First, the waiter seemed to have a little attitude when one of our guests requested separate checks.  And second, they had a band playing there that night.  I'm not sure if this is a common nightly play.  But, I'd rather not listen to a 70's - 90's cover band while I eat a fine meal.  Lastly, I couldn't overcome the fact that every time I looked around... I was still in a retail shopping center.  I love views, but not that of shoppers walking in and out of Louis Vuitton, Prada, etc.

UwqgmdnAYa_88WCeYQDfeQ.text: Incredible food and even more amazing service! Number one experience this trip to Vegas!

B_ywxLPL-9FwStcxofifzg.text: Drinks and dessert with with the girls during a Vegas trip. The warm butter cake with fresh fruit was so delicious, melt in your mouth amazing! and the fresh strawberries went together perfectly with it. The fresh whipped cream  that came with it was HUGE like a mountain of whipped cream...way too much we only used like two spoon-fulls.

eXNYdoMOtwrBx--3QVP8XA.text: Excellent dining experience which started with the hostesses, bubbly smile and welcoming personality. Heard many reviews about the bread basket, come on its bread. Now I eat those words. Several choices, sour dough roll, kalamata olive, pretzel (my fav) and others. I had seared ahi tuna. Generous portion cooked to perfection with wasabi and pickled ginger. My date had the pan sauteed scallops. She loved them and my taste was wonderful. She also had the lobster bisque. It was so rich and creamy.  For sides we had mushrooms, sauteed with garlic we loved them. Also had creamed spinach. We both thought it was fine, have had better. Both portions were very generous, more than enough for both of us. Service was fantastic.

z0_XlRyvyL88ZD53QA4qcg.text: This place was amazing! Everything I tried was awesome, service was the best. Out of everything I tried the escargot impressed me the most. I would defiantly be coming back here!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My husband had the lobster
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The tuna

j3zV2DyPKZolrhioX8NTSA.text: Mastro's really is as good as it gets.  They were so good, my bf and I came here twice during our three night excursion in Vegas.  The service here is impeccable, the food top notch and the ambiance exquisite and dramatic.    The first time we were served on by Tanya who delivered exemplary service all night.  We ordered the seafood tower with beluga caviar, lobster, raw oysters, crab and shrimp.  Everything was fresh and even tastier with the atomic horseradish condiment, red onions, parsley, egg white, egg yoke and capers.  If you like it hot, the horseradish here is simply the best.  It will give you an amp, clear your sinuses immediately and possibly cause you to shed a tear.  The escargot was soft and delectable with a garlic and buttery taste.  I can't pick out what herbs they put on them, but there was a greater complexity on the palette to make it more interesting.  We ordered a nice bottle of Cloudy Bay sauvignon blanc to compliment the seafood.  Dinner was so satisfying, we didn't have room for dessert, but we ended it with a couple of dirty martinis.  Unbeknownst to us, they also bring an entire shaker with the remnant vodka leftover!  Let's just say we left a little behind.  Unfortunately, a couple hours later my bf fell ill, but I didn't.  As always when ordering raw shellfish, it's always a possibility to get a bad oyster.  It was only disappointing to have to end the night so soon.  However, the way Mastro's handled it was outstanding.  We didn't have to call them to inform them how our dining experience went.  They called the next day to make sure it was good.  I ended up speaking to Sherry and told her about our wonderful experience minus the bad oyster.  She was extremely empathetic and invited us back in to make it right.  We gladly accepted the invitation and dined at Mastro's again a couple days later.  We were seated in the tree house again and Lionel waited on us this time.  He was every bit charming with a sense of humor and also delivered immaculate service.  We both had to use restraint  from devouring the fine variety of artisan breads in the basket.  We both shared the Tomahawk Kobe Beef bone-in ribeye medium rare.  All I can say is wow!  This was the best steak ever.  The softness of each morsel, darker color and bolder flavor was a real pleasure for us.  We ordered the escargot again and tried the roasted brussell sprouts and sauteed spinach- both cooked to perfection and tasty.  Lionel recommended a nice cab which I can't remember what- maybe Hill?  Nevertheless, it was a perfect compliment to our steak.  We ended the meal with a nice sponge cake dessert with fruit, whip cream and a couple ports.  Dinner at Mastro's in their architectural masterpiece called the "tree house" was the perfect last dinner in Vegas before going home.  Their appreciation for their customers and solicitous attitude really make this place top notch.  We definitely appreciated all they did to compensate for the bad oyster from the first visit on our second visit.  We had an amazing time and are sure to return next time we are in Vegas.   Thank you Mastro's for a wonderful dining experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. the tree house!

D3rPyxKOs8qW7RWfUkkt1Q.text: Excellent service and food prep as expected from this top shelf eatery. Best Steaks and Seafood. Extensive wine list.

eua-aTemI4JZ1WSFYMSpUQ.text: I was surprisingly disappointed with the food. I ordered the salmon, and it was too dry. My cousin ordered steak medium done, but instead it was rare. It also took a really long time to get the food. For sides we ordered corn which was my favorite. Bristle sprouts, mushrooms, and green beans. All which were really good, but not enough to say I would go back again.

F68ACA0XeHFBkcfLRDVchQ.text: I received a gift certificate for this restaurant for my birthday.  Having never heard of it, I looked it up and found out it was the treehouse-like restaurant in Crystals.  Now, interestingly, I have always wanted to eat there but I never knew what it was called or anything about it.   Having eaten there, I'm not sure why I've never heard anything about it.  I belong to a number of Las Vegas forums and Facebook pages and have never heard this place mentioned.  That's a mistake.  You can't mention all the fine dining seafood and steak restaurants and not have Mastro's on the list.    OK, so having read some Yelp reviews, my big takeaway was that portions were large.  My friend and I checked and splitting plates wouldn't be a problem.  We thought, "Great!  We can split everything and use up the $110 and even if we go over a little bit, no big deal;" we were quite certain we would get enough to eat.  Famous last words!  First up was a bread bowl.  OK, that's just evil right there.  Four different kinds of bread and you know you have to try one of each.  Just try not to finish any of them---more food is coming---more than you know.  We ordered a warm spinach salad.  They split that for us and we each had a normal sized salad in front of us.  Everything about this salad was delicious, including the bacon and cheese. The dressing was so good and there's still some bread so you know the bread went into the dressing because, well, sometimes you really can't get enough of a good thing.  For our entree, we split a 22oz bone in ribeye, creamed corn, steamed asparagus and steamed spinach.  When they brought the sizzling plate with the ribeye and put it front of me, I was quite sure they hadn't split it yet.  I was wrong and this big honkin' piece of meat was half!!!  It was cooked to perfection and still cooking on that plate.  So, here's the problem, we ate the meat.  I don't know where my stomach found room but that wasn't going to waste.  Sadly, after we had our first portions of vegetables, whatever vegetables were left in their bowls didn't make it to our plates.  We were so completely stuffed.  But, wait, it was our birthdays (4/7 and 4/21) so we celebrated with warm butter cake.  OK, that's just wrong, on so many levels.  I thought the bread was evil but the butter cake Is the devil incarnate.  Oh, we're not done yet.  Here comes a bowl of  home made whipped cream for the cake.  The bowl was so big, you could have taken a bath in it.    My friend and I agreed we are going back to this restaurant but we are bringing other people with us because, honestly, three or four people would have been very well fed on all this food.  The decor, atmosphere, and service (Gino, you are the best!!!) pushes this restaurant over the top.  They have many peers but none better!

2okzXmLhiW_BZkvmi9neGQ.text: I have been here twice, and I have to say this is probably my favorite restaurant of all time. The food is simply phenomenal and the service is excellent, too. It's definitely on the pricey side, but well worth it if you're looking for something nice. It can be the small things that make or break an establishment-in this case it's the ability to get "half" orders of their salads and side orders. Nice touch. I highly recommend giving Mastro's a try. Because it's in the middle of an indoor shopping mall, it's a little bit of a stretch to say it's super romantic or intimate. But, it's easy to tune all of that out and just focus on your food and company. I hardly ever give 5 star reviews, but I think this place has earned it.

i4dr1Nf1QLtqmCS2JGl-Yw.text: I took my boyfriend to Mastros for his birthday as a surprise and both of us thoroughly enjoyed the entire evening! He said his porterhouse was one of the best steaks he ever had and we have dined all over the world. I had the Blackened Salmon and it was delicious! The only negative I have  is the scalloped potatoes were over cooked. The service and atmosphere were excellent.  The butter cake was incredible and served with ice cream and whipped cream that was phenomenal! We will be returning!

LiSugVWw6umS2TbkjJMvTQ.text: One of the many indulgences of La Vegas. Mastro's is a well known stop for those looking to treat themselves.  Food: We went as a group of 7 girls and all got steak with a variety of shared sides. I split a 16oz filet made medium (almost half the price it would cost to get an 8 oz filet on your own). It was everything I expected from a good steakhouse, well seasoned, tender, and perfectly cooked. Its only dressing was a melting slice of butter on the top. The sides were all generally well made. The lobster mashed potatoes had real chunks of lobster it in, though, between the 7 of us, not everyone got a piece. The brussel sprouts and asparagus were cooked to just the right texture but there was nothing really special about them. The creamed corn was sweet and luxuriously smooth but needed a little more savory to balance it out.  Service: The service was excellent. The server was very accommodating and attentive. A few of us ordered steaks to split and they plated them separately for us. We also brought in our own cake since we were celebrating a birthday. They served the caked and repacked the leftover cake for us to go.  Locations: Mastro's unique architecture has made it a near icon among the casinos on the strip. Floating in the middle of Crystals, it makes up a beautiful view and provides one. The decor is subdued in an elegant way and it generally draws a quieter crowd.     While Mastro's wasn't a life changing dining experience, between the high class menu and eye catching locale, it certainly did not disappoint.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half of a 16oz steak with lobster mashed potatoes and brussel sprouts

CJn_qHA0GEkAGOLIKEOzmA.text: What a wonderful evening! When I initially called to make the reservation I had a warm welcoming voice on the other end.   Upon arriving I was a little unsure because I didn't realize it was inside the mall, I immediately didn't know what to expect. I have been to the one in Newport Beach, Scottsdale and Palm Springs, all fabulous of coarse.   Hostess looked well groomed, acted professional and was very inviting and seemed happy to have us dine.   Server Lionel was Amazing, Made great dinner suggestions. I had the Strawberry Mule to drink, Bone In Filet for dinner, My husband had the Lobster and we shared scallop potaoes and sauted asparagus. ( All sides are ala carte and are shareable for the table)   Only downfall was there was a problem with the scallop potatoes, within seconds a manager by the name of Brandon was there, took it away and offered garlic mash potatoes in place , until new ones were ready. Nice recovery, and made the situation forgotten. When the new ones came it was PERFECT!  At the end of our meal our server Lionel and Manager Brandon came by again and apologized for the mishap and brought us a complimentary dessert which is there signature dessert, The Warm Butter Cake. All I can say is OMG!!! Best thing ever.   It was a beautiful experience, Great food, service and atmosphere. Food was spaced out and timed perfectly. Excellent job chefs! I am defiantly going back next time we go to LV.   A restaurant that runs this smoothly from back of the house to front is all from great leadership. Kudos to whoever is in charge, keep it up because your doing it right!  Visited January 2016

Vw4Hh0n_kDxtAjtNMN_p5w.text: My fiance and I tried this place out yesterday for our anniversary dinner. I feel like usually when I leave a review its because I'm unhappy with the place but that's NOT at all how we felt last night at Mastro's.. Down to every detail the experience and the night was amazing. Our server Paul gave us the best costumer service we had ever experienced. He was friendly.. Made jokes and even custom tailored our menus to our liking.  I started off with a cocktail that Paul personally had made for me based off my preference for something sweet and tropical, yet strong. My fiance had a beer found only at Mastro's. For appetizer we both had shared the shrimp cocktail. The shrimps were jumbo sized and so fresh it's as if they had just got it from the ocean!   For our entrees my fiance had the rib eye and I had the 3lbs Maine lobster. Our server brought out the food and de shelled the lobster in front of me. He even cut up my steak in front of me. Talk about excellent service! The food was so flavorful.. fresh and the service was impeccable! I definitely would recommend this place.. And ask for Paul to be your server!

pzh-tbcB6sKf4JXiwaxHRg.text: AMAZING food. AMAZING service. Ive been to a couple Mastro locations, this one is slightly more laid back, which is nice. I'm not big into the overly attentive waiting, and clean up. But the food is incredible. The waiters are awesome. I can't wait to go back. This will be me returning location.

bWkOoM39sV9wlLBW3UpjfQ.text: By far the best restaurants in vegas, I have no words to describe this place was amazing the service was fantastic the waiters are nothing but perfection and professionalism the food is excellent I will definitely go back over and over again little expensive but every penny worth.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

s2dxUnAaUplzWjUTB2tdHw.text: Mastro's Ocean Club is a fine dining establishment located in the Aria Hotel and Casino. The ambiance is set well, the architecture is particularly astounding, and the service is exquisite. Our server, Joe, was on his game. My water glass and wine glass never reached half empty (or half full). Ordered the Bone Marrow, Lobster Bisque, Ocean Club Crab Cakes, Sauteed Broccoli, Gorgonzola Mac and Cheese, 22 oz. Bone-in Ribeye, and Mastro's Signature Warm Butter Cake.   Bone Marrow - Holy Donkey Punching Jesus this is astounding. I have never had Bone Marrow before but its alluring presence on the menu was enough for me to sample it. The Bone Marrow comes half charred on a split bone with a serving of toasted baguette to spread on. The flavor, the texture, the taste and everything about it was amazing. I will order this every time and you should as well.  Ocean Club Crab Cakes - Hearty crab cakes with more crab than cake. In fact the cakes fall apart to the softest touch, the chunks of crab meat separating with ease as only a minimal amount of filler has been used. Flavor and spice is more than enough to accent the cakes.  Lobster Bisque - Oftentimes Lobster Bisque comes heavily buttered, even in the most finest of dining establishment. Butter is an easy thing to add to a dish to increase its flavor without actually improving on its originality and substance. However, Mastro's Lobster Bisque does not perpetuate this and, rather, has a full-bodied bisque with a generous portion of lobster inside. The thickness is akin to how a bisque should be.  Sauteed Broccoli - Opting to go a slightly healthier route with one of the dishes I was still impressed but of course, it's sauteed broccoli, and only so much can be done while keeping it True.  Gorgonzola Mac and Cheese - a perfect compliment to my Bone-in Ribeye and a hearty side at that. It's a shame our hotel fridge has a monitored scale with a restocking fee otherwise I would have had no issue taking the remainder of this with me.  22 oz. Bone-in Ribeye - One of the finer Ribeyes I have had. A generous amount of fat and it was seared and salted well enough to make it exceedingly juicy. Cooked to perfection (rare) with a cool red center while the black crust of searing on iron was still present.   Mastro's Signature Warm Butter Cake - Fuck. That's Amazing.  The servings sizes of sides are plentiful and the prices are what you'd expect at such an establishment. Be wary of those giving Mastro's a bad review due to price or service, such an establishment would be careful to hire only proven servers and I would wager that the reviewers themselves to be the standoffish party.

qA483P8xFHru_j5FT6h4Cw.text: Excellent meal. We made reservations at 7pm for a 9pm meal. Arrived at 8:20 and sat at the bar. 2 delicious pomegranate martinis. We were sat at 9am. Met an excellent server Johnny from Chicago. We was exceptional. Superb recommendations on meal and wine selection. Seared Ahi tuna, spinach salad, bone in filet and ribeye, lobster mashed and Brussel sprouts. Then to top it off at the end of the night, Butter Cake. We have made reservations for our return trip in December. We are impressed and you will be too.

Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone in filet, lobster mashed

A9BJCIINI89--Qs25PltWw.text: Mastros you were very disappointing. We were very excited to give this place a try because of the reviews that were given.   First off the service was horrible. And keep in mind I'm not asking for you guys to bend over backwards to keep us happy, but the attitude needs a lot of improvement from the host to the server.   I didn't keep that in mind for long because we were here for the food anyway and I thought the food will make up for it. We order the hamachi appetizer, which was the only decent tasting dish. We ordered the sea bass, rack of lamb and scallop. They were all just super basic dishes. It was literally just a protein with no sauce whatsoever! I could have done this at home and this would have tasted better at a local BJs. I expected much better from you guys.   Then when we were about to leave I asked for a box so I could take the bread to go so that we could snack on it later. I got attitude and was asked twice am I sure I did not want to take the courses to go. There's a reason why we didn't ask for box to go and we obviously thought it was NOT good enough to take it to go, and I understand why our server gave us attitude. He thought we were wasteful, but the food sucked so just leave us alone and don't ask twice with an attitude.   I would skipped this place if you're in Vegas, you can find much better places to eat around here. I understand sometimes it sucks to be working on a holiday or the weekend, but keep in mind we all work too and we spend good money to have a good meal out here too. We don't deserve any of this nasty attitude or food.

-BPAd3M_0SKqi6QXbEeQ9Q.text: This place was so freaking amazing!  We sat in the tree house last night for my fiances birthday.  She ordered lemon drops and I had mojitos all night.  Started with two delicious crab cakes, followed by halves of a Ceasar and wedge salads.  Then came the filet mignon, gorgonzola mac n cheese, and lobster mash potatoes.  We were stuffed but of course had to try their famous butter cake and we were so glad we did!  The filets were a tad more rare than we like but we're still great and my fiance said the lemon drops, Mac n cheese, and the butter cake were the best dishes she's ever eaten! That says a lot since we frequent places like Gordon Ramsey's Steakhouse, PRIME st Bellagio, N9NE at Palms, SW at Wynn, to name a few for special occasions.   It's a great place and we will absolutely return!

ecHxc8DGO2WBt8GlalaJ2Q.text: Wonderful service that matched a great array of fresh and exquisite shellfish selection. The mains were also a delight but I found the sides to be quite rich (which took away from the main attraction), substantial and unnecessary. The wine list was a fairly condensed affair but what was on offer certainly complimented their menu satisfactorily.

1mEyA48aifjCnJ7sJ8ktzQ.text: We have dined at this restaurant 3 times it is one of my wife's favorites in Las Vegas. Yes it's expensive but if your going to have at least one special meal this is one of the best. The service is 5 star, the food is top notch, and the setting is spectacular. You are actually eating in a treehouse inside city center. Great spot for a first date, wedding proposal, or anniversary.

LUb3GTndOfFnIhw1BrHGYg.text: Fiance and I been here a couple of times and we absolutely loved it. staff is friendly and professional. I don't like to dress up so everytime I go to fancy places I get stereotyped service if you will. Not this place, both times I was treated nice. We had the seafood tower, ribeye, lamb chops, and buttercake. for the place they're striving to be I must say all expectations were met. Service, ambiance and food was top notch.   If I had to say something negative...maybe the restrooms being upstairs. Lol after all the food I ate I don't wanna be going on stairs but they do have a elevator.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FfL4Uy5L_ZSrn5BIBDJTFQ.text: Had a wonderful experience. The food is spectacular and the service was on point. Perfectly cooked filet. Delicious sides especially the cream corn. Albacore had a little too much soy sauce on top.   Overall really enjoyed Mastro's

6ASAsjbrrMVRR7K5Uj6IxQ.text: We enjoyed our first visit to Mastro's on New Year's Eve....and had the most fabulous fine dining experience! The food and drinks were fantastic, the atmosphere wonderful and our server Sam (Samantha) was absolutely made our dining experience one to remember....in fact, we went back just this past weekend for my husband's birthday....and Sam greeted us, welcomed us back although she wasn't our server, she was checking that our dining experience was good. Nice touch, for a server to remember a couple in the midst of the hundreds that she assists (that's attention to detail if you ask me).   Our first visit we enjoyed their delicious bread basket (pretzel bread my fav), Lobster Bisque (dare I say, the best ever tasted...and that's coming from someone that grew up in Monterey with some of the best seafood anywhere), lamb (again, the best ever tasted), filet, sauteed green beans....and topped off with their signature warm butter cake! And can't forget the smoothest and delicious Lemon Drop cocktail....love the dry ice effect!   We had another fabulous dining experience that evening for my husband's birthday just this past weekend with Craig as our server. This time we started we took it lighter and slower to enjoy.....starting with their spinach salad and decided to split the 22oz Ribeye that I had read about and recommended...they kindly split it up on 2 separate plates for us (without us asking), sauteed asparagus.....and was topped off with a birthday creme brulee (my hubby's fav dessert)....I wasn't much of a brulee fan....until I tried theirs....smooth, creamy, delicious vanilla bean custard!  We won't miss a visit on our future Vegas visits...even if just to sit at the bar for appetizers, bisque, drinks and dessert!

ZNH0fCKgfzP8shvS60RmTg.text: Food + Service Was Awesome  We ordered The Shrimp Cocktail 20$ I'd rate it 3 Japanese Kobe Beef Steak 140$ Rate 4 Gorgonzola Mac & Cheese 14$ Rate A Perfect 5 Twin lobster tails 70$ Rate A Perfect 5!  Service was great!  Thanks Paul and craig.  Scenery Was The Best Part

DZeNXBiWpenfocbD38iwWw.text: Came by for dinner the other night and the experience left a lot to be desired. Made a group reservation and surprisingly, we were given a slew of small tables...  The restaurant has a unique venue but it was both loud and hot...in the middle of December...when it's 45F outside...  Started off with the bread and it was mediocre. Too hard and salty.  Moved on to the mixed greens salad and the vegetables weren't too fresh and the salad and plate both had some fridge taste...  Moved on to the Lobster Roll and again, it was pre-made, wasn't fresh, and had too much rice.  The seared ahi tuna came out really dark...didn't seem fresh.  My 8 oz Petite Filet was requested medium rare and came out as such. The meat had a strong flavor and was slightly salty...nothing spectacular here.  The sauteed mushrooms, creamed corn, and garlic mashed potatoes were all mediocre.  Service was okay. The wait staff slammed the dishes on the table and quickly split our side dishes...it was pretty rushed.  ...the tap water had a strong chlorine smell...gross.

cHqiBZBuqR11oMnvDssoBA.text: The service is beyond friendly, but for $150 for the Waygu, I would of appreciated it not being salted to all hell. Couldn't appreciate the meat itself because I was busy downing water and could only taste salt. Cmon.

8IXl-JNFGieeGxW5ctnaJg.text: By far the ugliest mastros I've ever been to. Honestly the restaurant was just sad. Went there for my bday dinner and I was very underwhelmed. It's located inside the crystal shopping center. Literally looks like the Starbucks located across from the restaurant. The food was not great. The service was ok and the drinks were filled with cheap vodka. It was basically eating at sizzer

305c-Q5KenVBoMI-KKJsEA.text: My lovely girlfriend took me here for my birthday. Being a non-practicing Hindu, I hold a special love for a medium-rare steak. Our reservation was for 7:30PM and once we got there we were escorted to our table and seated promptly. It's a very busy place; so do reserve a table ahead of time.  Our server was very nice and professional. We ordered soups for starters, my girlfriend ordered clam chowder and I ordered the lobster bisque, both soups were delicious, especially the lobster bisque. Lobster bisque was cream and not too sweet and as an added bonus there were big piece of delicious lobster meat.   After we were done with both soups we both ordered filet mignon. I went with 12 OZ. medium rare cut while my girlfriend went with 8 OZ. well done cut (sacrilege!!!). We also ordered creamed spinach, baked potatoes with cheese and sauteed asparagus. After a 20-25 minute wait we were served our delicious meal. The steak was exquisite, the seasoning was perfect and the meat was like butter. It melted in our mouth. The sides were also delicious, creamed spinach in particular complimented the steak well.  The only complaint of mine was that the baked potato had too much cheese on it, but everything else was amazing.   I think this is best steak house I've been to in Las Vegas and if you are on the strip, then this is the place to go.

_uqeb6p91Axan9yhKDbBUg.text: Phenomenal service and food. The seafood tower was fresh and delicious. I had the bone in filet, halibut, along with multiple sides. Everything was perfect.

M8Evs7cHYGETPLHWqm6pFQ.text: My wife and I live in Summerlin, and enjoy all the amazing dining that it has to offer. What people who visit Vegas don't know is, our little West Side has eats as good as anything you will find on the World Famous Las Vegas Strip.  However, for special occasions, we still venture down to the zoo.  On this occasion, for our 9th anniversary we settled on Mastro's after hearing nothing but amazing things. Welp. In fact they are all True. We were absolutely blown away by the quality of the food product, and the attention to detail.  Yes. It was an expensive dinner. But man, does this staff and Chef crew nail it. From the soft breads offered, to the Caesar salad, to the lobster mashed potatoes. Yes. Lobster.  The star of the evening beyond the waitstaff who I can't say enough about, was the medium rare Rib-eye with truffle butter cooked to literal perfection. I have eaten many steaks, all over the world. This was simply one of the finest I have ever had the pleasure of tasting.  Well done Mastro's. Well done.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mastro&#39;s Rib-eye with truffle butter. 100 out of 100. Nothing finer.

uG6n5jVstb82k38EhsyobA.text: This is a good steakhouse, but not 5 star which is what I was expecting (and what I paid for). We went for my wife's birthday. The bone in ribeye is really good. Imo, it's as good as Ruth Chris (but not as good as Fleming's). The potatoes were ok (but my wife makes WAY better). The desert there is friggin ridiculous! It's this huge butter cake and it's awesome! So get that and save room for it! Actually, maybe skip the steak and just get that! That's the only thing I would come back here for. The atmosphere sucks because you're in the middle of a mall. It's not really romantic or classy - more like food-courty... Service is good. The waiters were a little bit formal for my taste, but it's kind of that type of place.

pcBL8dL8E0_2pnQ1Fc_okg.text: I went to a Mastro's in Chicago with my brother. I loved their butter cake so much that after seeing a show in Vegas, I took my wife to experience the greatness that is Mastro's Butter Cake.   If you haven't tried it and you are on death row, this should be your final meal (for dessert). If you are not on death row or in prison, you should definitely make a trip and try it out. The rest of their food is really good as well, but we came for THE dessert.   I can't describe it, except it is scrumtralecent. I envy anyone who lives within an hour of Mastro's. If you live within an hour and haven't tried it yet you should be deported... to Idaho.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The legend

9x4Jftvp1CKtjjQyVDITxg.text: Wow! Wow! Wow! is all that I can say!  I am a huge fan of Mastro's and have been to most of them in the Los Angeles area but I have to say this is the most unique one I've ever seen. Located in the shops at Crystals which in itself is a gorgeous mall, this beautiful wood structure houses The Ocean Club Mastro's in Las Vegas. And as usual the food is always amazing here. My go to favorites have always been the bone in ribeye, the cream corn and the always delicious pretzel bread. And to top it off the always delicious butter cake.... the best dessert I've ever had in my life! I have tried to go to other steakhouses but I always come back to Mastros...hands down the best steakhouse in the country....

m5txLXlmIBQwarwz11RCng.text: Nice atmosphere and the food was pretty good.    The service was really good throughout the entire meal as you expect from a high end restaurant.   The steak was alright but I would recommend the seafood tower as an appetizer.

MtNU7DEQS3QYSccl3gPRHA.text: We love coming to Mastros.  The food is top notch as well as the service.  You must save room for their warm butter cake.  You will not be disappointed.  We had the sushi, crab legs, shrimp, steak, roasted chicken, creamed corn, scallops, and desserts.  Yummy!

z-WgWuu42sNOuN_k7eL3ZQ.text: Although it is called Mastro's OCEAN Club, I actually think that one may be better off getting Steak here.  I had the Sea Bass and felt as though it was pretty dry and maybe over cooked.  The appetizers / sides were all good, but the highlight for me was the dessert.  I had the vanilla cake, and it was outrageously good.  It was like a chocolate lava cake, but vanilla.  I never had anything like that before, and it was great.  If the main dish was better, Mastro's would be a 4 star meal.  The prices were what one would expect.  By no means is it a cheap meal, but it was "A-OK" (for the price).  This has to be rated based on cost / enjoyment.

Zn9JIAj9mBeMdY1-XJ5ZBw.text: Wow, I've been to many steak restaurants but this one really takes the cake. We were a group of 7. The intimate setting and fancy atmosphere made me expect a very large bill but the prices are very reasonable for the amount of luxury, excellent service, food quality, and professionalism.  Piotr was our waiter but it felt like the entire restaurant's staff was at our finger tips. We never felt like we needed to wait and it really felt like we were special guests at this establishment. I would highly recommend this place no matter your group size! I felt like they could handle anything we threw at them.  The food was amazing and all the meats just melted as we ate them. The portion sizes available were very appreciated since the group had various (stomach) sized people. Cooked to culinary perfection, we had a meal to remember for the rest of our lives.  Thank you so much.

gl0IeRF9bhoS0vBdmOYbmQ.text: OH wow how could I forget to make a review for this place?! LONG overdue this review is for March.... I was celebrating my 21st birthday you know in LAS VEGAS duh! Hahaha, my boyfriend made reservation for my birthday dinner on a Sunday night this was last minute because we wanted to stay in Vegas longer hahaha , we usually go to the one in Orange County because we are from California.   OH wow this Mastros is GORGEOUS! Make sure to ask for a seat in the bird-nest!!   Food - BEST BEST BEST Lamb racks ever!!! Ugh I had it medium rare but it came out more rare but I didn't mind. Ever bite taste like butter. Boy friend has the New York Steak - This wasn't so bad, I couldn't stop thinking about how good my lamb racks were that I can't remember if this was super good or not hahaha. We had a side of Mac and Cheese too greasy, would not order this I think we prefer the Lobster Mash potatoes instead.   Service was wonderful! Better service than we had in Orange County. Everyone was nice, and even the manager came to ask if everything was fine.   In the end of the meal our server ask if we wanted any dessert but we were super full for any. But he still came out and surprise me with a birthday cake! He even wrote " Happy 21st birthday. " Which I think is very special to me!    THANK YOU MASTRO'S LAS VEGAS!
