u8sUQVO-axjCbChntyMGTg.text: Went here expecting one of the best meals of my life since it was one of the most expensive. Left feeling not impressed. Made reservations days in advance but didn't know to request the "tree house" so we were seated outside the tree house in the open mall area. Grouper was standard, not worth $50, twice baked potato was nothing special. King crab legs were good, lobster roll was standard. Overall we had a mediocre experience at a premium price. Would not recommend or return.

TfuxRFIQsa5htwHZ8aQ3mw.text: Great for business dinner, round tables available.  Highly recommend the John Dorry fish, lobster roll, oysters, and Ahi Tuna.  Would have 5 stars but Swordfish overcooked.  Beautiful restaurant, packed bar.  Great drinks and wine list here.

e8rPGdz3Z7wgDunAVxoxjA.text: Mastros ocean club Las Vegas really hit it out of the park. Dinning is an experience compiled of food, service and ambiance for me. So when one is missing or lacking it affects the whole experience. Mastros has it all down to a near perfection. Our server was incredible, attentive and funny. The restaurant was beautifully organized and last but not least the food, I have to say, is the best I've had at any mastros. The seafood tower, tomahawk, gnocchi definitely stood out for me and, OF COURSE, the buttercake. What a wonderful experience will for sure return to this location on our next trip to Vegas.

ltOCaTDUDTa8jAtOGPEzXg.text: Beautiful location in one of the high end malls in the new City Center. Little bit hard to find if you don't normally shop here. And I don't. Civil servant salary :(. But we made it and we made reservations in advance so no problems with our table.   Once placed at a table I think the floormanager thought it took too long before we got menu's and drinks because after some talking in a little microphone he brought the menu's himself. And bizarre: he really, really resembles Sheldon Cooper (Big Bang Theory). And once you've seen it........  Our waiter showed up explaining the menu and taking the drink orders. To be honoust, we've missed most of the information. A high speed talk with way too much information about the specials.  We decided on half a portion of the salad of the day (spinach, bacon, egg, the promised blue cheese was hard to find), the lobster bisque, a Ahi Tuna Tartare and the Ribeye with bone. For sides just the sauteed mushrooms.  Portions are huge, but had a few dissapointments considering the price. Although we'resure the waitress spoke off different kinds of Preparing the meat (grilled, blackend, etc.) she didn't asked we would like the meat prepared. Looking at the meat of our neigbours we asked which cooking that was. Turned out to be rare. Just a little too pink for us so we asked the meat to be cooked medium. Can tell you, what we got was definitely way beyond medium. Almost welldone. And no,we didn't send it back. I know, we should have.  The mushrooms were perfectly cooked and huge. Like the portion. More than enough to satisfy four. The bisque was oke but both appetizers, the spinach salad and Ahi Tuna Tartare were flat. The salad being nothing special and the Tuna was way to cold  discover any taste at all. I also don't understand the fried things (onions?) on the bottom.  Best experiences were the setting, despite the location, the services and the bread. Especially the latter was excellent.   Together with a glass of white and red we've paid $163 before tip.  NOTE: excuse any grammar and spelling mistakes. I'm no native speaker and keep having troubles with my Apple device that keeps trying to change the English words into proper Dutch words. Yes, you've guessed right. My first language.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Even the cup of (verveine / mint) tea is huge
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The leftovers. Mastro&#39;s really got the better of us. Pfff....way too much
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye with sauteed mushrooms on the side

CxvxZCJPeqadUBak8C_tJQ.text: What drew me here was the treehouse! I've never dined in one in the middle of a mall so we figured why not? I like to people watch too. We went here a couple months ago so my complete recollection is foggy. The features that stick out are the ambiance really. The food was good but nothing that made me say wow, i need to come back and eat this again. I had the miso cod and escargot.  Both good but not memorable. What was memorable was the ambiance. It was romantic yet there were large groups around that worked well too. There was a piano man right next to the bar area that took requests all night. We even stayed and hung out bar side because he was so good! When dining make sure to request to sit IN the treehouse, if not there's not too much of a wow factor in your experience.

6Oeci7pXkfaMEAp_EoLesA.text: Couldn't stop eating...steak, calamari, scallops, lobster mashed potatoes, spinach, butter cake!!  Impeccable service, nice views of crystals, and awesome leftovers:)

z9LOErHREjQ8xupl84NnIg.text: So far, it's the best ribeye steak I've ever had.  Very juicy and tasty.  Can't go wrong with this dish.

RRAyU68g5NdycqTiGXf-oA.text: Amazing restaurant! We had oysters Rockefeller and bone marrow for appetizer. Both were superb! Ribeye and rack of lamb for main course were absolutely delicious. The atmosphere was very inviting. The only draw back was the location in the mall. Will come back here every time  were in Vegas.

JIAv_qrE3pUVHFCJQQ9kbg.text: This place time and time again will always be the best. It is the restaurant that I use to compare all other dining experiences I have. The Creme de la Creme!

EmV8EVQpNTvE-exm4SO7yA.text: A culinary delight!  Started off with the beefsteak tomato and mozzarella salad.  Chose the salmon blackened for dinner and shared a mountain of sweet potato fries and the cream corn.  For desert I ordered the butter cake which topped the meal off perfectly!  The Mastro's Martini is a must have if you like martinis.  Don't be scared off by the $19.00 price...they bring the shaker out and it fills the glass three times!  Superior service.  A great evening out!

4tXLk1X8dJ5JukldZGHCeg.text: We read the reviews and thought would be a great place for dinner. The live music was so LOUD we could barely talk to each other and we were jammed into a table that had to be moved so we could sit there and still felt like we were bumping into our neighbors. The first waiter that showed was excellent but the second was clearly a jerk. How can this be at a premium restaurant?  I ordered a steak medium and it was grey and overcooked and the 1lb potato was under cooked. My wife's sashimi was good but for these prices, never again.

_BKU0jM_OwgsChA0tkxF2Q.text: Excellent food, great service. Our food came out piping hot and perfectly cooked. The restaurant was busy (saturday night) but the service was not lacking. What made it even better was that my friend Rick paid with his winnings from gambling. No complaints here...

iwYMaLuLKGq2UolC3i1rMg.text: Ate here recently when we were in Vegas.  I was so excited because reviews were great.  Service was very good, food was very good.  Filets were good, but I guess I expected outstanding.  And of course, it's in a mall.  I would recommend someone try this place, but I'll try something else next time.

ru0Gdmg0d3si2OiFuRBwKA.text: The lobster mashed potatoes is absolutely delish!  We came here on a Wednesday night and there was live music which was pretty cool.  We ordered Kumomoto oysters and the scallops for appetizers and share the bone-in filet and the mashed potatoes.  Everything was delish and our server was super attentive.  Will definitely go back.

XCK8BLFdsjXArUSDZm9wRA.text: Every dinner I have had at Mastro's Ocean Club has been delish!! I am heading there tonight and can't wait to have some of my faves.... Tuna tar tar, Chilean sea bass and the brussel sprouts!!! Mmmmmm. Can't beat having live entertainment as well. Managers and service is the best here. See you soon!

ETavn6SP1k3Oj5D15_Whkw.text: My husband and I went to Mastros after it was highly recommended by my boss, and listening to Mark & Brian from KLOS go on and on how great this place is.  Well, they were not joking.  Had an absolutely fabulous dinner,  We both ordered the Bone in Fillet, melted in my mouth, this was the most Delicious steak I have ever had.  Ordered the side of cream corn, which we shared, excellent once again.  The ending was the best, as it was our anniversary, Michael our waiter( he was awesome!) brought us Mastros signature butter cake, to die for!!  The service was suburb, from the hostess who sat us, to our awesome waiter.  We will definitely be back (soon I hope!)

VfNJRtzlaBiDeQjQvUpwjA.text: Came here for cocktails after dinner at a company event.  Although I never tried the food here, I have to give this place 5 stars (would give it more if I could) for one reason: the bartenter Victor.  Victor isn't just one of the finest mixologists whose creations I have had the joy of imbibing.....he is truly an artist.  I tried the Boulevardier (which was the most well-balanced Boulevardier I have ever tried - it was actually a little bit mind-blowing.  I am good friends with one of L.A.'s top bartenders and he says the Boulevardier is one of the trickiest drinks to balance) and something called the "Faux-jito" which was also amazing.  I asked Victor to make me one of his original inventions, and I sadly forget the name of the drink, but it was a unique and sensational libation as well.  Next time I visit Las Vegas, I hope to find Victor again and enjoy the best cocktails in Las Vegas!

khQOEPPI2OZ6yaFSA-oKhA.text: Quite pricey but you honestly get what you pay for and more here. One of my favorite places to eat on special occasions. I went here first with my girlfriend for an anniversary and also with my family for New Years. I recommend their fish since they are known for their seafood here. The service is top notch and be sure to tell them if you came for an anniversary since they usually hook you up with some sort of dessert! If you like alcohol with your meal I definitely recommend their lemon drops. It was so amazing I asked the waiter how they make it and they told me they soak their vodka with lemons for a long period of time to get the flavor. It tastes so delicious I could barely tell there was any alcohol in it but I felt it hit me after a glass. One of the best drinks I have ever tried. Be sure to make a reservation as well. I never had too much trouble making one and they did seat me earlier since we got there 20 minutes early but it always seems quite packed. This restaurant would definitely make my top 5 of the best restaurants I have gone to in terms of service and food quality.

KKkWpqe6h9OhxzRhaaMMIA.text: Our reservations were for 10:30 pm (Valentine's Day), but we arrived a little after 10:00 and were quickly seated in the "tree house", which is more like a bird cage!  Our waitress (Tanya) was phenomenal the entire evening.  She catered to every need and offered excellent suggestions during ordering.    We began with a few cocktails, which were very tasty.  My wife and I decided to split a bowl of Lobster bisque, since I had read reviews that it was very good (I had Lobster  bisque the previous evening at a Venitian restaurant, and was very disappointed).  This bisque was the best I have ever had!  It was a quite large serving with many sizeable pieces of lobster.  It could easily satisfy as a meal by itself!  As a main course, we split the Chilean Sea Bass ($50, I think).  When asked for suggestions, Tanya recommended the Blackened seasoning.  For sides, we chose the King Crab truffled Gnocci ($29), and Roasted Brussle Sprouts ($11).  The fish came a la carte on a large plate.  For being a split order, the portions were surprisingly generous.  The gnocci and brussle sprouts came as large sides to be shared.  The waitress dished the sides on the main plate.  Now, plated and ready to go, and accompanied by a basket of various breads, my wife and I embarked on the best meal we have ever had!  Initially, we agreed it had to be in the top three, but then we couldn't come up with where we had had a more impeccable meal (and service).  The Sea Bass was tender, flakey, moist, and so perfectly seasoned.  The Gnocci had large pieces of crab mixed with the creamy gnocci.  For the brussle sprouts, we like them almost burnt on the outside to bring out the flavor.  They, too, were perfectly roasted dark and tender!    We ate the all the fish, even though we were quite full.  We took home the leftover gnocci and brussle sprouts, which was enough to make another whole meal for two.  My wife made the comment that she wanted to take home a piece of the bread that was still in the bread basket.  The waitress said she would get us fresh ones.  With our leftovers, she packed four extra pieces of the fresh "pretzle" bread.  We travel a lot, we love to cook, and we love to eat at quality restaurants.  If you go to Vegas, you HAVE to eat here!  We hope your experience is as enjoyable as ours was!

3oj5sJUVdSm2P22BDnUdIA.text: Mastro's is always fantasitc, highly recommend their seafood salad that they have under appetizers, it's beyond excellent. The dining experience never ceases to amaze...

UkNS1dYVU_3OYikbC7lCXg.text: What a wonderful place for a date! If you're a bourbon fan, they have Blanton's, yum.. The service was pretty good, the portions are huge, and the steak was delicious. The lobster mash was okay, but I could live without it. The gnocchi was tasty. The macaroni and cheese was forgettable. Next time, I think I will do without the sides.

WPPENYjEdM2ntYYPLFMo6g.text: Top 5 in the city.. This place has it covered from great selections on the menu to great food to great service. The staff is on point. Definitely get the seafood tower and the king crab gnocchi.

vPMS8_n5i_5LuGtWYCe8sg.text: Out in Las Vegas for a week and this restaurant is my new favorite on the strip. We were late for our reservation and the hostess was very nice and very accomadating. The fish and seafood were some of the best I have had. I have seen on the food network how the desert flies in the best seafood, but this restaurant really proved it. to top it off the restaurant called the next day and made sure everything was great. 5 stars for this place and can't wait to go back.

yGStspeRST3sHZ9Kxl5afQ.text: Always a good experience at this place.I hope my hubby surprises me this year again and we end up at Mastro's having strawberries and that home made cream

-JA6I86XC-nrhANBsz8Xow.text: The lobster mash-potatoes are worth the calories. I brought in 25 with dinner at this location, I loved the free dessert for special occasions, I loved the feeling of floating in the sky great view was kind of hard to find the location but we made it, most definitely a must try over and over again

iDGQtCRzvt5ISHeCypu87Q.text: Any trip to Mastro's is always a good one!! The food and drinks are always perfect!!

Cuub7rztDCn2cLw6MSrhbg.text: We didnt get to sit in the treehouse, but we were nearby about two tables away.  This was on my  Bookmark before I even touched foot in LV, and only reserved here because we stayed another night and needed a destination. I was hesitant because I've seen postcard-type ads for this place at CES, and I believe that places that need to advertise aren't the best. Opentable also promoted it with extra points.  Anyways, OpenTable showed same day availability for party of 5, so I booked it anyways, no cost booking and I could cancel if I found a better place.  We were seated promptly at the reservation time, no need for a lengthy wait like the previous restaurants this past week. Mastro's wasnt that busy when we arrived, although it did once 8:30p rolled around.  We ordered our entrees and sides. However I did not know the entrees come as that, with the sides making the dish. What I also didn't know was the production involved once dinner arrived....  The production went as follows, you get one or two servers serving the entrees, then a supporting team of servers go around putting sides on your entree plate. I believe we had six servers, in a high paced whirlwind headturning array of food being served onto our plates.  The $37 lobster mash potato was alright, but having a similar $15 smaller portion lobster mash at N9NE the previous night, I would skip Mastro's and go for N9NE's.  I would skip the Au Gratin Potato, it was nothing more than potato with cheese melted on top, not what I expected.  Creamed spinach was good.   Yes, the booze is marked up.  All told, of the three dinners I had in LV, this ranked third.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My $30 salmon came on that large plate naked, until all the sides arrived, accompanied by a waiter, served each onto my plate.
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BREAD! The darker roll, tasted like a pretzel, yum.

tB3Q3dpqHOeveMlUL32GYA.text: Best service and amazing food. My husband and I came for our anniversary and had a great time with good drinks and food. My sea bass pan seared was cooked to perfection. My husband had the bone in filet which was not only cooked perfect but the flavor  was fantastic. Simple yet flavorful and then the sides just amazing. The Mac and cheese could be a meal in itself with how cheesy and delicious it was. The garlic mash so creamy and almost melted in your mouth. Last but not least their signature desert, butter cake. To die for. Came with home made whipped cream and vanilla ice cream.  Highly recommend this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5rxn3-ur3otwLpeZj0YkEA.text: The food here is pricey, but well worth it. The sides are served family style so you may only need two or three for the whole table. The steaks are perfectly cooked and the cuts of meat are the best of quality.  This particular location offers a cool area to sit in if you are fortunate enough to be seated there. It is a pod-like structure that is in the middle of the hotel atrium. It feels very cool and adds to the experience.  If you are looking to go big, this is a great place to do it!

oT1iemk_FraA_LVZzQvTCQ.text: My wife and I are visiting from Austin for my birthday and wanted to have a special birthday dinner.  I checked reviews in yelp for a good steakhouse and came across this restaurant. I had not heard of it before but when I saw the very high ratings decided to give it a try. All I can say is AMAZING!  The service was excellent!  Make sure you ask for Mike. He was a excellent waiter. He took his time answering all of our questions and his service was prompt and personal. The food was super delicious.  I had the ribeye cooked hard medium. Talk about juicy and full of flavor! I'm a firm believer that a good steak does not need steak sauce and brother let me tell you absolutely no steak sauce needed. Same for my wife, she had a filet (Oscar style). I paired my steak with a grilled lobster tail. OMG, talk about good. For our sides (ala cart) we had the saute asparagus and mashed sweet potatoes. Both very flavorful.  We paired our meal with wine. I had a perfect balanced Summerland Pinot (flavor was heavier than some Pinots but not as heavy as a Cab). My wife had a Jaylor Cab (pretty sure I spelled it wrong). She loved it with the crab and steak.  By the way the crab meat was large whole chunks.  Amazing!  For dessert Mike brought me a smaller version of their butter cake. OMG, OMG!!! I'm a huge chocolate fan and very rarely do I eat anything else, but this cake was phenomenal.  You have to try it.  That's all I will say.   Anyway I hope this helps. You can not go wrong with this restaurant.  Heck, we initially sat behind Shania Twain but moved because other people in her party were a little loud and we wanted a quiet dinner experience.  From what we were told, they always have celebrities visiting.   Forgot to mention that we stayed at the Aria.  Which is right next to the Crystal Shops, where the restaurant is. Check them out too.   Enjoy!

_7FfCztDdoJB0VvaZQmphA.text: My boyfriend took me to Mastro's for a romantic Valentine's date. We were very excited to dine here, but our experience was everything but romantic. We had made a reservation and the hostess was very nice but she gave us the worst table in the house. I know restaurants are very busy on Valentine's but the plastic tables they added to the restaurant (the one we sat at) is very tacky for the ambiance "Mastro's" gives off. We got put in a corner, right next to the server station, where we heard the servers chitter chatter throughout our whole meal, the wooden doors slamming as they grabbed items for tables was very annoying. It was just not the feel my boyfriend and I wanted for a romantic Valentine's. The food itself was very delicious. Our waiter did try and rush us throughout the whole meal. Only had about 5 minutes to eat my appetizer before our main course came to the table. At the end of the day not a great experience, I prefer Ruth Chris for a classy dinning experience.

52jjvATckLGu1AqFwBAl4Q.text: My party of three had the most unpleasant, disappointing experience on Friday evening, August 12, 2016.  My sister and I took my mother out as part of her 85th birthday celebration that weekend.  (I am a member of the Palm but it was closed, and I know Mastro's from Scottsdale.)  Having had wonderful meals all week, I expected nothing less that exceptional service at Mastro's Ocean Club.  We had a lovely experience at the bar, but once seated, the experience went steadily downhill.  Aside from the very perfunctory service by our server, Michael, and some hiccups throughout the meal, the greatest disappointment was the rush to clear our main dinner plates and the placement of dessert plates for what otherwise would have been a surprise birthday cake.  We had to ask for lemon for hands, and when the linens arrived, there was no server to remove them, leaving us to place them on the table.  We waited for the cake, and had a nice little celebration, but then no server came to cut and serve.  I can serve myself at home, but I do not expect to do so when I am dining out. I can't say that Michael was busy as there were several empty table.  Perhaps my expectations were too high as I was expecting the service I experience at Preston's, Dominick's, and Capital Grill.  Mastro's Ocean Club does not come close to even sub-par.

WD3TKYcVhG6SsFONKsSUzQ.text: Mastro's Ocean Club is smack dab in the middle of the Aria City Center mall. Because of  this, the ambiance and setting is not as upscale as the one in Beverly Hills. This place has more of a casual setting to it but most people will dress in their casual Friday attire.  The food was great.. very similar to the food at Beverly Hill location but because of the Ocean Club name, they have more fresh seafood at this location.. I still think that Mastro's excels in steak so unless you don't eat beef, why would you order anything else?  Also, I recommend that you make reservations to this place. When I went, they were not busy (they had like 6 parties dining), they insisted that they were. Make sure you specifically ask to dine in the Treehouse. This is the middle part of the restaurant that overlooks the mall. Anywhere else, and you end up close to the piano, and the piano's volume can get overwhelming.  All in all, Mastro's in Vegas is a good steakhouse. But because of it's prices, I expected it to be a little more on the personal and upscale level. but the fact that it's in the mall makes it seem like they are a more casual restaurant with high prices. I personally prefer the Mastro's in Beverly Hills. If you are a local to Vegas, definitely give this place a try. All of you that did the 4 hour commute to Vegas, drive back and go to the one on Canan in the 90210.

A_EG3svYpsZrhAfhEPA6tQ.text: Amazing service!!!! The food was to die for. I highly recommend me this restaurant. Anytime your in Vegas this spot is a must.

DrfB0r_gNmCACs9mGTBErg.text: Really Nice View and great food. nice break from the strip when it's 9:30 at night and the temperature finally gets down to 99 degrees. lol

lC8srxtPouo_I5ht0mWgUw.text: Drooling to return!!!  Wow...wow...and I mean wow! Far beyond any expectations! Since we were here for a birthday celebration we decided to go all out and order close to everything -can't finish? no prob, mini fridge in hotel room was waiting :) ...and every single dish was pure perfection. The lobster mash was humongous and delish with lots of lobster pieces, meats were tender, fish buttery, service sublime (checked on us without disturbing & smiled when serving), ended with desert to die for. DO NOT skip the warm butter cake, unless you're diabetic or out of your mind.   A rare find of friendly attentive service and food that's worth every dollar! Bravo! I'll be sending everyone I know. Seriously can't wait to return!  ps, You can't miss this place. Swing by if only for a peak at the unusual design. Center of the Crystals shopping center in a spiral treehouse looking architecture.

adSEC8A0QyqjdQioMgQbgQ.text: My first Mastro's experience took place inside the treehouse of the steakhouse chain's Las Vegas restaurant. I had never expected to take the plunge at Mastro's in Vegas, as I have been eyeballing its SoCal locations for years but never had set foot inside.  The verdict? In the overall spectrum of Las Vegas steakhouses, Mastro's was superior to Craftsteak but a significant step down from CUT.   The high point of the meal arrived early in the form of the seafood tower, which was over-the-top but fantastic. In short, the seafood tower here crushes the one at Oceanaire. It's the best reason to have dinner here.  The low point of the meal was my filet. In fact, in an unexpected turn of events, I left feeling as though I should have ordered the salmon instead. Like everyone else at my table did. As for wine, order the duck horn merlot.   Surprisingly, another underwhelming aspect of the meal were the sides. Mastro's take on mac and cheese was a bust compared to CUT. The lobster mashed potatoes were a let down too, especially given the hype and eye-popping price tag. As a salad, I had wanted to order the caprese, which generally is a favorite of mine. Our server talked me into the heirloom burrata instead, which I regretted doing after tasting it.  For dessert, the chocolate cake sounded like the best choice after skimming the menu, but turned out to be dry. The better option was effectively donuts with ice cream. Neither, however, were good enough to recommend with much enthusiasm.

SFGAymRHCsloSSWvwJW2Kg.text: Great restaurant excellent food! big portions, definitely for sharing..

wrsi7anT9JG8BR_DXwXcoQ.text: Staying at the Aria and a small group of us went to Mastros for dinner. No reservation so sat at high top in bar area. I had the griller red snapper which was well prepared. A couple split a filet and other had chop salad and all said great. The cocktails were friendly and plentiful with quick service. I split Mac and cheese with a buddy but we only ate half despite great flavor. A little expensive but would definately do again.

8tnXdojNdseBXJk6SCH-CQ.text: I found Mastro's on Yelp and didn't realize that it was the cool restaurant that looked like it was encased in a cocoon (now known as The Treehouse) when I shopped at the city center a couple of trips back.  I made reservations that day via Yelp and although we waited for about 15 minutes for our 9pm reservations, we were lucky enough to be seated in the Treehouse.  Very cool!    I had the lobster bisque for a starter and the bowl was HUGE!  It filled me up quite a bit and from the mid point on, I wished I had it to share but managed to drink it all.  It was a bit rich so I was kind of done with it before I finished it off but didn't want to waste any of it so I was a trooper and drank it to the last drop.  Chilean sea bass seemed to be the popular recommendation so that's what I ordered for my entree and that was definitely delicious.  It's a good thing I didn't order any sides because those two dishes totally filled me up!  Great place to try and would recommend at least going there once.  It is a bit pricey but I think worth the experience. Next time I go back, I'd like to go back with a whole bunch of people to get their seafood tower.  The table next to us ordered that and it looked really cool.  If not for the food, just to take a picture to post online.  Haha!

vQPQ8gFZgJEdhY9ahbW6Bg.text: Went here for Christmas dinner, very disappointed. Food was not good. Vanilla battered shrimp were outrageously huge (3x the size of jumbo shrimp, might want to note that on the menu) and too thick and chewy for me. I ordered my 8oz filet medium well; the waiter confirmed it would be lightly pink in the center, and it came out charred, crunchy and bone dry. Absolutely terrible.  A proper steakhouse always asks you if the steak was cooked to your liking; my waiter never asked me.   My girlfriend ordered the Chilean sea bass, also overcooked, and she pushed it aside after a few bites.  This place specializes in steak and seafood?  What a joke. Any high class restaurant in Vegas blows this place away, I've eaten at almost all of them. Of all the restaurants in the $100 per person class, I'd rate Mastro's dead last.   Service was good, albeit a little slow. The bright spots of our meal were the pretzel bread and chocolate pudding cake, they were delicious. Dining in the birdhouse was nice, but not worth the terrible food.

lQrWnJqJ3YxiCQPaYQ4F9g.text: The bread was great, and the cocktails were amazing, but that was the extent of it.  I got the scallops, and they were a bit overcooked and really greasy, and they were served on a limp, super greasy piece of what I think was supposed to be garlic bread.  Not sure.  We also got the gnocchi, which was great.  A little rich, but I think that was intentional.  Friends got fish and a sushi roll, both alright, but I expected a lot more out of a place that was charging so much.  Definitely can get better quality, especially in Vegas.

MjJVaHXuroPri3njse1eyQ.text: Best tasting food ever!! The shrimp cocktail are gigantic and delicious! The Caesar salad is very good. The clam chowder is amazing... But the only complaint I have is that either the waiters or the kitchen staff make a lot of mistakes with the steaks... It's either kinda undercooked or overcooked. I asked for a medium rare plus and they gave me a rare. They comped the steak because it was their error but it was just a shame I couldn't enjoy my steak. The butter cake there is amazing!! It's a must try for all!

N7lPQOzkLVVW5t_ttAcv_A.text: This place was unbelievable front the time we walked into the time we left the service was great. The food was perfect  as well. I got a steak that was perfect. The lobster  mashed potatoes were great as well. They are for sure a must try.

-aMf9ReTo_1rLAASQiXUdw.text: Just great....food and service was wonderful....yes...the most famous lobster mash potato was indeed...magnificent !!  it is must try.  The Filet Mignon I had was wonderful as they serve it on a plate that is 400 degree.

tRU5p3n70wvlVTB3YmXFZw.text: I don't say this much.  OMG, this place is amazing.  I was in Vegas with friends, and my buddy said i should try this place out  and i would love it.  i was skeptic at best..  We had a group of 8 and we decided to do family style and order apps.  We ordered the bone marrow, escargot, scallops, and calamari    The bone marrow was okay in my opinion, but everyone loved it on my table.  I would have like some more accompaniment to enhance the flavors.  There was plenty of marrow, bread and  micro greens, and fine sea salt flakes.  It was very rich and flavor, but i had better.  it is still worth it.  The scallops were perfectly pan seared, and it came with a pleasant herb-y butter sauce.  Each bite was amazing and when you are done with the scallops.  The sauce was great for  bread  dipping.  The escargot was good.  it came with the standard butter, garlic and shallots.  T here is probably a few other herbs in there, but we ate them too fast to really look. .   The friend calamari was good and came with two sauce, tartar, and i think a remoulade.  After having the other items, i wasn't too impressed.  This would be a great dish, if it was somewhere else. But we are talking about Mastro's.  The OMG moment was a  bone in petite filet we ordered.  When i first saw it, i was very disappointed when i saw the waiter cut it,  It look raw.  I was thinking how can a place like this, don't know the difference between medium rare and raw.  Boy was i wrong.  The table decide we should try it and not waste it, because we all thought the same thing.  But when i bit into it, it was the most wonderful steak i had in recent memory.  It has a full of flavor, it was season to perfection.  Every bite, i wanted another one.   In the end, i would have fought off the table for the bone.  Lucky for me, no one wanted it.  I love the acidic marinade they used for the steak.  I guess it is a balsamic vinegar marinade.  Man, i want to go back so badly.  Anyway, i don't think i can top anything else in this review.  I have to say the signature pound cake was good, but you must really have a sweet tooth.    Waiters and bus people were amazing and entertaining.  they are here to give you the best experience they can.    so please tip well.  The decor is amazing, just go look at the pictures online.    Now i just want to go to any Mastro's and have that steak again.

c_V_TWGt9WERqE-8z_cfCg.text: We've dined at Mastro's before and was hesitant to go back simply because there are soo many great places in Vegas.  With that said we decided to have drinks and apps this time.  We weren't disappointed!!  I ordered a strawberry lemon drop and my girlfriend ordered a raspberry lemon drop...they were delicious. My husband and his friend ordered the penicillin and they were equally delighted! I didn't order the butter cake this time but it's a MUST!  If you choose to go definitely make reservations particularly if in Vegas on a busy weekend. Bon Appetite!

w8sYAYXKFHiTZKyvks7V6w.text: Excellent everything! The prawns were amazing as was Mastro's mustard sauce.  Highly recommend the seabass and filet.

8hND2gMZRTXmwaFu7fUJPw.text: OK experience.  Not likely to go back given all the other options in Vegas.  Surprised at how strong many of the reviews are.  I feel misled by Yelp on this one.  Service was great.  Ambiance not great.  You are in a shopping mall and you will be starting across the mall at retail stores and shoppers.  Food quality was good, but expensive for ambiance.  Good balance of seafood and steak house.

Dpa93_FroAhVxpS8QSoJag.text: The place is really cool.  Although it opens up to an enclosed high end retail, they do an excellent job of making the place very interesting.   We did that surf and turf for 2 and it was delicious!

gTBMp-6fO-iKQhfgaQi-hw.text: I didn't believe it when I heard the Ribeye was hard to finish.  From my experience, fine dining is hard to get full. This was not the case here. I was warned about the size of the steak and from the menu it was 22oz! That's ridiculous! Even if the bone was about 5oz, that's still a whopping 17oz!  All the servers here are exceptionally knowledgeable and professional. I felt like I was not treated as a kid eating at the adults' table.   We all shared a portion of the lobster mashed potatoes and by far they are the best mashed potatoes I've ever had. I would highly recommend trying this dish.  For my main entree, I ordered the 22oz Ribeye cooked medium rare. Although next time I would probably get rare+, I thought the medium rare was still delicious. The steak was massive and amazingly flavored. By the end of the meal I felt overwhelmed and defeated. I have never been conquered by how much steak there was until Mastro's.  My brain kept telling me to eat more but my stomach fought against this decision.  Overall, Mastro's was a great experience. The steak here, so far, is only second to the Kobe beef I had in Japan. I would definitely come back for seconds.

bpPr2SqChq_RVPVrGDPUdg.text: Believe the hype. This place is worth the hit on your bank account.   They took 5-star dining to a whole new level via a phone call the next day to see how our experience was the night before. Some patrons might not like this unsolicited call, but I didn't mind the show of courtesy.   Must haves: bone-in ribeye, truffle crab gnocchi, and brussel sprouts.   Further proof they're all about customer service: they automatically split our entree in half for us (no split fee). Also, we were apprehensive about ordering the full order of the truffle gnocchi, so our server offered to give us a half portion (for exactly half the price: $16). This was NOT on the menu, and the half order is more than enough for 2 people (I can't imagine how huge the full order must be). If just two of you, I highly recommend you ask for the half portion and order something else.   So, here's a PERFECT meal at this Mastros for 2 people at ~$100 (no alcohol)-  1. Bone-in Ribeye 22oz ($59) 2. Half order of the Truffle Gnocchi ($16) 3. Brussel Sprouts ($11), or whatever other side dish you prefer  That's A LOT of food for 2 people. Trust me. And everything's mindblowing.   Lastly, can another unoriginal idiot please post another unoriginal picture of the restaurant's structure? There aren't enough of them on yelp. Thanks.

VZgvYD3UfEgFz8wE4QZcLg.text: 3 couples seated under the structure in a very nice roundtable(there are few so reserve....) some other larger tables are not as nice....  Tried many plates...  To start, Seafood tower, lobster 5/5 well cooked, shrimp 5/5, crab claws 5/5, oysters...good tower....skip the alaskan crab(here and maybe everywhere not as good imho)  Caesar salad is very, very good here 5/5  Filet mignon 4.5/5  Famous butter cake 5/5 (not always this perfectly good)  Spinach side, broccoli 5/5  Many others ordered fish....chilean sea bass again 5/5.  Others did some crazy blackening to their filet of sole...not as happy.  Hamachi sushi for starters looked good, but it comes with truffle oil(which I hate, though I know many love)  Only complaint is that our waiter seemed a little out of place for the quality of this place, one of those "I know more about food than you because i work here..." not recommended for dealing with some clients in this kinda of restaurant...  Overall, Highly recommended. Will come back, always do!  Nice setting, not the SW as far as luxury or people watching, but quite possibly, even better food!

VKOLip0stCd-HpPqdLbBXg.text: I was so disappointed. I am a huge fan of Mastros and have been to multiple locations over the country. This was the most disappointing experience I've had at a mastros. I got the 8 oz filet, garlic mashed potatoes, and Brussels sprouts. The steak and potatoes were good. The steak was not as tender as normal, which was disappointing. I also found that the Brussels sprouts were not as crispy as they should have been. They could have used a bit more time in the oven. We ended our meal with the warm butter cake, which came out cold. Disappointing....I love when the butter cake is perfectly warm with the cold ice cream. It just wasn't as amazing as it normally is! It was my first time at this location and I'm not sure I will come back. I also just didn't love the atmosphere. Mastros is normally very sultry and romantic. This location seemed to abstract and strangely, too bright. Service was great though!

r7CHvgA34sQ9EkHjQYq6Ow.text: I'm being critical here. The Mastros in Costa Mesa, Ca, is my favorite steak house anywhere. The Mastros Ocean Club in Laguna Beach has an awesome coastal location. This Mastros is in a mall. Enough said.

YJU2SH6DCh0mtsnvRHN_yQ.text: This is our go to restaurant when we are in Vegas!! Now this is a high end steakhouse. You don't want to go to Vegas and not eat here.   Their steaks are delicious!! Cooked exactly how you like. The mashed potatoes and Mac and cheese are must haves!! Can't really say anything about the seafood as I don't eat it. But if you want  a great steak with some delicious sides and some good cocktails with an overall 5 star dining experience then you will like Mastros.   I look forward to eating here again on my next visit!!!

SCun_lwS5yh3EOnpeP7FbA.text: The food was absolutely amazing. Everything was seasoned just right, and it was served nice 'n hot on that 400-degree plate.  If you like cocktails, I highly recommend the dream berry. And if you really want a party in your mouth, top your meal off with their delectable butter cake. You won't be disappointed.

xR3zxigxno0ijeBq_BKb4A.text: It looks like it's all been said before, so I'll keep this short (as much as I can manage) and sweet.    Impressive digs: the sculptural treehouse dining room is a gem.  The bar is impressive (a two story shelf of bottles).    The service is absolutely top notch: when we arrived for our 8:30 pm reservations, the hosts apologized but there was going to be a twenty minute delay.  We weren't bothered at all by the wait, but we were still given glasses of complimentary champagne--and we were treated to the restaurant's signature Warm Butter Cake for dessert.  I have absolutely no complaints about the delay in getting seated.  Mastro's handled a difficult situation appropriately, and in my opinion, went above and beyond for myself and the other guests that were also seated late.  My boyfriend and I went all out for dinner and ordered the seared ahi appetizer as well as the Hamachi with Fried Onions.  Please, oh please make sure you get this.  I've never seen anything like it before.  The perfectly fried onions melt on your tongue like butter, and the hamachi was perfect.  What an amazing combination.  We ordered the Bone-In 12 Oz Filet and the 22 Oz Rack of Lamb with a side of Gorgonzola Mac & Cheese and Roasted Brussels Sprouts.   The proteins were cooked perfectly and were absolutely delicious, but the stand out dish on the table was the flippin' amazing Mac & Cheese.  We talked about it at the restaurant, as we were leaving the restaurant, while we were next door at the Aria casino, on our flight home, and ever since we've been back home.  They are out of this world.  We were so sad that we weren't able to take home the leftovers.  Dessert: what hasn't been said about the Warm Butter Cake already?  Just get it already.  This place is spendy--and totally worth every penny.

Ty9GiprA8QRphIyfVd533Q.text: This restaurant is truly exquisite in every detail. The food preparation is always perfection times 10. Ask for George, the epitome of a White Tux - extemely gracious waiter!

vhLBPSSvWOl7Yif1VND3OA.text: We recently dined here for my husband's birthday. Having been at the Mastro's in Scottsdale, we knew what to expect: tasty appetizers, good drinks, and even better steak, so we were excited to check out this location.  The restaurant itself is in a unique setting: inside the high-end Crystal mall in the ARIA in a wooden tree house sculpture - pretty unique! I will say that having dinner while being able to look out at the Fendi & Louis Vuitton store did seem to downplay the high-end feel of this restaurant and it made me really annoyed (I know, hater) at all the women walking around with their Chanel & Prada shopping bags.  We were promptly seated outside of the tree house in the booths and as usual, service was second to none. They were aware of the gluten-free dining note on our Open Table reservation and brought me the Gluten Free Menu which is pretty large and almost mirrors the regular menu with a few exceptions and some alterations.  Large signature cocktail, beer and wine menu - I liked that they denoted which cocktails were gluten free as this is usually a place in the gluten-free menus restaurants ignore. Stunning and colorful bar - my husband liked the large selection of craft beers as well. The two TVs flanking the bar though did seem out of place.  For a starter, the shrimp cocktail is a great choice: presentation is really cool with the dry ice vapor, the shrimp are HUGE and the sauce is good. For an entree, I went with the filet. Instead of their regular rub which contains gluten, they will season it with salt & black pepper. It was a huge portion (had I known, I would have ordered the small filet) and it was cooked well and they even did a butterfly cut to ensure it cooked through. I also ordered a side of green beans with sliced almonds - tasty & fresh however, there were no almonds...   Our waiter was extremely friendly and knowledgeable and did a great job of checking up on us despite a busy Saturday night.  He was even nice enough to bring out some chocolate covered strawberry with whipped cream on the house to celebrate my husband's birthday which was even more thoughtful because he made sure it was a dessert I could eat given my gluten-free diet.  We had an awesome time, with superb food and drinks and top of the line service. Would highly recommend for a nice dinner, but be prepared to spend at least couple of hundred dollars on this indulgence!

98b4XK6cFz6e9truiCqQWQ.text: Most amazing place we've eaten, all around. Good thing to note, they offer a generous military/LE discount. Absolutely loved everything about our visit. I had the 12oz filet, wedge salad, garlic mashed potatoes, clam chowder, chocolate covered strawberries, and a glass of Hess Cabernet. Everything is a la carte, with large portions. I would say the cost is equivalent to most steakhouse prices, but Mastro's has great sized portions and amazing quality. We highly recommend the Las Vegas location and will be visiting the New Port Beach location for our next date night. Hoping to have another wonderful dinner in NPB very soon!

i-OZiX4lS6Rb_umdCTAFQQ.text: Had the chocolate pudding. Loved it. So delicious. Definitely very rich. One portion enough for two. Environment and service were great too.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oFAdr7mQlSETph3glq-W2w.text: Excellent restaurant. Truly classy dining experience and the butter cake lived up to the hype. Perfect restaurant to spend my husbands 40th birthday.

BWkGlIRYsIVjRFU5MhvZ2w.text: Excellent service and amazing food! Wish i could eat here more often. Best appetizers and everything is cooked perfectly. And the butter cake is wow

HQFHjMQmNiohz61ss81VzA.text: Came here to celebrate my bday with my fiancee. The food was amazing! I got the 22oz. Rack of lamb and my fiancee got the bone in rib eye steak. The most tender steak i have ever tasted, since i took a piece from her plate. But aside from the food, the service here is the best service we've ever had by the WHOLE staff specially our waiter George who attended us like royalty. Thanks George. And thank you to the pretty girl at the front desk who my fiancee asked for a pic in the front entrance and she did without a hesitation. Great experience here!!

G1u0-mMQtD8Lej9EuobmAg.text: Had a birthday dinner for my twin cousins who came to town. Great wine list. Excellent service. Our entire party (5 people) was pleased from beginning to end of the meal. Is this a place to come everyday? Nope (though I'd love to be able to afford it). Is it a place for a special occasion? Absolutely. I've been fortunate enough to eat here a few times on a corporate dime, and a few times on my own. It's always been a very good experience. Get a steak, some shrimp, and finish with pecan pie or butter cake (or in our case, both) and you will come way stuffed and pleased.

Tth2_irqoXxpdK74rMZGUA.text: I used to always walk by this place during undergrad thinking... "Man will i ever make enough to be able to eat at this place?" I still don't but pulled the trigger one night before watching the game of thrones concert. Call it an off night which i'm sure it definitely was because I really wasn't all that impressed with the service or the food.  ***Since this is a $$$$ restaurant, i'm gonna be much more critical so please don't think i'm being pompous***  Service: A beautiful wood hive embodies the restaurant as its worker bees hustle to make amazing food with beyond satisfactory service is the impression at first glance but upon being seated my plate had a long strand of hair waiting for me. Waiter was prompted and merely switched it out without any real apologetic notion. "ohh oops... is this your first time here?" I expected more of "My dear this is absolutely unacceptable, please excuse this avoidable mistake." Our server was a middle aged man with what sounded like a scottish accent seemed a bit perplexed maybe it was his first few shifts working here but didn't represent the valor of "Mastros" that I have heard so much about. The wait staff was efficient in clearing plates and refilling our waters. I ordered my rack of lamb medium rare and it came out quite rare. The server was accommodating to take the piece back to have it more evenly cooked.   Food: Calamari was pretty standard compared to other calamari I have had at other restaurant. The Lobster bisque was definitely the highlight of the night, Full pieces of lobster claw and meat in my soup that was genuine since I was interrupted by a piece of shell in my mouth as I was enjoying this otherwise wonderful soup. Garlic mashed potatoes was standard and the gorgonzola mac & cheese was good but a bit thick with al dente macaroni. I was hoping for mac & cheese more on the soft buttery cheesy side but the cheese was quite solidified. Rack of lamb was excellent but make sure you order it medium and no more rarer than this. By the end of the meal we were too full to get dessert which I know they are famous for but at this point I wasn't to impressed with dinner.   Overall: I really can't say if i'll give this place a chance. I'm not big into fancy restaurants unless the occasion calls for it and the next special night I have i'll probably end up going to one of my favorite spots in Vegas, Echo and Rig.

_6i88wp1JzemdTGtZeR8xQ.text: Good food , great customer service, beautiful location, nice atmosphere but damn well pricey.   You will pay for each and every second you spend inside the place :)  PS: the bread is delicious

WYjOz26lpzKi0uNeNgvbsw.text: The most underwhelming $707 dinner of my life.   Nothing was terrible per say but nothing was great either. My rib eye was flavorless which was most disappointing.  2 stars for atmosphere and service.

wAKDxJRpWFgwHLPl-UoBtQ.text: After being disappointed at their Scottsdale location we decided to eat at this one and were glad we did.   Her filet was cooked a perfect medium, mine was a medium when I asked for medium rare. But once I tried it, I didn't care, it was sooo good.   Creamed spinach and mushrooms were both delicious.   I wish you could order a split side instead of having to order two separate ones. It's just too much food, but I get it.

hbJtr3OHI5-5RwOruFg5ww.text: The appetizing cuisine offerings at this restaurant were absolutely wonderful. Enjoyed a delectable steak, calamari , crab legs, and the strawberry shortcake brought out for my husband's birthday was to die for. Had a wonderful outing  catching up with friends and enjoyed the cuisine and exciting atmosphere. Service was great, was kind of surprised when asked if we all wanted butter on our steak ended up coating 60.00. Be aware of thia when asked, as it was not disclosed. Not a huge deal, but come on butter for 60.00,  really? Other than that, enjoyed our dinner, pleasant ambiance, and hanging out with friends.

Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best strawberry shortcake ever!
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Appetizing side orders

6sEcfhBfRjMQxPoWfjDP7g.text: This place is so good and totally worth the Vegas prices (note that you will probably spend about $100 per person). From reading many Yelp reviews, I developed a strategy. Share one of the bigger steaks with one person (because it's cheaper that way) and then split the sides with everyone. You will be super full - unless you love steak so much that you just have to have your own. I think the way most people do it is that they order their main dish - whether it be steak or seafood - and then you order a bunch of sides that the servers split and put on your plate.  We came with a party of six, and so here's what we got:   - I split a 12 oz filet with one other person, and they will totally plate it for you if you tell them you are splitting it. Two of my other friends split the 16 oz bone-in. And one of our friends got their special wagyu steak. I will say that I'm not a super huge fan of steak, but the steak here was cooked perfectly, seasoned well, and the wagyu was incredible. Best steak I've ever eaten - the perfect ratio of fat and meat made it just melt in your mouth.   - Lobster Mashed Potatoes: We were on the fence about this side dish because some of the reviews were meh about it. However, I'd say get it! The big chunks of lobster in the creamy mashed potatoes makes it so delicious. If you like lobster and mashed potatoes, definitely go for this dish. They put quite a bit of lobster in here - hence the hefty price tag of $35.   - Alaskan Crab Truffle Gnocchi: This is super delicious as well. The gnocchi is soft and pillowy the way it's supposed to be and the truffle flavor is perfect. I didn't really get pieces of crab in the serving I got, but I know the crab was in there.   - Brussel Sprouts: This was the only dish that was actually not done well to me. I like my brussel sprouts with a bit of caramelization and soft on the inside. Some of these just tasted incredibly burnt and the flavor wasn't great. I would pass on this as a side next time.   - Mac & Cheese: This mac & cheese was pretty excellent. The noodles were cooked perfectly and it was amazingly cheesy. It was so cheesy that it did that stringy cheese thing when the server put it on our plate. A classically delicious side!   For dessert, we listened to the rave reviews and got the butter cake. And you know what, it was underwhelming to me. I like desserts that are lighter and less sweet, especially after we got such a crazy rich meal. The warm butter cake is extremely rich, it comes with a dollop on ice cream on top and a side of whipped cream. It is more than enough to share between six people, especially after the meal we had. I personally thought it was too rich and sweet, but enough people have raved about it on here that you should give it a try.   The service here is very good. I especially appreciate that our server stopped us from getting two sides of the gnocchi. He thought it would be wayyy too much food for us and he was totally right. All in all, this was an incredibly rich and decadent meal and totally delicious. I would definitely come back again for some of the things we got.

P6gZ8GzfUGb_Ci0hW0bEsQ.text: Had dinner last night. Liz was fantastic and food was amazing. Highly recommend. Great location and service and food here is always top notch.

wAvz_qa_dEx2HuL_NjWFpQ.text: Way long overdue review of this fine establishment. Fine dining at its best. Hubby and I had our honeymoon last year from here. We enjoyed every moment of our visit.  The food and service is amaze balls. If you are a steak lover like I'am. Then this place is for you. It's super ultra expensive. I had my New York Strip steak for $57.00 alone. Yes alone meaning you have to order sides for extra cost. But mind you! You are getting the very best in high quality meat. So expect to pay that much.   The sides comes out in family style in small platters. So you can take out what amount you want.   The wait staff pays attention to detail about you're visit. The waiters aren't overbearing. Always ask to be seated in the birds nest for an amazing experience. The architecture of the birds nest is truly magical.   Five stars all around.   Go get you're steak now.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The architecture of the birds nest. Ask to be seated inside.
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Enjoying the moment.
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy Couple.

ua1quG-jT8OlNH8ZA_itag.text: By far the best dining experience I have ever had. LR and his team were amazing!! The food was mind blowing! For appetizers we had caviar, king crab cocktail, crab cakes and smoked salon. Entrees we did family style and had the sea bass, blackened halibut, bone in rib eye (18oz), twin lobster tails, Gorgonzola Mac and cheese, king crab truffle gnocchi, sea salt and vinegar fries and asparagus. Everything was amazing! Even the wine was delicious! We started with a Duckhorn Merlot from the coravin section and ended with another red that I can't remember because I was mesmerized by the food. Thank you for the amazing experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xpI7XsxIzk0TIVwyLq7BaQ.text: I am not a steak connoisseur as I rarely eat red meat, but I did try my boyfriends rib eye when we ate here for his birthday and OH MY GOODNESS was it incredible! It was perfectly cooked as a "medium rare" steak as he requested, and it was melt in your mouth quality. I only have one other fancy steakhouse restaurant to compare it to and that's Ruth Chris' Steakhouse....And I would say this is better. The buttercake dessert is also to die for even though you might literally die from a heart attack from it because I'm sure it's not the healthiest thing out there, but it is sooo worth cheating any diet to try it! Again, I rarely eat red meat and I freaking love the steak here and believe that this may have been the greatest thing I've ever tasted. The texture and taste are both on point. I definitely want to come back!!!

tQO33YdoE54Nd8gAYhA_QQ.text: The first time I dined at one of the Mastro's was over 5 years ago in SoCal.  I was with co-workers celebrating a huge case and were told to expense our entire meal.  My first experience was over-the-top due to the amount of money that was spent for dinner, desserts, beers, and alcohol.  I never had the chance to try Las Vegas' Mastro's until recently.   We were celebrating Valentine's Day a couple of days before the actual day to avoid the crowds.  We arrived about 10 minutes before our reservation and was immediately seated. Service throughout our entire dinner was as good as expected from a place like Mastro's.  We were served bread pretty much as soon as we sat.  The entire bread basket was very good.  The bread basket consist of a dinner bread, garlic bread, and pretzel bread. The basket had two of each, which is perfect if you're sharing with just one other person.  I ordered the 8 oz. filet and it was marvelous.  It's so lean, tender, and enough to keep me satisfied for a few hours.  We also shared the twice baked potato and this was a beast.  It's huge and a half serving is equivalent to most restaurant's full sized potato.  The highlight of the evening had to be dessert.  I have steak all the time and have to admit that I was looking forward to their Signature Warm Butter Cake the whole evening.  The dessert is really simple....just a butter cake, ice cream, strawberry drizzle, and heavy whipped cream.  Every part of this dessert was amazing.  Trust me, the Signature Warm Butter Cake is worth the trip to Mastro's.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 8 oz. Filet &amp; Twice Baked Potato
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mel C was here!
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mastro &#39;s Signature Warm Butter Cake

P1khZU_8hzAYc1E59z9XZw.text: Our waiter by the name of Craig was THE WORST server EVER. He was VERY rude and did not make myself and husband feel cared about at all. He took literally 5-10 to just come over and greet us and when he did he didn't let us know about any specials, whether it was our first time here or not, etc he just asked if he wanted to start off with water and walked off. He came back maybe 10 min later and then asked us if we wanted a cocktail and at that point we were already ready to order. When we ordered he was very short and not pleasant. He grabbed the menus and left and never came back over until when our food had arrived and asked how everything looked and never came back over to check on us until the end when he asked if we wanted dessert. At this point my blood was boiling because I've been to mastro's Plenty of times in Los Angeles and what stands out about them is not just their delicious steaks but also their superb customer service. Craig then came back with the bill even though we didn't even ask for it and instead placing the bill on the table he slid it over to us on the table and walked off. No thank you very much enjoy the rest of your evening. I left him no tip which was very hurtful because I'm always generous when I tip for great service. We thought at first maybe he was like that because he was having a bad day, but we watched how he interacted with his other tables and it was complete night and day. To be honest, our real waiter was the bus boys, they were more attentive to use than Craig was. The only reason why I know why his name is Craig is because I had to look on my receipt. Never like to play the race card, but just simply put: Craig had a PROBLEM with waiting on a black table. Mastro's I'm sooo upset with you, and Craig I hope you never have anyone make you feel the way that you made me and my husband feel #blackisbeautiful  I just feel that if you're going to spend quite a bit of money for great food, then the service should be EXCELLENT. I did end up speaking to one of the managers name Dan and yes I do feel that he listened to what I had to say, but at the same time I feel that he was kind of defending Craig by saying he's been a server for years there and he's never had a complaint. Kinda hard to believe

CE2Ni1jJLBSFQ7yGXIUi-g.text: Another bookmark that took us a while to check off, Mastro's Ocean Club is located at the Crystals Shops.  We celebrated Valentine's Day two days early to avoid all the crowds on the actual day.  We arrived at the appointed reservation time and were seated promptly in the "birds' nest" area of the restaurant.  All I've heard from friends about Mastro's centers around the Signature Warm Butter Cake dessert and we did have that, but first, dinner.  After perusing the menu and hearing the options available, I settled on surf and turf with the petite filet mignon (6 oz.) Oscar-style with crab meat and Bearnaise sauce.  According to our waiter, the meat of two large crab legs comes with the filet and when it was served, this did actually seem to be the case.  The dish was just the perfect size for me, plus we shared a large twice-baked potato.  Service throughout our meal was attentive, but not cloyingly so:  our glasses were never empty for long.  Oh, I forgot to mention the bread basket that came to the table first:  a carb lover's dream! We counted three different kinds of bread:  pretzel bread, garlic bread, and sourdough with the pretzel bread being my definite favorite.   As I mentioned, we finally got to try the famous butter cake served with a big scoop of vanilla ice cream and whipped cream on the side:  heavenly!   Mastro's is definitely a wonderful choice for a special occasion when you want to spoil yourselves.

N9VgJy32B86jNjuENDeCfQ.text: Described in one word...EXCELLENT!  My wife and I celebtated our anniversary. We wanted to go somewhere we had never tried before. After asking many people we decided on Mastros. We asked to be seated in the tree house. They went out of their way to do this for us (Saturday night in Vegas and March Madness)not an easy request. Started at the bar for cocktails, staff was great and they pour them STIFF. The food was fabulous to say the least, but the staff was the True star. Very involved in our experience and wanting it to be a perfect night for us. They all took the time to engage with us and have a little fun. GREAT JOB MASTROS. Locals dining on the strip usually feel like just another one of the herd, but not at Mastros. You were on point and for that you have earned two new loyal customers.
