Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dm-I7oQKWIj2y1bhb2ogWg.text: I enjoyed my dining experience! The atmosphere is very intimate and the architecture is beautiful. You are situated in a treehouse overlooking the Crystals shopping mall.... my steak was perfectly cooked and the mashed potatoes were to die for! A little pricey for what you get but you're paying for the experience, my server was very knowledgeable and offered plenty recommendations! I will be back to celebrate many more special occasions!

3CjCCkxqlC99VqtgilmT1A.text: Made dinner reservations for Saturday night at 8pm to celebrate our birthdays.  Once we arrived (just before 8), we were promptly seated, and then almost immediately greeted by our server.  We were told about the specials, given the wine list, and then a basket of warm bread was delivered to the table.  We started with Oysters Rockefeller and a Caesar Salad.  Dinner was the salmon for me, and rack of lamb for my husband with sauteed broccoli as a side.  Everything was delicious, and spaced out to where we did not feel rushed what so ever.  Not only was the food top notch, so was the service.  In fact, due to the fact that we were celebrating birthdays, the brought us a complimentary piece of the 5 layer chocolate cake with fresh whip cream that was to die for!  Thank You Maestros for making our birthday celebration wonderful!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LQEYAYdeVG5-0lYACR2fEg.text: My family and I love going to nice steak houses in town and this is by far my favorite! They go above and beyond every time.. I recently went there for my birthday and they made sure my night was perfect! Great customer service all around! This place is a must!

yh_wawgTdatxQQKfuGazSQ.text: Still outstanding.  Seafood, expertly prepared served in a contemporary tree house in the middle of the desert.  It never gets old.   All this from a chain restaurant.  The fish version of a steakhouse.  Large filet cuts of fresh fish, simply seasoned and grilled.  No swimming in sauces, no embellishments on the plate.  Sides, like at a steakhouse are ordered separately and meant to be  shared.  The food; this isn't a sushi restaurant or a steakhouse.  Nuff said.  Classic cold starters from perfectly cooked and chilled jumbo (U8) shrimp, sweet chunks of Dungeness crab leg meat, chunks of just cooked through lobster all served with a zesty cocktail sauce are all excellent.    For something warm, the sauteed day boat sea scallops, ocean candy.  Perfect sear, mid rare, enhanced with a bit of butter and squeeze of lemon.  Also consider sharing the Vanilla battered lobster (a main).  Sounds weird, but the vanilla imparts an indescribable flavor that heightens the oceanic sweetness of the lobster.  The light tempura style batter provides a hint of textural contrast.  Mains are all about the fish.  The Scottish salmon, simply seasoned and grilled medium is outstanding.  Loaded with creamy fat that carries the unmistakable sweet flavor of salmon.  The flavor goes on and on.  The Crusted Chilean sea bass cooked medium well is equally good.  Large flakes of moist, tender flesh oozing oceanic fattiness.     Save room for sides.  The lobster mashed potatoes remains excellent.  Seemingly more lobster than potato.  Perfectly cooked, large chunks of lobster enveloped in a buttery, mash, whole claws thrown in for good measure.  Sinfully delicious.  The Alaskan king crab black truffle gnocchi, wow.  50 percent sweet king crab meat, 50 percent pillowy gnocchi in a delicate cream sauce imbued with black truffle oil and bits.  Aggressively seasoned but it works to heighten the umame finish that makes whatever piece of grilled fish accompanying it explode with flavor.  Very good wine program.  Typical Vegas resort markup.  Excellent steakhouse (I know) service.  Sometimes simple is best.

e0bmhmpmUNCgb67pda0CUg.text: I made reservations a few days in advance.  I dressed up to go to dinner but many people were dressed casual wearing shorts and flip flops.  Ronald was our waiter for the evening.  I ordered the mussels and mashed potatoes.  They were really good.  The serving of mashed potatoes is enough to feed several people. The broth for the mussels was seasoned and not too salty.  I loved the lemon that was served in bags to catch the seeds.  The salmon was good but it could have used more flavoring.  My key lime martini was the most I have ever paid for a cocktail but I got two drinks out of the shaker and it was delicious.  For dessert the butter cake was very sweet but I saved half and ate it the next day.  The gigantic dish of whipped cream served with it is impossible to eat!  The tree house was interesting to dine in.  I wish Mastro's had a location in the Southeast so I could celebrate there more than once a year.

N07CIxBAtqYttH3QHehXow.text: I felt like we were eating in a spaceship with the extrordinary architectural design of this restaurant. Once the food started to come, you completely forgot about everything else except the STEAK.  The tomahawk steak is a gigantic rib eye with the RIB still attached and it is HUGE!  I split it with someone and still only could eat half of my half.  But that half...oh my! Tender, tasty and cooked perfectly.  The sides were decadent with the lobster mashed potatoes and the ever yummy mac and cheese.  My favorite side?  brussel sprouts! Amazing, just try them.  And for dessert, even though we couldn't eat anymore, the butter cake. Unbelievable.

a5rogMblUTr2lGCzMMfbKA.text: To whom it may concern, This is the worst dinning experience my wife and I have ever endured!  The evening was a special anniversary that was a complete let down with service, atmosphere and quality of dishes. From BAD placement, to RUDE servers and in the middle a very apologetic manager offering to move us from the table which was next to the buss boy/server station, where they made comments about the dinning guests and used foul language. To start the evening, we where staying at THE HOTEL and I had called ahead for reservations and informed the receptionist that it was a special occasion.On arriving  the young lady/Maitre d asked if it was a special evening and after answering YES she states she has a very special table for us! She then placed us next to the servers station when the restaurant was empty. The waiter came to our table and was RUDE, the food was HORRIBLE/ SUB PAR , we had the halibut special and the whole evening was one we will try to forget. We live in Paradise Valley, Az. and have been to the Mastro's  and Ocean Club here. I WARN everyone this Las Vegas restaurant is nothing like the others STAY AWAY. SPEND your money somewhere else. So SAD !!

Pot92SeHdN4_lq_0lfWCrg.text: I have been here once, I have not one thing to complain about! The food was delicious, hot, and cooked well. Servers were so friendly, and willing to explain everything on the menu. everything is so over priced, but the atmosphere and amazing, its inside the Aria Hotel, cant complain would go back!

DhbeJxBl8aPmZWfGCPxU8g.text: This will always be my favorite place to eat & eill continue to be but, When I asked about the steak sauces and got a full description at the tail end or beginning I feel the waiter should've used the words, " At an additional cost or for a fee".  He said nothing.  So when I saw the $5 which is nothing really but I was annoyed.  In my profession I am require to tell clients everything I know.  The asparigus I chose said "Sauteed".  Which means to mean with butter and so it was but also with garlic.  Un-smiley face, I was hoping to kiss my date after words not after that little secret they brought to my plate. I forgot how far away the table was I missed my date he was so far away.  Ha Ha.....The food was delicious as always and I will be a fan.  I just didn't like all of the things I felt I could've been told & was not. Oh, well next time I will be prepared for surprises that's all.

BwsfpCdEbHY0LysSTICGTg.text: Love this restaurant! We had a wonderful experience there. Top-notch service and great food. Came here last week with my sister and my bf. We made reservation for 7:30 but we were about 15 mins late. The staff were really nice and didn't make us wait for our seats. We were seated almost immediately. Right when we were seated, the server asked us if we cared for any drinks and offered us a warm towel to wipe our hands with. He also explained EVERYTHING on the menu which I thought was awesome.   My sister and I ordered two cocktails ($18/each for the cocktails) and we shared the salmon as a main course. For appetizer we had the escargot and oysters on the half shell. My bf ordered the filet mignon ($50+) but it was really tender and cooked to perfection. We also had the lobster mashed potatoes which I thought was great. The bill came out to be over $250 but I think it was well worth it for the great food, atmosphere and service.  I would suggest requesting for a seat inside the birdnest because every table is separated with a glass so it's very unique.

tYUQk2-4z9yia3F-UTYC1g.text: A perfect meal in Vegas! Although the wait was over an hour long, we immediately found a table in the bar which turned out to be more intimate than any of the tables in the dining room. Service was prompt; the waitress delightful and extremely knowledgeable. This was literally the best meal I have ever shared with my boyfriend of nearly a year. Each item was split and served on two plates in perfect presentation: the heirloom tomato salad, the blackened halibut. The brussel sprouts and lobster mash potatoes were of plenty proportions - and the mash had the most perfect creamy flavor with an abundance of lobster. The variety of breads were served warm with soften tabs of butter. Ever staff person was attentive. The drinks, a pomegranate martini and cucumber cooler, were a homerun. I've never tasted something better in my life. If I had the room, I know the butter cake would kick butt of any cake I ever ate (I'm going back today to make sure). And the coffee served at the end of the meal was the testament that the entire meal was EPIC. Thank you Mastro!

rfPQ45kTxZi_NSoS-8_w7g.text: THE best food I've ever had. Filet, white fish special, lobster mash, truffle gnocchi... Service was on point. Very classy. We planned a proposal in the treehouse and it was perfect

ITsTxKOSQNUMbxtaGRDphQ.text: Had an excellent evening out with friends at mastro's.   This is my second time here and both times it's been above my expectations.  It's got a somewhat more casual feel than a lot of the fancier places, which I like.  One of the better steaks I've had in Vegas for sure.

Ab1PXvnL2hc_WAx0dEgyRg.text: This is a really fun night out - the steak is served on a sizzle plate in a beautiful pool of butter. The last time I came the cocktails come with a shaker with maybe 2 refills in it (whaaa). And the piano player is crooning Jason Mraz songs, and the service is bright and sunny. You're sitting in a little wood bauble in the middle of a high end shopping mall and it's one of those "only in Las Vegas" sort of things.

-M91eyeGmKZStuqUqBJypA.text: It's not that we had a bad experience at Mastro's. But for what we paid I was expecting a bit more. The bread basket was good, but not dazzling. The tomato and mozzarella salad we shared wasn't memorable. In fact, for burratta mozzarella it wasn't good at all. I thoroughly enjoyed my bone-in filet which made up for the salad. The side of mashed potatoes was decent but not outstanding, same goes for the side of peas we shared. Mostly we went because the location was conveniently close to the Aria, where we stayed, and because after seeing the tree house on a previous visit to Vegas I desperately wanted to eat there. Being in the tree house wasn't the best experience. It's loud, since you are in the middle of the Crystal's mall. All in all, it was decent but overpriced in my opinion. I probably won't be returning to this Mastro's location.

fYjwnsVu4MbYg3-mPEN5oA.text: I went there to check out the venue for a private dinner.  The waitress was attentive and cordial.  The manager really turned my head because he called me after the meal with our small party.  What attentiveness!  The seafood tower was great as was the fish.  The steak delish~~~

SIb2gQnq7AtcSn9ppBWqpQ.text: Came here a couple weeks ago with my girlfriend and had absolutely the best seafood I have had in a long time.  We started off with a couple cosmos which are my favorite at the Ocean Club because they seem to be never ending and they use dry ice to keep it exceptionally cold!  For our entree we chose the seafood tower (see pic) which was amazing and a ton of food!  After that we could not eat anything more except desert and our waitress Shauna told us the Butter Cake could not be beat and she was right.  I would definitely recommend  Mastro's Ocean Club for a fine dining experience... the service is spectacular, the food is spectacular and the restaurant is very cool.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood Tower

wcbEsTjwk-Gn01tfex_cZA.text: I was really expecting a fabulous dinner but I was truly disappointed. For an appetizer I ordered the sauteed shrimp. It was very good. I had the lobster tails for dinner. They were a bit over cooked and not sweet at all. For the price that was charged they should have been perfect. After reading the reviews of the butter cake, I was looking forward to it. Their desserts are so large that as one person I couldn't order it :(.

FFCo0dfvuHDy4YXUZEQB9g.text: Delicious food period. I take all my visitors for a meal here so I can gloat that I have this fantastic place in my town. Lobster and steaks supreme. Just love the food...getting hungry writing this. Go here for sure!

TxKDhsQc1T57ZqJ1KdvOSQ.text: Have you ever been called a day later from a restaurant you ate at the night before? Yeah, me neither- until I ate at Maestro's Ocean Room.  It was like a one night stand you want to call you again. Real classy joint. The whole family went to Vegas for Christmas. Since we are Jews, we decided to forego the stereotypical Chinese food and step it up a bit.  We were looking for a nice steakhouse and we were torn between Craft Steak or Maestros- Since we were staying at Vdara, Maestro's was closer.  Thank goodness- hands down best steak I've ever had. Even my picky eater girls loved it. I had the filet- melted in my mouth like butter.  We ordered the mussels, crab claws, bone marrow, salmon, broccoli, sweet potato fries, spinach- I don't normally eat seafood but I was so stuffed and satisfied when I left- I'll let you make the one night stand joke this time. EAT HERE.

8kZR_335i0WS7yCGAZHQNg.text: Great steaks, fantastic pretzel bread, the freshest fish (my wife swears by the crab cocktail appetizer) and of course the out of this world butter cake. What a fantastic meal up in the "birds nest" at City Center.  Still prefer the Newport Beach location but when in Vegas . . .

xyeRNYJddZxuRjqltOQn8Q.text: It's restaurant week in Vegas. Saw Mastro's was participating.  Great deal for $50 per person.  I recommend the Mambo salad.  Really unique ask about it. Enjoyed the 8ounce filet, it was perfect! Mine and my wife's. Med rare!  I usually order bone in steaks for the extra flavor, but wow this really had a lot of flavor and didn't taste over seasoned. I we be back and can hardly wait until the newest location opens in Palm Desert Ca. In November!   Keep up the good work. You are tops in my book!!!!!

tKlpjDqE33kek3ZWAjsNDg.text: We went to Mastro's for my friend's birthday dinner.  We were all impressed with the staff - they were very friendly and accommodating (we were 30 minutes late for our reservation).  Our waiter was attentive and made sure we all had our drinks and that the food was to our liking.  Speaking of the food, we loved EVERYTHING!  A few of us ordered steaks (that were cooked to perfection and melted in your mouth!!)  Some ordered fish and they raved about their dishes.  We shared a variety of sides including asparagus (steamed and sauteed), lobster mashed potatoes, creamed spinach, and king crab gnocchi (which was out of this world!!!!!)     Bottom line, it's definitely worth a visit.  We will be going back next time we are in Vegas.

zC4YUJiJ0wgqdNWYLrB7CQ.text: Visited for lunch last year.  Food quality is fantastic.  Great cocktail menu.  Would definitely try dinner when I have the chance.  Service was great, but restaurant was not busy when I was there.  The Beef Carpaccio as a starter is wicked!!  Big wine list also!!

eRlA6RFla4G8T6HMRVcl5Q.text: Diane and I enjoyed another night here with friends, where golden Fried Calamari with Sweet Chili Oil and Spicy Aoli and Vanilla Battered Shrimp served as very nice starters, along with a complimentary bread basket.  Once all the great Pretzel Bread had been consumed, I asked for more, and we received an entire basket of Pretzel Bread to accompany the remainder of our meal.   Then I indulged in a bowl of smooth and creamy, potato-chunk-laden bowl of Clam Chowder, while Diane waxed euphoric over her bowl of Lobster Bisque with a generous dollop of Creme Fraiche.  An excellent small House Salad with Bleu Cheese Dressing was not that small, and surprised me with an unexpected, large cooked Breaded Shrimp lying on top of the mixed greens.  Now for the entrees!  Never tiring of vanilla battered crustaceans, Diane ordered a Vanilla Battered Lobster Tail along with a Steamed Lobster Tail for her main, both of which she very much liked.  A Twice Baked Potato remained untouched until it was boxed and enjoyed by her for lunch at a later date.  Although I usually make it a point to order steak at a steak house, this time I was in the mood for another treasure of the sea.  So I uncharacteristically ordered Grilled New Zealand King Salmon, accompanied by Roasted Brussels Sprouts and French Fried Potatoes.  The Salmon was moist and all I hoped for; the Brussels Sprouts perfectly al dente; and the crisp French Fries hot and enormous in quantity.  Half of the Fries were taken home to be eaten for lunch the next day.  For dessert I opted to slim things down with an order of Mixed Seasonal Berries (Strawberries, Raspberries, and Blueberries), only to then balloon up the calories and sugar intake by finding it difficult to resist the bowl of Homemade Whipped Cream which accompanied this dish.  Meanwhile one of my tablemates pronounced the Creme Brulee the best she had ever had.  Service by multiple servers was exemplary, and the atmosphere inside the nest overlooking The Shops at Crystal classy and somewhat romantic.  Another great dinner at Mastro's!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vanilla Battered Lobster Tail and Steamed Lobster Tail
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled New Zealand King Salmon

mO75ME3CSqYKKjeazcdQVA.text: Mastro's is located in the Crystals Shoppes next to the Aria! There is limited seating so it's best to have a reservation. The bone-in rib eye is one of my favorites here. I love a good char. It's 22 ounces so beware of over ordering.   Do I even have to mention the warm butter cake? It's a must! Beautiful atmosphere, great drinks, excellent service.

ic4vYq4dsmDcyWmHeyvCtw.text: Omfg I love Mastro's. Although it's a chain restaurant, I really love the consistency regardless of the location you dine at. I've been to the Beverly Hills and Costa Mesa locations before trying this one. And all I have to say is LOBSTER. MASHED. POTATOES. I could eat that everyday (if it wouldn't make me gain 19362916392 lbs from the delicious cream and butter they make it with).   We came here for my bestie's bday and interesting enough didn't order a single steak. Hah! I love a good steak, but their seafood is actually so yummy too. Here's what we got:  - CAESAR SALAD: there's no Caesar salad like a steakhouse Caesars salad. I swear it's so freaking delicious and made with real anchovies and I just want to eat this every single day. 10/10  - OYSTERS ROCKEFELLER: tbh this isn't my favorite dish, but that's not a Mastro's issue. I didn't care for it in culinary school when I was introduced to it, and I don't really care for it now. BUT my bestie wanted to try it. Mastro's wasn't bad, but all I could taste was the Parmesan (we also had to get it without any meat they typically add - my bestie is a pescatarian). Comes with 6 oysters. 7/10  - HAMACHI WITH CRISPY ONIONS: ahh this was so tasty. It was a light addition to our apps. It's thin pieces of hamachi topped with a ponzu truffle oil, truffle salt and crispy onion. GIVE IT TO ME!! 10/10  - SAUTEED SCALLOPS: YUM! They cooked these perfectly - beautifully pan seared on the outside and so delicate on the inside. Comes with about 5 scallops - 10/10  - LOBSTER MASHED POTATOES: so this is my favorite thing and I get it always.... who doesn't love creamy, heaven sent whipped potatoes topped with succulent lobster. 15/10. YEAH THEY'RE THAT GOOD!!   - KING CRAB TRUFFLE GNOCCHI: I was not prepared for there to be a side to compete with the mash, but holy moly this one gave it a run for its money. I love truffle, gnocchi and king crab so this was a HIT. 12/10 (not quite the mash, but also heaven sent)  - BUTTER CAKE: I feel like if you're coming here, who cares about a diet anyway.... amirite?!?! Yeah so get this. I don't care how full you are... it's warm, beautiful butter cake, topped with vanilla ice cream and served with whipped cream on the side. Worst case scenario, you bring it home... and eat it for breakfast the next day. Hah! No but for real- get this. 10/10  The service here was also great. Our server dropped many things, but I was so engaged with how delicious my meal was, it didn't really bother me. It was hot as hell in there, but I think that's Crystals vs. a Mastro's issue.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hamachi with crispy onion, truffle ponzu and truffle salt. GET THIS
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. If you like Caesar, get it.
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters Rockefeller - you can probably skip it. Tasted like Parmesan, not much else. 7/10

KTcNt4T3gGaoHerdMRNvQQ.text: The atmosphere is gorgeous and peaceful.  You can hear the faint classical music playing in the background and the lights are dimmed just right.  The staff are professional and pleasant, but not 5 star worthy.  Another thing I noticed is that this location doesn't really care how you look walking into their "5-star experience" restaurant.  I came on a Friday night around 8 p.m. and there were many people eating with casual dress on.  This would not fly in BH lol.  The food is priced how you would expect it to be...this isn't an Applebee's.  I decided on some wine (Browne Family Vineyards @ $23/glass) and the person I went with ordered Hennessy on the rocks (unsure the cost of that, but it wasn't just a shot -- good portion.)  The wine was yummy, but I've experienced better for less.  The bread bowl and butter are always a good way to start your meal.  I always have to stop myself because I could eat that pretzel bread for the rest of my life.  We both ended up getting a Filet Mignon (mine 8 oz. and his 12 oz. -- $52 / $59).  Also, 3 sides.  Lobster mashed potatoes, because you can NEVER pass this up if you're going to Mastro's - $38  Creamed spinach - $14 Steamed asparagus - $14  The sides are a la carte, but there is plenty to share!  They bring them out with a serving spoon, ask you which sides you'd like, and put your serving on your plate.  The lobster mashed potatoes are of course the best side you can possibly order, but everything else was satisfying too.  My steak had plenty of moisture and flavour to it so I was pleased.  Our waiter was helpful, but not as attentive as the waiters in BH.  They are always on top of everything!  Either way, this location wasn't horrible and I'm sure I'll be returning since I am obviously closer to this one.  But I will say that it's not at my top lists of restaurants in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Browne Family Vineyards wine
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread basket

LAqGNgqgGnM5Cpxf33P0Sg.text: This location is set in a treehouse structure in The Shops at Crystals connected to the Aria Hotel.  Highly recommended by our son who has been to a couple locations in SoCal, we decided to make reservations since they had a Mastros here in Vegas.  The place was elegant and the service was over the top.  For appetizers, we went with the shrimp cocktail for appetizers (sweet and plump). The rest, we decided to go with what the son recommended (his favorites). The hubby had the steak of the evening and I had the salmon with tapenade.  Both entrees were cooked perfectly!  For the side, we went with the lobster mashed potatoes.  They should have called it "lobster with mashed potatoes" since the lobster meat came in huge potions...it was decadent!  As we waited they delivered a huge basket of piping hot breads of all sorts.  Our favorite was the warm chewy pretzels.  Dinner was amazing, everything cooked perfectly.  Got to chit chat more with the manager who told us Mastros in SF is soon to open up.  Excited to check that out!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious chocolate truffle cake served with fresh house made whipped cream
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Located in The Shops at Crystals connected to the Aria Hotel.
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gorgeous interior

qlCOIS9wSafylfB0T6Eo_Q.text: Great place!! Took my son there 2 months ago- great quality and service was amazing . Steak was cooked perfectly and seafood was fresh!!

fXZOTusW5H7RFlFW3XNpFw.text: My husband and I dine out often, and while in Vegas we were excited to experience Mastro's and see what the hype was all about. It was sadly underwhelming. Attentiveness from the wait staff and management were good, the kitchen was slow and the food was very disappointing. The waiter encouraged my husband and I to split the chopped salad which sounded great. It came out very bland and the iceberg lettuce ruined the flavor.   I ordered the petite filet which arrived over cooked and my husband ordered the halibut "orgenata" style. The fish was flavorless and the sauce served with it had an overpowering lemon zing.   On to the sides. My husband and I love creamed corn and order it often at five star restaurants. This version was on the runny side and not even tasty. The Mac and Cheese was too al dente and the pasta was oily, not cheesy. There was a layer of cheese on top, but none throughout the dish. I love Mac and Cheese and could not force myself to eat it. Much to our waiters insult it was sent back to the kitchen. The service was so slow that we didn't have have time for dessert before heading out to catch our show. Perhaps we should have opted for one of the seafood towers they are known for.   If you're seeking ambiance and good service this is a good place. If you're seeking great food, I'd dine elsewhere. We will not return.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The not so cheesy Mac and Cheese
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CcjV-u82kqOBGmdmamir9A.text: I've got to say, pretty solid restaurant.   Love the decor, presentation of the food is pretty good. Looks like they have some private rooms upstairs looks good for private events.  So a run down of dinner tonight is   Bread was pretty good, hot and fresh out of the oven, there was this one with like ... parmesan on it? YUM  First dish to come out, Roasted Bone Marrow, really deep flavor pairs good with the little toasted bread. Very delicious, and was my first time trying it :)  Moving on to the Burrata salad, this is my favorite type of cheese, whenever I see it I always order it, the Burrata itself was pretty yum paired with heirloom tomatoes topped with balsamic. A classic cant go wrong.  Next appetizer, was crab cakes, pretty nice and meaty, although gotta say I've had better. Thank you, next.  For main course we had the pan seared Sea Bass, which was good. Also a 12oz bone in filet. Sides garlic mashed potatoes, yuuum and asparagus which was eh, my own personal preference is I dont typically like the larger ones.   Finished with some chocolate covered strawberries :)

1vX9c23XKWps9hBIQTvlmQ.text: My man took me here for my birthday. It's right inside crystals so if you don't have any reservations and by some reason is on a will call, you can either window shop or do a little shopping spree before you devour their mouthwatering steaks! I got their rib eye and it was definitely sooooo juicy good! I even got a yummy bday dessert for free! :)

leR-IpjJbVR7jcmuAyWHvQ.text: Everything about this place is great ate at this location 4-5 times and every time the food service atmosphere is great . And the price is not all that high as i thought  Its well worth every penny and must try the bacon steak it's not on the menu its great all the side dishes are great as well

2KSh041eEfc-hSOKwtFFnw.text: For the high price, the food is not satisfying at all. no taste or flavor, especially the side dishes (mashed potatoes) that we barely even touch. And the fried calamari... the batter is all you can taste and still its not tasty at all. We asked for 2 medium well steaks. One is burned and the other one is soaking bloody on my plate. It was my husband's birthday and it was a mistake to choose this place. I will not recommend this place.  I should have also read the not recommended reviews at the bottom of this page. There were mostly 3 stars that were taken down.

0QTHQLKDUouXDeLb7n1MhQ.text: I chose this spot to celebrate my birthday. I wanted to go somewhere special since we don't go to fancy places anymore since having kids. I was not disappointed with my choice.   Let me start with the service. Our server was Edgar, but my bf swears his name was Hector. I apologize if I'm wrong. Anyhow, he was amazing. He was very easy to talk to. Our conversation about being locals and loving Vegas was not forced. He was genuine with his words and I felt like he was actually listening to us when he asked how my day was going. 5 star service definitely goes to him.   On to the food...that bread basket to start was awesome. I liked how there was a variety of bread instead of just one type. Since it was my birthday, I ordered myself the Elderflower martini which had St Germain and Hendricks gin. This cocktail was light and clean tasting and was not too heavy with the meal. For the appetizer we ordered the sauteed scallops which were cooked to perfection. I loved the buttery sauce that it came with and soaked it up with the crostinis. For our main course, I opted for the Chilean sea bass and my bf got the 22 oz rib eye. My fish was moist, buttery and flaky. I didn't try my bf's steak since he ordered it rare, but he said it was one of the best steaks he's ever eaten. For our sides, we ordered the lobster mashed potatoes and Brussel sprouts. Those lobster mashed potatoes...OMG, like heaven in your mouth. They were silky and smooth with huge chunks of lobster. And for dessert, we opted for the butter cake which was served with ice cream and hand made whipped cream. Dear Jesus, I could have eaten the whipped cream by itself. It was that good.   Now the reason I can't justify giving them a 5 star rating is for a few things. The Brussel sprouts were dry and boring. I make this much better at home. If I'm going to pay $14 for a small dish of Brussel sprouts, they better be amazing. And sadly, these were not. I was also excited to try their elusive butter cake. What we got was a dry and crumbly piece of whatever it is they gave us. It was literally like eating sand cake. Not even the ice cream or whipped cream it was served with could have saved it. And my last annoyance was that the tables were waaay too close together. I wanted to enjoy my meal since my bf and I never have alone time. Instead, they sat another party next to us and I listened to their snooty "we have so much money" conversation the entire time.   My tummy was definitely happy after this meal. I'm glad I was able to celebrate my birthday here. This will definitely be a spot to consider again for our next special date night. Maybe next time I'll ask to sit in their tree house where it isn't so crowded.

kw_xL7Q0mwTISIHmnKs3jQ.text: Came here with my boss and co-worker a few weeks back and was totally blown away by the service and food. Looks are a little deceiving because walking in looks a little small but this place is really big. Once inside immediately seated and be forewarned make a reservation because this place gets very busy. Our waitress was so nice and couldn't have asked for better service.   For dinner I had the salmon accompanied by a side of the roasted asparagus and lobster mash potatoes. Another warning the sides are huge and meant for sharing. we wanted to get appetizers but it was a long day and we were all pretty hangry so it was right to business with ordering food and salads to start. The salmon was amazing and even though they have steak options couldn't imagine eating here and not eating what they are known for which is fish. After an amazing meal we just sat here and talked and enjoyed the company. There was no rush to leave and even tough we were done our waitress acted like we just arrived. Great choice for dinner while in Las Vegas and would highly recommend  to anyone...promise you will have a great time

a1601483_Mv5R5jF3exekQ.text: Fantastic food.  We got the Seafood tower and lots more and it was out of this world.  Definitely the best Seafood place I've been to in Vegas.  Does anyone remember Buzios @ the Rio Hotel a few decades ago?  That was a fantastic place with amazing atmosphere.  So is Mastro's.

7OUQRNFgIDg_gJhAyAJyEg.text: Mastro's is always fabulous, and this location was no exception. Extraordinary service and impeccable food.  The oysters were outstanding (I get them every time I'm at Mastro's, and love the tiny Tobasco sauce bottle they come with), Caesar salad was delicious, and the scallops were seriously the best scallops I've ever had. Highly, highly recommend the scallops. I do have to say, we usually order the creamed spinach at the Chicago location, but I felt that the creamed spinach we had here was not as good.   For dessert, my family always gets the butter cake as it is always so yummy, and this Ocean Club location did not disappoint with it!

LXRytxRYPbnQkTMdfzGqEg.text: What a great place on the strip. We NEVER venture down here but were given a gift card so we decided to spend our anniversary there. The service was wonderful, the food was amazing and we would definitely come back. I ordered the gnocchi but vegetarian style, which was absolutely delicious. One thing I will say is that the portions are HUGE! We not only had a great meal but a great lunch the next day!

trUGz5gOhdPd_WZhgsrwSQ.text: No wonder Maestro's is so highly rated by so many Yelpers.  I came in for an early dinner during a weekday and got seated immediately. The complimentary bread basket is huge with many varieties of breads and a side of butter. The bread was soft and warm, however the butter was a tad too salty.  I skipped the appetizers and went straight for the entree. Blackened salmon was my choice! Also ordered a side of wild mushrooms with truffle butter. Salted caramel martini was my drink that night.  The entree plate came with a generous and the most delicious piece of salmon. Perfectly cooked and juicy. Loved every bite of it. The side of wild mushrooms was also my favorite!  I highly recommend making a trip to Maestro's for dinner when in Vegas. You're sure to love it. Not just the food, but the high end ambiance and service all adds up to a perfect dinner experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wild mushrooms with truffle butter
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blackened Salmon - Absolutely delicious
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salted caramel martini - Dessert cocktail lovers, this is for you!

DIabo4apDZeWYTtGYFPR2Q.text: I went to Vegas for a work trip and was definitely spoiled by getting to eat at fancy restaurants like this.  Mastro's is located in Crystals with all the high end shops.  A client took us out to dinner and decided on this place.  We started off the night with some white wine which was really good (I can't remember what kind) and got the Mastro's Seafood Tower.  We got to pick our own items that we wanted (oysters, crab and lobster) and it came out on a huge iced seafood tower.  The seafood was delicious!  It tasted so fresh.  I order the Hawaiian Big Eye Tuna as my entree.  Unfortunately is wasn't as great as I thought but the rest of my experience here was amazing.  Service was very professional and the atmosphere of the restaurant was definitely a Las Vegas feel (so classy).  If I ever get a chance to go again, I'll definitely be eating more of their seafood!

nEx2g6A7tbhP8lekO5yY8w.text: Beyond expectations. We had friends recommend Mastro's so we went.   WOW. The food is phenomenal. The service amazing.  A MUST! We ordered several appetizers each, a side and a salad. Fresh, flavorful and amazing presentation. Loved the mashed potatoes. We will definitely be back.    The couple behind us nearly ruined the experience. They were drunk and getting loud. Our waiter Dominic, recognized the situation, the manager apologized and comped us a few drinks.   Even with our experience of poorly behaved patrons, which I suspect does not happen as often as one may think in Vegas, this place is totally worth it.

e-49g7-einqrPbkq0c9vgA.text: I took my wife out for a special evening, she retired from 24 years of nursing in the Navy and in the private sector. Greta was our server, not only did she give us amazing service but she made us feel welcome and special guests. We ordered the butter cake for desert (must have, BTW) and because she knew it was my wife's retirement night out, she did a little something special. They comp'd the desert and wrote "congratulations on your retirement" on the plate. Thanks, Mastro's kitchen staff!

NdlJgMtS09kDyMtZbW8i6g.text: I've been to this place maybe about 3 times, and one of its sister locations in Costa Mesa about 3 times as well. Both restaurants exude that high end feeling and you will leave feeling... well feeling awesome that you spent 50 bucks on a slab of meat. But that's not all.  If you make an Open Table reservation they will always call you the day of to confirm and remind you that you are going to attend. One of the times I've been to this Mastro's Ocean Club and they were fully committed, and suggested to look for a seat at the bar area, and then one of the waitress or hostesses asked if I would mind eating on the piano (they had live music that time) which I found it hilarious, a $1k+ grand piano with me eating on it. Regardless I told her I would wait for a party at the bar to be seated but that was another time.   You're going to pay at least $70+ per person but the food along with the service makes it all worth it. Every time I go to Mastro's, the waiters/waitresses are always so nice, helpful, professional, and willing to answer any and all questions you may have about the menu. If you haven't been there before they will let you know the vastness of the menu and how they operate as a steakhouse/ocean club.  My reccemondations as far as Mastro's Ocean Club in Las Vegas?  Bone-in Fillet Bone-in Ribeye (although the Filet wins my money by a mile) Alaskan King Crab Black Truffle Gnocchi Lobster Mashed Potatoes Garlic Mashed Potatoes Ocean Club Salad And their Raw Oysters - wherever it is from because it is super fresh  If you go in on a special occasion like a birthday or a graduation, most of the time they'll give you a slice of chocolate cake as dessert and the most kick ass whipped cream you would have ever had the chance to have. Yes it is just that good.  Hope you guys enjoy it as much as I do. After writing this review, I'm just vying to go back.

ayQRw60Y2Wm3CsepzIJpsA.text: This was the best dinner I had in vegas. We got:  the lobster sushi roll- really tasty and light, great app the spring mix salad (not sure on the name)- Not great... I wouldn't get it again the sashimi tuna-AMAZING the best tuna I have ever had, and the sesame seeds added a great flavor the gorgonzola mac and cheese- Mac and cheese with gorgonzola... do I really need to say how tasty this was? the butter cake-super moist and sweet, good texture and flavor  Overall, I love this place. We sat in the birdnest thing, great experience and view.

iA3veG66-HofPvE2_qDBHw.text: I had the lobster bisque it was extremely salty. The steak was cooked as like I have requested. I ordered the steak with the truffle butter, for $15.00, I could have done without it. The service was good and staff was friendly.

sthGv5bCcOsIkWoId1tTnA.text: We've been coming to Mastro's since they opened in Vegas and have been to a few different locations in S. Cal and it one of my favorite places in Vegas.  We went the other night for my birthday and everything was excellent.  The seafood platter was fresh and come with great sauces.  All the steaks, chops and fish were really good as well.  The Butter cake is also a must!  Make sure to make a reservation, especially on a weekend and bring your wallet!!

j04Qomx2YYnpojMZu6TJFQ.text: Ambience, service and upscale environment....all as advertised. The food, however, was very salty and not fitting of the high price tag. We ordered two filets(medium) and a side of creamed spinach. The steaks were brought out and appeared to have been cooked medium well, again at a place like this, you would expect better.    Creamed spinach tasted as if they dumped a whole carton of salt in it. Overall, it was very much below expectation.

KsgIPiwstaLlx-Ym2pDoRA.text: My first time dining at this particular Mastro's and they did not disappoint. It was restaurant week but our group went and ordered our own stuff anyways. Yeah, this's place is that good hahha  Food Tried:  Pretzel Bread - like a soft, warm, perfectly salted pretzel.  Lobster Mash - delish Mushrooms - I love these tasty mushrooms Spinach - not a big fan of spinach but Mastro's does it right  12 oz bone in filet - cooked just right. Med rare and awesome  Service: Great. Attentive and courteous. My friend couldn't finish his 22oz rib eye and asked to take the rest to go. They accidentally tossed it but went out of their way to make up for it. Our group was dressed casually and I can imagine some lesser establishments not giving us this type of great service based just on this alone.

GgAOYr8CPN2HbmhEgdo_eA.text: What can I say, I'm a baller...  I LOVE Mastro's.  They do it right.  Top quality service, top quality drinks, top quality food.  For the first time I had the oysters here, and they were ... AWESOME.  We walked in, no-reservation, found a table in the bar area, watched the Lakers lose to OKC (yes!) and had another swank experience.  The huge wooden design thing-thing dining area that opens up/sits over the mall provides for a great atmosphere also.. (ref pic)  The place is all that.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7-rwfjZgQl_uDMDCZlR8gw.text: Mastro's to me is just another steak house. Just like Fleming's or Morton's and Ruth's Chris, Morton's offers a very classic steak restaurant. Visiting Vegas, I made a decision I shouldn't have made. Not to say that going to Matro's Ocean Club inside the Shops At Crystals was a mistake or a bad experience. I just have a dining out rule when I'm in Vegas. "If there's one in LA or OC, don't go there." Well, I broke my rule, but it was all for a birthday celebration. I figured, I probably won't be going to Mastro's anytime soon, so might as well. And the bird's nest really attracted me. I was really happy with my decision for the most part.  We started things of with bread service. They offered pretzel, crouton, baguette, dinner roll, and wheat bread. The breadbasket had variety all were quite good. My favorite was the pretzel -- it was soft and airy.  I had some of the Caesar salad to start. I needed some kind of greens to soak up all that meat juice. Their Caesar salad was near perfect. The dressing was nice and creamy. The addition of parmesan cheese and cracked pepper made everything better.  I was ready for the main event, the 22oz bone in rib eye. The rib eye is one of my favorite cuts because of the even fat marbling and soft texture. Mine was cooked perfectly medium rare, though a bit more on the rare side. This actually caused the meat to be a bit tough. This cut did have some nice fat running through the steak. This helped with the tenderness and mouth feel of the meat. Even though this wasn't the best steak I have had, the help of the amazing sides made it all better.  The real reason I came here wasn't the steak. Well it is, and it isn't. The real reason I came here was for the lobster mashed potatoes. I mean. It is Mastro's Ocean Club -- Ocean, meaning seafood is in order. This side dish was rich as can be -- full of butter. I believe the potato to butter ratio is near 1 to 1. With a whole lobster tail carefully chopped up and placed in a pool of butter, the potatoes were creamy and flavorful. The pure essence of the sea was encased in butter, and mixed with potatoes. Eating this with steak was pure bliss. The kid in me wanted to order the mac and cheese. made with gorgonzola, the flavor was very rich. Another cream heavy and dairy heavy dish, the mac and cheese was delicious. My favorite was the layer of melted cheese on top.  My favorite was dessert. We were celebrating a birthday, so they gave us a chocolate birthday cake. The cake was rich in chocolate and eating just a few bites was enough for me. The best thing about this dessert was their home made whipped cream. Served on the side in a bowl, the homemade whipped cream was so dense and fluffy. The cold cream and the chocolate cake was a perfect mixture. Honestly though, the whipped cream was the best thing ever. I wanted to take it all home.  Eating at Mastro's Ocean Club was a great experience. The location is a bit awkward. As you are enjoying your expensive meal inside an amazingly architectured "bird's nest," you look out and you see people shopping. That is cool and all, but you can't help but think you are inside of a mall -- Well, you are inside of a mall, and this Mastro's makes sure you know that. I couldn't help but think I was at a very glorified food court at a mall. When I eat at a nice establishment, I want to feel secluded from the world. I just didn't get the at from here. The food is great, though as far as steakhouses go in Las Vegas, you can do a lot better. I guess I can only break my rule once. Never eat at Las Vegas where you can at home.

gC8FjzSnnnLfB_N2mnF1kA.text: I'll save you some time from reading and cut to the chase:  1. Request the Tree House 2. Cocktail: Mastro Mojito 3. Appetizer: Mastro's Seafood Tower (if you're a group of 4 or more, it's big) 4. Side: Lobster Mashed Potatoes 5. Entree: Bone-in Ribeye, medium-rare.  The Chilean Sea Bass is actually pretty good but c'mon this is Mastros! 6. Dessert: Warm butter cake  7. Walk it off at the Cosmopolitan next door.  If you're eating here, I'm happy for you!

8-Pv6zKv6Chrp7fQYFhJAw.text: Worst meal for the money that we have had in any restaurant in United States in the last 20 years. Please don't go by their ratings.  All five  of our  dinner party's  meals were very subpar.  Our bill was $500. We were trying to celebrate a birthday for a nationally recognized physician.  All were very disappointed.  I have never written a review before but because this meal was such a rip off I felt it my duty.  Please do not go to this restaurant.   Spend your funds on a very nice show instead. You'll be so glad you did. The ambience at best is fair.  Please please do not go by published ratings as we did. They are misleading. I am confident  the restaurant is good in other cities but this one in Las Vegas is very sub par. It is a waste of your money. There are many better restaurants in this fun city.

QgCwRuLykGj0_fnsJV0mQw.text: No no mastros why did you do us like that? Everyone do yourself, your taste buds and your wallet a favor and go to Bev Hills Mastros! The place the food here was nothing compared to BH. I won't ever return here, felt like I couldn't breathe.

rXilsgUy4MKssc5QNzgxtg.text: This shall be short because Mastro's is just plain awesome.  Lobster Tails = Delectable Creamed Spinach = Delish Scalloped Potatoes = RICH! Very yummy cheeses in the dish Ahi Tuna = Yum!  Chocolate Cake = Da Bomb  Corkage Fee - $35. Service = IMPECCABLE  This is our go-to place whenever we're in Vegas for an expensive dinner. The boyfriend goes here when he's in Scottsdale for business dinners. It's just fantastic.  A pretty penny, but amazing.

f8978wSRYUIJYAaaOpezzg.text: Mastro's does hospitality right - I've been to their location in PHX as well and it seems that service training is very important to this group.  We went here just for dessert (Boss Man is a butter cake fiend) and sat in the bar area, but our service was as good as if we were ordering full dinners & bottles of expensive wine.  Don't take me to mean that anything here is cheap - that butter cake is going to be $16 but it's an absolutely enormous cake (like 6" round) and served with a literal bucket of Chantilly cream. It's easily enough for 4-5 people or one person who's been jonesing for this cake.   Their wine list is well chosen and a pretty good value as well, all things considered. I had a French Cremant & for $10 it was an extremely generous pour.

Hmjh9FWWRqdA4bgnI0mUNQ.text: We came here based on 2 recommendations from good friends. My goodness, we sure are happy we did. We came here for dinner last night to celebrate our one year anniversary. We made reservations a week prior to visiting Mastro's, which apparently was a wise thing to do. We were sat within 5 minutes of our arrival. The server greeted us and informed us of the daily specials. We ordered the calamari (yuummm) and a mojito (don't order it, you won't miss out on much, tastes like Sprite with a hint of mint). The drink however, will not affect the way I will review our main course and service. My husband and I both ordered a filet for dinner with a side of scalloped potatoes and asparagus.... The asparagus was fresh and cooked to perfection. The potatoes were packed with flavor. You won't be disappointed with the potatoes. Lastly, the steak.... WOW. The steak was cooked to order and very delicious. We enjoyed our dinner at Mastro's aaaaand were very thankful and appreciative of the complimentary warm butter cake dessert that was given to us to help us celebrate our anniversary.   The excellent food, attentive and friendly staff, establishment design and atmosphere make for a enjoyable dinner experience. I definitely recommend this place. It's pricey, but worth it... I say live a little and treat yourself to a nice Mastro's dinner, you won't be disappointed.

OaABf9GciVQ-bCD7L5iryw.text: Daniel was my server, AH-MAZE-ING!! Service team was incredible, each dish was delicious and cooked perfectly.  I enjoyed the sea bass, tender, rich in flavor with the scalloped potatoes. A glass of Haan Point Noir and the Butter Cake with fresh whipped cream, as recommended by Daniel. I dined alone as I'm on a business trip, they were kind enough to take care of my wine and dessert, truly a nice gesture!

XY5PqJ7O0gErrxHoBpAXWw.text: My girlfriend took me here for date night. We had an amazing time seated in the tree house.  We both loved the atmosphere.   Everything we ate or drank was overwhelmingly delicious. It would be to great a challenge to identify a favorite dish. Though don't leave until you have tried the signature butter cake.  The service was everything you could hope for. Our waiter Lionel was very attentive yet gave as the space to enjoy our date. We never felt rushed and every one one of his recommendations enhanced our meal.   I hope this was the first of many visits.

yMiIMmxT4xZmEXUJSxHX3A.text: Over rated and over priced! Food was bland and lacked any kind of flavor. Such a disappointment. Go somewhere else. This place is not worth it.

Dhpwl-bPMYkynWzN7jaKxg.text: Service: 5/5 (From beginning of planning the event to attending the event) Food: 4/5 Ambiance: 3.5/5 Private rooms can use some more decor/personal touches; IMHO, it was pretty plain  We had a party of 32 ppl, and we opted for the private room upstairs.  I worked with Carly and Brandon to set up this event. Everything went as planned--overall flawless experience.   Ordered: Starter--Family Style: 1) Lobster Roll--4/5: My favorite 2) Seared Ahi Tuna: 3.5/5 3) Mini Crab Cake-3/5  Entree: 22oz Bone in Ribeye--Delicious! 4/5 Chilean Sea Bass: 4/5 12oz Bone in Filet: 3/5  Dessert: YUM! Creme Brulee: 4/5 Butter Cake: 4/5 Cheesecake: 3/5

ELUaO-CNFt1r8EOQG8eU1w.text: My main course was the Chilean Sea Bass - - it turned out to be the best prepared Chilean Sea Bass I've ever had...simply incredible.  Sides:  lobster mashed potatoes - amazing.  Scalloped potatoes - near perfection  Other sides were slightly above average.  Lobster Bisque was very flavorful, but needed more lobster in it.  Shrimp cocktail had large succulent shrimp.  Private dinning room waitress and support staff were as professional as they come.  Overall a great dinning experience.

lGHND4cFgTDCLSTG62tafw.text: Wonderful! Ultimate 5 star experience in Vegas! We thoroughly enjoyed our experience here. We loved the appetizer tower that can be mixed and matched. Oysters were fantastic. The cocktail shrimp vanilla  We sat inside the 'space ship' or 'UFO'... Be sure to request this seating during your reservation.  To begin... Cocktails: Paloma was fantastic for the tart drink lovers. Elderflower martini was better for the sweet tooth!   Appetizer: Cocktail jumbo shrimp, vanilla battered shrimp & oysters... Delish!   Salad: We split the iceberg Wedge, please note that in photo... It's only half. The bacon used was a sweet hickory smoked Wisconsin bacon. Amazing.   Soup: Lobster Bisque. Phenomenal. Rich & Creamy.   Entree: Filet. Ordered med well but the cut was too thick and it ended up well done on outside and almost rare in the middle, but it was still fantastic.  Side: King Crab & Black Truffle Gnocchi- TO DIE FOR. An absolute must. Yes, I actually chose this over my standard potatoes au gratin with steak and was do glad I did.  Creamed spinach was fantastic.   We ended our meal with Cappuccinos.  Thank you for well educated wait staff and quality service.
