LED9FGetNIR0HdAeRYkdqA.text: Warm butter cake was the best thing I ate!  Food was good, not great.

I23je7eYwcmQjTiK4mNQ8w.text: This was the most over rated restaurant I have ever dined at.  The food was just OK. Actually the pretzel rolls were the best part of the meal.  My husband's lemon sole was over cooked and his clam chowder was just ok.  I had the tomatoes and buratta cheese.  The cheese was very good.  My lobster tails:  one baked and one in a vanilla batter were both over cooked.  We shared the Butter Cake which was good but not spectacular.  Along with this our service was horrible.  We had to ask for bread which eventually came had no butter with it.  We had a different person for each course and were totally ignored in between.  In the meantime a woman manager in a business suit and the waiter were busy fawning over the people at the next table.  Eat at Sinatra's if you want a first class meal and exceptional service. Renee P.

T5zm2_AkkR1m7AR7Uo5_sQ.text: Jae wore a tank top and they still let him in. The sides were just okay. Gnocchi was the best side we had. Lobster mash potato, asparagus, Mack n cheese, and spinach. We ordered three different steaks and split it for the table medium rare. I like rare medium rare and my restaurant to have a dimmer light.

nq9654ED9GaXSpfOpRRIgw.text: Yes I know I am the only person on here to give them 3 stars but please hear me out for my reasoning behind all this.   On Saturday, I had made reservations for a party of two at 730PM. When he arrived at 720PM, it was not really busy nor was it a ghost town in there. The hostess stand said it would be a moment as they got our table ready and for us to take a seat at the bar, enjoy a cocktail or two and they will get us.   During our 30 minute wait (yes maybe they were short staffed, not ready yet etc.... which I am ok with) they sat multiple tables of walk-in's and a few reservations of small 2-4 tops. (I know this because a few sat at the bar whom we spoke to and others I over heard when I stood by the hostess stand to wait to check on my table. Off to a bad start.....   Anyway, we had a nice table overlooking the garden down stairs in the back of the restaurant. All the back-waiters were very prompt and professional with regards to keeping the water glasses full, serving the bread, clearing the table from the right and serving from the left etc... (After working in this industry for years, I get picky about this crap at high end restaurants) The server was pretty on the ball and friendly but a little to relaxed with us. (Yes we are young and eating at a high end restaurant, I am ok with that)  On to the food, below is a list of what we ordered and what I thought about it:   Calamari App: Lightly breaded with light seasoning. Dipping sauce complimented it very well.   Fillet Mignon: Very tender and medium rare is more of rare. But it is better to under cook the steak then burn the hell out of it. VERY TENDER, cut with your fork status.   Sea Bass: Parmesan crusted.... a little on the very fishy side for my taste which overcame the rest of the flavors  Cream of Spinach: Very creamy and just was not my style. Girlfriend liked it though.  Sea salt/vinegar fries: These shoestring cut fries were epic! Yes.... of everything I ate, I was most impressed by the large basket of $10 fries.   Warm Butter Cake: Once again.... this was the main reason we went here for my birthday and because the other half loves this dessert more than she loves me. :)  Multiple layer chocolate birthday cake: Now to be honest, this was what saved Mastro's from getting the dreadful 2-star rating from me. In my reservation, I had noted "birthday" but no one had seemed to see it. Hell, we even ordered desert and were half way finished with it before they brought out the cake. Personally, did someone at the hostess stand go oops! We need to send a birthday cake over to Table XX immediately even though they already are half way through their dessert? But to be honest, they did and it truly made my otherwise mediocre dining experience in to a pleasant one.   Overall Mastros.... maybe I set my expectations to high and I understand, you have only been open for a few months now so maybe all the bugs are still getting worked out. In the words of my girlfriend, it was not as good as the Crystal Cove, CA location yet on par with the one in Costa Mesa, CA.   Sounds like I have to try all this again at the Crystal Cove location and compare! Granted.... thanks for the last minute birthday cake. It was nice to see those little comments on Open Table actually mean something.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. In front of Mastro&#39;s
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday Cake Mastros&#39;s Style.

jolSEnSu8Tq_IVpR5_2P4Q.text: Excellent ,  fun and friendly!.  Nice tuna.   Superb entertainment .  Piano and singer.

rsuBWd2A98ANiVAFpq6URg.text: I completely regret resisting going to this place. After 3 hard vegas days, expensive food seemed like a waste, but this meal was one of the best memories of the trip. Lobster Bisque was definitely one of or the best I've ever had, my friends' macaroni and cheese was huge and delicious and the butter cake, our main reason for going here was so good, I was contemplating pulling the trigger right there just to force in a few more bites. Sitting in the treehouse in the middle of the mall made the whole experience that much more unique. There was a 2:1 diner/waiter ratio, our main guy was one of the most attentive pros I've ever had.

i6umETJvndYr53eF1zvHBA.text: It's certainly spendy, and there seems to be some debate here among the reviews on if the food is worth it, but the service and location certainly are.  We ate here around Christmas.  As mentioned, the service was phenomenal.  On the advice of my waiter, I ordered a bone-in ribeye, my date ordered the chilean sea bass.  As a side we had the lobstered mash potatoes.  My server Robert was outstanding.  It's the first time I've had a waiter observe my steak after I started eating, confirm that it wasn't cooked as ordered, and offer to send it back for another, without me saying a thing.  2 days later I received a phone call from the restaurant thanking us for the visit.  That just doesn't happen anymore.

yTMX-zuGWk5E7p0G4f0GXQ.text: Several friends were in town and they booked dinner at a different restaurant, after the entrees were consumed I suggested we walk a few blocks to Mastro's Ocean Club in the Crystals at CityCenter for desert and nightcap beverages. It's one of my favorite steakhouses in Vegas and #1 choice for outstanding deserts and port wines or a glass of late harvest liquid gold (Far Niente Dolce). Made a quick reservation on Yelp and we showed up around 9:30pm. The bar was lively. I ordered one Chocolate Pudding Cake and one Cherry Crisp, plus the "100 years flight of Port flight" and a glass of Dolce. The dark chocolate pudding cake was warm, fresh, and delicious. The liquid cream and fresh whipped cream, serving of blackberries and mint were exceptional and we all enjoyed. The Cherry Crisp was scrumptious. Highly recommend this venue as the architecture is remarkable, service attentive and friendly (Kaitlyn was wonderful) and it's convenient to The Strip action.

BMBF6q6Kx58q7mTW4_VriQ.text: Yes yes yes! Took some friends and clients for a beautiful dinner here. What can i say? Amazing food. Highest quality I've had in a VERY long time. The steaks were amazing, perfectly cooked and all topped off with their truffle butter (highly recommended but an extra $15 add-on, I know. I can buy a lot of butter for $15, but worth it). Yum! Also ordered a fairly large seafood tower. It was stocked with lobster, large crab claws, oysters, crab legs. Can you say, Unbelievable! With our steaks, we ordered the following sides. Creamed spinach, mac and cheese, and the gnocci. All amazing. Obviously the price here is fairly hefty but was well worth it. Impeccable service with our waiter anticipating our every need. We ordered so much food that they ultimately comped us on a free desert. Way to go Maestros. Will most definitely come again!

x_t6ap08v79NWjXIEXitYg.text: I had a bone in steak which was fabulous! I also had the blue cheese Mac and Cheese and the butter cake. The food was fantastic, I would suggest they train their cooks to cook steaks. I ordered medium pink center and I got medium well. Also, I would have loved to add Oscar style but my waiter never mentioned it. Service was good and management was very nice. Worth the price!

w6PouKbZ96tzJwp2TBc-0A.text: My wife and I visited mastro's and was very impressed. I got the ribeye and it was one of the best steaks I've ever had. My wife got the brussel sprouts. She said they were great. The bathroom was like none that I've ever been to before. This was one of the best steakhouse experiences I've ever had. The only let down was it was very loud and the tables were very close to each other.

FS2oA_cpCz9Fd_hp9GV17Q.text: We live close to the ocean club in Newport Coast where we've eaten several times and is always perfect. While in Vegas staying at the Aria we had a group here for dinner and basically ate the menu (bill was almost 4000).  Everything was pretty good but the steak was probably the worst I've ever had.  I ordered a bone in filet which was almost $60 which was fatty and undercooked (ordered medium rare).  Didn't send it back because I wasn't interested in eating more food since we had so many appetizers and we had desserts coming. I'm just surprised that any Mastro's would send a piece of meat of that quality not properly cooked for that price.  You guys are better than that...

wKy2OdjnBbF2D6wwsWa-fg.text: My wife and I came here for our anniversary and had a wonderful experience. We were happy with the service as well as the food. We were seated in the tree house as requested.  We started with the steamed mussles and bread basket. mussels were good however quite small. Bread was aldo good no complaints. I had the 18oz bone-in filet, Oscar style something I've always wanted to try.  The amount of crab meat was generous and the bernaisse sauce was good. Worth the extra $25.  My wife got the pan seared Chilean Sea Bass and it did not dissapoint. As for sides we ordered half orders of the lobster mash, green beans and the mushrooms. The amount of food was way too much for the two of us. The lobster mash was good but not worth the $18. We could've gone without it. Better off using that money to get your steak Oscar style. Much more satisfying.  Staff was professional and attentive. Drinks were really good ad well. For dessert we got a complimentary butter cake which very good but we were to stuffed at that point to really enjoy it.   I took one star away because I had my steak packed to-go for a midnight snack and when I open the box I find that there was only one piece of crab. I know I had at least 4-5 pieces left. I really wouldn't have been able to eat it all but it's the principle.  Anyway I would visit Mastro's again but order less.

rHgtZF3qFm8aQ6-dCMYSoQ.text: Best food EVER. Steak is perfectly cooked and lobster mash is to die for. Didn't really like the creamed spinach but the BUTTER CAKE YUMMY!!!!!! If you make a reservation ask to sit in Linus section. He is one of the best waiters EVER!!!!!

jJyGHl-nuRUkW0e1rbYZWA.text: Top three talked about phrases for this place from Yelp:  1) Lobster Mashed Potatoes (already tried in LA) 2) tree house (sounds interesting, I'll take two!) 3) Chilean Sea Bass (since it's the ocean club I will definitely try this)  Okay just kidding I didn't really order the tree house. It was pretty cool to be seated there because I saw this the last time I was walking around here and had no idea it was for Mastro's. For such a nice restaurant I really expect the sea bass to be of top notch but it sadly was not. We split some sides of scalloped potatoes (everyone thought these were gross and overly salty), sauteed spinach, mushrooms, and mac & cheese. The sides are nice but none of that really matters if the main entree doesn't hit the spot.  My friend order the special "tomahawk" steak which is a massive piece of meat on a gimongous bone, making it look like a tomahawk - pretty awesome!

-rtO5_whdF5euskBFAlImA.text: No doubt a popular venue as judged by our wait even after we had a reservation.   Ate my usual bone in filet and was utterly disappointed. In fact I was underwhelmed by every dish that came out.    I guess I should have gotten the seafood?

whzVWNLrA8ObNUnz-Kn8HA.text: For the most part, a pretty good experience. The gin martini was very good (it was practically two drinks).  It "worked" very well. I've had better (more garlic/butter) escargot but these were pretty good.  Lobster bisque was more than acceptable. Ocean Club salad was tasty and cold but they use iceberg lettuce (really?).  Mussels were decent.  Bone Marrow was interesting but way overpriced. Sea Bass was nice, light tasty.  Blackened grouper was pretty good.  They served both the scallops and the lamb underdone.  They promptly took both back to the kitchen and when they re-served them (just three minutes later), the scallops were acceptable but the lamb was completely awesome.  The lamb was hot with the proper amount of crust and perfectly medium rare. (Why didn't they do that the first time?) The lamb was the winner, for sure. (I glanced at other tables' filets ... too small.  It didn't look appetizing.) Brussels sprouts were delicious.  The lobster mashed potatoes were too liquidy.  What WAS that liquid?  They totally should've been thicker. For dessert (ugh, we were so full but we just HAD to have dessert) was the cherry crisp.  Tasty but needed more cherry.  The ice cream was nice and the freshly-made whipped cream was awesome.  Plenty for four people. With tip (including two drinks and everything mentioned, above) for four people, the check came to $480 (incl. $80 tip). Yes, it was overpriced but it was a fun experience, very nice service (including lots of amenities in the men's bathroom) and the food was pretty good, overall.  Not sure we'd go back (because it's so expensive) but certainly nice when you're on vacation and want to splurge a little.

MSjlR8wec8pV5T8Y6BDmNA.text: The service here is amazing - probably the best I've experienced.  The attention to detail was ridiculous.  All of the wait staff was very friendly and attentive and worked together seamlessly to make our experience as pleasant as possible.  They had a moderate sized wine list with a good selection of reasonably priced bottles as well as several by the glass options.  No complaints there.  For our entree, I ordered the bone in ribeye and my wife got a filet.  This was probably my first experience at a high end restaurant where the steaks were wet aged.  My impression was unfortunately mixed.  The steaks were definitely supremely tender but they lacked that meaty punch that good dry aged steaks usually have.  Overall they tasted like a really tender version of a supermarket steak - not bad but definitely below expectations.  We got the warm butter cake for dessert which was very good.  It's big enough for 2-3 people to share though you won't want to share it.  Anyway, aside from the somewhat disappointing steaks, this was an amazing meal and experience.  We'll certainly be back next time we're in town.

SscwrPhL9FIgA6LmKgUTNA.text: Amazing restaurant. I took my gf here for her birthday, because she loves mall food, and this restaurant is in one of the most expensive malls I've ever been to. All jokes aside, the food is excellent and the service was impeccable. I had the lamb rack; it was mouth watering and the presentation was unique.

m0HHmXMINE4_gGGsPGM27w.text: My Girlfriend had told me about this place and although it had great reviews for a steakhouse. I thought it was just okay. The service was great which was a plus, but I thought the food was just okay. Maybe we're just used to the more traditional and old-fashioned steakhouses. There didn't seem to be much of a dress code and the steak (Ribeye) was too fatty for our taste. We didn't want anything lean, but this was too fatty. The best side to me was the creamed corn and the clam chowder soup was the highlight of my dinner. I will say it was my first time having clam chowder. The ambiance was not exciting at all. (Not for an *upscale* steakhouse. I don't think I'll come back unless I'm going to try the seafood or the butter cake.

iKYOmbkP4zyYEqYQ0RS-kw.text: 3.5 stars- definitely better than 3 stars, but not quite 4.  This restaurant is location in the middle of Crystals on the Strip.  From the outside looking in, the restaurant is inside a neat sculptured "treehouse". It sort of made me feel like if would be cool to eat in there, but sitting on the inside of the treehouse looking out I feel a little disappointed, because I felt like I was eating in an "upscale" food court with views of retail stores, such as  LV, Jimmy Choo, and Zegna.  Not exactly, the scene I expected  from an expensive restaurant, however on the other side there was a piano bar.  However, service was impeccable, except we were only told the beef carpaccio was out when we ordering rather than beforehand.  In a rush we picked tuna tartare as our appetizer, husband ordered mac & cheese, we shared the chopped salad,  king crab legs and sea bass.    We ordered a bottle of Schramberg Blanc de Blanc for $70. Given it is about $27 in retail that markup isn't terrible, beside by the glass ranged from $15 to $30. The wine list is comprehensive.  I am kind of bored with tuna tartare, but it was definitely above average and the portion size of the appetizer is the size of a meal.  It is presented like a tower with the base made of crushed fried wontons, then avocado almost like guacamole, then the seasoned tuna.    The mac & cheese was a huge portion that could feed 4 people on its own or 6 side servings.  I just had to have a bite, it was creamy, cheesy and tangy all the same time; I like the addition of gorgonzola, which still remained subtle.   Definitely an adult upscale mac & cheese.   Chopped salad was solid and I like how we were told the ingredients and asked if we wanted to omit anything.  The King Crab comes warm when it is an entree and that was a bit unexpected, but tasted sweet and drowned in the drawn butter....ooooh, so good. I was surprised how meaty the 1 lb of legs were...easily filling up one person.    I love Chilean Sea Bass prepared any way, but I it was pan-fried to perfection.  The outside crusty and the inside soft and buttery. the seasoning was just salt.  The serving size is probably 8 oz, which is ample and justifies the price.  No room for dessert, but a slice of  chocolate layer cake with schlag (whipped cream) was on the house since it was my birthday.  Very generous.  Overall, pretty good, but again I couldn't get past the view which cheapened the ambiance. We left with enough food for another dinner so that was good too.  Don't know why it is called "beach club".  The environment doesn't in any way demonstrate a "beach club".  That may be a good thing, though.  Will I go again? Probably not, I think Joe's Seafood (NOT the Crab Shack) has a better ambiance and food, except the fish here is better.

FKHYrp0S_sv99yVqk6of1g.text: One of my favorites has now gone by the gutter.  Lack of attention to detail regarding reservation and celebrating a special occasion, lame excuse for credit system not handling chase visas and overall an unappetizing experience.   As a frequent customer to Mastro's I'm annoyed by the way management is handling us as consumers due to a fraud alert on our credit card.  Very impersonal, humiliating and overall disgusting.  We did enjoy the meal but don't feel I'll ever return to any Mastro's in the near or far future.  They even told us after trying to pay that chase visas have been an issue.  AFTER eating that is....BTW the credit was fine and all resolved but treated as lepers as we leave.  HORRIBLE

3S5_ooz_-SWaxEZVn_o5-A.text: Nothing less than the best! Each and every time we have dined @ Mastros we have been treated impeccably! Sam is by far my favorite waitress! She took care of us with attention to detail compared to none. The steaks are perfect and the warm butter cake is a must have on each visit! Fit for a queen!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday dinner @ our favorite spot!

MeqHJLfwq80uDuB-GRJK3A.text: Our wedding anniversary dinner could not have been better. Excellent and attentive service by Jonny. Awesome NY steak and to top it off they gave us a complimentary dessert for our celebration. We will definitely be back.

Mac9WH5kLtPl7hOPr1NSXw.text: It's become a family tradition to dine at Mastro's Ocean Club every New Year's Eve. We're from Los Angeles but spend a lot of time at our home in Las Vegas and this location is by far the best location we've been to. The service is top notch and, of course, the food is absolutely delicious. Every. Single. Time. Highly recommend the vanilla battered shrimp and scallop appetizers. The bone in filet will ruin all other cuts of meat for you. The lobster mashed potatoes will change your life. The Butter Cake will clog your arteries and might send you into cardiac arrest, but hey, at least you will die happy. Silver linings.

_vhlvuaqCEg7sFG1lO73cA.text: This place is amazing! My boyfriend and I went here our last night in Vegas. We had made reservations and got seated right away inside of the beautiful architecture. Our server Megan was extremely informative and attentive. She went through the menu and gave us some suggestions.   We ordered some drinks and they brought out the huge bread basket, which had at least 4-5 types of bread. I really liked the pretzel bread and the cheese crisps. Our server brought out our drinks, The Paloma i ordered was excellent, not over powering but had wonderful refreshing grapefruit flavor.   I ended up ordering the Oysters Rockefeller, Clear Lobster Roll and the Alaskan King Crab Gnocchi with Black Truffle. My boyfriend got the Chilean Sea Bass, wedge salad and sauteed asparagus. The oysters were juicy and full of flavor and honestly this was the best gnocchi I've ever had. It was rich and was full of crab and truffle. The lobster roll was okay, had good flavor. My boyfriend's fish was cooked perfectly and almost tasted like lobster. It went well with the asparagus and gnocchi.   Our plates were cleared and Megan brought out a dessert menu, we were way too full for dessert. However, she brought us out a little pair of chocolate covered strawberries with fresh whip cream for a little sweet treat on the house! Service was impeccable, our water glasses were always full and we were definitely catered to. Megan our server made our experience a wonderful one, I highly recommend this place for a special occasion, it's worth every penny!

tEyNrFqqIPBcAJ3gVw8frQ.text: the service of course is great. We had the 12 oz bone-in filet (in the $50's range) and the 10oz filet ($48). if you like your steak tasting soft like butter it's best to order it medium rare. It comes in a 200 degree plate so it'll continue to cook the steak.   for sides, we had the lobster mashed potato ($39)-it was delicious, it was a bit salty for me  but my party liked it.   cream spinach-bland- i think i had better at Lawry's   Gorgonzola mac and cheese-best eat it while it's hot, once it's cold it's really bland.   the sides are generous, we order one of each  and it was more than enough for my party of 6.  We did have some appetizers prior.    the basket of bread of abundant- prezel bread, garlic Parmesan bread, olive bread and some other stuff.

1HduLkyckXgzf4zPZEXfWg.text: We've been to the maestros in Newport beach and Beverly hills a few times each. They are both better than the one next to aria that we ate at tonight. The bread was delicious, the crab appetizer was also fantastic. We got the escargot and it was actually terrible. It wasn't hot and the snails didn't taste good at all. I was very disappointed, because usually its one of my favorite things to order at other fine dining restaurants. My husband ordered lamb chops and they were very good. I got the prawn special. Each prawn was 8oz. Don't order this dish. Prawns aren't suppose to be that big. They tasted like bottom feeders.   Our friends got the filet and the tuna, both were very good.   Service was good.  Dessert was good. They brought us the butter cake for our anniversary. It was delicious.   Overall it was good and management was great!!!!

j_VtwDbOew2ftxYh6bVPdg.text: This is our 2nd time dining at Mastro's Ocean Club.  Lanford was our waiter for the evening.  He was extremely personable and very knowledgeable about the menu.  We dined on Oysters Rockefeller,  Sea Bass, Scallops, Lobster/black truffle gnocchi and the Brussel sprouts.  Everything was wonderful.  We spoke to 3 of the on duty managers in passing: Nicholas, Brandon and Dan(?).  We have nothing but praise for this restaurant and all who work there.  We will be back!

p0dxVnopxSqIp54eLkxeNA.text: My party came here to celebrate a milestone birthday and we all agreed that everything was top-notch.  Located in the Crystals shopping complex, Mastro's cuts an imposing figure from its perch over and above the mall.  Most of my party ordered seafood and all of it was delicious.  My salmon fillet was perfect and made me feel full and fabulous (thanks, omega-3's!).  All of the side dishes (brussels sprouts, asparagus, etc.) were served by the wait staff and everyone's glasses were kept full.  Mastro's gifted my birthday celebrating friend with a free dessert (butter cake) -- this dessert is worth another visit!  Yum.  Wait staff were also patient with another friend's toddler, who insisted on wandering about and mingling with the singers (dinner music) of the evening.  Thanks for a lovely evening, Mastro's!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My pretty plate!  Fries, salmon, Brussels sprouts, crab gnocchi, asparagus
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sea salt and vinegar fries
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled Scottish salmon filet

c0ZJYfjINzTzJsDV4cVhFA.text: There's really nothing negative to say about this place. The petite filet was amazing, it was cooked to perfection. The sides were delicious. We had the cream of corn, sauteed spinach, mac & cheese and mushrooms. Service was great and the atmosphere was lovely.   I'm just disappointed I wasn't able to try everything on the menu but the next time I'm in Vegas, I will definitely return.

b0t4i7OV-JHW3VnfOp4EoQ.text: How does this place get that many stars. The service is sub-par, the bathrooms are two flights up, and the bartenders don't know a boxed wine from a good wine. I'm sure the food is good but it's been 45 minutes and I still haven't received mine. The steaks just came out but the order was wrong so off they went. I guess the good thing is that the wine numbed my pain due to my empty stomach.

TP6iPlV4oCiEVIbmdM9PeQ.text: This is as good as it gets. Three of us went to Mastro's after deciding on seafood and reading the reviews on Yelp. Everything was top notch, including the attentive service, the gorgeous presentation of the food, and the portions. Some of my favorites included the crab cocktail (with an abundance of crab meat), served over a bowl with dry ice, lobster bisque (creamy and with actual meat), and the black truffle crab gnocchi. I had that night's special, which was a fantastic John Dory with a chardonnay lemon sauce.   Some of the other "little touches" to make the experience better? The server actually served side dishes on our plates for us, and we received a follow up phone call a couple of days later to ensure our satisfaction. Very classy!  Expect a hit to your wallet: Three of us walked out of there at $600, though we did splurge on Grey Goose martinis (shaken table side), wine and lobster. I can assure you it's well worth it!

RecYrlMehlPz4FZjRx3UKA.text: This is the second Mastro's location that I have gone to. I've been to the one in Thousand Oaks, CA a few times and thought I would give this location a try. It is located in the Crystals shopping plaza that is next to the Aria hotel. This place is really nice and you feel a little bit underdressed if you aren't in your Sunday best.   I made reservations ahead of time but the place didn't looked too packed for a Saturday night. We had a nice table an attentive waiter. We got our drinks pretty quickly and the martinis were strong.  There was some live music being heard from the lounge area near the bar area which had a nice touch to it.   I still went with the meat selection even though this was the Ocean Club. My boyfriend and I both had petite which is served on a searing hot plate. The meat continues to cook on the plate and just easily cuts like butter. The steak just melts in your mouth as the seasoning of the meat and light butter from the plate meet in your mouth, I call it Meaty Symphonic Harmony.   We also ordered the sweet potato fries as a side. This is no mere small side dish but a mound of fries is delivered. Each fry is seasoned with an almost tempura like batter on the outside that leaves you craving more and more. I was stuffed after the filet and the fries and the yummy bread basket they bring you (with warm pretzel bread and other goodies).   Dessert is something that just can't be missed and I suggest the sinful delight of the signature Warm Butter Cake and whipped cream. The butter cake is rich and heavy with deliciousness and the whipped cream is no ordinary whipped cream. It almost has the consistency of ice cream as it hits your palate.  This is my treat for the year, it is expensive so be warned but it is also a high class meal. I highly recommend it.

XhL9Yxja7sf1QVG5ccAXFw.text: My husband and I had a wonderful time at Mastro's. The food was excellent, nice ambiance, drinks were great, and the warm butter cake is ridiculous. We came back the next day to have the warm butter cake one more time before our flight home. The medium well petite filet was moist because our waiter offered to butterfly it, the bake potato was delicious, as well as the asparagus. The Blufeld Riesling was so smooth. It was a nice compliment to our meal.   I saw people complaining about this Mastro's being in a mall. It is located in a mall but it is a high end shopping mall connected to Aria where other nice restaurants are located. I found the shape of the restaurant to be cool and it has a nice ambiance.

9Q9fZ740ECI4QM0pCrYy4Q.text: Oh my gosh, this was the best and most indulgent meal I have ever had in my life!  My husband and I had the seafood tower appy, a bottle of fabulous wine, and split the Wagyu beef and a HUMONGOUS lobster.  Everything was completely amazing.  The cost of the meal made my heart stop for a few minutes ($750 with tip)...but it was a once-in-a-lifetime kind of thing.  Bucket list stuff.

vueJv_nRgYUrv1BAGJ8SIA.text: If you go anywhere, go here. Such a classic steak restaurant with a view that can't be beat during sunset. Be careful with the pomegranate martini, it's delicious but lethal!

C29FRqpdT8hzx4UHtXlC6w.text: Best steak I have ever had. View is awesome. Service is on point and I would return. Great drinks and good vibes

cskUjOohICZBEVvRBgbu7w.text: Oooh, we fancy!  The boy and I got all dolled up for after-dinner drinks. It was around midnight (where the night just begins on the Vegas strip), and the place was beginning to clear out (big win for us).  He ordered a Manhattan (as a real man does) and I wanted something spicy, so I got a Bloody Mary.   His drink: strong, bold, tasty--just like him! My drink: spicy, salty, and filled with every vegetable you can imagine--just like... me?   Seriously, though, the Bloody Mary was excellent; it was one of those that burned your throat; being the masochist that I am, I quite enjoyed it. I was also able to snack on the olives and giant celery stick that accompanied it. A drink AND a meal--what more could you possibly want?  It wasn't cheap, but then again, we didn't expect it to be--a snazzy joint like that.

mT7mFZfusJ6fTcfwuCNAaQ.text: Heard about Mastro's for a long time and finally had a chance to try it in Vegas.  This location is insides the Crystals @ Citycenter.  If you go to this location make sure to request to sit in the tree house (it's the giant wooden structure you see in the pictures), it's much more interesting then just sitting in the regular dining room.  The service was impeccable; water was always full, the plates and crumbs were constantly being cleared and the waiter was friendly.  Me and my wife shared the double cut porter house.  This thing was REALLY good, and was probably the best steak i've ever had at the time.  We were not even hungry and we ate half of it.   Took the rest to go and the next day i just straight up ate the leftovers straight out of the box (no fridge or microwave in the hotel room).

25YEZ7mqtSEa8L0LpniN2g.text: This was the first dinner on our vegas trip. My finest restaurant experience yet... ever.  We showed up around 935p after Wolfgang puck's spot close by turned us away (politely) for having just closed. I'd never heard of this chain before.   We were sat quickly. I felt way underdressed even though the staff never made me feel uncomfortable. We ordered entrees, I had some sticker shock but it's Vegas and a nice place. I got the higher end (not waygu) new York steak 16oz medium rare and sides of asparagus and butter truffle mushrooms.   The food was delicious. Every bite of steak and mushroom was a symphony of flavor. The plates are served piping hot and even my last bites were still hot. I finished the whole steak and half of the mushrooms and asparagus. The vegetable serving size is very very generous.  The staff was great, although the food took a little longer than we liked, and I had to remind my server not once, but twice about my drinks.  Had the house specialty cake dessert. Well worth it. Great way to finish up. I was expecting to pay about 200-240 for the whole meal, ended up a little over budget expectations but a great experience is well worth it

W9N4wD1U8jW5IpXa-izGiw.text: Great atmosphere, however if looking for an intimate setting, this isn't it. Unfortunately, dinner was disappointing. The ribeye while prepared accurately temp wise, lacked flavor and the lobster mash potatoes were extremely salty. On the other hand, our waiter was superb.

mtVziwTD8ZLBD2BNLMk36Q.text: Date & Time:  Saturday July 29, 2017 @ 8pm Dining Companion:  The Husband Scene:  Couples on Double-Dates:  Guys in Polo Shorts, Dress Shorts & Loafers & Girls in Little White or Blush Dresses  Decor:  Contemporary Tree House Over-Looking Crystal Shops Service:  Courteous, Polite, Efficient Imbibe:  Martinis Devour:  Seafood Tower, Lamb Chops, Filet Mignon, Cream Spinach & Butter Cake Total:  $225

9i5tnQWlPiP8RPYoVseYVw.text: Food: - special bacon appetizer (delicious) - crab cocktail (AMAZING!) - sea scallops (too salty) - sea bass (great texture, too salty) - brussel sprouts (too salty) - butter cake (very strong butter flavor)  In general, I was underwhelmed by this place. Everything was too salty and this butter cake everyone raved about was not my cup of tea. I guess I don't like butter flavor. I'd rather have a chocolate cake or key lime pie.   Service: top notch as expected.   Location: inside the mall so the ambiance is not what I'd want for the price paid. Awkward to be staring at a store from your seat.   So many other high end options available, I'd rather go to a restaurant that is not in the mall.

ZCgaUnVvUBBBb4xo8I10oQ.text: Anniversary dinner was fabulous! I forgot to take pictures:( bc food was so delicious!! Started off with Calamari for appetizer, comes with a sweet and sour sauce. I ordered the Chilean Sea bass, lobsters mashed potatoes- to die for! Servers were very attentive and friendly. Our bill was pretty high but th e manager was kind enough to waive our anniversary dessert,  choc cake, fresh raspberries & homemade whipped cream.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6RP6PLDZ9PruP64Qv1ohNQ.text: This is one of my favorite sea food restaurants and probably my favorite architectural peice in all of Las Vegas.  How often do you get to eat in a world class tree house?  Once you've eaten here your tummy will answer, Not Enough!  It was my birthday and I had so many choices so I choose Mastro's.  It was amazing from start to finish. We sat at the bar and had a drink while waiting for our table.  One of the nicest looking bars in town and they always pure 2oz drinks!  Friendly professional staff were on top of our every need.  The hostess brought us to our table in the tree house.  I couldn't have picked a better table. We had the perfect view of the tree house and ice sculptures below.  I ordered the salmon and my lady ordered the 6oz filet.  We ordered two sides as they are plentiful. The gorgonzola mac & cheese and the sweet snap pea's.  They surprised me with a butter cake topped with incredible delicious scoop of ice cream and decorated with chocolate.  Thank you for the staff for making my birthday awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RBXwYbuPJRFgMWjAD4gCQQ.text: I'm a local, so finding the right place to entertain family, friends and clients is important to me. There are a lot of good foodie options in Las Vegas, and this is one of them.   Our service was exceptional, from the head waiter (Johnny) to the team that assisted. We had clients invited tonight, so it was important that everyone was left fulfilled. Mission accomplished!  We started with the seafood tower. It was a marvelous piece of art loaded with crab, oysters, lobster and shrimp. I had the crusted sea bass. Nice thick cut and very tender. Others had scallops, ribeye and grouper. Everyone was pleased. Sides were good. Very creamy mashed potatoes, followed by tasty macaroni and cheese, sauteed spinach and asparagus. Everyone at our table was pleased.   My only regret was we didn't have time to try the butter cake for dessert. We had to attend the Bruno Mars concert. (Apparently Bruno Mars ate hear a few weeks ago and really enjoyed it).   Nice ambiance. Great service. Wonderful food. Will be back soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood Tower
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab is King
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sea of Tranquility

DJpmL5MygpA9lovvoAkAJg.text: Returning to Vegas, I wanted to introduce a young friend to a dinning experience to be remembered.   This was my second dinner at Mastro's, and as the  first, it was spectacular.  Service is provided by a small platoon of servers, yet never over intrusive.  The steaks are some of the best I have enjoyed, ever.   I would recommend to share a 8oz Kobe New York steak. And consider ordering it Med. Not the expected Med Rare. The beer fed, daily massaged fat, gets released when you cook a tad longer than normal.    The appetizers are many as are the side dishes. The garlic mashed, snap peas, lobster Mac and cheese, Brussel sprouts, and Himachi all are as expected, most likely exceeding many expectations.  I would suggest to make a reservation, keep your expectations high and be surprised by the service, quality, wine list, and craft cocktails.  Great people watching as well as captivating atmosphere.  Dress is Vegas upscale. A dinner jacket is not out of place.

YizST5ZTTcdLa0qTfHihiA.text: Just barely ok...have to admit I've been spoiled by Craftsteak. The waiter is knowledagble and patient...which is much appreciated. You have to get the French fries they are delicious and my husband's birthday pound cake was decadent...the steaks were lackluster unfortunately. I understand why there are so many offerings like butter sauce etc for the steaks. Not a complete disappointment but certainly not a restaurant I can't wait to get back to.

VijwQFb8h0zp9MqQd0VIgg.text: I give 5 stars for Elizabeth, the berry blast cocktail, the lobster mashed potatoes, the calamari sauce, and the creamed spinach.  I give 3.5 stars for the seared tuna (sliced thinner than any place I've ever seen), the bone in ribeye (one grain of salt away from being too salty) and the rack of lamb (charred too much on the outside).  Overall it was a good meal but I wouldn't order the lamb again. I only ate one chop and took the rest to go. The seared tuna was a huge let down too. Also, we didn't receive a complimentary desert for our anniversary despite receiving well wishes from several members of staff. It's no big deal but reading the other reviews it seems that it's generally given to everyone else celebrating. Next time we will skip the appetizers and enjoy cocktails/steak/sides.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy (ish)

grMkIMQwj-VxFUI5SH61Yw.text: Update: August 2017:  Back again with the wife to celebrate her birthday.  The food and service here was excellent as usual.    Last time we ordered too much and didn't have room for dessert.  This time we ordered a Mambo Salad (basically a spicy Cesar salad with a wasabi dressing), the Chilean Sea Bass, and repeated on the Rack of Lamb and the Sweet sugar peas.  For dessert we had cappuccinos and since it was the wife's birthday they gave her chocolate cake! Sweeet!  Our server Kim was great and very helpful.  Excellent suggestions on the Sea Bass and Mambo Salad and thank you for the birthday cake!  Still a five star dining experience!  Christmas Season 2016:  I love this place!  The wife and I have been here several times. The food is great. The atmosphere is unique.  Always ask to be seated in the treehouse!  Today we are here for dinner and we had the rack of lamb, the Hawaiian Big Eye Tuna and several sides.    They start with a bread basket of several types.  I personally love the pretzel bread  The lamb was medium and perfect.  A nice char on the outside and moist and tender in the inside.  Standard presentation of a lamb "drum stick"  The tuna was barely seared and sashimi grade; served over a bed of carrots, onions, and celery with a beer and soy sauce. Served with wasabi and ginger. Great presentation.  Sides...mac and cheese, sweet sugar peas, and the garlic mashed potatoes.  Helpful hint - they actually offer a smaller serving size on sides (not on the menu).    No room for dessert today.  5 stars as always.

Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cappuccino
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet Sugar Peas

xq9pjf0qwpMKx_Trvuff_w.text: Bad service and the waiters and Pit Boss was very rude, also the ribeye steak tasted terrible and I also ordered the scallops and it was not even cooked. creamed corn and cream spinach  taste terrible very watery. do not recommend this place. I recommend you go to SW Steakhouse or Lakeside at the Wynn

r4ntoIv3MTlf9CLOZs9XQg.text: You will definitely get your money's worth coming here. The food is delicious. I can honestly say it's like nothing I've ever tried before. I got the petite filet Oscar-style. The steak alone was $45 and it's a $36 extra to get Oscar-style. Which in my opinion was totally worth it. The taste was amazing. I also recommend the dream berry martini. It's my favorite drink from there and you can't leave without trying the signature butter cake !

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Petite filet 6oz Oscar-style. It is a $36 extra for oscar-style

WRkgMQMYapGzFLPoouaLFg.text: You really can't compare this restaurant to any other. The staff is impeccably attentive and not pretentious at all. The food is always flawless. A basket of complimentary bread always comes out with the water. The steaks are always cooked perfectly to order. The sides are huge and taste amazing. Usually there's no room for dessert, though they have a great selection on the menu. Reservations are recommended, it's a little pricey but you get what you pay for and then some. Wonderful location inside the Crystals mall in City Center adjacent to the Aria.

9yil6F6KEYyh9y1vdq5GAg.text: First time dining. Wasn't able to get a booth or table inside the "tree house" dome. Booked online for our reservation. They sat us by the service station with the view of the shopping area.  Ordered seafood tower (which is ala carte price), they just put it all together. We also got Sauteed sea scallop and Japanese A5 for him. With the side dish of mashed potato and button mushroom. As well as glass of wine for each. Our server put out a dessert for a birthday.   Decor is fancy, Very tasty dish, expensive price of course because its located at the strip so be prepared to spend about $300+ for two people.  They also offer private dining room upstairs for private/larger party.

BzyS1CGKzKQv0XyQU_e7Ng.text: Looks like an upscale tree house which I loved. Service was good We got the: seafood tower- good but not great scallops- delicious ahi tuna tostada- good jalapeno tuna sashimi- yummy but the jalapenos needed more bite butter cake- very rich but meh we also got assorted cocktails that were all very good

fs_XFqXBnhHpe9gIcAN4Dg.text: Mastro's is among the best steak houses in the country. I like the prime filet. The seafood tower Is spectacular.

nxw_BbztwV8SD_hCAfWIcg.text: We dinned here for Restaurant Week and tried their Clam Chowder beautifully paired with a Rarangi by Wither Hills Sauvignon Blanc (16' Marlborough, NZ) which our server recommended. Followed with a 8oz Fillet and deliciously paired with a Argyle "Reserve" (14' Willamette Valley, OR), also tried the Earthquake Cab which was delicious. The sides we chose were Twice Baked Potato, Cream Spinach, and the Mushrooms. All delicious. The mushrooms weren't out of this world. Average.  For the third course I did the Butter Cake which was very rich and creamy. I should've asked for milk lol. My friend has the Lemoncello sorbet which was perfect! I wish I would've gotten that as it was light, refreshing, and a palate cleanser after everything we ate. Do recommend this restaurant. The bar caught by attention as the bottles were categorized by color. During the weekdays there is a pianist which plays great music from the 70's and 80's.

m7qByV_m6cioTMumuYQPQA.text: This is was the first time that my wife and I stopped in dinner. We both ordered a fillet, one with a potato and the other with cream spinach.   The steaks were cooked perfectly and had great flavor. Sides also cooked perfectly and had a great taste! Very fresh!  The service was over the top! We had Angie Burke as our server. She was super friendly and pleasant. Checked in several times and made sure glasses stayed full. She offered us their specialty cocktails. Las Vegas is all about hospitality and service and that's what Angie offered us.

QbTG3CbsYzjf3xXmUZCBpw.text: Great place for a late steak dinner with no reservations usually. The best meat and chefs plus service is top notch professional.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1CsltiENEMNb-vShQJdQzQ.text: This review is for Mastro's Ocean Club as a part of my (and my girlfriend's) quest to eat at all of the steakhouses in Las Vegas. The overall score is an average of all other categories with steak being counted twice, since it is a review of a steakhouse.    Overall: 4.7 Decor: 4 Bread: 5 Appetizer: 4 Filet:5 Side: 5 Dessert: 5   Mastro's is a  steakhouse located in Crystals Mall in City Center on the Las Vegas Strip.    The decor is very nice, modern, and has an open air concept inside the mall and overlooking a few of the high end stores.   The bread was excellent with a good variety of very tasty breads.   I ordered the  crab cakes as an appetizer and it was very good. For me the lump crab cake at Morton's is the gold standard but Mastro's has one of the few crab cakes that I like.    The filet mignon was excellent.   As a side I ordered a twice baked potato and it was excellent. Mastro's probably has one of the best twice baked potatoes anywhere.    For dessert I ordered the chocolate cake with the homemade whipped cream and it was excellent.    Overall, Mastro's was excellent and a great place to go for special occasions.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet mignon and twice baked potato.

qeHltbbm9pJhvlymdtdXVg.text: Great place, good food! Love the way the restaurant is set up in the wood dome thing. Good service, not terribly expensive.  Definitely had a great time and would recommend this place!

nmnGL2nIJcGtexekmBZDwg.text: Solo, Friday night, after hours of shopping. Hungry and tired. I decided to Uber to Crystals to shop some more. Stumbled to the mall center and noticed the beautiful dome decor of this restaurant. Load of people at 9:15pm. So Yes, I'm going to give this a try.  Hostess offered a table or the bar, bar it is. Great bartenders and service throughout the hour. What did I ordered: mussels, bone-in filet; tomato and onion; foie gras and scallops!  I finished half and box-away the rest. Buuuuurp. Belvedere tonic with extra lime and a glass of Pinot as the chaser.  Not bad at all... headed to more (buzzed) shopping afterwards =)

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mussels galore
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beefsteak Tomato &amp; Onion
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seared foie gras

DMQBvsrJr9zaYrswrjc-nw.text: Praises to Mastro's Ocean Club, and my mother agrees. From the delicious lemon drop martini until the very end. The food is absolutely incredible. Comes out quickly and piping hot. The sauteed shrimp is to die for until the last piece of garlic bread hits your palette. Truly a meal unto itself. You only get three shrimp but they're huge and ridiculously delicious. We probably should've stopped there but of course we didn't. We don't live close so we went for the gusto. We finished with Truffle butter mushrooms, lobster mashed potatoes and Chilean sea bass cooked two different ways. And last but not least, the famous butter cake. This is not the place to skip dessert trust me. What a treat this was. Do yourself a favor and make the reservation.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bruno style Chilean Sea Bass
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Mashed Potatoes
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked Salmon

MFw7MrDsruGm2xmPkZLXgQ.text: We arrived early for our 6 PM reservation and were seated immediately in the Tree House, which was requested.  Our table was large and the seats and backrests soft and comfortable. The Tree House is open throughout and allows for maximum people watching.  Water and a bread basket appeared in a few minutes after seating. George, our server welcomed us and described the specials of the day. Service is not rushed with ample time to enjoy cocktails. We ordered the Petite Filet 8 oz, twin Lobster Tails 7 oz each, Double Baked Potato and Roasted Brussels Sprouts. The Filet was tender and juicy which sometimes is difficult to achieve when ordered well done. A great job by the chef. The Lobster Tails with a side of melted butter was excellent, melt in your mouth joy. We shared the Potato and the Brussels Sprouts. The large size of the potato and the quantity of sprouts were large enough for four people. The sprouts were nicely charred to perfection. Dessert was a complementary birthday Butter Cake with a large bowl of fresh cream on the side. It was the perfect finale to a wonderful meal.  Service throughout was spot on. George checked on us periodically and the wait staff worked as a team in refilling water glasses and removing empty dishes on a timely basis.   Parking is complimentary when using the Crystals Valet parking service

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tree House Entrance
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted Brussels Sprouts

saLrsQTOx3TrGXiqgehxog.text: Search steakhouses on Yelp in Vegas and you're going to be overwhelmed with choices. I was recommended Mastro's by a friend who lives in Vegas, so I decided to dine here on a Saturday evening. Reservations were a breeze to make online.   For a starter, we tried the bone marrow which was unreal. One of the best I've ever tried and I've had bone marrow prepared a few different ways. The bone marrow also comes with a side salad with a light vinaigrette dressing and capers which was a nice extra.   The main courses consisted of the seafood tower (this is totally customizable) and the alpine steak. The seafood was so fresh, my favorite was the east coast oysters. The steak cut like butter and was massive, plenty for two people to split. I highly recommend adding a side of the truffle butter mushrooms to top the steak with.   For dessert... BUTTER CAKE. Just do it. Amazing!   Next trip to Vegas, skip the branded steak joints and hit Mastro's.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Daou Cab Sav
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Butter cake with home made whip

wWyCLW6q7f-fD2b2-6Wvvw.text: This restaurant is beautiful and consistently excellent. Not like hey everybody I had a great meal as everyone says about everything. I mean really top tier.  Yeah, you will pay for it too. But you will know where your money went.   I had a chopped salad to start. The bartender (I sat at the bar) suggested I might be happy with a half salad. I appreciated the suggestion. He was right. It was plenty and very good. Next I had the boneless 18 oz ribeye with fries. He suggested a smaller fries order. Same thing -- he was right. I like medium rare steak but I always think medium rare is too red in many restaurants. He suggested medium rare plus. They nailed it. Then I had dessert. I like profiteroles but only when made with ice cream, no cream filling crap. They really get it right -- dark chocolate and vanilla bean ice cream. They come 5 to an order but he suggested two instead. They were huge and it was more than enough.    When I want to be sure my steak is going to be excellent, I go here (or SW Steakhouse). You won't be sorry.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Medium rare plus. Perfecto.

dpYN5Ik4lvAmX_WR3-tYhw.text: Everything was great!  Took a group of clients here for dinner + my wife's birthday. Staff was super attentive.  Service is always TOPS when we come here. Staff worked hard to ensure we had everything we needed. See you next time Masteos.

8xKdfw7Y5PNgzceu1FkiVg.text: Outstanding! A beautiful restaurant with impeccable service and an outstanding menu. The escargot was delicious. However, we did request garlic to be added as it is not traditionally prepared with garlic. The rack of lamb was so delicious and the sea bas encrusted with panko and Parmesan was served at an excellent temperature. Two of us shared the sauteed spinach with garlic.   An excellent experience all around

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dining area

BMM1ZtmgUYu7jO4A0Z-c0A.text: We usually eat at the Beverly Hills location so wanted to dine at the same place for my birthday in Vegas. I had made reservations ahead of time & pushed it an hour later because we were running late. We ordered the same thing as what we would eat in BH. The tomahawk steak 32oz was enough for the both of us... creamed corn, garlic mash & my favorite the butter cake. The steak was cooked medium & it was cooked to perfection. You have to get it with the truffle butter. I must say the service & food was spot on. Our waiter Johnny was very pleasant we had a more enjoyable dinner. This location is very busy but there is enough employees to always fill your glass. Would definitely come back here when I'm in Vegas.

Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6DnRo8mg9iApQ4SsKtgtqw.text: Worst, they over salted a $70 steak,  then they made another with NO seasoning!  The manager asked if I'd like a third... I've never before posted!  these people are amateurs,  they think they are wonderful!!  Servers have attitude, manger it young and untrained   This is the last time I'll come here!

R7TnCCidr2JutdCQyvu7Fw.text: Don't let dining in a mall through you off. Mastro's is a top notch dining experience.   Wait staff was excellent and the food was memorable. Is was looking for a surf and they did not have that option on the menu. The waitress and I bandied options on how to get there. We settled on the Alaskan King Crab Black Truffle Gnocchi to go with my steak. This is a wonderful dish but super rich so I'd only order this again IF 4 to 6 people were to share it with me. A little goes a long way.

fV95HJIml0nzCfi12sNTLg.text: I made a reservation here for a Saturday night. The restaurant wasn't too packed but definitely busy. It's in the middle of the mall but the way it's designed you don't feel as if you're in the mall.   Service was impeccable. Waters never got even halfway empty and dirty plates were immediately removed. I wish I could remember our servers name because she was fantastic. So kind and knew every detail of the menu. She even flagged a few items for me due to my food allergy.   The lobster starter was great! Two large lobsters and the meat was soooo good! For dinner I got the petite filet. It was cooked perfectly! We ordered a side of their lobster mashed potatoes. It was enough to serve about 4 people. They didn't skimp on the lobster! There were so many large chunks mixed in. This side is a must! I'm still craving it!   Definitely a must try restaurant if in the Vegas area!

Lg6yDtDjS04sUQi4OlLR0A.text: First time trying out this place after many years of walking through the Crystal Mall. The exterior design and appearance of the restaurant is definitely appealing and eye catching. The interior is also clean and gives you a comfort feel. The steaks here are priced as what you would expect at a fancy steakhouse. The sides were also priced slightly high with the cocktails. We shared the 40z Waygu Tomahawk Chops (Snake River Farms). My other friend got the filet mignon and the bone in ribeye. The Tomahawk was pretty tasty and cooked perfectly.  The sides I had were also tasty - I liked the cream corn, truffle butter sauteed wild mushrooms, and scalloped potatoes. The service here is great as you would expect from this establishment.  Overall,  a good experience and I'm glad that finally tried this place out.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

R64cz05pg4e7J_UMV9M39A.text: Always a great experience.. I've been fortunate enough to enjoy the locations from CA to NY and the Vegas location provides the same level of class, quality and experience. Chopin Dirty Martini with blue cheese olives please and thank you! Everything is great, but if you've never been here before make sure to order the lobster mash as a side and for dessert, the butter cake.

T0aINv_cAiKIlk_r8dXRew.text: The best sea bass ever! So tender and juicy and flavorful. Crab cake was pretty awesome too. The side (mushroom) was a little too salty. Butter cake is a must try! Very classy setting and excellent service. Overall, I would give the whole experience a 5-Star!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilean Sea Bass
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mastro &#39;s Signature Warm Butter Cake
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

M3CBWbFS56-_Q1FOxXNbNQ.text: Mastro's is so unexpectedly nice to be inside of a mall. It's a "Luxury Mall" and this restaurant is luxe dining. The crab cakes were delicious and meaty, and the blackened swordfish was well prepared.I also had the house salad with vinaigrette. Very delicious.  But (by a huge margin) the best part of the my meal was the truffle butter mushrooms. Oh. Em. Gee. Order this and get your entire life! Sides are large  shareable portions. Two of us tried to finish them and couldn't. I just kept eating more and more.    Even afterwards, greed made us try the butter cake. I had time to take a picture. A small size is enough for 2 people. It's very rich. But tastes fantastic eith the fresh whipped cream. So happy our waiter suggested it.  I wish they had a larger selection of wine by the glass, but this place is obviously emphasizing sharing food and drink. Worth the price.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rum butter cake

gML_-9QbDkKxlMBE2osjEg.text: It's in the middle of the shopping mall but don't let that stop you!  We freakin loved it here!  Oysters galore, shucked right! Squeaky clean I got the Chilean sea bass, we both did! Macaroni and cheese side was so good   I would recommend it!

OceCw7xPpAnjgJhCK1sJYw.text: We came strictly for this! This heavenly butter cake!!  You haven't lived till you tried this cake.  Wow wow wow  But really wow.   Service is great, everyone is so nice and amazing always.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2dr9NmP-mPfocTly63CDCQ.text: This restaurant is basically in an open space in a mall on the Strip.  All the noises from the mall, like people shouting, enter the dining area.  Mastro's tries to drown this out by playing their music very loudly, which is also not consistent with fine dining.  My date and I arrived on time for our reservation at 6 pm.  We ordered steaks and split a Caesar salad.  We got our salad promptly, and then we waited.  At about 6:45, our waiter said he would check on our entree's, but he didn't come back with an update.  At 6:55, I asked our waiter to check again.  By this time, people next to us who had also ordered steak were finishing up their meal.  The food came at 7:00, exactly an hour after we had arrived.  The steak was too hot to eat, still, (which means the kitchen did not let the meat rest the requisite 8 or so minutes before serving), and I burned my mouth on the first bite.  Once my steak cooled off, it was tender and had a very good flavor, but my dining experience was basically shot.  At $63 per steak, I expect the total package to be much better than it was.  I won't go back there.

5VLycYdokPdyxkJgi6-0Jg.text: Excellent place to entertain clients.  This was not my first time at Mastro's and they never disappoint.  The Wagu beef was the best I've ever had.  EVERYTHING wasa absolutely delicious, and the staff is as professional as they come.  Unfortunately for me, after this visit, I fell ill.  I have no reason to believe it was because of Mastro's, but when they called to follow up on my dining experience, I told them, in the event others had also had issues.  They assured me they had not been aware of issues, but would talk to their chef, just in case.  They followed up with two more phone calls that rang True of genuine concern.  I live in the Chicagoland area and had no idea they had a restaurant in Chicago as well - if not for their phone calls, I may not know for a long time.  Class act, all the way around.

ZJIVRSCeDreefAaz6-q-ow.text: This is my favorite restaurant in las vegas..the staff is perfect and managers are the best

y1uzA_qjupG5tbXIoNQkqg.text: I LOVE Mastro's in Beverly Hills so I did not expect this one to meet the same high standard but boy was I wrong!  The service here was excellent!  We had a large party and they accommodated us with ease and the food was delectable!  Definitely one of my favorite places to eat in Vegas now.

COWwEJ2-MP2nTzCMAYhByg.text: One of my favorite places. The food and service are awesome. The lemon drop martinis are great. Lump crabmeat cocktail is delicious. Steaks tender and tasty. Try to sit out in the treehouse for a unique experience. Top notch dining experience.

LyMYlctJra6zWA6pzLF0hA.text: This place is the best for fish.  Get the tuna, and get it raw, or close to it.  Lobster mashed potatoes are superb, probably has a whole lobster in an order. At almost $40, it's not a cheap side, but worth it and more than enough to share with a few people.  Service is always great.  Mastro's is obviously not cheap, but if I'm going to spend that much for dinner, this is the only place I know that still consistently over-delivers at that price.

OtY_X6QJ-fMNXbzrfRoI_g.text: Wow, what a great dining experience! It was my boyfriends 21st birthday weekend and I wanted to treat him to something special, and special it was.  We were seated in the "Treehouse" and our server Lionell was the best, he gave us great recommendations and he was very attentive. We shared an order of the tempura shrimp for an appetizer, I had the twin lobster tails, my boyfriend had the new york strip and we shared a side of the creamed spinach. Wow, wow, wow is all I can say. They also brought out a huge slice of chocolate cake after dinner for my boyfriend, something he wasn't expecting, it was a nice surprise and we both really enjoyed it.   The whole experience was great. We will definitely be back, no doubts about that.
