Lqeo8L5kJQCPL5ufsIvFJA.text: I died, went heavenward, then came back and ate more butter cake & its accompanying cloud of fresh whipped cream. This place is exceptional. Clean, chilled Belvedere martini. Spicy Mambo salad (chilled chopped romaine hearts with grated parmesan; a horseradishy/wasabied Caesar of sorts) to start & bone-in 22 oz ribeye for my beauhunk & seabass for me. Ambiance is stellar. A terrific experience from start to finish. Thank you Mastro's!

zwVbEt5-Kn1E1na3DLz0MQ.text: Outstanding...and I live at the ocean and love steak!  Not my first "surf and turf" experience, heck, not my first of the week but probably the BEST I've ever had.  We went with the live lobster table side shelled by Tanya and the bone in fillet.  Lobster cooked to perfection (not over cooked) and steak was so tender it cut with a fork.  Drinks and sides were also wonderful...house special lemon drop, crab and truffle gnocchi, twice baked potato and mushrooms.  WOW!  High end Vegas at its best.  Shops with million dollar dresses in the window surround and live "Vegas style entertainment" abounds.  Definitely highly recommended (and the ONLY five star review I've even written on Yelp!).*  *((edit: ok at the time the only fiver I had given...found you need to do fives sometimes to bring up the average from the unwashed...sorry to be misleading in anyway ';-))

0-4NV6R3qDLF1MLnEYLNYg.text: Maestros is amazing! We added one more person at the last minute and the host were accommodating. We had a party at 7 and the night flew. Our server was great. Everything came out 5 stars. They must have forgot my boy friends steak but they were overly apologic and the manager brought it out himself. Portions are huge so plan accordingly. The check wasn't bad. 106$ each with tip and a lot of bottles. I got the 6oz Fliet and couldn't finish it.

0QNqlicbtvgwoEfKL_uF2A.text: We came for lunch & service was excellent.  First we ordered the Lobster Bisque, this was not too impressive it had 2 pieces of lobster in it. Then the Fried Calamari came & this plate was plentiful! We were surprised how much they gave us & could not finish it all. For my main dish i ordered Halibut Fish & Chips, this came with 5 small pieces of fish & the fries were too salty. My husband's main dish was Grilled Prime Burger, this burger was huge but again had salty fries.

oOe5gY9JbW_8h561GLyQ7g.text: Reservation was at 9:30 but didn't get seated until 10 and was given some excuse that someone bought the whole wood area and it affected the rest of the reservations.    They treated us as we were small potatoes compared to the large group.  Will not go to any Mastor's again.  Food was good though.

MOa30acFOInfloRBlOKRuA.text: Can I just start off by saying, THIS specific Mastro's set the bar for all future fine dining for me.  We were in Vegas for my boyfriend's birthday and knowing that he loves steak, I got us a reservation at Mastros after seeing the high reviews. I left a little note with my reservation on Open Table stating that it'll be my boyfriend's birthday and requested to be seated in the tree house. We got everything we wanted and more!!  First off, we got there about 5-10 minutes early but the hostesses seated us right away. They even greeted him happy birthday and sparked a lovely conversation with us while walking us to our table. She was so friendly and made us feel comfortable knowing that it was our first time dining with them.   When we were seated, our waitress (whom I wish I remembered her name because she was simply the greatest) got us all settled with drinks and everything. She too greeted my boyfriend happy birthday and went on to tell us her recommendations since we were new to their menu. My boyfriend jumped at hearing the tomahawk steak so we went with that for him. Me, I'm not really a steak person but I really wanted to try their lobster mashed potatoes and their king crab black truffle gnocchi. I couldn't choose between the two so she said they can split half/half for me and make it an entree. Ahh, she made life so much easier! After we placed our orders, my boyfriend realized that he wanted some sides since his plates was just going to be a huge hunk of meat. So we asked her if we can add some sauteed mushrooms and spinach if it wasn't too late. She made it happen!   While we were waiting for our food, all the passing waiters or hosts all greeted my boyfriend happy birthday. We were so shocked cause damn, they made him feel like a king! Everyone knew it was his birthday and they made him feel super special, which I lovedddd. Our food came out after what seemed like barely 5-10 minutes, so quick! We didn't really hear her when she described how big the tomahawk was.. But when it came out, it was a huge 30-33 ounce steak..LOL . He devoured that thing till he couldn't any longer. Every bite melted in our mouths, it was delicious! They placed all the sides on our plates one by one, making us feel like royalty! Everything was delicious!!! They even brought him out a complimentary birthday cake and offered to take pictures for us. Overall, I was so mind blown by the superb service we had that night. My bf said I won best girlfriend of the year award for this dinner. (;  Expensive? Yes. But it was worth every penny!! I will definitely be coming back every time I'm in Vegas!

PT2L0rLrfk5VPEvYdRhsfQ.text: This place was recommended to me by a friend who lives in Las Vegas. We were celebrating a birthday. The ambiance and the service were just starters to a terrific meal. Our waiter was helpful with suggestions and the other waitstaff was BOMB!  When our appetizers arrived ( calamari, and dungeoness crab cocktail was oh so good. Dinner was delicious. We had the blackened halibut x3 and the other person had the lobster tail. Our sides were   Sauteed broccoli, lobster mash, sauteed asparagus , all were top notch. FABULOUS!!!  The service alone was 5 star. And the food was another 5 star.   We'll be back. Yes it's pricey, but who cares!!

CkzJoaRKIkcJcqNitFqKQg.text: This place is delicious.  Outstanding service and excellent.  My only gripe is that it is sooooooo expensive.  Otherwise it's 5-star all the way.  Perhaps you get what you pay for?

EyFIK0hJBdlWYdzkZqmT8w.text: The service was excellent and the food delicious. However, the location wasn't my favorite since the restaurant is located inside the Crystal's LV shopping center and it has an open view which you can see all the shops. Otherwise, it would be 5 stars.

o_lIDulwrI12ZuN57ZFHbA.text: Ok, so my other half was raving about this place based on various peoples' opinions....we tried it out on vacation and I wasn't that impressed...the place itself is beautiful and innovative...but the food and service left much to be desired  It was decent at best, the appetizers were blah...we ordered sweet potato fries (totally can't mess those up) but the alleged "vanilla crusted something shrimp" were just plain old fried shrimp with no hint of vanilla anything...my steak (filet) was cooked ok but hers was supposed to be prepared medium-well but came out talking to us...  My biggest complaint was the service of our waitress...she literally rushed us like I've never been rushed before and I was born and raised in NYC...I was chewing my so- called "vanilla" shrimp when she brought out our steaks... with our appetizer plates still half full...  I think it was way too pricey ($250 spent) for 2 people (included a $50 bottle of wine)  We wanted to try the buttercake for dessert but felt so rushed that we left very annoyed...Such a high quality place needs to be stricter when choosing wait staff...not to mention another young couple next to us complaining about the same problem of being rushed and the place was not busy that night so it wasn't like they needed those deuce tables...

bQJTClgVbWj3mv7sVBP7iA.text: Unbelieveable experience! Went there with a group of 8 and sat in the treehouse. The food was fantastic but it was the service that made the night. Our server knew the menu inside and out and made recommendations that everyone enjoyed. She even knew all the preparations inside and out. Some had seafood while others enjoyed the signature steaks Mastros is known for. Also the cocktails were great. If you have a group and are looking for an A+ experience while in Vegas this is a great choice.

k4Qf_lT6OtrCZd5g_2cCmA.text: WOW I was pretty impressed with this place and I've done my share of dining in Vegas. The decor was modern and in the middle had this treehouse area where there are more tables. That night, they happened to have the treehouse rented out so there was live music playing which got a bit annoying since it was loud. That was my main complaint.   On to the food. We started with the seafood tower and I wasn't even hungry going into this dinner but I gobbled everything up. It had jumbo shrimp cocktail, kunumoto oysters, crab claws, lobster, and king crab legs, the works. It was presented with dry ice. They served it with cocktail sauce, this mustard sauce and atomic horseradish, when you mix all 3 it was a pretty good sauce that way too.   I was pretty full so I opted to get a salad and I chose the iceberg salad. Now I have to say i always get dressings on the side but this dressing was a red wine vinaigrette but it was creamy looking. The waitress said it was emulsified but there was no cream in it. It was the BEST salad dressing I have ever had! I think i wanted to dip every lettuce in a spoonful of dressing, that's how much I liked it.  It just had this tangy taste (from the red wine) but a smooth creamy texture but it had no creme. YUM!  I tried my bf's steak and he had the rib eye and it was delicious, melt in your mouth meat. Our favorite steak houses in Vegas are Michael's (Southpoint) and Cut (Palazzo) but I think Mastro's takes the cake on this. We had so many sides, potato's au gratin, snow peas, yam fries, mac and cheese but I heard the gnocci here was delicious from the rest of our party although I was too stuffed to try.   But the best part of dinner was the dessert! We had the warm butter cake, it tasted like a mix of pound cake and maybe cheesecake but it is served with vanilla ice cream and had a creamy inside, and sugar flakes line the cake to give it texture. Oh and it comes with homemade whip cream! I think that was better than the ice cream, I wanted to eat gobs of it.   This is definitely a favorite now although the seafood tower is VERY pricey, it was probably half of the price of the meal, and we were with a party of 10. n

NAcaenk063tJOSfem8IFKA.text: I am glad I tried this great restaurant out.  The restaurant is located in the Aria City center in a mall called the Crystals.  It is located on the second floor that looks like a wooden Aladdin lamp.    The ambiance was great.  It was comfortable, cozy, and had live music.  The food was pretty awesome.  I ordered the cowboy ribeye cut bone in steak.  It's the second largest steak on the menu.  It is probably by far the best cut of steak I've had.  It was tender, soft, and juicy.  The potatoes au gratin was alright.  Next time I am going to try the lobster mashed potatoes.  The bread they serve is pretty impressive.  You actually get a bread basket full of different assortment of bread.  There is pretzel bread, wheat, white, bread sticks, and others that I can't recall right now.  Tasted like it was freshly baked that day.  The service is the reason why I gave this place 5 stars instead of 4.  Our server was outstanding.  He was pretty knowledgeable about the food.  Helped me make up my mind on what I want right away.  Didn't give me too much info where it would confuse me (it doesn't take much to confuse me).  He checked up on us every now and then to see how we were doing on our meal.  He asked if we wanted to order dessert.  We declined because we were stuffed like a turkey at a thanksgiving dinner.  So we politely asked for the bill.  So our server brought us back a raspberry sorbet with our bill.  It was on the house and and he said he couldn't let us go without having dessert to complete our wonderful meal.  How cool was that!? I am not a sorbet fan, but I still take a few bites cause I'm a fatass.  I recommend to go and enjoy the food, but I will return because of the service.

mAEDSCTDw1eVo7F9kXeuxQ.text: I gave this restaurant 1 star because at least the service was good, but the food was horrible. First we got the escargot as an appetizer. Parts of the escargot was cold and tasted like dirt. It was obviously frozen and not cleaned well. Just to let you know this is not our first time eating escargot, it's one of our favorite dishes, so we've had it plenty of times. As for the entrees we got the swordfish, which was extremely dry and tasteless. We also got the seabass, which was over cooked and the filet steak which was over chard. It was very disgusting! Very disappointed in the food.  How can we tell our server that all of the food that came out was disgusting. We didn't want to make a scene so we just ate what we could, paid and left. Our first and last time ever going there. The price that you pay for the food, it was definitely not worth it. We've had 100 times better. Mastro definitely topped the list for the worst expensive restaurant in Vegas. Definitely will not be returning. Great service but horrible food. Don't waste your time and money.

8rffSx-Ay7_rVeidbtIh-Q.text: The were some definite pros and cons at Mastros.   The service was top notch, very impressed. Sat on the edge of the tree house area, prime spot.   Had lemon drop martinis throughout the night, they are served with dry ice so it appears as tough there's smoke coming from the bottom. Very nice, cool experience!  Ordered bone marrow and 3 MASSIVE shrimp for an appetizer (served with dry ice as well). The bone marrow comes with bread, I had never had it before but since everyone raved I thought I would give it a try...it was very good but I don't know what the hype is all about, in general---it's just a delicacy? The shrimp were delicious but I was not a fan of the cocktail sauce...waaaay too strong for me.   Ordered the lobster tail, not impressed at all. However, if you like a smoky taste on seafood, then by all means, order it. I was not a fan in the least, very disappointed. For sides I had the Gorgonzola mac & cheese and chic peas. Both are buttered to perfection, definitely worth the fat and calories.   I also happened to go on my birthday so they surprised me with their Butter Cake (with ice cream and whipped cream) everyone couldn't stop talking about and OMG I completely understand why. I would have never chosen to order it but I can say, with confidence, that this is hands down one of the tastiest, most well made desserts I have ever eaten. You have not lived until you try it.

n-VIoAFQyvz39ROKPOcvaQ.text: Great place and location in the upscale Crystal mall.  The service was great and matched what you would expect in a high end restaurant.  The food was good but not great blow your sox off.  We had crab legs (a little dry) and halibut also overcooked and dry.  Both had an ok taste however.  The tuna jalapeno appetizer was quite tasty and the serving size was nice too.  It was a great experience but I am not sure the meal matched the price.

yxoiiNf11vuA7i8tAyehpA.text: Had a fabulous dinner at Mastro's! We started with the Seafood tower with crab and oysters. Definitely delicious! We had the calamari which was also lovely. For our entree we had shared the wagyu tomahawk steak with gorgonzola mac n cheese and creamed corn. For a tomahawk given it's size it was actually cooked quite well at a medium rare. The creamed corn was actually the best I've ever had so buttery and creamy felt totally decadent! Service was excellent and personal. We went with our 2 young kids and the staff took care of us all. Will definitely go back to try other things on the menu!

vVa69Bu5-y-B0_uwnhKDSQ.text: My husband and I have been to Mastro's twice, once for work and most recently for my birthday.   1. Service is good.    2. Caesar salad was over dressed and had too much cheese.  Gavin Degraw was also eating at the restaurant that night and shared the same feedback on the Caesar salad.    3. Steak is the reason that this rating is 4 stars instead of 5.  We have had far better steak at Craftsteak. But the side of mushrooms that you can order with the steak is sooo good!  4. Butter cake was a great dessert but there chocolate cake was very dry.  Both you could share with someone else.  5. The lemon drop is one of the best I have ever had.  I will order it every time I am in Vegas. The wine list is also reasonable and has a lot of good choices.

Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab cake
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon drop.... Soo good!! Comes in a shaker.

0-QaBNE7Ca5eLjj20AKveg.text: Well I have never had a bad meal here and the great steak I had recently keeps that streak alive. We had prawns the size of my hand and those were outstanding.  Blackened swordfish was in our group and it was well worth it, I can't recall how many sides we ordered but I took lots of food home. Have you ever had the butter cake? You will see God. Our server Sam was super wonderful and a delight for the eyes, she took splendid care of us. Thank you Mastro's , again.

KvNA-TtzPfQxZ99tcuLvuw.text: I had an exceptional meal here this past weekend. As always, my eyes are always greedy and I order more than I could ever eat. I ordered the following: 1) clam chowder was delicious, however, it could have used more clams. 2) crab cakes were one of the better crab cakes I've had. Plenty of crab meat! 3) Gorgonzola Mac n Cheese was outstanding 4) lobster mash potatoes was good but nothing special except the few pieces of lobster added to it 5) snap peas are in season and always worth ordering 6) rack of lamb was cooked to perfection and I really enjoyed it 7) can't leave Mastro's without ordering some butter cake:) 8) Mr Michael provided us with exceptional table service:)

wieD5paFjugnu6BmMjyfuQ.text: I read all these great reviews and I just don't get it.  I've eaten at the Beverly Hills location on several occasions and LOVED it.  I've tried on many occasions to duplicate the Tomatoes and Onions at home, but never the same.  I've been in Vegas 4 years now, and never knew that this was here until about 3 weeks ago.  It was so beautiful that i couldn't wait to try it.  Since it was my birthday, I said "Lets go to Maestros."   Why am I the only person to have a bad experience here?  The waiters and bussers were waiters and bussers, no personality at all, but thats not what i went for, so no issue there.    I wanted the Tomatoes and Onions.  When the server sat the plate down, i asked "Those are sweet onions, right?"  He replied "Yeah!"  They were not. Three slices of tomato and 2 slices of a regular onion that you would put on a hamburger, burned the inside of the nose.  Calimari was very good.  We both ordered the 22 oz bone in rib eye, mine medium rare, my guest Medium, with a few sides:  Gargonzola Mac & Cheese (Pretty damn good), sauteed spinach, and Burnt Brussel Sprouts, which they were.  When they sat the plate down, the steaks looked like they were for Fred and Barney, and they tasted that old.  These were the worst steaks that I've ever had.  I sawed (literally) a piece off of each end and could not go any further. A chainsaw wouldn't help. The taste was like that of a 30 year old cow.  My asked asked "Does yours taste like an old cow?"  "CLEARLY!"  The busser asked if we wanted everything to go:  I said "Sure, but please place this steak in a separate box", as i intended to give it to one of the homeless people on the bridge.  When he heard us discussing how awful the meat was, busser told us that he could put it on the grill a little longer.  I told him that that wouldn't help it.  So, He boxed it up and the waiter gave us the check.  NO ONE (Manager, waiter, etc...) ever asked, from the time that the steak was sat down, "How is it?".  At Del Friscos, or Hugos Cellar, or descent restaurants they always say "Please cut into the center and let us know if that is prepared correctly", before they ever walk away.  I guess that they are tired of seeing the sawing action. After Paying, waiter said "Till next time" to which my guest replied "there wont be a next time!"  Trust me, I really wanted this to be an awesome experience, as it was my birthday, the place is BEAUTIFUL, and it took some talking to get my guest to go with me.  Check was only $250, but $130 of that was a total waste.  I could NEVER go to this place again, not even for free.

0ZF68jEQXY-rLZonTFPY5w.text: There were 7 of us for dinner.. What we all loved was the personal recommendations from the servers.. From the drinks to the apps to the entrees.. It was pricy, but it was worth it! We got the seafood tower, lots of steaks and recommended sides.. And a free birthday cake/ice cream.. That was amazing...   We all enjoyed ourselves, everything was great!

WfJ9dR4zlPMqjLyX5LR2Rw.text: Overall place is overrated and average. We were a group of 20 people and the overall opinion was average. Service was slow.

2nqfJRclhnM1YtOU2YZVGQ.text: Food was good had the lobster 2 ways buttered and vanilla battered! Also we had the mashed potato, green beans, and the twice baked potato. Service was great as well

apdJ7tcOLIkwOrRgr5BFNQ.text: Mastros is the best fine dining restaurant for the fairest price on the Strip. They're not over priced like all the other fine dining restaurants in Vegas. The lobster bisque and Arctic char are delicious! A must try in Vegas.

1zIErUFYcirTlPK_xvswjg.text: We have been here a few times prior. This time the service was good but the entrees were just average.  My wife had the sea bass and I had the bone in ribeye. The bass was okay but lacked flavor. My ribeye was perfectly cooked but was probably the leanest ribeye I have ever eaten.  Good flavor just needed more fat like a good ribeye should have.

HfL8aG7o4hf8pp04fx6vfA.text: I would like to sincerely thank Jacob for helping me, over the phone, to surprise my friends who were celebrating their upcoming nuptials.  My friends had checked in on social media, and I wanted to surprise them with drinks or dessert.  Jacob kindly searched the restaurant until he found them (they didn't have a reservation) and sent over dessert immediately. Jacob - they were so surprised and thrilled!  Thank you so much for making this wonderful trip for them even better.  I can't express how grateful I am for your amazing kindness.

Jdzla_V24hSia-TNixnWug.text: Ordered the NY strip 16 oz. I asked for it to be cooked medium rare, but it was slightly more rare than I had expected. Nonetheless, it was still an amazing piece of big juicy steak. I would like to say that I went a little overboard with the whole pound of steak. The 12 oz would've sufficed.  We had a side of lobster mashed potatoes. Mashed potatoes were really creamy and the lobster blended well with the gravy. Overall, I felt it was a decent side. Don't know why people keep raving about it.  We had sauteed mushrooms for our second side. These were very juicy and well flavored. Mushrooms and steak make an amazing combination.  I will definitely be returning next time to try their seafood.

q2GD36bfZxPWW0W8R1z73A.text: Came here with my cousin for my birthday last night. I have been to the Crystal Cove location (Newport beach) so I was really excited to try this one out! I was pleasantly surprised I love the dining area overlooking the mall:) the food was impeccable , the service was awesome and the drinks got me!!!! I will definitely be returning!

Our waiter was excellent and took good care of my table. Keep on going guys. I sure to come back soon. Cheers

RmRkNNJPoYQ2wiJMOvg-8w.text: Hand's down, some of the best seafood I've ever had.   Everything was fresh and excellently prepared.  The sides are great for sharing and it's definitely worth it to take the plunge for the lobster mashed potatoes.  The service was exceptional and the interesting martinis were a treat!  Great people watching with it being located in a fashion mall in Las Vegas as well.

5XNp9CH0hnJB6mBOKw4sBA.text: HIgh quality up market steak house. I like the location in Vegas you are seated in this amazing hardwood balcony/nest in the middle of an expensive mall. Great service and great food.

jcQgvYTFrcu3Bbg59Fvv3Q.text: Gr8 steak and seafood in this elegant and classy restaurant.  The wine list and bar menu are top shelf.  Desserts are other-worldly.  Service and ambience make me want to say "shut up and just take my money."  Just as good as the one in Newport Beach sans the ocean view.

We_F3NmopO07hkXseech7A.text: Last night I had a terrible meal.   The calamari was over breaded and there were only rings, no legs.   Both fish entries were over cooked and flavorless.  If you want a really expensive Denny's ($250 for 2, wine / no desert) this is the place.  Service was great.

B1GlGbK1I9ajLPAlfdDMpA.text: Excellent location at crystals aria and excellent food .this is my spot when I have visitors from out of town .

0Wvuog4II6L1uVXBV3Urqg.text: The perfect place for a great steak!  No matter which location we visit they are all a great experience.  The butter cake is a must have, tell them you are celebrating something and it's free!!  The Mac and cheese is a must try, not for the calorie counters.  Cocktails are awesome.  This is not the place if you are on a budget but a great place for the special occasion.    Even with all of the choices in Las Vegas Mastro's is always at the top of our list.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. You&#39;ll need the black chips

S4_3j0RiRakKjMR6eVqmAA.text: I loved this restaurant as soon as we arrived. The atmosphere was classy and I loved how cozy and romantic the treehouse dining area was. Started with an $18 pomegranate martini which was well worth it. I loved the variety bread basket on the table.  The food was absolutely delicious. My boyfriend and I shared the mussels as an appetizer and were both really impressed with the flavor and freshness. I also loved all the little garlic crustinis that we're everywhere in the sauce. For dinner I ordered twin lobster tails which my server nicely de-shelled for me table side. My boyfriend ordered a steak special - wagyu beef which he loved. Overall the service was outstanding and the food was delicious.

TKK9H2fiweiIB4n3o_J7Bg.text: Again 5 star! Excellent food and service. Always on point. Great atmosphere and ambiance. Can't wait to return. Had the garlic mash potatoes, 22 oz. bone in rib eye, and seared brussel sprouts. Incredible!!

Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best on the strip.

9PaTrKneJss97-eRtmVatQ.text: Been to the one in Beverly Hills and now here. Great spot. Similar steaks to deal fricsos. Order martinis at the the bar. You pay for one but get 3-4 out of them! Bone in filet is epic.

_WHo7jcR_kVYKyk8JcSD8Q.text: Fab!  Make a reservation and sit in the 'treehouse.'  I was a bit concerned when I read reviews because I am a HUGE fan of the LA location but everything was GREAT!   Who knew items from the Seafood Tower can be served warm?!?! Pre-cracked Crab Legs? 2lbs heated up please!  The 12oz Petit Filet was devine.  Gnocci with Truffle and Crab, Shrimp Scampi, Sweet Potato Fries... Oh boy!  The staff was also very aware of show times and kept asking to ensure we did not miss our show.

2ILt6uznZjYUbr049eo_fg.text: To start, great atmosphere. The bar is very attractive with the artistic bottle layout.  The restaurant is set up with a patio like feel, so its a little loud.  Food was great, steaks were cooked to perfection, and the sides were spot on. I highly recommend the mac, it pairs very well with the steak. The service was good, the waiters were very knowledgeable and professional. Even if you are stuffed, order the butter cake to finish off your dinner, you won't regret it.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YrYOTPTShTT7ZsH-fMeBOg.text: I was REALLY dissapointed.  I had heard great things and I have been wanting to go here for a really long time. We came here to celebrate my husband's birthday and we made reservations a couple of weeks prior. When we got there, the hostesses were not only rude to the patrons, but also rude to each other.  They were talking back to each other, rolling their eyes and just plain unpleasant.   The servers were great to the patrons, but we were sitting pretty close to the kitchen/bar and could hear the conversations of the servers and management and could tell that they just don't get along well. That made the experience a little bit of a downer.   As far as the food, I was just so disappointed!!!! Talk about the biggest let down ever! We spent about $300 on everything and it was not worth it.   First course was the Clear Lobster Rolls which were ok but we could get better sushi for less elsewhere. We also got the tuna sashimi, also good but had too many sesame seeds.  Second course was the clam chowder which was really good! The part that upset me though was when our main course arrived, I was still eating the soup, but then they took my soup away mid-bite and didn't even ask if I was still eating or not.   Our main courses were the twin lobster tails, which were really salty. My husband got the Chilean sea bass which was pretty dry but my husband said the flavor was good, but since it was dry, it felt kind of dense. We also got the mushrooms and lobster mashed potatoes. Both were delicious and seasoned well.   All in all, we will probably never go back again. The only good thing was that they did give my husband a complimentary cake for his birthday. We enjoyed the cake and the cream that came on the side.  Average food, mediocre service for a really high price. Not good.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Appetizers
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clam Chowder
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Twin Lobster Tails

Mn88z9xnpzycP_HPu4tIYQ.text: This was actually my first time at mastros, and the food was delicious, although a bit on the salty side.  First of all.. The bread was to die for.. My friends and I had to restrain ourselves from devouring two baskets of bread so we won't be too full for our meal.  We ordered a Caesars salad split between three people, but it didn't come out until AFTER our meal and sides came. I didn't think that was very professional, but everyone makes mistakes.   We got the cream corn and lobster mashed potatoes for our sides. They were both to die for! I ordered the sauteed scallops which were delicious but a little too salty for my taste. My two friends ordered the filet mignon and the bone-in ribeye, which they loved.   We also ordered two bottles of the Argyle Pinot noir, which our server recommended for us. It was wonderful.. Not too sweet, not too dry.   We also informed our waiter that it was our friend's birthday, so at the end of our meal, they brought out an amaaaazing butter cake with a candle!   Overall, the experience was great, especially sitting in the nest! Lol

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheers!
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Argyle Pinot noir and stuffed bread basket yum!
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sautéed scallops!

LRzz0K9b15OdF_pV3vhvkQ.text: Best in class service, experienced staff, outstanding steak and seafood, large portions. Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mastros Ocean Club in Crystals, Las Vegas

lmFp8njvQK2hoGunk-kv8A.text: So let me first start off by saying I don't eat seafood. At all. Allergies make life fun.   With that in mind, I'd actually be giving this place a 4/5, but I can't say that as everyone came out very happy, including myself. The only drawback I had was the steak, an 18oz NY Strip on the bone that was nothing particularly special, but definitely adequate. When I say adequate, I mean a steak I'd expect to get at a mom and pop 'steakhouse' in the midwest, not one of the nicer places in Las Vegas.   Mastro's has one of the coolest locations in Las Vegas. The exterior bar in the Crystal Shops is flanked by retailers like Audmers Piguet, Tom Ford and Richard Mille....I mean, its hard to walk into the restaurant when so many cool shops are right next to it....but hey, that's neither here nor there. It actually has nothing to do with the review, I just love watches. Actually, the interior design probably plays into other people's reviews, so...uh...idk, 5/5? Would interior decorate appreciate again?  The staff was amazingly attentive, down to Earth and incredibly good at their jobs. I was incredibly impressed with the knowledge of the somm, and our waiter was very, very good at his job.   Everyone got appetizers, the foie gras was incredibly good...and I foolishly shared with another at the table. Given the portion was like 2 bites in total, I got one. Still damn good.   Dinner came; steak was decent, potato was...well, a potato...hard to do anything with a simple starch that would be categorized as amazing, but it was an overall good meal. Everyone at the table raved about their seafood though, like...they loved the place.   If you're still reading this, ha. But yeah, I personally think 4/5 due to 'meh' steak, but overall I'd definitely come back for the great staff, great location and great wine list.

atHss_h61MqM0zoOvkKOGQ.text: Mastro's is AMAZING! Every single thing I have tried at this restaurant is DELICIOUS. Their dining room is very unique yet has a classy fine dining feel to it. My favorite tables are located within the "tree house" because who doesn't want to be in a tree house? =)  I've been there a bunch of times and below are some of my favorite food items: - Alaskan King Crab Legs - (Available by the pound) Comes out warm and ready to eat with the shells already cracked open. They serve it with melted butter but I prefer their cocktail sauce instead. - Cocktail Sauce - Yes, I put this in it's own category LOL. It's AMAZING. This is the best cocktail sauce I have ever had. It has the perfect amount of kick. - Shrimp Cocktail - huge, plump, and delicious! One order includes 3 shrimps. It comes out in an entertaining presentation because of the dry ice below the bed of ice. - Dungeness Crab Cocktail - This is probably the best value for the seafood tower appetizers. You get a bunch of crab meat with a few different sauces: cocktail (again, its the best!), Mastro's mustard, and extra horse radish (super strong).  - Bone-In Rib Eye - They seem to cook a little more on the rare side. Possibly because the plate comes out at 400 degrees. (Be careful!) The meat tastes fabulous alone but they do offer Bearnaise and Peppercorn sauce as an option. - Sea Scallops - Perfectly cooked and savory (Appetizer portion has 3, Entree portion has 5.) - Signature Warm Butter Cake - THIS IS THE BEST DESSERT EVER!!!! Warm butter cake topped with a scoop of vanilla ice cream and served with a huge side of whipped cream. It is quite large and well worth the price! Serves 3-4 people easily.   The service is genuine and attentive. If you put any notes in your reservation such as a special celebration, they pay close attention to it. It was so nice to not worry about telling the server it was my boyfriend's birthday.  I know I listed a bunch of my favorites, but if you could take away anything from this review, TRY THE BUTTER CAKE! =)

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert Menu (January 2016)
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dungeness Crab Cocktail
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sea Scallops (appetizer portion)

gmm8pdILEfXyPEaUdoiExg.text: First off the seafood tower was amazing but everything after that was hands down one of the worst experiences I have ever had. We ordered a wagyu steak that was over $100 and it was served well done although we asked for MEDIUM RARE. The manager treated us like peasants when we brought this to his attention, walked away before we found a resolution, and ignored us for over 15 minutes following the encounter. They then brought us an ice cold steak to try to resolve the situation. I unfortunately had a client dinner here next week with my CEOs but I will have to cancel because I cannot take a business risk.

0MZkTI0HddVKcP4gFTzTzg.text: We went last night as a party of seven for a farewell dinner before I head to the middle east.  We requested the tree house and a round table and it was perfect.  The service all night was outstanding, water glasses never got less than half empty.  We all ordered apps, salad/soups, main course and dessert.  The escargot was great, very garlicky and the sauteed shrimp were excellent.  The Caesar salad was good, but you could really taste the anchovy, if you don't like anchovies, stay away.   I had a bone in filet and it was the best, most melt in your mouth steak I have ever had.  All the steaks, sea bass, scallops and lobster were great.  The only critique I have is that my father's rack of lamb was quite under done.  We should have sent it back, but he refused.  Overall, a great place for fine dining, bring your $$$$.

6WPWQz_zS3pmlsF0-xUTGg.text: Very few restaurants I've ever eaten in has ever left me walking away so satisfied feeling that they couldn't possibly top themselves... except Mastro's. From being ushered into the beautifully unique wooden architecture aka the "Treehouse" that housed the restaurant, to the exceptional service and, being, overall, treated like royalty, my party of three had pretty much felt that we had eaten at the best restaurant in Las Vegas.   Nestled aesthetically inside the Crystals at the City Center besides Aria Hotel, Mastro's was incorporated within the shopping center, in the midst of luxury brand names: Vuitton, Zegna, Cartier, et al. The most striking feature of the restaurant was how the interior of the restaurant is actually built into a structure that resembled a treehouse skeleton, with no solid walls in the main dining room. This monstrosity emerged from the ground floor and grew at least eight stories into the air and eventually flowing symbolically into the ceiling.   The dining experience was superb. Highly attentive, the staff reminded me of 3-Michelin star restaurants but at much lower prices and with sense of humor that made it fun and even more memorable. The maitre d', well-dressed in a fine suit, was always attentive over the entire dining space like a hawk and was quick to address diners' requests. Our waiter was especially quirky and cracked a few tongue-in-cheek jokes that were appropriate for our young, lively group.  As for the quality, it was on par with most upscale restaurants. Steaks were delivered in juicy perfection. The incorporation of seafood into potato dishes were noteworthy, especially the crab gnocchi and lobster mac and cheese. There wasn't anything else the chef could've done to improve these dishes.  These were the items selected by our table:  Alaskan King Crab Black Truffle Gnocchi *** Roasted Brussels Sprouts ** Lobster Mashed Potatoes *** Bone-In Filet ***12oz Filet ***12oz Gorgonzola Mac & Cheese *** Clam Chowder **  *   don't bother **  average/good enough *** exceptional  Not realizing that we had ordered more than enough food for our small party, we opted to take the rest home, which the waitstaff briskly took care of and within minutes, returned with all of the food packaged in their own individual black to-go boxes with the Mastro's sticker label affixed to the top and neatly arranged in a shopping bag.   Bathrooms were supplied with an assortment of items found in medicine cabinets had personal effects like Tums, men's cologne and mouthwash and someone to hand you a paper towel to dry your hands with. Again, Michelin-star quality without the Michelin-star price.   Best $350 spent in Vegas. Worthwhile for a beautiful night out to impress your significant other, client or, perhaps, to just have the best fine dining experience in Sin City.

Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

J7kMSEc4Y5zEIwFgthaU5g.text: Mastros is a great restaurant with a very cool dinning room built like a tree house. The wine list is very extensive and the service was great.   Our main course was delayed for some reason & I was really unimpressed by my steak. It was good steak, but it was a bit dry and tasted like it had sat under a warmer while someone forgot to tell the expo guy. My wife's Lobster was overcooked and dry. We actually sent it back which is rare for me.   All in all our meal was good, but not 5 star in my opinion.

V0xnoLT46HNQVkxVGreGLg.text: A bite out of the ars of some heavenly bovine.  This place truly had the best meal I believe I have ever eaten.  Best as far as the entree goes (filet, mac n cheese, etc..).  However I do think the seafood appetizer though delightfully displayed, was just "I've had better.  The service was cool, although the group I was with had built that up something fierce, and it was a bit lacking from the time they had been there before. If you really want great service, check out the Chilis in Layton, Ut.  This is not joking, that is some fine service. They will never let your drink go empty, a mistake Mastro's made.

8jKG0SdW1-ywy5QCb0P1Ng.text: Great dining! Very good Service! The food is delicious, get the bon in fillet steak 18oz with string beans and almonds, and mash potatoes! Chef knows what he is doing!

QH_Es2rq13Z9S46mn6JZag.text: This restaurant is so amazing. I can't get enough of their delicious 8 0Z filet mignon, garlic mash potatoes, and macaroni and cheese. Of course you can't just stop at the dinner you have to order s butter cake for dessert. I don't know how or what they do to make this cake so moist and buttery but it's addicting. The butter cake also comes with home made whipped cream made in house. My boyfriend loves their bone in New York steak 22 0Z it's so big. The complimentary bread basket is a nice touch also you get different varieties of bread while waiting for your food. I recommend getting your steak butterflied and well done. The steak always comes out on a hot plate sizzling. Maestros is becoming a Friday or Saturday date night habit for me and my boyfriend. We always get Stephen as our server he rocks he's so awesome. He's taken a nectar note of what we like and always remembers how we like it prepared. He's the best server hands down. For drinks I recommend the lemon drop martini it comes out ice cold and has smoke on top and it bubbles and makes a crackling sound. My boyfriend drinks the Maestros Margarita. The ambiance is beautiful we always request to sit in the dining area which is inside this beautiful caged area over looking the crystals mall attached to Aria. If you haven't tried Maestros you are in for a major treat. It's pricey but worth it. You. Any put a price on good quality food and service.

YL4Ra5_xF_Pf927VS11ErQ.text: My first thought is, 'it was ok'. My wife agrees. While we had a great service, everything was just 'ok'.  We have been to many nice places in Vegas and nothing here 'wowed' us. overall it was a good experience.

ap3t9oeR5hwfJyVFFuXbAw.text: Based on my food I would have given this place a two stars.  I ordered the sole which which was bone dry.  I could not eat it.   FYI ... Everything is a la carte.  The service was very good.  The "treehouse" location of our table was unique.  Drinks and wine were good, although pricey.   I would not return because they could not cook my entree.

_-JDBvJ0zGVfhFFc0InKyA.text: This meal was FANTASTIC!       We started with the calamari, it was so fresh with a spice on it and the sauce was tasty. The bread was fresh and I just love a good piece of bread yum! My husband had a salad and he enjoyed it greatly.  For the main course I ordered Chilean Sea Bass, OMG! prepared just right. My fish just melted in my mouth. I forgot what my husband ordered but he was completely statisfied. We ordered the Gnocchi and the sauteed broccoli as our sides, loved the Gnocchi and the broccoli was good.   I cannot recall if we had desert, but if we did I'm sure it was great. As far as ambiance goes, the place was nice and they had live music going thoughout dinner and we enjoyed it.

35Cph81Ts0Ur8HBfERht0g.text: I have been to the Mastro's in Los Angeles and when I saw the Ocean Club at the City Center in Las Vegas - I have to say I was a bit taken a back. Do not get me wrong reader - here is this amazing bird's nest modern structure that looks like it should be in a museum somewhere....nested in a MALL. Given the shops were all upscale. But still, a MALL to say the least. It had that new mall smell that you'll just never get out of your clothes. It left me wondering what the restaurant and atmosphere would be like during dinner service. Well, I didn't have to wonder. My group had planned a bachelorette dinner for the lucky bride to be.   Staff - These people are pros. Seriously, every person works together like a well oiled machine. We had a group of nine girls, which is not easy but I'm sure they see that pretty often. It is Vegas. And the service was fantastic. Our waiter and the whole wait staff was really great and accommodating. Our reservations were at 745pm and we had to be out of there by 915pm to catch our ride. They were so mindful of that the whole time, but also didn't take away from the experience.   The meal - What can I say about the food that has not already been said? Pretty much nothing - so I'll just reinforce what my fellow yelpers have been saying the whole time - it's amazing. I ordered the salmon and one of the other girls ordered a fillet and we shared both plates. Both cooked perfectly. For sides - Lobster mashed potatoes, regular mashed potatoes and asparagus. All delicious.   The whole experience was wonderful. And I had serious reservations about what this was going to entail when I walked in. But Mastro's did not disappoint. I enjoyed stepping back and being able to compare my experience in LA to Vegas. And although each restaurant had their similarities whether it be with the menu or just how the staff serves you, both restaurants still had a their own uniqueness which made each experience stand out.

tFBlhAOyUxPBx2L0Mi10hg.text: I think Mastro's has good food, but the food itself is not worth the price.  You are really paying extra in exchange for the privilege of eating your dinner inside of a giant, 3-D artist's rendition of a tree house.  It's still pretty good though.  I got the big bone-in fillet, creamed spinach, and club house salad.  The house salad has shrimps and crab in it.  It's quite good.  The warm butter cake is OK.  I thought the grain was coarse and the flavor was just "yellow".  I dunno, it's just not as good as everyone keeps saying.  But I still gave it four stars for the architecture.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Me after stuffing myself to the gills at Mastro&#39;s.
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Warm butter cake and too much whipped cream.
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The waiter is smiling.

wjwBrSVJ0QfrZoLX5bfYww.text: Hooray pretzel bread!  Great steaks and sides, can't go wrong with Mastro's.

y8CrFeY5NdKbVv4zWiTKUA.text: Purpose of the visit: our signature meal event for the weekend get away with the guys. Chose this place as an alternative to the meat temples that are typically selected and it was also close to the Aria. The atmosphere was interesting, very open and spacious overlooking parts of city cent. The birdhouse was an interesting design and seating experience. We ordered mussels, vanilla battered shrimp, sauteed sea scallops and sushi sea bass ponzu. The ponzu was excellent lightly fried and tender. Battered shrimp also was nicely flavored. Main course was blackened sea bass. Grilled sea bass was very flavorful. Sides w French fries, sauteed spinach, desert was also fantastic. Warm buttered cake was a great way to finish the meal.  Atmosphere was lively and supported by a nice two person live band that sang some nice good old rock and roll covers.

RgCwQZwqovuZT-5CNYmN_A.text: My fiance, Shanyce and I  went to Mastros during our vacation around Christmas time and had a wonderful experience.  We eat at the Palm Desert  Mastros often and had to try out the Vegas location. Our server, Sam, made our experience even better.  We had a great time.

3flrfua4cjcNOk1eP_zAdg.text: I live in Orange County and have always wanted to try Mastro's steakhouse but have never had the chance. A short trip to Vegas and we needed a place to dine- so Mastro's Ocean Club was the choice for the evening! When we made reservations, we asked to be seated in the treehouse- what a cool ambience! Bread basket was super yummy but pace yourself- don't want to fill up before that delicioussteak gets to your table! Orders at the table included: Mastro's salad, filet mignon, shoestring french fries, baked potato, side of mushrooms, and the sauteed asparagus. All were delicious! All 3 of us had the filet and it was perfectly cooked and DELICIOUS. Can't wait to go back! We were so full but had to have dessert so ordered the butter cake and we were not disappointed. I'm not a huge fan of cake but this was one of the best desserts I have ever had. Great service and great food!

v4VPAnDlWafwgtYTEE6maw.text: I really don't get what the hype is. My husband went here with his friends on his bachelor party and said it was sooo good so he had to take me. I don't know if when I went, I just got the wrong thing or what, but I got the ribeye steak and it was just average. It was not as good as some of the steak I've had in the past and it was very heavy. I have heard the bone in filet mignon is very good but have not been able to try it yet. The sides are okay as well. It's a very roudy restaurant and the ambience is not that great because it kind of floats atop a shopping area. It was not as good as everyone had been raving about.

6B8Hn_b6DaRcIlcX4GPkfw.text: My first visit to a Mastro's was this past weekend and they didn't disappoint.  My girlfriend and I had the bone-in ribeye (x2) and the lobster mashed potatoes.  The steak? Cooked and seasoned to perfection.  Nice buttery taste to it even though it doesn't come out in a plate of butter (like that other steakhouse.. heehee).  The lobster mashed potatoes?  Heaven on a dish.  It is definitely a must order the next time I go to a Mastro's.

AS6re6Ffrxa8y4jvab4CnA.text: Unexpectedly great experience. We Spent our day at the pool and worked up quite an appetite. Always wanted to try Mastros but weren't sure if we would be welcome in our casual pool attire. Amazingly enough our server Shauna (not sure what her last name is) treated us as if we were dressed to the nines. We felt very comfortable and had a great meal. The food was excellent especially the escargot and lobster soup. Definitely coming back next time we are in town

auCPV6ln2bEadYSfmJ_e0g.text: My new favorite steak and seafood house in Las Vegas.  Went again last night and had a magnifcent experience!  The manager, Scott, is a terrific guy. Our server, Sylvia, was charming and attentive. And the food... How about a 32 oz bone-in ribeye!! OMG! (I'm just getting out of the hospital now...had my blood cleaned.)  It was worth it. That's why Crestor was invented.

NmdDdPV0A47N5mcMf8go3Q.text: Shady rolled in to Mastro's to commence his epic 8 night assault on Vegas on a sunday evening 8.30. Housed in the Crystals Mall(one word of caution-if u come to Crystals with a special someone plan on dropping a few k$-its 5th ave on steriods). Seated in the neat tree house, Shady and Co. started with some seared Ahi tuna, well presented and delicious. Shady and lucky guest split the bone in ribeye and the crusted Halibut special and side of roasted sprouts. The steak and brussel sprouts were spot on. The Halibut was a touch disappointing, undercooked in spots and with no real oomph in the flavor. The dessert had to be the signature warm butter cake. Big enough for 8, Shady and friend got 1/3 through and called it quits. The creme fraiche was outstanding and the cake as good as advertised. But why so huge? Service was very good, and the vibe very enjoyable. Shady always have reservations ordering fish in Las Vegas, and next time will stick with what Shady thinks is their forte-the meats. 3.5 stars.

6IIPOlLKFJaKdJ-O4saUOA.text: One of my favorite steakhouses. The only part missing for me in regard to this location is atmosphere. The two Arizona locations and the Beverly Hills location have an intimate atmosphere. I find this open air mall location distracting.

ny7q2EFDSO4Z_xqGZ_3zqA.text: My first thought when seated was, "It's a good thing all of these world class stores aren't doing any business because it sure takes the edge off a high-dining experience along the mall food court railing". Our table felt like a satellite location for a sparkling contemporary version of daddy's classic steak house. And we weren't even seated in the satellite (you'll get it if you visit). It just seemed surreal for a "room" with such distinguishing attributes. I won't hold that against them, much.  It was just my son and I that visited to celebrate his 21st. Matt was our dining guide and he was fun. Not like, "let's have a Vegas night!", fun. Just that he carried his demeanor well and kept his smile on. He was very, very consistent in that his presentation to each of the three tables nearby was identical, and specific. He was meticulous to ensure accuracy and satisfaction.  We were completely impressed by the young lady and gentleman entertaining the room. We later learned that it was their first night at Mastro's. Their acoustics in that challenging environment are absolute perfection and their talents are superior.    We went light on the openers which were supplemented by an abundant variety of stellar bread choices. My son is All-American in his need for a Calamari appetizer. It was the best we'd ever had, and maybe will. I had the Ocean Club Salad and, again, maybe the best complete salad I've ever enjoyed. My son ordered the Bone-In KC Strip a little less than medium and he dubbed it The Crown Jewel of his steak experiences. He couldn't finish it and he finishes everything. I asked for the Bone-In Ribeye. Matt helped me herd descriptives into a perfectly cooked finish. I'm still thinking it's the fact that I live in Colorado, where even onions and garlic sometimes have difficulty offering flavor, but if it's possible to have too much natural flavor in a steak, it happened. I'm taking accountability on that one, because it's not Mastro's fault I live at high altitude. This was a huge steak and I hardly dented it. We sided up a strong contender for best garlic mashed, which we carried out more of than we ate. So we get this this lovely shopping bag, consistent with the elevated neighborhood, to carry our midnight snack down the strip with.   I have so many reasons to go 5 star all over this place and fractions of thoughts about why I wouldn't. Those fractions, the bulk of which are carried by the food court railing ambiance, add up to one. And I won't insult Matt because I liked him.  When I return in May, I might just take the other half of the family because I can't go wrong on this one.

04_DlAWgUTNBIfPLv8qJng.text: I'm torn between 3 and 4 stars. The location is weird to me. If you're all about s calm and tranquil atmosphere when you eat.....this is not the place. Service is super fast and super efficient. The kind of service I want when I go to Denny's. Not when I'm trying to enjoy a nice dinner. Like I said efficient but very rushed but I guess that is to be expected in Las Vegas! We split a filet and two lobster tails, sauteed asparagus and mushrooms, I had a bowl of lobster bisque. Asparagus was whatever, mushrooms were tasty, steak was perfect , lobster was too salty and not really fresh. Same with the bisque, it had a slight fishy odor. Lots of lobster and the flavor was good just not FRESH. Again, it's the desert so what did I expect? This was my first Mastro's experience, and while I wasn't disappointed, I wasn't too impressed. Satisfied. I would try the Beverly Hills location, but not again in Vegas.

4_wfUAhsIOcNyrwo5NsPcQ.text: The food is great & the portions are generous.  I had the tuna tartare & the twice baked potato & my boyfriend had the filet & sweet potato fries.  This place never disappoints!  I always look forward to eating here & the one back home in LA.

QOnFyPUtEncTk8B444SQfQ.text: Food and service is impeccable! My fiance and I went and can't wait to go back! I had the filet and he had the bone-in ribeye, both we great! Their twice backed potato was too good to just consider it a potato and the king crab claw on ice was delicious! We go to steak houses often everywhere we travel but this is definitely in the top for us.

siyU7Ksvn42wEH5nT15l4A.text: Better food than most upscale restaurants, good service weird location and set up. I prefer to go to the Mastro's in L.A.

tq-jH0loSMk1yFL3tKNn8Q.text: As yummy as it gets! We came to this restaurant based on reviews and we love trying all the great restaurants when we are in Vegas. Wow Mastro's did not disappoint! The lobster mashed potatoes were delightful and my filet was cooked to perfection. There was a fun band playing when we went which really added to the ambiance. It was pricey but so worth it! Oh and our waitress was truly the best! Oh and the buttercake for dessert was soooo good the real whipped cream was to die for =)

w6JN__GaOjfMWe-OYcdQNA.text: My girlfriend and I took a whole week vacation off to visit the West coast. It was our first time trip to visit Las Vegas, and the entire experience was amazing and unforgettable. Amid the many alluring performing shows, the endless eyes-dazing slot machines, and the gigantic resorts were some of the most fantastic restaurants that Vegas could offer.   We first passed by OC while exploring the riches on the famed Strip. It was located within the beautiful Crystal. Upon seeing it, both of us were intrigued by the outstanding artistry presented by the original designer. The structure's frames were made out of steel and covered with fine, deep red wood. Between the frames were giant crystal clear glasses that allowed a perfect view from both within and out. However, the most salient and attracting feature was that the entire structure was slanted. My words would be lacking and limited for the description, but just imagine an hourglass tilted like a forward-slash sign. Bemused by its charm, we booked a table on a Monday night and dressed in proper attires, girlfriend in a beautiful orange-red dress.  We arrived around 10pm after seeing the fantastic Le Reve at Wynn. Being Monday night, the restaurant had only a few tables occupied. We were given a table near the crystal glasses, which allowed an excellent view for the outside. Our waitress of the night was very friendly and polite. As she went slowly on explaining the menu she also told us that the structure was called "The Tree", its name inspired by the tiny leaves spurting out of the joints of the steel frames. From the menu, we picked "Dungeness Crab Cocktail" and "Vanilla Batter Shrimp" for appetizers, a "Fillet of Arctic Char Oreganate" with "Alaskan King Crab Black Truffle Gnocchi" as entree and side dish. The crab cocktail came in a special tall glass container filled with mist giving dry ice. Each large lumps of crab meat was tender and fresh with the saltiness and sweetness of the ocean. The vanilla fried shrimps were gigantic in size, each crispy on the outside and tender within, a must try for shrimp lovers. The arctic char was perfect, cooked to medium-rare the way I loved. It was a huge fillet more than enough for the two of us to share. The Oreganate style was foreign to me, but the combination of butter, spices, and bread crumbs had made a wonderful sauce suited well with the fish. The gnocchi was huge in portion, baked in large hot skillet and filled with delicious cheese and crab meat. The mix of crab meat, cheese, and truffle gave the dish an unique and saliva dripping aroma. However, due to the large portion, over-stuffing this huge amount of cheese, crab meat and gnocchi is not recommended. You would need to trust me on this, as the first 5 bites would have you mouthwatering for more, but double that you would start having the too-much-cream-stuck-in-your-stomach feeling, and beyond that would be just too much to handle.  Alas, at the end, gf and I had to pick out the delicious crab meat along with the truffle to eat and wasted a large amount of the gnocchi.  Regrettably, since we were on a tight schedule for a night club to visit, we skipped the desserts - What a shame! Dinning at Ocean Club was such a wonderful experience. My gf and I enjoyed every minute from beginning to end. Yes, it was a very expensive place, but so was everything else in Vegas and every penny spend was well worth it. So by chance if you ever stop by Vegas, be sure to checkout this amazing restaurant.

eN3GlFUMqjPvh7gcnt1smA.text: Delicious! I started with Conundrum Mixed White from Cali, then had the Chilean Sea Bass Ponzu (FREAKING AMAZING) and the Jalepeno Tuna Shashimi... Both are amazing appetizers. I then ordered the Sea Scallops and the side of brown butter Brussel Sprouts... I've never had a side as good as THOSE BRUSSEL SPROUTS! Addicting. I was dreaming about them last night! The Scallops are in a butter sauce that I could drink! Thankfully they serve the dish with bread to soak up some of the amazing sauce! PLEASE DO YOURSELF A FAVOR and visit this restaurant! The staff is amazing!

tMP85P4fHYrW_7CSZfNZfw.text: Was lucky enough to go here two nights in a row during CES. It was awesome. The steaks are high quality and cooked perfectly. The sides were all very good. The seafood tower is a fun thing to order with the dry ice making a cool effect at the table. On the 2nd night we hd a group of 15 and they put us in a private room which was nice. If you need to make a large reservation ask for Carly... she was very helpful!

0UxitB6WMXkC5BU5Cva5_g.text: Fancy.  The 18 oz. steak and lobster mashed potatoes were very good.  The steak was juicy, and lobster pieces were with every bite.  Yes, this place is pricey and it was busy.  Split the dishes if you can.  Also, the bread served before the dishes were very very soft, and warm.  I think reservations are a must here, but you can also sit at the bar area if seats are available.

Pk4t3ZTsNkdrt-QWBXfmlQ.text: I do not get the great reviews this place is getting. Main course was awful. The restaurants in Orange County & LA are so much better then this.  I was there Friday May 4th with a group of 20 people. I thought it would be amazing since it is Mastro's after all. It was the opposite. Good service, but food was so so. My twin lobsters were so over cooked. It was tough & crunchy. I ate half of one & gave up. Felt bad not to eat it, but it was awful. I eat lobster all of the time & it's supposed to melt in your mouth. That was not the case here. The rest of my group ordered filet mignon & they were all complaining as well. Over cooked & chewy is what I was told. The shrimp cocktail was fine. The oysters were ok. The asparagus wasn't good. The cremed corn was good. The alaskan king crab black truffle gnocchi was excellent. The creme brulee was great. But, I would never go there again. Unless you are in the wooden dome seating area it fells like you're just eating at the food court in the mall. Not what I expected. Save your money please & go to STK in the Cosmo or Joe's at Caesars. The lobster is to die for.

IGQuNLVnjbBOW5P1mJ8m8Q.text: My fiancee and I dined in the grand piano lounge a few nights ago. Service was impeccable, our server Raquel was not only knowledgeable, but put up with all of my questions and requests. We absolutely loved the music  and since we make a trip to Vegas a few times a year, you can be sure we will be back. (Hopefully at the same high table near the bar with that sweetheart Raquel.

JTLDdXsJi3jo3fwcr0J8Jg.text: I have been wanting to try Mastros Ocean Club for a very long time.  We were on a short vacation from Los Angeles.  I have to say that I was disappointed with food and felt it wasn't worth the money.   We were a party of 4.  Started off with the tuna tartar tower and escargot.  I thought they lacked flavor.  I've had better at other places that are not that expensive.  My daughter had the gnocchi with Alaskan Crab as a entree.  She enjoyed it.  My son and BF had the Petite filets 6 oz and 8 oz.  They were tasty but again nothing special.  I had the twin lobster tails.  They came out cold and were flat and just ok.  The sides we had were basic Garlic mash and asparagus.  I informed the waiter about my lobster and he gave us the butter cake on the house.  I thought that was nice.  But then again heard that it was amazing and I didn't think so and happy we didn't have to pay for that.  Our server was nice enough but nothing special.  Guess my expectations were to high.

Ek3EYhgbRtS3Waa2eKmo3Q.text: Just wanted to update all of you and say that the manager reached out to me and apologized for the poor experience we had there.  He informed me that they would be opening up a location in NYC and would be sending me a gift certificate to enjoy on my first visit to the new location.  I will update after that experience, but I was very happy with the response I received from the manager.  He showed that the restaurant really does care about the opinion of its customers.

R8xF5SdHRmBwq0WgaYKIHw.text: As a newer Yelper, this is only my second review and beyond deserved.  On our most recent trip to Las Vegas last weekend, my boyfriend and I ended up unexpectedly at Mastro's Ocean Club in Crystals inside City Center for the first time.  We go to Vegas quite a bit (about once every 2 months or so) and have passed by this place quite a few times.    The interestingly constructed architecture of the main dining area has been quite the source of amusement to us in the past... it resembles something like the shell of a wooden submarine that has exit chutes above and below it to spit you out into Crystals when you are done with your meal (btw, this is a joke.  You do not get ejected from your seat.  It is only my strange sense of humor that comes up with this stuff).  My imaginative uses for the architecture aside, the design/layout is nice; it makes you feel as if the restaurant is floating in the middle of Crystals with a very open and airy feel.  As we were walking through Crystals on our way back to our hotel room at Aria from a long day of shopping, we decided to make an impromptu stop at the ejection submarine and see if there was any chance they would take us as walk-ins on a busy Friday night.  With it being such an upscale spot, I was sure we would either be turned away without a reservation or asked to wait for a ridiculous amount of time.  Au contraire!  They offered us immediate seating in the bar/lounge area or a few minute wait for the main dining room.  Since we felt a bit underdressed for the location, we opted for the bar/lounge area and were glad we did.  We had the perfect seat right next to the piano player and fiery red-headed chanteuse, who was pleasantly entertaining.   We were promptly greeted by our amazing server, Sara.  The only reason I know her name is because I made sure to ask her for it when we were leaving as I knew I wanted to review this place.  Sara was so attentive, knowledgeable about menu, friendly, and always two steps ahead of us -  really as perfect as a server can get.  All of her recommendations were great as well.  I had the swordfish (I hadnt met my mercury quota for the month yet) and my boyfriend had the bone-in Ribeye.  We shared the most delicious side dish - the Alaskan King Crab Black Truffle Gnocchi.  My swordfish paired very well with gnocchi and it was the perfect combo of light and creamy.  However, my boyfriend's Ribeye wasnt anything stellar.  It wasnt as flavorful as a most quality Ribeyes should be.  It's on our do-not-order-again list.  This is an "Ocean Club" though so maybe that was his error for ordering one of the few non-seafood options.  Now,  for the absolute BEST part of the meal.... THE MOST HEAVENLY DESSERT EVER - Mastro's Signature Warm Butter Cake.  Even if the rest of the meal and service had been horrible, which it was far from, I would have given this place 5 stars just for this dessert!  I dreamt about this cake the rest of our stay in Vegas and cant wait to go back again on our next trip just to have it.  This creation alone makes Mastro's Ocean Club one of my top 5 all-time favorite restaurants.  I would happily get ejected from this sea-faring vessel any time! ;)  Sorry for the ridiculously long review, but I had so much to comment on and didnt know where to shorten it.

7TV3QByTzDFadN6QjmnhgA.text: I have now had two amazing meals here and can't wait to return.  The steaks, lobster mashed potatoes, and that brown butter cake are the must orders for me.  Sitting in the tree house is quite nice and I love hearing the live music from the bar.  The service is excellent as well.  I love being greeted by the friendly woman at the front.  (It's a pet peeve of mine when nice places put bitchy girls at the front who act like they are bothered that you showed up - ugh.)  The front people are so friendly, even on super busy nights.  All around - this is a really top notch place.

jGq3XHv-tuNyWgcHINQthw.text: Excellent service from start to finish!  Wife's crab cocktail and filet were perfect.  I was a little disappointed in my bone in New York.  Meat had a large vein of gristle  running through the  middle into the bone.  Martini was larger than average!!

aYG-wRRVV0xC-PqNQoJ2eQ.text: Great service, great steaks. Felt like i was dining in a ufo pod of some kind. Mastro's definitely operates at 10 out of 10 level

t73yQEckzFfdcaZ9782_kw.text: I  had a reservation for 3 people on Saturday, right away we were seated by a friendly receptionist, Our waiters name was Paul he knew about everything on  the menu, I highly recommended that you ask  for  him he is  very attentive. I wasn't to sure of  what to order and he helped me choose from drinks to dessert!  Aside from great customer service the food was delicious and perfectly cooked! There's a lot of restaurant's in Las Vegas but very few like  Mastro's it us a must try! and  don't forget to try the warm buttercream cake!

Txr2mYdVi5xAZHM5N5rl2A.text: Second time to eat here, almost exactly one year apart from each other--both times for a bachelor party.  We actually had the same waiter both times.  This place is fantastic.  We had a seafood tower for the appetizer with all kinds of incredibly fresh items (dungeness crab, two types of oysters, lobster, shrimp, snow crab, etc.).  You can get that made to fit a particular price point per person.  The scallops were incredible.  The wine selection is great.  Highly, highly recommend.

09JS2vuO3jakC9dWjefVxg.text: If you want world class food and wine in Las Vegas, this is the place to go. The food the drinks, the ambiance and the service are unequalled. I will keep coming back to this place every time I'm in Las Vegas, In fact I will come to Las Vegas just for this place alone, IT IS THAT GOOD!!!!   This place is absolutely the best.  and sorry to say, but maybe better than the other Mastro's locations. :)

-VUvwB-ApYQFVUYrjvKw5Q.text: Some of the best food that you'll ever eat in a treehouse! The seafood and steaks are out of this world. Highly recommended!

nLqw5OAUIS_k9uECRn_gRQ.text: Always great food! Very good service & dessert is yummy worth the price, big portions great value and quality food!!

9FzkSR-V0K6wpXzUnCiKGg.text: Great food, music, service and atmosphere.

OhbO4IcesQrMlMLjNNTo-g.text: Not that this restaurant needs anymore reviews... So, I'll keep it short and sweet.  I've been to this place twice now. It's awesome. Hands down the best place for seafood I've been to in Vegas.   Awesome service, love the ambiance and they have the yummiest breads.  I would suggest: Lobster Mashed potatoes Crab Crab Cakes Black Truffle Gnocchi Chilean Sea bass  If you want a fancy dinner and you're dressed to impress, this would be a lovely place to hit up. Just make reservations :)

Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster tails w/black truffle gnocchi.

VPKUJcn9r2_dT4tSJVxVtw.text: 2 stars for decent food & very nice ambiance, I think. Nice basket of bread to stuff in your pie hole while waiting around. Lousy mac n cheese, they even bake it w/cheese on top to disguise how dry it is. Rib eye was sizzling hot, plate was 400degrees... Wife had good gnocchi plate(truffle...)

YqCi1ANj1-5kdkueFLjyVA.text: Stopped by for an anniversary dinner before watching Le Reve. Since it was Monday after Easter, it was easy to make a same day reservation for 5:30 pm. The place was pretty quiet then and around 6:30, more people started to come by so we definitely beat the dinner rush. Got a nice seat in the treehouse, with a view overlooking the Dior store downstairs.  Since we didn't want to be food comatose for our show later, we ordered just the petite filet, the regular filet, and a side of scalloped potatoes. I also ordered Coke, but beware that it's by the aluminum bottle and not with unlimited refills. The scalloped potatoes were rich and delicious, but the cheese was too much halfway through the side order. The meat was very tender and cooked to perfection. The medium was medium and the medium rare was just as it should be. Since it was our anniversary, they also brought by a complimentary slice of rich chocolate cake topped with raspberries and whipped cream. Overall a fantastic meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. petite filet with a side of scalloped potatoes
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. chocolate cake for our anniversary

9Xi7OXG_7OIOhV_sNKXgOQ.text: We stopped in on a Sunday early evening just for their warm butter cake. It was a meal for two by itself. Tasty and of course buttery smooth with a slightly crunchy/crispy crust. The bowl of whip cream on the side was massive and well appreciated. Overall a good dessert but not great. The Caramel Bundino from DOCG and the Toffee Pudding at Gordon Ramsay steak easily demolish this offering however. Nice service and vibe though.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Warm Butter Cake

t9jzJ_wdZi2xdmY2NeFDsA.text: My sister and I tried the truffle gnocchi and thought we died and went to heaven that night; it was that outstanding! The service was excellent, and it wasn't too loud in the restaurant. The only slight downsides were the fact that it's a little dark in the space and the seating is somewhat tight, but certainly don't let that deter you from coming here, b/c it's wonderful!

9KnmH4V4LPMZ3Z_Xk6mbDQ.text: We came here just for the butter cake. It was heavenly. The cake was soft and crunchy, the ice cream was melting with the warm cake and was lovely. The whipped cream was fresh and had thick- butter like texture but was amazing. The only thing wrong with my visit was that Aria was testing the fire alarms. There was not sound, but the fire alarms were flashing. You couldn't notice the lights outside of mastros because the surrounding area was bright, but inside of mastros the lights were very dim and it was dark. The flashing lights stood out and gave me a headache. Other than that, the cake was great.

5jTEaZP3xn_lqh70bfYyrg.text: We went there for a birthday party.  Lemon drop Martini to die for , 12 oz bone in filet was great  Brandon was very professional and great service he gave us is going to be remember for long time

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HI7saVYCaRFZRFhmuPV48A.text: Amazing staff. Food is exceptional. The butter cake is a must have for dessert. I love coming to this place. Definitely will be returning

afiTk2QPQnKRkH2ewjhlHg.text: Went for my friends 50th birthday last week. We all loved it great service delicious food and a complimentary dessert. French portion is huge!!! Definitely on the list for our next visit. Suggest reservation.

u-hZxtdgNETvnInbNKaMbQ.text: Excellent presentation.  Food was fresh and tasty.  Elegant decor. Seated immediately at the exact time of reservation.  Waiter was very prompt and professional.  Nice place for date night or special occasion.

SD0xronAJvQWruR7kfxdXw.text: We had a perfect evening. Food was perfect and service was impeccable. Our server, Katie, was on top of our every need. We had the huge tomahawk streak that was cooked to perfection. We love to cook and are quite good at it. We enjoy having foods that we can't cook. Getting that perfect crust on the steak is nearly impossible at home, but Mastros has it mastered and is worth the price. Ok the Mac and cheese is not as good as mine, sorry. The Brussels sprouts were very good but again, not as good as mine. The evening was wonderful. We had such mediocre dinners in Vegas up to this point that is was such a breath of fresh air. We have eaten at Mastros several times, even near our home, and never had a bad meal. This was our 26th anniversary and they even gave us a complimentary cake. Thank you.

esOzGLSerIZEuW_pn16Oig.text: BEST RESTAURANT I'VE EVER HAD THE PLEASURE OF DINING AT! HANDS DOWN!   The people at Mastros truly get it! Service service & more service. My wife & I ate here on our honeymoon & while he food was great, the service was amazing!!!  FOOD: My wife had the sea bass which was incredible. Buttery, delicate, flaky, delectable & flavorful. I had the incredible salmon & I was floored! Not to mention the huge complimentary warm butter cake was THE BEST RESTAURANT DESSERT I'VE EVER HAD!   SERVICE: We ordered the mac-n-cheese but our waiter brought out the wrong side dish. He didn't dispute it, he didn't make a face or impose a funny energy about it AT ALL! He simply said, oh we're so sorry! Keep this one & I'll bring out the correct side dish. Whattttt?!?! Where do they do that at???? Mastro's apparently! They even plate your sides onto your entree plate for you. Ultimately & even more importantly the servers & bus boys energies were warm & full of laughter & smiles. This ..... Is what service is about as my wife & I rave about this place to everyone! This inspired a HUGE TIP!   SYNOPSIS: You so called Michelin rated, 4 star uppity high end restaurants could learn a hell of a lot from Mastro's. They have single handed restored my faith that fine dining doesn't have to equate to stuffy, dry, bland, pretentious uninspired service & energy. 10 stars!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary warm butter cake with the best ice cream-like whipped cream we&#39;ve ever had! On our honeymoon

qVtgYMEvjvH8urh7HBEPSA.text: Came here for a business meeting and my boss told me to try their martinis.  I am not, what-so-ever, a martini drinker but, I cannot rave enough about their Dragonberry martini.
