Off the bat, I was thrown off by the jalapeno in the drink but, I think that's what made the drink different, special, and delicious for me. It had that extra kick with alllllll that alcohol.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ohhhh laaa LIQUOR

inDARLhCLow_zKD25zG_Lw.text: Here is how I would break down my review   Service - 5 (great service and even removed the charge for my steak) Appetizers - 5 (ahi tuna, stone crab legs, and shrimp all rocked) Steak - 3 (1st was medium well, 2nd was rare...medium rare is not that hard!) Sides - 4 (mac and cheese, steamed spinach,  and brussel sprouts) Desert - 5 (butter cake is where it's at) Atmosphere - 3 (I like the funky "tree house", but sitting in the middle or a mall adds a little bit of a "food court" feel)

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The tree house

eqS_z7mmdWauCPlmN8mgmQ.text: Nothing short of amazing.  We spent our anniversary dinner here.   The food was amazing, and the service was top notch.  We had sauteed shrimp as an app, and split the bone in filet, garlic mashed and 2 lobster tails.  All was great, but he highlights....     1.  The sauteed shrimp was one of the bet things I have ever eaten.  Perfectly cooked.  And the sauce was to die for.  It came with soft garlic bread to sop up the sauce.  I would have been happy with this for my entire meal.      2.  I got lobster tail two ways, but the vanilla fried was amazing.         Lastly and maybe most important was the dessert.  I am it a huge dessert fan, and we probably wouldn't have ordered dessert if it wasn't for them offering it for free for our anniversary.   We are fans for life.   I think they call it butter cake.   It was insane.   We had leftovers and ate it for breakfast.   Soooo good.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sautéed Shrimp.  The sauce is amazing!!!

BOD51sqO-UgHYzj2gRjCSg.text: I've been to this location before and as always, they are on point with their customer service. It's always great to see them work together as a unit and are attentive to the guests. The glasses are never empty, offering of seconds on drinks and breads are consistent.   The waiters are very knowledgeable of their products. They know exactly how the meals are prepared and the taste of each item on their menu. They also offer great advices on how to maximize the flavor and food experience.   The side dishes are large enough for a party of 4 and the main course itself are large enough to satisfy your hunger.  I have to be honest, the last time I was here, I ordered the Chilean Sea Bass and I was underwhelmed by the preparation. With that said, I wanted to give another fish another try since they are after all, the "Ocean Club". I  ordered their feature of the day, the halibut which comes 3 ways: pan seared, cajun/creole rub, or breaded. With the suggestion from the waiter, I chose to go through the pan seared route. It was a good size fish, served with tartar sauce on the side. The fish was prepared nicely. It was flaky and juicy. However, again I was underwhelmed with the flavor. In my opinion, it was bland and flat. The tartar sauce didn't do anything as far as offering another dimension on flavor.   My friend ordered the lamb chop and he was not impressed either. It was prepared well, pink in the middle and tender but he said he was expecting more flavors.  The other friend ordered a tomahawk steak and it was big! He said it was good and flavorful. From the look of it, the meat was prepared well also. Perfectly pink in the middle throughout. He said it was good but had better.   My bestie ordered a wedge salad (of all the great options...she gets a salad!). She said it wasn't impressive. Just another wedge. Although she did mentioned that she liked their blue cheese crumbles.   The lobster bisque was very rich in flavor and had a lot of lobster chunks. I love a good lobster bisque...but the cream was a bit too rich. I wouldn't have been able to finish one by myself due to its richness, good thing it was split in half.    The lobster mashed potatoes were full of flavors and is extremely rich in butter and cream. It was served onto our plates by the host. The sugar snap peas were very tasty and had the perfect crunch and bite to it. The fries were just fries.   We were all too full to order a big dessert, I really wanted to order their butter cake but couldn't bring myself to do it so we ordered the creme brulee. It was served with a big bowl of homemade whipped cream and was a good compliment to the dessert. The brulee was sweet and the cream was not which balanced out the flavors nicely.  Overall, it is a great experience but I don't know if I can justify eating the fish here.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sugar snap peas
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb chop
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomahawk steak

WaO1jJBBnntPtSfhVTVwHg.text: Mastro's Beverly Hills is in my top 3 steakhouses so I decided to give Ocean Club a try. It did not disappoint. The food is great and since you want everything the real problem becomes trying to not order too much. Service is top notch and the staff is very friendly and knowledgable. Shrimp cocktail is served chilled with dry ice and the atomic horseradish that comes with it is sweet and will singe your sinuses in the best possible way. The lobster mashed potatoes are a must get, rich and filled with large pieces of lobster meat. We also got the Wagyu tomahawk cut to share which was perfectly marbled.   So why not 5 stars?  These items may seem nit picky but you can be the judge. We ordered the Wagyu black and blue (seared rare) and while it did have the cool red center you really want a better crust on it. In addition I know we were sharing but they simply cut the steak down the middle with one person getting the bone piece. For something like this you would expect a presentation similar to a porterhouse. Lastly although it shouldn't matter that it located inside a mall it does mean that the people next to you could be in shorts, flip flops and a backwards baseball cap. I know it's Vegas but come on.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Cocktail with atomic horseradish.

ooLFN_Ls85wAiPHJDOG0HA.text: Atmosphere: huge plus for being inside Crystals mall. Classy, a bit on chatty side. Food: amazing! Service: he meant well, but...  The snow crab claw was by far the best I've had. It's served cracked, fresh, and insanely cold with a dramatic dry ice presentation.   Food and service deserves 5 stars, but here's what I want to take a point off of. Nobody warned us that portions were HUGE. We left half the food on the table, which was meant for one person.   Keep in mind I am a size 0, it's not hard to guess I won't have a huge appetite.  The smooth talking waiter talked us into getting the steak special, 20oz bone in for $90-100, not on menu. He said it was for ONE person. Also he suggested the lobster mashed potatoes as a side and sushi roll.   The steak was good, but too big for both of us to finish.  Then the server hands me the charred bone bit - actually, more like plop it in the mashed potato - and tells me to eat the meat off of it. Really? Are you expecting me to lick my fingers off after I chew off the meat with my teeth and hands like a classy lady?  We opted for half portion lobster potatoes instead of a full, which was still a whole bowl of potato mash swimming in a pool of butter. Whatever happened to mixing? The half portion of sweet potato fries had so much breading that I couldn't taste the sweet potato. I'm sure there's a lot of people who drool over this type of side dish, but I was certainly not one of them.  I'll give 4stars, but next time, please don't suggest ordering extra food when it's clear we can't even finish one plate. It's too good to waste!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster mashed potatoes, swimming in butter.
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and bone, given to me. I was told to eat the charred meat from it...with my hands???
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half portion sweet potato fries

l20vlf420Eewjz5Q3eHCyw.text: I really enjoyed the food - esp the bone marrow dish.  I want to give them a five but they didn't not earn it due to service.  It is a good place but the service was a bit "elite" feeling.  I felt they could have accommodated our party better than they did.  Good however is excellent.

QTiC_wn3jiq2z-X3xWw6Ig.text: Been here now three times.  Also been to the one in Newport Beach CA.  You absolutely cannot go wrong dining here.  Service, Appetizers, Drinks, and FOOD is simply amazing.  You can't go wrong with anything on the menu.  It's going to cost you, but it's TOTALLY worth it.  Save your nickels and make this a fun event for you and people you care about.

dAG8DH09WgEii21lc7ea7A.text: Perfect food, perfect service, a pretty and relaxing location, you can't ask for more.    We had the ribeye, lobster mashed potatoes, wedge salad and Caesar salad.  The food was delicious and portions were large.  Will be back as soon as possible.  Thank you for a very enjoyable evening out.

Tf_7bf3QjnmyRoh9GqZsOg.text: Good service. Ok food. Expensive.  Went here on expense account with group of 12. Love the look of the wooden structure but we were seated outside of it so it was more like eating in the aria mall (which is also beautiful but not as distinctive). Very good bread. Mixed seafood appetizer was nice, with all the classic things you would expect like lobster and prawns prepared adequately. Jalapeno sashimi was also added and was great. Cocktails well prepared but not imaginative.   For dinner I had sea bass which was overcooked. When you order any of the fish, they ask if you want it pan seared or encrusted. Therefore there is nothing imaginative about any of the fish entrees. It's just a piece of fish on a plate. I think this approach can work for steak, but I'd really rather the chef put some effort into a creative method and flavor for each fish on the menu.  Sides were good but nothing noteworthy.  Overall par for the course for Vegas. Unjustifiably expensive food with service that is excellent but also a little pushy, so you end up with more food than you want to eat. Very beautiful venue. None of the food or cocktails stood out.

0ZQOdW5M1mL1RjR16SbrMw.text: We went there for New Years and this place is so amazing!!! The food was very filling, waiters are friendly, they even gave us free glass bottles!!!! This is a great place to go for any special occasion or if you want to just eat at a fancy restaurant at any time.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is such a great restaurant

Mu2lC8QMwRluYwicD1K78Q.text: When you are looking for an incredible meal, look no further then Mastro's Ocean Club located in the Crystals Shopping Mall at the City Center.   I started with the jalapeno tuna sashimi. I loved this dish. Thin slices of tune w just the right amount of jalapeno made each bit the perfect amount of spicy. Only down side was the dish was a bit oily.   For my entree I went w the Sea Bass. I can't express enough.. this was hands down the best Sea Bass I've ever had.   Last but definitely not least.. I finished w the famous Mastro's Butter Cake. Mind blown. It gets better every time.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mastro&#39;s Ocean Club. Home of the best damn dessert in Vegas... The Butter Cake

xFTHyvajgLmLpRAXG3c7yA.text: It's my second visit at this particular Mastros. Kinda hard to find.  The restaurant is inside the mall "The shops at Crystals," next to Aria hotel.  Just look for the giant wood art sculpture second floor of mall. it is breathtaking.   I love love love their lobster bisque  Ordered the filet mignon with garlic mash potatoes and roasted Brussels sprouts. For added flavor and $$$ I added truffle butter   It was awesome! Bread basket warm and delicious. My favorite is the pretzel bread.   My son had the Chilean sea bass. It just melts in your mouth. We had it simply prepared as pan seared.  My husband and other son had steak too and they were so focused on their meal so I know they loved their steaks.   Our server Micheal provided great service. lt all ended with their famous butter cake with homemade fresh whipped cream.   Our meal for a family of four was costly but worth every penny.  We visit Mastros every time we come to Vegas. See you next time

xOF1koNQNfAP3OpuqzMJrA.text: Totally Overrated, We were looking for "the best Chilean Seabass in las vegas" since we are lovers of that delicious, buttery and tasty fish, and we decided to go fancy and chose mastros for their excellent reviews, the attention is perfect, the service is super nice, their wine list is spectacular, we ordered the ahi tuna tartar... frozen tuna, kinda tasteless, I would rate it a 6 out of 10, and after that we ordered the truffle king crab gnocchi... that is the best I've ever had!  And we ordered the Chardonnay to make a nice pairing with the Chilean seabass... we chose the pan seared crust, which we love! But this time they actually served it as a shoe sole, completely fibrous, Tasteless, horrible... I complained and the waitress kindly changed it to us, second try was grilled... and it was raw and frozen on the inside.... AWFUL yet uncomfortable to eat that fish raw! They gave us the butter cake (awesome cake!!!!) as a gift but they charged the Chilean seabass.... that was the worse $150 and luxury night wasted for a seabass diner.  The restaurant is amazing, but the food Is just okay, never would recommend it as the best Chilean seabass in any place.

kLhSmiQEUN6ecw3eWRDZVQ.text: The service was amazing but the quality of food was not what I thought it would be. The price range was not worth the quality of food. However, the drinks were on point.   I ordered a medium cooked prime rib and it came out crusty and overcooked. The manager offered to make me another steak, but I didn't want to wait the 20 minutes for another while my friend ate her salmon (tasty!).   There's just too much hype for this location. The steakhouse at Circus Circus was much better than this restaurant. I hope I get what I pay for next time.

nH4KRjcJb4lB4it9xajFSQ.text: Tried the famous Mastro's Ocean Seafood Club. Very unique dining facilities. The staff and management are first rate and the food menu is extensive.   The Bone Marrow was generous, prepared well and tasty but I think the salted butter used on the marrow and toast points made it a little salty to our taste. I just downed more water as it was so good.  We shared a tossed salad with tomatoes, onion and shrimp and was very clean and delicious.  The main course of Chilean Sea Bass was grilled to perfection. The filet was a couple inches thick and not over grilled. It was flaky and very delicious - every bite. You may want to share it - it was so good.  The Bone in Rib Eye lacked the common fat eye. The meat was perfectly cooked med rare but the cut I got was tougher than I expected. Looking back at the experience I should have said something but I soldiered on and finished the meat. It would just be bad ju-ju not to finish it.  The sides were the Lobster Mash and Sauteed Spinach. The Lobster Mash was just ok. I like mash potatoes with a thicker texture and not as soupy as they present it. I'll pass on it next time.  The dessert was the famous butter cake. Oh man, this was great with coffee. However, after the amount of food we already consumed the desert was just too much to finish. It felt like a shame not to finish the dessert. The perfect portion for us would have be to share the dessert between four instead of two. 5,000 calories later  Overall the experience was positively memorable  - 5,000 calories later. A little loud at times. The staff did everything they could to make it a great night. The food was prepared well but in the case of the Rib-Eye was sub par. Chalk it up to sub-par cut of meat. I'll go to Mastro's again.

kcNs3StiEzj00uk9aJ4u6w.text: Im a local and this is probably my favorite restaurants in vegas. The staff is tentative and the food is great. The tomahawk steak, rib eye steak and Chilean (blackened) sea bass are my favorites. Of course no meal is complete without starting out with their crab cakes. Top 3 crab cakes I've ever had. The key lime for desert is a must have as well. I tell everyone I can about this place. Don't forget to mention if you are celebrating a special occasion.

mmM-BDpONFLRX-nfzvUuUg.text: All things aside this place is expensive but worth every penny.. Only thing that matters is save room for the butter cake.. Don't screw it up! Always save room for the butter cake...

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BUTTER CAKE!!!

0Nb-5PGWLu4rut-vo9Gi9Q.text: Dined here after a show for wife's 60th birthday - a special day. Arrived earlier than our reservation and Concierge said party at our reserved table was just closing check. We headed to the bar for drinks and after 1/2 hour I went to inquire about the delay. A different concierge informed me the party was just getting dessert - what's the real story? Was getting late so we took another table and enjoyed dinner. Would expect better from a higher end dining establishment - Concierge never offered anything for the delayed seating. Several other restaurants along the Strip with comparable food and more attentive staff.

lliInQDkeVNIgEVEL1ZB5A.text: We came here on a Monday evening for a pharmaceutical lecture. We got escorted to the 2nd floor where we had our own private room. I had the grilled salmon and grilled chicken with mash potatoes, spinach, and sweet snap peas, cheesecake with fruit on the side and coffee and of course some some chardonnay to wash it all down.   - Great service! Can't complain when you have 5 waiters giving you food all at the same time and always refilling my wine glass...hiccup! lol - Salmon was very flaky! crispy on the outside and soft body texture inside. And I can say that for the chicken as well! It was delicious. Rich seasoning! - The sides could have been better, but I didn't think it taste like PRISON FOOD! haha. That's a bit harsh.  - The cheesecake was superb! So smooth and creamy. I highly recommend a slice! - The men's bathroom looks like a women's bathroom! You have your own room.  - Can't speak for a dinner for 2 at this location, but great venue for a formal event.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Personal men&#39;s bathroom
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesecake and coffee
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled chicken

FOJgV625wgivt8JyyRZRGg.text: One of my favorite places in Vegas.  Great seafood.  Make sure to get the Seafood tower

ELhIMnIGaGJJFT8pZoSo9Q.text: Had our late Valentine's dinner here tonight, and this place is phenomenal! My family and I love to try different restaurants, and out of the many restaurants we've been to, living her in Vegas for the past 20 years, Mastro's is by far the best we've been to! Capital Grill, Gallaghers, Sonoma Cellar, Hank's, and the list goes on, but nothing beats the food and service we've experienced tonight. The staff there were very attentive, someone always there to make sure everything was as we liked it. The food, I must say was exquisite! The ribeye steak was cooked to perfection, soft and flavorful. The salmon filet was flaky and juicy..the lobster mashed potato is a must! And to end it all, as full as we were..we just had to get the butter cake, which I can say was heaven! Very good experience, and we will definitely be back! Thank you Mastro's for an unbeleivable night!

EL8s9fSwsdPl5o5N9_PzkA.text: High class food in the mall.  Of course, this isn't like every mall.  You will be dining while watching shoppers hit up Gucci, Prada and other high end boutiques.  The service here is incredible.  The pretentiousness that exists at other elegant restaurants is removed while still maintaining the professional courtesies you would expect.  We ordered ala carte.  The sides are large enough for two or three to share.  The scallops and tuna were cooked to perfection.  Try the snap peas!  They are fabulous!

SxTCBU4uwd-scY0YBZa0sQ.text: 22 ounces ribeye steak was absolutely perfect and filet mignon was melting in the mouth. service was spotless and busboy was all around our table make sure to make our dinner an excellent experience. beautiful atmosphere in tree house make it even more memorable

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. filet
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. ahi tuna
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 22 ounces

cQs9rlrjDrskMVrg5xW8gQ.text: Tried Mastro's for the first time on Saturday while staying in Vegas. Made a reservation on Yelp (super convenient and easy) for 5:15pm. Ended up coming 15 mins late because of traffic but was still seated right away after we arrived. If you do plan on coming here, leave about 30-40 mins (depends on traffic also) early since you do have to park/valet then walk into Crystals Mall located at Aria.  Appetizer - Tried the calamari and I would have to say I have had better. The calamari was reallllllly chewy. Some might prefer that but I don't believe calamari should be chewy. The only reason why it was enjoyable was the creamy sauce that came with it. I could eat the sauce by itself. It was THAT delicious. As a high-end restaurant, I was expecting better calamari, but Flemings and Ruth Chris both win on that dish.  Entree - Bone-in Filet and Bone-in Ribeye. The Filet was amazing! It was tender, juicy, and perfectly cooked. I usually get filet without the bone but decided to try something different and it did not do me wrong. The bone-in ribeye was good but not as good as the filet. It was soft in the center but the outside was too blacken for my taste. It was over-charred and slightly burnt in corners. Probably wouldn't get that again.  Sides- Lobster mashed potatoes.... WOW! Such a genius idea. $39 side... so you will expect something amazing and it was! So flavorful with lobster pieces in each bite. I will definitely get this again. Cream corn - nothing that stands out from other cream corn I have tried before. Though, I could tell the corn was cut from fresh corn, rather than using canned corn - which was a plus.   Complimentary bread - variety... probably 4-5 different types.  Service - from a 1-10, I'd give about 7.5. Server wasn't as personable or attentive.  1 appetizer, 2 sides and 2 steaks came out to be $188.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster mash!

jFeRnnD0__O4SEdr3FRiUg.text: And we can't stop And we won't stop Can't you see it's we who own the night? Can't you see it's we who 'bout that life at...MASTRO'S OCEAN CLUB! - Miley Cyrus (we can't stop)  I made reservations here the day of as I wanted to watch a cirque show but didn't know if we wanted to watch the earlier or the later showing. No problems here, as Mastro's was very accommodating. When I came to check in, they were already aware that I had a two hour window before the show and made sure I'd be good to go. Off to a great start!  Seeing as I didn't eat any steak earlier in the trip, I had to get one here. It was super tasty and although a little closer to medium than medium rare, turned out to be just as fantastic. The chilean sea bass, which many yelpers have gotten, is excellent pan seared and a good sized portion as well. We also ordered sides of the lobster mashed potatoes and a half order of the Alaskan crab black truffle gnocchi. Both were served table side and both had huge chunks of lobster and king crab, respectively.  With about half an hour to go, our waitress knew about our showtime as well and brought us out the signature butter cake, which is a must order here. You're in Vegas; this thing is crazy buttery but oh man, you have to try it. If I'm staying at the Aria again next time, I would order this dessert to go to take back to the room.  Huge thumbs up for excellent service and the live music was fun and we got on our way on time. With a very cool atmosphere and location, I want to thank Mastro's for a memorable meal, I approve!

lKpvWKi8msf8w_dUIKO1xA.text: I was out here celebrating my birthday for the second straight year (yes, it's cliche - I'm perfectly OK with that) with my baby brother. We wanted steak, but didn't necessarily want to spend an arm and a leg. Well, we succeeded at the former, if not the latter, but we left very happy and very, very full.  We settled into the bar and I asked the bartender about the dry-iced martini. It was at that point I discovered the bar was much more about the fufu martinis rather than classic. I'm partial to the classics, so I was a bit disappointed. That said, that's E-Me - I should have checked out the menu in advance, or read a couple more Yelp reviews. (Take note if you're looking for a classic cocktail here, you won't find it.) I wound up going with the on the menu manhattan, which was very good, but not great.  Now it was time to settle into the real reason for going - meat. We had a bit of a conversation with the very friendly bartender about what was good and must-haves on the menu. We already knew we were having the bone marrow, which she did recommend. We talked steak and sides, when she insisted we have the brussel sprouts. Now, I'm not much of a brussel sprout fan, but given the recommendation that was given I figured we had to have them.  The bone marrow came out and it was two huge bones. I could have slid down them - I'd have been a very happy man if I had. The marrow was plentiful and delicious. You won't have to scrape just to get a little, you'll be scraping just to get the last little bit of all that wonderful marrow goodness.  Now for the steak. I did the bone-in ribeye, which came out perfectly rare - if not maybe a touch too rare, which is very weird for me to say. That said, it was amazingly flavorful and near melt-in-your-mouth. And the brussel sprouts - well, I'm not a True convert yet, but if you keep serving me more like these I might change my ways.  Then, on to dessert. A huge, and delicious, butter cake. We couldn't stop eating it despite the fact that we were absolutely stuffed.  In the end, and for the money, I do think there are better steak experiences to be had on the strip. That said, you absolutely can't go wrong with a stop to Mastro's.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thick-cut bone-in ribeye. FTW
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. That&#39;s some serious bone marrow

wW0L0ygkxpACIaioCK7x0A.text: Simply wonderful ! Best dinning experience ever ! Such attention to details  and needs of customers :) I will be back very soon !!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best meal and experience !!!!! Thank you so much :)

wA9vAJhtaSItLetKVj5JjA.text: I realize I am an outlier with my review. The staff was very friendly and we were escorted to our table at our exact reservation time. However, the lobster in the bisque was tough and chewy. The scalloped potatoes had an imitation cheese taste. My filet was terribly salty and undercooked. I ordered medium well and it was absolutely medium rare. Near purple center. I have never complained in a restaurant and would have if our waitress had ever come back. She stopped by when food was served and I was about to cut into my steak and never returned. After a long wait I finally had the bus boy clear it and asked him to find our waitress with the check. Total bill was $250 with a bottle of wine.

qbWVQdkpyjFggmNlzySLog.text: Today was our friend's birthday and our server Tanya was so friendly and really went out her way to make sure our dining experience was excellent! The food was delicious and Tanya was very knowledgable and friendly. We had such a lovely time at Mastros Ocean Club and next time we come to Vegas we would love to come back!!! Thank you Tanya and Mastros for ensuring that our lovely experience!!!

RtOgp5Ai-iYceCee7q0PFg.text: This place is the creme of the creme. Everything we tried on the menu was superb! I highly recommend the Oysters, Chilean Sea Bass & Filet. Everyone in our group of 6 walked away satisfied and very full.

8qCclKvoIkp9G_MH__E_sQ.text: Let me preface by saying we're here for the architecture. As such, it's a 5 star "Treehouse" experience in a magnificently creative space. I felt like we were dining in a modern interpretation of a Jack and the Beanstalk tree house above Superman's Fortress of Solitude. Enough imagery, onward to the food review.  The sea bass was amazing, the cod was very good; but the blackened halibuts were overdone (even the one we had specified medium rare). We also had crab cakes, a lobster bisque, and a salad - all done very well. Sides of creamed spinach and mushrooms were also on cue.  As such,  we made no mention of the less than perfect preparation of the halibut. Yet, a dessert arrived at the conclusion of our dinners, compliments of the house, as if the chef could read our minds. Maybe this is the real Superman's Fortress of Solitude!

YXmLHsF8_4bElYPG4wv4xQ.text: It has taken me a while to find the time to finally add a couple of posts. I decided to treat my girlfriend to a good dinner for her birthday and I remembered how she was saying that she wanted to try Mastro's Ocean Club. I took her there on February 19th as a surprise dinner. For the amount I paid, the service could have definitely been better. Started off great. Had a 9:00 reservation and was seated as soon as we arrived an hour early. Unfortunately the wait for drinks and food took a lot longer to come. The server was very pleasant, but whether she had too many tables, it just took way too long. The food was good. We absolutely loved the Lobster mashed potatoes, the steak was great, and the Swordfish ( usually one of my favorites ) was a decent entree. The dessert was pretty good too. It was the butter cake which they are known for. I may go back in the future, but there are many other places in town I think I would try first if I plan on spending over $250 on dinner again.

Wk35HtqdVqOZIHFchb9vLA.text: Wow, this place certainly earned every amazing review it received. I did extensive research before I picked a restaurant to take my mom for her 70th birthday dinner while in Vegas for the weekend. I ordered the bone-in filet; she ordered the grilled salmon. The salmon was absolutely delicious, perfectly cooked, generous size, literally melted like butter. Speaking of which, we ordered the heirloom tomato/cheese appetizer. OMG, yum, yum, yum! Again, the portion size huge for an appetizer. As for the bone-in filet, well, we both agreed the best steak we've ever tasted. Oh, and the bread basket? Huge, warm, ridiculously fresh variety of insane bread and butter. As for dessert, they brought her their signature warm butter cake with a side of whipped cream... okay, without questions, best dessert I have ever tasted! I literally brought the leftovers home on the plane the next day! As for SERVICE - top notch but not stuffy!!! Our waiter Tim was awesome!!! So funny, professional, accommodating, couldn't have asked for anything better. As for the PRICES - hey, it's Vegas, it's going to be expensive; however, there are thousands of restaurants that are overpriced and you feel ripped off when you are done - not Mastro's! Worth every penny if you ask me (and my mom!). Absolutely excellent dinner all the way around, would treat myself to this upscale dining experience any chance I could get!

28rviK_o4hYdR7eH9eqtIA.text: Liked it the first time so I made reservation to dine there 2nd time around.  Top notch qualify.  Steaks were great, seafoods were great, banana bread beer was awsome.  Chocolate dessert is to die for.

SmKOLKE-Bxw5X5BqiXfmAA.text: The ambiance was pretty rad. It's not you're usual dimly lit steakhouse. It's right in the middle of Crystal and very bright. I liked the modern decor and the live music was a nice touch. The service was great. The bathroom attendant made me feel like I was a a club.   My bone-in filet (12ox) was tasty, but I personally miss the crisp edges and extra butter on the Ruth Chris' steak. The Mastro side dishes though, definitely beat Ruth Chris'. I loved the Truffled Gnocchi, Lobster Mash Potatoes, Sweet Potato Fries, and Oysters Rockefeller.   My highlight of the night was the butter cake! Yummy!

BvGesWRAfaJKT8BTUOhBNA.text: Really great place for seafood and salads.  Great option for a meal before any of the shows at Aria, MGM or other surrounding casinos.   Top notch service

Akj8ShLNpsig2mBXai7Aqw.text: Obviously Mastro's is really expensive but it's very much worth it. This is in Vegas so my friends and I didn't have time for dinner so we decided to go to the bar and have some appetizers.  Chopped Salad Calamari Lobster Mashed Potatoes  The chocolate covered strawberries are ridiculously good.  We ended up back at the bar the following night to do it all again. I wish I could remember both bartender's names but I can't. They were both great.  If you don't mind paying for great food the this is the place to go.

vsrK6_582RDp4FZYkWgE-Q.text: My mom and I came to this restaurant because we got a gift card to the shops at Crystals. I got the filet mignon and my mother got sushi. The filet mignon was cooked to perfection and the sushi was excellent. The sushi dish actually came with quite a large amount of sushi. The bread basket was pretty nice also. We also got the asparagus and the mashed potatoes. We actually had a miscommunication with our very very knowledgable waitress and wanted lobster mashed potatoes instead. The manager came up to us and without hesitation brought us a lobster mashed potatoes literally within 3 minutes. The lobster mashed potatoes were also great. For dessert we had the butter cake and it was to die for. I'm not usually a cake person, but this was one of the best desserts I've ever had. Highly recommended - great service, great food. The price tag of the meal is quite high however; with all of our food the total was still about $100 even with a $100 gift card.

_gBhJI9aeCJpdHTpCViSiQ.text: Super disappointed tonight to not eat here.  Had reservations at 8:15 and they were backed up - told us it would be 15-20 minutes.  Checked back a couple of times and the hostess was a bit aloof.  I assume it was because there were numerous people waiting for their reservations.  Checked back at 8:45 to be told that best case was another 20 minutes....not sure the point in reservations if you don't get to keep them.  Sure the food is good but we left to find something else.

ZqhqyELz47-RKVwxERSuTA.text: Great food. I am not rich so I would not come here if it weren't for a gift card I received from the Vdara hotel. It's your typical over the top priced steak house. The service was great as you would expect. My meal was delicious. However, for the price I would probably go to outback instead. Sure this place was waaaay better but $173 for two people to eat a steak and vegetables?  Out of my league.

SID0nkFZSkN6TXGCrDO3Nw.text: Best dinner ever!  Amazing food. Great service and they brought me out a piece of cake for my birthday. Will definitely be back!

DV5OvvyIyJb383sm4lmtwQ.text: The most amazing meal and because of Paul our waiter, it made it even better. Very fresh, delicious cuisine and excellent service.   Love this place and always looking forward to returning.

QneRJat8a3sKuNfnBuvDKw.text: This place is amazing!. The steak here is cooked at a ridiculously hot temperature and makes it taste better than anything in life. I got the 12 oz bone in filet and was not let down by the taste and quality of it. My family got the Chilean sea bass blackened and it is by far the best seabass I have ever had. The sides come out really hot in their own pans and we had the mac n cheese and green beans which were delicious. They have a great wine selection but the butter dessert cake really topped it off with the scoop of ice cream on top you just can't get enough of it. I can't wait to come back here next year because its something I look forward to that much. Service is awesome and Lionel is the best waiter who knows his stuff.

6-p4MMzu0ci6bi3BSyjdSQ.text: my fiance and i enjoyed a new years eve dinner here. great food as usual -- we usually frequent the mastros ocean club in newport beach.  service is unparalled, food is incredible, always a wonderful time here!

aJpagR-Hg-X1GXGm-WrcjA.text: I was here on a business dinner.  Didn't have any drinks so I can't comment on that.  The hostess was this beautiful brunette, I'd say around 21.  Got seated without any issues and our server was a guy in his 30's. He was funny, quick and sarcastic. Can't recall his name but he had some facial hair and we tipped him well.  I went with a rib-eye and the wasabi mashed potatoes. Excellent.

4ZYqJG_ek0zqBWLs-DVRjw.text: Was there while in Las Vegas for business. My hosts were contractors on the project and we maybe got a little extra pampering. There were 7 of us.   Food is incredible. We didn't order appetizers, but a couple of us did have salads. The entrees around the table were steaks, swordfish, and seared tuna. We shared the stellar mashed potatoes, along with creamed corn and broccoli. For desert, they just left us the desert tray. We couldn't finish it!   Service is second to none. Everything you would expect.

V8P2RSm2HpudjQkQSdmvXg.text: AHHMAAYZING!!! The Butter Cake is to Die for!!! Love this place. I love their Escargot!  This is a Vegas Must!!  We never miss out on this place, everytime we're in town!!

eOYTDPA2nhqFDnw6Hgkf5w.text: Fantastic food. The service is questionable at best. I made a reservation and it took 30 minutes to get a table.   My party and I watched couples come and go from the bar where we waited. I asked the hostess at the 15 minute mark for a status and I was told they were preparing the table.  At the 25 minute mark I ask the bartender to speak with a manager. The bartender goes and speaks with the manger. The manger sends the bartender back to tell me the table is being prepared.   If I ask speak to a manager then I should speak with the manager.  At the 30 min mark is when we were finally shown our way to the table. I was assured it was one of the best tables in the house. The entire purpose of a reservation is "Time".   If you value your time and expect for an establishment to respect it, this is not the place for you.

1oc4X0rHJr_2sqzIott7hw.text: I went here with colleagues while in Vegas at a conference. Happy I was there for work as it was quite a pricey dinner. Overall, it was a great experience, the service was good and the food and drinks were overall good, but not necessarily amazing (thus the 3 star rating).  Drinks: they have a great cocktail list. The first one I had was a nice smoky drink with a little bit of spice. I also had the spa day which was a strong but refreshing cucumber drink. The drinks were pricey ($15-$25) but everyone seemed to be happy.  Appetizers: We had shrimp, calamari and bone marrow. All was tasty and I would order again.  Main meal: For the main meal, I had the pacific swordfish Cajun style. This is where my rating got downgraded. My fish was a bit over cooked and this dry.  Given the variety of restaurants in Vegas, I likely would not go back.

TygZNoAFHrjd5ZQx4Za6cw.text: Back for a full meal and not just dessert this time. Our experience was just as great. I'm actually not a steak person, so I filled up on shrimp cocktail and lobster mashed potatoes. I've been dreaming of these two items since having them at the LA location a few years back. Of course we had the butter cake, too, but I was equally impressed this time with the cocktails.  The service was outstanding, and I actually prefer this Las Vegas location to any of the ones in and around LA. It's a much more intimate and quiet restaurant. When you go out for a nice dinner with your husband, you don't want to feel as if you're mashed in between other diners so much so that you can't hear each other. Best meal of the trip!

WgouZQljOHndWfaD6OEaGQ.text: My faith in Mastros has been restored.  Went back in the summer and 4 out of 6 people got undercooked seafood.  First time in 7 or 8 visits that has happened.  Even the non seafood wasn't good as they burned the foie gras.  Went back last night (01/28/19) and everything was amazing.  From the sushi and raw oyster starters to the king crab and steak/foie gras entrees to the snap pea and brussel sprout sides, it was devine.  Service was impeccable which has always been the case there.  Thanks Mastros for making it back on the "must eat there" list.

BYg0KXTXfcqIaOy45Yyi5w.text: I wasn't sure about this one when we first sat down. I've been lucky enough to eat at 3 other locations, all in Southern California, but this was is different in that you're inside a mall. When I sat down I was facing Louis Vuitton and that was odd. Initially I thought it was going to have a "food court" feel to it. I was wrong, as soon as our waiter and pretzel bread arrived, we forgot all about the mall. Also worth noting, you never hear any pedestrian traffic. No weird mall conversations to ruin the atmosphere. The whole thing works brilliantly. Pretzel bread, home run. My wife always orders some smokey bubbling drink that is always from to watch and I get the same theatrics with the shrimp. Dry ice smoke shows make everything better. As always, the people watching is fantastic. If you're in Vegas and want a break from the noise and congestion, stop by, you'll be glad you did.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Try the pretzel bread.

dg02o1kJ6Ya98DmfjpTt5Q.text: Enjoyed dinner here the other night. I had been to the location in Arizona a couple times and I remember loving the entire experience. So, needless to say I was yet again pleased with my experience at the Las Vegas location.   Honestly, I was a bit reluctant it being inside a mall, even though yes its the Crystals mall (which is not any average mall). We were seated at a table overlooking the edge, which kind of gave the appeal of being near a cliff. The host who greeted us was extremely friendly and personable. Our server greeted us within a few minutes and went over the menu and a couple items he suggested.     We started with the foie gras and escargot for appetizer. The escargot was average but the foie gras was delicious. Served with some sprigs of green and toasted bread. We also enjoyed half a dozen oysters on a half shell. We then moved on to have our entrees. Japaleno tuna sashimi definitely recommend this item. Truffled gnocchi was delicious as well as the creamed spinach.   Discovered a new wine as well, Leviathian, a red blend from St. Helena California. Extremely smooth and vibrant!  Still not disappointed with Maestro's

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Foie Gras

OFWutmmylIJ7xA_cUhIVtA.text: Great service! Went for my brothers 26th birthday, there was consistent service and great quality food. The petite filet was cooked medium rare plus and it went perfect with the creamed, macaroni and cheese and two bottles of wine. The butter cake was a perfect ending to our mouth watering meal. My family and I will definitely be returning again

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wine
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clear Lobster Roll Creamed Corn

8EZE7i2EmWh7aTMhlqEXGg.text: Expected to be wowed but was slightly disappointed. Food was good decent but it wasn't amazing. This restaurant was more of a checked box won't be coming back. But the service was great, everyone was friendly and the prices were decent.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Herb Roasted Chicken
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French Fries

Uwg1vT0wu8wiHbT5uovELA.text: Tim was our lead server and he was the best !  We had 9 in our group celebrating 2 birthdays and an anniversary.  Starting dinner with 2 seafood towers best ever the variety of tastes served all of our palates!  Next the  Espresso Chocolate Martini was suburb, the steak, the sole and sides were excellent.   The dessert sinfully good. Especially, the butter cake.     When we go back we would skip some of the sides (just too much food). Otherwise atmosphere, food, service and experience was fantastic.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Atmosphere FUN!
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Martinis with Expresso beans YUM!
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 40th and 32nd Bday celebration with the seafood tower!

wbKHAnD0UpOs6Da-_g48KA.text: Anyone who knows me knows where I spend Super Bowl Weekend and I never ever visit Vegas without a visit to Mastro's Ocean Club. Masto's Is my favorite restaurant on the planet and the Malibu, Vegas and Newport Beach locations top my list. I haven't been to a location yet that has disappointed me. My favorite choices on the menu, you may ask: Chilean Sea Bass-blackened, sauteed spinach, Mac and Cheese, Caesar's Salad, Wild mushrooms, Mastro's Margarita and Veuve Clicquot La Grande Dame Rose'. Just stop me now!!! I can't think about the Warm Butter Cake without getting all sorts of tingly.  So, its that time of the year again and I will be on my way in 3 weeks with a party of 19. I've already made my reservations for Saturday night and I'm hoping we get the Tree House again for my group. What can I say,  I'm a creature of habit and this is definitely a habit I don't plan to get rid of anytime soon. Hey Mastro's Las Vegas....See you in 3 weeks!

gUGA45AW9v2IXOWi7zaiIQ.text: I love this place!! I made a reservation two hours in advance using Open Table. Arrived 10 minutes early and was seated immediately. Servers were very nice and professional. If you have someone in your party celebrating a birthday, tell your server and they'll give them a beautiful slice of chocolate cake on a pretty plate and fresh whipped cream. Enough to share with 3-4 people.   Crab lovers get the Dungeness Crab Cocktail! It's amazing!! The Clear Lobster Roll and calamari is really good as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dungeness Crab Cocktail
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uq-aLL5d8sALlWoyDlXFVQ.text: Outstanding meal.  Service was exceptional and informative.  Highly recommended.  Steak was perfect, lobster whipped potatoes were decadent

9o4tYWArcGu7F1EfPSPSvw.text: Mastros you motherf*cker!! You have ruined me!! #MeToo, my tastebuds were assaulted by what is known as a marblelous (see what i did there) Japanese A5 Wagyu steak :'( I had never had a steak this wonderful in my life. When people say a steak melts like butter in your mouth, they must be talking about Wagyu steak. I know for damn sure there is no other steak out there that can compare. When i saw the price, I was like "this steak better have gold flakes on it or something.." it was $150 for 8 oz but I thought what the heck its Vegas and I'd been winning at the tables yeah baby! So after ordering a lemon drop , a delicious concoction thats sweet and sour and gets you all warmed up, I went for it. Needless to say, everytime I eat steak from now on, they will be compared to this amazing steak, and they will always fall short in expectations :(. The boyfriend got his usual ribeye, still on the quest for the best ribeye. Nevertheless, he thoroughly enjoyed his meal. We ordered the gorgonzola mac and cheese and lobster mashed potatoes. Both sides were delish, the service was attentive and not pretentious at all. Our server George was very knowledgeable about the menu and even suggested we try an appetizer thats not on the menu, thick cut maplewood bacon. Oh my god, ot was sooo damn good!  They added a special touch at the end of the meal, bringing out a big piece of chocolate cake with a heaping serving of fresh whipped cream, having mentioned my bf was celebrating his bday. Oh my lanta, just what we needed to cap off an amazing dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bf w/birffday cake
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. JAPANESE A5 WAGYU w/sides
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread bssket

OCuJoVWThPJV-vV8mg7iEA.text: We had some wine, a cocktail, Escargot, Shrimp Sushi, NY steak with truffle butter,  Mushrooms and Casserole potatoes.  We did have 2 cups of coffee at the end as well.  Bill was $227 and $45 tip.  Was well worth it.  One of the best dinners we have had in a long time.  The service was beyond, over the top, amazing; just friendly as hell.  The atmosphere is nice, not the nicest, but it is an upper-class mall.  Our Server was Matt, we do not remember the chef that night.

qbcsw-Tc98qyOHNJIfqdzg.text: So Disappointed with Steaks Super Salty..  As a prior patron of the place, this visit left much to be desired. Spending $ 543 on this restaurant really disappointed me since the Aspen Ridge New York Strip & Aspen Ridge Ribeye tasted more as Salted Steaks/ Mac & Cheese side disappointing also Drinks ok The massive app Seafood Tower was ok Server good Fish ok Best part of the comp butter dessert cake

PsdogBZpwJrXw55qfAU4Cw.text: I have been to Mastro in California and it was amazing, few of their location there. This Mastro was ok, their filet and their sauted scallops that I order wasn't as good as la since they didn't put much sauce in it . Steak was good but could have Been better but what I didn't like about this place was their server . Not nice and seemed to care. After leaving  review the restaurant manager contacted me didn't offer me anything beside basically telling me to let him know once we are in next time for better service . Who wants to go spring another over 200 bucks meal with a place without good service ? I am manager of a big company and you have to spend to make money

DnnC2Mb6gnraepOg-LLKRA.text: Service was wonderful. I accidentally made a reservation with the Malibu location and they were able to seat us immediately anyways. Staff was incredibly friendly and we were greeted several times for water, bread, menus, etc.   The menu is extensive and delicious. It was difficult deciding on a drink with so many amazing choices. Although I wanted to try the in house infused vodka's - the red wine recommended by our server paired nicely with our filets.   We each ordered a filet and shared the lobster mashed potatoes. This was an incredibly amount of food. We weren't able to finish the lobster mash. We ordered medium filets with the black truffle butter. They were delicious albeit over cooked, which was a bit of a disappointment for a $52 steak. The lobster in the lobster mashed potatoes although plentiful was also over cooked and a bit chewy. Not a soft melt in your mouth lobster which was also a bummer.   For dessert (which we did save room for since no appetizers were ordered) we couldn't decide between the flourless pudding cake (GF) served molten lava style or the creme brulee (GF) - so when in Vegas - get both! And then we needed to be rolled out. They were amazing. The flourless cake was incredibly rich and neither of us were able to finish it. The creme brulee had vanilla bean and was light and perfect.   Our server George was great. He suggested a wonderful wine and was very knowledgeable on the menu and the ingredients the kitchen uses - which is helpful for me being gluten free.   Our water was never near empty and servers weren't hovering over us obnoxiously and came and went with ease, barely interrupting our dinner conversation.   The ambience of the restaurant is really cool as is the architecture. It does feel a little weird eating at such a classy establishment in a mall.   The steak with the truffle butter was probably one of the top 5 I've ever had. Had it not been overcooked - likely could have been top 3. The meal overall was the most expensive we've ever had and it was good - but not the best we've ever eaten. For the price we paid, I would have expected close to perfection on every front.    I'm struggling with either a 3 star or 4 star. This place has the potential to be 5 stars if the steaks are cooked properly and the lobster isn't overcooked.

e9dZchCB9iGvZ0LJCqZnAQ.text: Amazing birthday dinner. So fun sitting in the treehouse people watching. *** Must order the lemon drop - it is not on the menu *** Food and staff worth every penny. Hint ..... side dishes are huge - feed 3 to 4 - so save the money and choose wisely.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary birthday butter cake was so delicious
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb chops with king crab gnocchi
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilean Sea Bass = Perfection

r08TG0GAUXaMXV207v7tUQ.text: The food was good, but nothing unique or exciting. For example no sauces on fish or creative ways of presenting. Butter cake was yummy, but overall didn't live up to hype. It wasn't like wow. Great service, but could add a few more female waitress as it is 2019!

6stThZr5domBrJKNKkv0bg.text: OMG Mastro's is delicious! If you're looking for some fine dining in Vegas, I highly recommend this place. The food, service, and ambience were absolutely amazing. We came here for my friend's birthday dinner and it was the perfect event! We were a large group (7 people) so we ordered family style and surprisingly the bill wasn't that bad. The bill came out to $300 with alcohol and (free!) dessert. I recommend getting several plates and sharing.   I highly recommend their truffle Alaskan crab gnocchi! I think it was a seasonal special but I hope they keep it on the menu. It was one of the best dishes I've had! They also served us really good rose. I normally don't care for rose (I prefer red wine) but their version was refreshing.   For dessert, they serve this delicious butter cake! It was enough for the whole group.   Definitely worth checking out if you want to switch it up from the ratchet scene.

bZM5KZgELzN__QrmdJ3TSQ.text: Definitely not impressed. Read several reviews online before deciding that this would be where my husband and I would have dinner on our last night in Vegas. The only good things about my experience were the bread basket and the scallops appetizer. I had a petite filet and was not impressed. I ate maybe half of it. I would have thought that when our server saw that I had stopped eating that he would have asked if everything is ok. I did not want to complain so I didn't say anything and that is where I messed up. A manager stopped by and asked how everything was and that was after maybe 1-2 bites before I realized exactly how poor my steak was. I always order a filet when I go out for a nice meal and now I am wishing that I had just ordered the appetizer instead of wasting money on eating half of a meal. I am now back in my hotel room trying to figure out if I should try to go somewhere else to salvage my night and have something to eat. I will add that my husband had the ahi tuna sashimi and it was a very large portion and he enjoyed his meal. We ordered the garlic mashed potatoes and didn't even finish half of them, they were definitely nothing spectacular. There are way better dining options, so be careful what you order and if you don't like it then say something, unlike myself who is now out $125 for a mediocre dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very large portion of ahi tuna sashimi.
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Petite filet and garlic mashed potatoes. Definitely not the best steak I have ever had.

e-0_88GCeiCXkjFVnhBEiA.text: Went here on a recommendation from a friend who is a regular.... went with my sister for her birthday.  Now you know the place is great when its part of a basket / bird nest sculpture...  On a serious note, the food was out of this world. I had the bone-in filet mignon, medium - one of the best filets I've EVER had...and I've had a lot of filets.  I can't remember all the sides I had, but they all were great as well. The sides are served "family style" so you can share with one or two people at a time. Service was at part overall. The hostesses were very accommodating with reservations (might be because it was a Monday). We did have to flag down our server once or twice...and usually I ding a restaurant for having to do that...but the food was so great this place gets a pass. Oh, and I think we were the youngest patrons the entire time. Could've been a fluke...again, was a Monday night.    Definitely would come again!

axmM8nv1jbKbIFelKXgQlw.text: I've been here a couple of times now. I can't say I love and I wont say it sucks. There is just a lack of something that takes me from 4 to 3 stars. Service was outstanding both times. Very attentive waiters, but not annoying. The food is good, it's just not great. I haven't been wow'd either time. I enjoyed my meal, yes, but wasn't super crazy. Maybe its' the price point and I dont feel I'm truly getting my moneys worth. I had the ribeye the first time and the sole the second time. I've had the calamari appetizer (PASS on this, not good), the mussels (pretty good both times), I also had the wedge salad which I always enjoy. Again, food is good, I'm not complaining, it's just not great. Drinks are good but like the food, on the priceyer end.

pVe9qa5atOTW8Q3NHnJKgQ.text: BEST SEA BASS IN MY LIFE.  The portion was much bigger than I was expecting, and because I ordered it medium rare, the fish was cooked just right!  Everyone at our 8-person table had either the sea bass, rib-eye, or bone-in filet, and everyone's dish was delicious.  Would definitely come back here!!!

JOXoh7RtHHAs0CJDUEf0uw.text: Sea bass is a must! The fillet mignon is superb too. Unfortunately, my warm butter cake was way too hard and dry. Even the ice cream didn't help the dryness.

xhrw5Dc8IirlK3AHq8WPNg.text: Everything was absolutely perfect. Service, food, atmosphere. Love, love, loved it.  My MIL always says that the first sign of a really fancy restaurant is that if you request a black napkin (to avoid the white lint on your clothes of course), they don't bat an eye and bring you one immediately. Well, at Mastro's, we didn't even have to ask - as we sat down our white napkins were removed and black ones were draped across our laps. Superb start.  Our waiter was both professional and friendly - we really enjoyed the service here.  The food was excellent, and too much of it of course! We wanted to try so many things that there was no way we could really eat it all.   And, they brought out a complimentary, decadent desert for my 30th birthday to end the night.  We drank and ate our way to belly bulging bliss...ready for club XS after this!

OxWEe7C7YkkVK7miZT-SQA.text: I can be a big spender when the time is right and when you're in Vegas, the time is right.  Instead of standing in line at a buffet and stuffing yourself with mediocre food, why not go all out and get an exquisite meal at a first class restaurant?  The quality of the food here is out of this world and so are the prices so be prepared to drop $150 per person or more if you go all out.  The steaks are huge, cooked to perfection and the Seafood is fresh and soooo tasty.  The service is impeccable!

sfEQTtH6Bj0b0wkqb1pVOQ.text: We had our Christmas Party for the company there Saturday in the private Room 3. The swordfish I ordered was good but the cheesecake was out of this world! Can you tell I have a sweet tooth?!!!

CpbIb8RSBjUfuxd6dC2pog.text: It's tough to find a more elegant place with better food than this. From the incredible service and attention to detail to the wonderful selection of meats and seafood.  We started with several appetizers, all that were amazing. The steak I ordered was prepared to perfection and the sides were impecable. The lamb dish was the best I have ever eaten and everything was perfect. It's hard to leave room for desert but you absolutely have to because the deserts are as incredible as the meals.

eDPbcKsC002V7ij7zV5yMg.text: Best restaurant in the entire world! Its a hidden gem because its in a mall and less crowded than restaurants in casinos but dont let the crowd size fool you. Ive been there probably 20 times and ive never had a bad anything. Ive had everything on the menu because we often go to dinner with about 20 people so we order everything. Great wines, really fresh seafood, but the side dishes and desserts is what really sets them apart from others. My fav sides are brussels sprouts, scalloped potatoes, creamed corn, gorgonzola mac n cheese and mushrooms. For desserts nothing is better than the butter cake and pecan pie. If youre not a fan of raspberry sauce like myself you can order the butter cake without the raspberry and its heavenly! Its romantic enough for a date and trendy enough for dinner before going out with friends- like i said best restaurant in the entire world!

-wMwYEwXOfXWRewOxG7Bvw.text: Great service , tasty food and perfect location . ALTHOGUH it's expensive but believe it worth it . Ihave tried flowery flavor fish as a main dish and it's just great .. also the appetizers are yummy I have got crab mix and tomato cheese salad .. if u r a big fan of pinacolada u haven't drink a heavenly one if u r not in thia place.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab and the tomato salad

0sfm8q79405PRPwTcFbA9A.text: Mika, your smile and phenomenal service made my first experience at Mastro's a great experience. Thanks to you and Brandon, I'll be back here next time I'm in Vegas. The food, the service and the ambiance was perfect. Couldn't ask for a better place to celebrate our anniversary. Thank you, Mika.  You're the sweetest and the best.

bzxYnp0Wa9zpiFuH2401VA.text: Hearing about my preivous  dining experience. Masto's General Manager Dan Boyer, invited me back to dine in on a regular night and me and my wife take the opportunity and did. Our server Amanda was very sharp and very attentive to details.  My steak was cook to perfection and my wife seabass's were melt in your mouth goodness. Great attentive staff, absolutely great customer service. A top of the class experience if you ask me.  Stop by at Mastros Ocean Club, its not just a restaurant, it want you to be part of their club or family.

vNr8dSX0SSSYgsGc_U5xfA.text: Oh My Goodness!  I had one of the best meals of my life.  The Calamari was delicious!  The Scallops were divine!  I ordered the Pacific Swordfish (my first time having it) and it did not disappoint.  Add to that the Lobster Mashed Potatoes and you've got a perfect meal!!   So wonderful!  If you get a chance to eat here, take it!

iZTyHx04Mw-Iu4-JL0H45A.text: This is an example of 5 starts restaurant. Great service, classy environment and hosts, amazing drinks and great food. Yes, it is pricy but it is the best.

a41FlsWS70ab3JrUHYH7-w.text: We went here last night for my girlfriend's birthday.  Mixed feelings about our experience.  To start off with, the service was impeccable.  Daniel and Tim made sure to constantly check in and my water glass was never empty.  We started out with the strawberry mules which tasted good and strong.  We skipped an appetizer and just munched on the bread basket which was also tasty.  For dinner, we ordered the lobster mash and steamed broccoli to share as our family style sides.  Our server came back to apologize that they were out of broccoli so we switched to spinach.  Both were good.  We loved the lobster mash. For our entrees, we ordered the 8oz petite filet, Chilean sea bass, sauteed scallops and another fish dish that I cannot recall at this time.  My scallops were great.  My friend said the other fish I can't recall was great as well.  Birthday girl had the petite filet and stated after her first bite that the quality of meat was definitely lacking.  After us all trying a bite, we agreed it did not taste like a very high quality meat.  The server confirmed it was corn fed beef sourced from various Midwestern farms.  Surprising for such a high quality restaurant to source corn fed beef.  The Chilean sea bass our other friend ordered was a bit over cooked making it dried out as well.  We mentioned our dislike of the steak to our server and he did apologize and offer to get us started on something else.  We were all sharing our meals and noted it was fine and we didn't need a replacement dish.  For dessert, we were treated to a happy birthday slice of chocolate cake (a bit dry) as well as the butter cake (which was phenomenal).  In the end, the steak was taken off our bill and both desserts were comped.  The service made our experience enjoyable despite some of our dishes being off.  5 stars for service, 3 stars for taste of food, 3 stars for price in comparison to quality of food.  Unfortunately, not sure the price is worth the quality of food you receive at this one.

AQxVE24XhBS4DN9tDcnyyQ.text: Decent seafood in an odd location. You are in the middle of a mall. Most of the times I've eaten in a mall has been at a food court. This isn't a food court, its a high end seafood place that costs a good chunk.   The seafood tower was excellent except for the peanut sized oysters. My salad was very good. My tuna entree was on a par with Outback Steakhouse.   Not enough going on here to make me want to go back. Even if you got to sit in the alien mothership, it wouldn't calm the odd feeling you get here.  Flat to slightly upturned face.

qCf6tRLieunItwmC5dtAcw.text: I would rate this more of a 3.5.  For starters, the decor and architecture of this restaurant is absolutely breathtaking.  Based in the center of a classy mall, the treehouse area has a unique and interesting view of everything around you.  We went around 9, so no one was really shopping and the mall was pretty bare. I felt like I was in a different world!  For a Monday night the restaurant was hardly crowded and we were seated immediately at a table of our choice.  The complimentary bread was interesting, although there were several pieces that were extremely hard to bite into, I enjoyed the soft pretzel-like bread the most.  For drinks we tried the lemon drop and the cantaloupe martini.  Both very awesome, and the cool thing is that they come with the martini shaker, so you end up getting two drinks really.  I enjoyed both drinks, the cantaloupe one tasted like sweet cantaloupe but strong enough to get you buzzed.  As for the lemon drop, it was soooo cool - they put some kinda sizzling dry ice or something in it so it looked like a volcano when it came out.  I sat there in awe for like 2 minutes just staring at the smoke come out of my drink! Then sipped on it and got buzzed 10 min after hahahhaha.    As for the entree, we ordered the rib eye medium rare, macaroni and cheese, and creamed corn.  I'm sad to say but I wasn't too impressed with the rib eye.  I felt like it was cooked in fire too high - the bone was completely charred.  Even though the inside was medium rare, the outside had bad burnt areas all around it.  And since we shared a plate, they brought out another plate for me, but it was soooo hot that when we put food on it, the oil kept splattering on me!!!  I mean granted it was a nice gesture, but I did not like how bits of oil kept splattering on my nice dress!  So anyhow, despite the slight disappointment in the steak, the macaroni and creamed corn TOTALLY made up for it.  The macaroni came out in a sizzling pan where the cheese would not stop ooozing when you tried to take a spoon full of it off....just the way I like it!!! I couldn't stop eating the side items that I probably would have rather eaten those as my meal rather than the steak itself!  Anyhowl, I dont know if I'd come back for the steak, but I definitely appreciated the view, side items, and drinks.  Our bill came out to be $110 for 2 drinks, 2 side items, and 1 rib eye.  It was what we were expecting for a steakhouse at this caliber so not surprised.  I rounded up on the rating only because between the two of us, we shared the leftover mac and cheese and creamed corn the next day and still were satisfied :)

NiQLdKa6ZeBFWWGqZscLgg.text: Went there on New Years Eve, had a nice table and food always good. The service was atrocious.. so bad it didn't even deserve a tip- I did leave one, but wouldn't go back to this one again. One in Newport Beach much better. Of all the restaurants in Vegas, we chose your restaurant, we are locals and had a choice to go ANYWHERE!! Extremely DISAPPOINTED... many may ask , was it busy? No... just bad service.

DZ_Zmflg4k_8YRDuz6TifQ.text: I am a regular here @ Mastros and I can't say enough about it! I am from So Cal and have been to every mastros in the company besides the new New York restaurant and this one is my favorite! Whether it be for dinner to late night drinks at the bar this isa go -to for a great steakhouse with great ambiance.  The view from the tree house room is great and they aways go out of their way to accommodate you.  Plus for being i the middle of the desert, the seafood is amazing!  You won't be dissipated here.

7mBNklP4Y7NoVxMfMilN_g.text: Exceptional experience from start to finish. Our server, Sam, was impeccable from the moment we were seated. Staff is coordinated in their approach and teamwork to make your dining experience flawless. Food was excellent: Swordfish and rack of lamb were our selections accompanied with two plentiful sides. High marks for Mastro's!

SI_BRwe5nzrmviNx9qNJKQ.text: Came here on a Wednesday evening to celebrate my 30th birthday. Had really high hopes as I haven't dined here before. When we arrived, they couldn't find my boyfriends reservation, although we have the email confirmation and the the notes he wrote that said it was my 30th birthday. They sat us anyway, without asking or engaging with us and we were seated by what I assume would be a manager. Anyhow, they sat us next two family with their kids running up and off the booths. When there were other tables not in between two families. We ordered the bone marrow and lobster bisque to start, both were great. We shared the tomahawk and truffle king crab gnocchi and mushrooms. All great, steak was pretty fatty but it was still good. Dessert we had the butter cake, I was expecting a candle or something since it was my birthday and I forgot they messed up on the reservation. So they had no clue it was my birthday. Overall completely disappointed in a very expensive dining experience.

RO_kI6dPgl8CY1POBw7IJg.text: I admit I had my reservations dining in the middle of a mall, albeit a nice one, dining in the treehouse room felt intimate and classy.  In the grand scheme of steakhouses, I'd rate the food a solid 4, perhaps a 5, but the attention to detail by the staff, fantastic cocktails, wonderful ambiance, and late hours helped Mastro's earn a 5th star in its belt.  I was a bit peeved that we had to wait almost 30 minutes for our table at the bar, but the generous cocktail pours helped soothe the senses.  Plus, we were late to our reservation by an hour and a half so I had to throw them a bone (haha!).  We arrived around 10:30pm and were surprised to find a happening bar scene and a 75% full dining room.  We left past 1am, but the staff was gracious and didn't try to rush us out even when we were the second to last table in the restaurant.  The food was delicious.  We may have over ordered on the appetizers, but we hadn't eaten in 12 hours so we figured we would indulge a bit.  Very fresh oysters with all the fixings with lemon halves that were wrapped in cheesecloth and speared onto a fork.  Great detail.  Smoked salmon plate was also good.  The fried calamari was ok - good, but certainly have had better.  My bone-in rib-eye was great.  Cooked a little past medium rare, but still tasted wonderful - a nice char on the outside, lightly salted crust.  The side dishes were also good, in particular the mac and cheese, but get it while it's still warm.  At the end of our meal, our coffee order came out a bit lukewarm, but it was close to closing time so I gave them a pass.  In honor of the groom, the staff also brought out a dessert with the words "Don't do it!" written in chocolate on the borders of the plate.  Again, great attention to detail.  I really think this is where Mastro's shines.  The details.  We were asked whether we wanted a black napkin versus a white one to minimize lint getting onto dark pants when we sat down.  I just received a phone call today asking whether we enjoyed our experience and to visit again.  I might have had a better steak elsewhere (not by much), but it's a real pleasure to dine somewhere that focuses on the little details that elevate a dining experience into a fine dining experience.  Bravo Mastro's - I will be back.

do8qPkBag9MAGJUkqzSQHg.text: Went here with my wife and two adult kids on recommendation from our Concierge at the Green Valley resort. The ceasar salad and warm spinach salad were perfect and they let you split portions. We had the salmon and three boneless filets with garlic mashed potatoes. Again they let us split the potatoes 4 ways. Steak and Salmon was some of the best that I ever had. Service was impeccable. Prices are very fair especially because they let you split the salads and sides.

fMvv2RYYTIndPh4hUINQuA.text: An exceptional dining experience from start to finish.    Service = exceptional  Food = exceptional, executed well  Ambiance = Classy - but for people who come in and shorts and flip flops  I highly suggest the filet mignon.  As a meat lover, I ended up choosing the 12oz versus the 9oz.  In retrospect, I should have gone with the 9oz.  Nonetheless, it was a perfectly cooked medium steak.  I started off with a caesar salad, which was a bit salty.

bGZYLcTVlQEJsQKu9QXUVg.text: I have eaten at this location more times than I can remember.  I adore the gorgeous setting in Crystals, part of City Center in Vegas and  I love sitting at the opulent marble bar and enjoying a glass of wine.  The bartenders on this particular night were a little busy so we were not getting the service we usually would expect, but it was still good.  We ordered oysters for the appetizer.  As always, fresh and delicious!  The seafood here is consistently fresh and perfectly prepared. I have never had the steak, but people rave about that as well.  Mastros, you never let me down.  Next time I am home, I shall visit you.

95Dkh35VzC2uBf2fvdmFFA.text: We were celebrating my wife's birthday and decided that we would go out for a nice dinner.  After a couple of our first choices were not available, we did get a reservation at Mastro's.  I can see why they had availability on a Saturday night.  The night started out really well.  The live music in the lounge was very good, and our server in the bar recommended a fantastic Riesling.  Once we were seated, our server recommended a couple of salads.  I had a spinach/bacon salad.  Nothing special, but ended up being the star of the meal.   For the main course, I decided to try the vanilla batter twin lobster tails, because I read that it was a specialty of the chef.  I should have known something was up when the server also said I could get the tails baked or steamed, or a combination of those options.  I chose steamed and the vanilla batter.  The steamed tail was just fine, as expected.  The battered tail tasted like something from Long John Silvers.  It was so salty, and greasy, it ruined what should have been a great dinner.    We also ordered a twice baked potato to share.  This should be a very safe and tough to screw up dish.  They managed to do so.  My wife and I both commented that we get better twice baked potatoes from the grocery store, and we certainly prepare them better.  These must have been sitting out for a while, and were probably over cooked to begin with.  They were so dry, we could not finish it.  We had two waiters for the evening, and we never saw them.  I'm sure they saw our meal and did not want to check in with us.  No refills on our water, much less filling our wine glasses.  I did see the manager at another table, but she did not stop by to see us about our meal.  The star of the meal if there was one, was the portion size of the ahi tuna sashimi.  It was reasonably priced, but loaded with seeds, so bad that it was a chore to wade through them.

ENGSDmA5JM4ywPkZfjcNUQ.text: Delicious! We came for "Linner" and I just wish I was hungrier! At Morel's in the Palazzo, we met the most amazing waiter and totally chatted it up with him. He let us know that he also works at Mastro's Ocean Club so we also had to go visit him there...  This restaurant is gorgeous to look at and basically looks like a tree house with the Crystal's shopping area of City Center. It's gorgeous!  We started with amazing cappuccinos in the bar area since our favorite waiter, Dion, was not quite ready yet. I noticed that a cocktail that one girl in the bar was drinking was "smoking"... I think they put dry ice in it for effect!  When we were seated for lunch, we ordered the fried onion strings as an appetizer and the escargot. The bread including "pretzel bread" was a great appetizer too. The onion string serving size was HUGE and could have fed about 8 people. The escargot were in amazing sauce that I dipped my bread into afterward!   Then, I ordered the Cobb salad that came with a generous serving of huge prawns; it was delicious! He had the sea bass with the light bread crumb preparation and it was also amazing! We also shared the house mashed potatoes that included scallions, bacon, etc mixed in and were rich and delicious.   What a fabulous late lunch/early dinner on the way to the airport! It was tough to leave Vegas after an amazing meal like that though!

tjo-RLXEi9_ASxN7HYoNMw.text: Over rated and over priced....mash potatoes taste like they are out of a box. Ahi tuna is great but again very over priced. Don't understand why people rave about it.  Restaurants should be based on quality of food versus "trendy".

-pw7z0JvBzzIMqgrTPJdZw.text: LOVE, love, love this restaurant!  What a treat and a perfect way to end an already awesome Vegas trip.  This restaurant is located within the new City Center mall and was ultra convenient to get to from the Aria Hotel.  We started the night by sitting at the live Piano Bar in the lounge and ordering Pomegranate Martini's on dry ice.  The Martini's bubbled from the dry ice.  It was very cool and they were oh so good.  As far as the food goes... the meat is so tender and cooked to perfection.  My husband and I split an 18 oz. Bone-In Steak and it was more than we could possibly eat.  The steak was gigantic.  It was also really nice that they cut it for us and brought it out on two plates.
