With 4 people we ordered 3 separate side dishes and it was way too much food.  One side will feed 3 - 4 people easily, but they are all so good you have to try more than one.   By the time the chocolate birthday cake was served we were all so full that we had one bite and that was all but it was really good too.  The servers were really good and the atmosphere was perfect.  The tree house was really neat.  This is a definite must try.  Oh and I almost forgot... We shared the Lobster Bisque to start and it was the best ever.  We also really enjoyed the different breads in the basket.  I think the waitress said that the Pretzels come from Germany.  If you want an amazing dinner you have to try this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pomegranete Martinis served with dry ice sitting on the piano bar.

jJOYLeSjuheswRcNRQ0fdQ.text: Had dinner there last night. Filet was excellent and our server Piotr was outstanding. Got to try the butter cake it was fantastic

er5hnsQakobAs_KZ1hEldw.text: What can I say about this place ! Its amazingggg love love everything the appetizers are super good and the butter cake is heaven the service is excellent ThankYou this restaurant is my husbands and I favorite :)

-7-rXZYhPouN4KJlgP96Yw.text: This place is amazing I have the bone in ribeye, it was one of the best steaks I have ever had  , and the bone marrow appetizer.

7A743aZ85Dait_EfbMCPfg.text: Delicious! Best steak I've had compared to: del frisco's, papa's, Perry's, Ruth Chris, Flemings, the strip house, Vic and Anthony's, Morton's .... All of them and more.   I don't remember what my cocktail was but it was a strawberry drink with a sugar rim. The shaker had an endless amount. I ended up with at least 3 full refills for $18.  The calamari was crispy and deceptively flavorful. They appeared to be plain, but the seasoning was just right. I did not care for the horseradish/mustard type sauce though, but I think that was just my dislike for those types of condiments.   I ordered the 12oz filet medium rare. It had a beautiful seared crust that was crispy and not burned. The inside was so perfectly tender juicy red and melted in my mouth. The texture of the two was perfect.   For sides we had the baked potatoe which was huge! But was the least appetizing item all night. The Gorgonzola Mac and cheese was delicious! I don't tend to like blue cheeses or very much cheese, but this cheese goodness was Devine. I enjoyed it so much I'm going to try to remake this this week for dinner! It was served in it's own skillet and was more than enough for myself and my two othe dinner companions.   Warm butter cake. What can I say but order this! I usually love tiramisu and cream brulee but mmmm this cake was so moist and had a crunch sugar top under the vanilla ice cream. The cream brulee was actually disappointing. I didn't care for the crust or Vanilla flavored cream... Or perhaps the butter cake just stole my heart.  The live small band sounded great with dinner. They werent too loud and the music was a good mix, classy good sounding modern and hit music, not clubby like stk. you wo t leave with a headach and sore throat.The atmosphere of the restaurant was light and elegant. I didn't mind that it was located in the crystals. Honestly I liked being able to walk around while we waited for our reservation we made through aria, our hotel. If you do have a bit of a wait go down stairs to the little water tornadoes. They are touch sensitive and you can control how they spin!

yrNgiY4gymVWpcuVFcCYvQ.text: I have been coming here for years and this has been my favorite place in lv.  Wheels came off last night, bad food, poor service, so dissapointing.  Ordered bone in filet, medium.  Cut into it and it was purple, np big deal sent it back.  Steak came out later, now red, waiter sort of argued with me about it which was unusual as mastros usually has great service, sent it back again.  Now of course it comes out well done.  Manager comes by, listens to me takes it off bill and comps dessert.  Nice but still poor dinner at a place i have always considered bullet proof.  People i ate with liked their food, but it was not a good experience for me.

HK0wBL1_MvfQ0GllySRuxg.text: Excellent atmosphere, fabulous food & superb service. The steaks were perfect & the lemon drop martinis were the best we've ever had. Staff were attentive. Ask for Brandon Manoff to be your food server. Knowledgable & professional, he made it a memorable meal.

7K682eT4qcZpF01qfOXTrQ.text: I have been here multiple times and have brought multiple friends just for the buttercake. But today, the host was extremely rude and unprofessional. She wouldn't look up from her book to answer our basic question of if they are serving the buttercake that I will never return or suggest this place to anyone. Check your front desk host and make sure you don't ruin a loyal customers experience to the point of never wanting to return. Clearly management needs to teach customer service.

TMle6UT30z64S2r6_iWcSA.text: This place is phenomenal.  Breathtaking when you walk in... just like then 1st time i walked in to XS the nightclub. Absolutely breathtaking.  I had the bone in filet mignon. It was cooked perfectly!!! but honestly it really needs sauce. not the type of steak you can eat by itself. maybe next time ill try ribeye. But with sauce its good.  SEAFOOD TOWER WAS INCREDIBLE!!!! Lobster Cocktail & Oysters were great. They use blue point oysters.  Lobster Mash was good.  For Dessert, the CHOCOLATE PUDDING CAKE WAS THE BEST!!!! Very similar to a Chocolate Lava Cake. Outstanding.  I love this place. Its so beautiful and it really represents living the good life!!!   Service is great. They have like 5 people waiting on your table, bread person, server, drink person. everything. Great great service.  Seating was quick. Probably because City Center is new. I am enjoying it though & i am not looking forward to when this place gets packed. LOVE IT!!! GOTTA TAKE ADVANTAGE OF THE EXCLUSIVITY WHILE IT LASTS!!!!!!!!!!!!

xvnbsOLQHlArvWbqXk-OYA.text: We dined here just this past Monday 9/21/15.  My boyfriend and I wanted to treat his parents to a "fancy" evening, and let me tell you it was nothing short of fantastic! Paul (our server) was beyond knowledgeable and added so much more to our fun.  My boyfriend's mom even tried the escargot, (after much prodding) but ended up really enjoying it.  If I could I would come back 3 times a week.  Definitely save room for the Butter Cake, all of us being over-stuffed still ate the entire thing without complaints :)  They do have a more expensive spread but it is more than worth the splurge. Double date with the parents was a huge success, thanks Paul! ABSOLUTELY  ASK FOR PAUL... HE ROCKS!

xWK9xgBGf8W_Dz-gVma-rw.text: The best thing about this place was their level of service. The staff was amazing and I feel like my party was a lot of work for them and they remained pleasant, helpful, and toggled between utmost professionalism and fun and silly based on what we needed.   The food itself was good overall. I wasn't blown away. We had crab legs for an appetizer, I'm not a connoisseur here but they were good. The main dishes were the highlight for me, we had filets and a crusted sea bass. The Brussels sprouts were pretty plain and blah, Gorgonzola mac and cheese was decent. Everyone at the table loved the butter cake, I'm not really a sweets person but it was good.

nRBSBDCSjp8YhI4ro4uIfg.text: The table service is always excellent here; however, I ordered the scallops again and asked them to brown them well on the outside as in pan-sear them.  When they came to the table however there was no brown, they appeared baked. I sent them back yet upon return they were no "browner" just more baked and now rubbery in texture with the bread sticks on the plate that were once crisp now moist and bent ( it seemed that they just stuck the whole plate back in the oven).  Not what I expected from a restaurant of this caliber.  I left it at that - disappointed - even though I had specified from the start how I wished them prepared.  I won't be ordering the scallops here again.

5i6c-bJrHyoyGbCo8Y9-zA.text: Awesome Restaurant. Order the special dry ice Lemon Drop and Cosmopolitan Martini's. They are definitely not for the unobtrusive. The iceberg wedge salad, crab cake and Lobster Mashed Potatoes are great and my husband enjoyed his swordfish but the piece de resistance is the Butter Cake with fresh whipped cream. The service was impeccable and friendly. This was such a pleasant experience that we want to try the Mastro's in Beverly Hills, Chicago and AZ as well.

LkkagQ6HQ5XwLKy44jz5Fg.text: Absolutely awesome food. From the attentive service, tasty drinks, fresh seafood to the butter cake for dessert, everything was really good.  Swordfish perfectly done. Salmon was delicious also. Will definitely go back. Worth the cost.

NFolin2hcK0xde3GtOkWEg.text: I had a chance to visit Mastro's Ocean Club Las Vegas on our last night.  I have dined there in the past and I admit I am a fan.  I talked some friends into joining me by talking up the butter cake.  To start off we were very late for our reservation due to a later than expected golf round and traffic.  I had to call to make sure our 6:30 reservation would be honored I was assured it would.  We arrived at 7:15 to a packed house but only had to wait 10 minutes at the bar, just time enough to enjoy a drink.  We were seated at a great table and were waited on non stop.  We all ordered individual appetizers I had the lump crab meat cocktail (my favorite).  The crab was dungeness my favorite and off the boat fresh, I however prefer a horseradish dipping source theirs came with cocktail sauce and mayo.  My entry was the baked halibut in a special seasoning particular to Mastro's it was very good!  We ordered sides as well the creamed spinach and creamed corn were really outstanding.  We enjoyed a great Pinot noir with dinner that our waiter helped us choose his wine knowledge was extensive.  For dessert we had the signature butter cake.  We enjoyed a lot of fine dinning on this trip but the four of us agreed Mastro's was the best!  If you have never been it is so worth the trip.  If you get a chance I recommend Mastro's Ocean Club as a must eat when visiting LV.

QQWMCiM5E45oFJMHgtUjKg.text: The bomb- awesome- just like the Beverly Hills place. Not only is the food amazing- but they actually used alcohol in there drinks  (unlike many places in Vegas) We went on a Thursday night- and the eye candy of "available" women waiting for clients was mind boggling.   All the senses my senses were tickled at dinner.

ru1J02XBWU5jkf1-LXg1Qw.text: When in Vegas, you gotta do it right and Mastro's is well...doing it right.  Mastro's Ocean Club is owned by the same very popular chain steakhouses but focuses more on a seafood selection. It's located right in the Crystals shopping center in City Center.   I came here with a group of 9 and we were able to be seated in the treehouse (ballin!). Food was great. I had the bone in ribeye and but also nibbled on a chilean sea bass as well. Both were delicious. The sides rocked as well with the wasabi mashed potatoes being my favorite.   Overall a great dining experience, highly recommend!

LMqJ0_lzZjC9dfVlWsa0Jg.text: I will keep this short and simple.  Service - awesome. Everyone, and I mean everyone, is so nice and attentive!  Dining area- we requested to be seated in the wooden weavy basket area. Love the layout. This is a nice place if you wanted to do a business dinner! (We were just a party of two though) Appetizer- Dungeness crab cocktail. Okay. I am spoiled by Seattle's seafood so I have high expectations. Yes. The crab is good. Cold and refreshing. However for $25 dollars I rather have tried something else as I can get much more up north. However it was good.  Steak- bone in filet was their signature so that's the one we chose. I think they cooked it exactly the way we wanted. Medium rare. It was tender and it was good, but not melt in your mouth fantastic. It was overshadowed by (dun dun dun) the fish!!!  Seafood- Chilean sea bass. I got it the "arreganato" way. I probably butchered the word too. Holy crap this was amazing. It melted in your mouth and left you wondering where the heck it went so you just kept going back for more.  Sides: thanks to the yelper who gave the advice to get half the amt of gnocchi. Omg this is soooo good. The truffle oil just perfected it. Best gnocchi ever!! Lobster mashed potatoes was a huge portion (had to take it to go!) I am not really a mashed potato or lobster fan but my bf is and he really liked it so definitely try one of these sides.  Didnt have room for dessert but we really wanted to try the butter cake. Lame. Next time!  Overall a good experience but expect to cough up some serious $$$. Try the fish!!!

94FNawYA7S8XhKW0V65TTA.text: Check your steak. They taste great but always takes 2 shots to get it right. Always overcooked or raw. Awesome when they finally get it right.

BL9aAKPyEf4D_h1GfhJsCw.text: Had a great anniversary dinner here over the weekend. The service was top notch, thank you Alan and all staff. The food was amazing. We had a 8oz filet, bone in filet, lobster mash, and mac-n-cheese sides. The meal was amazing. The food was delicious and rich, I was hungry but there was no way I could even put a dent in the sides. We ordered two specialty cocktails. The strawberry mule was one of the best drinks I've had in a long time. Thank you Mastro's for making our anniversary extra special. I hope to be back soon.

_uwy1hjCRa3jZVR5Z9NjbA.text: This place was AMAZING! Came here with my fiance for our Thanksgiving dinner. We had the sea bass HIGHLY recommend and the ahi crusted tuna. Loved the location and the table we sat at which was in the wooden structure. Service and staff were friendly and great!

ER_k8t-CT_y0i6FlIuFeww.text: Everything about this place is amazing.. The food was on point and we couldn't have asked for better service. Try your absolute hardest to save room for the butter cake I could only fit one bite but it was so worth it. Try this place, you won't be disappointed.

jUbPE3w9JPEZcy_nv0MiGw.text: All of their locations are great. They have the best steaks west of Chicago, hands down. You pay alot but get your money's worth. Great side dishes & service. You MUST try profiteroles & or cherry cobbler.  Enjoy this a great restaurant.

QsKMmPREFRoptGNPLkGOLQ.text: My wife and I had dinner on August 9 as a treat while we were in Vegas. We were not disappointed. It was an overall great dining experience. The atmosphere was excellent. The food was good to great. My wife's steak was a tad over cooked, but my steak "Oscar style" was awesome! The sides were generous and delicious (lobster bisque, gargonzola Mac & cheese, king crab gnocchi). And the butter cake for dessert...wow! The service was impeccable from our waitress Tanya to the support staff. Tanya was informative, attentive, and most of all friendly. If we make it back there, we will request her table for sure because we were very impressed. So, even though it is pricey, I highly recommend Mastro's. Cheers.

rvfJUWkVGJ30tqfx83Wnyw.text: Great food, great service. awesome execution, and a wonderful wine list - This was the best meal I had in Las Vegas this year. I went back twice this week! Gnocchi with Alaskan crab ,truffle oil then topped with shaved black truffle and crisped panko bread crumbs is decadent and delish! It is served sizzling and definitely  enough to share between two people. I ordered a half portion the second visit and it still was enough between the two of  us! One of the best things i have ever eaten. I am picky about gnocchi and they do it light and pillowy here with a white sauce. On to the steaks, PRIME CUT EVERYTHING! all steaks are served on 400 degree plates with clarified butter and ur choice of salt/pepper or u can request cajun blackened. Phenomonal steaks and yes I am from Texas and still say this, My favorite winery is Michael David from Lodi  ..they make the good ol 7Deadlyzins, petite petit sirah and Mastros serves their Earthquake Cab for only two times markup (51 bucks)! this is a GREAT value for Vegas . SW steakhouse in the Wynn charges an obnoxious 5x markup! - This is important if you love wine with ur steaks. I had filet mignon, tomahawk ribeye,  truffle crab gnocchi, chocolate pudding cake, gorgonzola mac and cheese, lobster roll, and oysters rockefeller this week at mastros. The gnocchi , steaks and lobster roll were NOT TO BE MISSED here. I wasnt crazy about the mac and cheese but that may be because I was totally spoiled by the gnocchi(priced at 32 full portion, 16 for half portion) . If you are budgeting however the mac is only 13 and 6.50 for a half portion. try it you will love it ! Our waiter was excellent and attentive , this place is worth the money in the big pool of steakhouses in Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomahawk wagyu ribeye

qRbqwPvXzdyCSEfdC2Q_hg.text: You can never go wrong with Mastro's. It is the perfect place for a special occasion. We went to this location to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday. The bread basket is filled with goodness. The ahi tuna tar tar was excellent. We both ordered the steak and it was delicious! Mashed potatoes and steamed asparagus were Good too. After dinner, they even included a slice of chocolate cake on the house for my boyfriend. Amazing! I highly recommend this place.

_LiHCy7F8eY8qU3rqtg1yQ.text: Food is absolutely delicious!!!!  Great for a romantic dinner or dinner with a group of friends - my husband and I go once a month!!!!

rtx1c8SSMWzl9OjVv1thbA.text: I came here for a nice dinner with a special person, and I absolutely loved it.   First of all, the xmas decorations in the mall were amazing. Set the mood very well for our dinner. We checked in with the hostess, and the hostess who walked us to our seats was very friendly.   We sat next to the live band, a lady singer and a guy pianist/singer. They played really good music ranging from older American pop songs to older R&B songs with their own twist. I couldn't help but to quietly sing along during dinner.   We ordered the following:  1. lobster mashed potatoes - this was the best mashed potatoes I've had in my life. They really don't skimp on the lobster meat either you would find huge chunks, and it was like digging for treasure! The meat was also cooked just right, and it was really fresh. If you go to this restaurant, this side dish is a must get if you like lobster.   2. Sauteed Asparagus - pretty standard just got this dish to get some veggies.   3. Petite Filet Mignon - usually I like more flavorful cuts like ribeyes, and I don't really like filet mignons because they are lean. However this steak was so tender and cooked just right. I enjoyed it a lot. It was just the right portion, 8 oz, since I wasn't too hungry.  3. Sea Scallops - I had a small bite, the scallop was cooked just right, medium rare, and the meat was so sweet!!  Definitely recommend to come here on a special occasion, or if you won from gambling!

0ZMy7dWHZ-Qi_K2rmFKV_A.text: I decided on this place for my boyfriends birthday because he loves steak and I love seafood. He tried to convince me to go somewhere cheaper but I wouldnt allow it. At first I was not a fan of our server- took about 15 minutes to get menu's and an introduction. I think he heard me bitching about it because after that he went out of his way to attend to us. He was an odd fellow but he was trying very hard. I am a sucker for expensive glasses of wine and love it when a restaurant offers such- The server gave a very on point description of the wine I ordered. For entree I had the sea bass and my boyfriend had steak- something with a bone in it- I guess the rib eye? Im not sure about that as I dont eat beef...I was loving my sea bass until my darling mentioned that his steak was extremely salty...and in that moment I noticed that mine was also extremely salty...and I LOVE salt. The sea bass was cooked to perfection and was so flaky and delicious with just the perfect amount of crust on the outside. But- it was almost too salty to eat. My boyfriend said the same thing about the steak- that it was perfectly cooked and a great piece of meat but too salty to really enjoy.   Overall the meal cost me an arm and at least 2 legs...Service B+, Wine A+, Entree C, Bread A+, Price for what you get C+.

VXz9NKYI-xExA_iRjc1Ltw.text: Surprised my wife with a trip to Vegas for our anniversary.  Stayed at Palazzo and have eaten at Craftsteak, Cut, Delmonico, and being from Chicago, we know our way around our Beef (Nine, Gene and Georgetti's, Gibsons, Chicago Chop House, Keefers, Kinzie...).  Considered return to Cut, booked and unbooked Carnevino and Prime before settling on Mastro's because of our evening plans (Mandarin Oriental for drinks) and because we've wanted to try the newbie here in Chicago.    Request, and wait for if necessary, the tree house dining.    Mike R (ASK FOR HIM, HE'S THAT GOOD) did an excellent job with the pacing of our meal.  He knew it was our anniversary and he made sure to congratulate us several times, chat us up without being intrusive, and sincerely took an interest in making our experience pleasurable.  Wife had the bone in Filet (12 oz) and I had the bone in Rib eye...plate, ordered the au gratin potatos to share (our server Mike R recommended one side to share due to the size) and the meal was worth every single of the five stars we are giving this place.      For our anniversary, they treated us to their signature butter cake.  We were stuffed but did our due dilligence....very tasty, very good, and if you actually save room for it, worth ordering.   Upon reflection, this was a perfect destination to celebrate an anniversary.  Live music was noticable, but not intrusive, the tree house, particularly when the sun went down, created a very romantic atmosphere.  Have read complaints about the setting (basically in the middle of the mall) but I don't share those complaints.  Yes, you are in a mall, albeit a mall the average person can walk through but not afford to shop in, but you hardly notice the people honestly.  Saw many people enjoying either bottles of wine (like us...oh, and yes the list has some mark up and bottles you would have to mortgage your home to afford, but also some very reasonably priced, well worth the mark up bottles to be enjoyed ... ) or their signature cocktails which were generous pours and will be on "the list" next time we visit.    But I have to come back to Mkie R, he was a throwback, a restaurant professional who knows the food, knows the wine list, knows the importance of making your feel as though he is there only to make your experience memorable.  I am not kidding, REQUEST him when you visit, you will write me and thank me profusely if you do.    We return to Vegas in September...will definitely drop by for drinks and desert at minimum.

-GD6A7TedrDBuHF6LbFyhw.text: My wife and I can be fussy with restaurants, but Mastro's was so perfect on a recent Vegas visit, that we cancelled plans at another restaurant the following night and did Mastro's all over again...with equally perfect results. Steaks were delicious, tender, and done to perfection. The sides are overly generous and delicious (recommend the Sweet Potato fries). Salads very fresh and tasty. But don't leave without having the butter cake dessert. That was the happiest my tastebuds have been in a long, long time. Our waiter Mario was sensational. Bright, friendly, and efficient. And the setting is as fun and charming as others here describe it.

idOH1huyWP4y3-aZJCOMkQ.text: Dined here last year and had a fabulous time with my family.  Ordered the ribeye (as usual).  Mastro's in Vegas is located on the upper deck of a very swanky shopping mall (on the Vegas Strip).  Ambience is perfect, and of course the food is amazing.

MF7qorvjxf-711XthU2BWw.text: Been to two Mastro's: Costa Mesa and Vegas. Both amazing food, but Vegas is in a treehouse -- AWESOME! I've always wanted to dine in a treehouse! Mastro's is my favorite steakhouse. Mastro's Ocean Club was by far THE most expensive dinner I've EVER had (almost a grand including tips for two), but it was so @#$%^&!%$#! good! What we ordered: - Cosmo with dry ice - Mastro's Signature Seafood Tower with caviar* and lobster cocktail - Escargot with puff pastry - Tomahawk (bone-in ribeye) - Lobster mashed potatoes - Dessert? I'll pass. I just want my steak and lobster mash!! * Seafood tower with caviar was the main item that drove up the bill. (i think it was 200-300 just for that). It's definitely feasible to have a more affordable dinner at Mastro's. Writing this review makes me wanna go back to Vegas and order the tomahawk again. oh. my. gosh. sooooo amazing!! Seafood tower: yelp.com/biz_photos/GI-C...

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. caviar toppings
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mastro&#39;s Signature Seafood Tower with caviar

sV7Ks1Z3lcrgMqouL7pbew.text: Definitely must do spot if you're celebrating a special occasion.  Pricey? Yes, but you're worth it!   Hubby took me for my x0th bday.   First order of the night were drinks and appetizer. I ordered a lemon drop and surprised that the whole shaker remained on the table. I had probably 3-4 glass servings. There was dry ice in my martini glass so the fog effect was a nice treat!  For appetizer, we shared the crab cake which was just enough for us two. They brought out the bread (different types) and ALL freshly baked!  We also shared a Caesar salad per recommendation of our server cuz it was a good size. Not your average Caesar - you can tell is was all from scratch down to the anchovies.  For the main course, I ordered a 6oz filet and hubby ordered 12oz. Both perfect as expected. For the sides, we had the lobster mash potatoes (OMG!) and sauteed asparagus. All of it was scrumptious. Finally, they brought me my bday cake - butter cake topped with vanilla ice cream and a side of housemate whipped cream.  It was yummy and rich, But truly, this could be shared by six people, I barely scratched the surface.   Great atmosphere, great servers, awesome food!

AvManpm-2fcPPzEFybhW5Q.text: One of the BEST meals our group agrees we've had. Even the simplest details, from the almost-double-portion martinis to the piping hot pretzel rolls are well-considered and designed to impress and welcome. Steak was incredible, portions were generous. We couldn't decide if the "blackened" finish or the truffle butter won more accolades, but I doubt you can go wrong.   I had the petit (6oz) filet mignon with a crab cake to create my own little "surf & turf". Again, portions were above and beyond so it was almost more than I could finish. Having lived in Boston and Maryland I'm extremely well-versed in seafood, especially lobster and crab cakes, so I tend not to order these items freely elsewhere. The crab cake was pan-fried but still great. (I tend to prefer broiled.) The steak was better than top steak houses in DC/NY. Honestly. Find a way to get steak and seafood into your meal!  For "family style" sides we ordered creamed spinach (unnecessary), crab gnocchi (food heaven), lobster mashed potatoes (must get), and sweet potato fries (I didn't even bother as I had too much more interesting food already). The server actually walks around to distribute the sides as you like, which again was a wonderful touch for our group of 9.   Other winners: shrimp sushi roll, all martinis, espresso drinks, tomato/burrata salad.   Our server was really fantastic. Friendly, efficient, doting, and plenty loud which again, is very important when you have lists of specials to communicate enthusiastically and a long table of 9 semi-rowdy friends.  We used to actually go off the Strip to find hidden top steakhouse gems but now Maestro's in Crystal Center will be the go-to.   If you have only ONE good/fancy/formal meal for your trip: go here.

ueZ60vUnMRfoIv46plZqkA.text: I've been fascinated by this "tree house" for the longest. This was my first time visiting Mastro's and I had long heard of the famous warm butter cake, so I was excited to come for a pharm. rep dinner, get to learn and try a new place.   We made our selections from a pre-set menu.  My first course I went with the Caeser Salad, this was pretty standard except for the bits of anchovie throughout, which is my favorite kind of Caeser.   For my entree I chose the 8oz filet. I asked for it to be prepared medium. What came out was between rare and tartare. Since we were in a small private dining room for the lecture, I didn't feel comfortable sending my steak back, it would be disruptive, and I didn't want to interupt the lecturer. I ended up giving it to my friend to take home to her dogs.  The family style shared sides weren't impressive either. Mashed potatoes had no flavor, and the sugar snap peas as well. Only one I liked was the creamed spinach.   Dessert we had a choice between chocolate sin cake and cheesecake. I went with the chocolate cake, it came with a side of homemade whipped cream which I thought was better than the cake itself.   Pretty disappointing meal all together. I would come back for a second try, just not in a hurry to do so. I definitely enjoyed the lecture more than dinner.

qHxza_aZe0_yaRLh_AE1cA.text: Absolutely wonderful. Probably the best meal I have eaten in Vegas in years. It was my husband's birthday so I made reservations. I wasn't that impressed with the venue, almost like a food court in Crystals, City Center. But the service and attention from the moment we arrived more than made us feel special. We had crab cakes, mussels, filet and lobster mashed potatoes. Super heated plates, everything cooked to perfection. We shared everything and had more than enough food for two. Oh and a couple of bottles of wine. The prices were not silly! I had mentioned on the reservation that it was a birthday and an absolutely phenomenal dessert was brought to the table with no prompt from me. The manager personally visited the table and left a card. The following morning I received a call asking how we enjoyed ourselves. Who does that?? Perfect attention to detail.

vJdXN-xl8I8EAplpyixswg.text: Located in the Crystals Shopping center next to Aria. Park at Crystals Valet if you aren't staying at the hotel. They have electric car charging. Consistently delicious food every time we come. 5 stars for service, food, everything. Try to get a table inside the treehouse. Few of the items we ordered:  Petite filet: absolutely melt in your mouth delicious.  Heirloom tomato and burrata cheese: very good but pricey at $20. Sea salt and vinegar fries: addicting! Alaskan halibut: hubby says was very good. Creamed corn side: delish. Signature butter cake: so yummy! Sugar snap peas side: cooked perfect...super crunchy. Table bread and butter: even that was awesome!  Would highly recommend and def be back, Mastros!

sdBfkkMEMIEmMUPDoZqniQ.text: I had made reservations here for my wife's birthday and when we got there the place was crowded.  The hostesses explained the wait, and offered for us to have a drink in the lounge until our table was ready.  They kept checking in on us until we were ready to be seated.    We started with two cups of coffee and the Dungeness Crab Cocktail.  The crab came out on a cup of dry ice that was smoking and was a very good presentation, as well as being extremely tasty.  For dinner my wife had the 8oz. Petite Filet and I had the Chilean Sea Bass.  The waiter, Piotr, explained that the sides are served family style and that we should share a couple.  We chose the Lobster Mashed Potatoes and the Steamed Broccoli.  My wife, when asked how she wanted her meat cooked, asked for it to be medium, Piotr explained that medium would still have some pink in the center, and sensing the way that she likes hers cooked, recommended medium plus.  When it came out it was cooked perfectly, and was the most tender steak that she has ever had.  My Sea Bass was cooked so it had a nice, crispy shell of the outside, but was milky and soft on the inside.  The Lobster Mashed Potatoes has spoiled me, now I find it hard to not expect that kind of perfection from all other potatoes.  After dinner they brought out a complimentary Chocolate Sin Cake for us to share with a birthday message written in sauce on the plate.    Overall, this was an amazing meal at an amazing restaurant, and I would highly recommend this to anyone.  The prices are high, but you will get what you pay for.  My only regret is not being able to try the Warm Butter Cake everyone raves about, but I guess that means I have to go here again next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Treehouse dining room
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate Sin Cake with happy birthday message
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilean Sea Bass with Lobster Mashed Potatoes and Broccoli

N2Og9xgA7AltGU5ljpIFxw.text: I always passed by Mastro's but never had a chance to try their food. My BF and his brother took me here for my birthday last September. We order a couple a la carte sides ( Yumm to the lobster mash) and I ordered the rack of lamb. I really like my lamb but unfortunately it was too much for me to finish. I highly recommend this place if you've never been.

ywmBMx0o7mx9j68GDmF97A.text: We had six in our party and had a great experience.  Great live piano player, cool ambiance, 5 star quality food, reasonable wine list, and nice staff.  I love this restaurant.  The only possible knock is the dining room, although sleek and modern with an amazing architectural tree house in the middle, is in the mall.  Even though this mall has the highest of high end shops, it still feels a bit like your eating in a mall. No biggee for me, just something to consider.  Food: Steak 5 stars - ribeye was an excellent cut and perfectly prepared Salad 5 stars - really simple but well done Wine list and our selection - 5 star - great bottle at reasonable price Desert - butter cake?  10 stars - best desert I have ever had - our group talked about it the rest of the trip   Service: Polite, professional and well trained.  What you get in a AAA five diamond restaurant.  Mastros should be proud.  This is even more rare than great food.  Ambiance:  The piano player, ultra modern dining area and spacious layout make this a great place for a business meeting, special occasion or date night.    Overall - awesome ++ Love it!

i_5xkvFA5lsvzABcxezs3w.text: Very cool decor and excellent service.  We just finished eating elsewhere before we found this hidden gem and were completely bummed we didn't find it sooner.  So we sat at the bar and had a nice glass of malbec - a very generous glass of wine - with a very friendly bartender, Melissa.  She explained the menu to us in great detail and told us exactly what we should order the next time we visited.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very cool view of this restaurant inside Crystals in the City Center.

xtp6DTz9V9zJpwMs6eXyCQ.text: For starters I really wanted to give this place a great review because the food was good, but after receiving my bill I just can't do it.  Our total bill came up to $243.23. That's not my complaint. My complaint is that we left a cash tip and when we saw the charge on the card, it was for $291.88. I'm glad I kept my receipt.  This prompted a call from me to the restaurant today to find out why there was an additional $47.00 charged to my card without disclosing it to me. The manager told me that the company they use AUTOMATICALLY adds a 20% gratuity to the bill.   This was not disclosed to us by the waitress. It was not disclosed on our receipt. In fact, when I called, he said they receive that complaint at least 5 times a day, as if that's the normal order of business. FIX IT if people are complaining. You have no right to charge them an additional 20% without disclosing this BEFORE  they eat.  Tips are VOLUNTARY, not mandatory unless disclosed. I leave my tips in cash and I always cross out the tip line on the receipt.  The money isn't the issue,its the principle that they have no right to take my money without my permission. That is basically theft.   So now, I have to wait 2-3 business days for the additional $47 to be refunded to my card, which means I won't see my money until Tuesday or Wednesday, since we ate there Friday night. Other than this absurd experience with my bill, here is a review on the food.  1) The customer service is great except for not disclosing that I'll be charged an additional 20% even if you leave a cash tip.  2) The  crab cakes were good, but both my wife and I had a small piece of shell. Nothing worth complaining about.  3) My wife had the blackened ribeye. It was delicious.  4) I had rack of lamb. it was delicious.  5) Twice baked potato was good.  6) Gorgonzola mac & cheese was good.  7) Clam chowder was good.  8) Calamari was just OK.  9) The complimentary bread was mostly hard except for the pretzels. I don't mind a mix of breads, but when the majority are hard, its just not for us.   Overall, the food was good, but we will not be going back until the change they policy of charging people an additional 20% without their knowledge.  If you eat here PAY CASH.

QkhBA4qRXQ7-KgIBdQ9Itw.text: We spontaneously decided to eat here tonight for dinner and they seated us right away which was great. The table we were assigned was not one we liked and they had no problem letting us sit beside the balcony instead... I ordered the oysters on the half shell and even though the month of July has no r in it, they tasted extremely fresh. Their horseradish is amazing! For an entree I ordered the scallops. I have not ordered scallops in years because it's such a difficult food for restaurants to really have fresh but this was a worthy choice. My partner is vegetarian and her sides were homemade mashed potatoes, brussels sprouts and asparagus. Everything was so good that we forgot to leave space for dessert... Even the complimentary bread was irresistible. Thanks Mario!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The oysters on the half shell
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The amazing side dishes!
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallops

NXL6oTdcckwj3pczpMwOxg.text: We couldn't make our initial reservation and was disappointed but when we checked in to the Aria and noticed it was located in the Crystal shops, we decided to have a late dinner after shopping.   The ambiance was unique, in a good way. Our server Daniel gave us exceptional service - he was very attentive and accommodating. We ordered the Rack of Lamb, Scallops and the Gorgonzola Mac n Cheese! Everything was cooked to perfection and well seasoned aka tasty.   We were not disappointed and happy we were able to experience Mastro's Ocean Club before leaving Vegas.

6V4InYz3px1eRjcvXYAC5g.text: Mastro's has good reviews and my honey really loves lobster bisque so we decided to give it a try. We had seen the strange bird house looking structure at Crystals many times before. We made a reservation for a table in the birdhouse although there are a lot of tables in the other sections of the restaurant. We were promptly seated and service started immediately. We ordered the vanilla battered shrimp as an appetizer. My wife ordered the lobster bisque which we shared. She ordered Parmesan crusted grouper. I ordered Blackened Chilean Sea Bass. For sides we ordered creamed spinach and sea salt and vinegar fries. My wife liked the shrimp, I was disappointed in it. It was very lightly tempura battered, very tender. I just thought it was bland. The lobster bisque was everything we had hoped for and more. It was thick and creamy with large pieces of lobster; very savory. The Parmesan crusted grouper was excellent. It was perfectly cooked and lightly spiced. The Sea Bass was perfect. It was very thick, light and flaky. The creamed spinach was excellent. The salt and vinegar fries were good. They are very thinly sliced (think potato sticks). But the best was still to come. We ordered their signature warm butter cake. OMG this may be the best cake either of us has ever eaten. It is served with a garnish of fresh fruit, a huge scoop of ice cream and fresh whipped cream. Regardless of what else you order here, you MUST try this warm butter cake. Service was excellent and she the price is fair.   Minuses- the noise level is very high. Very hard to hold a conversation. They have a large staff of servers, but service was slow. One of our sides was delivered as we finished our entre's.   We will definitely be back.

nqaL1QTpLvtAUhAEV0YXUw.text: A beautiful fusion of woods, forward leaning design, sushi & seafood selections and warm service make this a great large party dining experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. More than a few options for cocktails.

71gXM9MdNGM3r8x2DEE-yg.text: This is just for service - Didn't even get to try the food here!  I was excited to try this place during an impromptu Vegas trip. Called for Reservations a week ahead and they called me the day off to confirm. I told them we were running 15 min late and they said it might take longer to seat us.  We ended up waiting 30 minutes before we gave up and left since we had a show to get to. I don't think pushing the reservations 15 back should have made that much of a dramatic wait difference - isn't the point of a reservation is to HOLD the table for me? Whats the diff between holding it 15min in the beginning than if i took an extra 15 min to eat/sit there?  Anyways, as we were waiting at the bar, another couple had  reservation as well and they were waiting longer than we were and also getting fed up.What's weird was there was a decent amount of empty tables so it wasn't like very table was filled to capacity.   Don't think I'll attempt to eat at this place, whats the point of reservations if you have to wait?

zN-rWYF0Ruk8z-4O8UCuYg.text: You have to order cocktails here the presentation is so cool, bubbling and smoking all over the place. And they are so full the value is really good!   For food I ordered the tuna tartar and oysters as appetizers both were presented beautifully. As the main course of course I had to eat lobster because I am not an animal! When it was time for dessert I was too full for anything so I enjoyed a double espresso so I would be ready for a Vegas night!   I really should mention the ambience. The location is so cool it sort of feels like you are seated in the skeleton of a wine barrel or an old ship. The beautiful polished wood and dim lighting it had a very romantic feeling. Plus it is elevated in the heart of this shopping area so you can watch all the people passing by. I would definitely go again!

PnuLbCk0pbDBAJhREn5cRA.text: MASTRO'S Never disappoints, why would this one!  Best steak restaurant on this planet!  I have been to 10 different locations, all around and I always get the same service and quality of food.   No matter what you get from the menu, you will never be disappointed (and if you are, there is something wrong with you head..see a psych asap)...

F3fHAl9VEr8WfHUPaN0nbA.text: This steakhouse is heaven on earth. The ribeye and filet are excellent, even the sides were amazing asparagus - yum, lobster mashed potatoes were so worth the extra lbs. Our server was charming and helpful in every way. Definitely worth the splurge. Love you Mastro's!!

c1cTDeyFMQAoiOtovExvyw.text: Wow, what a great experience!  Mastro's is definitely a once in a lifetime place to eat.    From my initial phone call with Britney, I knew this place was first class.  She was very friendly and helpful.  We arrived a little early for our dinner and they seated us in the Treehouse!  Awesome decor  Tim was our server and he was friendly and very helpful with our selections.    We ordered both steaks and fish.  All the entrees come a la carte.  The steaks were steaming hot as they arrived.  Melted in your mouth!  My sea bass was delicious.    For the sides, make sure you get the mac & cheese, delicious!  We also had the sweet potato fries which were crispy and the broccoli.  The hot bread was also very delicious.  With no alcohol, our dinner for four was $275 plus tip.  Not an everyday place but definitely a once in Vegas trip.  The next morning Zach called us to follow up on our experience, I have never had this happen from a restaurant ever!  Nice touch

jCZUm51ONaoOSoN0Bo4Giw.text: Cool place to enjoy a nice dinner with friends. Upscale experience without a ton of fuss. Awesome servers who know their stuff. Very cool structure in the middle of Crystals that almost makes you forget you're in the middle of a bougie mall. Went with a group of 6 and everyone's food looked great. I got a Spicy Mambo Salad and would probably skip it next time, only because it's just a caesar salad, sans croutons with a hint of wasabi. Kinda boring, but not worth losing a star over. Sweet potato fries are bomb, as are the mac & cheese and mashed sweet potatoes. DO NOT SKIP THE BUTTER CAKE. Thank me later.

afM9brpB7Dwm-CLiKmP19A.text: We went twice on our last trip and just let me say we have a new favorite steakhouse and maybe our favorite restaurant period. Everything was first class service food and atmosphere amazing. You must have the famous butter cake. My favorite dessert ever.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JRyPPnzdAnOjEdBC8VuItQ.text: I'm not sure where their high ratings come from. At the price they sell main courses ($35-$60) which includes no sides at all but just a piece of fish or meat is ridiculous as even then it's just a piece of meat - no interesting garnish or sauce even on the plate.   The quality of the fish was ok but we too don't live on the coast and the fish at our local Whole Foods is as good or better than here. Also their beef was just that - ok but I know our local store sells as high of quality.   Was pissed that this place charged $20 for an heirloom tomato salad and served it with the tomatoes cold as if straight from a fridge. Who the hell does that? The tomatoes should be stored at room temperature anyway and I certainly don't want a cold tomato salad. Weak and almost embarrassing for the restaurant.   The vegetable sides are about as generic as you can get and available almost anywhere. Brussels sprouts, green beans, garlic mashed potatoes -  not interesting nor were they very good.   Not sure if their high ratings come from people that live way outside a major city or maybe in live the middle of the country where chain restaurants are the only option but this place was downright shameful for the price and for the generic food preparation. Almost like they have no head chef running things but just an expediter slinging out the same old stuff every day and never thinking to change or improve things.   Bill was around $120/person. No problem if it was an amazing meal (or even above average) but again I could've cooked it better at home for 1/3 the price.   I guess this restaurant will keep cashing in on people don't who know any better or want the most simple uninspiring food on the planet.

ZdBVx4uszh-3LoW-yOwLwg.text: I had the following items:  Petit Filet Scalopped Potatoes Butter Cake  Everything was very good - all items were perfectly seasoned and I really felt satisfied with such a flavorful meal.  Ending the meal with the Butter Cake is the best choice you can make - it is so decadent and satisfying!  Great service and attention to detail here...it's a pricey spot, but worth the splurge.

pld2YtD8_ZEDkFd1Umk5KA.text: I've only been to one steakhouse before this and I wasn't too impressed, but I decided to give this place a shot since our friends were really excited for some fine dining in Vegas.   Our group of eight was seated at a round table underneath the massive open-air structure.   The lobster mashed potatoes were so buttery and delicious. This was a table favorite and it was devoured in minutes. I honestly think the garlic mashed potatoes would have probably tasted just as good and would have been much cheaper.   The 22oz bone-in ribeye was enormous. My friends and I were joking how maybe half the steak would just be bone, but it turns out we were sorely wrong .The bone was maybe 4-5 ounces and the rest of it was delicious, flavorful meat. I opted for medium rare, my friend opted for rare, and I think most of the table preferred the medium rare since it had more flavor although the rare meat was more tender. It really depends on your steak preferences.  The dessert was butter cake. The first couple bites I thought were way to sweet, but that's why it came with a side of heavy whip cream. Top the dessert with the whip cream and it really tones down the sweetness.  The things that stood out the most was the ambiance and quality of food.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Butter cake
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 22oz ribeye

W63U_UjBYkqiw09sC2KaKw.text: This is a very elegant restaurant. The food is incredible and the service is superb.  For sure you should try the crab cakes and the signature cake is fantastic.  The wine selection also is great.  I guess everything is perfect in this place five stars for sure

QmU0Xfx6E758SYFkMTVg9w.text: Impeccable.  Awesome.  Tasty.    We come here every year for special dinners, and of all places in Vegas, THIS place is our favorite.  Amazing structure to dine in, such a good menu.  Impeccable top to bottom.

HykGE2jOI3JOT6GgABebMg.text: Got the bone-in KC cut was perfect. Cream of corn amazing, lobster mash potatoes wow. But nothing and I mean nothing comes close to the butter cake desert with the home made whip cream.   Service was outstanding and one thing I really liked was that when the sides came out the servers would go around the table and place some for each one of us.   Outstanding Steak House

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Butter Cake

pKhnPH7Wv3kyVkALTao4KA.text: Came here last night for my anniversary dinner and it was fantastic. They gave us a really good table and the server was extremely nice. We love their oysters. Me and my husband ate 3 dozen before our meal. We got the sea bass which was amazing and the Kobe steak . I have no complaints. Our experience here was great as usual.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PI-VpVa1ZYGCQnnlz9a89w.text: Worth every penny!  Amazing food, great environment and incredible service!  We would recommend this place to anyone headed to Vegas f you're looking for a high class dining option. The steak was amazing and the seared tuna was the best I've ever had!

cDQbbKlRMGRrWaWZ6THpNQ.text: I'm so disappointed to write this review.  We had such high expectations of Mastro's having been to their other locations.  Celebrating our wedding anniversary and completely giddy, we sat down, ordered cocktails and dove into the incredible bread basket.  Our waiter seemed annoyed with us from the start, but no big deal, we ignored it.  I ordered chicken (please spare me the "you don't order chicken at a seafood place" lecture...I ordered it because it was on the menu, so let's get through that, k? Lol).  Our waiter was non-existent all evening, so he wasn't around at all for me to tell him that the chicken was glaringly under-cooked.  The manager happened to see us looking around and took it back to the kitchen.  He brought the same re-cooked piece back, but one spot (it was a really thick piece) still didn't look ok.  We had the flash light out and kinda debated if it was cooked enough, but the chance of eating slightly under-cooked chicken and getting sick was not an appealing option to me.  (And should I be having this debate at such a fine restaurant?).  I decided not to chance it, but not say anything.  The manager saw me not eating (our waiter was still in abandonment mode), took it away and insisted on replacing it with a filet.  The filet came out and was delicious and we were happy, albeit the mood had changed.  We felt like we had done something wrong.  Honestly, our least favorite meal of the whole weekend.  No butter cake, no second drinks--happy anniversary to us.  :(  Thank you to the manager for not charging us for my chicken or filet and really trying to fix it, but I'm so sad we spent our anniversary there.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 6 oz filet that replaced the undercooked chicken
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Halibut
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My chicken that I ended up sending back because it was undercooked:(

Ju4nGOHcyxPuBqyJT6ktiQ.text: By far the best meal I had in Vegas. I had the crab cocktail, grilled swordfish, crab gnocchi, wild mushrooms, and the buttercake - of course. The crab cocktail was delicious, perfectly cooked sweet crab with a decent cocktail sauce. The swordfish was a little dry on the sides but perfectly cooked towards in inside. The mushrooms were fantastic and full of garlic and butter. The gnocchi was to die for, so delicious and creamy and oh so full of crab- they do not skimp out here. The buttercake was delicious.   My largest complaint about Maestro's is the waitstaff. While they were very nice they were very pushy. They came 3 times in five minutes to ask if they could take our plates. It was probably around 6:30 and our plates were half full. There was no need for a rush.

xcUsKhtAmFh7517CXHsvMw.text: Great service. We were sat quickly with no reservation. Got seated with water service and bread expeditiously. And our server even ran to the bartender to cancel our drink order after he realized we were going to dine with a Morton's Giftcard, which obviously, Mastro's does not accept. Oooops. Our bad.   Our cool server didn't make us feel any more stupid than we already did for being in the wrong restaurant. He even walked us half way towards the right one. If he's an example of the service at Mastro's, we may just come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IJxQe5e_l1QJ4Aj--arJ-w.text: The halibut was great! It did have a white wine butter sauce but the scallops were to die for.  Definitely a great spot to come back to!

EYJseVkOJQyTt2jocQLmtg.text: Hmm.   We always eat at Mastro's wherever possible.   We had really slow service (at 6p?!) and couldn't have dessert bc it took so long for meal that we were about to miss our 8p show.  Our server wasn't that busy and we had already ordered drinks...so don't know why there was such a lag.  It was somewhat annoying, as we love their desserts.    The shrimp cocktail and jalapeno sashimi were outstanding.   Actually, the sashimi was better than similar dish at Nobu that we always order.   Crab cake was good.   We also had filet, crab legs and scallops.    All good.  Sides were average and actually didn't really enjoy the Brussel sprouts.     Still 4 stars but for an $$$$ dinner--should've been 5.

VxEh1Uo2NWyQcaE_uacK5w.text: My husband and I love going to Mastros at home so we decided to check out the Las Vegas location. Sadly we were very disappointed. My steak was burnt on the outside but medium rare on the inside. (I ordered medium so I didn't return it) My husband order medium well and it was bleeding all over his plate! The waiter took his three pieces of steak back where it was cooked dry. The brussel sprouts had no flavor and were just dry. I gave two stars because the waiter kept my water glass full. For a $200 meal I expect my food to be cooked properly. I've included a picture of my burnt steak.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lRhJ916MY3BFLo8L2_qu4g.text: "First Timer" this was a good  dining experience! The restaurant itself was nice, the staff was friendly   shocked we have never had Mastro's before. For drinks we ordered the Buddha Belly which was good.The bartender Sheryl was very nice and outgoing with great personality! We sat down our waiter was super nice and knowledgeable. I ordered the Seabass It was tender, seasoned very flavorful. My boyfriend ordered the ribeye he enjoyed it.. He also ordered the lobster tail loaded potatoes and the Mac n cheese I am definitely coming back here. Dessert we ordered the butter cake it was a little dry and didn't really taste all that amazing to me a little over rated in my opinion

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seabass

4bacb5rXA-140ctQZau_3g.text: This place has the potential to be something awesome, but the staff really held us back from enjoying what could have been a wonderful experience. Service started out good but before we even got around to placing our order they were already falling flat. No drink menu or wine list for starters and to go along with that no wine recommendations. I guess if you don't want us to order wine, 1) don't give us a menu, 2) don't mention what pairs well. Service got obnoxiously slow after we ordered our food, so bad that one of our party went and lodged a complaint with the manager. The only saving grace on this visit was the food. Everyone seemed to enjoy their plates. I ordered the filet, which came out wonderful and cooked perfectly. For what they charge here, everything should have been dialed in, it's unfortunate that we didn't have the same experience so many others were able to enjoy.

Ov6wtUaoX8nvItVETXs4Iw.text: Best butter cake I've tried so far. This place is really good I think the food pictures are self explanatory. Only thing that sucks is they serve the food extremely hot so you can't eat it right away lol.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their mac &amp; cheese is amazing!

2PPjR5grFGjrBduAge9Zww.text: Was here for a private party and am very grateful to the hosts for treating us all to the experience. In a luxury mall on the strip. Be sure to window shop on ur way to the restaurant. Amazing service. Excellent wines. A filet cooked to med rare perfection & so generous in its proportions i couldn't believe my eyes. Very interesting architectural statement in the main dining room. And at least two sculpture groupings in the mall worth a look.

eakxUccRMZoT0kBctEgxwg.text: Very disappointed.     A for architecture.  C for food.    In a city with plethora of premiere steak restaurants, this place does not impress.  If you are used to great steak restaurants in Vegas like Prime, Joe's prime, Capital Grill.....Mastro's is not a place you want to spend your $$$ in.

Xpc1N4EEXcO1ZCAHS2F8CA.text: this mastros was awesome!  it does feel like you're in a treehouse :) ok, let's start with the bread basket...forget the other breads, go straight for the pretzel one that is fresh out of the oven still hot and steamy this party of six had the chilean sea bass, petit filet, ribeye, bone in filet which was all amazing! except for one that didnt really eat the bone in filet - it looked a little dry for medium (maybe he should have ordered medium rare) for the sides, we had the lobster mashed potato which had big chunks of lobster on top the sweet potato fries were soooo good and still a little al dente which was nice the gongonzola mac n cheese was really cheesy and good! sauteed spinach was garlicky and of course you can't leave mastros without having the BUTTER CAKE!!! service was top notch as always

KSVarfNiBpMpbo1CBzTaLA.text: top notch service  great portions at good prices for the quality  actually called afterwards to ask about the service and satisfaction free buttercake for your birthday!

ierCrtMlaM0M4KYBi-WnjA.text: We had the king crab claws for appetizer.  They were fantastic; the spicy cocktail sauce was very good with them.  We tried the chopped salad and clam chowder instead of the shared sides we usually have and they were both very good. The best part of the meal was the wagyu sirloin, it was unbelievably tender.   For desert we had the butter cake, it's to die for nothing like it anywhere else.

6TiOORsIfgHI7FSfY7qR-A.text: Oh my gosh we are still talking about our dinner at Mastros.  What an incredible experience!  Focus on the word experience because that is what it is.  Excellent service with super friendly and knowledgeable staff, great ambiance and outstanding food.  Not too often you get all three in one place.  We went to Mastros on a Wednesday night recently and were seated in the bird cage area.  Very cool way to encase the restaurant in the mall.  Elizabeth and Daniel took care of us that night and what a great team.  So friendly, relaxed, professional and fun they made it such a great dining experience.  Before i even get to appetizers I have to mention the bread basket. I'm not a huge bread person but this was so good! And my martini was classic, simple and perfect. For appetizers we got the spicy salad and the heirloom tomatoes and buratta cheese.  I struggled feeling like I should choose some seafood but Daniel assured me the tomatoes were spectacular right now.  Boy oh boy was he right!  Fantastic flavors on both of these dishes.  For dinner my husband chose the filet rare which few places will actually cook RARE.  His was picture perfect.  I chose the seabass with the Oregenatta topping suggested by Elizabeth - DELICIOUS! Just outstanding.   Lucianna the Bar Manager realizing we were from Washington DC told us about the new restaurant opening there in just 2 days.  She was lovely to check that we were enjoying our time and sent over their signature butter cake for dessert.  we weren't going to get anything since we were stuffed but we dug into what we now call the dessert to beat all desserts.  My husband is a big chocolate person so saying this about vanilla cake with caramelized sugar, vanilla ice cream and raspberry sauce is something.  Like all the other diners say - this is not to be skipped!  when you pay a lot of money for dinner you want it to be good and rightly get annoyed when it's not.  We walked away saying this place is worth every single penny.  we haven't had such a lovely time in ages.  I cannot wait to return to Mastros in Las Vegas and will be sure to visit in DC.  Thank you Elizabeth, Daniel and Lucianna!

Bzf982C60uxmnD6pXHCMsA.text: This is a fabulous restaurant in the Crystals mall at the City Center development.  It's part of the Mastro's chain, which I was familiar with before my visit from their store in Beverly Hills.  Despite the intimidating size of the City Center complex, if you park in the Crystals valet, getting in and out is really pretty easy.  The restaurant is everything you would expect from an eatery at this price point and more.  The service is immaculate and attentive. (I particularly like the flourish that comes with the simultaneous presentation of all of the table's entrees.)  Also, the manager came over and checked on us to make sure everything was perfect as well.  This restaurant has the steaks that you would expect from the Mastro's name but its primarily focus is seafood. (Thus the "Ocean Club" moniker.)  The quality and preparation are top notch.  In terms of the facility itself, part of the dining area sits in a stylized banyan tree. (Really.)  It certainly makes a statement and is definitely where the cool kids want to sit.  Finally, while it will shave months off of your life, you absolutely must have the butter cake desert - I lack the vocabulary to describe how utterly scrumptious this myocardial infarction inducing item is.

bLwejkZHkPZ5ysUUkTrL8g.text: Best steak I've ever had, bone in filet. Service is great. Setting odd but it works. Prepare to spend.  You have to try the butter cake for dessert. It's a legend.

yo3L8VLTo_IFKz2Y7o2H7Q.text: the  appetizer, salad and desert were great but I had the worst halibut and my wife had tasteless steak which was over cooked ( she asked for medium well )  , will not dine in Mastro's Ocean Club ,  over priced and not worth the time

e7fISvGgkVZguvzGtQUSmg.text: Outstanding food and service.  Even the bread basket was delicious!  I was wary of eating at a restaurant in the middle of a mall, no matter how fascinating it looks.  But everything was delicious!  I ordered a Lemon Drop, and they put a little dry ice on the bottom of the glass and serve it table side.  The drink starts to bubble and smoke.  It tasted refreshingly yummy!  There were 4 of us.  We ordered The Lobster Bisque, Mussels, Tuna Tartar, and a Cesar salad for appz.  OMG.  Delicious!  As another reviewer pointed out, if you order a main dish, like the Sea Bass, it will come all by itself on a plate.  So order some side dishes.  The waiter will plate it up for you at your table.  We were so stuffed that we didn't have room for dessert.  Bummer, because I'm sure it would have been yummy.  Our bill was around $475 with tip.  So not too bad with all that we had, including cocktails and wine.

PrUlFSSI9puLXpw8SWcsqA.text: Truly enjoyed all aspects of dining here. The dungeness crab was excellent, and our steaks were cooked perfectly. I could probably do without the 400 degree plate. It's Vegas, I really didn't need anything to make the evening warmer. The service was attentive, and the wine selection was nice.  I will definitely stop in at the new location Chicago to sample more of their appetizers and fish selections.

Q2xdb27E-gC-JsCfW_fNyQ.text: Amazing! Incredible treehouse setting, stupendous service and great food. Las Vegas has a new jewel high atop the rather dull Crystals shopping center at the dreary City Center. I can't tell you how wonderful the entire experience dining at Mastro's is--it's magical. Go, enjoy and bring your camera and appetite.

Bizm7KqOH-Vd0E-YvC4BNg.text: I gotta go 5 stars. The spicy horseradish that comes with the shrimp cocktail is the best I have ever had. Simply incredible! Everything here is very very good. It is probly the most expensive place on the strip though, make sure you save your pennies! LOL. Also try the crab cake, you won't regret it!

VdFMiWv6sRSlFHhqdTXwxw.text: We had a lovely dinner.  My friend and I split the scallops and the NY steak and they were delicious.  A few comments:  1) the restaurant is in a high-end mall so it didn't feel very secluded or intimate; 2) we ordered creamed spinach and mashed potatoes as our sides.  These side portions could have easily fed 4-5 people each.  I wished that the waiter would have told us that how much food this is. Too much waste.  We were on vacation - so no doggy-bags possible.

Y3h4Xmpix062LZ8q09mMKQ.text: I was on a trip to Vegas on a shopping trip with my mother and my husband demanded that we went to this restaurant.  My mom loved that the restaurant was in a tree-house. Our waitress was very nice and knowledgeable about everything on the menu. We both had the petite fillet, cook amazingly to both our liking. We also had the lobster mashed potatoes (amazing as well). unfortunately, we didn't have room for desert, but it a reason to go back! I even got a phone call the next day asking about my experience which makes me feel valued.

N04syGYeQzr2AdZVYOLedQ.text: This is my favorite place to eat in Las Vegas. Although it's basically a restaurant located in the middle of a shopping mall (albeit an upscale mall), it is a very pleasurable dining experience. The food here is incredible. The lemon drops are fantastic and entertaining as they are served smoking and bubbling. Excellent wines on the wine list. The filet here is magnificent. The truffle lobster gnocchi is out of this world. The side dishes are excellent and feed about four or five people. The warm butter cake is spectacular and is served with a huge bowl of some of the best whipped cream we have tasted. Unfortunately, one of the people in our party ordered the crab cakes and was disappointed with them as she thought they were over seasoned and almost tasted as though they were seasoned with poultry seasoning. The last time we ate at Mastro's Ocean the service was tad bit better, but compared to the poor service that we've been receiving lately, the service was outstanding. Did I mention the live pianist? Some of the people in our party thought they were listening to some recorded Billy Joel music and were surprised when they found out that it was actually a young man playing the piano.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab Cakes
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab Salad

kntWsMnSrvoldcQtUEMR9w.text: This is my first online review.  I felt compelled to write it based on a dining experience that stands apart from others i've had in Vegas.  While there are a handful of high quality restaurants in Las Vegas, Mastros Ocean Club stood out for its consistent, high quality cuisine and  great service.  While the nose bleed prices are over the top and the greet staff unexceptional, the food was excellent, the portions ample, menu deep, ambiance nice and service excellent.  That, in and of itself, is sufficient for me to reserve at least one of my nights in Vegas.  The thing that would bring me there every night was my waitress, Heather.  Sweet, smart, personable, attentive, funny, efficient, knowlegable and unassuming.  She handled tables of conference guys, couples and singles with equal aplomb. I live in NYC, eat out alot, have my goto places with goto staff, and have to say that in a very short period of time Heather distinguished herself as top notch.  If you're lucky enough to get her as your waitress, with sufficent credit line, you'll eat there every night.

qaWV2u3GjtGmLPaOMcqcrQ.text: Went to Maestros as part of a regional get together with colleagues.  The ambiance was great, and the food was excellent.  By far my favorite part was the sea food tower, build it anyway you like, everything on there was so fresh I could hear waves crashing.  My steak was cooked exactly how I like it, and the wine flight pairing made for a nice compliment.  Only down side was because our party was somewhat large, and there was at least one other large party service was a little sparse and at one point we waited 15 min for someone to come around.  This is the only reason Maestros gets a 4 out of 5 in my book, however I will return as the food was just that good.

e-TWBPdGXkflg8CEdgixgQ.text: I love Mastro's the food here is FANTASTIC and the the atmosphere is very nice :) I love the vegetables here they are GREAT!!! The service is also very good and the prices may be up there...however its well worth the money :) WONDERFUL place to go for dinner :)

KST18MQcY3ESFw8z_PrWjA.text: This is the kind of over the top dining that I like to treat myself to once in a while. Gorgeous white tablecloth service, servers in white sportscoats, beautiful bar. I wish I could have spent 3 hours drinking my way through the meal and probably will allow myself that much time next visit.   I had the 12oz bone in filet, it was excellent. Our table ordered the gnocchi & crab as a side dish. Delicious even for $26.    It's a tiny bit awkward that it's in the middle of a massive shopping mall, for this kind of evening I wish I could just put on a nice dress and heels, take a cab and have a doorman open the restaurant door for me instead of trekking through a gi-normous mall up and down escalators to get there. However they make up for it with a cool bar and outstanding service.

bRzpf3eS1q31Wla_bb4e2g.text: 18 oz bone-in filet was the best and priciest piece of steak I had so far.    Lobster mashed potatoes were good.  The portion was huge.  It can probably feed 3 to 4 people.

VIeQgOYdWM27tQ50_2JSBQ.text: Was here exactly one week ago with a group- about 10 of us, girls and guys (what was left over from a combined bachelor/bachelorette weekend). My husband and I are from Chicago and the Mastros here is my FAVORITE restaurant in the world (see review)- so I came to this one with really high expectations. First off our server, Tim, was phenomenal! So friendly, quick, and informative with every question we had. Next was the food, which was just as I expected- amazing. Husband had the bone in filet, and I did the halibut. Both delicious! I tried my girlfriends sea bass and that was awesome too. We all split a ton of apps and sides, and finished off with butter cakes for the table. Food coma heaven!  The only thing lacking was the atmosphere. (Why I knocked off 1 star) we were expecting a loud, energetic "Vegas" style restaurant (much like the one back home here in Chicago) But it was very quiet, bright, and just low energy. More suitable for a quiet dinner with your significant other, not a crazy group of 8 guys and 2 girls lol. But hey maybe that's the feel this Mastros is going for, which I can totally appreciate.

CqdAbtkMwL3J_Abfd_8WcA.text: 40th Bday dinner for my girl and what can I say....Mastro's didn't disappoint. Once again our food/service was awesome, ambience great and drinks were too good!   * Try the dream berry martini if you like strawberries. *  Try the Mambo salad. It is a Cesar salad with horseradish in the dressing so it has a spicy kick. Have them serve it with shrimp for something really delicious. * Lobster mash is good and sinful. Don't let it get cold

1DOQfTsH9dFkVSBMGn92wg.text: As a 'local' in this town, it is one of our favorites, with the reason being that the portion sizes are so large that you will have left overs for at least one meal!  The prices do support this, but once you divide it by 2 or 3 I feel it is worth it.  The wait staff is very friendly and knowledgeable.  They are excellent at giving you the actual methods of preparation, ingredients, etc. on any item vs. places where they basically repeat what is written on the menu (yes, I can read).  The lobster bisque is sublime.  The creamed spinach is wonderful.  The fish and seafood I have had each time was perfectly cooked and very tasty.  And above all else...be sure to save room for the warm butter cake!  I feel bad for the tourists that usually leave so much on the table.  Me....I'm walking out with my doggy bag!

iV_jZ_Ue4dQJXjnBb21uWg.text: Everything from the bread basket to my appetizer to my steak to dessert to service was outstanding at Mastro's!!  I have nothing bad to say about this place.  Okay, if I had to pick one thing... I would say if you're looking for a "romantic" dinner date setting, I would probably say this is NOT the place.  It's in the middle of a mall.  But, romance is what you create so to me, if the food is good and service is great, that's really what counts!  Our server was awesome.  He made great recommendations, was attentive, was kind, was not annoying in the sense that he was trying to recommend only the most expensive things.  He was honest about what was good and not just based on price.  The steaks were cooked to perfection and they are huge!!!  You can seriously share a steak.  Like really.  The sides were amazing and also huge.  I mean seriously... Truffle Gnocchi!?!?  Holy hell!  And Lobster Mash?!!!  Yes please!  And you need to save room for the butter cake. You just have to.  It was so good.  I mean like really good.  I don't know what else to say, it really was that good!

aByW8CmRbZApwwogMzm1KA.text: Amazing place to enjoy a great meal. There is NOTHING about this place that isn't top notch. Service, food, drinks,atmosphere. All 5 stars

L_Lso3cq5au1t5_9_mpbYw.text: Best steak I've ever had. I had the Bone in filet cooked medium rare and it was so tender it just dissolved in my mouth. I also shared the lobster mashed potatoes and it was probably the best mashed potatoes i've ever had as well. It was super creamy and the lobster was cooked perfectly.  I came here w/ a group of 20 other guys for my friends bachelor party and we were given a private room w/ a tv so we could watch some football. Boys night out w/ steak, wine, and football? Cant beat that. The Bachelor kept saying this was way too fancy and it was all too much when he walked in the room. But one of our waiters told us "This place is fancy...but you can act ghetto if you want. just relax and have a good time."  We had an excellent experience w/ even better food. This place is legit.

ZOBBQQaxIXkCLzvj7GIznw.text: Tried this place for dinner and was not impressed.  Had lamb chops and scalloped potatoes. The potatoes were half cooked and the lamb was bland

bVPn02Ky2KBiUKEm4DjDtg.text: Love coming here when we come to Vegas. Restaurant is located in the Crystal 's center, which is close to surrounding hotels. The staff is friendly and very polite. Our waiter Paul was awesome!! Food portions are a good size. The steak, salad and sides were cooked to perfection. The food was delicious. The most amazing dessert ever is the butter cake.

QmIsBeehr5aBaX2Q7S49KQ.text: I had by far the best dining experience of my life here! Truffle gnocchi and the wagyu steak are the way to go! Also the dessert martinis are killer! Beautiful restaurant and exceptional service. I will go back!

Ag0iJE9MrzO6O1Eu-aUDHg.text: A great experience from beginning to end. Excellent customer service, fantastic food, great wine and exceptional company! Highly recommend Mastro's.  Biggest highlight was the rack of lamb, extraordinary!

mFIAt3ozDK8O99kj6gvxiA.text: Probably one of the most amazing dinners from start to finish. The food was excellent but what really topped it off was the customer service. I highly recommend having Juan@Tanya as your servers. Those two are top notch. I am very picky on customer service. It seems like a forgotten art these days. They were friendly, never let our glasses empty and even helped with pairing  food. Juan even suggested we remove some items from our order just because it would be too much and we would of been stuffed. So many times these days wait staff don't care what you order or how much. And they expect their 20% regardless. Not these two! We will visit Mastro's again in the future.

EDthFZemfEkK9wz46ESu7w.text: I would do a 3 and a half star rating if I could but since I can't, they don't deserve a 4 for sure.  Friends have ranted and raved about maestros since they knew my love for fine dining. Frankly, it was mediocre.   It is located in the Crystals near the Cosmopolitan and Aria. It's in this art structure that looks like a nest type deal. Then you walk in and we were seated near the "open" area of the restuarant. It basically overlooks the mall. Not impressed, but then again it is Vegas.. What else to stare at than people.   Long story short. Ordered my steak with a near bored to death server or blatently rude..and my girl ordered hers rare and they both came back medium... Was not happy. The drinks were OK and the only thing that sold me was their final dessert of the butter cake. Basically made my whole night.   Overall nothing to rant and rave about...

xYWchTRAqGRdlP7M5MgvUA.text: It's our special event place when we're in Las Vegas, and tonight was a special, special event. The food was wonderful, and so was our server, Katie.
