We snagged a table in the bar corner, ordered copious amounts of chilled seafood and great cocktails and Katie and the team brought it all to us was great attitude and special service. Any question I asked (and I asked a ton) was welcomed. Thanks to Katie and the gang for making it a great night.

fJCmH3-xUWUNxhhH36gSkA.text: Love this place - usually go to the Ocean Club in Newport Coast.  Seafood tower was received and eaten.  Fantastic.  Love the dry ice steaming down the table.  Dinner - split the wagyu tomahawk chop.  It was huge, but delicious.  Dessert - butter cake...don't bother with anything else.

7tMHaKmD71Zlgm-XRUpNEg.text: 24oz Rack of Lamb a bit undercooked, good value $48 but too much for one person. Twice baked potato enormous like $12 - too much cheese on too - potato was not dry thankfully didnt need butter - live entertainment not bad but a bit overpowering - server was cute and good.

vifCGSRulfMQLpT9LIh-mg.text: This review is for the warm butter cake!!!  A friend of mine found out I was in Vegas for my birthday and all he said was make sure you go to Mastro's Ocean Club for the warm butter cake. I was like ok...I'll try it.  He was like no, you better try it.  So, I was on a hunt to try this warm butter cake.  To my surprise, my hotel is literally across the street from the place.   We get to the place at 11:30pm and the hostess tells us we're closed and we're bummed.  Bummed because we're scheduled to leave tomorrow and wouldn't have the chance to try it.  We begged to just sit at the bar and see if they would let us order dessert. She said sure...YAY :)  Got to the bar, looked at the menu and the bartender said you have to try our signature dessert dish and we said ok but we're here for one thing and he said the warm butter cake and we were like YES!!!!!  When it came out it was sooo beautiful.  To cute to cut!!! The cuteness didn't last long.  We took our first bite and OMG...decadence!!!! It was mouth watering. It was fabulous. It was soooooooo sweet and so good.  i could feel my sugar levels going up but I didn't care :)  Gotta try it!!!

2isKj8gZhCoDMH-HpaCoHw.text: A bit disappointed with their steak, our group had an array of steak, rib eye bone in, rib eye, filet mignon, and a salmon dish. Granted it's Mastro's ocean club, their salmon was excellent, but their steak. Egh, dry not too flavorful. Service was excellent, we sat upstairs in our own room which was lovely.  However the service did not make up for the food. Will not be returning.

d9e6GHpqWXt4UVVwjTKC7w.text: Excellent! From entering this unique architectural design restaurant all the way through dessert. Hard to find fault with anything. The only issue was that we ate too much bread.  We started with the crab cake, then tried the ahi tuna tostada. We had the Seabass and the John Dory fish with a large sized side of the Lobster Gnocchi. The service was impeccable. This has to be one of the best seafood places anywhere.

35nt4YpOmtegW78Mv7C9XA.text: If you want classy, high end, and delicious food.. go to Mastro's! My husband and I LOVE Mastro's. The crab cakes (appetizer) and butter cakes (dessert) are to die for! The atmosphere is very inviting and romantic, and the servings are VERY generous. I was full after eating just bread, my appetizer, and side salad! Lol Our most recent visit was on Valentine's day evening. We were seated in the private dining area upstairs and were very pleased with the service. Our waiter was extremely friendly and informative if we had any questions regarding anything on the menu. The hostesses were VERY welcoming and easy to talk to over the phone when making reservations. Our most recent visit was fantastic! They even gave us a butter cake "on the house" as a thank you for visiting them on Valentine's Day (Score!). We had a wonderful experience and overall, the food, atmosphere, service, experience, etc, was all top notch! Highly recommended.   The ONLY thing I had a problem with, was halfway through our meal, we noticed there were so many servers and waiters, some of them stood around and walked around aimlessly (WITHIN the private dining area, instead of out in the hall) because, well... I don't know.. maybe they just couldn't find anything to do because there were so many of them? It made me a bit uncomfortable as I felt I was being watched or stared at. I'm sure this was due to the fact that Valentine's day was a busy one for them, so I'm sure it's not normal. But, still..

ZV88Mf779a2Rv25-h07-IQ.text: Keep in mind this is the first steakhouse I've ever been to that was more than $50 per person so I'm easily impressed. Off the bat I felt out of place in my "los pollos hermanos" graphic t-shirt, basketball shorts, and flip flops, but they made me feel welcome anyways. The service was nuts, by the time I entered and had my plate of food, I was probably introduced to like 8 different people, all of them friendly and accomodating. They work super fast and efficient too, the lady swooped around behind me and refilled my water without me even noticing. When they brought out our food, they had a person for each plate, and put it all on our table within a few seconds. I was like daaaayuuummm sooonnnn. food was great too.

Owe8mc0wu3qnm8CaVz3MIQ.text: Stopped in on a whim the other night for dinner and couldn't have had a greater time. I had the pleasure of having a gentleman named Matt as my server and he made for an extremely delightful experience. He knew the menu and the specials by heart and gave me great recommendations based on my interests. He was friendly, professional and even cracked a few jokes which made my solo dinner outing so much less uncomfortable - felt like he was an old friend.   I had the truffle gnocchi which I highly suggest if you're a truffle fan. Thanks also to Matt for recommending the butter cake which was to die for. It's waiters like him that keep me coming back to places like this. A+

22CdVxMUh36yuOR6VGffpQ.text: The hostess was the rudest EVER! For a fine dining restraint, they need to train the staff. She didn't greet us. The restaurant was not busy or full however she told us that we could pull two tables together in the bar!! Wtf? We had a party of 6. She didn't even look at us as she rudely pointed to the bar. My sister had to ask her to direct us which way. As we walked in to the dining room another waiter saw us looking confused and sat us at a table. She needs to be fired!!!   However the food was excellent and the service was good.   Only complaint was the skinny brunette hostess who has no business seating guest at a fine dining restaurant.

9KmCDaWAxPes4S_AyT6rtw.text: Such a great experience! The wait staff were so attentive, and the food was fantastic. The restaurant itself looks very nice and upscale. There's not much else to say because it was such a perfect dinner. I wish I knew the name of my waiter, so I could mention him. He was wonderful though. I'm sure they all are:)

15ucyctQwV2ZL7xF4tnrtA.text: Came here last week for Las Vegas Restaurant Week and the menu was absolutely delicious! We had the tuna tartar, caesar salad, halibut, filet mignon, mushrooms, mashed potatoes, creamed corn and creamed spinach! For dessert I had the butter cake which was absolutely PHENOMENAL! My friend had the chocolate cake which was good too. I ordered a martini and it was so tasty, they even bring you the remaining in the martini shaker! Brandon was our server and was very professional, the bussers and water servers were so on point as well! Would highly recommend this place!

w1xnmm22SeIKjdr0yXolVA.text: Come here for the seafood!! We got the shrimp cocktail and the oysters to share and I cannot stop thinking about the gigantic shrimp! Fresh, juicy, and the size of a mini lobster! The Kumato oysters were fresh, but sandy. I wish we would have tried the crab or lobster instead.  The steak was good, but had parts that were more heavily seasoned than others. It was still tasty, but I felt Ruth's Chris does a better steak. The mac and cheese was mediocre and could be skipped next time. The asparagus was fresh, but the tips weren't cooked. I did like that they serve the sides for you. The berry dream cocktail was to die for! It was strong, but didn't have the strong alcohol taste and the server shakes it up table side and leaves you the remains in the shaker. Definite plus! For dessert, they brought out the chocolate cake for our anniversary celebration. It was overly sweet and a bit dry. I really wanted to try the butter cake so we ordered one of those too. Very decadent and delicious. I enjoyed the slightly crisp edges and soft, warm center with the ice cream.  Overall, this was a good experience. We would come back the next time and try more of the seafood.

J0TG-zTnH7xN3ug6guk0xw.text: Best food love it there i am always in the one in nyc  and now in vegas love this one to !!!!good scene great staff Craig the waiter was so nice and professional  the way it should be !!! A must go

z0MWBzQLaFEF2_FF4O0WTA.text: Mastros never disappoints with fabulous food and service. Must haves: martinis, lobster mash potatoes, and the fried shrimp. We were very impressed with the staff and general manager Luciana. Thanks for the memories!  The lefties from Texas

XotFoU133YS-oGlEC9gHNg.text: I've never ever thought in my life that I would find a perfect restaurant, but I guess I was proved wrong when I dined at Mastro's. The service was absolutely amazing; the waiters practically catered to our every whim and made sure that our time at Mastro's was warm and inviting. The appetizers were delicious. The escargot was average but the steamed mussels were very good.   I ordered the petite fillet cooked to medium. My parents ordered their special of the night: the Australian wagyu. Let me just say the steaks were absolutely amazing. Definitely 5 star status; both of the steaks were flavorful and tender. The juices from the meat blended incredibly well with the spices. These were probably some of the best steaks I've eaten and I've eaten at a ton of places.   The lobster mashed potatoes and the Alaskan king crab black truffle gnocchi was just so delicious and filled with epic flavors, I give my kindest remarks to the chef. The meal was too amazing.   We were too stuffed for any dessert but the next time, I'll be sure to try something off of their dessert menu. This restaurant was way above expectation: service was extraordinary, food was delicious, amazing presentation and ambiance. Absolutely perfect! I love Mastro's and will be sure to visit again.

ONSEFIZ-m1Xh0gZgD656-A.text: SUPER DELICIOUS.  JUST LIKE THE ONE IN COSTA MESA.  MASTROS HAS ONE OF THE BEST AGED RIB EYES.  We did it family style.  Ordered 2 Bone In Ribeye Steaks.  Unfortunately they didn't have the "Chef's Cut" at this location.  So just got the regular, still super delicious.  Really, really good steaks.  Aged meat, juicy, charred and seasoned just right.    Potatoes, mac n cheese, tomatoes and onions, all great.

nOz9KPj7E0Y5OZk37D4rBw.text: Great food and the service was excellent! They ran out of the steak my husband wanted and the manager came to our table and gave him a bigger steak no extra charge. Very nice man. Our server was also super friendly. Thank you for the great experience!

vGkAemU5WFKyjcgLV8hkWw.text: we did not have a reservation but they were able to get us 2 seats at the bar.  The barstaff provided great service in addition to making lots of drinks.  Busy Friday night. The food was excellent and very large portions, we were able to order half portions since we were a party of 2. The meal was a good value given the portions and quality. Also the restaurant had a very dramatic location.

FkXNBVL-rQERjQ208s5TWg.text: Exceptional service! I had the swordfish and it was very good.  I found it funny that the waiter kept on looking to my grandpa to pay the bill ect. When i was paying.   *NOTE to Mastro's*  Don't under estimate a 25 year old.  Perhaps Place the check in the Middle?  Never just assume.

4REwnDi3jQ-8atmSwd2AYQ.text: Food is good, but ambiance is terrible. Literally eating dinner in the middle of a mall, which would be fine if I were at home but for Vegas it's lame. Service was excellent. But definitely think there are better places to go!

rH_W5D7ywGkIn1utG_hJog.text: We did not eat this time around.  We just stopped in for some late night drinks.  The setting is great.  The bar is a cool place.  Our bartender was knowledgable, friendly and attentive.  She also did a great job mixing our drinks.  I ordered a caipirinha.  There are many places that somehow manage to screw them up, but she nailed it.  We will have to return to eat at some point.

9IrJnhCHg6FNDRSY4I5Acw.text: What a wonderful dinning experience! Everything from the hostess' and LR's outstanding service! Definitely coming back. A MUST the Seafood Tower and the Butter Cake.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

H-VzunzqX0jcNSHj08Fkxg.text: This is one of the most interesting (fancy) places I have ever dined at. The restaurant itself sits in the middle of the Crystals City Center retail area. We were seated in the treehouse-esque area so had a nice view of retail shops and passersby. Service was prompt without being stuffy. Some menu items are $$$$ so be prepared. Sides are rather large so maybe share with your group. This is a great special occasion type of place.

4Vl5WbUlGQGjQZUsL62faQ.text: The steak here was really good. Cooked perfectly to my liking. I would definitely come back for some steak.   The only reason I took 1 star off is because the sides were ok. We ordered the mushrooms, fries and green beans. Again, ok.  If you're in Vegas and looking for some good steak, Mastro's.

roWKIcy7ury7QdG4U6jrbA.text: I think it is actually called the "tree house", but I kept calling it the birds nest. Whatever it was, it was cool!! Now, keep in mind, this was a business dinner that I was at, so anything goes when it comes to ordering!!   As far as what I had, I started with the chopped salad. Delish! For dinner I got the petite filet special. This was different than the regular petite filet, because it came with the most delicious king crab leg meat as well in a yummy butter sauce. I honestly could only eat half of the steak, this was just too much food all around.   For sides, we got the mushrooms, creamed corn, creamed spinach, sweet potato fries, and scalloped potatoes. holy bananas these were all so good.  Then we finished with the butter cake!! Which is gigantic, way to big for two people. We all got some of it (there were six of us), but keep in mind we were stuffed at this point! The noise level was reasonable in this restaurant, so it was perfect for a dinner with colleagues.

7NU97_V9libK7mE5tMcUcA.text: I fell in love with Mastro's in B.H. about six years ago. So, naturally when asked to make dinner reservations for an important business dinner, I didn't hesitate.   Everything was wonderful. The ambiance was beautifully unique. The food was as amazing, as i'd always known it to be.   We had a nice mix of Filet,  Seafood tower, Rib eye, and a delicious butter cake for dessert.   They also have one of my favorite pinot noirs on their menu. Summerland. And it's not too pricey!   Love, Love, Love MASTRO'S. And, when it comes to customer service both this one and Bev Hills location have that down pat.

lPnx7Vkb2hvh1EbGeZ5bhw.text: Meh. Underwhelming. I do not care to ever return to this restaurant. It really just does not feel like a steakhouse, it felt more like a cafe. We stopped by before going out for my friends birthday and we were pretty regretful with our choice. Considering it is Mastro's, I had much higher expectations. Food was bland and so were their servers lol bye.

T35jJP55wiLkLIgfRHuvNw.text: This place is worthy of its high rankings.  There is a good selection of steaks and seafood.  It is located in this very interesting wooden alcove offering good people watching opportunities from some tables.  I thought our server was more than a bit officious, but the service from his busser and him was very good.    My wife's Chilean sea bass with lemon caper butter was excellent.  She says it was one of the best servings of sea bass she has ever had.  The lobster mashed potatoes were excellent (at $35), as was the mac and cheese.  I was disappointed in my rib eye.  I order them a lot and the texture and taste of my serving was not to my liking.  Our friend's scallops were also excellent.  I would have given a ranking of excellent were it not for our server's demeanor and my steak.

MmAHR3jGGG2rqu77gFFg0A.text: Everything here is absolutely amazing. I had the ribeye and it the best I've ever had. The truffle mushrooms are to die for and the Mac n cheese forget it. Our drinks were wonderful and the service was impeccable. Can't wait to go back!

HNMSPfNNpJi_pg9H4vSWOA.text: I was so excited to try Mastros for the first time after hearing such amazing things about the place. Boyfriend made reservations here for our 8 year anniversary on a Saturday evening, requesting to sit inside the "treehouse" that everyone on yelp recommended. They even called him the day before to confirm if we were still coming.   We arrived about 5 minutes early and the host immediately had an "oh crap" look once we gave her the name for our reservation. She said if we wanted to sit in the treehouse it would be a 45 minute wait.. I was so upset because we made reservations almost a month in advance and the fact that they called us the day before to make sure we were still coming... Whatever  We didn't want to wait the extra 45 minutes cause we were starving, so they sat us at a different table.   We ordered cocktails, which were really good and strong! We got crab legs as appetizer and they were really fresh, I liked the cocktail sauce that came with it. We decided to share the bone in filet because we didn't want leftovers because the hotel we stayed at had no fridge, they were kind enough to split this for us. We also ordered scalloped potatoes as a side. The steak was okay, a little too salty for my liking. The potatoes were still hard, I wish we got Mac and cheese instead. Even though we split the steak we still couldn't finish it, we ended up taking it togo along with the potatoes.   For dessert we got the infamous butter cake and it was delicious! They put and candle and wrote happy anniversary, which was really sweet of them. When the check came I noticed that they charged us for the anniversary cake, I was reading other reviews that people got their dessert comped?! Anyways, overall I'm not sure if I'll return, at least not this location. I'm still bitter that they couldn't accommodate our seating arrangement for our anniversary.

WegDcMSX0TTriInQkyVpoQ.text: Outstanding seafood and service. Would definitely come back. It's in the Crystals shopping mall.

wvcI_8DU6LeUmWcFSqXx2w.text: I don't know what else I can add to these reviews. I love steak. Mastro's has the best steak I have ever put in my mouth. Hands down. The seafood was also amazing. I was there during restaurant week and got the three course - chowder, strip, and butter cake. I'll save room for more steak next time, but the cake was delicious (not really a sweet tooth kind of person). I was amazed at the quality and freshness of the seafood - we got the tower with dungeoness and snow crab, prawns, and oysters ($200).   Everything was totally worth it. The service was impeccable.

MFVVnf_6r_H1x3fCz4_VVA.text: Mastro's literally is THE best restaurant in Las Vegas.   The restaurant overlooks the main floor of Crystal's and is absolutely gorgeous. Very spacious with plenty of seating area.  I've been here about 4 times and am never disappointed. In fact, I think I'm even more impressed each and every time I go and fall in love with the restaurant all over again.   Service: Impeccable, from the hosts to the servers. I've had a light skinned African American male with dreadlocks and glasses twice (embarrassing I should really remember his name) and he was quite delightful. I've had other servers as well who without a doubt, like the gentleman we had twice, ensured we were taken care of throughout our entire meal.   Food: To die for. The best bone-in ribeye I've ever had. I've tried quite a few steakhouses in Las Vegas (ribeyes because I am obsessed) and none compare to Mastro's. Their appetizers and sides are wonderful too! I've tried their scallops which are soft like butter, tuna tartare, lobster mashed potatoes (a must try), Gorgonzola mac and cheese, king crab black truffle gnocchi, creamed corn, and the brussels sprouts (gotta have some veggies).  Wine: They have one of my favorite Cabernets here that pairs perfectly with the ribeye, Chateau St. Jean. Highly recommend with your meal if you're enjoying steak, not seafood.  Dessert: Do the butter cake. Comes with a heaping pile of homemade whipped cream. Sweet, warm, and delicious!  I love this restaurant. Writing this review makes me want to go there this week. A perfect 5!

GOcys36UT0Cuc2neKeC9uw.text: We ordered steak, lobster mashed potatoes, Rosemary mushrooms and a lobster bisque.. everything was amazing and cooked just as we ordered except the lobster bisque it was waaaaay too salty for my taste. On top of the bisque its self being salty it came with a piece of Parmesan bread which made it even more salty and did nothing to even out the taste. I ordered this as my dinner because I wanted something light since I had eaten a late lunch. It was disappointing.

8FX-pwwhLPULObRYg3yKng.text: Unfortunately this was not one of those awesome Mastro's visits that everyone raves about. We've been to both Mastro's in OC and the one in LA and this was by far the least pleasant visit. We've also been to a lot of the high-end restaurants in LV and typically skipped Mastro's because we could get it easily when we lived in SoCal. But now that we live out of state, we were craving BUTTER CAKE!  When Mastro's called to confirm our reservations, we mentioned that we would be coming in straight form the airport, and they said it wouldn't be a problem to store our luggage during dinner. Upon arrival, they didn't have any room in the clutter closet behind the hostess stand. We brought our luggage to the dinner table which was slightly awkward but there was room.  We had two different main waiters and the service was a bit off. The appetizers were cleared from the table and placed on a stand next to us...not sure why they weren't just removed. Then the entrees came - we were warned about the hot plates but they were barely warm. I ordered the steak medium rare and parts of it was rare so I didn't eat it. It took a long time to flag down someone to get our dessert order. I had previously mentioned in my OpenTable reservation that we were celebrating a friend's birthday. Mastro's was very kind in bringing out a slice of chocolate cake for her with a message written on the plate. When the butter cake finally came out, it was also not very warm. We didn't finish the cake but it was still pretty delicious.  Maybe this experience was an anomaly or off night, but we won't be back soon. Even if the butter cake is divine.

Pv-80Im6VoRpUTVBiS_3Kw.text: This review is not about foods but about how the servers pushes its patrons to have more foods than what they wish to order. We had to repeat and tell our waiter " No" several times in respond to him asking us "I can just double every order." If we wanted double of all our appetizers orders, we would have requested double. We came here yesterday to celebrate our best friend 40th birthday. We are a tight group of close friends and know each other likes and dislikes. We all love fine dining and enjoy Maestro Ocean club on a regular base. So it's disheartening for me to write this review as the foods and services have always been excellent in the many years we've dined at Maestro's establishment. (not this particular one) This was our first time at this Maestro in Vegas and because of this incident, we may not return here. We were charged 2x for majority of our appetizers dishes. We specifically told our waiter NOT to double as we like varieties and didn't want to fill up so much as our meals are always so filling. The night was fun and We didn't feel the need to check our bill. It wasn't the first time and Maestro have always given us superb service. But the next day, my friends and I all look over our bill, $2,286 for our large group of 16 but to have the waiter took it upon himself to ADD it to our order was a bit of a disappointment. I hope this is not a regular practice of this Maestro with large parties. So if you dine here, please check your bill and make sure to emphasize with the servers what you would like to "Double" or not.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1 of 2 bills totaling $2,286. Highlighted part was an overcharge:(

mOhaZZ4Xx8BYxLZe9XNjEg.text: Perfect on every aspect! I tried the Wagyu steak (for the first time of my life), my wife got the surf and turf. Food was absolutely fantastic! Wine suggestion was perfect and service on top! The birthday cake was a nice attention... but at that point it was too much food :)  Will go back!

3Ds1coIcR1200RBxS1wepw.text: I LOVED my experience at Mastro's! Exceptional service from the hostess, server, and sommelier.  Every single thing we had tasted delicious. I had Sea Bass, it was perfect. Our table had steak, appetizers, and an array of sides. Highly recommend letting the Sommelier pair a wine with your order. Also, you MUST have the butter cake dessert!   I will be back for sure.

ae7gIbT2aO2II12C2K6lLA.text: My family celebrated Christmas Eve 2017 at Mastro's Ocean Club, the staff was welcoming, happy and attentive. The food was delicious! New York Strip, Bone-In Rib eye, and Lobster were PERFECT! Lobster Mashed Potatoes, Roasted Brussels Sprouts, Creamed Spinach and Gorgonzola Mac & Cheese did not disappoint!  Mastro's in Las Vegas is a MUST!  Enjoy!

dIdH2135viSV9DefoHLQjg.text: Ordered the filet 12oz. Gorgonzola mac and cheese and heirloom tomato burrata! All so good!!! Steak melted like butter in my mouth! Lol! Wine (pinot noir) is great!  Will definitely come back!

wOneuOeD4qIyFGYPD2rTjg.text: Been to many Mastros food is always great but ambience could be better been to mastered in OC costs Mesa is the best

yklxHORvaSnaJY3onVMpiQ.text: After reading the Yelp reviews on Mastro's, I was excited about having a high-end steakhouse experience. I was a little suspicious that their Yelp rating was so high since they were nowhere to be found on multiple lists of the best steakhouses in Vegas, but we needed a place that could accommodate a vegetarian, the Yelp rating was 4.5 with over 1000 reviews, and the decor looked inviting and unique. However, I wish I had listened to my gut and gone something else.  The service was incredibly slow and poor in quality. I had to ask twice about the location of our waitress after being seated for 5-10 minutes with no service. Each time, I was told she was "on her way," and one server offered this same excuse even after our waitress finally showed up. It seemed like a standard line they were using rather than actually communicating with each other and coordinating adequate service. Furthermore, they serve the side dishes for you, which took an unfortunate turn when one of the servers missed the plate with our macaroni and cheese and decided that pulling the hot, cheesy mess over my wife's lap was a better idea than putting the spoon over the plate or returning the mac and cheese to its dish.   Also, they heat their steak plates to over 400 degrees, a fact that they are quite proud of. In my opinion, a truly high-end restaurant shouldn't have a gimmick, let alone one that has no appreciable purpose. I really enjoyed not being able to adjust my plate on the table, in addition to having a personal space heater for the evening. /s  I like my steak medium rare, and I was warned that they tend to undercook their meats, but I ordered a medium rare NY strip anyways. Imagine my surprise when I received a steak that was medium at best (medium pink center with a few reddish juices) and too chargrilled on the outside to really appreciate the cut of meat (44 Farms). I've had better steak for the same price at restaurants back home. How is this considered a good experience in one of America's steakhouse meccas? My wife ordered the clam chowder and couldn't even bring herself to finish it.   The sides weren't terrible, but I don't agree with the other reviewers about the lobster mashed potatoes. For $35 I expect to see more than 2 tiny pieces of lobster meat. They tasted fine but were nothing mind-blowing. For that price, there should have been at least a few whole chunks of lobster meat to enjoy. The twin lobster tails run twice the price on Mastro's menu; am I supposed to believe that the cost of potatoes is so much that they couldn't afford to include even half of a single lobster tail? The brussels sprouts were overcooked as well, with their charred exterior overwhelming any proper flavor.  The treehouse design of the restaurant is an interesting concept and looks cool in pictures, but in reality, you are floating over a shopping mall, and seeing/hearing shoppers meander about really detracts from any sense of class you hoped to have during your meal.    Overall, I expected much more given the critical acclaim Yelp has for this place. The next time I'm in Vegas, I'll stick to the big name steakhouses or at least those that worthy of a mention on Eater.

9DHVp3MuO0GoX3bZbLw_wQ.text: I don't understand how anyone can give less than 5 stats based off the food alone! But include the service and I'm at a 6.5 (if there were such a thing). So my mom, grandma,  and I were late for our 6:15 reso. I made the reso via open table letting them know it was my moms birthday and we'd like a table in the tree house. Even though we were late(double your travel time if its raining) they honored our table request!   We started with 2 lemon drop martinis and a glass of white zin. The lemon martinis are no joke. The lemon flavor is PERFECT. Our sever Brandon(I think) explained that they infuse vodka with lemons to make the martinis. For apps we had bone marrow which was served with an arugula salad dressed with capers and escargot served with puff pastry. Both were PHENOMENAL. My 89 yo grandma killed the bone marrow!   For our meal we shared sea scallops,  ribeye,  alaskan king crab black truffle gnocchi, creamed corn, and mashed sweet potatoes. Everything was FANTASTIC!! The scallops were served in a garlic butter sauce with tomato and parm. I could have licked the bowl they were served in! Because we shared the ribeye it was sliced for us and we were supplied with tongs to serve ourselves(after the initial serving the manager and server helped serve). I loved how they served us our food!  You need to get the gnocchi. It is AMAZING. The creamed corn was fantastic too. Our service was fantastic. We ordered sparkling wine and our flutes were never empty. Timing of the courses was great. We finished our meal with chocolate layer cake and butter cake. Both were oh the house because it was my moms bday and because we're locals. I didn't care for the chocolate cake but the butter cake was good!! For all the items above including tax and 20+% tip we spent $140 per person. Pretty hefty but well worth it!

ifvK9No1EKcm_JdZkugABg.text: All hype ya'll.  We had a group of 15 for a birthday celebration.  Upstairs room was too warm. Many many waiters and bussers but I had to ask for water all night long. I had to ask for my plates to be cleared.   Regarding the food:  average food, way way overpriced.  Everyone on yelp raves about the butter cake?  Not good at all. One friend had the Chilean Southeast Asia bass and said it was actually great. Another friend had the Clear Lobster Roll and said it was in the bottom 2% of sushi he's ever had; all rice.  I had the ribeye, wife had the NY strip. I should have had the strip.   Cocktails were a hit!  Tiki Time, Lemon Drop, Caliente Breeze!    And then they brought the wrong birthday cake??  REALLY??!!  Watch your check closely. Review it carefully. Audit the bill folks. Or, just skip Mastro's and walk to In-n-Out Burgers. Better food, better price.

77nfJGgmKJlfYNcl0-LRDQ.text: Absolutely beautiful and delicious! Made reservations for this place back in January based on the Yelp reviews. So glad I did! Well worth every dollar! Husband and I are celebrating our 10 year anniversary... (one notch down, 1,000 to go) Our waiter, George was on point! He started us off with a lemon drop martini.... yeah it was the bomb! Appetizers (crab cakes) were amazing, they give you so much food, no way you leave without a take home bag or two. Husband ordered the swordfish, I chose the 22oz. ribeye (medium). When the plate arrived it was so hot the steak was still sizzling! Cooked to perfection. Lawd have mercy! Lobster mashed potatoes were so smooth and well seasoned. Creamed spinach was definitely fresh, not frozen. Also had to try Alaskan king crab black truffle gnocchi. Very good I must say!  The lemonade was perfect and they made sure to place it with a refill each time. To end our experience, we received a large complimentary slice of double chocolate cake to share! I honestly don't have anything negative to say about this restaurant.  We will definitely visit again while in Vegas.  *I suggest casual attire* *Take pictures, you don't want to forget this restaurant*

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 10th anniversary!  Double chocolate cake
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 22oz. Bone-in ribeye cooked to perfection! Creamed spinach  Lobster mashed potatoes  Alaskan king crab black truffle gnocchi
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best Boston Clam Chowder EVER!

Z2E4zvni4pKWMRrDrdcJdg.text: All i can say is , i absolutely adore this location . Everything is impeccable  from the service , to the food . I'm at always pleasantly delighted here

49EMCN5yNUxOKs2rYJ4OtA.text: Mastro's Ocean Club is a wonderful fine dinning restaurant that you will want to return to again and again.  Make reservations or you will not be getting in. Don't dress like you are going to a buffet. I suggest a jacket for men and something nice for women.   Once you get there you are greeted by lovely people. You will be seated in a beautiful space with comfortable chairs. They have a full bar and an extensive, and very expensive wine list. Not being rich, I skip the wine so I can have more starters. All of them are amazing.  They have the best oyster rockerfeller you will find in the state. As for mains, the sea bass, any steak, the lobster and any fresh fish are cooked to perfection. Get the lobster mashed potatoes. Get two--I do, but I forgot about a diet years ago. They are just heaven.   You are never rushed but there is great service and they are there when you need them. Have the best time.

Bm_wNEytlRyIMJ1cArHZsg.text: Made reservations here two weeks ago for our 9th wedding anniversary and I must say Mastro's does live up to their name. My husband and I are well-versed in dining at steak houses/restaurants and out of all the places we decided on Mastro's. We like the flavor and sides and appreciate good service.  Overall we had a pleasant experience with our server and accommodations.  Food was good although I wasn't a big fan of the tomahawk since I'm more of a filet mignon type.  I would've given this place 5 stars but I felt like they were too bougie to acknowledge our celebrating our anniversary. In the middle of crystals shopping plaza with rich people all around who needed our business. My bro in law used to manage the one in Newport coast so it wasn't a big deal for us.  If I had to choose another place to eat I would've if I knew they didn't  celebrate or even ask why we were dining there.

tns9fmaYdAzfOx1rsN4N-g.text: Chilean Sea Bass and Lobster Tail.....YUMMM!! This place is absolutely delicious... and it never ever ever disappoints

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Tail &amp; Chilean Sea Bass

FBQEwPZr5YLdx0YW0LUbjQ.text: There was a group of 8 of us and the service was great. I had the recommendation which was the sea bass and two scallops which was the best sea bass I have ever had. The sides we got were so different because of we had someone with food allergies. We had the sea salt fries which were crispy and really good. Also had the lobster mashed potatoes (amazing) Brussels sprouts and creamed spinach. We also had the recommended bacon from the waiter which were thick slices in amazing maple and other amazing things. Overall really good experience and I definitely would go back!

LZRdLfYc5BIOECiTrXyC9g.text: Pretty decent seafood spot in Vegas! I loved the atmosphere/ambiance more than anything so I would highly recommend coming for a special occasion. But remember to make a reservation as they can get pretty crazy packed.   We wanted to try to crab cocktail but they ran out, so we got the shrimp cocktail instead. Those giant shrimps were delicious! For entree, I tried the Chilean Sea Bass and got it pan seared, which I really enjoyed. We also got the bone-in ribeye (huge portion) that was cooked perfectly and was super juicy. We shared the buttery lobster mashed potato and was one of the best mashed potatoes I've ever tried. They sure don't skimp out on the lobsters they put in there. The portion of the mashed potato (a side dish) was pretty big so I would recommend sharing that with 3-4 people. But as far as my favorite thing from Mastro's, I still crave it everyday - would be their warm butter cake (also extremely huge so you can share with 3-4 people). I don't think I ever had anything like that, it tasted exactly like the name, warm and buttery, topped with fresh strawberries and their house made whipped cream. I know it sounds plain and simple but trust me, try it!!   I cannot wait to be back, mainly because of their warm butter cake but also excited to try their other seafood options!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Whipped cream
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mastro &#39;s Signature Warm Butter Cake
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Mashed Potatoes

LsPn88uJ-uwYNqtKN36Fdw.text: We were seated promptly at our reservation time. The food was excellent and the wine list was decent. The service is excellent. The only issue we had was the noise. Probably not a Good choice for an intimate date if you want to talk with each other. The restaurant is an open air setting inside an upscale mall.

45WICtOJGBzPTsSOSST8zw.text: This review is purely for a stop at the bar, not a dining experience.    On a hot summer night, my husband and I were walking down the strip, taking advantage of a few kid-free hours.  We were looking for something new and different to try when we walked past the Aria.  Just inside the attached shopping center and right off the strip, is Mastro's.  My husband has been wanting to try it out, but to be honest we weren't sure this was the right day because we were wearing shorts and sandals.   We walked up and asked about the dress code.  Surprisingly they said, "No problem!" and pointed us inside and to the left when we asked about the bar.    We walked in straight to the bar, which is a little small, with some tables just behind it.  Dining tables extend into a interesting architectural feature that has you eating suspended over the shopping center.  With a full bar, there are several cocktails and other beverages available, including a few signature ones.  They are pricey (like  $20 a drink), so make sure that you know that going in.  I like sweet stuff so I had a dream berry martini with a sugar rim. It was yummy.  The bartenders were very helpful and fun to chat with.  The cool thing about this place is it is definitely a celebrity hangout.  We were there during NBA summer league, so my husband saw Laker legend Magic Johnson and got a hug and a handshake out of him.  The staff likes to keep it low-key so we did not push for pics.  Stop by this cool spot and have a drink!  I'm hoping to come back for a meal some day.  You never know who you might run into!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dream Berry
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Decisions, decisions...

Vd_he8H7nDcaG1CyQ0EOQA.text: I waited years to go to to this restaurant so I was excited to be there. All in all it felt like the food had no love. Perhaps, I just didn't understand the concept. The front door of the restaurant seems to set an atmosphere of warmth with dark wood. However, after walking further in, it opens up and feels like a mall. I understand, the restaurant is in a mall but I had thought the inside of the restaurant would be more intimate.  The server was completely professional and also perfunctory, the food was good but lacked salt and appeared rapidly plated. The whole experience seems like a great example of when corporate rules kill passion.

oo4voL5XRkXfZw2DzKkxmA.text: We have been to a lot of seafood restaurants and this one was pretty good. The ambiance was amazing and the prices were commensurate with where you are at. We eat a lobster and it came fairly raw and they were good enough to take it off the bill. I probably would go elsewhere as there's so many great choices on the strip.

dG1NextAmiUTfO4T_1dY1Q.text: Everything here was so delicious! I ordered the filet, which I usually don't love because it has less flavor than the ribeye, but that was not the case here. The filet was so flavorful and delicious, the best filet I've ever had. The sides, drinks, and bread were all great too! For dessert, we had to try the butter cake since that seems to be their signature. I'm a chocolate lover, so this wouldn't normally be a dessert I order, but holy deliciousness. So freakin good! And the vanilla bean ice cream on top was amazing.

5VGxlpWqUECv-ntYgOB_7g.text: Introduced to Mastro's in PHX to both Ocean Club Old Town Scottsdale and Steak centric in North Scottsdale. It was a go to place for special occasions and business dinners when it had to be awesome. Never disappoints had the chance to plan a night out with my Sweetie and this popped up on Open Table and we knew it would be great. As usual, I'm never wrong. Mastro's hit a homer.   First it's in a great location in Crystal Shops in Aria complex. Easy to get to from pretty much anywhere in that general south Strip area. For us we were at Cosmo and easy 5 minute walk. I was a little taken aback at first since the location seems centered in an open area in the mall. Not an issue regarding noise or intimacy. Once seated in a great comfortable booth in center area it was service central. We had a couple cocktails. Wife two thumbs on pomegranate martini. I'm a simpleton so had a Redbreast on rocks. Extensive bar menu.   They double team service so you are always being attended too by Pro's. Anticipate needs and appear. Service like this is under rated and more rare. We decided to split a surf and turf with sea bass and boneless ribeye to enjoy both sides of the protein world. They have the best sea bass bar none and know how to sear and get the skin crispy with tender flesh. Again over the top. The ribeye might been a touch more rare than we wanted, but the small portion left on our plate says not a big issue. Sides we did max and cheese and creamed spinach. Both are large portions that we barely made a dent in and we left fully stuffed.   Good choice in a super competitive LV strip market but superstars from many by doing things just a bit better.

vzYt3w0LSKAvddmmlmNr1A.text: Arrived at Mastro's for my 7:15 reservation.  We were greeted with smiles and seated right away.  The restaurant was louder than I expected but didn't mind.  Sitting in the treehouse was awesome.  Our waiter George was attentive and knowledgeable about the menu.  When asked for a wine recommendation to go with the fish he gave a great one.  The Blackened Chilean Sea Bass was so good!  My husband ordered the Blackened Swordfish which he really liked.  For sides we had grilled asparagus and garlic mash potatoes which were both excellent.  The mango sorbet was an excellent choice for dessert.  Couldn't have asked for a better experience!  Now I have to visit again to try the steak, they looked equally delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mango Sorbet..... huge portion and very refreshing.

1Ph_pJRd_8ikaNkcIVho9w.text: We went to a birthday party and there were about 20 of us dining. They brought the bread over and I knew it was going to be a great night. Our host ordered a few seafood towers with lobster, crab, and oysters. It was the best I've had in a long time, so fresh and cold. I started with a wedge, others irderwx the Lobster Bisque, it was excellent. I ordered the rack of lamb, it was charred and cooked to perfection. Others ordered ribeye, swordfish, Chilean sea bass and everyone was happy. All the sides were served and the Mac & cheese was killer. We ended with butter cake, soooo good!

vtX_AKaVRlA-eItjrIONWA.text: Went for our 7 year anniversary and dinner was amazing as always here and the server even brought us a slice of cake and a candle that said happy anniversary!! The server was GREAT I forgot his name a bald guy super nice!

fTV---ff3vt77J4hd8KM-g.text: This is my favorite restaurant in the entire United States of US and A. The food is incredible every time, top-notch, tough to find. And yes, it is a bit expensive. But if I can spend $400 for a nice bottle of wine, great appetizers, and the best steak I'm gonna have the entire year, plus the best service you'll ever have? Do it.   Lionel this year was awesome. Thank you Mastro's for always making our anniversary fun!

H0a-FiWjsnTAklu3bIAarQ.text: Mastro's is a food experience that you have to try at least once in your life. I went with a party of 3 and got a nice seat in the three house. The staff is super professional and make you feel like a good. They take care of your water, pick up any croutons, make sure your drink is filled up.  Mastro's Ocean club specializes in seafood and their many offers every type of fished cooked different ways: Pan seared, grilled, and blackened.  I personally have had the Chilean Sea Bass, and its magnificent. They give you a thick filet and they cook it just perfectly.  Mastro's is also really good at steaks and I've had the filet mignon and is amazing!!! The sides are shareable and I highly recommend the lobster mashed potatoes. It's the most delicious mashed potatoes ever, with generous pieces of lobster.  The clam chowder is nice and can be split between two people.  For appetizer I tied the shrimp cocktail and OMG! The biggest shrimps ever! The cocktail sauce was a little bit to hot but delicious!  As most of you have read the main thing about Mastro's is the Buttercream cake. A delicious dessert with pieces of fruit, ice cream and home made whipped cream. This cake can no be described with words you can just try it and enjoy it "mmmmmmm" feel the most amazing flavors in your mouth.  I know my review is getting longer but I can't leave without mentioning my favorite cocktail. This guys have a cocktail name Hennessy Sidecard. It's made with Hennessy and juices, it's a strong and delicious drink. They bring you the shaker to the table. Cheers!

TjYfCOvMwwOwTTfm5Q_lyQ.text: Can I say WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER!!! Went there to celebrate my husbands birthday and asked if we can have a special table when I made the reservations, we get there and they seat us in the wayyyy back of the restaurant where no one is there. I asked the server to change tables is when the manager walked over and spoke to us like we were idiots!! So I said whatever. For the next 11 minutes the servers were breaking up tables moving chairs and making so much noise and at this point we haven't seen our server or even gotten a glass of water! We decided to walk out then the same manager walked back over and asked what was the problem we said well we asked to switch tables which you didn't wanna do then for 11 minutes we had to heat tables and chairs banging around and No server to be found. He them says I'll switch your table if you want???? Really Dan really?? No it's to late 30minutez were wasted. Thank you mastros for ruining our evening!! Thank you Dan the manager for being so rude! Zero stars

Tjdo5IJ9IwwjA6-z_R-OBA.text: I've only been here for sea food. I've tried the Chilean sea bass oreganara style. The item are the scallops. Both are amazingly good! One side that I recommend to you is the wild mushrooms with truffle butter. So tasty   Good Ambience, you will feel like your eating in a big nest sort of.  A unique design, they call "treehouse "  enjoy!

17pkt2N2a10HwG49y8SnLg.text: First time at Mastros my bf got a filet mignon with bone I think, and I got the Chilean bass, with a side of mashed potatoes, it was delicious!!!! Plus instead of getting just a glass of wine for $12, we got a bottle $36 instead. Service was great, no complaints. We also got a complimentary huge piece of chocolate cake for our anniversary (it was amazing). The only "but" I have, was their bread was cold and hard, not fresh. Other than that everything was great!

pluqfeLo_8KQBteyP3EMQg.text: WORTH EVERY DIME. If there's one meal that constantly makes my mouth water it's Mastro's oscar style steak. Atmosphere was great, service was fantastic, food was delicious!  When I made my reservation online I specified that we'd be celebrating a birthday and never had to mention anything to our waiter in order to get surprised with their infamous butter cake!

CCEbi5pV3773d14BmQju6Q.text: Went here after my wife and I renewed our vows. Over the top prices but worth it for the service and food. One of the best meals I've ever had!

ebGg_jA_aW6hDx8oXhFh3w.text: B U T T E R C A K E!  Don't get me wrong theres a lot more to the menu. The Buttercake is a must have. Service is great. Food is even better.

-l4gT8zGVPWk6QmnrFSS7Q.text: Located inside the upscale Shops at Crystal, Mastro's has an amazing wooden lattice structure that you can choose to dine in rather than inside. But hey we're here for the food right?   The seafood here is top notch and as fresh as it gets.   Everything from the amazing crab cakes, to the scallops, and outrageously fresh king crab legs were any seafood diners dream come True. The Chilean Sea Bass was perfectly cooked and super flaky and buttery.  Warm Butter Cake, their signature dessert, is worth saving room for.   On top of that, service was one of the best I've ever had in any restaurant. Super attentive but not overly fawning - they were always there at the right time.

0VUWApUBL_tkkWbPHg-7RQ.text: Love this place!  Had a great weekend for my birthday and Mastro's and my family made it extra special!  I am blessed and thank you for a great meal and experience @Mastro's, you never disappoint!

CJ3vwMsMFWfaPoNeQRj6qg.text: Place is amazing, from the service to the quality of steaks and sides.  Another great dinner @ mastros in another city ! We got bone in filet, unreal! And the blackened grouper amazing. Extra crispy potatoes were to die for! Best steak house in the city. Reasonable pricing for quality

y7RQ7kG6titjj72rJpO9Mw.text: Sooooo delicious!! My favorite spot to eat in Vegas!  The lobster mash potatoes is a must !! I've never disliked anything I've ate from here and the staff is very polite and professional!

mppXG0JWdv4SojhymKeGxQ.text: 2 years 1/2 ago here was the first dating place with my boyfriend , we still celebrate our important dates at Mastro's !  We love this place and the amazing crew

YKoekaayN2ccVMg1u_CHGQ.text: Ok, this place was straight up amazing. Super expensive, but amazing. We met some old friends for dinner. Started with the cold seafood tower, which would have darn near fed us all. Then we had the lobster bisque, which was the best I've ever had (and I've had a lot).  I finished with the tuna sashimi style, which I wouldn't recommend, actually. My guests all had steaks which were very, very good. The sides were also amazing. Get out your wallet and go to Maestro's Ocean Club!  Woot woot!

q-xMh8E-BS5A4eAsxDgfxw.text: Easily my favorite restaurant for food and service.  I love the follow up phone call they give you the next day to see how the food and service was.  No other restaurant does that.  The butter cake is to die for!  Steaks, apps, mambo Caesar salad, pretzel bread, and oysters are all delicious.  I eat here monthly when in Vegas for work and hit up other locations in Scottsdale and Beverly Hills when traveling there.  Mastro's has been my favorite restaurant group for well over 10 years now and they keep going strong1

-sMPc7Tvn-whMyBpmyTf6w.text: We always wanted to try this restaurant and we were not disappointed. The level of service that we received was awesome. The bartender was knowledgeable with the menu and was able to provide great recommendations based off of people's preferences.   Our waiter was the best. He provided us with the perfect suggestions for our selections of appetizers and entrees. The steaks were cooked perfectly and we are glad that we got the seafood tower. The only thing I wish is that I had a larger stomach.   But to top it off, they even helped my wife and I celebrate our anniversary. They gifted us a butter cake to help us celebrate!   This has easily become one of our favorites in Vegas.

dM82ccuAnZKPG4n6w2Ipeg.text: Celebrating 50th birthday for my sister  This is an amazing restaurant!!! We loved it. We celebrated my sisters 50th birthday and they made it so special.  Our server was a woman named Rene. We dined on May 12th.  We had the best filet mignon in Vegas ever.  We had the butter cake to die for ! We loved the lobster bisque and most of all.... the rad lemon drop which is a signature drink!!! Go eat and enjoy as often as you can!!! Tell them Tina sent you!

dpm-WJmCCboguA623FTK6Q.text: Pros: the New York strip; service from the wait staff; in the hotel I was staying in  Cons: the Ribeye (so salty and overcooked); service from the hosts/hostesses; no strip view as it was located completely in the mall   Bottom line: don't expect a spectacular view, the best ribeye, or spectacular attitude from the hosts. You'll have an otherwise typical Mastro's experience

-SGq7n2yCzAmz516W7gJVw.text: I've been coming to Las Vegas for last 10 years on business conference. As a result, I've had the opportunity to visit many restaurants on and off the Strip. Mastro's Ocean Club ranks at the very top of all of my dinning experiences. The restaurant is located in the Crystals Shops in the Aria hotel. The place is quite stylish and spacious.  What is there not to love about Mastro's? The carefully crafted cocktails and perfectly cooked food with amazing sides dishes is a given for a calibre of this restaurant. The menu is varied and offers a wide selection of seafood and steaks. Other vegetarian options and (chicken, duck, eggs) are also available. The accompanying dishes, wine pairings and cocktails were really what dining at Mastro's to a higher level of excellence.   The only time I eat bread and butter is while dining at restaurants. I certainly wasn't disappointed by the carefully arranged basket of bread and the purest of butter goodness at Mastro's. Since I'm a vegetarian, chef prepared perfect pasta for me off the menu. Sides of note; macaroni and cheese was one of the best ones I have had. The sauteed mushrooms were absolutely out of this world. For desert a butter cake that was large enough to serve 2. One of the better butter cakes I have had.  A tequilla based cocktail marked the start of our eating festivities and a good South Australian Shiraz ensured the gleeful fine dining momentum continued throughout. Mastro's is absolutely on the pricy side. However, it's literally worth every single penny. I cannot recommend this restaurant enough.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Customized prefix menu for the private party at Mastro&#39;s!!!
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mastro&#39;s Signature warm butter cake! A must try...
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mixed vegetable gnocchi, specially made to order!

FHCOpaw0ESVTq9eKHndojw.text: Came here for our wedding anniversary. The drinks selection (especially the vast wine selection) was impressive. I had the sangria and it was great; they are generous with the alcohol. My husbands drink was strong,  but nobody is complaining here. The complimentary bread is amazing! The pretzel bread is to die for. I had the salmon and my husband had the swordfish; cooked perfectly.  Sides: lobster mashed potatoes and truffle wild mushrooms. Wow!! The mashed potatoes had these enormous chunks of lobster, exquisite! We come here every year for our anniversary and this time didn't opt for dessert, but if you do the butter cake is amazing! My only thing is that they should keep the military discount consistent, depending on the server our total percentage discount  will always vary.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon, lobster mashed potatoes and truffle wild mushrooms

5ZAzb3d4xb1u35aI9E5msw.text: I actually had to spend a few hours thinking this review over, as Chuck P points to in his review, this restaurant has a glaring issue which we shall get to.  The good.....  This is not a cheap place to eat, however, I had the bone in ribeye which frankly, I would put against any non Waygu steak in town, it was fantastic, the same could be said off my lobster bisque, I can honestly say, this was perfection.  The not so good....  Caesars salad, it was okay, a little heavy on the anchovies, which considering I love anchovies means it could be way to much for some.  Scalloped potatoes, they were under cooked, not terrible, but just a little more time in the kitchen would have done wonders for them.  The bad....  Sea bass, yes it's sea bass, so it does tend to pick up the flavors of the other foods on the plate, however, there was no saving this dish, I will say, it was perfectly cooked  The really bad....  The service, at this price point, service needs to be top notch, now I counted 15 or so waiters and assistant waiters, however, service was slow, I do not mean it was rushed, I mean it just wasn't there.  As I said above, the sea bass dish was not good, however, there was no way to send it back as the food was dropped off and everyone disappeared, we suddenly became invisible.  Drinks were left empty, which considering the cost of $5 for a very small bottle of soda, you would think that management would make sure they were being pushed by the staff, the same could be said for the $16 gin and tonic, though I will say, the pour on the gin and tonics was at least a double, so the price could be forgiven, what can not is having to walk to the hostess station to get someone to find someone to get us drinks and deal with the bad fish dish.  This should of been an excellent dinner, however the service levels were not there, if you do decide to try it, the ribeye is hard to beat.

WyBHnmVJpR8gUJB2usxAgg.text: The way the menu is designed this is really a place for 6 people or more. Many of the side dishes not to mention the entrees are enough for sharing. Our julienned vinegar and salt french fries could have been a side dish for a table of 6 without a problem.     We enjoyed the Rack of Lamb and Blackened Swordfish, both expertly cooked although the blackened fish had more than its' serving of salt in the seasoning. The twice baked potato was rockin' and we also loved the Brussel sprouts. Don't miss the butter cake which comes warm and a la mode.     The service was so amazing it felt like we were their only table.
