V77wu0RvS6uxBxzwfXzjhQ.text: Plenty of reviews already so I am going to jump right into it. For sure make reservations if you want to sit in the tree house. We did and we loved it! Waiter was really nice and explained the menu to us while suggesting very popular items.   For appetizers we started off with the "Oyster Rockefeller" and "Sauteed Shrimp". The oysters were not bad but let's just say we won't order them again. The shrimp on the other hand were very delicious. Had great seasoning and the creamy butter sauce was pretty amazing.  Main course le boyfriend and I each both had the "22oz Bone in Ribeye". And for sides we did the "Lobster mashed, Cream corn & Sauted mushrooms". Both steaks were cooked and seasoned to perfection. "Seriously best steak I've ever had in my life"... those were the boyfriends words since this was my first time in over a year eating red meat. But I have to agree with him. The lobster mashed potatoes were so creamy and buttery. Cream of corn was very tasty, almost reminded me of the mexican corn with out all the cheese. The sauteed mushrooms were also very delicious. Very happy with the entrees and sides we got. I fell in love with all of them.  Las but not least, DESSERT!.  Waiter brought us out a chocolate piece of cake with fresh whipped cream. I did not care so much for this cake as it was a little on the dry side for me but eh it was complimentary for our Anniversary. I knew I had to order the famous Butter Cake so I did. The butter cake came out super warm with a big scoop of ice cream on top. Okay so this cake was good but I feel like I've had better dessert. I hate salt on any dessert so this was a huge downfall for me. Cake tasted like a very sweet, buttery corn bread. I don't know how to make out of this cake but if I go back I probably won't order it again. Yes I know very sad as everyone literally worships this cake. Over all I had a great experience and I cannot wait to go back again. I think this is my new favorite steak house.

bQF5NO-kJoErY8ltZz6VSA.text: The design of the restaurant itself is an art and worth to check it out. Maestro is always one of my favorite steakhouse in both LA and LV. Wagu and lobster bisque is strongly recommended.

JVhFZ6AHck1TwYlGqBHJpA.text: My favorite restaurant i have to go there every time I'm in Vegas. I took my cousins there on Friday for the first time and they loved it. They said that it was by far the best restaurant they have ever been too. Every thing that I've had there has been good. I love the scallop appetizer,  and the butter cake, the pomegranate martini is so good. The service is excellent. I highly recommend this place everything is great!

0E2-VvIF-T1J9qtsXr7zqg.text: The food is wonderful and the ambiance is incredible.  The restaurant is in the Shops at Crystals, and in this very unique architectural element called the nest.  The food was wonderful, we had shrimp cocktail, steak, sides, and dessert.  I was here in the summer and I did not pack for formal wear that most nice restaurants in Vegas require, however, this restaurant is business casual.  I have a hard time wearing pants for anything in 112 degree weather...  It was also conveniently located near Aria, Mandarin Oriental, and Bellagio via tram.

XAtSSfD-ZCgwBV_mGH1qhg.text: Yummmmmmy! This restaurant is so delicious. The service can be a little slow on the weekend but it's understand with so many people dining out. I've had their bone in ribeye and sea scallops. They were juicy and delicious! I highly recommend this place. Yes it's pretty pricey but it's worth the money if the food is good

_UckpcD378zpUP7u84anUA.text: After hitting for a couple hundo at the Blackjack table, the wife and I decided to splurge on dinner in a venue where we knew the decor and ambiance was going to add a good 40% to the tab, if you know what I mean.  Was it worth the extra scratch?  As the Kool-Aid Man famously yells, "Ohhhh, Yeeaaahhhh!"  Every course we ordered was mouth-watering delicious, from the Sea Scallops to the Filet and Lobster Tail to the complimentary Chocolate Cake I received for my birthday.  All of our items were cooked to perfection, and the flavors were incredible.  If you get lucky at a table game, or hit a jackpot on a machine, treat yo'self!  You won't be disappointed!

WbOn22PiDBt_77YVpB27cQ.text: Great experience ! Food,service, ambiance all superb. A perfect steak! Oysters Rockefeller to die for! Waiter was amazing, entire staff superlative!

8VHmk4bdJhpQxcSKKfpnYQ.text: Love me some Mastro's and lucky for us Vegas has the best Mastro's ever; you can be casual or fancy...it's a great environment.   *Request to be seated in the 'tree house'  when making your reservation.   -Try a speciality dry ice cocktail, the presentation is so fun.   -Lobster mashed potatos are a must try here.   -All the desserts are amazing but the butter cake with their whip cream KILLS any other cake dessert you have ever had. Incredible & complimentary for special occasions.   Superb service & food. From the starter bread to the brussel sprouts to the sea food tower to the steak you will not be let down!

2o4QfXZ6Yqxfq1y6EyAeNg.text: Decided to eat here ! Great vibe ! Food was great ! What was even better was the manager on shift the night we went ..Aaron smith .. I had ordered the Mac and cheese as a side dish and it wasn't met with my expectations so I had sent it back and it was replaced with the creamy spinach which was delicious ! Aaron made sure it was replaced and took care of us! Drinks are also a solid ! Nice and strong .. was a little skeptical because of a couple bad reviews .. but we tried it and it was definitely worth that shot ! Oh and our waiter he's name is Johnny was also a plus ! See u guys soon!

Vybb4lFsPstiY1ylXFTVeA.text: This is one of favorite spots in Vegas. The service is outstanding and the food is always great. I highly recommend this restaurant. The restaurant is not too loud so you can actually have conversations with your group. Food quality and presentation can not be beat.

wWaKaUT_Gp9ngVsPlD5g5Q.text: He always said we should have a nice proper steak dinner.  But every single time I'm in town, we end up skipping the whole steak thing.  But this time, his boyfriend had a client to impress, so we off we went on a steak dinner.  Yay me!  Anyhow, since it is rare back home in Honolulu to find a filet with bone in, that's what they got.  Myself, because my eating habits have changed (boo!!) I opted for the petite filet.  I know, sad, right?  I got 8 ounces of meat!  Not the 12 ounces they ordered.  I got my meat rare, cold center, hot plate.  Mmmm I just love a good piece of meat especially when you can control how you're gonna receive it.  I got it just the way I want it, which is actually hard to come by.  I'll take it the way I want it.  He says out loud, "you think you know a person," when I ordered my meat rare.  Oh, honey, you've known me for how many years now, and you still don't know how I like my meat?  As rare as can be is how I like it and I got a True piece of meat perfection.  You know that I ate all of it!  I love me some meat!  The rest of the dishes were typical.  Salads, soups, sides were just regular, nothing extraordinarily spectacular to really write about.  The portions for those items are generous, I must say.  We did order a bottle of wine to go with dinner.  I think it was a shiraz.  I didn't pick it out, but it did go well with dinner.  And since it was their birthday, there was dessert.  Not 1, but 2, since two of them were celebrating.  One was a butter cake and the other a chocolate cake.  How nice, right?  We couldn't finish the desserts, but I must say they were very rich and of course yummy.  Would I return again?  Most definitely!  It's good that this place was a nice walk from our hotel.  I sure am glad that they are open late, since my eating habits were out of wack.  I love me some meat!!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is how to do RARE!  My rare petite filet!  So much yumminest!!
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Petite filet with three mushrooms

jxbuRMwetVs7EyqIrC6-Qg.text: Awesome food, service, and the best Manhattan I've ever had. Lobster mashed potatoes are not to be missed. They also provided a slice of cake for my friend's birthday and I made the reservation about 10 minutes before we showed up on a Tuesday.

BzTiKXXXXVSxR3QhrMQJkQ.text: My boyfriend and I have been to the Mastro's in Thousand Oaks and just had to come to the one in Las Vegas of course! The food was on point, the waiter was sooooo on top of it! The wait was about no more than 10 minutes and we we're seated. Will come again and bring the family to have an exquisite dinner !

0lEooxtsDiWH8wVLh2zr6A.text: The service at Mastro's was impeccable.  The restaurant is beautiful.  We ordered the crab cakes, tuna tower and salmon appetizers to begin with. We were already full with those 3. They have good sized portions so consider that when you order your appetizers.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Feels like your inside a wooden space ship.
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful restaurant!

odPvIYtVplkqe_MHXHFWlA.text: Outstanding dinner, as always. Jacob and the staff did an awesome job tonight. Thanks for a memorable dinner tonight. See you guys the next time we visit Vegas.

vXZuYhbc4a1PEukWAgxmsw.text: Love at first sight when the bread basket came out.. What does that tell you? Oh my goodness! This place was amazing!    My husband made reservations to have dinner here and he requested a nice table in the tree house! So much fun! We were treated like royalty here!! Everyone was! Their customer service here at Mastros was superb!! They know how to make customers feel like they're having a great eating experience.   We started with a bottle of Moscato! Nivole Moscato D'asti is my favorite!!   I had a little trouble deciding what I wanted to eat for dinner, but when I saw the Chilean Sea Bass in the menu, I was hooked! They rubbed panko bread crumbs and fried it lightly to perfection!! My husband had the rib eye cooked medium well! And guess what? It was medium well!! They had a long list of sides. We went with the Lobster Mashed Potatoes, which had big chunks of fresh lobster. The lobster and potatoes just melted in your mouth because of all the butter! And then we had the Gorgonzola Mac & Cheese!   I was so sad that our hotel room did not have a refrigerator. I would have definitely took our left overs with me. As we left the restaurant, I was devastated! The food was absolutely delicious and I wished I had room in my belly to finish all of it!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My date!
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Moscato D&#39;Asti
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gorgonzola Mac &amp; Cheese

ebCAomx0TAbsXAa69Oxl1A.text: I was just there last weekend for dinner hands-down the best lobster mashed potatoes I had that Waggy beef Tomahawk steak butter melts in your mouth I will recommend mastro's to anybody who loves steak the ambience nice just a great service great food and great people

_pxaBMRCIKAsTile4fSbPw.text: An excellent bar experience!    I have eaten at Mastro's Ocean Club in Las Vegas on several occasions.  The food is always fresh, creative, exceptional and special.    The atmosphere at Mastro's is open, airy, cool and is perched inside a funky tree house in the center of Crystals at City Center.   But my most recent visit was to the bar for a drink with a friend having just seen Akhob by James Turrell at Louis Vuitton.  It was about 4:45PM on a Thursday.  The bar is not incredibly large, but is it welcoming, tasteful, upscale and classy.  Their drinks are priced in the $15-$21 range, but are really the essence of a great mixologists and high style.  The cocktail list is extensive.  The bartender was quick to have me taste a few things and explore my senses a bit.    A solid bar experience!

Btp35UG4iSfu6Lz8pEXS5Q.text: If you're a seafood lover, you'll absolutely love this place! Mastro's is an elegant dining experience in the centre of the Shops at Crystals.  At our visit, we had the Oyster Rockefeller, Twin Lobster Tails and Pacific Swordfish. The food was absolutely delicious! We were the most impressed with the oysters and lobsters!   Overall, we had such a positive experience and we would highly recommend Mastro's to all.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Twin Lobster Tails at Mastro&#39;s Ocean Club in Las Vegas
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oyster Rockefeller at Mastro&#39;s Ocean Club in Las Vegas

xi60-IiydBJ-J3GuA1sO5w.text: We came to this restaurant with hungry stomach knowing that they are famous for their big portion food lol. So I was astonished with their lobster mash potatoes. Many of you might know lots of dishes with "lobsters" ain't really serving many lobsters in it (not even with "Red Lobsters"), but man, this dish came with A LOT OF lobsters in it, which made me speechless with the tenderness and the flavor of the sauce! It totally worth $38. And also you can see the size of the Bone-in ribeye (22 oz.) which I took more than half home cause I was hungry but not that hungry haha! We had a great experience with the service as well, the GM on training came to say hi with friendly introduce. We will be back fo sho! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BUTTER CAKE!!!
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb Chop

NgN7JJU0HBnCsZW2QG4hqA.text: I went to Mastro's for a business dinner for the first time earlier this month, and definitely plan on going back again if the opportunity arises.  The staff, from the hostess to our waiter, were very friendly, and our waiter was very knowledgable on the menu, chef preparation recommendations and specials. He also didn't hover too much, which is appreciated.   Our table started with calamari and an order of one of the day's selected oysters. The calamari was incredibly tender, the oysters were excellent too - the delicate cucumber flavor was exactly as described by our waiter.  For our main course, I had the arctic char oreganata (prepared with seasoned breadcrumbs) and my companions had the special wagyu and Chilean sea bass. For sides, we split the gorgonzola mac & cheese, sauteed asparagus and creamed corn.   I'm deducted one star for the slightly underseasoned sides and for the ridiculously large portion sizes. My arctic char, while delicious, was enough for three meals (no, seriously, it was a pound of fish), and the sides were also much larger than you would expect at a restaurant in this price range, which can significantly limit the variety of sides you can try if you're dining in a party of 5 or less.

4FdE2nOVrkGRCIvmSIKXXQ.text: If you are a fan of ribeye, do yourself a favor and come to Mastro's indulge and in what is the TOMAHAWK: a 33oz bone-in beast of a steak worth every penny of your winnings.   This intimidating slab of wagyu beef was perfectly medium rare, well marbled, and seasoned with care despite it's size. Definitely one of the best, if not the best, steaks I have had. You can be a monster and eat it all, or even split it with someone and order a few sides.   So what if Mastro's is in a mall or if the "treehouse" is a little tacky for your tastes...you'll forget after your first bite. Best mall food ever.

8oz9Df3DVmJ8TH5txis0mw.text: Possibly the best meal we have ever had. Ahi Tuna Tostada was flawless. Also had the Sea Bass and Alaskan Halibut. Oysters Rockefeller came out with a strange smell but I think it was the shells on the 400 degree salt. Once it cooled off smell went away and the oysters were as fresh as I have ever enjoyed. Outstanding Restaurant.

gW6-uVeYWOzeP1Iypsv0YQ.text: We had dinner here for my husbands birthday and it was not what we were expecting. We had reservations and came on time. They had us waiting for over 20 minutes before we got a table and wen we finally sat down, it took awhile for the waiter to come take our order. We got our drinks (lemon drop is my favorite and it was delicious here) fast but our dinner took way too long. When we did get our food we barely ate it because we were so hungry we are the bread and had our drinks. Then the alarm went off and all the lights and sirens were flashing. It just wasn't what we were expecting.

2u79iGJKqQlvD7tVXPR3KA.text: I am here during the restaurant week. Crab cake is fantastic! 16oz New York Strip is huge and tender.

q_IKOshwqUVS2-PPIBHtXw.text: I enjoyed this a little bit more than the Beverly Hills location because of the view. Lobster mashed, creamed corn, steak and butter cake all for me

EsS960iJRCTV6I_AlsifFQ.text: I'm sure the entrees were delicious, but in this outing I was in a fast so all I had was vegges and water.  Now on the other hand everyone I was with at the table which was about 20 people loved their entree.  Next time I will indulge.

W5LR66u2vovGEFxqM8Hi_Q.text: First off, the service was outstanding. As per my request, they were able to save us a table inside the tree house near the edge, so we had a nice view of the architecture around us. Our server Sam managed to be attentive and informative without being too intrusive and asking us how the food was every few seconds, which I thoroughly appreciated.   Usually I don't talk about the bread basket, but this one was pretty good. The bread was warm and soft, but waay too much for two people. On to the main courses: the rack of lamb was tender, juicy, and perfectly medium rare..kind of wish there was a bit more seasoning though. The bone-in ribeye was just as tender and more to my liking, although the outside seemed pretty charred...  After we were done with the mains, we barely had any room left for dessert, but I kept reading reviews for the warm butter cake, so we ordered it to share. The cake came with a HUGE helping of whipped cream on the side and a big scoop of ice cream on top...naturally, we couldn't finish it and asked to have it wrapped up. The cake was moist and the layer of crunch outside from the caramelized sugar was great, but overall, it was too sweet. =(    We definitely made a good choice coming here. The food and service was all really good. Will definitely try to come back again next time we're in town.

SMI0FWCrY8K1t_newJbDjg.text: This my favorite steak house in Vegas, tonite I will be here for my birthday. Best place and my only place I'm vegas

CPEsQYOPI-jHVqRFAlYzJw.text: This place is home to some of best food I've ever had in my life! From the escargot to the steaks and seafood

wOglGWUVZPtQH9Jo6JKSSw.text: EXCELLENT service. OUTSTANDING FOOD. We try to come every time we are in town.  My favorite restaurant in Vegas. Even beats the Ocean Club in Newport Beach CA. They give you the right amount of service at the table, checking on you timely but without interrupting or being overbearing. When the set up the table, I saw the manager readjusting to make sure the setting was perfect, they even put a light on the wine and water glasses to make sure they are perfectly clean! Everyone is super polite, you are rushed but not left unattended either. They have nailed it! We really appreciated it.  Food is delicious. From the bread, to the crab cocktail, to the steak, lobster mashed potatoes and last but not least the butter cake. All to die for.   You really get what you pay for here! And it's worth it! Thank you!

lyIU6MFYzvHF26qXUh2psw.text: We went to Mastro's on a Sunday early evening for dinner.  There were maybe three to four other tables occupied but other than that there was plenty of good seating available.    Speaking of seating, I found the set up a little off-putting...we were seated at a two person table that butted directly against the back of a circular seating arrangement, which just so happened to contain 3-4 lovely active young children on this day.  Somehow your ability to enjoy a nice meal is a bit inhibited with a 5 year old staring at you from 1.5 feet away.  Perhaps it was our fault for not requesting one of the 50 odd other empty tables.  As other yelpsters have stated it is also a bit weird to be enjoying a $$$$ meal with Miley Cyrus cranking in the background due to the open seating overlooking/hearing the mall like Crystal Shops.  Enough nit picking though, on to the food!  Our server was very attentive and started us out promptly with ice water and tea.  Micro demerit for including a lemon in my iced tea after asking to hold the lemon, but no big deal.  Huge stars go out to the staff for keeping the beverages brimming full, a frequent problem for such an iced tea addict as myself.  The bread service came with enough to feed a small army.  Mini-loaves of sourdough, pretzel, bruschetta, and French.    We ordered the Calamari ($15).  There was plenty for the two of us, lightly breaded and including a lemon side and a dipping sauce very similar to the Outback sauce you get with bloomin onions.    Taking the "go big or go home" philosophy I decided to order the twin lobster tails ($69) AND 22 oz Ribeye ($55) for my entree.  My girlfriend ordered the sea bass ($50) and we split a side of lobster mashed potatoes ($38).    The steak was wonderfully charred, cooked medium.   The server was nice enough to "de-shell" the lobster tails.  The lobster was perfectly cooked and delicious with melted butter.  The sea bass was also excellent.  I let my date enjoy the majority of the potatoes as they were a bit soupy due to the sauce but the small portion I had did taste good.    We got the butter cake to go, not sure on the price, it came complete with detailed instructions on how to best prepare it from our server.  Final bill with tip $325.

XberAgKHxU47HBtbi8oNxg.text: Just finished a perfect dinner here! Everyone was impressed with their meals. I had the grouper and it was wonderful! We had 2 people get the rib eye and 3 get the filet. Our sides were the lobster mashed potatoes and the Mac n cheese. We also had calamari which was the best any of us had ever eaten. Only thing I regret was not saving room for the desserts I saw at other tables. Two sides were more than enough for our group of 6! I did not find the total bill to be too much! Any nice place I expect to be around $100 per person. Overall a perfect dinner

BvppOO17R3P1A6g9Ed4ZqQ.text: I've always said that you can judge a restaurant by it's bread as an indication of it's food. The bread basket at this particular Mastro's was a bad omen in itself.   I've better had better escargot's at a Vietnamese restaurant in Little Saigon. My Chilean Seabass was a tragedy, usually my favorite fish. It had to be the oil or butter that they pan seared it in that tastes like gasoline and left me nauseated. It was the fist time I left Chilean Seabass half eaten. The shoe string fries was mostly fried in the same horrific lard. Even ketchup couldn't salvage the flavor.  The mushrooms were good but my nausea keep me for enjoying them.   The 18 oz bone in filet was had no character what so ever. Such a disappointment compared to other Mastro's that we dined at.  I've had good steaks at good restaurants. This place isn't it.

omgEgMNYwXXv2QwRv27Rhw.text: It's everything you could want / expect in fine dining (aka expensive) restaurant.  Can't really say much else that hasn't already been previously addressed.   We dined here tonight for my mom's early birthday celebration. My sister and I split a 20 oz bone in rib eye and my mom had grilled pacific swordfish. We also ordered sides of steamed broccoli and garlic mashed potatoes. Since it was her birthday, she got a free warm butter cake with a personal touch!   The food was good - although there was a wee bit of over-charred areas on the steak and the butter cake was also a bit too sweet (maybe my taste buds are too sensitive now).  Overall it was a good dining experience. Would I come back..? Maybe after I've experienced other fine dining places.

v91aSOw6Dn9GOa0nw5MTAg.text: Every time i hear Mastros i always crave for everything in this restaurant. Servers are amazing! Some of the hostess' are amazingly nice some of them are okay.. everything is good in this restaurant.. i always order Bone in rib eye (YUM!), Lobster mashed potatoes and Lobster bisque. just an FYI, if you're gonna have a huge party with you the side dishes is good for 4 people! which is really great :)

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Warm buttercake
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I had a little of bone in ribeye, lobster mashed potato, asparagus and red wine. Yum!

bOBYX0xBWNSV3CbnshH_0g.text: Jean George's was closed at aria, so host recommended mastros. All was perfect. Went out of their way to see everyone satisfied. Great customer service. Restaurant looks like shell of a boat,hokey at 1st but it grows on you. Was in Crystals,about 10 steps from aria to crystals. However 117 degree temp,and my pacemaker made it seem longer. Worth it.

xzVvQEtu_PC3xSq3cJ60VA.text: Love the ambience here! The lobster mashed potatoes are amazing! The filet was cooked and seasoned to perfection! I always get the butter cake and I am never disappointed! My favorite dessert ever! Always happy with the food and service at all Mastro's I've dined at.

WmlFlSI_uzfd0oE47clAqQ.text: Wow....If it wasn't a bit spendy I'd love to go here more often when in Las Vegas!  Great bar staff with amazing drinks.... Although the martini's are a bit expensive, they give you the shaker w/ the leftover which makes it almost two martini's... And they are awesome...  We also had a great bottle of wine from their nice selection to choose from.  And the food!!! Wow, the steaks are amazing and we also had a shrimp and a crab cocktail appetizer that were to die for. Nice atmosphere - a little dressy, but it is Vegas so you can show up casual.  We had several great bartenders since we sat at the bar and thoroughly enjoyed it.  Great spot in central location on the strip.....

NzGAZy11tijr4g6BwAgTmQ.text: Let's start with the service, absolutely exceptional!! We were greeted and welcomed by several staff members just entering the restaurant and walking to our table. Our waiter was awesome and very attentive. Now to the food. I ordered a rib eye and asked for it medium well (which has a little pink inside.) It came well done and I didn't have the heart to complain since it was a $59 steak and sending it back would mean they would have to make a whole new one. It was also pretty flavorless. Boyfriend ordered lobster tail and in his exact words "best lobster tail I've ever had." I'm glad he felt that way since the rest was just ok. Our scalloped potatoes were very salty, but the creamed corn was pretty good. It was $200 for just the two of us.

jNzhE5Ztw-Oj5KRAJVqr5w.text: What is there to say about Mastro's Ocean Club that has not already been said? It's funny . . . we live in Scottsdale, home of the original Mastro's and Mastro's Ocean Club, and yet, this is where we decided to dine in Las Vegas. Having never been to Mastro's Ocean Club in Scottsdale, but knowing friends far and wide have been so delighted there, we thought on our vacation, we should give the sister restaurant a try! We are so glad we did!  The space itself is very unique in design. We were seated in the "Tree House". It is quite a spectacle from inside as well as outside as the wood towers from the lower level of the Crystals shopping center to the very top with a rounded platform area, that kind of resembles an open wooden spaceship, within which is the dining room seating. It is very light and airy. There is plenty of room between tables and despite some of other reviewers complaints that the music is loud, we had no problem with it, even on a Friday night.  Our waiter (I think his name is Robert) was one of the best servers we have ever had, in just about any restaurant in which we have dined. He was knowledgeable, friendly, didn't hover, and was not pushy at all. He gave us time to order, time in between courses, time to finish the humongous plates of food.  The rest of the waitstaff was also attentive. Having sat outside at the pool all day, my husband was parched, and I think he drank at least eight glasses of water . . . he never had to wait for the glass to be refilled! When I couldn't finish a course, the attendant asked if he could wrap the remaining up to go. I didn't have to flag anyone down.  The food was top notch, bar none!  We started with the ahi tuna tartare. It was a massive appetizer of tiny cubed ahi piled above avocado and what I believe were panko chips. Fresh, flavorful and enough for a table of four (not two) to share! Not knowing how large the portion was going to be, we also ordered an Ocean Club Salad to split - fabulous! And, huge! It had chopped egg, onion, shrimp, lobster, blue cheese . . . you could eat one as a meal. At that point, I issued a proclamation to my husband, aside from our main entrees, we could only order ONE side. Hubby ordered the bone-in rib eye . . . a hunka hunka burnin' love of meat, perfectly seasoned, perfectly seared to medium rare. Bliss for my hubby who gets no red meat at home!  I ordered the Chilean Sea Bass Oreganata . . . melted in my mouth . . . and, it too was a giant piece of fish! I couldn't even finish it. The twice baked potato was delish, even luke warm, as we couldn't even finish it during our meal, but instead had it as a midnight snack back in our hotel room!    One other note . . . and this was pure genius. I couldn't finish my wine. If I put anything more into my stomach, I think I would have exploded! Our waiter said on the way out, take my drink to the hostess and she will give it to me to go. Apparently, the hostess can do this, but the waiter can't. Thinking I am going to get my wine in a plastic cup . . . the hostess actually poured it into another wine glass and told me to keep it!   Without a doubt, this was the best meal we had in Vegas over this three-day holiday. And despite what some would say is a hefty price tag, I beg to differ. The quality of the service and food were spot on. We had dinner at two other similarly priced restaurants and left feeling robbed. Not so at Mastro's Ocean Club.   I think I have finally convinced my husband to make the Scottsdale Mastro's Ocean Club on our regular rotation for fine dining . . . I hope it lives up to the Las Vegas outlet!

11c3lW6ILwDL2FL3PP8BSg.text: The Red Dragonfire drink is oh sooooo delicious.  A smooth martini with a hint of spice. Also try the butter cake. This cake literally melts in your mouth.

1vcR1w0Vq0uoKhxa88q8Xg.text: I was introduced to Mastro's by a friend of mine. He had nothing but good things to say about it, so last year, we gave it a shot. Mastro's is the perfect hybrid of really good seafood and classic steakhouse. When you walk in the first thing you smell is the juicy steaks coming out of the kitchen. This was our second time here and I'm not going to lie, I was a little worried that it wouldn't be as good as I remembered. Lucky for us, it was just as good. I remembered that they had a nice wine list and they still do. Gramercy Guy was able to get Darioush (one of our favorite Napa wineries) by the glass, which is really hard to find. While our waiter was walking us through the menu, some specials, and suggestions, I zeroed in on a salad called, the Spicy Mambo, which is a take on a Caesar salad, without croutons but has horseradish and blue cheese crumbles. It was really tasty and I'm looking forward to going home and adjusting my Caesar dressing recipe with some fresh horseradish. A secret menu item is the Mastro's Mash. It used to be on the menu but has recently come off, if you ask, they will make it for you. It's like a loaded baked potato but mashed. We also got sauteed spinach, don't forget your greens. The design of Mastro's is really amazing, they have what they call a 'tree house', a wooden structure that has two levels. The bottom is the Crystal's information desk and the top level is the Mastro's tree house. When we booked our reservation, we requested a table in the tree house. Once you step inside, the atmosphere totally changes, the band (which is really good) gets muffled and it's very relaxing and feels almost private (there are about a dozen tables). My advice for anyone going to Mastro's...share...the portions are huge and unless you have a place to store your left overs, it will all go to waste. Also, the pretzel rolls in the bread basket are amazing. To see pictures and read more, go to gramercygirl.blogspot.co...

Oj5LigVWvJV9EyCHt3C2zA.text: I AINT NO UPPER CLASS. I don't go out and spend $100 on dinner everyday. With that said.. I don't appreciate my waiter giving me attitude just because I don't know half of his fancy schmancy expensive food vocabulary.  We got there last Friday at around 730 PM. The waiter went over the menu with us and began taking order. We didn't know what kind of cooking style we want on the fish. When we asked him questions, instead of him answering patiently, he decided to just give us THE LOOK and say "i just went over all the cooking style with you.."BLAH..  The food was salty and whatever..   I don't understand why he's giving me attitude if I still have to pay him tip.  I'm gonna save that money for a nice purse next time.

zhqHX0OXg3CoQVqhtSaJTA.text: This is my 3rd time to this particular restaurant.  This time was kinda disappointing.  I have brought my over-sea clients to this restaurant and the service was 30% of what it used to be.  Our waiter kept chatting with other waiters and it took us 3 times to raise our hands to get his attention for both times.  When I had asked about the types of steaks, he answered as if I was supposed to know that with "Obviously", "of course this type of steak is more firm..."  we really do not appreciate that.  We pay high price to came to enjoy the food and environment, not to be treated as if it is our job to know the types of food.  The food was good, but our party of 9 people who are all business owners said they liked the food, but agreed that for this class level of spending, the service was very disappointing and substandard.  We did see that services were much better at other tables...seems as if our waiter has a little discriminative to Asians.  As a result, we gave 10% of the service tip instead of the 20% I usually give at this restaurant.  This will be my last time taking clients to this particular restaurant.

2Lid2Bo_wC7313uJYlFLrw.text: Mmmmmmm!  Best steakhouse in Las Vegas and there are a lot of them.  Everything was PERFECT at our meal.  Very pricey, but worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FR4C43Yl2poclJzEps4FZw.text: Poor customer service. Very rude hostess (Asian young lady with dyed blond hair working on the evening of 09/26/15). No eye contact when we arrived, no eye contact as we were speaking to her. We understood that there were extremely busy during the time and we had to wait, but interaction with the first person you encounter makes a big difference in your whole experience. The first encounter ruined our whole dining experience. We made the mistake of staying because we were so hungry even though we had to wait an extra half hour even with reservations. We were hoping the service after the first encounter would be better but the whole experience just felt rushed. The food was so so. The one star is for the Chilean Sea Bass which was excellent but the rest you can find at other similar restaurants. For the price you spend at a restaurant such as this, we expected better customer service at the very least.  Would not recommend as there are much better coptions in Vegas with similar menus, much better service, and much better ambiance (not in a mall).

6xA7p8nrCqf2Of_YiM0fhQ.text: We came here after leaving another restaurant before eating due to poor service and we are SO happy that we made the switch! My husband and I came on a busy Thanksgiving evening and they squeezed  us in with no problem. From the get go, the service was amazing! Amazing food. It's expensive but worth every dime.  Highly recommend.

6GCdBTR8wvskKwPn9eqGVw.text: I liked this place, but I think it's more for the atmosphere than the food.  Don't get me wrong, the food was good - it just didn't quite live up to what I was expecting.  We ordered the seafood tower and everything was delicious.  For my entree, I ordered the petite filet.  While good, it definitely could have been seasoned more and was a bit overcooked.  Honestly, I think Kevin Rathbun Steak has ruined  every other steak restaurant for me - nothing will ever to compare to the steak I had there.  As a side, we ordered the gorgonzola mac and cheese, which had far more mac than cheese unfortunately.  I could barely taste the gorgonzola at all, and given it's strong flavor, there had to be practically none in there.  Drinks were top notch and the service was excellent.  We sat in the treehouse, which was very cool, but the food just didn't do it for me.  Unfortunately, it just didn't live up to my lofty expectations.

xtgvjuTiS3b9fEBeLszU2g.text: 12oz. Filet was very consistent with the great reviews this venue is receiving. Bartenders are very knowledgeable and welcoming. Regardless of if it's location in a mall or a hotel, this restaurant has a big future ahead of it.

sLE-6rzyBhUbW2EQ4OApiw.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants, this location in particular is fantabulous!  The food is always mouth watering, the service and staff are superb from the moment you walk in everything is nothing short of excellent.  My husband and I make it a point to dine here when we are in town, it never disappoints.  Our servers Tanya and Juan were AMAZING and made our dining experience superior this past visit!  They made us feel like we were the only table in the restaurant :)  I would highly recommend everyone dine here and of course order the butter cake.

_FZWYp2YXIDB0gwCWKb07A.text: Absolutely amazing! Excellent service from the time I called to make a reservation (because open table didn't show availability for the time I wanted) to the hostess to the wait staff. We ordered the filet and it was cooked to perfection! The garlic mashed potatoes and spinach were generous and the butter cake lived up to expectations. We will definitely be back

L0wMh_dVPsjVzC9wcPjNPA.text: I made a reservation for a business dinner through Open Table on Sunday June 5th for 8:30pm. At 7:35pm I received a call that they had technical difficulties in the kitchen and that they were only able to serve cold appetizers, salads and desserts. So we opted to go to a different restaurant(which was quite a task). Hence my surprise when I got an e-mail from Open Table a day later that informed me that Mastro's reported me as a "no show". You inform me 55 minutes before my reservation time that you are unable to fulfill my request and then have the nerve to report me as a "no show"? Needless to say that I won't come back and will take my business elsewhere in the future.

AQGy7_HYq4VoVjTrksOVnQ.text: Celebrated my birthday with 4 ladies this evening. It has been my experience at other restaurants that waiters do their best to ignore serving women because they expect a lousy gratuity. Not here; the service was excellent by Robert and our food delicious. Our steaks arrived perfectly cooked, hot and juicy.  The butter cake is not to be missed! In the last couple of months I have eaten at Maestro's Beverly Hills, Palm Springs and now Las Vegas. You can't go wrong!

v4uPCn3MB-IQCobDRLhnIw.text: The atmosphere is unique, the food is succulent and the service is second to none! The lobster mashed potatoes are a must! The bone in filet can't be beat! The warm butter cake is the best desert I've ever had! Mastro's is hands down the best restaurant in Vegas!

-EDU-wUe06Kf-B5TdD_CEA.text: This Mastro's is better than the one in LA. All 3 of us couldn't believe how good it was. The sauteed mushrooms are out of this world.   I had the 12oz filet (not the on the bone filet) and it was amazing. I don't like bone-on filets personally. I know i'm the only one. It was great.   Its in the mall at the aria/crystals/whatever the fuck its called place, but its a pretty upscale mall with lots of swanky shit goin on - so don't stress, its not mall food-ish at all.

eCgfglB-rU_PAcXH-18OTw.text: We were able to sit in the treehouse which got us off on the right foot. Our waiter was in command...a table full of ladies...so we appreciated it. Troy made great wine and dinner recommendations.  By the end of the meal we were calling him "Christian Grey." The bread basket had a nice assortment but I ended up with the pretzel bread based on another Yelp review. I ordered the salmon - blackened, lobster mashed and sauteed spinach. Salmon...close to perfection...mashed potatoes good but lobster was a little chewy. $40 mashed potatoes...wow...they were good, but not THAT good. I will admit that the side portions are definitely big enough to share (we had a table of 4). Overall the food was fresh and flavorful and the service was icing on the cake. Troy/Christian brought us out  the butter cake....SLAP YO MOMMA good!!! It looked dangerous just sitting there on the plate, but after one taste...OMG. We had to exert an insane amount of discipline not to finish it as I am sure it has about 2,000 calories.  Looking forward to trying the Mastro's in Chicago.

5YOhqyNIIwyQ69-0NLaMKQ.text: What an amazing experience with Mastro's!  We came in with a large party for a Christmas dinner. This was most of my guests first time dining here. We had a view of the treehouse, love the architecture! There was no wait for a table.  We started with Calamari, Smoked Salmon Caesar Salad and Chopped Salad. The bread basket was to die for! We enjoyed New York strip, Filet, Chicken, Artic Char, and my favorite the Sea Bass! We had so many sides, they were all wonderful!  Our servers Trista and Daniel were wonderful. Very friendly, always made sure we had a drink and were happy. And the manager Luciana checked on us a few times making sure we were enjoying each course.  Best dinner in Vegas ever! Can't wait to return!

7g0EHem4pBfoF3ISdJHQaw.text: Stopped in to Mastro's Ocean Club recently on a work related dinner.  We got to sit under the Tree House that overlooks the Crystals Shopping Center.  After waiting about 15 minutes to be seated, we started with the Seafood Tower because nothing says over the top LV dining like a seafood tower.  On this tower were jumbo shrimp, a variety of crab legs, and some oysters.  Served on the side were a traditional cocktail sauce, their atomic horseradish, and a mustard sauce.  I was a little too liberal with the horseradish sauce and can confirm that the "atomic" description is accurate.  For my main, I went with the Ribeye steak and the table ordered a variety of sides: lobster mac and cheese, creamed spinach, gnocchi, asparagus, and au gratin potatoes.    Unfortunately, the highlight of my meal were a few of the sides.  I really enjoyed the lobster mac and cheese, the gnocchi, and creamed spinach, all of which were excellent.  But my steak left a little to be desired.  It was flavorfull, but the piece of meat simply had too much gristle.  I appreciate a bit of fat on my steak, but this piece of meat had just a bit too much on and I had to cut around quite a bit of my meal.  Based on the other reviews, it sounds like my experience may have been out of the ordinary, but from my experience, there are better places to try in LV.

foFANXBo5Qsf4FU-wiK6yw.text: Really bad experience, here. Was hoping for an awesome night for my 50th birthday. Based on reviews, I chose Mastro's. Wish i hadn't. Filet came out well done, sent it back, came out raw in the middle. A fine restaurant that can't cook a filet to medium rare should just close its doors. On top of that, my wife and son's NY strips tasted like liver. Not sure how they achieved that. The manager was very apologetic and tore up the check, but I still can't recommend this place.

EZhA6DL0oiyQlhIIx8d9FA.text: I recently had dinner there with few friends. Food was amazing, service was great. It is pricey. The only "slight" negative is that we did no realize that NOT all the tables are inside the tree-house looking structure. We asked to be moved there but they were not very open to it, saying it will be an hour wait or so.

ZsODmnXODDF_wi4HUVU0dg.text: Great food and service. It was exactly what I expected. We enjoy the Beverly Hills location and wanted to enjoy the same in Vegas. The food was great and service was flawless!

KQrdbryBxHBPm_idwZcMmA.text: This place is awesome. While known for great seafood, the steaks are amazing as well.  Make sure to save room for Butter cake.  Nice atmoshpere.  We go here often.  In my opinion Delmonico at Venitian, Strip Steak at Mandalay Bay,  and Craft at MGM dont compare.

CGOvpvM6-jf1JbFyOKvwvg.text: Mastro's in las Vegas is wonderful.  Ate there for ten year anniversary.  Service is wonderful.  Food is delicious.  Warm butter cake for dessert(on the house for special occasion) will make you jump back flips.  Lobster mash is incredible. Steaks were fab.  Waiter mike r, was great.  Go and enjoy.

xisUOpjEh48wWtmxcEvqZQ.text: Came with full anticipation of excellent service, great ambience and tasty dishes based on experiences shared by other Yelpers. Left with full satisfaction and lasting impression of a wonderful dining experience. Our table was located in a treehouse with chandeliers and white tablecloth; however, it did not feel stuffy, rather cozy and friendly, with top notch service. Cloth napkins were offered in either black or white color. Hot towels were distributed after we finished our seafood appetizers served icy cold with cool dry ice presentation (their signature seafood tower). Salted caramel martini is deliciously mixed and served in a salted rim glass. The portion is very generous, from the drink, to the bread basket (5 different types), as well as the entree and side dishes. Collectively, everyone in our party was very pleased with their choices of entrees; e.g., Halibut, Arctic Char "Oreganata", Chilean sea bass, Vanilla battered lobster tails, Bone-in Ribeye. Side dishes were meant to be shared. The lobster mashed potatoes and Alaskan King Crab Black Truffle Gnocchi were very tasty with big chunks of lobster and crab. Sea Salt & Vinegar Fries were crispy and well-seasoned. The meal ended with the popular warm butter cake and key lime pie. We left in time for Caesar's Palace's Fourth of July fireworks, and others from various Station Casinos throughout Vegas. An epic meal ended with an impressive firework show. What a memorable Fourth!

fXUANJAdeM7G-yMCh57llw.text: My husband and I are huge mastro's fans! We have dined frequently at the Beverly Hills location and thought it would be a perfect date night on our last trip to Vegas to experience their Ocean Club. The location of this restaurant is in the crystals shopping center which is a little bit of a disappointment.  We dined in the tree house which was beautiful but the view of people shopping and the mall did take away from the ambiance, thus the four stars. I am a sweet wine type of girl and had the moscato, which was so smooth and sweet.   For an appetizer we ordered the scallops which were cooked to perfection and tasted amazing. For our entree my husband ordered the chicken and I ordered the bone-in rib eye.  The Ocean club is the sea food version of their traditionally restaurant but offers many of their beef variations.  Most of the appetizers are seafood options but they offer their regular sides with additional seafood options. The mac n cheese and garlic mashed potatoes were great as always.

Rlm2dJ8q63iVagp3qQw3Lw.text: I sent an email thru the Mastro website to let them know I got food poisoning at one of their restaurants. No response from them yet. I guess the restaurant doesn't care about their customers...

2gQblLyIrAvyNiKUHULEnw.text: WOW is all I can say.  We have a Mastros Steakhouse in Chicago and I have not been able to get in as it's always so hoppin. So since we were in Vegas, we decided to give Mastros Ocean Club a try.  We were not disappointed.  The restaurant is located in the City Center shopping area and fits in well with the high end shopping and the swanky decor of the city center and surrounding hotels.  The decor is simple contemporary.  It would be too simple if it wasn't for their amazing bar set up but more their "tree house" structure.  If you visit Mastros, request that you sit in the tree house section.  They also have a lounge singer and piano player.  The volume was fine (as I've read other review that it was extremely loud) - but we were sitting in the tree house area so I can imagine if you had one of the tables next to the singer or in the booths behind them, it would be pretty loud.  Regardless, the singer was very good and sang songs from all genres.  Now to the important part - the food.  Everything we ordered was amazing.  As all higher end restaurants, all sides are ala cart but big enough to share.  Our entrees were delishous - ahi tuna, sea bass, and scallops.  I have no complaints, all were cooked PERFECTLY and extremely flavorful.  The portions were quite large.  The sides were equally amazing and big enough to share between 3-4 people.  One of the sides - the mac and cheese was AH. MAZ. ING.  If we're ever back I'd be happy to dive into the Lobster mashed potatoes.  The wedge salad was enourmous, enough to share between 2 people.  I had the lobster bisque which was very tasty.  I've had it before at other places and it sometimes has had a "fishy" taste but not this. And there were big chunks of lobster.  Service, supurb as expected.  The menu is pricey, but worth it.  I'll definitely be checking out Mastros in Chicago.

tI8PznaAT12xACErKdhstw.text: Landed in Vegas and went on a mad hunt for a place to eat with the boyfriend. Wandered into Aria and found this swanky little place. Went to see if they had any tables open. About a 30 minute wait so we decided to do open seating at the bar. We ordered the mussels for appetizer, scallops for the main dish (for me) and steak for the mr. The mussels and the scallops were a little too salty for me, but the texture of the scallops was cooked perfectly. I also felt like I was eating the same thing with my main dish because the scallops came on slices of bread which was the same type of bread that was served to us for appetizer. The portion was quite generous though. The bf and I were trying to guess how many I'd get. I thought maybe 2 big pieces, and he thought maybe 3 moderately sized pieces. The dish came with 5 moderately sized pieces. The boyfriend's 12oz filet, however, was on a whole different level, and I couldn't stop eating his food. Juicy, tender, not overcooked (he got medium rare). It was the best steak the both of us have ever had. Seriously, TRY THE STEAK!

V_aszqA8mKWMni_c0uB1eQ.text: I think I must have gone on a bad night and had an awful server because my experience differed from other yelpers.  I'm reserving further comments  on this restaurant until I give it a second chance.  Can't let one server ruin the reputation of the restaurant.

xgDgohdSm_oAeb8Z5Fsxpg.text: Ah finally! Mastro's is a chain that is throughout CA and a few other states. I have been wanting to go for awhile now but the Vegas location is byfar the prettiest and in the middle of the City Center. The staff was super generous and allowed us to delay our reservation time a few times and still had a table for us. I have been looking forward to these infamous lobster mashed potatoes for awhile as I have only had them once before as leftovers. IT WAS AMAZING! I'm still dreaming about them now... It had a perfect consistency of creaminess and flavor with large pieces of lobster. I had the Chilean Sea bass for my main entree along with the mashed potatoes and mushrooms on the side. The Sea bass had perfect consistency and was huge in portion. It was flaky and cooked perfectly. For dessert, we had the butter cake which was overbuttered in my opinion but was topped off with a fresh homemade whipped cream and ice cream.

s_ifFmpxmoR21bFUtZFBSQ.text: Worst dining experience of my life. Came with the family for my son's 21st birthday. Reservation was at 10:00. Main course didn't come out until 2 1/2 hours later. Service was horrible. Food was barely mediocre. I wouldn't recommend this abomination of a restaurant to anyone. I am usually pretty easygoing. I can't even remember the last time I even complained about a meal. Our reservation was at 10:00pm.  We sat in the bar and had drinks until our table was ready at 10:30. We sat down and our server took our drink order while we looked over the menus. The drinks came in short order and then the fun began. We ordered several appetizers, salads and our main courses. The appetizers included tuna so our server told us that he would bring those first since they came out quickly and he wanted them to be fresh for us. They did come out first. About a half hour later. An hour into our meal we were still waiting for our salads. Our server was off working the cash register. I couldn't get his attention so I got up and went over and asked when our salads would arrive. He looked at me like I had two heads and said he didn't know we wanted them out so quickly after our appetizers. Mind you we were now over an hour into our meal and had long since eaten the appetizers which were so so. They finally showed up a half hour later. I got up again and asked to speak to the general manager. The server told me it was all his fault but I insisted on speaking to the person in charge. Eventually someone came up who introduced himself as the assistant manager. He apologized profusely, told us that section of the dining room was running slow and what could he do to help. I said please send out our meals. He looked at me quizically and asked if I really wanted my food to come out right away since we still seemed to be into our salads. I said yes just bring the food. He said right away. A half hour later our meals had not yet arrived. I found our server and told him that most of us had lost out appetites since we were so upset with the service. We wanted to cancel our food. All except the birthday boy who still wanted his steak dinner. It finally came out. He had ordered it medium. It was charred nicely on the outside but when he cut into it, it was so raw I swear I saw the slab of meat start to squirm. We had to send it back. It came back and was cooked to the right temperature. My son took a bite and said it was OK. Some tried a bite and agreed it was very mediocre. He finished and we left. The impression we left with was that they thought we made far too much of our service. In fact we had assumed that the reason the assistant manager came over was that the general manager was not working that night. Not True. She was the woman with the walkie talkie hovering about in the background we later found out. She never once came over and and seemed to have no interest in trying to help us out. Please people, if you have any compassion, boycott Mastros. HORRIBLE!!!

GAlDpUG-7bw7JuOKu0UJvQ.text: Truly a study of excess starting with the "tree house" in the middle of the Crystals Mall.  The excellent food is also a study of excess especially if you are not a huge eater!  Starting with the Escargot, served in the shell swimming in butter and garlic with a wonderful assortment of breads on the side.  Best I have had in a long time.  The entree of Ahi Tuna Sashimi was huge (10 oz.) and perfectly cooked (virtually uncooked!) was a real treat.  The scallops were also more than generous, perfectly seared and served in a wonderful creamy sauce with toast points.  We decided to splurge and went for the $37 lobster mashed potatoes and were not disappointed, only bad part is this really would be too much for a table of four instead of 2 but we managed to eat all the lobster anyway.  Service was flawless.  As you might imagine the bill was part of the excess, cocktails, wine, shared app, entrees with side and a shared desert came to about $260 but it was fun!

8GXHnj2oXNPtO92VD9K8xA.text: The food and service were both excellent. We tasted each other's main courses and I liked the fish better than the steak (I ordered the boned fillet). The lobster mashed potatoes and their signature desert (butter cake) is an absolute must.

F1HUEIpXK83iOWu19qYiFQ.text: I had been intrigued by the scallop-looking building in the sky since the first time I had gone to Crystals when it had initially opened.  I finally went earlier this week, and was extremely impressed with the decor and the service (everyone from the host stand to the waiter -- service is top notch here).  When the menu came, I was in a seafood eater's heaven!!  Their seafood, which ranges from the traditional (tuna, salmon, swordfish) to the the more interesting (opakapaka and chilean seabass), is flown in fresh.... and that's what allows Mastro's to keep the flavors simple so that the fish remains the star on the plate.  I opted for the Chilean Sea Bass and my man went for their jumbo lobster tails.  Brilliance.   The group we were with also ordered almost all the sides on this menu and stand outs were the creamed spinach, the asparagus, and the sauteed mushrooms.   Their wine list is also pretty extensive and the sauvignon blanc was fantastic.   We skipped dessert because we were too full... but the tea we had (they have really interesting flavors, including chocolate coconut) was a perfect compliment to a great meal.  Given the choice between Bartolotta (see my review) and Mastro's, I would take Mastro's any day.  Bravo, Mastro's, on a job well done!!

zf_frR2NDIAJO2qWFEidZA.text: Husband and I were in Vegas for a few days and we had dinner at Mastro's on our first night.  I originally booked the table for 7:30 p.m. but as we were running late, I called and asked that our time be pushed back to 8 p.m. and the lady said it should be fine.  We got there at 8 promptly and were seated at the first table by the entrance.  It has its pros & cons.  It's good in that we were sort of in our own corner but bad in that there was a lot of traffic, people walking by and the table next to us was quite loud.  Nevertheless, we enjoyed our dinner tremendously, both the food and the service.  Our server was Rob and we really want to thank him here again for his excellent and professional service.  I hope he will read this review, but if not, I hope other diners will ask for Rob as he is really awesome.  He is very sincere and does just enough to make you feel welcomed and taken care of.  The food was really awesome.  We ordered lobster cocktail, a 33 oz Australian Kobe steak to share and a side of sauteed mushrooms and a bottle of Tomey.  Everything was delicious.  We were on a bit of tight schedule as we have a show to watch at 10 p.m.  at the Mirage and Rob did everything he could to get us of out there in time for the show.  Thank you so much Rob for a wonderful dinner experience!

xzZGL_gJXYRSnPjrvkqEaw.text: I just experienced a wonderful meal at this establishment. I would say there was a mid-century modern flair to the establishment, with an extremely classy twist. Our server was a gentleman by the name of Eric Baily, and I use the term gentleman loosely...kidding of course, as this man had a great sense of humor, and would truly appreciate a joke as such. He was amazingly attentive.  Our table was also assisted by many other staff members throughout the meal, who were also very helpful and attentive. Everyone was definitely friendly, and seemed excited about the restaurant and what they had to offer. We also spoke with a bar manager for a bit, Luciana, I may have spelt that wrong :(. She had a radiant personality.  They offer a great cocktail and wine list. We tried a key lime martini...yum, and they had Duckhorn Decoy by the glass, for a respectable price...so I had to try it. The bar is beautiful, several stories in height, layered with a beautiful collage of bottles. There was a great open air feel to the restaurant, yet it still maintained a  wonderful level of intimacy.   Then of course comes the food, solid, simple, and of high quality. Judging from my one experience...that seems to be what they are going for. We had a chilled lobster cocktail and oysters on the half shell for starters. Seriously...amazing oysters...I am in the middle of the desert....eating amazing oysters. The lobster was also great. For our mains we had a steak that came out on a 400 degree plate, hot as can be....I know because I touched it, even after I was warned not to ;P Perfect med rare...perfect med rare for sure. My lady had a crab cake dish... a little ballsy to order such a thing coming from living outside of Maryland for some time. Yet...it was much success...top notch fresh crab meat. I guess you gotta thank modern times and next day air, cause everything we tried was super fresh and very tasty. Again, dishes were very simplistic...but with fresh flavors such as that, you'd only be doing an injustice by masking it with complex levels of flavors.

KXLkhWpDSk3QoQ4y22TZkQ.text: Went in expecting a decent experience in vegas......came out with wonderful reviews and I could not have asked for more. So let's not be generic and give detailed reviews. To start. I can not give a better, more glowing review for our server, Valerie Bynan. Notice please that I listed her name because she made a great meal amazing. Wonderful advice without being pushy, delightful enthusiasm and just in general a wonderful person. I had the scallops and the ahi tarte...both delish and cooked to perfection. The scallops were cooked to perfection and seasoned perfectly. My complements to the chef. We heard the butter cake was great and let me say.....try it. Simple. Amazing. Savory. I loved every bite! I give five stars and I am very picky, detail oriented and do not give five stars easily!

uahezvnZtixTLoEgPRkMaw.text: Terrific steak, the lobster mashed potatoes were great. The best part was the butter cake dessert. You must try it....amazing. I would give it five stars if it had better ambiance....it's in the middle of a mall.

8YeXj6D7A9R8seUXwndUgw.text: I love the food here, especially the mac and cheese.  The service was horrible.  I will never come back here again.

D1oJnKMDGD1cfsGNyZSsEw.text: This place is simply amazing. Planned a nice dinner out for a party of eight before we caught Britney at PH. Every single thing I put in my mouth was outstanding. Yeah it's pricey, but this is quality seafood. Wine and cocktails also great. The crab cakes were some of the best ones I have ever tasted! Same with the calamari - so fresh! No one had complaints. Wanted to check out the dessert menu but had to hustle to our show unfortunately. I would love to come back next time we are in Vegas. A five star experience all around.

PtNcYi9O4HHLM83bL3GB_A.text: Went here for an anniversary dinner and it was amazing. Ordered the crab cakes, New York strip, pan seared seabass, lobster mashed potatoes, green beans with almonds and finally the BUTTER CAKE.  Big portions of food and very fresh. Our server was super nice and the complimentary bread had pretzel bread.   For our anniversary they comped the butter cake which was very thoughtful and well appreciated.   Bill came out to be 257 after taxes not including tip. A 5 star establishment!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary bread. Garlic bread and pretzel bread included.
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab cakes!
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan seared seabass with truffle butter. Lobster mashed potatoes and green beans with almonds.

0lEghIsTllpKDDg_Jmefpg.text: What a disappointment. We surprised our daughter to a great meal for her 21st birthday, unfortunately the meal was a huge disappointment. We ordered our steaks medium plus, they came out charred on the outside and completely raw in the center. We sent the steaks back, they cooked the same steaks, that were already charred and burnt on the outside, when we received them back they were so over cooked it was like beef jerky. The garlic mashed potatoes tasted like box potatoes, runny and flavorless.  Now, for iconic butter cake dessert! We have ordered this dessert many times before in other locations and it was always great, however the butter cake was cold and hard.  I'm not speaking for all Mastros locations but this location was a real let down.

1_AgGtQXtDS606gmnwCnew.text: We wanted to try this restaurant after a friend highly recommended to us. My first impression is service was top notch. Our waiter was friendly, and informative on the dishes. Throughout the night, the waiter constantly address our needs without having to ask. We ultimately decide on the sea bass, lobster mash potatoes, rib eyes bone in,  scallops, brussel sprouts with bacon and butter cake.   Lobster mash 5/5 - must have if you are fan of mash potatoes. The taste and texture of the dish is perfection.   Sea bass 3.5/5 - The sea bass was pan seared crispy on the outside, but it was also lacking little seasoning. The dish was a bit disappointing to me due to a lot reviews saying so much great things about it.   Scallops 5/5 - The scallops was my favorite dish of the night. Very much like how the sea bass was cook, and   Brussel sprouts with bacon 3.5/5 - they cooked the brussel just the way I like it. It was crispy in the outside and soft in the side. There was a few piece that was burn and left a bitter taste, but the one that isn't taste very well.   Bone in ryebye 4/5- the streak was delicious , but it wasn't anything speical.  The overall quality and service was amazing. At the end of the night I was highly satisfied!

mvxjrC5r8IJIM_tRzB_1KQ.text: Mastro's Ocean Club is one of my favorite restaurants inside of City Center!  Although the designer of this restaurant claims that it is set in a treehouse, it feels more like the dining room of a luxury cruise ship.    Their Caesar salad CANNOT be beat.  I'm a huge fan of the pretzel bread too and apparently my server noticed.  He won my heart by giving me an entire basket of it!  I wish they were still open for lunch.

9dx4uOkwZl7Xlsh33bxPVQ.text: Now THAT is what I call Fine Dining!!! I was simply WOW'D by the absolutely impeccable service and presentation!! Every other fine dining restaurant in Vegas should emulate EVERYTHING that Mastro's does but they won't so Mastro's shall remain the BEST.  I took my 74 year old mom there for her birthday after reading the glowing reviews and she was in tears over how AMAZING her experience was!  They cater to your every need and anticipate them which is what I look for. Never an empty water glass, dishes cleared immediately, food kept coming!    And the fooooddd!!! Appetizer: Mom: Calamari Me: Lobster Bisque=  OH YEAH!  Entree: Mom: Scallops Me: Chilean Sea Bass= Woah Nelly!!!  Sides: Scalloped potatoes,  creamed Spinach,  and those French fries= To die for!  Dessert: Their world renowned BUTTER CAKE!  They wrote "Happy Birthday" to my mom in chocolate and gave us this CRAZE AMAZE homemade whipped cream.  We were both so stuffed by then that we couldn't eat that much of the cake but next time I'm not eating for a week before I go!!    Overall,  my mom and I are still both in complete awe over our dining odysey at Mastro's.  I've lived in Vegas for over 17 years and it's actually pretty rare to get service like that here.  There's good service  and then there's MASTRO'S SERVICE!!!

rKck_mSA5ml-Lcu_5eXZfA.text: As expected, the food and level of service were remarkably top notch. The martini drinks were huge, shaken in a full size shaker, giving you two full servings. The Oysters Rockefeller and jumbo shrimp cocktail were delicious. The special "Tomahawk Australian Wagyu beef" was tender, juicy, perfectly seasoned, grilled to perfection medium rare! The Twin lobster tails were lightly steamed, preserving their delicate texture and softness! Tasty Garlic mashed potatoes and creamed spinach were the perfect complement to the proteins. We mentioned that we were sharing everything, so the chef pre-sliced the beef and lobster, upon suggestion, to my liking! So high end, so pricey and so worth it!

Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Twin Lobster Tails!
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Australian Wagyu beef, with Garlic Mashed potatoes and Creamed Spinach!

WSfh-xvGLGJ7TIQqXvuotg.text: Once again, amazing.  We were here for dinner on NYE prior to going to the Bridge Bash at NYNY.  Although it was busy, we did not feel like they were rushing us to finish and open the table.  All the faves were ordered, as usual... Gorgonzola Mac, Lobster Mash, Filet, Mussels, Sweet Potato Fries, Chocolate Covered Strawberries.  Plus some other items our friends ordered.  Not a complaint to be heard from anyone at our table!  Drinks were great, and service was exceptional (as usual!).    See you next time, Mastros!

4gwQ3OaQiD6gNk_Kf2SlLA.text: So disappointed in this Mastro's. My fiance and I love Mastro's in Beverly Hills, we love the food but most importantly the service is great! We decided to celebrate my birthday in Vegas and what better way than to have dinner at Mastro's in Vegas. We had in mind it was going to be just as great if not better than Beverly Hills, but that was not the case at all. Upon arriving the table we were seated at was so close to the next table it was so uncomfortable I had to apologize to the couple sitting next to us in advance before getting through to my seat, and we were pushed right up against a wall where all the waiters and waitresses are constantly coming in and out of.  Our waiter was nice but he spoke so fast and also had a very heavy accent that we just could not understand what he was saying or explaining to us. My fiance' ordered steak and it had to be taken back twice because it was just too noticeably under cooked. After we ate we were looking forward to having their famous butter cake that we always have upon celebrating a special occasion and we ended up just paying our bill and leaving. We were really disappointed and most likely will not be returning back to this Mastro's.

AWC9Mh15cxjr_DR6mHr7ow.text: Came here with a larger group. Seafood was excellent, service top class. Highly recommended for a special occasion.

XTQiHmWLHmT4vQv0WGMOyg.text: Simply immaculate. From the location, treehouse structure, service, and the food. We came here for an early Valentine's dinner. My husband and I shared the Wagyu tomahawk, I had a lobster and we ordered a couple sides. Everything was superb!! I can't wait to come back to try other options.

VF0BHsCxCdOdGnrDTeKSHg.text: Went for Father's Day, some dishes weren't on par with their usual quality. To bout, our waiter was borderline rude (which was a first for them) and we were charged for an extra entree. Sad they ruined the Father's Day meal.

Avbo1O1tWnbsFT7Seeso_A.text: Amazing dining experience from start to finish. I was able to make a same day reservation for dinner that night to celebrate my husband's birthday. The restaurant was chic and the service, cocktails, and food were all first class. Johnny was our server and he was phenomenal. It felt so refreshing to have such amazing service. The food, ugh the food, was exceptional. We shared the crab cakes for our appetizer, which was delicious and made with all crab meat, no fillers. We both had Hennessy sidecars for our drinks. Great choice!!! For our main course, we asked to split the twin lobster tails between the two of us and each was paired with an 8oz filet and petite filet. The steaks were topped with truffle butter. The filets were so tender and the lobster was baked to perfection. We enjoyed the side dishes as well. Our meal concluded with complimentary butter cake and chocolate covered strawberries for his birthday. A great finishing touch to an already outstanding dining experience.

-3rst5vAHDrT49vjVbugyQ.text: This is the only fancy restaurant I've been to in Las Vegas. So, I'm sure there are others that live up. But for me in my experience. This was the best wine, best steak I have ever had. The restaurant was beautiful but a little noisy being in the middle of a mall. But I would absolutely recommend this restaurant.

lyHAPAhge-ILzCU-yG9dEQ.text: Have been here a few times, and it never disappoints.  Service is very attentive, food is excellent.  Must have the butter cake for dessert.

ZRCbSQsHJQT6y66wWxa0Lw.text: Go here a few times a year for birthdays etc...  Great service - stellar classy service.  FAST - efficient!  Best filet on strip hands down - gorgeous taste and preparation - worth EVERY penny.  The apps are great too - though adding some grilled shrimp would be nice touch.  Dessert cake is ridiculous and to die for.  ALWAYS a treat and first rate.

ihxEFHT9WSRDuVBU_i4Yiw.text: I am a mastro fan and I have been to a few different ones. Pros for this particular place: staff is extremely friendly (some other places like LA they were stiff and kinda annoying), food is delicious (the butter cake is a must), spacious. The only con is that it's in a mall setting which was a little weird. But I still enjoyed the meal and I am looking forward to the next meal here.

DJS6YRuj8EekWAyBzqZqig.text: Absolutely incredible. I truly cannot say enough good things about this restaurant as the service was impeccable and the food was outstanding. Highlights for us were the shrimp cocktail, caesar salad, sea bass, big eye tuna and button mushrooms. We also enjoyed the classic martini which was perfection and came with a hefty "extra" shaker serving. Everything was truly outstanding and worth every penny. The portions are huge though, so keep that in mind when ordering. They offer half portions of all sides which was a nice touch. The server timed everything perfectly and I can't think of one misstep during our entire 3+ hour meal.

tDpQfEyQcHMHf7jAmwcxNg.text: I guess I just can't say that I am a fan of this famous restaurant, but hubby is definitely a fan of their steak, so still 4 stars, the service was over the top, and the restaurant is classy and beautiful.   Decided to have anniversary dinner here, we asked to be seated at one of those window seatings in the tree house, our host managed to get us one, it was very nice of her. Started off with bottle of French champagne, loved it, the bread basket was so delicious, just too much for 2 people, it could easily feed up to 5 people seriously! Menu is huge, in addition to lots of choices of steaks, the seafood selections were great too, also sushi items.   Our server introduced lots of things, we decided to do chilled seafood platter first, a little bit of everything on the platter. The presentation was amazing, smokes came out of the prawns container, beautiful and appetizing. The Kumamoto oysters were so good, the lobster claw meat was fairly tender. But the other things were bad, the crab meat was so hard and chewy, the prawns were the worst, they were hard to cut, harder to chewy on, almost impossible to swallow, we couldn't even finish them, so wasteful! The horseradish and cocktail sauces were so good, great with the chilled seafood. It pains me to say that this seafood platter was the worst I have ever had, for a famous steakhouse, that's unacceptable!   Clam chowder soup with garlic bread, our server was nice enough to split the soup for us, even though we didn't ask so. The soup portion was still huge after splitting, too bad I didn't want any soup, so I just gave it to hubby, kinda felt bad for our server's thoughtful gesture.   Lobster roll as my entree, it was so bad, the rice was thick, the stuffings were flavorless, I didn't like the cream sauce on it, I had one and half pieces, and couldn't continue to eat.   12 oz bone in filet in medium rare, the plate was 400 degrees hot! Perfectly cooked to medium rare, the steak melted in hubby's mouth right away, he said it tasted amazing! Absolutely loved every single bite of it!   Side of mushrooms, I love mushrooms so much, but those were so bland, I had one bite, that's it.   So, either my taste buds were numbed from too much drinking? Or Mastro's is really just for steak lovers? My food was just bad... I didn't even eat that much, just sat there, sip on my champagne, and tried very hard not to fall asleep in the middle of a dinner date!   They gave us anniversary chocolate cake with a lit candle, so beautiful, and a huge plate of whipped cream too. The cake was so good, both of us loved it, so yummy! I had a 20 -yr -old tawny ($27) to go with it, it was amazing. It's a famous steakhouse, of course it's pricey. Reserved wine list starts at $100 a bottle, up to 10 thousand. Tab was $350 for two.   To be honest, I didn't like my food, not one bit, dinner experience was good, I was just too sleepy to really enjoy it. Their restroom is located on second floor next to private dining room, the elevator was claustrophobic.    I don't think this place is good for dinner dates, food is too much for two people, impossible to finish everything. The restaurant is too bright, not intimate at all. But it's definitely great for family, group dining, or steak lovers!

KXQl-_2D5gClLYWhGpTylw.text: Sea bass pan seared with butter is amazing. Halibut appetizer lacked substance especially for the price. Service was on point and entertaining at times I thought the guys in their white jackets were going to bust out in song and dance.

7_ZDaRn64549VuddXMPlRw.text: AMAZING as always :) Came for my Daddy's 60th birthday dinner while in Vegas for the weekend. Mastro's never fails to disappoint. Table for 6 in the treehouse, in the round white booths. Service was excellent like usual. The only thing was that they messed up on the peppercorn on my fiance new york strip. I know it's the ocean club but all the Mastro's are usually consistent. Can't take away a star for that b/c everything else was amazing. The server even brought complimentary THREE DESSERTs for the table for my dad's birthday. Usually they bring the slice of chocolate cake or the butter cake, but they presented a massive plate with those two and eclairs! AMAZING but prob a good 5000 calories.  Love Mastro's and will def be back to this location next time we're in Vegas.  Thanks for making my father's dinner a memorable one!
