Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Triple dessert!

oWsYZGUV85dcbCzWYkCK6Q.text: One of the top 3 restaurants in Vegas! Third time coming here this year and I have never been disappointed. Service from the waitress was on point and she was very thorough with explaining the specials on the menu. The shrimp cocktail is probably the best I've ever had along with the lobster bisque.  I had the rack of lamb as my main course which was amazing. Black truffle gnocchi as a side is brilliant also. The one thing you cannot leave this restaurant without ordering is the legendary butter cake!!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Butter Cake!

VhoZA1lpiiO-J7SQrAVNQw.text: Being a Vegas local, living on the strip, I get to try amazing Vegas eats weekly. I must say by far Mastros is a step above the rest & my personal favorite restaurant on the strips.  Service is top notch, as good as it gets! Some of my fav dishes are the Scallops, KC Strip, Hamachi, Petite Filet Mignon, & of course the amazing Buttercake dessert. Must try.

qIojtPHi9AvczepHKmhaNQ.text: Awesome place , good restaurant for family or business gathering meals , good atmosphere. Crew is helpful, staff is ready . Food is delicious

P05vDrO0Fy2hJRHdbOO29w.text: PERFECTION!  Mary brought me to Mastro's for my Birthday dinner as part of my Birthday trip to Las Vegas in August.  Our dinner at Mastro's in Vegas, as all our dinners at every Mastro's we have ever visited was pure perfection.    The ambiance and the food, the staff, the management.... Impeccable!

na3tHSbUNCauidHEEg2mdQ.text: It is no secret that I am a huge carnivore. Naturally I constantly get asked what the best steak is. However, one does not simply choose a best steak. True aficionados do not limit themselves to one choice. They are so in love with the subject they want to learn everything about it. So when you ask me for my favorite steak be prepared for a long response. I might ask you what you've liked in the past and what you look for in a steak. There are so many ways to prepare a steak that it can't be drilled down to just one ideal steak.   With that said, Mastro's did not disappoint. It has made it on to my list of high quality eats.  Went on a Saturday night so it was very busy. However the service kept up with the demand quite well. There is a bar with live piano music where you can wait while they prepare your table.  We ordered the seafood tower with oysters and shrimp. Other available choices were lobster, caviar and crab legs. No complaints here. Just great tasting, fresh food.  I wasn't in the mood to have the meat sweats later so I ordered the modestly sized bone-in filet, medium rare. I judge a steak by how it's cooked more than anything else. I like mine almost rare and it was cooked as requested. Highly recommended. Other steaks at my table were the Tomahawk Wagyu Ribeye and the Ribeye. The steaks are huge so plan accordingly if you want to order sides and dessert, and you should.  As for side dishes we ordered the lobster mashed potatoes and creamed spinach. The mashed potatoes had a whole lobster mixed in it and topped with a sauce flavored with the juices from the lobster. Most creamed spinach I've tried in the past were way too buttery but they nailed it here. More cream than butter so it remained thick and didn't fall apart.  The service was first rate as expected for a joint like this. Our waiter, Craig, was professional and gave us a great tip when we asked if he knew a place to get cigars afterwards.   To top it off the hostess sent us a butter cake on the housel! I normally don't order dessert but this cake changed my life.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomahawk Wagyu Ribeye, Lobster Mashed Potatoes, Creamed Spinach.

LLR5rj3M16NMbiDfIcndpA.text: With all the 5 star reviews, I was expecting to get wowed by this place.  The restaurant is pretty cool looking, and the waitstaff was excellent though the hostesses were not very hospitable.  There were 4 of us dining here and we thought the food was not very good.  Bland!!!  I had the bone-in ribeye which is the only steak I order and the flavor was just bland. Another person ordered the Chilean sea bass and we both agreed that it simply lacked flavor.  The lobster mashed potatoes did not taste good to all 4 of us.  The only thing I enjoyed there was the pretzel bread and their warm butter cake.

uqtsG00sMJzMqHU3RBPupg.text: Great service, great martinis, great seafood and steak. Had dinner in the treehouse. Perfect!

A3U1mgf1s9hO5DeBEShHHQ.text: My wife and I don't often eat at restaurants this pricey but maybe once or twice a year, so when we do we really want to be sure that it's worth it. Some friends of our invited us out and really wanted to go here, the reviews made it sound wonderful so we agreed. The reviews, glowing as they are, don't do it justice in my opinion. Everything from the service to the food to the atmosphere is top notch.   We sat in the treehouse. We'd seen this structure before when we'd walked through Crystals (the mall the restaurant is located in) and had no idea what it was, so we were pleasantly surprised when we entered to find out that the main dining room is located in this unique architectural feature. From below, you would think it's not that spacious, but feels very airy due to the open nature of the design. We didn't feel cramped in any way, and we had a party of 6.   The waite staff are dressed in white jackets and bowties and they are the best at what they do. You feel very well taken care of without feeling watched or "hovered" over.   The food is amazing. I won't mince words here, it's expensive and everything is 'a la carte', but the portions are substantial and the sides are easily shareable. In fact, that's the only potential "negative" of our experience. We ordered WAY TOO MUCH food, but that's not our server's fault. He warned us but we refused to believe him. The good news is we got to try a little bit of everything, the bad news is we ate a little too much of everything and still had food left over!   I had the Chilean Sea Bass cooked "oreganata" style, which was amazing. They really know how to prepare seafood here. It's easy to overcook fish but this was cooked perfectly. Sea Bass is one of my favorite fish and this is easily one of the best I've ever had.  My wife decided to REALLY splurge and ordered one of the specials that was on offer, an 8oz Japanese Wagyu Steak for $125. Words don't do it justice. It was delicious. It melted in your mouth and was just buttery, rich and savory. Not a trace of gristle, every bite was perfect.   Our friends ordered the roasted chicken which was excellent, a bone in ribeye with truffle butter which was almost as amazing as the Wagyu Steak for half the price, and halibut, which was also excellent and perfectly cooked. We started with oysters (I'm not a oyster connoisseur so I can't provide any more detail than that) and for sides we had sauteed asparagus, creamed spinach, gorgonzola mac and cheese, salt and vinegar fries and lobster mashed potatoes (now you see why we ordered too much food). All of the aforementioned items were excellent but the standout was the lobster mashed potatoes. We're not talking about mashed potatoes with bits of lobster flavor, we're talking about mashed potatoes drenched in melted butter with massive chunks of lobster. Seriously, there was not a bit of lobster less than an inch thick in there. It was fantastic.   For dessert we again ordered too much. We had the butter cake (and you should too) which was easily shareable by 4 or more people, but again since I didn't believe the waiter, we ordered two. We also had chocolate covered strawberries and Key Lime Pie, both of which were fantastic, but the butter cake is a standout!   Drinks. The wine menu is extensive and the beer selection was pretty decent too for a "fancy" type of place (which in my experience usually seem to look down on beer). The signature cocktails/martinis were delicious and, again, nicely portioned for the price. $17 seems pricey for a martini until you realize they give you the shaker with practically another entire glass full in there for a top off. They also have a nice selection of ports, dessert wines, and cordials for after dinner. I don't usually splurge on an "after dinner" drink, but I was in full on splurge mode that night, so I did. The waiter recommended a white dessert wine as opposed to a port since it would pair better with the butter cake, and he was not wrong. I had no idea what was good so I went with his recommendation, which was a Royal Tokaji 5 Puttonyos Aszu wine for $25. It blew me away. It was thick, viscous and sweet but not overly sweet and the flavor was a delicate array of fruit (apricot, hints of citrus and honey) with a creamy, slightly smoky finish. I immediately looked it up online and ordered a bottle for home, which was $50, that's how much I loved it.   I can't reiterate enough how special this experience was to us. Our total for 6 people was a little over $800, but that price seems perfectly justified based on our experience. We would return here without hesitation, although we would definitely listen to our waiter next time when he says we might be ordering too much food, and if we were to show more restraint on our next visit, I think we could get out the door for under $200 (for 2 people). Which as a meal for a special occasion would be more than worth the price.

OzO2mwIhYKoMBPd8zXOrdA.text: The N9ne is much better....I've had better at Red Lobster and that's sad...save your money or go to the N9ne at the Palms

FsZgBa9VULLmtckndUkogQ.text: Excellent anniversary dinner experience!  Dinner drinks and staff were all excellent. The manager cam out and greeted us which was a real treat. Although we're reserving this restaurant for our special occasions, we can't wait to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NkUx9SwTPOWvvVeEp0kFNw.text: Service here is exceptional, not like the Beverly Hills location. Servers are very attentive and has great personality.  I came here for dinner with the hubby the week-end before Christmas and made a reservation through opentable. We were runing late so I called Mastros to inform them of our situation, when we arrived at the restaurant the hostess said thank you for informing us that you'll be late, we reserved a nice seat by the tree house for you two. She was very nice. She even checked-in my coat.  I love the restaurant ambiance, not too loud and not as cramped as the Beverly Hills location.  I love the different bread choices.  We started our dinner with escargot, which is really good. I love the flaky bread that came with it. We ordered mac and cheese, rack of lamb and bone-in filet. This is not the best steak I've ever had but my steak was done perfectly, medium rare which I asked for. My husband loved the rack of lamb. Lamb serving was huge, he got 2 racks. Mac and cheese was ok. They didn't have porterhouse here not like the Beverly Hills location, since their specialty is seafood.  We had a great dining experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rack of lamb $48
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gorgonzola mac n cheese $13
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $15 Escargot...love it!

fAY-AUNcPhV44fVghYaGsg.text: I did not get to enjoy my meal as much as I wish... =( but I know for a fact that the food was really good..  Me & my girl friend (Amy L) made reservations for 6PM on a Saturday. After dragging ourselves over here from Vdara, we finally made it on time. It was an absolute drag because we were awake for 30+ hours & we felt really crappy from all the "beverages" we consumed... basically we felt like utter sh** and couldn't enjoy our meals =(  Located in the City Center, the restaurant is pretty much in the very center of the building. Service was good but a bit slow. I love the assortment of bread, my favorite is the crunchy cheesey-garlicky one =)  Here's what we ordered:  Lobster Bisque - comes in a huge bowl, tastes very very VERYY rich, not too many pieces of lobster but still pretty delicious  Seared Sea Scallops - I've had this before at Mastro's in Beverly Hills, same thing, still delicious, comes with 3 scallops & yummy cheese/garlic bread. Scallops from Mastro's comes in 2nd place after Providence's :P   Bone-in Filet - cooked medium. Comes on a sizzling plate, very good rich flavors and good texture. I was only able to eat 2-3 bites. I did eat the leftovers the next morning & it was still pretty tasty.   Chilean Sea Bass - blacken cajun flavored, I think.. It was pretty damn good, texture is very similar to scallops.  King Crab Gnocchi - big enough to be an entree on it's own, holy sh*t, I don't know how this thing can just be a side dish lol it's meant to be shared amongst 4+ people.. I thought it was pretty yummy, I love cheese and king crab meat... but this is super duper heavy, I probably would not order this again...  Garlic Spinach - tasty but a bit too garlicky for me, it was so infused with garlic that it tasted a bit bitter to me..  I am so sad that we were so full that I didn't get to try to butter cake, AGAIN! =( We didn't have much of an appetite at all, plus I think we ordered a little too much lol... we were stuffed after having a few bites of our appetizers.  Service was good, our waiter was a bit slow though. Our water glasses were never empty (thank goodness, we must have drank a total of 13 glasses each..)  Restrooms are located on the second floor, kind of a hassle to look for. Bad idea to go when you're intoxicated..  Lesson learned: do not attempt fine dining after a night of debauchery....excellent restaurant & food! Must try the butter cake one day.... =(

Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Alaskan king crab legs (1/2)  with lobster mash
Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pfo5P8u7kG9v0Zt1HYnifQ.text: Yummie!  This place was great. There was 9 of us for dinner for a friend's birthday, our table was ready and waiting for us when we arrived, they allowed us to decorate the table, the service was awesome, their menu includes steak & seafood so everyone could order whatever they wanted.  The restaurant was very busy I must say and every table had cocktails on it, both are good signs for me.  They have tons of steaks to choose from, lamb, vanilla fried lobster, scallops, and tons of fish. My only confusion came from how the fish was actually prepared b/c there wasn't really on the menu explaining how you can get your fish cooked. After asking the waitress, she explained the 5 fish preparations.  Here's what we ate: 1) Sashimi tower -white fish, Tuna, lobster rolls all very good [see pix] 2) Heirloom tomatoes and burrata salad-very tasty and tons to share 3) Escargot-my favorite very very good [see pix] 4) Creamed Corn-typically not a fan but I did enjoy this very much 5) Brussels Sprouts-eh they are good for you 6) Mac n blue cheese-yes for sure 7) Halibut Oreganata - almost $50, but was a huge piece of fish, definitely could share this 8) the fried lobster was another one of my favorites 9) tuna tostadas again very good [see pix]  I wanted to try the crab cake but didn't have any room left. We had more leftovers in bags then arms to carry them on.  Other notable notes: waiters were exceptional with their service of our table, my glass of Veuve was never empty and the waiter was calling me by name the whole time :). Our bill was over a grand after everything was said and done. So it's on the pricer side.

ZlRWskewJC3urxTaYzFzRg.text: A couple buddies and I decided to come out and try out the Vegas Mastros after a long day of playing tables. Got seating right away without having to make an appointment,  and service was very professional.  After we received our steak it was hands down the best we ever had and would come out for dinner again on our next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prepared for our feast.

pNfXsZrsNHAWZb63JjdeMA.text: Mastro's is a very good steak and seafood restaurant in the Crystal's shopping mall next to Aria on the second floor.  It's best to make reservations ahead of time or you wait.  Service was prompt and courteous. I enjoyed a delicate Malbec (it doesn't give me migraine headaches like other wines do). My husband and I split a Wedge salad that was perfectly mixed with blue cheese, cheddar cheese, bacon and onions. My husband really enjoyed the bone-in ribeye and I couldn't finish the delicious Artic Char I was served. The double baked potato was gargantuan and awesomely scrumptious, but the best part was ordering creme brulee' and to be served a giant wallop of real whipped cream bigger than the dessert portion!  Simply delightful.

VnOZYVNXA6MGgeO23AW_YA.text: Celebrated my birthday here. Delicious food all night long. Ordered the Sauteed Sea Scallops as an appetizer, Bone-In Ribeye, Lobster Mashed Potatoes (a MUST!), Creamed corn (delicious and not too sweet), and Sauteed Asparagus. And they threw in a slice of delicious chocolate cake. Very happy with the excellent service and dining experience.

ypUUckh0gXzUthX47cPrug.text: Butter cake..... is heaven. Seriously everything here is so damn good!! Atmosphere and staff is amazing as well

PjLYYhfoGzF0Xxecw-aUyA.text: I'm not typically one to write reviews but I was so blown away by my dining experience here, I felt compelled to share. I will start by saying the service was truly over the top. We were seated immediately upon arrival and we never waited for anything. Our server, Elizabeth, greeted us promptly, explained the menu, and brought our drinks and a warm bread basket. In addition, there were many other "wait staff" assisting all of the tables. The minute our glasses were empty, someone was right there ready to fill it. In all of my years of fine dining, I've never experienced service quite like this...not to mention, it was prime time on a Friday evening so it's not like they weren't busy.  Now, aside from the top-notch service, the food was out of this world! The jumbo sauteed sea scallops were cooked to perfection, with a delicious garlic sauce. The filet mignon was so tender, it just melted in your mouth. I've been craving it ever since we left! We thought we were full but when that warm butter cake came out....O-M-G. Best dessert I've ever eaten in my life! All I can say is, it's a good thing we ate here on our last night because I would have wanted to go back a few times! I researched the other locations and found one in NYC. I'll be going there in March and I'm looking forward to another fantastic meal!  I highly recommend this restaurant. I would give it 10 stars if I could...and a special thank you to our server, Elizabeth, for making this such a memorable dining experience

ruwnM-wRVti16Yw82qHOYg.text: ***Short version of this review***  Mastro's is the Cheesecake Factory of fine dining.  --------------------------------------------------------  ***Long version of this review***  I dropped by Mastro's in the Crystals mall for a quick dinner before a night on the town.  I'd heard of the Mastro's chain before, especially their swanky steakhouses in Orange County and LA, but this was my first time hearing of their seafood restaurant.  It seemed like the perfect opportunity to lose my Mastro's virginity without being subjected to massive slabs of red meat.  First thing's first -- Mastro's is enormous, and it's absolutely stunning.  In terms of architectural design, this place is a feast for the eyes.  The interior of the restaurant is bold and stunning.  Much of the dining room is suspended over the rest of the mall in a giant wooden "treehouse".  I sat at the bar, which was a veritable mountain of mirrors and glass.  Just being at Mastro's feels glamorous.  After being seated, I ordered a glass of the "Grace Lane" Riesling (which was fabulous) and was promptly offered a complementary breadbasket, filled with pretzel bread, toasted baguette, and various other goodies.    I noticed that most of the plates being carted around the restaurants were pretty large, so I decided to build a dinner out of two different appetizers.  I opted for the sauteed sea scallops and the ahi tuna tostada.  Needless to say, two appetizers were more than enough food, since these so-called "appetizers" were really entree portions.  The sea scallops included 3 giant scallops, soaking in a rich and buttery sauce and served alongside huge slabs of cheesy baguette.  The ahi tuna tostada was actually 3 separate tostadas, each loaded to the hilt with big-eye tuna, avocado, and ponzu chili sauce.  Of the two dishes, I preferred the scallops, which were simply prepared and oh so silky and indulgent.  The ahi tuna tostada was less enjoyable, since the tuna was served warm and had a slightly mealy consistency.    Service was efficient, formal, and bland -- fairly typical for a chain restaurant, but especially a Vegas chain restaurant.    All in all, I'd really glad I had the chance to experience Mastro's for the first time.  The behemoth portions, straightforward food, and stiff service felt like Cheesecake Factory -- not a bad place per se, but not somewhere that I'd visit on the reg, either.

YgQKA0k_ljpHrZgLa3RwCQ.text: One of the best steakhouses in Vegas if not the best! Had the wagyu Australian rib eye med rare. Great steak. Always great service also. Definitely check out mastros at aria if you have not. A++

o-fQ-6vpSxKOV9H_762r3g.text: If you like lots of Food on your plate you'll like mastro's, if you like a sensible way of serving food you won't enjoy it that much. The filet was superb, as well as the chicken but the sides where for a group of four each and not presented in a way you would expect in a restaurant like that...though they tasted good. Waitress was very attentive...

eo5AO45FVPZc2A6xCLNnZA.text: My my my...what a treat it was to eat here. From start to finish, the food tasted superb, and service was impeccable.   FOOD HIGHLIGHTS * Bread basket: Served steamy and warm with Mastro's fresh salted butter. Pretzel bread and cheesy, cracker-like breadsticks were my favorites. * Truffle-lobster gnocchi appetizer special: The chewiest, richest gnocchi I've tried, with tender lobster meat and drizzled with truffle oil. * Bone-in filet steak, medium rare: Soft, tender beef, topped with clarified butter and a pinch of herbs. Served on a 400 degree plate, so it stays nice and toasty throughout your meal! * Butter cake: Devastatingly moist, melty, slightly salty, and of course, buttery, with a crisp crust, a scoop of French vanilla ice cream, and whole plate of freshly whipped cream. Not overrated in any sense of the word.  I'm going to stop writing now because I'll drool all over my work laptop keyboard otherwise...

xv4hDvyR97295F29Q2VucA.text: Overall, this is a solid choice for an evening of fine dining. But there are a few annoyances keeping it from being 5 star.  We walked in with no reservations but it was early and we were sat immediately. We were escorted to a table outside the bird nest, which wouldn't be a big deal if they were not playing the most awful fine dining lounge music ever. After requesting a new table there was some initial resistance but eventually they sat us in the birds nest which thankfully has traditional dining background tunes. - 1 star  The service was quick and friendly though we ordered way too much food. I don't feel we were properly warned about the portion sizes of the side items. There was easily more than a pound of food left uneaten. But what we did eat was good enough to avoid losing another star. Simply put it was all around delicious. Judging by what we had, the dishes I watched go past me, and the reaction of the other diners... close your eyes and pick anything you want... it will be great.  In summery, great food, good service, $$$-$$$$, but-   Unless you want to bring earplugs to dinner, be sure to get a table in the birds nest!

LYt9N4FmDcjlYCA_teWbWQ.text: In the mall at Aria lies a bird house made of wood that serves great steak. We came here with a reservation made on Open Table for a pre-show dinner for a birthday. It's pricey but the steaks are worth it. I read the sides are massive, they were decent. Enough for 2 people in my opinion. I had the bone-in filet and it was delicious. My partner had a grilled fish and it was fresh and tasty. The sauteed spinach was full of garlicky goodness and the asparagus was cooked to perfection. The big bread basket had lots of choices and the chocolate cake was great. The service was impeccable and our waiter was very knowledgable. The only downfall is the location. It's so odd to be at a high-end restaurant in a mall, even if it is a very high-end mall.

MT8k6e7ZUqBbl-z_BELI9Q.text: Love everything about this restaurant.   The food is amazing and the butter cake is to die for.

0dljGxjx-aZPXnDYM9Z4fQ.text: The service and food were incredible.  This meal was worth every penny. We started with the wedge salad. My husband and I split the salad,  which I'm glad we did because it was large.  For the entree I had the big eye tuna served sushi style and it was fantastic.  We ordered the sweet potato side dish and it was heaven in a bowl.  I will eat here again the next time we are in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastro's Ocean Club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8WqgA8ZqLjMOooM3XQFaWw.text: Oh my goodness!!! I'm so full I may need to be rolled back to my hotel... We were told to share food so we did, thank God. We started with a bottle of Chateu St Michell Chardonnay. We had a wedge salad and I'm pretty sure I've never tasted tomatoes like that before, they were so flavorful. Then split a New York Strip steak, delish, cooked perfectly, I could only eat 1/4. Paired it with a twice baked potato that could have been a meal of it's own. To finish it off we had their famous warm butter cake, holy cow! It's like nothing you have ever tasted before, it's a must!!!

42hi7mL7_FhSSKyf7OBUAA.text: Been here a few times now and I swear it gets better and better! Ribeye with a side of Lobster? There are no words!! Enjoy...

EG1VSlaAXq9F3b3DxH8gwA.text: I really wish I could give this place 5 stars because the food was very good and it is in a convenient location.  I would definitely recommend coming here, but our party made reservations well in advance and we still had to wait over an hour for our table to open up.  We weren't apologized to and everything seemed a bit frantic. Our party had an eventful day in Vegas, so we had a lot to talk about in our extended wait, but it still shouldn't happen to people that made reservations. Upside: BUTTER CAKE

V85U66qH_fpYwFh7z1I8Qg.text: This is actually 3.5 stars.  So me and the guys had dinner here last night and as usual the food is excellent (5 stars).    The reason for the lower rating was due to service and ambience.  I've been to other Mastro's and their service has always been top notch.  They always anticipated your needs and followed up quickly.  Our main server here could have worked at Sizzler, Black Angus, Outback or any of those type of places and the clientele there would have thought he was good.  At Mastro's, not the case.    I am a low maintenance client and in the restaurant business so I understand how it can be.  But last night's dinner service wasn't busy and Mastro's has a pretty good wait staff to client ratio so our needs should have been met fairly easily.    My biggest complaint are the lack of water initially and follow up afterwards.  We didn't get water until are appetizers were served.  There was never a follow up after any of the dishes were served.  This is pretty basic service for a fine dining establishment so I will not give you any leeway here.    My other issue is more of a personal taste.  Mastro's is located in Crystals Shopping Center at CityCenter and has an "open top" feel with views of the mall.  The restaurant is not enclosed so it feels like I'm dining at a very expensive food court.  As with typical steak houses they are usually dark but here it's pretty bright.  I didn't feel like I had the full Mastro's steak house experience.  While I really enjoyed the food and time with my friends I'm not sure I will go back since Vegas has a lot of dining options.

Q2ozV0ftDL6l48tTyvpHlw.text: Meat!  What else is there?  Oh, and the mushrooms weren't too shabby.

x4M78hCJpPR3Use-2q6SYQ.text: Beautiful Restaurant and impeccable service.  Request to eat in the treehouse and enjoy.

Va4yoT3RzwjSfeM2geA6xA.text: If I could give this place a million stars, I would. This is by far my favorite restaurant of all time. You must try the Gorgonzola Mac n cheese, creamed corn and of course, the Butter Cake. I would eat here every day if I could!! It always our go to spot for holidays, birthdays and anniversaries! YUMMY! A must try!!

ivPBdterLJmNDoyIX5m6nw.text: For what you pay, I expected much more on all fronts. First off, we had to get our entrees to go because we were going to be late for a show (not the fastest restaurant) and they forgot to include mine...so so sad :(  Too late to return to get it though. Otherwise I was just generally unimpressed. We were put in the darkest corner with no lights so the ambience was a little off to me. All the food was just blah, not bad, but not what you expect for the price. Fried calamari had too little seasoning for me. Seared ahi tuna was pretty tasty I will say, but there was like 4 thin pieces not much to eat. Spicy mambo salad was basically like ceasar salad. Seafood tower was decent and included raw oysters, lobster, crab...the basics. I was going to take pictures, actually I tried, but as I said place was nightime dark in there. Anyways, I'd take my money elsewhere personally. But again, I didn't have my dinner so...

5IfAZ2mvIhO2QO196Mr1gQ.text: One of the best seafood restaurants we've been to. Definitely a must go if you are in a city the serve. King Crab legs a must get. Dungeness crab cocktail that was all large chunks, nothing shredded. Lobster bisque was outstanding with actual pieces of lobster in it.

MMeQ6fx_lK_xDLgQi4tIyA.text: Great decor & design  Good Food  Good service  Reservations a must   Dropped in after a short search with my Yelp Android App, the design of the place by KAA is amazing. I felt like I was eating inside of a piece of art, sculpture that is.   It's obvious the rich and famous dine here as the presentation of the entrees are really dramatic but very entertaining. Service was good, but could have been better - it was a Monday night.   If you haven't been, you must give a try!

dLFfU00kfXFYL5VkUw0kgw.text: LOUD! We were first seated in the dining room right next to the piano/singer in the bar. I had to ask twice to be moved to somewhere more quiet because I could not be heard over the singer. Fortunately we were seated shortly away from the bar, but the noise level was still very high. I would not return no matter how good the food just because of the noise level.  The food. We split a Caesar salad, which was OK but too salty and over dressed. We had to ask for some bread. My wife loved her scallops. My swordfish was very thick and looked delicious. It, however, was a little over cooked, and fairly bland. It did not have that grilled flavor I love on fish. The waiter recommended the lobster mashed potatoes ($38), so we got that and the green beans with slivered almonds. If you do not absolutely love lobster, take the $10 baked potato instead. I do not like my veggies over cooked, but the beans were way under done. After dinner decaf coffee was just OK and served in a large cup, but we not offer a refill until we were ready to leave. Key Lime Pie was a large slice, but I've had much better.

IneTpPRqdI40-Vn66n76Fg.text: Mastro's was recommended by a co-worker who went to one of the locations in CA and absolutely loved it. I made reservations for a group of friends and I, and despite some initial resistance from my fellow Yelper Lauren M., we all had a fabulous time and were more than happy with our decision to come here!  Our server, Lionel, was amazing the whole evening. He was friendly, helpful, and attentive. He recommended we get a customized seafood tower, and everyone in the group was very impressed.  We were also impressed with our meals. I got the bone-in filet, and two of my friends split the tomahawk special. My other friends got fish. My filet melted in my mouth and was cooked perfectly. I don't typically get filet when I go to a steakhouse, but I was so happy with my meal!   We also got the very popular lobster mashed potatoes for a side, and it was delicious. Lionel brought us out some of the warm butter cake for dessert, and it was amazing! You could definitely smell the butter as soon as he put it down on the table. You must try it if you come to Mastro's!  The setting is a little weird, as you are essentially in the middle of a mall. Honestly, the food was so good that I could have been sitting literally anywhere and enjoyed this meal!

17g4nDrEUyCOOaLWpN7NqQ.text: The Las Vegas-Mastro's ranks among our top dining experiences anywhere in the world.  On this Labor Day Weekend visit, our initial disappointment, of not being seated in the unique & always fascinating "tree-house", was quickly extinguished by Shauna, our Culinary Captain Extraordinaire, menu "tour guide" and libation/wine aficionado.  Turns out... our "Terrace" seating near the piano bar was as enjoyable as it was entertaining, resulting in yet another "positively outrageous" fine dining adventure.  Shauna introduced us to Mastro's participation in "Las Vegas Restaurant Week", a worthy nationwide charity drive to raise money for & donate meals to 3-Square Food Bank in Southern Nevada.  She offered a special 4-course dinner deliciously flanked by Beefsteak Tomato & Onion Salad, an 8 oz. Petite Filet, Creamed Spinach & Garlic Mashed Potatoes, and Key Lime Pie all for a reasonable price, part of which was ultimately donated for a worthy cause.    As there were 5 of us on this visit, the aforementioned special meal was joined by collection of our menu favs and Shauna's recommendations. She perfectly paired our appetizers & meals with wonderful Riesling, Cabernet, and Sauvignon Blanc.  Sooo, included in the culinary delight were: The Legendary Seafood Tower (Ohhh YES!!), Lobster Bisque (best in class!), Herb Roasted Chicken (delightful), New York Strip (absolute perfection), Chilean Sea Bass (sweet & outa this world), Sauteed Sea Scallops (Oh Yeah!), Creamed Corn (buttered and seasoned to perfection), Sauteed Mushrooms ( a fav of favs), Roasted Brussels Sprouts (these aren't yo mama's sprouts, believe it!), 1 lb. Baked Potato (huge), Triple Chocolate Layer Cake (nothing but delish), AND...(drum roll)... the Mastro's Signature Warm Butter Cake!!...once again to die for!!!  Without fail, and to paraphrase the writings of T. Scott Gross,... Mastro's was again a "positively outrageous" dining experience where the culinary expectations were always far exceeded.  Shauna's unsurpassed service & superior guidance was unexpected, delivered-at-random, fun, entertaining, and so very memorable!  It doesn't get any better!
